1 Nephi 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128342694" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="1"></span>^N			<h1 data-aid="128342695" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The First Book of Nephi</span></h1>^N			<p class="subtitle" data-aid="128342696" id="subtitle1">His Reign and Ministry</p>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128342697" id="intro1">An account of Lehi and his wife Sariah, and his four sons, being called, (beginning at the eldest) Laman, Lemuel, Sam, and Nephi. The Lord warns Lehi to depart out of the land of Jerusalem, because he prophesieth unto the people concerning their iniquity and they seek to destroy his life. He taketh three days’ journey into the wilderness with his family. Nephi taketh his brethren and returneth to the land of Jerusalem after the record of the Jews. The account of their sufferings. They take the daughters of Ishmael to wife. They take their families and depart into the wilderness. Their sufferings and afflictions in the wilderness. The course of their travels. They come to the large waters. Nephi’s brethren rebel against him. He confoundeth them, and buildeth a ship. They call the name of the place Bountiful. They cross the large waters into the promised land, and so forth. This is according to the account of Nephi; or in other words, I, Nephi, wrote this record.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128342698" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128342699" id="study_summary1">Nephi begins the record of his people—Lehi sees in vision a pillar of fire and reads from a book of prophecy—He praises God, foretells the coming of the Messiah, and prophesies the destruction of Jerusalem—He is persecuted by the Jews. About 600 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342700" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>I, Nephi, having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>goodly</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>parents</span>, therefore I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>taught</span> somewhat in all the learning of my father; and having seen many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>afflictions</span> in the course of my days, nevertheless, having been highly favored of the Lord in all my days; yea, having had a great knowledge of the goodness and the mysteries of God, therefore I make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>record</span> of my proceedings in my days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342701" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, I make a record in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> of my father, which consists of the learning of the Jews and the language of the Egyptians.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342702" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I know that the record which I make is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>true</span>; and I make it with mine own hand; and I make it according to my knowledge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342703" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For it came to pass in the commencement of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> year of the reign of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zedekiah</span>, king of Judah, (my father, Lehi, having dwelt at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jerusalem</span> in all his days); and in that same year there came many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>prophets</span>, prophesying unto the people that they must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>repent</span>, or the great city <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Jerusalem</span> must be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342704" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore it came to pass that my father, Lehi, as he went forth prayed unto the Lord, yea, even <span class="page-break" data-page="2"></span>with all his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heart</span>, in behalf of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342705" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass as he prayed unto the Lord, there came a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pillar</span> of fire and dwelt upon a rock before him; and he saw and heard much; and because of the things which he saw and heard he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quake</span> and tremble exceedingly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342706" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that he returned to his own house at Jerusalem; and he cast himself upon his bed, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>overcome</span> with the Spirit and the things which he had seen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342707" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And being thus overcome with the Spirit, he was carried away in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vision</span>, even that he saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heavens</span> open, and he thought he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>saw</span> God sitting upon his throne, surrounded with numberless concourses of angels in the attitude of singing and praising their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342708" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that he saw One descending out of the midst of heaven, and he beheld that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>luster</span> was above that of the sun at noon-day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342709" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he also saw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> others following him, and their brightness did exceed that of the stars in the firmament.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342710" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And they came down and went forth upon the face of the earth; and the first came and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stood</span> before my father, and gave unto him a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>book</span>, and bade him that he should read.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342711" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that as he read, he was filled with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342712" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And he read, saying: Wo, wo, unto Jerusalem, for I have seen thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominations</span>! Yea, and many things did my father read concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jerusalem</span>—that it should be destroyed, and the inhabitants thereof; many should perish by the sword, and many should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>carried away</span> captive into Babylon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342713" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that when my father had read and seen many great and marvelous things, he did exclaim many things unto the Lord; such as: Great and marvelous are thy works, O Lord God Almighty! Thy throne is high in the heavens, and thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>, and goodness, and mercy are over all the inhabitants of the earth; and, because thou art merciful, thou wilt not suffer those who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto thee that they shall perish!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342714" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And after this manner was the language of my father in the praising of his God; for his soul did rejoice, and his whole heart was filled, because of the things which he had seen, yea, which the Lord had shown unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342715" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now I, Nephi, do not make a full account of the things which my father hath written, for he hath written many things which he saw in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visions</span> and in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dreams</span>; and he also hath written many things which he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophesied</span> and spake <span class="page-break" data-page="3"></span>unto his children, of which I shall not make a full account.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342716" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But I shall make an account of my proceedings in my days. Behold, I make an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abridgment</span> of the record of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>father</span>, upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plates</span> which I have made with mine own hands; wherefore, after I have abridged the record of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>father</span> then will I make an account of mine own life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342717" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Therefore, I would that ye should know, that after the Lord had shown so many marvelous things unto my father, Lehi, yea, concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> of Jerusalem, behold he went forth among the people, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophesy</span> and to declare unto them concerning the things which he had both seen and heard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342718" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mock</span> him because of the things which he testified of them; for he truly testified of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wickedness</span> and their abominations; and he testified that the things which he saw and heard, and also the things which he read in the book, manifested plainly of the coming of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Messiah</span>, and also the redemption of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342719" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And when the Jews heard these things they were angry with him; yea, even as with the prophets of old, whom they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast out</span>, and stoned, and slain; and they also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sought</span> his life, that they might take it away. But behold, I, Nephi, will show unto you that the tender <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mercies</span> of the Lord are over all those whom he hath chosen, because of their faith, to make them mighty even unto the power of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>deliverance</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343807" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128343808" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128343809" id="study_summary1">Lehi takes his family into the wilderness by the Red Sea—They leave their property—Lehi offers a sacrifice to the Lord and teaches his sons to keep the commandments—Laman and Lemuel murmur against their father—Nephi is obedient and prays in faith; the Lord speaks to him, and he is chosen to rule over his brethren. About 600 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343810" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>For behold, it came to pass that the Lord spake unto my father, yea, even in a dream, and said unto him: Blessed art thou Lehi, because of the things which thou hast done; and because thou hast been faithful and declared unto this people the things which I commanded thee, behold, they seek to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>take away</span> thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>life</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343811" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> my father, even in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dream</span>, that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take</span> his family and depart into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343812" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>obedient</span> unto the word of the Lord, wherefore he did as the Lord commanded him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343813" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that he departed into the wilderness. And he left his house, and the land of his inheritance, and his gold, and his silver, and his precious things, and took nothing with him, save it <span class="page-break" data-page="4"></span>were his family, and provisions, and tents, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>departed</span> into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343814" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And he came down by the borders near the shore of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Red Sea</span>; and he traveled in the wilderness in the borders which are nearer the Red Sea; and he did travel in the wilderness with his family, which consisted of my mother, Sariah, and my elder brothers, who were Laman, Lemuel, and Sam.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343815" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that when he had traveled three days in the wilderness, he pitched his tent in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley</span> by the side of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>river</span> of water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343816" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that he built an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>altar</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stones</span>, and made an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>offering</span> unto the Lord, and gave <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>thanks</span> unto the Lord our God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343817" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that he called the name of the river, Laman, and it emptied into the Red Sea; and the valley was in the borders near the mouth thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343818" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And when my father saw that the waters of the river emptied into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fountain</span> of the Red Sea, he spake unto Laman, saying: O that thou mightest be like unto this river, continually running into the fountain of all righteousness!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344819" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he also spake unto Lemuel: O that thou mightest be like unto this valley, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>firm</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>steadfast</span>, and immovable in keeping the commandments of the Lord!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344820" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now this he spake because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffneckedness</span> of Laman and Lemuel; for behold they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murmur</span> in many things against their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>father</span>, because he was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>visionary</span> man, and had led them out of the land of Jerusalem, to leave the land of their inheritance, and their gold, and their silver, and their precious things, to perish in the wilderness. And this they said he had done because of the foolish imaginations of his heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344821" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And thus Laman and Lemuel, being the eldest, did murmur against their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span>. And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murmur</span> because they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knew not</span> the dealings of that God who had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>created</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344822" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Neither did they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> that Jerusalem, that great city, could be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyed</span> according to the words of the prophets. And they were like unto the Jews who were at Jerusalem, who sought to take away the life of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344823" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that my father did speak unto them in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley of Lemuel</span>, with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span>, being filled with the Spirit, until their frames did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>shake</span> before him. And he did confound them, that they durst not utter against him; wherefore, they did as he commanded them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344824" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And my father dwelt in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tent</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344825" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, being exceedingly young, nevertheless being large in stature, and also having great desires to know of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mysteries</span> of God, <span class="page-break" data-page="5"></span>wherefore, I did cry unto the Lord; and behold he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visit</span> me, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>soften</span> my heart that I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>believe</span> all the words which had been spoken by my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>father</span>; wherefore, I did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>rebel</span> against him like unto my brothers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344826" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And I spake unto Sam, making known unto him the things which the Lord had manifested unto me by his Holy Spirit. And it came to pass that he believed in my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344827" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But, behold, Laman and Lemuel would not hearken unto my words; and being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grieved</span> because of the hardness of their hearts I cried unto the Lord for them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344828" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord spake unto me, saying: Blessed art thou, Nephi, because of thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, for thou hast sought me diligently, with lowliness of heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344829" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And inasmuch as ye shall keep my commandments, ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span>, and shall be led to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of promise</span>; yea, even a land which I have prepared for you; yea, a land which is choice above all other lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344830" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And inasmuch as thy brethren shall rebel against thee, they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cut off</span> from the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344831" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And inasmuch as thou shalt keep my commandments, thou shalt be made a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ruler</span> and a teacher over thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344832" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For behold, in that day that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebel</span> against me, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>curse</span> them even with a sore curse, and they shall have no power over thy seed except they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rebel</span> against me also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344833" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And if it so be that they rebel against me, they shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scourge</span> unto thy seed, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stir</span> them up in the ways of remembrance.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344558" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344582" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344583" id="study_summary1">Lehi’s sons return to Jerusalem to obtain the plates of brass—Laban refuses to give the plates up—Nephi exhorts and encourages his brethren—Laban steals their property and attempts to slay them—Laman and Lemuel smite Nephi and Sam and are reproved by an angel. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344585" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, returned from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>speaking</span> with the Lord, to the tent of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344587" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that he spake unto me, saying: Behold I have dreamed a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dream</span>, in the which the Lord hath commanded me that thou and thy brethren shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>return</span> to Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344589" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For behold, Laban hath the record of the Jews and also a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>genealogy</span> of my forefathers, and they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>engraven</span> upon plates of brass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344591" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, the Lord hath commanded me that thou and thy brothers should go unto the house of Laban, and seek the records, and bring them down hither into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344593" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, behold thy brothers murmur, saying it is a hard thing which I have required of them; but behold I have not required it of <span class="page-break" data-page="6"></span>them, but it is a commandment of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344595" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Therefore go, my son, and thou shalt be favored of the Lord, because thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murmured</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344597" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, said unto my father: I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>will</span> go and do the things which the Lord hath commanded, for I know that the Lord giveth no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commandments</span> unto the children of men, save he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prepare</span> a way for them that they may accomplish the thing which he commandeth them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344599" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that when my father had heard these words he was exceedingly glad, for he knew that I had been blessed of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344601" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And I, Nephi, and my brethren took our journey in the wilderness, with our tents, to go up to the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344603" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that when we had gone up to the land of Jerusalem, I and my brethren did consult one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344606" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast lots</span>—who of us should go in unto the house of Laban. And it came to pass that the lot fell upon Laman; and Laman went in unto the house of Laban, and he talked with him as he sat in his house.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344608" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he desired of Laban the records which were engraven upon the plates of brass, which contained the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>genealogy</span> of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344610" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, it came to pass that Laban was angry, and thrust him out from his presence; and he would not that he should have the records. Wherefore, he said unto him: Behold thou art a robber, and I will slay thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344950" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But Laman fled out of his presence, and told the things which Laban had done, unto us. And we began to be exceedingly sorrowful, and my brethren were about to return unto my father in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344951" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But behold I said unto them that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>As</span> the Lord liveth, and as we live, we will not go down unto our father in the wilderness until we have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>accomplished</span> the thing which the Lord hath commanded us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344952" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wherefore, let us be faithful in keeping the commandments of the Lord; therefore let us go down to the land of our father’s <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inheritance</span>, for behold he left gold and silver, and all manner of riches. And all this he hath done because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commandments</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344953" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For he knew that Jerusalem must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span>, because of the wickedness of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344954" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For behold, they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejected</span> the words of the prophets. Wherefore, if my father should dwell in the land after he hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commanded</span> to flee out of the land, behold, he would also perish. Wherefore, it must needs be that he flee out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344955" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, it is wisdom in God that we should obtain these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span>, that we may preserve unto our children the language of our fathers;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344956" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And also that we may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preserve</span> unto them the words which have been spoken by the mouth of all the holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophets</span>, which have been delivered unto them by the Spirit and power of God, since the world began, even down unto this present time.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="7"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344957" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that after this manner of language did I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persuade</span> my brethren, that they might be faithful in keeping the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344958" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that we went down to the land of our inheritance, and we did gather together our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span>, and our silver, and our precious things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344959" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And after we had gathered these things together, we went up again unto the house of Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344960" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that we went in unto Laban, and desired him that he would give unto us the records which were engraven upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, for which we would give unto him our gold, and our silver, and all our precious things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344961" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that when Laban saw our property, and that it was exceedingly great, he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lust</span> after it, insomuch that he thrust us out, and sent his servants to slay us, that he might obtain our property.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344962" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>it</span> came to pass that we did flee before the servants of Laban, and we were obliged to leave behind our property, and it fell into the hands of Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344963" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that we fled into the wilderness, and the servants of Laban did not overtake us, and we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hid</span> ourselves in the cavity of a rock.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344964" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that Laman was angry with me, and also with my father; and also was Lemuel, for he hearkened unto the words of Laman. Wherefore Laman and Lemuel did speak many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hard words</span> unto us, their younger brothers, and they did smite us even with a rod.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344965" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass as they smote us with a rod, behold, an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of the Lord came and stood before them, and he spake unto them, saying: Why do ye smite your younger brother with a rod? Know ye not that the Lord hath chosen him to be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ruler</span> over you, and this because of your iniquities? Behold ye shall go up to Jerusalem again, and the Lord will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliver</span> Laban into your hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344966" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> had spoken unto us, he departed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344967" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And after the angel had departed, Laman and Lemuel again began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murmur</span>, saying: How is it possible that the Lord will deliver Laban into our hands? Behold, he is a mighty man, and he can command fifty, yea, even he can slay fifty; then why not us?</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344975" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344976" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344977" id="study_summary1">Nephi slays Laban at the Lord’s command and then secures the plates of brass by stratagem—Zoram chooses to join Lehi’s family in the wilderness. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344978" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that I spake unto my brethren, saying: Let us go up again unto Jerusalem, and let us be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faithful</span> in keeping the commandments of the Lord; for behold he is mightier than all the earth, then why not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mightier</span> than Laban and his fifty, yea, or even than his tens of thousands?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344979" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Therefore let us go up; let us be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strong</span> like unto Moses; for he truly spake unto the waters of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Red Sea</span> and they divided hither and thither, and our fathers came through, out of captivity, on dry ground, and the armies of Pharaoh <span class="page-break" data-page="8"></span>did follow and were drowned in the waters of the Red Sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344980" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now behold ye know that this is true; and ye also know that an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> hath spoken unto you; wherefore can ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>doubt</span>? Let us go up; the Lord is able to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliver</span> us, even as our fathers, and to destroy Laban, even as the Egyptians.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344981" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now when I had spoken these words, they were yet wroth, and did still continue to murmur; nevertheless they did follow me up until we came without the walls of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344982" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it was by night; and I caused that they should hide themselves without the walls. And after they had hid themselves, I, Nephi, crept into the city and went forth towards the house of Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344983" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led</span> by the Spirit, not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowing</span> beforehand the things which I should do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344984" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Nevertheless I went forth, and as I came near unto the house of Laban I beheld a man, and he had fallen to the earth before me, for he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drunken</span> with wine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344985" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when I came to him I found that it was Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344986" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And I beheld his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span>, and I drew it forth from the sheath thereof; and the hilt thereof was of pure gold, and the workmanship thereof was exceedingly fine, and I saw that the blade thereof was of the most precious steel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344987" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>constrained</span> by the Spirit that I should kill Laban; but I said in my heart: Never at any time have I shed the blood of man. And I shrunk and would that I might not slay him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344988" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Spirit said unto me again: Behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delivered</span> him into thy hands. Yea, and I also knew that he had sought to take away mine own life; yea, and he would not hearken unto the commandments of the Lord; and he also had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>taken</span> away our property.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344989" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that the Spirit said unto me again: Slay him, for the Lord hath delivered him into thy hands;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344990" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slayeth</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wicked</span> to bring forth his righteous purposes. It is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>better</span> that one man should perish than that a nation should dwindle and perish in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>unbelief</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344991" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, when I, Nephi, had heard these words, I remembered the words of the Lord which he spake unto me in the wilderness, saying that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Inasmuch</span> as thy seed shall keep my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commandments</span>, they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prosper</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>land of promise</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344992" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, and I also thought that they could not keep the commandments of the Lord according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> of Moses, save they should have the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344993" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I also knew that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> was engraven upon the plates of brass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344994" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And again, I knew that the Lord had delivered Laban into my hands for this cause—that I might obtain the records according to his commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344995" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Therefore I did obey the voice of the Spirit, and took Laban by the hair of the head, and I smote off his head with his own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344996" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And after I had smitten off his <span class="page-break" data-page="9"></span>head with his own sword, I took the garments of Laban and put them upon mine own body; yea, even every whit; and I did gird on his armor about my loins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344997" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And after I had done this, I went forth unto the treasury of Laban. And as I went forth towards the treasury of Laban, behold, I saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span> of Laban who had the keys of the treasury. And I commanded him in the voice of Laban, that he should go with me into the treasury.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344998" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he supposed me to be his master, Laban, for he beheld the garments and also the sword girded about my loins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344999" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And he spake unto me concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>elders</span> of the Jews, he knowing that his master, Laban, had been out by night among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345000" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And I spake unto him as if it had been Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345001" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And I also spake unto him that I should carry the engravings, which were upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, to my elder brethren, who were without the walls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345002" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And I also bade him that he should follow me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345003" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And he, supposing that I spake of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brethren</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span>, and that I was truly that Laban whom I had slain, wherefore he did follow me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345004" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And he spake unto me many times concerning the elders of the Jews, as I went forth unto my brethren, who were without the walls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345005" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that when Laman saw me he was exceedingly frightened, and also Lemuel and Sam. And they fled from before my presence; for they supposed it was Laban, and that he had slain me and had sought to take away their lives also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345006" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that I called after them, and they did hear me; wherefore they did cease to flee from my presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345007" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that when the servant of Laban beheld my brethren he began to tremble, and was about to flee from before me and return to the city of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345008" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And now I, Nephi, being a man large in stature, and also having received much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> of the Lord, therefore I did seize upon the servant of Laban, and held him, that he should not flee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345009" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that I spake with him, that if he would hearken unto my words, as the Lord liveth, and as I live, even so that if he would hearken unto our words, we would spare his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345010" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And I spake unto him, even with an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span>, that he need not fear; that he should be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>free</span> man like unto us if he would go down in the wilderness with us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345011" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And I also spake unto him, saying: Surely the Lord hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> us to do this thing; and shall we not be diligent in keeping the commandments of the Lord? Therefore, if thou wilt go down into the wilderness to my father thou shalt have place with us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345012" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoram</span> did take courage at the words which I spake. Now Zoram was the name of the servant; and he promised that he would go down into the wilderness unto our father. Yea, and he also made an oath unto us that he would tarry with us from that time forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345013" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now we were desirous that he should tarry with us for this cause, that the Jews might not know concerning our flight into the wilderness, lest they should pursue us and destroy us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345014" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that when <span class="page-break" data-page="10"></span>Zoram had made an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> unto us, our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fears</span> did cease concerning him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345015" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that we took the plates of brass and the servant of Laban, and departed into the wilderness, and journeyed unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tent</span> of our father.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344710" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344713" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344714" id="study_summary1">Sariah complains against Lehi—Both rejoice over the return of their sons—They offer sacrifices—The plates of brass contain writings of Moses and the prophets—The plates identify Lehi as a descendant of Joseph—Lehi prophesies concerning his seed and the preservation of the plates. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344716" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that after we had come down into the wilderness unto our father, behold, he was filled with joy, and also my mother, Sariah, was exceedingly glad, for she truly had mourned because of us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344718" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For she had supposed that we had perished in the wilderness; and she also had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>complained</span> against my father, telling him that he was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visionary</span> man; saying: Behold thou hast led us forth from the land of our inheritance, and my sons are no more, and we perish in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344720" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And after this manner of language had my mother complained against my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344721" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it had come to pass that my father spake unto her, saying: I know that I am a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visionary</span> man; for if I had not seen the things of God in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vision</span> I should not have known the goodness of God, but had tarried at Jerusalem, and had perished with my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344723" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But behold, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>obtained</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of promise</span>, in the which things I do rejoice; yea, and I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>know</span> that the Lord will deliver my sons out of the hands of Laban, and bring them down again unto us in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344725" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And after this manner of language did my father, Lehi, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>comfort</span> my mother, Sariah, concerning us, while we journeyed in the wilderness up to the land of Jerusalem, to obtain the record of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344727" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And when we had returned to the tent of my father, behold their joy was full, and my mother was comforted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344728" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And she spake, saying: Now I know of a surety that the Lord hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> my husband to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flee</span> into the wilderness; yea, and I also know of a surety that the Lord hath protected my sons, and delivered them out of the hands of Laban, and given them power whereby they could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>accomplish</span> the thing which the Lord hath commanded them. And after this manner of language did she speak.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344730" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they did rejoice exceedingly, and did offer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifice</span> and burnt offerings unto the Lord; and they gave <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thanks</span> unto the God of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344732" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And after they had given thanks unto the God of Israel, my father, Lehi, took the records which were engraven upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, and he did search them from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344734" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he beheld that they did contain the five <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>books</span> of Moses, which gave an account of the creation of the world, and also of Adam and Eve, who were our first parents;</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="11"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344735" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And also a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of the Jews from the beginning, even down to the commencement of the reign of Zedekiah, king of Judah;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344738" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And also the prophecies of the holy prophets, from the beginning, even down to the commencement of the reign of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zedekiah</span>; and also many prophecies which have been spoken by the mouth of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jeremiah</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344740" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that my father, Lehi, also found upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>genealogy</span> of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fathers</span>; wherefore he knew that he was a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Joseph</span>; yea, even that Joseph who was the son of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Jacob</span>, who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>sold</span> into Egypt, and who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>preserved</span> by the hand of the Lord, that he might preserve his father, Jacob, and all his household from perishing with famine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344743" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And they were also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led</span> out of captivity and out of the land of Egypt, by that same God who had preserved them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344745" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And thus my father, Lehi, did discover the genealogy of his fathers. And Laban also was a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Joseph</span>, wherefore he and his fathers had kept the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344747" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now when my father saw all these things, he was filled with the Spirit, and began to prophesy concerning his seed—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344750" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>That these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span> should go forth unto all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nations</span>, kindreds, tongues, and people who were of his seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344752" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore, he said that these plates of brass should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> perish; neither should they be dimmed any more by time. And he prophesied many things concerning his seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344754" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that thus far I and my father had kept the commandments wherewith the Lord had commanded us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344757" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And we had obtained the records which the Lord had commanded us, and searched them and found that they were desirable; yea, even of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worth</span> unto us, insomuch that we could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserve</span> the commandments of the Lord unto our children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344759" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Wherefore, it was wisdom in the Lord that we should carry them with us, as we journeyed in the wilderness towards the land of promise.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345022" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345023" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345024" id="study_summary1">Nephi writes of the things of God—Nephi’s purpose is to persuade men to come unto the God of Abraham and be saved. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345025" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Nephi, do not give the genealogy of my fathers in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> part of my record; neither at any time shall I give it after upon these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates</span> which I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>writing</span>; for it is given in the record which has been kept by my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>father</span>; wherefore, I do not write it in this work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345026" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For it sufficeth me to say that we are descendants of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Joseph</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345027" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it mattereth not to me that I am particular to give a full account of all the things of my father, for they cannot be written upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these <span class="page-break" data-page="12"></span>plates</span>, for I desire the room that I may write of the things of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345028" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For the fulness of mine intent is that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persuade</span> men to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, and be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345029" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore, the things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pleasing</span> unto the world I do not write, but the things which are pleasing unto God and unto those who are not of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345030" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, I shall give commandment unto my seed, that they shall not occupy these plates with things which are not of worth unto the children of men.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344801" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344802" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344803" id="study_summary1">Lehi’s sons return to Jerusalem and invite Ishmael and his household to join them in their journey—Laman and others rebel—Nephi exhorts his brethren to have faith in the Lord—They bind him with cords and plan his destruction—He is freed by the power of faith—His brethren ask forgiveness—Lehi and his company offer sacrifice and burnt offerings. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344804" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I would that ye might know, that after my father, Lehi, had made an end of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesying</span> concerning his seed, it came to pass that the Lord spake unto him again, saying that it was not meet for him, Lehi, that he should take his family into the wilderness alone; but that his sons should take <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>daughters</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wife</span>, that they might raise up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>seed</span> unto the Lord in the land of promise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344805" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> him that I, Nephi, and my brethren, should again return unto the land of Jerusalem, and bring down Ishmael and his family into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344806" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span>, with my brethren, go forth into the wilderness to go up to Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344807" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that we went up unto the house of Ishmael, and we did gain favor in the sight of Ishmael, insomuch that we did speak unto him the words of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344808" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> did soften the heart of Ishmael, and also his household, insomuch that they took their journey with us down into the wilderness to the tent of our father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344809" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that as we journeyed in the wilderness, behold Laman and Lemuel, and two of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of Ishmael, and the two <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sons</span> of Ishmael and their families, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rebel</span> against us; yea, against me, Nephi, and Sam, and their father, Ishmael, and his wife, and his three other daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344810" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass in the which rebellion, they were desirous to return unto the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344811" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now I, Nephi, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grieved</span> for the hardness of their hearts, therefore I spake unto them, saying, yea, even unto Laman and unto Lemuel: Behold ye are mine elder brethren, and how is it that ye are so hard in your hearts, and so blind in your minds, that ye have need that I, your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>younger</span> brother, should speak unto you, yea, and set an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>example</span> for you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344812" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>How is it that ye have not hearkened unto the word of the Lord?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344813" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>How is it that ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgotten</span> that ye have seen an angel of the Lord?</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="13"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344814" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, and how is it that ye have forgotten what great things the Lord hath done for us, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivering</span> us out of the hands of Laban, and also that we should obtain the record?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344815" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, and how is it that ye have forgotten that the Lord is able to do all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>things</span> according to his will, for the children of men, if it so be that they exercise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in him? Wherefore, let us be faithful to him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344816" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And if it so be that we are faithful to him, we shall obtain the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of promise</span>; and ye shall know at some future period that the word of the Lord shall be fulfilled concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jerusalem</span>; for all things which the Lord hath spoken concerning the destruction of Jerusalem must be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344817" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ceaseth</span> soon to strive with them; for behold, they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rejected</span> the prophets, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Jeremiah</span> have they cast into prison. And they have sought to take away the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>life</span> of my father, insomuch that they have driven him out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344818" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now behold, I say unto you that if ye will return unto Jerusalem ye shall also perish with them. And now, if ye have choice, go up to the land, and remember the words which I speak unto you, that if ye go ye will also perish; for thus the Spirit of the Lord constraineth me that I should speak.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345819" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that when I, Nephi, had spoken these words unto my brethren, they were angry with me. And it came to pass that they did lay their hands upon me, for behold, they were exceedingly wroth, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bind</span> me with cords, for they sought to take away my life, that they might leave me in the wilderness to be devoured by wild beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345820" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But it came to pass that I prayed unto the Lord, saying: O Lord, according to my faith which is in thee, wilt thou deliver me from the hands of my brethren; yea, even give me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burst</span> these bands with which I am bound.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345821" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that when I had said these words, behold, the bands were loosed from off my hands and feet, and I stood before my brethren, and I spake unto them again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345822" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that they were angry with me again, and sought to lay hands upon me; but behold, one of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of Ishmael, yea, and also her mother, and one of the sons of Ishmael, did plead with my brethren, insomuch that they did soften their hearts; and they did cease striving to take away my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345823" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they were sorrowful, because of their wickedness, insomuch that they did bow down before me, and did plead with me that I would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgive</span> them of the thing that they had done against me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345824" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that I did frankly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgive</span> them all that they had done, and I did exhort them that they would pray unto the Lord their God for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>forgiveness</span>. And it came to pass that they did so. And after they had done praying unto the Lord we did again travel on our journey towards the tent of our father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345825" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that we did <span class="page-break" data-page="14"></span>come down unto the tent of our father. And after I and my brethren and all the house of Ishmael had come down unto the tent of my father, they did give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thanks</span> unto the Lord their God; and they did offer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sacrifice</span> and burnt offerings unto him.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345860" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345861" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345862" id="study_summary1">Lehi sees a vision of the tree of life—He partakes of its fruit and desires his family to do likewise—He sees a rod of iron, a strait and narrow path, and the mists of darkness that enshroud men—Sariah, Nephi, and Sam partake of the fruit, but Laman and Lemuel refuse. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345863" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that we had gathered together all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seeds</span> of every kind, both of grain of every kind, and also of the seeds of fruit of every kind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345864" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that while my father tarried in the wilderness he spake unto us, saying: Behold, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dreamed</span> a dream;
