or, in other words, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seen</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>vision</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345865" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And behold, because of the thing which I have seen, I have reason to rejoice in the Lord because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span> and also of Sam; for I have reason to suppose that they, and also many of their seed, will be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345866" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Laman</span> and Lemuel, I fear exceedingly because of you; for behold, methought I saw in my dream, a dark and dreary wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345867" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that I saw a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span>, and he was dressed in a white <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>robe</span>; and he came and stood before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345868" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that he spake unto me, and bade me follow him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345869" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that as I followed him I beheld myself that I was in a dark and dreary waste.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345870" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And after I had traveled for the space of many hours in darkness, I began to pray unto the Lord that he would have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> on me, according to the multitude of his tender mercies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345871" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass after I had prayed unto the Lord I beheld a large and spacious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>field</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345872" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree</span>, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> was desirable to make one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>happy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345873" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that I did go forth and partake of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruit</span> thereof; and I beheld that it was most sweet, above all that I ever before tasted. Yea, and I beheld that the fruit thereof was white, to exceed all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whiteness</span> that I had ever seen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345874" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And as I partook of the fruit thereof it filled my soul with exceedingly great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span>; wherefore, I began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>desirous</span> that my family should partake of it also; for I knew that it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>desirable</span> above all other fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345875" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And as I cast my eyes round about, that perhaps I might discover my family also, I beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>river</span> of water; and it ran along, and it was near the tree of which I was partaking the fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345876" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And I looked to behold from whence it came; and I saw the head thereof a little way off; and at the head thereof I beheld your mother Sariah, and Sam, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>; and they stood as if they knew not whither they should go.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345877" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that I <span class="page-break" data-page="15"></span>beckoned unto them; and I also did say unto them with a loud voice that they should come unto me, and partake of the fruit, which was desirable above all other fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345878" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that they did come unto me and partake of the fruit also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345879" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that I was desirous that Laman and Lemuel should come and partake of the fruit also; wherefore, I cast mine eyes towards the head of the river, that perhaps I might see them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345880" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that I saw them, but they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> come unto me and partake of the fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345881" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And I beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rod of iron</span>, and it extended along the bank of the river, and led to the tree by which I stood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345882" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And I also beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strait</span> and narrow path, which came along by the rod of iron, even to the tree by which I stood; and it also led by the head of the fountain, unto a large and spacious field, as if it had been a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>world</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345883" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And I saw numberless concourses of people, many of whom were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pressing</span> forward, that they might obtain the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>path</span> which led unto the tree by which I stood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345884" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that they did come forth, and commence in the path which led to the tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345885" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that there arose a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mist</span> of darkness; yea, even an exceedingly great mist of darkness, insomuch that they who had commenced in the path did lose their way, that they wandered off and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lost</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345886" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld others pressing forward, and they came forth and caught hold of the end of the rod of iron; and they did press forward through the mist of darkness, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>clinging</span> to the rod of iron, even until they did come forth and partake of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> of the tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345887" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And after they had partaken of the fruit of the tree they did cast their eyes about as if they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ashamed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345888" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And I also cast my eyes round about, and beheld, on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other</span> side of the river of water, a great and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spacious</span> building; and it stood as it were in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>air</span>, high above the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345889" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it was filled with people, both old and young, both male and female; and their manner of dress was exceedingly fine; and they were in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>attitude</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mocking</span> and pointing their fingers towards those who had come at and were partaking of the fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345890" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And after they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tasted</span> of the fruit they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ashamed</span>, because of those that were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scoffing</span> at them; and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fell away</span> into forbidden paths and were lost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345891" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now I, Nephi, do not speak <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> the words of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345892" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>But, to be short in writing, behold, he saw other multitudes pressing forward; and they came and caught hold of the end of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rod of iron</span>; and they did press their way forward, continually holding <span class="page-break" data-page="16"></span>fast to the rod of iron, until they came forth and fell down and partook of the fruit of the tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345893" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he also saw other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>multitudes</span> feeling their way towards that great and spacious building.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345894" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that many were drowned in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>depths</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fountain</span>; and many were lost from his view, wandering in strange roads.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345895" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And great was the multitude that did enter into that strange building. And after they did enter into that building they did point the finger of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scorn</span> at me and those that were partaking of the fruit also; but we heeded them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345896" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>These are the words of my father: For as many as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heeded</span> them, had fallen away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345897" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Laman</span> and Lemuel partook not of the fruit, said my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345898" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass after my father had spoken all the words of his dream or vision, which were many, he said unto us, because of these things which he saw in a vision, he exceedingly feared for Laman and Lemuel; yea, he feared lest they should be cast off from the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345899" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exhort</span> them then with all the feeling of a tender parent, that they would hearken to his words, that perhaps the Lord would be merciful to them, and not cast them off; yea, my father did preach unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345900" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And after he had preached unto them, and also prophesied unto them of many things, he bade them to keep the commandments of the Lord; and he did cease speaking unto them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345950" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345951" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345952" id="study_summary1">Nephi makes two sets of records—Each is called the plates of Nephi—The larger plates contain a secular history; the smaller ones deal primarily with sacred things. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345953" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And all these things did my father see, and hear, and speak, as he dwelt in a tent, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley of Lemuel</span>, and also a great many more things, which cannot be written upon these plates.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345954" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now, as I have spoken concerning these plates, behold they are not the plates upon which I make a full account of the history of my people; for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates</span> upon which I make a full account of my people I have given the name of Nephi; wherefore, they are called the plates of Nephi, after mine own name; and these plates also are called the plates of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345955" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Nevertheless, I have received a commandment of the Lord that I should make these plates, for the special <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purpose</span> that there should be an account engraven of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ministry</span> of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345956" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Upon the other plates should be engraven an account of the reign of the kings, and the wars and contentions of my people; wherefore these plates are for the more part of the ministry; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other plates</span> are for the more part of the reign of the kings and the wars and contentions of my people.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="17"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345957" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore, the Lord hath commanded me to make these plates for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span> purpose in him, which purpose I know not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345958" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> all things from the beginning; wherefore, he prepareth a way to accomplish all his works among the children of men; for behold, he hath all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> unto the fulfilling of all his words. And thus it is. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343574" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128343576" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128343577" id="study_summary1">Lehi predicts that the Jews will be taken captive by the Babylonians—He tells of the coming among the Jews of a Messiah, a Savior, a Redeemer—Lehi tells also of the coming of the one who should baptize the Lamb of God—Lehi tells of the death and resurrection of the Messiah—He compares the scattering and gathering of Israel to an olive tree—Nephi speaks of the Son of God, of the gift of the Holy Ghost, and of the need for righteousness. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343578" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Nephi, proceed to give an account upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span> of my proceedings, and my reign and ministry; wherefore, to proceed with mine account, I must speak somewhat of the things of my father, and also of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343579" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, it came to pass after my father had made an end of speaking the words of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dream</span>, and also of exhorting them to all diligence, he spake unto them concerning the Jews—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343580" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>That after they should be destroyed, even that great city <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span>, and many be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carried away</span> captive into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Babylon</span>, according to the own due time of the Lord, they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>return</span> again, yea, even be brought back out of captivity; and after they should be brought back out of captivity they should possess again the land of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343581" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Yea, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>six hundred</span> years from the time that my father left Jerusalem, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophet</span> would the Lord God raise up among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jews</span>—even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Messiah</span>, or, in other words, a Savior of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343582" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And he also spake concerning the prophets, how great a number had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testified</span> of these things, concerning this Messiah, of whom he had spoken, or this Redeemer of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343583" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, all mankind were in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lost</span> and in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span> state, and ever would be save they should rely on this Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343584" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he spake also concerning a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophet</span> who should come before the Messiah, to prepare the way of the Lord—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343585" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, even he should go forth and cry in the wilderness: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Prepare</span> ye the way of the Lord, and make his paths straight; for there standeth one among you whom ye know not; and he is mightier than I, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose. And much spake my father concerning this thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343586" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And my father said he should <span class="page-break" data-page="18"></span>baptize in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bethabara</span>, beyond Jordan; and he also said he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptize</span> with water; even that he should baptize the Messiah with water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343587" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And after he had baptized the Messiah with water, he should behold and bear record that he had baptized the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamb</span> of God, who should take away the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343588" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass after my father had spoken these words he spake unto my brethren concerning the gospel which should be preached among the Jews, and also concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwindling</span> of the Jews in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span>. And after they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>slain</span> the Messiah, who should come, and after he had been slain he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rise</span> from the dead, and should make himself <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>manifest</span>, by the Holy Ghost, unto the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343589" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, even my father spake much concerning the Gentiles, and also concerning the house of Israel, that they should be compared like unto an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>olive tree</span>, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>branches</span> should be broken off and should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scattered</span> upon all the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343590" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, he said it must needs be that we should be led with one accord into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of promise</span>, unto the fulfilling of the word of the Lord, that we should be scattered upon all the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343591" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And after the house of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Israel</span> should be scattered they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gathered</span> together again; or, in fine, after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Gentiles</span> had received the fulness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Gospel</span>, the natural branches of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>olive tree</span>, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>remnants</span> of the house of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>Israel</span>, should be grafted in, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>come</span> to the knowledge of the true Messiah, their Lord and their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343592" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And after this manner of language did my father prophesy and speak unto my brethren, and also many more things which I do not write in this book; for I have written as many of them as were expedient for me in mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other book</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343593" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And all these things, of which I have spoken, were done as my father dwelt in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tent</span>, in the valley of Lemuel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343594" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass after I, Nephi, having heard all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of my father, concerning the things which he saw in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vision</span>, and also the things which he spake by the power of the Holy Ghost, which power he received by faith on the Son of God—and the Son of God was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Messiah</span> who should come—I, Nephi, was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>desirous</span> also that I might see, and hear, and know of these things, by the power of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Holy Ghost</span>, which is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>gift</span> of God unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>all</span> those who diligently seek him, as well in times of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>old</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="19"></span>as in the time that he should manifest himself unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343595" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For he is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>same</span> yesterday, today, and forever; and the way is prepared for all men from the foundation of the world, if it so be that they repent and come unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343596" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For he that diligently <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seeketh</span> shall find; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mysteries</span> of God shall be unfolded unto them, by the power of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Holy Ghost</span>, as well in these times as in times of old, and as well in times of old as in times to come; wherefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>course</span> of the Lord is one eternal round.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343597" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Therefore remember, O man, for all thy doings thou shalt be brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343598" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Wherefore, if ye have sought to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedly</span> in the days of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>probation</span>, then ye are found <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unclean</span> before the judgment-seat of God; and no unclean thing can dwell with God; wherefore, ye must be cast off forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343599" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And the Holy Ghost giveth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> that I should speak these things, and deny them not.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343575" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128343602" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128343605" id="study_summary1">Nephi sees the Spirit of the Lord and is shown in vision the tree of life—He sees the mother of the Son of God and learns of the condescension of God—He sees the baptism, ministry, and crucifixion of the Lamb of God—He sees also the call and ministry of the Twelve Apostles of the Lamb. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343608" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>For it came to pass after I had desired to know the things that my father had seen, and believing that the Lord was able to make them known unto me, as I sat <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pondering</span> in mine heart I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>caught away</span> in the Spirit of the Lord, yea, into an exceedingly high <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mountain</span>, which I never had before seen, and upon which I never had before set my foot.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343610" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the Spirit said unto me: Behold, what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desirest</span> thou?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343613" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I said: I desire to behold the things which my father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saw</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343615" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the Spirit said unto me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Believest</span> thou that thy father saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tree</span> of which he hath spoken?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343618" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I said: Yea, thou knowest that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> all the words of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343621" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And when I had spoken these words, the Spirit cried with a loud voice, saying: Hosanna to the Lord, the most high God; for he is God over all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>earth</span>, yea, even above all. And blessed art thou, Nephi, because thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believest</span> in the Son of the most high God; wherefore, thou shalt behold the things which thou hast desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343623" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold this thing shall be given unto thee for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span>, that after thou hast beheld the tree which bore the fruit which thy father tasted, thou shalt also behold a man descending out of heaven, and him shall ye witness; and after ye have witnessed him ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bear record</span> that it is the Son of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343626" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the Spirit said unto me: Look! And I <span class="page-break" data-page="20"></span>looked and beheld a tree; and it was like unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree</span> which my father had seen; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>beauty</span> thereof was far beyond, yea, exceeding of all beauty; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>whiteness</span> thereof did exceed the whiteness of the driven snow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343628" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass after I had seen the tree, I said unto the Spirit: I behold thou hast shown unto me the tree which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>precious</span> above all.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343631" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he said unto me: What desirest thou?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343633" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And I said unto him: To know the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>interpretation</span> thereof—for I spake unto him as a man speaketh; for I beheld that he was in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>form</span> of a man; yet nevertheless, I knew that it was the Spirit of the Lord; and he spake unto me as a man speaketh with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343636" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that he said unto me: Look! And I looked as if to look upon him, and I saw him not; for he had gone from before my presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343639" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that I looked and beheld the great city of Jerusalem, and also other cities. And I beheld the city of Nazareth; and in the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nazareth</span> I beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>virgin</span>, and she was exceedingly fair and white.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343641" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that I saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heavens</span> open; and an angel came down and stood before me; and he said unto me: Nephi, what beholdest thou?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343644" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I said unto him: A virgin, most beautiful and fair above all other virgins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343646" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And he said unto me: Knowest thou the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>condescension</span> of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343649" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And I said unto him: I know that he loveth his children; nevertheless, I do not know the meaning of all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343652" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And he said unto me: Behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>virgin</span> whom thou seest is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mother</span> of the Son of God, after the manner of the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343654" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld that she was carried away in the Spirit; and after she had been carried away in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> for the space of a time the angel spake unto me, saying: Look!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343657" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And I looked and beheld the virgin again, bearing a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>child</span> in her arms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343659" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the angel said unto me: Behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamb</span> of God, yea, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Son</span> of the Eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Father</span>! Knowest thou the meaning of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>tree</span> which thy father saw?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343662" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And I answered him, saying: Yea, it is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span> of God, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sheddeth</span> itself abroad in the hearts of the children of men; wherefore, it is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>most</span> desirable above all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343664" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he spake unto me, saying: Yea, and the most <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joyous</span> to the soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343667" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And after he had said these words, he said unto me: Look! And I looked, and I beheld the Son of God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>going</span> forth among the children of men; and I saw many fall down at his feet and worship him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343669" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rod of iron</span>, which my father had seen, was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>word</span> of God, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>led</span> to the fountain of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>living waters</span>, or to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>tree of life</span>; <span class="page-break" data-page="21"></span>which waters are a representation of the love of God; and I also beheld that the tree of life was a representation of the love of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343672" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the angel said unto me again: Look and behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>condescension</span> of God!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343674" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And I looked and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beheld</span> the Redeemer of the world, of whom my father had spoken; and I also beheld the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophet</span> who should prepare the way before him. And the Lamb of God went forth and was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>baptized</span> of him; and after he was baptized, I beheld the heavens open, and the Holy Ghost come down out of heaven and abide upon him in the form of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>dove</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343677" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And I beheld that he went forth ministering unto the people, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and great glory; and the multitudes were gathered together to hear him; and I beheld that they cast him out from among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343679" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I also beheld <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> others following him. And it came to pass that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carried away</span> in the Spirit from before my face, and I saw them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343682" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that the angel spake unto me again, saying: Look! And I looked, and I beheld the heavens open again, and I saw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> descending upon the children of men; and they did minister unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343685" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he spake unto me again, saying: Look! And I looked, and I beheld the Lamb of God going forth among the children of men. And I beheld multitudes of people who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sick</span>, and who were afflicted with all manner of diseases, and with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devils</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unclean spirits</span>; and the angel spake and showed all these things unto me. And they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>healed</span> by the power of the Lamb of God; and the devils and the unclean spirits were cast out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343687" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that the angel spake unto me again, saying: Look! And I looked and beheld the Lamb of God, that he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taken</span> by the people; yea, the Son of the everlasting God was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> of the world; and I saw and bear record.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343689" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And I, Nephi, saw that he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> upon the cross and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slain</span> for the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343690" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And after he was slain I saw the multitudes of the earth, that they were gathered together to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fight</span> against the apostles of the Lamb; for thus were the twelve called by the angel of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343691" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And the multitude of the earth was gathered together; and I beheld that they were in a large and spacious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>building</span>, like unto the building which my father saw. And the angel of the Lord spake unto me again, saying: Behold the world and the wisdom thereof; yea, behold the house of Israel hath gathered together to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fight</span> against the twelve apostles of the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343692" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that I saw and bear record, that the great and spacious building was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span> of the world; and it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fell</span>, and the fall thereof was exceedingly great. And the angel of the Lord spake unto me <span class="page-break" data-page="22"></span>again, saying: Thus shall be the destruction of all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people, that shall fight against the twelve apostles of the Lamb.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128342768" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128342769" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128342770" id="study_summary1">Nephi sees in vision the land of promise; the righteousness, iniquity, and downfall of its inhabitants; the coming of the Lamb of God among them; how the Twelve Disciples and the Twelve Apostles will judge Israel; and the loathsome and filthy state of those who dwindle in unbelief. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342780" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the angel said unto me: Look, and behold thy seed, and also the seed of thy brethren. And I looked and beheld the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of promise</span>; and I beheld multitudes of people, yea, even as it were in number as many as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sand</span> of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342782" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld multitudes gathered together to battle, one against the other; and I beheld <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span>, and rumors of wars, and great slaughters with the sword among my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342785" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld many generations pass away, after the manner of wars and contentions in the land; and I beheld many cities, yea, even that I did not number them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342787" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that I saw a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mist</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>darkness</span> on the face of the land of promise; and I saw lightnings, and I heard thunderings, and earthquakes, and all manner of tumultuous noises; and I saw the earth and the rocks, that they rent; and I saw mountains tumbling into pieces; and I saw the plains of the earth, that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>broken up</span>; and I saw many cities that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sunk</span>; and I saw many that they were burned with fire; and I saw many that did tumble to the earth, because of the quaking thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342789" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass after I saw these things, I saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vapor</span> of darkness, that it passed from off the face of the earth; and behold, I saw multitudes who had not fallen because of the great and terrible judgments of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342792" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And I saw the heavens open, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamb</span> of God descending out of heaven; and he came down and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>showed</span> himself unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342794" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And I also saw and bear record that the Holy Ghost fell upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> others; and they were ordained of God, and chosen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342796" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the angel spake unto me, saying: Behold the twelve disciples of the Lamb, who are chosen to minister unto thy seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342799" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he said unto me: Thou rememberest the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve apostles</span> of the Lamb? Behold they are they who shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span> the twelve tribes of Israel; wherefore, the twelve ministers of thy seed shall be judged of them; for ye are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342801" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve ministers</span> whom thou beholdest shall judge thy seed. And, behold, they are righteous forever; for because of their faith in the Lamb of God their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>garments</span> are made white in his blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342803" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the angel said unto me: Look! And I looked, and beheld <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> generations pass away in <span class="page-break" data-page="23"></span>righteousness; and their garments were white even like unto the Lamb of God. And the angel said unto me: These are made white in the blood of the Lamb, because of their faith in him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342806" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I, Nephi, also saw many of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fourth</span> generation who passed away in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342808" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that I saw the multitudes of the earth gathered together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342810" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And the angel said unto me: Behold thy seed, and also the seed of thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342813" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that I looked and beheld the people of my seed gathered together in multitudes <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> the seed of my brethren; and they were gathered together to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342815" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And the angel spake unto me, saying: Behold the fountain of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>filthy</span> water which thy father saw; yea, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>river</span> of which he spake; and the depths thereof are the depths of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hell</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342818" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mists</span> of darkness are the temptations of the devil, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blindeth</span> the eyes, and hardeneth the hearts of the children of men, and leadeth them away into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>broad roads</span>, that they perish and are lost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343820" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And the large and spacious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>building</span>, which thy father saw, is vain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>imaginations</span> and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pride</span> of the children of men. And a great and a terrible <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gulf</span> divideth them; yea, even the word of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>justice</span> of the Eternal God, and the Messiah who is the Lamb of God, of whom the Holy Ghost beareth record, from the beginning of the world until this time, and from this time henceforth and forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343822" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And while the angel spake these words, I beheld and saw that the seed of my brethren did contend against my seed, according to the word of the angel; and because of the pride of my seed, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temptations</span> of the devil, I beheld that the seed of my brethren did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>overpower</span> the people of my seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343824" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld, and saw the people of the seed of my brethren that they had overcome my seed; and they went forth in multitudes upon the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343827" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And I saw them gathered together in multitudes; and I saw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span> and rumors of wars among them; and in wars and rumors of wars I saw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>many generations</span> pass away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343829" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And the angel said unto me: Behold these shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwindle</span> in unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343831" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld, after they had dwindled in unbelief they became a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dark</span>, and loathsome, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthy</span> people, full of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>idleness</span> and all manner of abominations.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128342771" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128342772" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128342773" id="study_summary1">Nephi sees in vision the church of the devil set up among the Gentiles, the discovery and colonizing of America, the loss of many plain and precious parts of the Bible, the resultant state of gentile apostasy, the restoration of the gospel, the coming forth of latter-day scripture, and the building up of Zion. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="24"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342774" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the angel spake unto me, saying: Look! And I looked and beheld many nations and kingdoms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342775" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the angel said unto me: What beholdest thou? And I said: I behold many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nations</span> and kingdoms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342776" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he said unto me: These are the nations and kingdoms of the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342777" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that I saw among the nations of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span> the formation of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>great church</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342778" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the angel said unto me: Behold the formation of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> which is most abominable above all other churches, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slayeth</span> the saints of God, yea, and tortureth them and bindeth them down, and yoketh them with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>yoke</span> of iron, and bringeth them down into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342779" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>abominable</span> church; and I saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span> that he was the founder of it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342781" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And I also saw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span>, and silver, and silks, and scarlets, and fine-twined <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>linen</span>, and all manner of precious clothing; and I saw many harlots.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342783" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the angel spake unto me, saying: Behold the gold, and the silver, and the silks, and the scarlets, and the fine-twined linen, and the precious clothing, and the harlots, are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desires</span> of this great and abominable church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342784" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And also for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>praise</span> of the world do they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> the saints of God, and bring them down into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342786" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that I looked and beheld many waters; and they divided the Gentiles from the seed of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342788" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that the angel said unto me: Behold the wrath of God is upon the seed of thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342790" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I looked and beheld a man among the Gentiles, who was separated from the seed of my brethren by the many waters; and I beheld the Spirit of God, that it came down and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrought</span> upon the man; and he went forth upon the many waters, even unto the seed of my brethren, who were in the promised land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342791" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld the Spirit of God, that it wrought upon other Gentiles; and they went forth out of captivity, upon the many waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342793" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>multitudes</span> of the Gentiles upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of promise</span>; and I beheld the wrath of God, that it was upon the seed of my brethren; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scattered</span> before the Gentiles and were smitten.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342795" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I beheld the Spirit of the Lord, that it was upon the Gentiles, and they did prosper and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>obtain</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> for their inheritance; and I beheld that they were white, and exceedingly fair and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>beautiful</span>, like unto my people before they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>slain</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342797" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, beheld that the Gentiles who had gone forth out of captivity did humble themselves before the Lord; and the power of the Lord was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>with them</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342798" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And I beheld that their mother Gentiles were gathered together <span class="page-break" data-page="25"></span>upon the waters, and upon the land also, to battle against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342800" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I beheld that the power of God was with them, and also that the wrath of God was upon all those that were gathered together <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> them to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342802" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And I, Nephi, beheld that the Gentiles that had gone out of captivity were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> by the power of God out of the hands of all other nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342804" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, beheld that they did prosper in the land; and I beheld a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span>, and it was carried forth among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342805" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the angel said unto me: Knowest thou the meaning of the book?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342807" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And I said unto him: I know not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342809" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he said: Behold it proceedeth out of the mouth of a Jew. And I, Nephi, beheld it; and he said unto me: The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> that thou beholdest is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jews</span>, which contains the covenants of the Lord, which he hath made unto the house of Israel; and it also containeth many of the prophecies of the holy prophets; and it is a record like unto the engravings which are upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>plates of brass</span>, save there are not so many; nevertheless, they contain the covenants of the Lord, which he hath made unto the house of Israel; wherefore, they are of great worth unto the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342811" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And the angel of the Lord said unto me: Thou hast beheld that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> proceeded forth from the mouth of a Jew; and when it proceeded forth from the mouth of a Jew it contained the fulness of the gospel of the Lord, of whom the twelve apostles bear record; and they bear record according to the truth which is in the Lamb of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342812" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wherefore, these things go forth from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> in purity unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, according to the truth which is in God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342814" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And after they go forth by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hand</span> of the twelve apostles of the Lamb, from the Jews <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unto</span> the Gentiles, thou seest the formation of that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>great</span> and abominable <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>church</span>, which is most abominable above all other churches; for behold, they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>taken</span> away from the gospel of the Lamb many parts which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>plain</span> and most precious; and also many covenants of the Lord have they taken away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342816" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And all this have they done that they might pervert the right ways of the Lord, that they might blind the eyes and harden the hearts of the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128342817" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Wherefore, thou seest that after the book hath gone forth through the hands of the great and abominable church, that there are many plain and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>precious</span> things taken away from the book, which is the book of the Lamb of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343819" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And after these plain and precious things were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taken</span> away it goeth forth unto all the nations of the Gentiles; and after it goeth forth unto all the nations of the Gentiles, yea, even across the many waters which thou hast seen with the Gentiles which have gone forth out of captivity, thou seest—because of the many plain and precious things which have been taken out of the <span class="page-break" data-page="26"></span>book, which were plain unto the understanding of the children of men, according to the plainness which is in the Lamb of God—because of these things which are taken away out of the gospel of the Lamb, an exceedingly great many do stumble, yea, insomuch that Satan hath great power over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343821" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Nevertheless, thou beholdest that the Gentiles who have gone forth out of captivity, and have been lifted up by the power of God above all other nations, upon the face of the land which is choice above all other lands, which is the land that the Lord God hath covenanted with thy father that his seed should have for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> of their inheritance; wherefore, thou seest that the Lord God will not suffer that the Gentiles will utterly destroy the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mixture</span> of thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>seed</span>, which are among thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343823" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Neither will he suffer that the Gentiles shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the seed of thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343825" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Neither will the Lord God suffer that the Gentiles shall forever remain in that awful state of blindness, which thou beholdest they are in, because of the plain and most precious parts of the gospel of the Lamb which have been kept back by that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominable</span> church, whose formation thou hast seen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343826" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Wherefore saith the Lamb of God: I will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> unto the Gentiles, unto the visiting of the remnant of the house of Israel in great judgment.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343828" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that the angel of the Lord spake unto me, saying: Behold, saith the Lamb of God, after I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visited</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remnant</span> of the house of Israel—and this remnant of whom I speak is the seed of thy father—wherefore, after I have visited them in judgment, and smitten them by the hand of the Gentiles, and after the Gentiles do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stumble</span> exceedingly, because of the most plain and precious parts of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gospel</span> of the Lamb which have been kept back by that abominable church, which is the mother of harlots, saith the Lamb—I will be merciful unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Gentiles</span> in that day, insomuch that I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>bring forth</span> unto them, in mine own power, much of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>gospel</span>, which shall be plain and precious, saith the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343830" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>For, behold, saith the Lamb: I will manifest myself unto thy seed, that they shall write many things which I shall minister unto them, which shall be plain and precious; and after thy seed shall be destroyed, and dwindle in unbelief, and also the seed of thy brethren, behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these things</span> shall be hid up, to come forth unto the Gentiles, by the gift and power of the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343832" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And in them shall be written my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span>, saith the Lamb, and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rock</span> and my salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343833" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> are they who shall seek to bring forth my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zion</span> at that day, for they shall have the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gift</span> and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>power</span> of the Holy Ghost; and if they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>endure</span> unto the end they <span class="page-break" data-page="27"></span>shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>lifted up</span> at the last day, and shall be saved in the everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>kingdom</span> of the Lamb; and whoso shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>publish</span> peace, yea, tidings of great joy, how beautiful upon the mountains shall they be.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343835" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld the remnant of the seed of my brethren, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> of the Lamb of God, which had proceeded forth from the mouth of the Jew, that it came forth from the Gentiles <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unto</span> the remnant of the seed of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343837" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And after it had come forth unto them I beheld <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>books</span>, which came forth by the power of the Lamb, from the Gentiles unto them, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>convincing</span> of the Gentiles and the remnant of the seed of my brethren, and also the Jews who were scattered upon all the face of the earth, that the records of the prophets and of the twelve apostles of the Lamb are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>true</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343838" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And the angel spake unto me, saying: These <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>last records</span>, which thou hast seen among the Gentiles, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>establish</span> the truth of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>first</span>, which are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>twelve apostles</span> of the Lamb, and shall make known the plain and precious things which have been taken away from them; and shall make known to all kindreds, tongues, and people, that the Lamb of God is the Son of the Eternal Father, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Savior</span> of the world; and that all men must come unto him, or they cannot be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343840" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And they must come according to the words which shall be established by the mouth of the Lamb; and the words of the Lamb shall be made known in the records of thy seed, as well as in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> of the twelve apostles of the Lamb; wherefore they both shall be established in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span>; for there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>one God</span> and one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Shepherd</span> over all the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343842" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And the time cometh that he shall manifest himself unto all nations, both unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> and also unto the Gentiles; and after he has manifested himself unto the Jews and also unto the Gentiles, then he shall manifest himself unto the Gentiles and also unto the Jews, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>last</span> shall be first, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>first</span> shall be last.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
