1 Nephi 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343959" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128343960" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128343961" id="study_summary1">An angel tells Nephi of the blessings and cursings to fall upon the Gentiles—There are only two churches: the Church of the Lamb of God and the church of the devil—The Saints of God in all nations are persecuted by the great and abominable church—The Apostle John will write concerning the end of the world. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343962" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it shall come to pass, that if the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span> shall hearken unto the Lamb of God in that day that he shall manifest himself unto them in word, and also in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span>, in very deed, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>taking</span> away of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>stumbling blocks</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343963" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And harden not their hearts <span class="page-break" data-page="28"></span>against the Lamb of God, they shall be numbered among the seed of thy father; yea, they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numbered</span> among the house of Israel; and they shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessed</span> people upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>promised land</span> forever; they shall be no more brought down into captivity; and the house of Israel shall no more be confounded.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343964" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And that great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pit</span>, which hath been digged for them by that great and abominable church, which was founded by the devil and his children, that he might lead away the souls of men down to hell—yea, that great pit which hath been digged for the destruction of men shall be filled by those who digged it, unto their utter destruction, saith the Lamb of God; not the destruction of the soul, save it be the casting of it into that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span> which hath no end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343965" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, this is according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span> of the devil, and also according to the justice of God, upon all those who will work wickedness and abomination before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343966" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the angel spake unto me, Nephi, saying: Thou hast beheld that if the Gentiles repent it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>well</span> with them; and thou also knowest concerning the covenants of the Lord unto the house of Israel; and thou also hast heard that whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repenteth</span> not must perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343967" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> be unto the Gentiles if it so be that they harden their hearts against the Lamb of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343968" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For the time cometh, saith the Lamb of God, that I will work a great and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>marvelous work</span> among the children of men; a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>work</span> which shall be everlasting, either on the one hand or on the other—either to the convincing of them unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>peace</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>life eternal</span>, or unto the deliverance of them to the hardness of their hearts and the blindness of their minds unto their being brought down into captivity, and also into destruction, both temporally and spiritually, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>captivity</span> of the devil, of which I have spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343969" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that when the angel had spoken these words, he said unto me: Rememberest thou the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenants</span> of the Father unto the house of Israel? I said unto him, Yea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343970" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that he said unto me: Look, and behold that great and abominable church, which is the mother of abominations, whose founder is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>devil</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343971" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he said unto me: Behold there are save <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>two</span> churches only; the one is the church of the Lamb of God, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>other</span> is the church of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span>; wherefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>whoso</span> belongeth not to the church of the Lamb of God belongeth to that great church, which is the mother of abominations; and she is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>whore</span> of all the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343972" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that I <span class="page-break" data-page="29"></span>looked and beheld the whore of all the earth, and she sat upon many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters</span>; and she had dominion over <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> the earth, among all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343973" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld the church of the Lamb of God, and its numbers were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>few</span>, because of the wickedness and abominations of the whore who sat upon many waters; nevertheless, I beheld that the church of the Lamb, who were the saints of God, were also upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> the face of the earth; and their dominions upon the face of the earth were small, because of the wickedness of the great whore whom I saw.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343974" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld that the great mother of abominations did gather together multitudes upon the face of all the earth, among all the nations of the Gentiles, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fight</span> against the Lamb of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343975" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, beheld the power of the Lamb of God, that it descended upon the saints of the church of the Lamb, and upon the covenant people of the Lord, who were scattered upon all the face of the earth; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>armed</span> with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteousness</span> and with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>power</span> of God in great glory.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343976" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld that the wrath of God was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poured</span> out upon that great and abominable church, insomuch that there were wars and rumors of wars among all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nations</span> and kindreds of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343977" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And as there began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span> and rumors of wars among all the nations which belonged to the mother of abominations, the angel spake unto me, saying: Behold, the wrath of God is upon the mother of harlots; and behold, thou seest all these things—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343978" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> cometh that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrath</span> of God is poured out upon the mother of harlots, which is the great and abominable church of all the earth, whose founder is the devil, then, at that day, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>work</span> of the Father shall commence, in preparing the way for the fulfilling of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>covenants</span>, which he hath made to his people who are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343979" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that the angel spake unto me, saying: Look!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343980" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And I looked and beheld a man, and he was dressed in a white robe.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343981" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the angel said unto me: Behold <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343982" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold, he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>see</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remainder</span> of these things; yea, and also many things which have been.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343983" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And he shall also write concerning the end of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343984" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Wherefore, the things which he shall write are just and true; and behold they are written in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> which thou beheld proceeding out of the mouth of the Jew; and at the time they proceeded out of the mouth of the Jew, or, at the time the book proceeded out of the mouth of the Jew, the things which were written were plain and pure, and most <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>precious</span> and easy to the understanding of all men.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="30"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343985" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And behold, the things which this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>apostle</span> of the Lamb shall write are many things which thou hast seen; and behold, the remainder shalt thou see.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343986" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But the things which thou shalt see hereafter thou shalt not write; for the Lord God hath ordained the apostle of the Lamb of God that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343987" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And also others who have been, to them hath he shown all things, and they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> them; and they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sealed</span> up to come forth in their purity, according to the truth which is in the Lamb, in the own due time of the Lord, unto the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343988" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And I, Nephi, heard and bear record, that the name of the apostle of the Lamb was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>John</span>, according to the word of the angel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343989" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And behold, I, Nephi, am forbidden that I should write the remainder of the things which I saw and heard; wherefore the things which I have written sufficeth me; and I have written but a small part of the things which I saw.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343990" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I bear record that I saw the things which my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span> saw, and the angel of the Lord did make them known unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343991" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now I make an end of speaking concerning the things which I saw while I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carried away</span> in the Spirit; and if all the things which I saw are not written, the things which I have written are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>true</span>. And thus it is. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344031" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344039" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344042" id="study_summary1">Lehi’s seed are to receive the gospel from the Gentiles in the latter days—The gathering of Israel is likened unto an olive tree whose natural branches will be grafted in again—Nephi interprets the vision of the tree of life and speaks of the justice of God in dividing the wicked from the righteous. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344044" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had been carried away in the Spirit, and seen all these things, I returned to the tent of my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344046" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that I beheld my brethren, and they were disputing one with another concerning the things which my father had spoken unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344049" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For he truly spake many great things unto them, which were hard to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>understood</span>, save a man should inquire of the Lord; and they being hard in their hearts, therefore they did not look unto the Lord as they ought.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344051" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now I, Nephi, was grieved because of the hardness of their hearts, and also, because of the things which I had seen, and knew they must unavoidably come to pass because of the great wickedness of the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344053" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that I was overcome because of my afflictions, for I considered that mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span> were great above all, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> of my people, for I had beheld their fall.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344056" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that after I had received <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> I spake unto my brethren, desiring to know of them the cause of their disputations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344058" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they said: Behold, we cannot understand the words which our father hath spoken concerning the natural branches of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>olive tree</span>, and also concerning the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344060" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And I said unto them: Have ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquired</span> of the Lord?</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="31"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344063" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And they said unto me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>We</span> have not; for the Lord maketh no such thing known unto us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344065" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold, I said unto them: How is it that ye do not keep the commandments of the Lord? How is it that ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perish</span>, because of the hardness of your hearts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344067" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Do ye not remember the things which the Lord hath said?—If ye will not harden your hearts, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ask</span> me in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span>, believing that ye shall receive, with diligence in keeping my commandments, surely these things shall be made known unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344070" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, I say unto you, that the house of Israel was compared unto an olive tree, by the Spirit of the Lord which was in our father; and behold are we not broken off from the house of Israel, and are we not a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>branch</span> of the house of Israel?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344072" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, the thing which our father meaneth concerning the grafting in of the natural branches through the fulness of the Gentiles, is, that in the latter days, when our seed shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwindled</span> in unbelief, yea, for the space of many years, and many generations after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Messiah</span> shall be manifested in body unto the children of men, then shall the fulness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gospel</span> of the Messiah come unto the Gentiles, and from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Gentiles</span> unto the remnant of our seed—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344075" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And at that day shall the remnant of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> that they are of the house of Israel, and that they are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenant</span> people of the Lord; and then shall they know and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>come</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>knowledge</span> of their forefathers, and also to the knowledge of the gospel of their Redeemer, which was ministered unto their fathers by him; wherefore, they shall come to the knowledge of their Redeemer and the very points of his doctrine, that they may know how to come unto him and be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344077" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And then at that day will they not rejoice and give praise unto their everlasting God, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rock</span> and their salvation? Yea, at that day, will they not receive the strength and nourishment from the true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vine</span>? Yea, will they not come unto the true fold of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344079" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, I say unto you, Yea; they shall be remembered again among the house of Israel; they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grafted</span> in, being a natural branch of the olive tree, into the true olive tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344082" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And this is what our father meaneth; and he meaneth that it will not come to pass until after they are scattered by the Gentiles; and he meaneth that it shall come by way of the Gentiles, that the Lord may show his power unto the Gentiles, for the very cause that he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejected</span> of the Jews, or of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344084" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, our father hath not spoken of our seed alone, but also of all the house of Israel, pointing to the covenant which should be fulfilled in the latter days; which covenant the Lord made to our father Abraham, saying: In thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> shall all the kindreds of the earth be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessed</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="32"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344086" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, spake much unto them concerning these things; yea, I spake unto them concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restoration</span> of the Jews in the latter days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344089" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And I did rehearse unto them the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Isaiah</span>, who spake <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>concerning</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restoration</span> of the Jews, or of the house of Israel; and after they were restored they should no more be confounded, neither should they be scattered again. And it came to pass that I did speak many words unto my brethren, that they were pacified and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>humble</span> themselves before the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344091" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that they did speak unto me again, saying: What meaneth this thing which our father saw in a dream? What meaneth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree</span> which he saw?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344094" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And I said unto them: It was a representation of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree of life</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344096" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they said unto me: What meaneth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rod of iron</span> which our father saw, that led to the tree?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344098" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And I said unto them that it was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of God; and whoso would hearken unto the word of God, and would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hold</span> fast unto it, they would never perish; neither could the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>temptations</span> and the fiery <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>darts</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>adversary</span> overpower them unto blindness, to lead them away to destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344101" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wherefore, I, Nephi, did exhort them to give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heed</span> unto the word of the Lord; yea, I did exhort them with all the energies of my soul, and with all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faculty</span> which I possessed, that they would give heed to the word of God and remember to keep his commandments always in all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344103" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And they said unto me: What meaneth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>river</span> of water which our father saw?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344105" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And I said unto them that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>water</span> which my father saw was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthiness</span>; and so much was his mind swallowed up in other things that he beheld not the filthiness of the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344108" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And I said unto them that it was an awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gulf</span>, which separated the wicked from the tree of life, and also from the saints of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344110" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I said unto them that it was a representation of that awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hell</span>, which the angel said unto me was prepared for the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344112" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And I said unto them that our father also saw that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> of God did also divide the wicked from the righteous; and the brightness thereof was like unto the brightness of a flaming <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fire</span>, which ascendeth up unto God forever and ever, and hath no end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344115" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And they said unto me: Doth this thing mean the torment of the body in the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>probation</span>, or doth it mean the final state of the soul after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> of the temporal body, or doth it speak of the things which are temporal?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344117" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that I said unto them that it was a representation of things both temporal and spiritual; for the day should come that they must be judged of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span>, yea, even the works which were done by the temporal body in their days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>probation</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="33"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344119" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Wherefore, if they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>die</span> in their wickedness they must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast off</span> also, as to the things which are spiritual, which are pertaining to righteousness; wherefore, they must be brought to stand before God, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judged</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>works</span>; and if their works have been filthiness they must needs be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>filthy</span>; and if they be filthy it must needs be that they cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>dwell</span> in the kingdom of God; if so, the kingdom of God must be filthy also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344121" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>But behold, I say unto you, the kingdom of God is not filthy, and there cannot any unclean thing enter into the kingdom of God; wherefore there must needs be a place of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>filthiness</span> prepared for that which is filthy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344122" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And there is a place prepared, yea, even that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>awful</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span> of which I have spoken, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span> is the preparator of it; wherefore the final state of the souls of men is to dwell in the kingdom of God, or to be cast out because of that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>justice</span> of which I have spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344124" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Wherefore, the wicked are rejected from the righteous, and also from that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree of life</span>, whose fruit is most precious and most <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>desirable</span> above all other fruits; yea, and it is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>greatest</span> of all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gifts</span> of God. And thus I spake unto my brethren. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343755" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128343771" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128343772" id="study_summary1">The wicked take the truth to be hard—Lehi’s sons marry the daughters of Ishmael—The Liahona guides their course in the wilderness—Messages from the Lord are written on the Liahona from time to time—Ishmael dies; his family murmurs because of afflictions. About 600–592 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343773" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had made an end of speaking to my brethren, behold they said unto me: Thou hast declared unto us hard things, more than we are able to bear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343774" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that I said unto them that I knew that I had spoken <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hard things</span> against the wicked, according to the truth; and the righteous have I justified, and testified that they should be lifted up at the last day; wherefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>guilty</span> taketh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>truth</span> to be hard, for it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cutteth</span> them to the very center.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343775" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now my brethren, if ye were righteous and were willing to hearken to the truth, and give heed unto it, that ye might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> uprightly before God, then ye would not murmur because of the truth, and say: Thou speakest hard things against us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343776" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did exhort my brethren, with all diligence, to keep the commandments of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343777" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> themselves before the Lord; insomuch that I had joy and great hopes of them, that they would walk in the paths of righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343778" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, all these things were said <span class="page-break" data-page="34"></span>and done as my father dwelt in a tent in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley</span> which he called Lemuel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343779" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, took one of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of Ishmael to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wife</span>; and also, my brethren took of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>daughters</span> of Ishmael to wife; and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Zoram</span> took the eldest daughter of Ishmael to wife.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343780" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus my father had fulfilled all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span> of the Lord which had been given unto him. And also, I, Nephi, had been blessed of the Lord exceedingly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343781" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord spake unto my father by night, and commanded him that on the morrow he should take his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>journey</span> into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343782" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that as my father arose in the morning, and went forth to the tent door, to his great astonishment he beheld upon the ground a round <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ball</span> of curious workmanship; and it was of fine brass. And within the ball were two spindles; and the one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pointed</span> the way whither we should go into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343783" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that we did gather together whatsoever things we should carry into the wilderness, and all the remainder of our provisions which the Lord had given unto us; and we did take <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> of every kind that we might carry into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343784" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that we did take our tents and depart into the wilderness, across the river Laman.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343785" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that we traveled for the space of four days, nearly a south-southeast direction, and we did pitch our tents again; and we did call the name of the place <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shazer</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343786" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that we did take our bows and our arrows, and go forth into the wilderness to slay food for our families; and after we had slain food for our families we did return again to our families in the wilderness, to the place of Shazer. And we did go forth again in the wilderness, following the same direction, keeping in the most fertile parts of the wilderness, which were in the borders near the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Red Sea</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343787" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that we did travel for the space of many days, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slaying</span> food by the way, with our bows and our arrows and our stones and our slings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343788" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And we did follow the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>directions</span> of the ball, which led us in the more fertile parts of the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343789" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And after we had traveled for the space of many days, we did pitch our tents for the space of a time, that we might again rest ourselves and obtain food for our families.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343790" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that as I, Nephi, went forth to slay food, behold, I did break my bow, which was made of fine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steel</span>; and after I did break my bow, behold, my brethren were angry with me because of the loss of my bow, for we did obtain no food.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343791" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that we did return without food to our families, and being much fatigued, because of their journeying, they did suffer much for the want of food.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128343792" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that Laman and Lemuel and the sons of Ishmael did begin to murmur exceedingly, because of their sufferings and afflictions in the wilderness; and also my father began to murmur against the Lord his God; yea, and they were all exceedingly sorrowful, <span class="page-break" data-page="35"></span>even that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murmur</span> against the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344032" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now it came to pass that I, Nephi, having been afflicted with my brethren because of the loss of my bow, and their bows having lost their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>springs</span>, it began to be exceedingly difficult, yea, insomuch that we could obtain no food.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344033" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did speak much unto my brethren, because they had hardened their hearts again, even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>complaining</span> against the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344034" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>make</span> out of wood a bow, and out of a straight stick, an arrow; wherefore, I did arm myself with a bow and an arrow, with a sling and with stones. And I said unto my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>father</span>: Whither shall I go to obtain food?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344035" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquire</span> of the Lord, for they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>humbled</span> themselves because of my words; for I did say many things unto them in the energy of my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344036" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord came unto my father; and he was truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chastened</span> because of his murmuring against the Lord, insomuch that he was brought down into the depths of sorrow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344037" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord said unto him: Look upon the ball, and behold the things which are written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344038" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that when my father beheld the things which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> upon the ball, he did fear and tremble exceedingly, and also my brethren and the sons of Ishmael and our wives.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344040" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, beheld the pointers which were in the ball, that they did work according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> and diligence and heed which we did give unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344041" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And there was also written upon them a new writing, which was plain to be read, which did give us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>understanding</span> concerning the ways of the Lord; and it was written and changed from time to time, according to the faith and diligence which we gave unto it. And thus we see that by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>small</span> means the Lord can bring about great things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344043" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did go forth up into the top of the mountain, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>directions</span> which were given upon the ball.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344045" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that I did slay wild <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beasts</span>, insomuch that I did obtain food for our families.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344047" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that I did return to our tents, bearing the beasts which I had slain; and now when they beheld that I had obtained <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>food</span>, how great was their joy! And it came to pass that they did humble themselves before the Lord, and did give thanks unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344048" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that we did again take our journey, traveling nearly the same course as in the beginning; and after we had traveled for the space of many days we did pitch our tents again, that we might tarry for the space of a time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344050" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span> died, and was buried in the place which was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nahom</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344052" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that the daughters of Ishmael did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span> exceedingly, because of the loss of <span class="page-break" data-page="36"></span>their father, and because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span> in the wilderness; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>murmur</span> against my father, because he had brought them out of the land of Jerusalem, saying: Our father is dead; yea, and we have wandered much in the wilderness, and we have suffered much affliction, hunger, thirst, and fatigue; and after all these sufferings we must perish in the wilderness with hunger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344054" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And thus they did murmur against my father, and also against me; and they were desirous to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>return</span> again to Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344055" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And Laman said unto Lemuel and also unto the sons of Ishmael: Behold, let us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slay</span> our father, and also our brother Nephi, who has taken it upon him to be our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ruler</span> and our teacher, who are his elder brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344057" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Now, he says that the Lord has talked with him, and also that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> have ministered unto him. But behold, we know that he lies unto us; and he tells us these things, and he worketh many things by his cunning arts, that he may deceive our eyes, thinking, perhaps, that he may lead us away into some strange wilderness; and after he has led us away, he has thought to make himself a king and a ruler over us, that he may do with us according to his will and pleasure. And after this manner did my brother Laman <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stir up</span> their hearts to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>anger</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344059" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord was with us, yea, even the voice of the Lord came and did speak many words unto them, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chasten</span> them exceedingly; and after they were chastened by the voice of the Lord they did turn away their anger, and did repent of their sins, insomuch that the Lord did bless us again with food, that we did not perish.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 17	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128343793" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/17" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 17</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344123" id="title_number1">Chapter 17</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344125" id="study_summary1">Nephi is commanded to build a ship—His brethren oppose him—He exhorts them by recounting the history of God’s dealings with Israel—Nephi is filled with the power of God—His brethren are forbidden to touch him, lest they wither as a dried reed. About 592–591 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344126" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that we did again take our journey in the wilderness; and we did travel nearly eastward from that time forth. And we did travel and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wade</span> through much affliction in the wilderness; and our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>women</span> did bear children in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344128" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And so great were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessings</span> of the Lord upon us, that while we did live upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>raw</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>meat</span> in the wilderness, our women did give plenty of suck for their children, and were strong, yea, even like unto the men; and they began to bear their journeyings without murmurings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344130" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And thus we see that the commandments of God must be fulfilled. And if it so be that the children of men keep the commandments of God he doth nourish them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strengthen</span> them, and provide means whereby they can accomplish the thing which he has commanded them; wherefore, he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>provide</span> means for us while we did sojourn in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344132" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And we did sojourn for the space of many years, yea, even eight years in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344133" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And we did come to the land which we called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bountiful</span>, because <span class="page-break" data-page="37"></span>of its much fruit and also wild honey; and all these things were prepared of the Lord that we might not perish. And we beheld the sea, which we called Irreantum, which, being interpreted, is many waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344135" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that we did pitch our tents by the seashore; and notwithstanding we had suffered many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span> and much difficulty, yea, even so much that we cannot write them all, we were exceedingly rejoiced when we came to the seashore; and we called the place Bountiful, because of its much fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344137" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had been in the land of Bountiful for the space of many days, the voice of the Lord came unto me, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Arise</span>, and get thee into the mountain. And it came to pass that I arose and went up into the mountain, and cried unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344139" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord spake unto me, saying: Thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>construct</span> a ship, after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>manner</span> which I shall show thee, that I may carry thy people across these waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344141" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And I said: Lord, whither shall I go that I may find ore to molten, that I may make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tools</span> to construct the ship after the manner which thou hast shown unto me?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344142" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord told me whither I should go to find ore, that I might make tools.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344144" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did make a bellows wherewith to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blow</span> the fire, of the skins of beasts; and after I had made a bellows, that I might have wherewith to blow the fire, I did smite two stones together that I might make fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344146" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For the Lord had not hitherto suffered that we should make much fire, as we journeyed in the wilderness; for he said: I will make thy food become sweet, that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cook</span> it not;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344148" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And I will also be your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> in the wilderness; and I will prepare the way before you, if it so be that ye shall keep my commandments; wherefore, inasmuch as ye shall keep my commandments ye shall be led towards the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promised land</span>; and ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>know</span> that it is by me that ye are led.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344149" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, and the Lord said also that: After ye have arrived in the promised land, ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> that I, the Lord, am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>God</span>; and that I, the Lord, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliver</span> you from destruction; yea, that I did bring you out of the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344151" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Wherefore, I, Nephi, did strive to keep the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span> of the Lord, and I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>exhort</span> my brethren to faithfulness and diligence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344153" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>make</span> tools of the ore which I did molten out of the rock.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344154" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And when my brethren saw that I was about to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> a ship, they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murmur</span> against me, saying: Our brother is a fool, for he thinketh that he can build a ship; yea, and he also thinketh that he can cross these great waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344156" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And thus my brethren did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>complain</span> against me, and were desirous that they might not labor, for they did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> that I could build a ship; neither would they <span class="page-break" data-page="38"></span>believe that I was instructed of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344158" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now it came to pass that I, Nephi, was exceedingly sorrowful because of the hardness of their hearts; and now when they saw that I began to be sorrowful they were glad in their hearts, insomuch that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejoice</span> over me, saying: We knew that ye could not construct a ship, for we knew that ye were lacking in judgment; wherefore, thou canst not accomplish so great a work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344160" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And thou art like unto our father, led away by the foolish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>imaginations</span> of his heart; yea, he hath led us out of the land of Jerusalem, and we have wandered in the wilderness for these many years; and our women have toiled, being big with child; and they have borne children in the wilderness and suffered all things, save it were death; and it would have been better that they had died before they came out of Jerusalem than to have suffered these afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344161" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold, these many years we have suffered in the wilderness, which time we might have enjoyed our possessions and the land of our inheritance; yea, and we might have been happy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344163" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And we know that the people who were in the land of Jerusalem were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteous</span> people; for they kept the statutes and judgments of the Lord, and all his commandments, according to the law of Moses; wherefore, we know that they are a righteous people; and our father hath judged them, and hath led us away because we would hearken unto his words; yea, and our brother is like unto him. And after this manner of language did my brethren murmur and complain against us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344165" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, spake unto them, saying: Do ye believe that our fathers, who were the children of Israel, would have been led away out of the hands of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Egyptians</span> if they had not hearkened unto the words of the Lord?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344167" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Yea, do ye suppose that they would have been led out of bondage, if the Lord had not commanded Moses that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lead</span> them out of bondage?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344168" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now ye know that the children of Israel were in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>; and ye know that they were laden with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tasks</span>, which were grievous to be borne; wherefore, ye know that it must needs be a good thing for them, that they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>brought</span> out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344170" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now ye know that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moses</span> was commanded of the Lord to do that great work; and ye know that by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>word</span> the waters of the Red Sea were divided hither and thither, and they passed through on dry ground.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344172" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>But ye know that the Egyptians were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drowned</span> in the Red Sea, who were the armies of Pharaoh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344174" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And ye also know that they were fed with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manna</span> in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344175" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, and ye also know that Moses, by his word according to the power of God which was in him, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smote</span> the rock, and there came <span class="page-break" data-page="39"></span>forth water, that the children of Israel might quench their thirst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344177" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And notwithstanding they being led, the Lord their God, their Redeemer, going before them, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>leading</span> them by day and giving light unto them by night, and doing all things for them which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>expedient</span> for man to receive, they hardened their hearts and blinded their minds, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reviled</span> against Moses and against the true and living God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344179" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that according to his word he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> them; and according to his word he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lead</span> them; and according to his word he did do all things for them; and there was not any thing done save it were by his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344181" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And after they had crossed the river Jordan he did make them mighty unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>driving</span> out of the children of the land, yea, unto the scattering them to destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344182" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And now, do ye suppose that the children of this land, who were in the land of promise, who were driven out by our fathers, do ye suppose that they were righteous? Behold, I say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344184" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Do ye suppose that our fathers would have been more choice than they if they had been righteous? I say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344186" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Behold, the Lord esteemeth all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flesh</span> in one; he that is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteous</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>favored</span> of God. But behold, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>people</span> had rejected every word of God, and they were ripe in iniquity; and the fulness of the wrath of God was upon them; and the Lord did curse the land against them, and bless it unto our fathers; yea, he did curse it against them unto their destruction, and he did bless it unto our fathers unto their obtaining power over it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344188" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Behold, the Lord hath created the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>earth</span> that it should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>inhabited</span>; and he hath created his children that they should possess it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344189" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>raiseth</span> up a righteous nation, and destroyeth the nations of the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344191" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And he leadeth away the righteous into precious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lands</span>, and the wicked he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyeth</span>, and curseth the land unto them for their sakes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344193" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>He ruleth high in the heavens, for it is his throne, and this earth is his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>footstool</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344194" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And he loveth those who will have him to be their God. Behold, he loved our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fathers</span>, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenanted</span> with them, yea, even Abraham, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Isaac</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Jacob</span>; and he remembered the covenants which he had made; wherefore, he did bring them out of the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Egypt</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344196" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And he did straiten them in the wilderness with his rod; for they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hardened</span> their hearts, even as ye have; and the Lord straitened them because of their iniquity. He sent <span class="page-break" data-page="40"></span>fiery flying <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>serpents</span> among them; and after they were bitten he prepared a way that they might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>healed</span>; and the labor which they had to perform was to look; and because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>simpleness</span> of the way, or the easiness of it, there were many who perished.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344198" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And they did harden their hearts from time to time, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revile</span> against <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Moses</span>, and also against God; nevertheless, ye know that they were led forth by his matchless power into the land of promise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344200" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And now, after all these things, the time has come that they have become wicked, yea, nearly unto ripeness; and I know not but they are at this day about to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span>; for I know that the day must surely come that they must be destroyed, save a few only, who shall be led away into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344201" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>Wherefore, the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> my father that he should depart into the wilderness; and the Jews also sought to take away his life; yea, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ye</span> also have sought to take away his life; wherefore, ye are murderers in your hearts and ye are like unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344203" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>Ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swift</span> to do iniquity but slow to remember the Lord your God. Ye have seen an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angel</span>, and he spake unto you; yea, ye have heard his voice from time to time; and he hath spoken unto you in a still small voice, but ye were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>past</span> feeling, that ye could not feel his words; wherefore, he has spoken unto you like unto the voice of thunder, which did cause the earth to shake as if it were to divide asunder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344205" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And ye also know that by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of his almighty word he can cause the earth that it shall pass away; yea, and ye know that by his word he can cause the rough places to be made smooth, and smooth places shall be broken up. O, then, why is it, that ye can be so hard in your hearts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344207" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>Behold, my soul is rent with anguish because of you, and my heart is pained; I fear lest ye shall be cast off forever. Behold, I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>full</span> of the Spirit of God, insomuch that my frame has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no</span> strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344208" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>And now it came to pass that when I had spoken these words they were angry with me, and were desirous to throw me into the depths of the sea; and as they came forth to lay their hands upon me I spake unto them, saying: In the name of the Almighty God, I command you that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>touch</span> me not, for I am filled with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> of God, even unto the consuming of my flesh; and whoso shall lay his hands upon me shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wither</span> even as a dried reed; and he shall be as naught before the power of God, for God shall smite him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344210" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, said unto them that they should murmur no more against their father; neither should they withhold their labor from me, for God had commanded me that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> a ship.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344212" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>And I said unto them: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>If</span> God had commanded me to do all things I could do them. If he should command me that I should say unto this water, be thou earth, it should be earth; and if I should say it, it would be done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344214" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>And now, if the Lord has such great power, and has wrought so <span class="page-break" data-page="41"></span>many miracles among the children of men, how is it that he cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>instruct</span> me, that I should build a ship?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344215" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, said many things unto my brethren, insomuch that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>confounded</span> and could not contend against me; neither durst they lay their hands upon me nor touch me with their fingers, even for the space of many days. Now they durst not do this lest they should wither before me, so powerful was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span> of God; and thus it had wrought upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344217" id="p53"><span class="verse-number">53 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord said unto me: Stretch forth thine hand again unto thy brethren, and they shall not wither before thee, but I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shock</span> them, saith the Lord, and this will I do, that they may know that I am the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344219" id="p54"><span class="verse-number">54 </span>And it came to pass that I stretched forth my hand unto my brethren, and they did not wither before me; but the Lord did shake them, even according to the word which he had spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344221" id="p55"><span class="verse-number">55 </span>And now, they said: We know of a surety that the Lord is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note55a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>with thee</span>, for we know that it is the power of the Lord that has shaken us. And they fell down before me, and were about to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note55b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worship</span> me, but I would not suffer them, saying: I am thy brother, yea, even thy younger brother; wherefore, worship the Lord thy God, and honor thy father and thy mother, that thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note55c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>days</span> may be long in the land which the Lord thy God shall give thee.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 18	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344337" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/18" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 18</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344338" id="title_number1">Chapter 18</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344339" id="study_summary1">The ship is finished—The births of Jacob and Joseph are mentioned—The company embarks for the promised land—The sons of Ishmael and their wives join in revelry and rebellion—Nephi is bound, and the ship is driven back by a terrible tempest—Nephi is freed, and by his prayer the storm ceases—The people arrive in the promised land. About 591–589 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344340" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> the Lord, and did go forth with me; and we did work timbers of curious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>workmanship</span>.
