And the Lord did show me from time to time after what manner I should work the timbers of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ship</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344341" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now I, Nephi, did not work the timbers after the manner which was learned by men, neither did I build the ship after the manner of men; but I did build it after the manner which the Lord had shown unto me; wherefore, it was not after the manner of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344342" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I, Nephi, did go into the mount oft, and I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> oft unto the Lord; wherefore the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>showed</span> unto me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>great</span> things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344343" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that after I had finished the ship, according to the word of the Lord, my brethren beheld that it was good, and that the workmanship thereof was exceedingly fine; wherefore, they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> themselves again before the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344344" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord came unto my father, that we should arise and go down into the ship.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344345" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that on the morrow, after we had prepared all things, much fruits and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meat</span> from the wilderness, and honey in abundance, and provisions according to that which the Lord had commanded us, we did go down into the ship, with all our loading and our <span class="page-break" data-page="42"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seeds</span>, and whatsoever thing we had brought with us, every one according to his age; wherefore, we did all go down into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ship</span>, with our wives and our children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344346" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, my father had begat two sons in the wilderness; the elder was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jacob</span> and the younger <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Joseph</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344347" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass after we had all gone down into the ship, and had taken with us our provisions and things which had been commanded us, we did put forth into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sea</span> and were driven forth before the wind towards the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promised land</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344348" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And after we had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>driven</span> forth before the wind for the space of many days, behold, my brethren and the sons of Ishmael and also their wives began to make themselves merry, insomuch that they began to dance, and to sing, and to speak with much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rudeness</span>, yea, even that they did forget by what power they had been brought thither; yea, they were lifted up unto exceeding rudeness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344349" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And I, Nephi, began to fear exceedingly lest the Lord should be angry with us, and smite us because of our iniquity, that we should be swallowed up in the depths of the sea; wherefore, I, Nephi, began to speak to them with much soberness; but behold they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> with me, saying: We will not that our younger brother shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ruler</span> over us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344350" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that Laman and Lemuel did take me and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bind</span> me with cords, and they did treat me with much harshness; nevertheless, the Lord did suffer it that he might show forth his power, unto the fulfilling of his word which he had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spoken</span> concerning the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344351" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that after they had bound me insomuch that I could not move, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>compass</span>, which had been prepared of the Lord, did cease to work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344352" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, they knew not whither they should steer the ship, insomuch that there arose a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>storm</span>, yea, a great and terrible tempest, and we were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>driven</span> back upon the waters for the space of three days; and they began to be frightened exceedingly lest they should be drowned in the sea; nevertheless they did not loose me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344353" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And on the fourth day, which we had been driven back, the tempest began to be exceedingly sore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344354" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that we were about to be swallowed up in the depths of the sea. And after we had been driven back upon the waters for the space of four days, my brethren began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>see</span> that the judgments of God were upon them, and that they must perish save that they should repent of their iniquities; wherefore, they came unto me, and loosed the bands which were upon my wrists, and behold they had swollen exceedingly; and also mine ankles were much swollen, and great was the soreness thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344355" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Nevertheless, I did look unto my God, and I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>praise</span> him all the day long; and I did not murmur against the Lord because of mine afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344356" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now my father, Lehi, had said many things unto them, and also unto the sons of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span>; but, behold, they did breathe out much <span class="page-break" data-page="43"></span>threatenings against anyone that should speak for me; and my parents being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stricken</span> in years, and having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>suffered</span> much grief because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>children</span>, they were brought down, yea, even upon their sick-beds.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344357" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Because of their grief and much sorrow, and the iniquity of my brethren, they were brought near even to be carried out of this time to meet their God; yea, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grey hairs</span> were about to be brought down to lie low in the dust; yea, even they were near to be cast with sorrow into a watery grave.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344358" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And Jacob and Joseph also, being young, having need of much nourishment, were grieved because of the afflictions of their mother; and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my wife</span> with her tears and prayers, and also my children, did not soften the hearts of my brethren that they would loose me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344359" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And there was nothing save it were the power of God, which threatened them with destruction, could soften their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span>; wherefore, when they saw that they were about to be swallowed up in the depths of the sea they repented of the thing which they had done, insomuch that they loosed me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344360" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass after they had loosed me, behold, I took the compass, and it did work whither I desired it. And it came to pass that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayed</span> unto the Lord; and after I had prayed the winds did cease, and the storm did cease, and there was a great calm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344361" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did guide the ship, that we sailed again towards the promised land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344362" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that after we had sailed for the space of many days we did arrive at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promised land</span>; and we went forth upon the land, and did pitch our tents; and we did call it the promised land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344363" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that we did begin to till the earth, and we began to plant seeds; yea, we did put all our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seeds</span> into the earth, which we had brought from the land of Jerusalem. And it came to pass that they did grow exceedingly; wherefore, we were blessed in abundance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344364" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that we did find upon the land of promise, as we journeyed in the wilderness, that there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beasts</span> in the forests of every kind, both the cow and the ox, and the ass and the horse, and the goat and the wild goat, and all manner of wild animals, which were for the use of men. And we did find all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ore</span>, both of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gold</span>, and of silver, and of copper.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 19	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344403" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/19" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 19</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344404" id="title_number1">Chapter 19</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344405" id="study_summary1">Nephi makes plates of ore and records the history of his people—The God of Israel will come six hundred years from the time Lehi left Jerusalem—Nephi tells of His sufferings and crucifixion—The Jews will be despised and scattered until the latter days, when they will return unto the Lord. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344406" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord commanded me, wherefore I did make plates of ore that I might engraven upon them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of my people. And upon the plates which I made I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>engraven</span> the record of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>father</span>, and also our journeyings in the wilderness, and the prophecies of my father; and also many of mine own prophecies have I engraven upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344407" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I knew not at the time when I made them that I should be <span class="page-break" data-page="44"></span>commanded of the Lord to make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span>; wherefore, the record of my father, and the genealogy of his fathers, and the more part of all our proceedings in the wilderness are engraven upon those first plates of which I have spoken; wherefore, the things which transpired before I made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>these plates</span> are, of a truth, more particularly made mention upon the first plates.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344408" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And after I had made these plates by way of commandment, I, Nephi, received a commandment that the ministry and the prophecies, the more plain and precious parts of them, should be written upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span>; and that the things which were written should be kept for the instruction of my people, who should possess the land, and also for other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wise</span> purposes, which purposes are known unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344409" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, I, Nephi, did make a record upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other plates</span>, which gives an account, or which gives a greater account of the wars and contentions and destructions of my people. And this have I done, and commanded my people what they should do after I was gone; and that these plates should be handed down from one generation to another, or from one prophet to another, until further commandments of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344410" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And an account of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>making</span> these plates shall be given hereafter; and then, behold, I proceed according to that which I have spoken; and this I do that the more sacred things may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kept</span> for the knowledge of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344411" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Nevertheless, I do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> anything upon plates save it be that I think it be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sacred</span>. And now, if I do err, even did they err of old; not that I would excuse myself because of other men, but because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>weakness</span> which is in me, according to the flesh, I would excuse myself.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344412" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For the things which some men esteem to be of great worth, both to the body and soul, others set at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>naught</span> and trample under their feet. Yea, even the very God of Israel do men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trample</span> under their feet; I say, trample under their feet but I would speak in other words—they set him at naught, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearken not</span> to the voice of his counsels.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344413" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cometh</span>, according to the words of the angel, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>six hundred</span> years from the time my father left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344414" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the world, because of their iniquity, shall judge him to be a thing of naught; wherefore they scourge him, and he suffereth it; and they smite him, and he suffereth it. Yea, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spit</span> upon him, and he suffereth it, because of his loving <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kindness</span> and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>long-suffering</span> towards the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344415" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span> of our fathers, who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>led</span> out of Egypt, out of bondage, and also were preserved in the wilderness by him, yea, the <span class="page-break" data-page="45"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>God</span> of Abraham, and of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>yieldeth</span> himself, according to the words of the angel, as a man, into the hands of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>wicked</span> men, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>lifted up</span>, according to the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>Zenock</span>, and to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>crucified</span>, according to the words of Neum, and to be buried in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>sepulchre</span>, according to the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10j"><sup class="marker">j</sup>Zenos</span>, which he spake concerning the three days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10k"><sup class="marker">k</sup>darkness</span>, which should be a sign given of his death unto those who should inhabit the isles of the sea, more especially given unto those who are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10l"><sup class="marker">l</sup>house of Israel</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344416" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For thus spake the prophet: The Lord God surely shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visit</span> all the house of Israel at that day, some with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>voice</span>, because of their righteousness, unto their great joy and salvation, and others with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thunderings</span> and the lightnings of his power, by tempest, by fire, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>smoke</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>vapor</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>darkness</span>, and by the opening of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>earth</span>, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>mountains</span> which shall be carried up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344417" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> these things must surely come, saith the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zenos</span>. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rocks</span> of the earth must rend; and because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>groanings</span> of the earth, many of the kings of the isles of the sea shall be wrought upon by the Spirit of God, to exclaim: The God of nature suffers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344418" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And as for those who are at Jerusalem, saith the prophet, they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scourged</span> by all people, because they crucify the God of Israel, and turn their hearts aside, rejecting signs and wonders, and the power and glory of the God of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344419" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And because they turn their hearts aside, saith the prophet, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>despised</span> the Holy One of Israel, they shall wander in the flesh, and perish, and become a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hiss</span> and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>byword</span>, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hated</span> among all nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344420" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Nevertheless, when that day cometh, saith the prophet, that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no more</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>turn</span> aside their hearts against the Holy One of Israel, then will he remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenants</span> which he made to their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344421" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, then will he remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>isles</span> of the sea; yea, and all the people who are of the house of Israel, will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gather</span> in, saith the Lord, according to the words of the prophet Zenos, from the four quarters of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344422" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Yea, and all the earth shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>see</span> the salvation of the Lord, saith the <span class="page-break" data-page="46"></span>prophet; every nation, kindred, tongue and people shall be blessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344423" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I, Nephi, have written these things unto my people, that perhaps I might persuade them that they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> the Lord their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344424" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore, I speak unto all the house of Israel, if it so be that they should obtain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these things</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344425" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>For behold, I have workings in the spirit, which doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weary</span> me even that all my joints are weak, for those who are at Jerusalem; for had not the Lord been merciful, to show unto me concerning them, even as he had prophets of old, I should have perished also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344426" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he surely did show unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span> of old all things <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>concerning</span> them; and also he did show unto many concerning us; wherefore, it must needs be that we know concerning them for they are written upon the plates of brass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344427" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now it came to pass that I, Nephi, did teach my brethren these things; and it came to pass that I did read many things to them, which were engraven upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, that they might know concerning the doings of the Lord in other lands, among people of old.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344428" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And I did read many things unto them which were written in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>books</span> of Moses; but that I might more fully persuade them to believe in the Lord their Redeemer I did read unto them that which was written by the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Isaiah</span>; for I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liken</span> all scriptures unto us, that it might be for our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>profit</span> and learning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344429" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Wherefore I spake unto them, saying: Hear ye the words of the prophet, ye who are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the house of Israel, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>branch</span> who have been broken off; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hear</span> ye the words of the prophet, which were written unto all the house of Israel, and liken them unto yourselves, that ye may have hope as well as your brethren from whom ye have been broken off; for after this manner has the prophet written.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 20	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344882" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/20" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 20</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344499" id="title_number1">Chapter 20</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344500" id="study_summary1">The Lord reveals His purposes to Israel—Israel has been chosen in the furnace of affliction and is to go forth from Babylon—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/48">Isaiah 48</a>. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344501" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Hearken</span> and hear this, O house of Jacob, who are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, or out of the waters of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptism</span>, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>swear</span> by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, yet they swear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>not</span> in truth nor in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344502" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Nevertheless, they call themselves of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy city</span>, but they do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> stay themselves upon the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; yea, the Lord of Hosts is his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344503" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, I have declared the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>former</span> things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth, and I showed them. I did show them suddenly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344504" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I did it because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>neck</span> is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344505" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I have even from the beginning declared to thee; before it came <span class="page-break" data-page="47"></span>to pass I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>showed</span> them thee; and I showed them for fear lest thou shouldst say—Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image hath commanded them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344506" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Thou hast seen and heard all this; and will ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not declare</span> them? And that I have showed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344507" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>They are created now, and not from the beginning, even before the day when thou heardest them not they were declared unto thee, lest thou shouldst say—Behold I knew them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344508" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, and thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that time thine ear was not opened; for I knew that thou wouldst deal very treacherously, and wast called a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>transgressor</span> from the womb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344509" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Nevertheless, for my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name’s</span> sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain from thee, that I cut thee not off.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344510" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For, behold, I have refined thee, I have chosen thee in the furnace of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>affliction</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344511" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For mine own sake, yea, for mine own sake will I do this, for I will not suffer my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> to be polluted, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not give</span> my glory unto another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344512" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Hearken unto me, O Jacob, and Israel my called, for I am he; I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span>, and I am also the last.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344513" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Mine hand hath also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laid</span> the foundation of the earth, and my right hand hath spanned the heavens. I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> unto them and they stand up together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344514" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; who among them hath declared these things unto them? The Lord hath loved him; yea, and he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfil</span> his word which he hath declared by them; and he will do his pleasure on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Babylon</span>, and his arm shall come upon the Chaldeans.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344515" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Also, saith the Lord; I the Lord, yea, I have spoken; yea, I have called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>him</span> to declare, I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344516" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Come ye near unto me; I have not spoken in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span>; from the beginning, from the time that it was declared have I spoken; and the Lord God, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span>, hath sent me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344517" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And thus saith the Lord, thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Redeemer</span>, the Holy One of Israel; I have sent him, the Lord thy God who teacheth thee to profit, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>leadeth</span> thee by the way thou shouldst go, hath done it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344518" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>O that thou hadst hearkened to my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span>—then had thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>peace</span> been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344519" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> also had been as the sand; the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344520" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Go</span> ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Chaldeans</span>, with a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, utter to the end of the earth; say ye: The <span class="page-break" data-page="48"></span>Lord hath redeemed his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>servant</span> Jacob.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344521" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thirsted</span> not; he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rock</span> for them; he clave the rock also and the waters gushed out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344522" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And notwithstanding he hath done all this, and greater also, there is no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peace</span>, saith the Lord, unto the wicked.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 21	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344883" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/21" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 21</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344884" id="title_number1">Chapter 21</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344885" id="study_summary1">The Messiah will be a light to the Gentiles and will free the prisoners—Israel will be gathered with power in the last days—Kings will be their nursing fathers—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/49">Isaiah 49</a>. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344886" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> again: Hearken, O ye house of Israel, all ye that are broken off and are driven out because of the wickedness of the pastors of my people; yea, all ye that are broken off, that are scattered abroad, who are of my people, O house of Israel. Listen, O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>isles</span>, unto me, and hearken ye people from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>far</span>; the Lord hath called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother hath he made mention of my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344887" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft; in his quiver hath he hid me;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344888" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And said unto me: Thou art my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span>, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344889" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Then I said, I have labored in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vain</span>, I have spent my strength for naught and in vain; surely my judgment is with the Lord, and my work with my God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344890" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, saith the Lord—that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>formed</span> me from the womb that I should be his servant, to bring Jacob again to him—though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the Lord, and my God shall be my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344891" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he said: It is a light thing that thou shouldst be my servant to raise up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tribes</span> of Jacob, and to restore the preserved of Israel. I will also give thee for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Gentiles</span>, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the ends of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344892" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Thus saith the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nations abhorreth, to servant of rulers: Kings shall see and arise, princes also shall worship, because of the Lord that is faithful.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344893" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Thus saith the Lord: In an acceptable time have I heard thee, O isles of the sea, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee; and I will preserve thee, and give thee <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my servant</span> for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344894" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>That thou mayest say to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prisoners</span>: Go forth; to them that sit in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>darkness</span>: Show yourselves. They shall feed in the ways, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pastures</span> shall be in all high places.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344895" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>They shall not hunger nor thirst, neither shall the heat nor the sun smite them; for he that hath mercy on them shall lead them, even by the springs of water shall he guide them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344896" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And I will make all my mountains a way, and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>highways</span> shall be exalted.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="49"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344897" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And then, O house of Israel, behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these</span> shall come from far; and lo, these from the north and from the west; and these from the land of Sinim.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344898" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Sing</span>, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; for the feet of those who are in the east shall be established; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>break forth</span> into singing, O mountains; for they shall be smitten no more; for the Lord hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>afflicted</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344899" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But, behold, Zion hath said: The Lord hath forsaken me, and my Lord hath forgotten me—but he will show that he hath not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344900" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For can a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>woman</span> forget her sucking child, that she should not have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>compassion</span> on the son of her womb? Yea, they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>forget</span>, yet will I not forget thee, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344901" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, I have graven thee upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>palms</span> of my hands; thy walls are continually before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344902" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Thy children shall make haste against thy destroyers; and they that made thee <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waste</span> shall go forth of thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344903" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Lift up thine eyes round about and behold; all these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gather</span> themselves together, and they shall come to thee. And as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on even as a bride.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344904" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For thy waste and thy desolate places, and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants; and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344905" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>The children whom thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the first, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span> in thine ears say: The place is too strait for me; give place to me that I may dwell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344906" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Then shalt thou say in thine heart: Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children, and am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desolate</span>, a captive, and removing to and fro? And who hath brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where have they been?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344907" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Thus saith the Lord God: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, and set up my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>standard</span> to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>arms</span>, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344908" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kings</span> shall be thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nursing fathers</span>, and their queens thy nursing mothers; they shall bow down to thee with their face towards the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord; for they shall not be ashamed that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wait</span> for me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344909" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lawful captives</span> delivered?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344910" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But thus saith the Lord, even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344911" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>feed</span> them that <span class="page-break" data-page="50"></span>oppress thee with their own flesh; they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> that I, the Lord, am thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Savior</span> and thy Redeemer, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Mighty One</span> of Jacob.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
1 Nephi 22	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128344557" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/1-ne/22" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>1 Nephi 22</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128344559" id="title_number1">Chapter 22</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128344560" id="study_summary1">Israel will be scattered upon all the face of the earth—The Gentiles will nurse and nourish Israel with the gospel in the last days—Israel will be gathered and saved, and the wicked will burn as stubble—The kingdom of the devil will be destroyed, and Satan will be bound. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344561" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had read these things which were engraven upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, my brethren came unto me and said unto me: What <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>meaneth</span> these things which ye have read? Behold, are they to be understood according to things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>spiritual</span>, which shall come to pass according to the spirit and not the flesh?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344562" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I, Nephi, said unto them: Behold they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manifest</span> unto the prophet by the voice of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span>; for by the Spirit are all things made known unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophets</span>, which shall come upon the children of men according to the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344563" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, the things of which I have read are things pertaining to things both <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temporal</span> and spiritual; for it appears that the house of Israel, sooner or later, will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> upon all the face of the earth, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>among</span> all nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344564" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And behold, there are many who are already lost from the knowledge of those who are at Jerusalem. Yea, the more part of all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tribes</span> have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>led away</span>; and they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scattered</span> to and fro upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>isles</span> of the sea; and whither they are none of us knoweth, save that we know that they have been led away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344565" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And since they have been led away, these things have been prophesied concerning them, and also concerning all those who shall hereafter be scattered and be confounded, because of the Holy One of Israel; for against him will they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harden</span> their hearts; wherefore, they shall be scattered among all nations and shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hated</span> of all men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344566" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Nevertheless, after they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nursed</span> by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, and the Lord has lifted up his hand upon the Gentiles and set them up for a standard, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>children</span> have been carried in their arms, and their daughters have been carried upon their shoulders, behold these things of which are spoken are temporal; for thus are the covenants of the Lord with our fathers; and it meaneth us in the days to come, and also all our brethren who are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344567" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it meaneth that the time cometh that after all the house of Israel have been scattered and confounded, that the Lord God will raise up a mighty nation among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, yea, even upon the face of this land; and by them shall our seed be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344568" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And after our seed is scattered the <span class="page-break" data-page="51"></span>Lord God will proceed to do a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>marvelous work</span> among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, which shall be of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>worth</span> unto our seed; wherefore, it is likened unto their being nourished by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Gentiles</span> and being carried in their arms and upon their shoulders.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344569" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it shall also be of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worth</span> unto the Gentiles; and not only unto the Gentiles but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unto</span> all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>house of Israel</span>, unto the making known of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>covenants</span> of the Father of heaven unto Abraham, saying: In thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>seed</span> shall all the kindreds of the earth be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>blessed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344570" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And I would, my brethren, that ye should know that all the kindreds of the earth cannot be blessed unless he shall make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bare</span> his arm in the eyes of the nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344571" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, the Lord God will proceed to make bare his arm in the eyes of all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nations</span>, in bringing about his covenants and his gospel unto those who are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344572" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bring</span> them again out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>captivity</span>, and they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gathered</span> together to the lands of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>inheritance</span>; and they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>brought</span> out of obscurity and out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>darkness</span>; and they shall know that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>Lord</span> is their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>Savior</span> and their Redeemer, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>Mighty One</span> of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344573" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the blood of that great and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominable</span> church, which is the whore of all the earth, shall turn upon their own heads; for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>war</span> among themselves, and the sword of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>own</span> hands shall fall upon their own heads, and they shall be drunken with their own blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344574" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nation</span> which shall war against thee, O house of Israel, shall be turned one against another, and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fall</span> into the pit which they digged to ensnare the people of the Lord. And all that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fight</span> against Zion shall be destroyed, and that great whore, who hath perverted the right ways of the Lord, yea, that great and abominable church, shall tumble to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>dust</span> and great shall be the fall of it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344575" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For behold, saith the prophet, the time cometh speedily that Satan shall have no more power over the hearts of the children of men; for the day soon cometh that all the proud and they who do wickedly shall be as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stubble</span>; and the day cometh that they must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burned</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344576" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For the time soon cometh that the fulness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrath</span> of God shall be poured out upon all the children <span class="page-break" data-page="52"></span>of men; for he will not suffer that the wicked shall destroy the righteous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344577" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Wherefore, he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preserve</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteous</span> by his power, even if it so be that the fulness of his wrath must come, and the righteous be preserved, even unto the destruction of their enemies by fire. Wherefore, the righteous need not fear; for thus saith the prophet, they shall be saved, even if it so be as by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344578" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, my brethren, I say unto you, that these things must shortly come; yea, even blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke must come; and it must needs be upon the face of this earth; and it cometh unto men according to the flesh if it so be that they will harden their hearts against the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344579" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For behold, the righteous shall not perish; for the time surely must come that all they who fight against Zion shall be cut off.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344580" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the Lord will surely <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prepare</span> a way for his people, unto the fulfilling of the words of Moses, which he spake, saying: A <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophet</span> shall the Lord your God raise up unto you, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you. And it shall come to pass that all those who will not hear that prophet shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cut off</span> from among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344581" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now I, Nephi, declare unto you, that this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophet</span> of whom Moses spake was the Holy One of Israel; wherefore, he shall execute <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment</span> in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344584" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And the righteous need not fear, for they are those who shall not be confounded. But it is the kingdom of the devil, which shall be built up among the children of men, which kingdom is established among them which are in the flesh—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344586" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For the time speedily shall come that all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>churches</span> which are built up to get gain, and all those who are built up to get power over the flesh, and those who are built up to become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>popular</span> in the eyes of the world, and those who seek the lusts of the flesh and the things of the world, and to do all manner of iniquity; yea, in fine, all those who belong to the kingdom of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span> are they who need fear, and tremble, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>quake</span>; they are those who must be brought low in the dust; they are those who must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>consumed</span> as stubble; and this is according to the words of the prophet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344588" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And the time cometh speedily that the righteous must be led up as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>calves</span> of the stall, and the Holy One of Israel must reign in dominion, and might, and power, and great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344590" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathereth</span> his children from the four quarters of the earth; and he numbereth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sheep</span>, and they know him; and there shall be one fold and one shepherd; and he shall feed his sheep, and in him they shall find <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pasture</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344592" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> of his people, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Satan</span> has no power; wherefore, he cannot be loosed for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>many years</span>; for he hath no power over the hearts <span class="page-break" data-page="53"></span>of the people, for they dwell in righteousness, and the Holy One of Israel <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>reigneth</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344594" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now behold, I, Nephi, say unto you that all these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>things</span> must come according to the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344596" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>But, behold, all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people shall dwell safely in the Holy One of Israel if it so be that they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344598" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now I, Nephi, make an end; for I durst not speak further as yet concerning these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344600" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Wherefore, my brethren, I would that ye should consider that the things which have been written upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span> are true; and they testify that a man must be obedient to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128344602" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Wherefore, ye need not suppose that I and my father are the only ones that have testified, and also taught them. Wherefore, if ye shall be obedient to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span>, and endure to the end, ye shall be saved at the last day. And thus it is. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345040" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128345041" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Second Book of Nephi</span></h1>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128345042" id="intro1">An account of the death of Lehi. Nephi’s brethren rebel against him. The Lord warns Nephi to depart into the wilderness. His journeyings in the wilderness, and so forth.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345043" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345044" id="study_summary1">Lehi prophesies of a land of liberty—His seed will be scattered and smitten if they reject the Holy One of Israel—He exhorts his sons to put on the armor of righteousness. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345045" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had made an end of teaching my brethren, our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span>, Lehi, also spake many things unto them, and rehearsed unto them, how great things the Lord had done for them in bringing them out of the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345046" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he spake unto them concerning their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebellions</span> upon the waters, and the mercies of God in sparing their lives, that they were not swallowed up in the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345047" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he also spake unto them concerning the land of promise, which they had obtained—how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> the Lord had been in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>warning</span> us that we should flee out of the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345048" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For, behold, said he, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seen</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vision</span>, in which I know that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jerusalem</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>destroyed</span>; and had we remained in Jerusalem we should also have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>perished</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345049" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But, said he, notwithstanding our afflictions, we have obtained a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of promise</span>, a land which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>choice</span> above all other lands; a land which the Lord God hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenanted</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="54"></span>with me should be a land for the inheritance of my seed. Yea, the Lord hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>covenanted</span> this land unto me, and to my children forever, and also all those who should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>led</span> out of other countries by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345050" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, I, Lehi, prophesy according to the workings of the Spirit which is in me, that there shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> come into this land save they shall be brought by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345051" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Wherefore, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> is consecrated unto him whom he shall bring. And if it so be that they shall serve him according to the commandments which he hath given, it shall be a land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span> unto them; wherefore, they shall never be brought down into captivity; if so, it shall be because of iniquity; for if iniquity shall abound <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cursed</span> shall be the land for their sakes, but unto the righteous it shall be blessed forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345052" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, it is wisdom that this land should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kept</span> as yet from the knowledge of other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nations</span>; for behold, many nations would overrun the land, that there would be no place for an inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345053" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, I, Lehi, have obtained a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promise</span>, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>inasmuch</span> as those whom the Lord God shall bring out of the land of Jerusalem shall keep his commandments, they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prosper</span> upon the face of this land; and they shall be kept from all other nations, that they may possess this land unto themselves. And if it so be that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>keep</span> his commandments they shall be blessed upon the face of this land, and there shall be none to molest them, nor to take away the land of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>inheritance</span>; and they shall dwell safely forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345054" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But behold, when the time cometh that they shall dwindle in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span>, after they have received so great blessings from the hand of the Lord—having a knowledge of the creation of the earth, and all men, knowing the great and marvelous works of the Lord from the creation of the world; having power given them to do all things by faith; having all the commandments from the beginning, and having been brought by his infinite goodness into this precious land of promise—behold, I say, if the day shall come that they will reject the Holy One of Israel, the true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Messiah</span>, their Redeemer and their God, behold, the judgments of him that is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>just</span> shall rest upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345055" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, he will bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other nations</span> unto them, and he will give unto them power, and he will take away from them the lands of their possessions, and he will cause them to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> and smitten.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345056" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, as one generation passeth to another there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bloodsheds</span>, and great visitations among them; wherefore, my sons, I would that ye would remember; yea, I would that ye would hearken unto my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345057" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O that ye would awake; awake from a deep <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sleep</span>, yea, even from the sleep of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span>, and shake off the awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chains</span> by which ye are bound, which are the chains which bind the children of men, that they are carried away captive down to the eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gulf</span> of misery and woe.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="55"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345058" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Awake! and arise from the dust, and hear the words of a trembling <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>parent</span>, whose limbs ye must soon lay down in the cold and silent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grave</span>, from whence no traveler can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>return</span>; a few more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>days</span> and I go the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>way</span> of all the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345059" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But behold, the Lord hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeemed</span> my soul from hell; I have beheld his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>, and I am encircled about eternally in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>arms</span> of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>love</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345060" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I desire that ye should remember to observe the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>statutes</span> and the judgments of the Lord; behold, this hath been the anxiety of my soul from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345061" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>My heart hath been weighed down with sorrow from time to time, for I have feared, lest for the hardness of your hearts the Lord your God should come out in the fulness of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrath</span> upon you, that ye be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cut off</span> and destroyed forever;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345062" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Or, that a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursing</span> should come upon you for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>many generations</span>;
