and ye are visited by sword, and by famine, and are hated, and are led according to the will and captivity of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345063" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>O my sons, that these things might not come upon you, but that ye might be a choice and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>favored</span> people of the Lord. But behold, his will be done; for his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ways</span> are righteousness forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345064" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he hath said that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Inasmuch</span> as ye shall keep my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commandments</span> ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prosper</span> in the land; but inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from my presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345065" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now that my soul might have joy in you, and that my heart might leave this world with gladness because of you, that I might not be brought down with grief and sorrow to the grave, arise from the dust, my sons, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>men</span>, and be determined in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span> mind and in one heart, united in all things, that ye may not come down into captivity;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345066" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>That ye may not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> with a sore cursing; and also, that ye may not incur the displeasure of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>just</span> God upon you, unto the destruction, yea, the eternal destruction of both soul and body.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345067" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Awake, my sons; put on the armor of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span>. Shake off the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chains</span> with which ye are bound, and come forth out of obscurity, and arise from the dust.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345068" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Rebel no more against your brother, whose views have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glorious</span>, and who hath kept the commandments from the time that we left Jerusalem; and who hath been an instrument in the hands of God, in bringing us forth into the land of promise; for were it not for him, we must have perished with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hunger</span> in the wilderness; nevertheless, ye sought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take away</span> his <span class="page-break" data-page="56"></span>life; yea, and he hath suffered much sorrow because of you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345069" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And I exceedingly fear and tremble because of you, lest he shall suffer again; for behold, ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>accused</span> him that he sought power and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>authority</span> over you; but I know that he hath not sought for power nor authority over you, but he hath sought the glory of God, and your own eternal welfare.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345070" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And ye have murmured because he hath been plain unto you. Ye say that he hath used <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sharpness</span>; ye say that he hath been angry with you; but behold, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sharpness</span> was the sharpness of the power of the word of God, which was in him; and that which ye call anger was the truth, according to that which is in God, which he could not restrain, manifesting boldly concerning your iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345071" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it must needs be that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of God must be with him, even unto his commanding you that ye must obey. But behold, it was not he, but it was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord which was in him, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>opened</span> his mouth to utterance that he could not shut it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345072" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now my son, Laman, and also Lemuel and Sam, and also my sons who are the sons of Ishmael, behold, if ye will hearken unto the voice of Nephi ye shall not perish. And if ye will hearken unto him I leave unto you a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessing</span>, yea, even my first blessing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345073" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>But if ye will not hearken unto him I take away my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> blessing, yea, even my blessing, and it shall rest upon him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345074" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now, Zoram, I speak unto you: Behold, thou art the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span> of Laban; nevertheless, thou hast been brought out of the land of Jerusalem, and I know that thou art a true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>friend</span> unto my son, Nephi, forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345075" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Wherefore, because thou hast been faithful thy seed shall be blessed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>with</span> his seed, that they dwell in prosperity long upon the face of this land; and nothing, save it shall be iniquity among them, shall harm or disturb their prosperity upon the face of this land forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345076" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Wherefore, if ye shall keep the commandments of the Lord, the Lord hath consecrated this land for the security of thy seed with the seed of my son.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346391" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346392" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346393" id="study_summary1">Redemption comes through the Holy Messiah—Freedom of choice (agency) is essential to existence and progression—Adam fell that men might be—Men are free to choose liberty and eternal life. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346394" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, Jacob, I speak unto you: Thou art my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>firstborn</span> in the days of my tribulation in the wilderness. And behold, in thy childhood thou hast suffered afflictions and much sorrow, because of the rudeness of thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346395" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Nevertheless, Jacob, my firstborn in the wilderness, thou knowest the greatness of God; and he shall consecrate thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span> for thy gain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346396" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, thy soul shall be blessed, and thou shalt dwell safely with thy brother, Nephi; and thy days shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spent</span> in the service of thy God. Wherefore, I know that thou art redeemed, because of the righteousness of thy Redeemer; for thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>beheld</span> that in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fulness</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="57"></span>of time he cometh to bring salvation unto men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346397" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beheld</span> in thy youth his glory; wherefore, thou art blessed even as they unto whom he shall minister in the flesh; for the Spirit is the same, yesterday, today, and forever. And the way is prepared from the fall of man, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>salvation</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>free</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346398" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And men are instructed sufficiently that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> good from evil. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> is given unto men. And by the law no flesh is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>justified</span>; or, by the law men are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cut off</span>. Yea, by the temporal law they were cut off; and also, by the spiritual law they perish from that which is good, and become miserable forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346399" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redemption</span> cometh in and through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Messiah</span>; for he is full of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>grace</span> and truth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346400" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold, he offereth himself a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifice</span> for sin, to answer the ends of the law, unto all those who have a broken heart and a contrite spirit; and unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>none</span> else can the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ends</span> of the law be answered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346401" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, how great the importance to make these things known unto the inhabitants of the earth, that they may know that there is no flesh that can dwell in the presence of God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>save</span> it be through the merits, and mercy, and grace of the Holy Messiah, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>layeth</span> down his life according to the flesh, and taketh it again by the power of the Spirit, that he may bring to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead, being the first that should rise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346402" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, he is the firstfruits unto God, inasmuch as he shall make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>intercession</span> for all the children of men; and they that believe in him shall be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346403" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And because of the intercession for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span>, all men come unto God; wherefore, they stand in the presence of him, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> of him according to the truth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>holiness</span> which is in him. Wherefore, the ends of the law which the Holy One hath given, unto the inflicting of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>punishment</span> which is affixed, which punishment that is affixed is in opposition to that of the happiness which is affixed, to answer the ends of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>atonement</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346404" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For it must needs be, that there is an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>opposition</span> in all things. If not so, my firstborn in the wilderness, righteousness could not be brought to pass, neither wickedness, neither holiness nor misery, neither good nor bad. Wherefore, all things must needs be a compound in one; <span class="page-break" data-page="58"></span>wherefore, if it should be one body it must needs remain as dead, having no life neither death, nor corruption nor incorruption, happiness nor misery, neither sense nor insensibility.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346405" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, it must needs have been created for a thing of naught; wherefore there would have been no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purpose</span> in the end of its creation. Wherefore, this thing must needs destroy the wisdom of God and his eternal purposes, and also the power, and the mercy, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346406" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And if ye shall say there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no law</span>, ye shall also say there is no sin. If ye shall say there is no sin, ye shall also say there is no righteousness. And if there be no righteousness there be no happiness. And if there be no righteousness nor happiness there be no punishment nor misery. And if these things are not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>there</span> is no God. And if there is no God we are not, neither the earth; for there could have been no creation of things, neither to act nor to be acted upon; wherefore, all things must have vanished away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346407" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, my sons, I speak unto you these things for your profit and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>learning</span>; for there is a God, and he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>created</span> all things, both the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are, both things to act and things to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>acted</span> upon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346408" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And to bring about his eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purposes</span> in the end of man, after he had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>created</span> our first parents, and the beasts of the field and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fowls</span> of the air, and in fine, all things which are created, it must needs be that there was an opposition; even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>forbidden</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fruit</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>opposition</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>tree of life</span>; the one being sweet and the other bitter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346409" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wherefore, the Lord God gave unto man that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>act</span> for himself. Wherefore, man could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>act</span> for himself save it should be that he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>enticed</span> by the one or the other.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346410" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And I, Lehi, according to the things which I have read, must needs suppose that an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of God, according to that which is written, had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span> from heaven; wherefore, he became a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span>, having sought that which was evil before God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346411" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And because he had fallen from heaven, and had become miserable forever, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sought</span> also the misery of all mankind. Wherefore, he said unto Eve, yea, even that old serpent, who is the devil, who is the father of all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lies</span>, wherefore he said: Partake of the forbidden fruit, and ye shall not die, but ye shall be as God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowing</span> good and evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346412" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And after Adam and Eve had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>partaken</span> of the forbidden fruit they were driven out of the garden of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Eden</span>, to till the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346413" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they have brought forth <span class="page-break" data-page="59"></span>children; yea, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>family</span> of all the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346414" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the days of the children of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>men</span> were prolonged, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>will</span> of God, that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repent</span> while in the flesh; wherefore, their state became a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>probation</span>, and their time was lengthened, according to the commandments which the Lord God gave unto the children of men. For he gave commandment that all men must repent; for he showed unto all men that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>lost</span>, because of the transgression of their parents.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346415" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now, behold, if Adam had not transgressed he would not have fallen, but he would have remained in the garden of Eden. And all things which were created must have remained in the same state in which they were after they were created; and they must have remained forever, and had no end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346416" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they would have had no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span>; wherefore they would have remained in a state of innocence, having no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>joy</span>, for they knew no misery; doing no good, for they knew no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sin</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346417" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>But behold, all things have been done in the wisdom of him who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346418" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Adam</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fell</span> that men might be; and men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>are</span>, that they might have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>joy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346419" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Messiah</span> cometh in the fulness of time, that he may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redeem</span> the children of men from the fall. And because that they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redeemed</span> from the fall they have become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>free</span> forever, knowing good from evil; to act for themselves and not to be acted upon, save it be by the punishment of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>law</span> at the great and last day, according to the commandments which God hath given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346420" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Wherefore, men are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>free</span> according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flesh</span>; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>all</span> things are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>given</span> them which are expedient unto man. And they are free to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>choose</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>liberty</span> and eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>life</span>, through the great Mediator of all men, or to choose captivity and death, according to the captivity and power of the devil; for he seeketh that all men might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>miserable</span> like unto himself.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346421" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now, my sons, I would that ye should look to the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mediator</span>, and hearken unto his great commandments; and be faithful unto his words, and choose eternal life, according to the will of his Holy Spirit;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346422" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And not choose eternal death, according to the will of the flesh and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span> which is therein, which giveth the spirit of the devil power to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>captivate</span>, to bring you down to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hell</span>, that he may reign over you in his own kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346423" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>I have spoken these few words unto you all, my sons, in the last days of my probation; and I have <span class="page-break" data-page="60"></span>chosen the good part, according to the words of the prophet. And I have none other object save it be the everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>welfare</span> of your souls. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347004" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347023" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347025" id="study_summary1">Joseph in Egypt saw the Nephites in vision—He prophesied of Joseph Smith, the latter-day seer; of Moses, who would deliver Israel; and of the coming forth of the Book of Mormon. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347027" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I speak unto you, Joseph, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>last-born</span>. Thou wast born in the wilderness of mine afflictions; yea, in the days of my greatest sorrow did thy mother bear thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347030" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And may the Lord consecrate also unto thee this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span>, which is a most precious land, for thine inheritance and the inheritance of thy seed with thy brethren, for thy security forever, if it so be that ye shall keep the commandments of the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347032" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, Joseph, my last-born, whom I have brought out of the wilderness of mine afflictions, may the Lord bless thee forever, for thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> shall not utterly be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347035" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, thou art the fruit of my loins; and I am a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Joseph</span> who was carried <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>captive</span> into Egypt. And great were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenants</span> of the Lord which he made unto Joseph.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347038" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore, Joseph truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saw</span> our day. And he obtained a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promise</span> of the Lord, that out of the fruit of his loins the Lord God would raise up a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteous</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>branch</span> unto the house of Israel; not the Messiah, but a branch which was to be broken off, nevertheless, to be remembered in the covenants of the Lord that the Messiah should be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>manifest</span> unto them in the latter days, in the spirit of power, unto the bringing of them out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>darkness</span> unto light—yea, out of hidden darkness and out of captivity unto freedom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347041" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For Joseph truly testified, saying: A <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seer</span> shall the Lord my God raise up, who shall be a choice seer unto the fruit of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>loins</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347043" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Yea, Joseph truly said: Thus saith the Lord unto me: A choice <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seer</span> will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>raise up</span> out of the fruit of thy loins; and he shall be esteemed highly among the fruit of thy loins. And unto him will I give commandment that he shall do a work for the fruit of thy loins, his brethren, which shall be of great worth unto them, even to the bringing of them to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> of the covenants which I have made with thy fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347046" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And I will give unto him a commandment that he shall do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> other work, save the work which I shall command him. And I will make him great in mine eyes; for he shall do my work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347049" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he shall be great like unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moses</span>, whom I have said I would raise up unto you, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>people</span>, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347052" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moses</span> will I raise up, to deliver thy people out of the land of Egypt.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347054" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seer</span> will I raise up out <span class="page-break" data-page="61"></span>of the fruit of thy loins; and unto him will I give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bring forth</span> my word unto the seed of thy loins—and not to the bringing forth my word only, saith the Lord, but to the convincing them of my word, which shall have already gone forth among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347057" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, the fruit of thy loins shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span>; and the fruit of the loins of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Judah</span> shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>write</span>; and that which shall be written by the fruit of thy loins, and also that which shall be written by the fruit of the loins of Judah, shall grow together, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>confounding</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>false doctrines</span> and laying down of contentions, and establishing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>peace</span> among the fruit of thy loins, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>bringing</span> them to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>knowledge</span> of their fathers in the latter days, and also to the knowledge of my covenants, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347060" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And out of weakness he shall be made strong, in that day when my work shall commence among all my people, unto the restoring thee, O house of Israel, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347063" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And thus prophesied Joseph, saying: Behold, that seer will the Lord bless; and they that seek to destroy him shall be confounded; for this promise, which I have obtained of the Lord, of the fruit of my loins, shall be fulfilled. Behold, I am sure of the fulfilling of this promise;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347065" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> shall be called after me; and it shall be after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span> of his father. And he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>like</span> unto me; for the thing, which the Lord shall bring forth by his hand, by the power of the Lord shall bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>my</span> people unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>salvation</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347068" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, thus prophesied Joseph: I am sure of this thing, even as I am sure of the promise of Moses; for the Lord hath said unto me, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preserve</span> thy seed forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347071" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the Lord hath said: I will raise up a Moses; and I will give power unto him in a rod; and I will give judgment unto him in writing. Yet I will not loose his tongue, that he shall speak much, for I will not make him mighty in speaking. But I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> unto him my law, by the finger of mine own hand; and I will make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spokesman</span> for him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347074" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And the Lord said unto me also: I will raise up unto the fruit of thy loins; and I will make for him a spokesman. And I, behold, I will give unto him that he shall write the writing of the fruit of thy loins, unto the fruit of thy loins; and the spokesman of thy loins shall declare it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347076" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And the words which he shall write shall be the words which are expedient in my wisdom should go forth unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruit</span> of thy loins. And it shall be as if the fruit of thy loins had cried unto them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> the dust; for I know their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347079" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dust</span>; yea, even repentance unto their brethren, even after many generations have gone by them. And it shall come to pass that their cry shall go, even according to the simpleness of their words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347082" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Because of their faith their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> shall proceed forth out of <span class="page-break" data-page="62"></span>my mouth unto their brethren who are the fruit of thy loins; and the weakness of their words will I make strong in their faith, unto the remembering of my covenant which I made unto thy fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347084" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now, behold, my son Joseph, after this manner did my father of old <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347087" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Wherefore, because of this covenant thou art <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span>; for thy seed shall not be destroyed, for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearken</span> unto the words of the book.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347090" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And there shall rise up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> mighty among them, who shall do much good, both in word and in deed, being an instrument in the hands of God, with exceeding faith, to work mighty wonders, and do that thing which is great in the sight of God, unto the bringing to pass much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restoration</span> unto the house of Israel, and unto the seed of thy brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347093" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now, blessed art thou, Joseph. Behold, thou art little; wherefore hearken unto the words of thy brother, Nephi, and it shall be done unto thee even according to the words which I have spoken. Remember the words of thy dying father. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347255" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347256" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347257" id="study_summary1">Lehi counsels and blesses his posterity—He dies and is buried—Nephi glories in the goodness of God—Nephi puts his trust in the Lord forever. About 588–570 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347258" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, I, Nephi, speak concerning the prophecies of which my father hath spoken, concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Joseph</span>, who was carried into Egypt.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347259" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, he truly prophesied concerning all his seed. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophecies</span> which he wrote, there are not many greater. And he prophesied concerning us, and our future generations; and they are written upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates of brass</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347260" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, after my father had made an end of speaking concerning the prophecies of Joseph, he called the children of Laman, his sons, and his daughters, and said unto them: Behold, my sons, and my daughters, who are the sons and the daughters of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>firstborn</span>, I would that ye should give ear unto my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347261" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For the Lord God hath said that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Inasmuch</span> as ye shall keep my commandments ye shall prosper in the land; and inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from my presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347262" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But behold, my sons and my daughters, I cannot go down to my grave save I should leave a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessing</span> upon you; for behold, I know that if ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought up</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>way</span> ye should go ye will not depart from it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347263" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, if ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span>, behold, I leave my blessing upon you, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cursing</span> may be taken from you and be answered upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heads</span> of your parents.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347264" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Wherefore, because of my blessing the Lord God will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> suffer that ye shall perish; wherefore, he will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>merciful</span> unto you and unto your seed forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347265" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that after my father had made an end of speaking to the sons and daughters of Laman, he caused the sons and daughters of Lemuel to be brought before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347266" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he spake unto them, saying: <span class="page-break" data-page="63"></span>Behold, my sons and my daughters, who are the sons and the daughters of my second son; behold I leave unto you the same blessing which I left unto the sons and daughters of Laman; wherefore, thou shalt not utterly be destroyed; but in the end thy seed shall be blessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347267" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that when my father had made an end of speaking unto them, behold, he spake unto the sons of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span>, yea, and even all his household.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347268" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And after he had made an end of speaking unto them, he spake unto Sam, saying: Blessed art thou, and thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span>; for thou shalt inherit the land like unto thy brother Nephi. And thy seed shall be numbered with his seed; and thou shalt be even like unto thy brother, and thy seed like unto his seed; and thou shalt be blessed in all thy days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347269" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass after my father, Lehi, had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spoken</span> unto all his household, according to the feelings of his heart and the Spirit of the Lord which was in him, he waxed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>old</span>. And it came to pass that he died, and was buried.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347270" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that not many days after his death, Laman and Lemuel and the sons of Ishmael were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> with me because of the admonitions of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347271" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For I, Nephi, was constrained to speak unto them, according to his word; for I had spoken many things unto them, and also my father, before his death; many of which sayings are written upon mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other plates</span>; for a more history part are written upon mine other plates.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347272" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these</span> I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> the things of my soul, and many of the scriptures which are engraven upon the plates of brass. For my soul <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>delighteth</span> in the scriptures, and my heart <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>pondereth</span> them, and writeth them for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>learning</span> and the profit of my children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347273" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>soul</span> delighteth in the things of the Lord; and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heart</span> pondereth continually upon the things which I have seen and heard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347274" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Nevertheless, notwithstanding the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>goodness</span> of the Lord, in showing me his great and marvelous works, my heart exclaimeth: O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wretched</span> man that I am! Yea, my heart <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sorroweth</span> because of my flesh; my soul grieveth because of mine iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347275" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>I am encompassed about, because of the temptations and the sins which do so easily <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beset</span> me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347276" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And when I desire to rejoice, my heart groaneth because of my sins; nevertheless, I know in whom I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trusted</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347277" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>My God hath been my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>support</span>; he hath led me through mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span> in the wilderness; and he hath preserved me upon the waters of the great deep.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347278" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>He hath filled me with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span>, even unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>consuming</span> of my flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347279" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>He hath confounded mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enemies</span>, unto the causing of them to quake before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347280" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Behold, he hath heard my cry by <span class="page-break" data-page="64"></span>day, and he hath given me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visions</span> in the night-time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347281" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And by day have I waxed bold in mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayer</span> before him; yea, my voice have I sent up on high; and angels came down and ministered unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347282" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And upon the wings of his Spirit hath my body been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carried away</span> upon exceedingly high mountains. And mine eyes have beheld great things, yea, even too great for man; therefore I was bidden that I should not write them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347283" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>O then, if I have seen so great things, if the Lord in his condescension unto the children of men hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visited</span> men in so much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>why</span> should my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>heart</span> weep and my soul linger in the valley of sorrow, and my flesh waste away, and my strength slacken, because of mine afflictions?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347284" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And why should I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>yield</span> to sin, because of my flesh? Yea, why should I give way to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temptations</span>, that the evil one have place in my heart to destroy my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>peace</span> and afflict my soul? Why am I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>angry</span> because of mine enemy?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347285" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Awake, my soul! No longer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>droop</span> in sin. Rejoice, O my heart, and give place no more for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>enemy</span> of my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347286" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anger</span> again because of mine enemies. Do not slacken my strength because of mine afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347287" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Rejoice, O my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heart</span>, and cry unto the Lord, and say: O Lord, I will praise thee forever; yea, my soul will rejoice in thee, my God, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rock</span> of my salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347288" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>O Lord, wilt thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeem</span> my soul? Wilt thou deliver me out of the hands of mine enemies? Wilt thou make me that I may shake at the appearance of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sin</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347289" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>May the gates of hell be shut continually before me, because that my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heart</span> is broken and my spirit is contrite! O Lord, wilt thou not shut the gates of thy righteousness before me, that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walk</span> in the path of the low valley, that I may be strict in the plain road!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347290" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>O Lord, wilt thou encircle me around in the robe of thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span>! O Lord, wilt thou make a way for mine escape before mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>enemies</span>! Wilt thou make my path straight before me! Wilt thou not place a stumbling block in my way—but that thou wouldst clear my way before me, and hedge not up my way, but the ways of mine enemy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347291" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>O Lord, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trusted</span> in thee, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trust</span> in thee forever. I will not put my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>trust</span> in the arm of flesh; for I know that cursed is he that putteth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>trust</span> in the arm of flesh. Yea, cursed is he that putteth his trust in man or maketh flesh his arm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347292" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Yea, I know that God will give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>liberally</span> to him that asketh. Yea, my God will give me, if I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ask</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not</span> amiss; therefore I will lift up my voice unto thee; yea, I will cry unto thee, my God, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rock</span> of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>righteousness</span>. Behold, my voice <span class="page-break" data-page="65"></span>shall forever ascend up unto thee, my rock and mine everlasting God. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347361" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347362" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347363" id="study_summary1">The Nephites separate themselves from the Lamanites, keep the law of Moses, and build a temple—Because of their unbelief, the Lamanites are cut off from the presence of the Lord, are cursed, and become a scourge unto the Nephites. About 588–559 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347364" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, it came to pass that I, Nephi, did cry much unto the Lord my God, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anger</span> of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347365" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But behold, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anger</span> did increase against me, insomuch that they did seek to take away my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347366" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, they did murmur against me, saying: Our younger brother thinks to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rule</span> over us; and we have had much trial because of him; wherefore, now let us slay him, that we may not be afflicted more because of his words. For behold, we will not have him to be our ruler; for it belongs unto us, who are the elder brethren, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rule</span> over this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347367" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now I do not write upon these plates all the words which they murmured against me. But it sufficeth me to say, that they did seek to take away my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347368" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>warn</span> me, that I, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephi</span>, should depart from them and flee into the wilderness, and all those who would go with me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347369" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, it came to pass that I, Nephi, did take my family, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoram</span> and his family, and Sam, mine elder brother and his family, and Jacob and Joseph, my younger brethren, and also my sisters, and all those who would go with me. And all those who would go with me were those who believed in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>warnings</span> and the revelations of God; wherefore, they did hearken unto my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347370" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And we did take our tents and whatsoever things were possible for us, and did journey in the wilderness for the space of many days. And after we had journeyed for the space of many days we did pitch our tents.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347371" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And my people would that we should call the name of the place <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>; wherefore, we did call it Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347372" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And all those who were with me did take upon them to call themselves the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347373" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And we did observe to keep the judgments, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>statutes</span>, and the commandments of the Lord in all things, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347374" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Lord was with us; and we did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span> exceedingly; for we did sow seed, and we did reap again in abundance. And we began to raise flocks, and herds, and animals of every kind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347375" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I, Nephi, had also brought the records which were engraven upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>; and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ball</span>, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>compass</span>, which was prepared for my father by the hand of the Lord, according to that which is written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347376" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that we began to prosper exceedingly, and to multiply in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347377" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And I, Nephi, did take the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of Laban, and after the manner <span class="page-break" data-page="66"></span>of it did make many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>swords</span>, lest by any means the people who were now called Lamanites should come upon us and destroy us; for I knew their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hatred</span> towards me and my children and those who were called my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347378" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I did teach my people to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> buildings, and to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>work</span> in all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>manner</span> of wood, and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>iron</span>, and of copper, and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>brass</span>, and of steel, and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>gold</span>, and of silver, and of precious ores, which were in great abundance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347379" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I, Nephi, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temple</span>; and I did construct it after the manner of the temple of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Solomon</span> save it were not built of so many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>precious</span> things; for they were not to be found upon the land, wherefore, it could not be built like unto Solomon’s <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>temple</span>. But the manner of the construction was like unto the temple of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Solomon</span>; and the workmanship thereof was exceedingly fine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347380" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did cause my people to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>industrious</span>, and to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>labor</span> with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hands</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347381" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they would that I should be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span>. But I, Nephi, was desirous that they should have no king; nevertheless, I did for them according to that which was in my power.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347382" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, the words of the Lord had been fulfilled unto my brethren, which he spake concerning them, that I should be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ruler</span> and their teacher. Wherefore, I had been their ruler and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teacher</span>, according to the commandments of the Lord, until the time they sought to take away my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347383" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Wherefore, the word of the Lord was fulfilled which he spake unto me, saying that: Inasmuch as they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not hearken</span> unto thy words they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cut off</span> from the presence of the Lord. And behold, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cut off</span> from his presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347384" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he had caused the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursing</span> to come upon them, yea, even a sore cursing, because of their iniquity. For behold, they had hardened their hearts against him, that they had become like unto a flint; wherefore, as they were white, and exceedingly fair and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delightsome</span>, that they might not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>enticing</span> unto my people the Lord God did cause a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>skin</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>blackness</span> to come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347385" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And thus saith the Lord God: I will cause that they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>loathsome</span> unto thy people, save they shall repent of their iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347386" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And cursed shall be the seed of him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mixeth</span> with their seed; for they shall be cursed even with the same cursing. And the Lord spake it, and it was done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347387" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursing</span> which was upon them they did become an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>idle</span> people, full of <span class="page-break" data-page="67"></span>mischief and subtlety, and did seek in the wilderness for beasts of prey.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347388" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And the Lord God said unto me: They shall be a scourge unto thy seed, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir</span> them up in remembrance of me; and inasmuch as they will not remember me, and hearken unto my words, they shall scourge them even unto destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347389" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that I, Nephi, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrate</span> Jacob and Joseph, that they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>teachers</span> over the land of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347390" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that we lived after the manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>happiness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347391" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And thirty years had passed away from the time we left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347392" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I, Nephi, had kept the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> upon my plates, which I had made, of my people thus far.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347393" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord God said unto me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Make</span> other plates; and thou shalt engraven many things upon them which are good in my sight, for the profit of thy people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347394" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Wherefore, I, Nephi, to be obedient to the commandments of the Lord, went and made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span> upon which I have engraven these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347395" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And I engraved that which is pleasing unto God. And if my people are pleased with the things of God they will be pleased with mine engravings which are upon these plates.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347396" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And if my people desire to know the more particular part of the history of my people they must search mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347397" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it sufficeth me to say that forty years had passed away, and we had already had wars and contentions with our brethren.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347458" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347467" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347469" id="study_summary1">Jacob recounts Jewish history: The Babylonian captivity and return; the ministry and crucifixion of the Holy One of Israel; the help received from the Gentiles; and the Jews’ latter-day restoration when they believe in the Messiah. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347471" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of Jacob, the brother of Nephi, which he spake unto the people of Nephi:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347474" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, my beloved brethren, I, Jacob, having been called of God, and ordained after the manner of his holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span>, and having been consecrated by my brother Nephi, unto whom ye look as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>king</span> or a protector, and on whom ye depend for safety, behold ye know that I have spoken unto you exceedingly many things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347476" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Nevertheless, I speak unto you again; for I am desirous for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>welfare</span> of your souls. Yea, mine anxiety is great for you; and ye yourselves know that it ever has been. For I have exhorted you with all diligence; and I have taught you the words of my father; and I have spoken unto you concerning all things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>written</span>, from the creation of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347478" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now, behold, I would speak unto you concerning things which are, and which are to come; wherefore, I will read you the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Isaiah</span>. And they are the words which my brother has desired that I should speak unto you. And I speak unto you for your sakes, that ye may learn and glorify the name of your God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347481" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, the words which I shall read are they which Isaiah spake concerning all the house of Israel; <span class="page-break" data-page="68"></span>wherefore, they may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>likened</span> unto you, for ye are of the house of Israel. And there are many things which have been spoken by Isaiah which may be likened unto you, because ye are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347483" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, these are the words: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Thus</span> saith the Lord God: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>standard</span> to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347485" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kings</span> shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers; they shall bow down to thee with their faces towards the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>I am</span> the Lord; for they shall not be ashamed that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wait</span> for me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347487" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now I, Jacob, would speak somewhat concerning these words. For behold, the Lord has shown me that those who were at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span>, from whence we came, have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slain</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>carried away</span> captive.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347490" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Nevertheless, the Lord has shown unto me that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>return</span> again. And he also has shown unto me that the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, should manifest himself unto them in the flesh; and after he should manifest himself they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scourge</span> him and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>crucify</span> him, according to the words of the angel who spake it unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347492" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And after they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hardened</span> their hearts and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stiffened</span> their necks against the Holy One of Israel, behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judgments</span> of the Holy One of Israel shall come upon them. And the day cometh that they shall be smitten and afflicted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347494" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, after they are driven to and fro, for thus saith the angel, many shall be afflicted in the flesh, and shall not be suffered to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perish</span>, because of the prayers of the faithful;
