they shall be scattered, and smitten, and hated; nevertheless, the Lord will be merciful unto them, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>when</span> they shall come to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> of their Redeemer, they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gathered</span> together again to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>lands</span> of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347497" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And blessed are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, they of whom the prophet has written; for behold, if it so be that they shall repent and fight not against Zion, and do not unite themselves to that great and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>abominable</span> church, they shall be saved; for the Lord God will fulfil his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenants</span> which he has made unto his children; and for this cause the prophet has written these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347499" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, they that fight against Zion and the covenant people of the Lord shall lick up the dust of their feet; and the people of the Lord shall not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ashamed</span>. For the people of the Lord are they who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wait</span> for him; for they still wait for the coming of the Messiah.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="69"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347502" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold, according to the words of the prophet, the Messiah will set himself again the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>second</span> time to recover them; wherefore, he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>manifest</span> himself unto them in power and great glory, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destruction</span> of their enemies, when that day cometh when they shall believe in him; and none will he destroy that believe in him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347504" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And they that believe not in him shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span>, both by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fire</span>, and by tempest, and by earthquakes, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bloodsheds</span>, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>pestilence</span>, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>famine</span>. And they shall know that the Lord is God, the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347506" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>For</span> shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lawful captive</span> delivered?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347509" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But thus saith the Lord: Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>for</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mighty God</span> shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliver</span> his covenant people. For thus saith the Lord: I will contend with them that contendeth with thee—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347511" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I will feed them that oppress thee, with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall know that I the Lord am thy Savior and thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Redeemer</span>, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mighty One</span> of Jacob.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347457" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347459" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347460" id="study_summary1">Jacob continues reading from Isaiah: Isaiah speaks messianically—The Messiah will have the tongue of the learned—He will give His back to the smiters—He will not be confounded—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/50">Isaiah 50</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347461" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Yea</span>, for thus saith the Lord: Have I put thee away, or have I cast thee off forever? For thus saith the Lord: Where is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bill</span> of your mother’s <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>divorcement</span>? To whom have I put thee away, or to which of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>creditors</span> have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sold</span> you? Yea, to whom have I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347462" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span>, yea, there was none to answer. O house of Israel, is my hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem, or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dry up</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sea</span>, I make their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rivers</span> a wilderness and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fish</span> to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347463" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>I clothe the heavens with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blackness</span>, and I make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sackcloth</span> their covering.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347464" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>The Lord God hath given me the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tongue</span> of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season unto thee, O house of Israel. When <span class="page-break" data-page="70"></span>ye are weary he waketh morning by morning. He waketh mine ear to hear as the learned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347465" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>The Lord God hath opened mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ear</span>, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347466" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>I gave my back to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smiter</span>, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair. I hid not my face from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shame</span> and spitting.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347468" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded. Therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ashamed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347470" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the Lord is near, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justifieth</span> me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>smite</span> him with the strength of my mouth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347472" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For the Lord God will help me. And all they who shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>condemn</span> me, behold, all they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wax old</span> as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347473" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of his servant, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walketh</span> in darkness and hath no light?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347475" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Behold all ye that kindle fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks, walk in the light of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>your</span> fire and in the sparks which ye have kindled. <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>This</span> shall ye have of mine hand—ye shall lie down in sorrow.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347563" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347564" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347565" id="study_summary1">Jacob continues reading from Isaiah: In the last days, the Lord will comfort Zion and gather Israel—The redeemed will come to Zion amid great joy—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/51?span=51:1-52:2#p1">Isaiah 51 and 52:1–2</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347566" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Hearken</span> unto me, ye that follow after righteousness. Look unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rock</span> from whence ye are hewn, and to the hole of the pit from whence ye are digged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347567" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Look unto Abraham, your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span>, and unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Sarah</span>, she that bare you; for I called him alone, and blessed him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347568" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For the Lord shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>comfort</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zion</span>, he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wilderness</span> like <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Eden</span>, and her desert like the garden of the Lord. Joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving and the voice of melody.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347569" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation; for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> for the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347570" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>My righteousness is near; my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> is gone forth, and mine arm shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span> the people. The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>isles</span> shall wait upon me, and on mine arm shall they trust.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347571" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Lift up your eyes to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heavens</span>, and look upon the earth beneath; for the heavens shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vanish</span> away like smoke, and the earth shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wax old</span> like a garment; and they that dwell therein shall die in like manner. But my salvation shall be forever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347572" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart I have written my law, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fear</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="71"></span>ye not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>reproach</span> of men, neither be ye afraid of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>revilings</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347573" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>moth</span> shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool. But my righteousness shall be forever, and my salvation from generation to generation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347574" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Awake</span>, awake! Put on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span>, O arm of the Lord; awake as in the ancient days. Art thou not he that hath cut <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Rahab</span>, and wounded the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>dragon</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347575" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Art thou not he who hath dried the sea, the waters of the great deep; that hath made the depths of the sea a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>way</span> for the ransomed to pass over?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347576" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeemed</span> of the Lord shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>return</span>, and come with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>singing</span> unto Zion; and everlasting joy and holiness shall be upon their heads; and they shall obtain gladness and joy; sorrow and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mourning</span> shall flee away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347577" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> am he; yea, I am he that comforteth you. Behold, who art thou, that thou shouldst be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afraid</span> of man, who shall die, and of the son of man, who shall be made like unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grass</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347578" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgettest</span> the Lord thy maker, that hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stretched</span> forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth, and hast feared continually every day, because of the fury of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>oppressor</span>, as if he were ready to destroy? And where is the fury of the oppressor?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347579" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captive</span> exile hasteneth, that he may be loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that his bread should fail.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347580" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But I am the Lord thy God, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waves</span> roared; the Lord of Hosts is my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347581" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>put</span> my words in thy mouth, and have covered thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion: Behold, thou art my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>people</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347582" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cup</span> of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fury</span>—thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling wrung out—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347583" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And none to guide her among all the sons she hath brought forth; neither that taketh her by the hand, of all the sons she hath brought up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347584" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>These two <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons</span> are come unto thee, who shall be sorry for thee—thy desolation and destruction, and the famine and the sword—and by whom shall I comfort thee?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347585" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Thy sons have fainted, save these two; they lie at the head of all the streets; as a wild bull in a net, they are full of the fury of the Lord, the rebuke of thy God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347586" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drunken</span>, and not with wine:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347587" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Thus saith thy Lord, the Lord and thy God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pleadeth</span> the cause of his people; behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, the dregs of the cup of my fury; thou shalt no more drink it again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347588" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> will put it into the hand <span class="page-break" data-page="72"></span>of them that afflict thee; who have said to thy soul: Bow down, that we may go over—and thou hast laid thy body as the ground and as the street to them that went over.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347589" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Awake</span>, awake, put on thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span>, O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zion</span>; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city; for henceforth there shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no more</span> come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347590" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Shake thyself from the dust; arise, sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bands</span> of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347641" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347642" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347643" id="study_summary1">Jacob explains that the Jews will be gathered in all their lands of promise—The Atonement ransoms man from the Fall—The bodies of the dead will come forth from the grave, and their spirits from hell and from paradise—They will be judged—The Atonement saves from death, hell, the devil, and endless torment—The righteous are to be saved in the kingdom of God—Penalties for sins are set forth—The Holy One of Israel is the keeper of the gate. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347644" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, I have read these things that ye might know concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenants</span> of the Lord that he has covenanted with all the house of Israel—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347645" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>That he has spoken unto the Jews, by the mouth of his holy prophets, even from the beginning down, from generation to generation, until the time comes that they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restored</span> to the true church and fold of God; when they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gathered</span> home to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lands</span> of their inheritance, and shall be established in all their lands of promise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347646" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, my beloved brethren, I speak unto you these things that ye may rejoice, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lift up</span> your heads forever, because of the blessings which the Lord God shall bestow upon your children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347647" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For I know that ye have searched much, many of you, to know of things to come; wherefore I know that ye know that our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flesh</span> must waste away and die; nevertheless, in our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bodies</span> we shall see God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347648" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, I know that ye know that in the body he shall show himself unto those at Jerusalem, from whence we came; for it is expedient that it should be among them; for it behooveth the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Creator</span> that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>suffereth</span> himself to become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>subject</span> unto man in the flesh, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>die</span> for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>all</span> men, that all men might become subject unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347649" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> hath passed upon all men, to fulfil the merciful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan</span> of the great Creator, there must needs be a power of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>resurrection</span>, and the resurrection must needs come unto man by reason of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fall</span>; and the fall came by reason of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>transgression</span>; and because man became fallen they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>cut off</span> from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>presence</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347650" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Wherefore, it must needs be an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>infinite</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atonement</span>—save it should be an infinite atonement this <span class="page-break" data-page="73"></span>corruption could not put on incorruption. Wherefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>first</span> judgment which came upon man must needs have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>remained</span> to an endless duration. And if so, this flesh must have laid down to rot and to crumble to its mother earth, to rise no more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347651" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>O the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wisdom</span> of God, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span>! For behold, if the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>flesh</span> should rise no more our spirits must become subject to that angel who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fell</span> from before the presence of the Eternal God, and became the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>devil</span>, to rise no more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347652" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And our spirits must have become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>like</span> unto him, and we become devils, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angels</span> to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span>, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>shut out</span> from the presence of our God, and to remain with the father of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>lies</span>, in misery, like unto himself; yea, to that being who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>beguiled</span> our first parents, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>transformeth</span> himself nigh unto an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>angel</span> of light, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>stirreth up</span> the children of men unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9j"><sup class="marker">j</sup>secret combinations</span> of murder and all manner of secret works of darkness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347653" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>O how great the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>goodness</span> of our God, who prepareth a way for our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>escape</span> from the grasp of this awful monster; yea, that monster, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hell</span>, which I call the death of the body, and also the death of the spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347654" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And because of the way of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliverance</span> of our God, the Holy One of Israel, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>, of which I have spoken, which is the temporal, shall deliver up its dead; which death is the grave.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347655" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> of which I have spoken, which is the spiritual death, shall deliver up its dead; which spiritual death is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span>; wherefore, death and hell must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliver</span> up their dead, and hell must deliver up its <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>captive</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>spirits</span>, and the grave must deliver up its captive <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>bodies</span>, and the bodies and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>spirits</span> of men will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>restored</span> one to the other; and it is by the power of the resurrection of the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347656" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O how great the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plan</span> of our God! For on the other hand, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>paradise</span> of God must deliver up the spirits of the righteous, and the grave deliver up the body of the righteous; and the spirit and the body is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restored</span> to itself again, and all men become incorruptible, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>immortal</span>, and they are living souls, having a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>perfect</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>knowledge</span> like unto us in the flesh, save it be that our knowledge shall be perfect.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347657" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Wherefore, we shall have a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perfect</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of all our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>guilt</span>, and our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>uncleanness</span>, and our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>nakedness</span>;
