Would I be plain unto you according to the plainness of the truth if ye were freed from sin?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347691" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>Behold, if ye were holy I would speak unto you of holiness; but as ye are not holy, and ye look upon me as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teacher</span>, it must needs be expedient that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teach</span> you the consequences of sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347692" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>Behold, my soul abhorreth sin, and my heart <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delighteth</span> in righteousness; and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praise</span> the holy name of my God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347693" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>Come, my brethren, every one that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thirsteth</span>, come ye to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>waters</span>; and he that hath no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>money</span>, come buy and eat; yea, come buy wine and milk without money and without price.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347694" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>Wherefore, do not spend money for that which is of no worth, nor your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labor</span> for that which cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>satisfy</span>. Hearken diligently unto me, and remember the words which I have spoken; and come unto the Holy One of Israel, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>feast</span> upon that which perisheth not, neither can be corrupted, and let your soul delight in fatness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347695" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>Behold, my beloved brethren, remember the words of your God; pray unto him continually by day, and give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thanks</span> unto his holy name by night. Let your hearts <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rejoice</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347696" id="p53"><span class="verse-number">53 </span>And behold how great the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenants</span> of the Lord, and how great his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>condescensions</span> unto the children of men; and because of his greatness, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mercy</span>, he has promised unto us that our seed shall not utterly be destroyed, according to the flesh, but that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>preserve</span> them; and in future generations they shall become a righteous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>branch</span> unto the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347697" id="p54"><span class="verse-number">54 </span>And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345967" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="78"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345968" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345969" id="study_summary1">Jacob explains that the Jews will crucify their God—They will be scattered until they begin to believe in Him—America will be a land of liberty where no king will rule—Reconcile yourselves to God and gain salvation through His grace. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345970" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Jacob, speak unto you again, my beloved brethren, concerning this righteous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>branch</span> of which I have spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345971" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promises</span> which we have obtained are promises unto us according to the flesh; wherefore, as it has been shown unto me that many of our children shall perish in the flesh because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span>, nevertheless, God will be merciful unto many; and our children shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restored</span>, that they may come to that which will give them the true knowledge of their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345972" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, as I said unto you, it must needs be expedient that Christ—for in the last night the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> spake unto me that this should be his name—should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jews</span>, among those who are the more wicked part of the world; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>crucify</span> him—for thus it behooveth our God, and there is none other nation on earth that would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>crucify</span> their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>God</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345973" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For should the mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> be wrought among other nations they would repent, and know that he be their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345974" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priestcrafts</span> and iniquities, they at Jerusalem will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stiffen</span> their necks against him, that he be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>crucified</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345975" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, because of their iniquities, destructions, famines, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pestilences</span>, and bloodshed shall come upon them; and they who shall not be destroyed shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> among all nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345976" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But behold, thus saith the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord God</span>: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>When</span> the day cometh that they shall believe in me, that I am Christ, then have I covenanted with their fathers that they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restored</span> in the flesh, upon the earth, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>lands</span> of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345977" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it shall come to pass that they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathered</span> in from their long dispersion, from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>isles</span> of the sea, and from the four parts of the earth; and the nations of the Gentiles shall be great in the eyes of me, saith God, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>carrying</span> them forth to the lands of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345978" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Yea</span>, the kings of the Gentiles shall be nursing fathers unto them, and their queens shall become nursing mothers; wherefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promises</span> of the Lord are great unto the Gentiles, for he hath spoken it, and who can dispute?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345979" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But behold, this land, said God, shall be a land of thine inheritance, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span> shall be blessed upon the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345980" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And this land shall be a land of <span class="page-break" data-page="79"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>liberty</span> unto the Gentiles, and there shall be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kings</span> upon the land, who shall raise up unto the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345981" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I will fortify this land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> all other nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345982" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fighteth</span> against Zion shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perish</span>, saith God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345983" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For he that raiseth up a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> against me shall perish, for I, the Lord, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>king</span> of heaven, will be their king, and I will be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>light</span> unto them forever, that hear my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345984" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Wherefore, for this cause, that my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenants</span> may be fulfilled which I have made unto the children of men, that I will do unto them while they are in the flesh, I must needs destroy the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> works of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>darkness</span>, and of murders, and of abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345985" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wherefore, he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fighteth</span> against <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zion</span>, both Jew and Gentile, both bond and free, both male and female, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>shall</span> perish; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>they</span> are they who are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>whore</span> of all the earth; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>they</span> who are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>not</span> for me are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>against</span> me, saith our God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345986" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfil</span> my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promises</span> which I have made unto the children of men, that I will do unto them while they are in the flesh—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345987" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, thus saith our God: I will afflict thy seed by the hand of the Gentiles; nevertheless, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>soften</span> the hearts of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, that they shall be like unto a father to them; wherefore, the Gentiles shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blessed</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>numbered</span> among the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345988" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrate</span> this land unto thy seed, and them who shall be numbered among thy seed, forever, for the land of their inheritance; for it is a choice land, saith God unto me, above all other lands, wherefore I will have all men that dwell thereon that they shall worship me, saith God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345989" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, seeing that our merciful God has given us so great knowledge concerning these things, let us remember him, and lay aside our sins, and not hang down our heads, for we are not cast off; nevertheless, we have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>driven out</span> of the land of our inheritance; but we have been led to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>better land</span>, for the Lord has made the sea our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>path</span>, and we are upon an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>isle</span> of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345990" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But great are the promises of the Lord unto them who are upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>isles</span> of the sea; wherefore as it says isles, there must needs be more than this, and they are inhabited also by our brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345991" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, the Lord God has <span class="page-break" data-page="80"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led away</span> from time to time from the house of Israel, according to his will and pleasure. And now behold, the Lord remembereth all them who have been broken off, wherefore he remembereth us also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345992" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cheer up</span> your hearts, and remember that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>free</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>act</span> for yourselves—to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>choose</span> the way of everlasting death or the way of eternal life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345993" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reconcile</span> yourselves to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>will</span> of God, and not to the will of the devil and the flesh; and remember, after ye are reconciled unto God, that it is only in and through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span> of God that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>saved</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345994" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wherefore, may God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>raise</span> you from death by the power of the resurrection, and also from everlasting death by the power of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atonement</span>, that ye may be received into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>eternal</span> kingdom of God, that ye may praise him through grace divine. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346064" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346065" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346066" id="study_summary1">Jacob saw his Redeemer—The law of Moses typifies Christ and proves He will come. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346067" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jacob</span> spake many more things to my people at that time; nevertheless only these things have I caused to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>written</span>, for the things which I have written sufficeth me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346068" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now I, Nephi, write <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> of the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Isaiah</span>, for my soul delighteth in his words. For I will liken his words unto my people, and I will send them forth unto all my children, for he verily <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>saw</span> my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Redeemer</span>, even as I have seen him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346069" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And my brother, Jacob, also has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seen</span> him as I have seen him; wherefore, I will send their words forth unto my children to prove unto them that my words are true. Wherefore, by the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>three</span>, God hath said, I will establish my word. Nevertheless, God sendeth more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>witnesses</span>, and he proveth all his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346070" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, my soul delighteth in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>proving</span> unto my people the truth of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>coming</span> of Christ; for, for this end hath the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> of Moses been given; and all things which have been given of God from the beginning of the world, unto man, are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>typifying</span> of him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346071" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And also my soul delighteth in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenants</span> of the Lord which he hath made to our fathers; yea, my soul delighteth in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span>, and in his justice, and power, and mercy in the great and eternal plan of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliverance</span> from death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346072" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And my soul delighteth in proving unto my people that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>save</span> Christ should come all men must perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346073" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For if there be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> Christ there be no God; and if there be no God we <span class="page-break" data-page="81"></span>are not, for there could have been no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>creation</span>. But there is a God, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>he</span> is Christ, and he cometh in the fulness of his own time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346074" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now I write <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>some</span> of the words of Isaiah, that whoso of my people shall see these words may lift up their hearts and rejoice for all men. Now these are the words, and ye may liken them unto you and unto all men.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345153" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345154" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345155" id="study_summary1">Isaiah sees the latter-day temple, gathering of Israel, and millennial judgment and peace—The proud and wicked will be brought low at the Second Coming—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/2">Isaiah 2</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345156" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>The</span> word that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345157" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it shall come to pass in the last days, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>when</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mountain</span> of the Lord’s <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>house</span> shall be established in the top of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mountains</span>, and shall be exalted above the hills, and all nations shall flow unto it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345158" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mountain</span> of the Lord, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>house</span> of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>walk</span> in his paths; for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345159" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span> among the nations, and shall rebuke many people: and they shall beat their swords into plow-shares, and their spears into pruning-hooks—nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345160" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>O house of Jacob, come ye and let us walk in the light of the Lord; yea, come, for ye have all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gone astray</span>, every one to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wicked</span> ways.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345161" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Therefore, O Lord, thou hast forsaken thy people, the house of Jacob, because they be replenished from the east, and hearken unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>soothsayers</span> like the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Philistines</span>, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345162" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>treasures</span>; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345163" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Their land is also full of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>idols</span>; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345164" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the mean man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boweth</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> down, and the great man humbleth himself not, therefore, forgive him not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345165" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>O ye wicked ones, enter into the rock, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> thee in the dust, for the fear of the Lord and the glory of his majesty shall smite thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345166" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it shall come to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lofty</span> looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345167" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> of the Lord of <span class="page-break" data-page="82"></span>Hosts soon cometh upon all nations, yea, upon every one; yea, upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>proud</span> and lofty, and upon every one who is lifted up, and he shall be brought low.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345168" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, and the day of the Lord shall come upon all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cedars</span> of Lebanon, for they are high and lifted up; and upon all the oaks of Bashan;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345169" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And upon all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high</span> mountains, and upon all the hills, and upon all the nations which are lifted up, and upon every people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345170" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And upon every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high</span> tower, and upon every fenced wall;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345171" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And upon all the ships of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sea</span>, and upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345172" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>haughtiness</span> of men shall be made low; and the Lord alone shall be exalted in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>that day</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345173" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And the idols he shall utterly abolish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345174" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span> of his majesty shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345175" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which he hath made for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345176" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the majesty of his glory shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345177" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for wherein is he to be accounted of?</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346096" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346097" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346098" id="study_summary1">Judah and Jerusalem will be punished for their disobedience—The Lord pleads for and judges His people—The daughters of Zion are cursed and tormented for their worldliness—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/3">Isaiah 3</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346099" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>For</span> behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346100" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mighty</span> man, and the man of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>war</span>, the judge, and the prophet, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prudent</span>, and the ancient;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346101" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346102" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I will give children unto them to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346103" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the people shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oppressed</span>, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor; the child shall behave himself <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>proudly</span> against the ancient, and the base against the honorable.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346104" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and shall say: Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let not this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ruin</span> come under thy hand—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346105" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>In that day shall he swear, saying: I will not be a healer; for in my house there is neither bread nor clothing; make me not a ruler of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346106" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For Jerusalem is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ruined</span>, and Judah is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span>, because their <span class="page-break" data-page="83"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tongues</span> and their doings have been against the Lord, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>provoke</span> the eyes of his glory.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346107" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>The show of their countenance doth witness against them, and doth declare their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sin</span> to be even as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Sodom</span>, and they cannot hide it. Wo unto their souls, for they have rewarded evil unto themselves!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346108" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Say unto the righteous that it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>well</span> with them; for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eat</span> the fruit of their doings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346109" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wo unto the wicked, for they shall perish; for the reward of their hands shall be upon them!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346110" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lead</span> thee cause thee to err and destroy the way of thy paths.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346111" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>The Lord standeth up to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plead</span>, and standeth to judge the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346112" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>The Lord will enter into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span> with the ancients of his people and the princes thereof; for ye have eaten up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vineyard</span> and the spoil of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>poor</span> in your houses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346113" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>What mean ye? Ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beat</span> my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor, saith the Lord God of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346114" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Moreover, the Lord saith: Because the daughters of Zion are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>haughty</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walk</span> with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346115" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore the Lord will smite with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scab</span> the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>discover</span> their secret parts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346116" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>In that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346117" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346118" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346119" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>The rings, and nose jewels;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346120" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346121" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346122" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it shall come to pass, instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle, a rent; and instead of well set hair, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baldness</span>; and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burning</span> instead of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>beauty</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346123" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Thy men shall fall by the sword and thy mighty in the war.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346124" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And her <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gates</span> shall lament and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mourn</span>; and she shall be desolate, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sit</span> upon the ground.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346157" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346158" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346159" id="study_summary1">Zion and her daughters will be redeemed and cleansed in the millennial day—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/4">Isaiah 4</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346160" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> in that day, seven women shall take hold of one man, saying: We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel; only let us be called by thy name to take away our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>reproach</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346161" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>In that day shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>branch</span> of the Lord be beautiful and glorious; the fruit of the earth excellent and <span class="page-break" data-page="84"></span>comely to them that are escaped of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346162" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it shall come to pass, they that are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>left</span> in Zion and remain in Jerusalem shall be called holy, every one that is written among the living in Jerusalem—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346163" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>When the Lord shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>washed</span> away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burning</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346164" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cloud</span> and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346165" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime from the heat, and for a place of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>refuge</span>, and a covert from storm and from rain.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346172" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346176" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346177" id="study_summary1">The Lord’s vineyard (Israel) will become desolate, and His people will be scattered—Woes will come upon them in their apostate and scattered state—The Lord will lift an ensign and gather Israel—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/5">Isaiah 5</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346178" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> then will I sing to my well-beloved a song of my beloved, touching his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vineyard</span>. My well-beloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346179" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vine</span>, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a wine-press therein; and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346180" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346181" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>What could have been done more to my vineyard that I have not done in it? Wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes it brought forth wild grapes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346182" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard—I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>take away</span> the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and I will break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346183" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned nor digged; but there shall come up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>briers</span> and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rain</span> no rain upon it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346184" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vineyard</span> of the Lord of Hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant; and he looked for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment</span>, and behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>oppression</span>; for righteousness, but behold, a cry.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346185" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wo unto them that join <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>house to house</span>, till there can be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346186" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>In mine ears, said the Lord of Hosts, of a truth many houses shall be desolate, and great and fair cities without inhabitant.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346187" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bath</span>, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346188" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wo unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>follow</span> strong drink, that continue until night, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wine</span> inflame them!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346189" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And the harp, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>viol</span>, the tabret, and pipe, and wine are in their feasts; but they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>regard</span> not <span class="page-break" data-page="85"></span>the work of the Lord, neither consider the operation of his hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346190" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, my people are gone into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span>, because they have no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span>; and their honorable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346191" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore, hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure; and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346192" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And the mean man shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brought</span> down, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mighty</span> man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lofty</span> shall be humbled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346193" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But the Lord of Hosts shall be exalted in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span>, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346194" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fat</span> ones shall strangers eat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346195" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vanity</span>, and sin as it were with a cart rope;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346196" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>That say: Let him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>make</span> speed, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hasten</span> his work, that we may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>see</span> it; and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346197" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Wo unto them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>call</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil</span> good, and good evil, that put <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>darkness</span> for light, and light for darkness, that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346198" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Wo unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span> in their own eyes and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prudent</span> in their own sight!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346199" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Wo unto the mighty to drink <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wine</span>, and men of strength to mingle strong drink;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346200" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Who justify the wicked for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reward</span>, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346201" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fire</span> devoureth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stubble</span>, and the flame consumeth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chaff</span>, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>root</span> shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>despised</span> the word of the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346202" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Therefore, is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anger</span> of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346203" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And he will lift up an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ensign</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nations</span> from far, and will hiss unto them from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>end</span> of the earth; and behold, they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>come</span> with speed swiftly; none shall be weary nor stumble among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346204" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346205" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346206" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>They shall roar like young <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lions</span>; yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry away safe, and none shall deliver.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346207" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And in that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> they shall roar against them like the roaring of the <span class="page-break" data-page="86"></span>sea; and if they look unto the land, behold, darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346248" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346254" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346255" id="study_summary1">Isaiah sees the Lord—Isaiah’s sins are forgiven—He is called to prophesy—He prophesies of the rejection by the Jews of Christ’s teachings—A remnant will return—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/6">Isaiah 6</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346256" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>In</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>year</span> that king Uzziah died, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>saw</span> also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346257" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Above it stood the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seraphim</span>; each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346258" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And one cried unto another, and said: Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of Hosts; the whole earth is full of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346259" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346260" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Then said I: Wo is unto me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips; and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for mine eyes have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seen</span> the King, the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346261" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Then flew one of the seraphim unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346262" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he laid it upon my mouth, and said: Lo, this has touched thy lips; and thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquity</span> is taken away, and thy sin purged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346263" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Whom</span> shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said: Here am I; send me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346264" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he said: Go and tell this people—Hear ye indeed, but they understood not; and see ye indeed, but they perceived not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346265" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes—lest they see with their eyes, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hear</span> with their ears, and understand with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heart</span>, and be converted and be healed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346266" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Then said I: Lord, how long? And he said: Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346267" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And the Lord have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>removed</span> men far away, for there shall be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346268" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But yet there shall be a tenth, and they shall return, and shall be eaten, as a teil tree, and as an oak whose substance is in them when they cast their leaves; so the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy seed</span> shall be the substance thereof.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 17	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346281" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/17" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 17</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346282" id="title_number1">Chapter 17</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346283" id="study_summary1">Ephraim and Syria wage war against Judah—Christ will be born of a virgin—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/7">Isaiah 7</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346284" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> it came to pass in the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Ahaz</span> the son of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jotham</span>, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Rezin</span>, king of Syria, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Pekah</span> the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346285" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it was told the house of David, saying: Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346286" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Then said the Lord unto Isaiah: Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou <span class="page-break" data-page="87"></span>and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conduit</span> of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346287" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And say unto him: Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be faint-hearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346288" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346289" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Let us go up against Judah and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, yea, the son of Tabeal.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346290" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Thus saith the Lord God: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>It</span> shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346291" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus, Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>broken</span> that it be not a people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346292" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not believe</span> surely ye shall not be established.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346293" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Moreover, the Lord spake again unto Ahaz, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346294" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Ask thee a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span> of the Lord thy God; ask it either in the depths, or in the heights above.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346295" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But Ahaz said: I will not ask, neither will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tempt</span> the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346296" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And he said: Hear ye now, O house of David; is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346297" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore, the Lord himself shall give you a sign—Behold, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>virgin</span> shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and shall call his name <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Immanuel</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346298" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Butter and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>honey</span> shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil and to choose the good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346299" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>before</span> the child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>both</span> her kings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346300" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>The Lord shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bring</span> upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father’s house, days that have not come from the day that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Ephraim</span> departed from Judah, the king of Assyria.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346301" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346302" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346303" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>In the same day shall the Lord shave with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>razor</span> that is hired, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346304" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day, a man shall nourish a young cow and two sheep;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346305" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk they shall give he shall eat butter; for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346306" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day, every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, which shall be for briers and thorns.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346307" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>With arrows and with bows shall men come thither, because all the land shall become briers and thorns.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346308" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and the treading of lesser cattle.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 18	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345207" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/18" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 18</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="88"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345208" id="title_number1">Chapter 18</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345209" id="study_summary1">Christ will be as a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense—Seek the Lord, not peeping wizards—Turn to the law and to the testimony for guidance—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/8">Isaiah 8</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345210" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Moreover, the word of the Lord said unto me: Take thee a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>roll</span>, and write in it with a man’s pen, concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Maher-shalal-hash-baz</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345211" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I took unto me faithful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span> to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345212" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived and bare a son. Then said the Lord to me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Call</span> his name, Maher-shalal-hash-baz.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345213" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, before the riches of Damascus and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>spoil</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Samaria</span> shall be taken away before the king of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Assyria</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345214" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>The Lord spake also unto me again, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345215" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shiloah</span> that go softly, and rejoice in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Rezin</span> and Remaliah’s son;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345216" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Assyria</span> and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345217" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reach</span> even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345218" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Associate</span> yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear all ye of far countries; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345219" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Take counsel together, and it shall come to naught; speak the word, and it shall not stand; for God is with us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345220" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For the Lord spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345221" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Say ye not, A confederacy, to all to whom this people shall say, A <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>confederacy</span>; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345222" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Sanctify the Lord of Hosts himself, and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345223" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stone</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stumbling</span>, and for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rock</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>offense</span> to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>snare</span> to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345224" for wonders in Israel from the Lord of Hosts, which dwelleth in Mount Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345228" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And when they shall say unto people seek unto their God for the living to hear from the dead?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345229" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>To the <span class="study-note-ref" data-aid="128345230" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they shall pass through it hardly bestead and hungry; and it shall come to pass that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret
