2 Nephi 19	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346328" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/19" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 19</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346329" id="title_number1">Chapter 19</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346330" id="study_summary1">Isaiah speaks messianically—The people in darkness will see a great light—Unto us a child is born—He will be the Prince of Peace and will reign on David’s throne—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/9">Isaiah 9</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346331" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nevertheless</span>, the dimness shall not be such as was in her vexation, when at first he lightly afflicted the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zebulun</span>, and the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Naphtali</span>, and afterwards did more grievously afflict by the way of the Red Sea beyond Jordan in Galilee of the nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346332" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346333" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Thou hast multiplied the nation, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>increased</span> the joy—they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346334" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For thou hast broken the yoke of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>his</span> burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>oppressor</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346335" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> shall be with burning and fuel of fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346336" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For unto us a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>child</span> is born, unto us a son is given; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>government</span> shall be upon his shoulder; and his name shall be called, Wonderful, Counselor, The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Mighty God</span>, The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Everlasting Father</span>, The Prince of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Peace</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346337" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Of the increase of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>government</span> and peace <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>there</span> is no end, upon the throne of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>David</span>, and upon his kingdom to order it, and to establish it with judgment and with justice from henceforth, even forever. The zeal of the Lord of Hosts will perform this.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346338" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>The Lord sent his word unto Jacob and it hath lighted upon Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346339" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, that say in the pride and stoutness of heart:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346340" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stones</span>; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cedars</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346341" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Rezin</span> against him, and join his enemies together;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346342" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>devour</span> Israel with open mouth. For all this his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anger</span> is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346343" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For the people turneth not unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>him</span> that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346344" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore will the Lord cut off <span class="page-break" data-page="90"></span>from Israel head and tail, branch and rush <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in</span> one day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346345" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ancient</span>, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346346" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>leaders</span> of this people cause them to err; and they that are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>led</span> of them are destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346347" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> on their fatherless and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>widows</span>; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>every</span> one of them is a hypocrite and an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>evildoer</span>, and every mouth speaketh <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>folly</span>. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>hand</span> is stretched out still.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346348" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> burneth as the fire; it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forests, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346349" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Through the wrath of the Lord of Hosts is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no man</span> shall spare his brother.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346350" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shall</span> snatch on the right hand and be hungry; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eat</span> on the left hand and they shall not be satisfied; they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346351" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Manasseh, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ephraim</span>; and Ephraim, Manasseh; they together shall be against <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Judah</span>. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 20	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345261" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/20" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 20</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345263" id="title_number1">Chapter 20</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345264" id="study_summary1">The destruction of Assyria is a type of the destruction of the wicked at the Second Coming—Few people will be left after the Lord comes again—The remnant of Jacob will return in that day—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/10">Isaiah 10</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345265" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Wo</span> unto them that decree <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unrighteous</span> decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345266" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>To turn away the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor</span> of my people, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>widows</span> may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345267" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345268" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345269" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>their</span> indignation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345270" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>I will send him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against a hypocritical nation</span>, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345272" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but in his heart it is to destroy and cut off nations not a few.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345274" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For he saith: Are not my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>princes</span> altogether kings?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345276" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Is not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Calno</span> as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Carchemish</span>? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Damascus</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345278" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>As <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my hand</span> hath founded the <span class="page-break" data-page="91"></span>kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345280" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>idols</span>, so do to Jerusalem and to her idols?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345282" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore it shall come to pass that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon Mount Zion and upon Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Assyria</span>, and the glory of his high looks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345284" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>he</span> saith: By the strength of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>my hand</span> and by my wisdom I have done these things; for I am prudent; and I have moved the borders of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345286" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people; and as one gathereth eggs that are left have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345287" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ax</span> boast itself against him that heweth therewith? Shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? As if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself as if it were no wood!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345289" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, send among his fat ones, leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345291" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the light of Israel shall be for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fire</span>, and his Holy One for a flame, and shall burn and shall devour his thorns and his briers in one day;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345293" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body; and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345295" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span> of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345297" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>house of Jacob</span>, shall no more again <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stay upon</span> him that smote them, but shall stay upon the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345299" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> shall return, yea, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345301" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For though thy people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Israel</span> be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>return</span>; the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>consumption</span> decreed shall overflow with righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345303" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For the Lord God of Hosts shall make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consumption</span>, even determined in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345305" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, thus saith the Lord God of Hosts: O my people that dwellest in Zion, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>be</span> not afraid of the Assyrian; he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>manner</span> of Egypt.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345307" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For yet a very little while, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>indignation</span> shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345309" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the Lord of Hosts shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir up</span> a scourge for him according to the slaughter of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Midian</span> at the rock of Oreb; and as his rod was upon the sea so shall he lift it up after the manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Egypt</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="92"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345311" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>burden</span> shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anointing</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345313" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>He</span> is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345315" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>They are gone over the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>passage</span>; they have taken up their lodging at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Geba</span>; Ramath is afraid; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Gibeah</span> of Saul is fled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345317" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Lift up the voice, O daughter of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gallim</span>; cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Anathoth</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345319" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345321" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>As yet shall he remain at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nob</span> that day; he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345323" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts shall lop the bough with terror; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high</span> ones of stature shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hewn</span> down; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>haughty</span> shall be humbled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345325" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And he shall cut down the thickets of the forests with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 21	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345262" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/21" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 21</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345271" id="title_number1">Chapter 21</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345273" id="study_summary1">The stem of Jesse (Christ) will judge in righteousness—The knowledge of God will cover the earth in the Millennium—The Lord will raise an ensign and gather Israel—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/11">Isaiah 11</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345275" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> there shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> forth a rod out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stem of Jesse</span>, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>branch</span> shall grow out of his roots.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345277" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wisdom</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>understanding</span>, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345279" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the Lord; and he shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span> after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345281" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> shall he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span> the poor, and reprove with equity for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>meek</span> of the earth; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>smite</span> the earth with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>rod</span> of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345283" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345285" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wolf</span> also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid, and the calf and the young lion and fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345288" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together; and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345290" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice’s den.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345292" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>They shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> hurt nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> in all my holy mountain, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>earth</span> shall be full of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knowledge</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="93"></span>of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345294" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And in that day there shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>root of Jesse</span>, which shall stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span> seek; and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rest</span> shall be glorious.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345296" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall set his hand again the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>second</span> time to recover the remnant of his people which shall be left, from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Assyria</span>, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Shinar</span>, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345298" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he shall set up an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ensign</span> for the nations, and shall assemble the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>outcasts</span> of Israel, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gather</span> together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345300" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>envy</span> of Ephraim also shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>envy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Judah</span>, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345302" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Philistines</span> towards the west; they shall spoil them of the east together; they shall lay their hand upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Edom</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Moab</span>; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345304" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And the Lord shall utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind he shall shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dry</span> shod.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345306" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And there shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>highway</span> for the remnant of his people which shall be left, from Assyria, like as it was to Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 22	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346510" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/22" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 22</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346511" id="title_number1">Chapter 22</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346512" id="study_summary1">In the millennial day all men will praise the Lord—He will dwell among them—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/12">Isaiah 12</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346513" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> in that day thou shalt say: O Lord, I will praise thee; though thou wast angry with me thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346514" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, God is my salvation; I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trust</span>, and not be afraid; for the Lord <span class="deity-name"><span class="small-caps"><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jehovah</span></span></span> is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>strength</span> and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>song</span>; he also has become my salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346515" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore, with joy shall ye draw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>water</span> out of the wells of salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346516" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And in that day shall ye say: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Praise</span> the Lord, call upon his name, declare his doings among the people, make mention that his name is exalted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346517" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Sing</span> unto the Lord; for he hath done excellent things; this is known in all the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346518" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cry</span> out and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion; for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 23	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346528" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/23" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 23</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346529" id="title_number1">Chapter 23</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346530" id="study_summary1">The destruction of Babylon is a type of the destruction at the Second Coming—It will be a day of wrath and vengeance<span class="page-break" data-page="94"></span>—Babylon (the world) will fall forever—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/13">Isaiah 13</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346531" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>The burden</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Babylon</span>, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346532" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shake the hand</span>, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346533" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mighty</span> ones, for mine anger is not upon them that rejoice in my highness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346534" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>The noise of the multitude in the mountains like as of a great people, a tumultuous noise of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kingdoms</span> of nations <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gathered</span> together, the Lord of Hosts mustereth the hosts of the battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346535" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, yea, the Lord, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346536" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Howl ye, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346537" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore shall all hands be faint, every man’s heart shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>melt</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346538" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And they shall be afraid; pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346539" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the sinners thereof out of it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346540" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stars</span> of heaven and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>constellations</span> thereof shall not give their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>light</span>; the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sun</span> shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346541" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>punish</span> the world for evil, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wicked</span> for their iniquity; I will cause the arrogancy of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>proud</span> to cease, and will lay down the haughtiness of the terrible.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346542" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>I will make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span> more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346543" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shake</span> the heavens, and the earth shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remove</span> out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346544" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up; and they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346545" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Every one that is proud shall be thrust through; yea, and every one that is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joined</span> to the wicked shall fall by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346546" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> also shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dashed</span> to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled and their wives ravished.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346547" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Behold, I will stir up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Medes</span> against them, which shall not regard silver and gold, nor shall they delight in it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346548" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Their bows shall also dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pity</span> on the fruit of the womb; their eyes shall not spare children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346549" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Babylon</span>, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees’ excellency, shall be as when God overthrew <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Sodom</span> and Gomorrah.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="95"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346550" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>It shall never be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inhabited</span>, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346551" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wild</span> beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346552" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces; and her time is near to come, and her day shall not be prolonged. For I will destroy her speedily; yea, for I will be merciful unto my people, but the wicked shall perish.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 24	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346582" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/24" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 24</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346583" id="title_number1">Chapter 24</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346584" id="study_summary1">Israel will be gathered and will enjoy millennial rest—Lucifer was cast out of heaven for rebellion—Israel will triumph over Babylon (the world)—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/14">Isaiah 14</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346585" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>For</span> the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>choose</span> Israel, and set them in their own land; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>strangers</span> shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346586" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the people shall take them and bring them to their place; yea, from far unto the ends of the earth; and they shall return to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lands of promise</span>. And the house of Israel shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>possess</span> them, and the land of the Lord shall be for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>servants</span> and handmaids; and they shall take them captives unto whom they were captives; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rule</span> over their oppressors.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346587" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall give thee <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span>, from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346588" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it shall come to pass in that day, that thou shalt take up this proverb <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> the king of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Babylon</span>, and say: How hath the oppressor ceased, the golden city ceased!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346589" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>The Lord hath broken the staff of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wicked</span>, the scepters of the rulers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346590" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>He</span> who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346591" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>The whole earth is at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span>, and is quiet; they break forth into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>singing</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346592" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and also the cedars of Lebanon, saying: Since thou art laid down no feller is come up against us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346593" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Hell</span> from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; it stirreth up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span> for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346594" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>All they shall speak and say unto thee: Art thou also become weak as we? Art thou become like unto us?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346595" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Thy pomp is brought down to the grave; the noise of thy viols is not heard; the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346596" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>How</span> art thou fallen from heaven, O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lucifer</span>, son of the morning! Art thou cut down to the ground, which did weaken the nations!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346597" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For thou hast said in thy heart: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> will ascend into heaven, I will <span class="page-break" data-page="96"></span>exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346598" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346599" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pit</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346600" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and shall consider thee, and shall say: Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346601" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof, and opened not the house of his prisoners?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346602" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>All the kings of the nations, yea, all of them, lie in glory, every one of them in his own house.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346603" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and the remnant of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcass trodden under feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346604" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land and slain thy people; the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil-doers</span> shall never be renowned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346605" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Prepare slaughter for his children for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquities</span> of their fathers, that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346606" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For I will rise up against them, saith the Lord of Hosts, and cut off from Babylon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span>, and remnant, and son, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nephew</span>, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346607" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>I will also make it a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>possession</span> for the bittern, and pools of water; and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346608" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>The Lord of Hosts hath sworn, saying: Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346609" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>That I will bring the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot; then shall his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>yoke</span> depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346610" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth; and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346611" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>For the Lord of Hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul? And his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346612" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>In the year that king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ahaz</span> died was this burden.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346613" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smote</span> thee is broken; for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fiery flying serpent</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346614" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety; and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346615" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved; for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346616" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>What shall then answer the messengers of the nations? That the Lord hath founded <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zion</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>poor</span> of his people shall trust in it.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 25	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346643" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/25" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 25</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346652" id="title_number1">Chapter 25</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346653" id="study_summary1">Nephi glories in plainness—Isaiah’s prophecies will be understood in the last days—The Jews will return from Babylon, crucify the Messiah, and be scattered and scourged—They will be restored when they believe in the <span class="page-break" data-page="97"></span>Messiah—He will first come six hundred years after Lehi left Jerusalem—The Nephites keep the law of Moses and believe in Christ, who is the Holy One of Israel. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346654" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now I, Nephi, do speak somewhat concerning the words which I have written, which have been spoken by the mouth of Isaiah. For behold, Isaiah spake many things which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hard</span> for many of my people to understand; for they know not concerning the manner of prophesying among the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346655" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For I, Nephi, have not taught them many things concerning the manner of the Jews; for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span> were works of darkness, and their doings were doings of abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346656" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, I write unto my people, unto all those that shall receive hereafter these things which I write, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>that</span> they may know the judgments of God, that they come upon all nations, according to the word which he hath spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346657" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, hearken, O my people, which are of the house of Israel, and give ear unto my words; for because the words of Isaiah are not plain unto you, nevertheless they are plain unto all those that are filled with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spirit</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophecy</span>. But I give unto you a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophecy</span>, according to the spirit which is in me; wherefore I shall prophesy according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>plainness</span> which hath been with me from the time that I came out from Jerusalem with my father; for behold, my soul delighteth in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>plainness</span> unto my people, that they may learn.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346658" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and my soul delighteth in the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Isaiah</span>, for I came out from Jerusalem, and mine eyes hath beheld the things of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span>, and I know that the Jews do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>understand</span> the things of the prophets, and there is none other people that understand the things which were spoken unto the Jews like unto them, save it be that they are taught after the manner of the things of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346659" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But behold, I, Nephi, have not taught my children after the manner of the Jews; but behold, I, of myself, have dwelt at Jerusalem, wherefore I know concerning the regions round about; and I have made mention unto my children concerning the judgments of God, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hath</span> come to pass among the Jews, unto my children, according to all that which Isaiah hath spoken, and I do not write them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346660" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But behold, I proceed with mine own prophecy, according to my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plainness</span>; in the which I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> that no man can err; nevertheless, in the days that the prophecies of Isaiah shall be fulfilled men shall know of a surety, at the times when they shall come to pass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346661" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, they are of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worth</span> unto the children of men, and he that supposeth that they are not, unto them will I speak particularly, and confine the words unto mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>own</span> people; for I know that they shall be of great worth unto them in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>last days</span>; for in that day shall they understand them; wherefore, for their good have I written them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346662" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And as one generation hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span> among the Jews because of iniquity, even so have they been destroyed from generation to <span class="page-break" data-page="98"></span>generation according to their iniquities; and never hath any of them been destroyed save it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foretold</span> them by the prophets of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346663" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, it hath been told them concerning the destruction which should come upon them, immediately after my father left <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span>; nevertheless, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hardened</span> their hearts; and according to my prophecy they have been destroyed, save it be those which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>carried away</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>captive</span> into Babylon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346664" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now this I speak because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spirit</span> which is in me. And notwithstanding they have been carried away they shall return again, and possess the land of Jerusalem; wherefore, they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restored</span> again to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land</span> of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346665" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But, behold, they shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span>, and rumors of wars; and when the day cometh that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Only Begotten</span> of the Father, yea, even the Father of heaven and of earth, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>manifest</span> himself unto them in the flesh, behold, they will reject him, because of their iniquities, and the hardness of their hearts, and the stiffness of their necks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346666" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>crucify</span> him; and after he is laid in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sepulchre</span> for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>three</span> days he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rise</span> from the dead, with healing in his wings; and all those who shall believe on his name shall be saved in the kingdom of God. Wherefore, my soul delighteth to prophesy concerning him, for I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>seen</span> his day, and my heart doth magnify his holy name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346667" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold it shall come to pass that after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Messiah</span> hath risen from the dead, and hath manifested himself unto his people, unto as many as will believe on his name, behold, Jerusalem shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyed</span> again; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wo</span> unto them that fight against God and the people of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>church</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346668" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Wherefore, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> among all nations; yea, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Babylon</span> shall be destroyed; wherefore, the Jews shall be scattered by other nations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346669" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after they have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scattered</span>, and the Lord God hath scourged them by other nations for the space of many generations, yea, even down from generation to generation until they shall be persuaded to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> in Christ, the Son of God, and the atonement, which is infinite for all mankind—and when that day shall come that they shall believe in Christ, and worship the Father in his name, with pure hearts and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>clean hands</span>, and look not forward any more for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>another</span> Messiah, then, at that time, the day will come that it must needs be expedient that they should believe these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346670" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the Lord will set his hand <span class="page-break" data-page="99"></span>again the second time to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restore</span> his people from their lost and fallen state. Wherefore, he will proceed to do a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>marvelous work</span> and a wonder among the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346671" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, he shall bring forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>his</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> unto them, which words shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judge</span> them at the last day, for they shall be given them for the purpose of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>convincing</span> them of the true Messiah, who was rejected by them; and unto the convincing of them that they need not look forward any more for a Messiah to come, for there should not any come, save it should be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>false Messiah</span> which should deceive the people; for there is save one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Messiah</span> spoken of by the prophets, and that Messiah is he who should be rejected of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346672" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For according to the words of the prophets, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Messiah</span> cometh in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>six hundred</span> years from the time that my father left Jerusalem; and according to the words of the prophets, and also the word of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>angel</span> of God, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>name</span> shall be Jesus Christ, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Son of God</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346673" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, my brethren, I have spoken plainly that ye cannot err. And as the Lord God liveth that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brought</span> Israel up out of the land of Egypt, and gave unto Moses power that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heal</span> the nations after they had been bitten by the poisonous serpents, if they would cast their eyes unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>serpent</span> which he did raise up before them, and also gave him power that he should smite the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rock</span> and the water should come forth; yea, behold I say unto you, that as these things are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>true</span>, and as the Lord God liveth, there is none other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>name</span> given under heaven save it be this Jesus Christ, of which I have spoken, whereby man can be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346674" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Wherefore, for this cause hath the Lord God promised unto me that these things which I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> shall be kept and preserved, and handed down unto my seed, from generation to generation, that the promise may be fulfilled unto Joseph, that his seed should never <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perish</span> as long as the earth should stand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346675" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Wherefore, these things shall go from generation to generation as long as the earth shall stand; and they shall go according to the will and pleasure of God; and the nations who shall possess them shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span> of them according to the words which are written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346676" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For we labor diligently to write, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persuade</span> our children, and also our brethren, to believe in Christ, and to be reconciled to God; for we <span class="page-break" data-page="100"></span>know that it is by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span> that we are saved, after all we can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>do</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346677" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And, notwithstanding we believe in Christ, we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>keep</span> the law of Moses, and look forward with steadfastness unto Christ, until the law shall be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346678" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For, for this end was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> given; wherefore the law hath become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span> unto us, and we are made alive in Christ because of our faith; yet we keep the law because of the commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346679" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>talk</span> of Christ, we rejoice in Christ, we preach of Christ, we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophesy</span> of Christ, and we write according to our prophecies, that our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>children</span> may know to what source they may look for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>remission</span> of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346680" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Wherefore, we speak concerning the law that our children may know the deadness of the law; and they, by knowing the deadness of the law, may look forward unto that life which is in Christ, and know for what end the law was given. And after the law is fulfilled in Christ, that they need not harden their hearts against him when the law ought to be done away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346681" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now behold, my people, ye are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people; wherefore, I have spoken plainly unto you, that ye cannot misunderstand. And the words which I have spoken shall stand as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>testimony</span> against you; for they are sufficient to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>teach</span> any man the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>right</span> way; for the right way is to believe in Christ and deny him not; for by denying him ye also deny the prophets and the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346682" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now behold, I say unto you that the right way is to believe in Christ, and deny him not; and Christ is the Holy One of Israel; wherefore ye must bow down before him, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> him with all your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>might</span>, mind, and strength, and your whole soul; and if ye do this ye shall in nowise be cast out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346683" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And, inasmuch as it shall be expedient, ye must keep the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>performances</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordinances</span> of God until the law shall be fulfilled which was given unto Moses.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 26	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346751" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/26" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 26</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346770" id="title_number1">Chapter 26</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346771" id="study_summary1">Christ will minister to the Nephites—Nephi foresees the destruction of his people—They will speak from the dust—The Gentiles will build up false churches and secret combinations—The Lord forbids men to practice priestcrafts. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346772" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And after Christ shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>risen</span> from the dead he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>show</span> himself unto you, my children, and my beloved brethren; and the words which he shall speak unto you shall be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> which ye shall do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346773" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, I say unto you that I have beheld that many generations shall pass away, and there shall be great wars and contentions among my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346774" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And after the Messiah shall come there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>signs</span> given unto my people of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>birth</span>, and also of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span> and resurrection; and great and terrible shall that day be unto the wicked, for they shall perish; and they perish because they cast <span class="page-break" data-page="101"></span>out the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>prophets</span>, and the saints, and stone them, and slay them; wherefore the cry of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>blood</span> of the saints shall ascend up to God from the ground against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346775" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, all those who are proud, and that do wickedly, the day that cometh shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>burn</span> them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, for they shall be as stubble.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346776" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they that kill the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span>, and the saints, the depths of the earth shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>swallow</span> them up, saith the Lord of Hosts;
