and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mountains</span> shall cover them, and whirlwinds shall carry them away, and buildings shall fall upon them and crush them to pieces and grind them to powder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346777" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they shall be visited with thunderings, and lightnings, and earthquakes, and all manner of destructions, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fire</span> of the anger of the Lord shall be kindled against them, and they shall be as stubble, and the day that cometh shall consume them, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346778" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>O</span> the pain, and the anguish of my soul for the loss of the slain of my people! For I, Nephi, have seen it, and it well nigh consumeth me before the presence of the Lord; but I must cry unto my God: Thy ways are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>just</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346779" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But behold, the righteous that hearken unto the words of the prophets, and destroy them not, but look forward unto Christ with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steadfastness</span> for the signs which are given, notwithstanding all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>persecution</span>—behold, they are they which shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not perish</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346780" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But the Son of Righteousness shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appear</span> unto them; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heal</span> them, and they shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>peace</span> with him, until <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>three</span> generations shall have passed away, and many of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fourth</span> generation shall have passed away in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346781" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And when these things have passed away a speedy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> cometh unto my people; for, notwithstanding the pains of my soul, I have seen it; wherefore, I know that it shall come to pass; and they sell themselves for naught; for, for the reward of their pride and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foolishness</span> they shall reap destruction; for because they yield unto the devil and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>choose</span> works of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>darkness</span> rather than light, therefore they must go down to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>hell</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346782" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For the Spirit of the Lord will not always <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strive</span> with man. And when the Spirit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ceaseth</span> to strive with man then cometh speedy destruction, and this grieveth my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346783" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And as I spake concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>convincing</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span>, that Jesus is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>very Christ</span>, it must needs be that the Gentiles be convinced also that Jesus is the Christ, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Eternal</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>God</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346784" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manifesteth</span> himself unto all those who believe in <span class="page-break" data-page="102"></span>him, by the power of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>; yea, unto every nation, kindred, tongue, and people, working mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>miracles</span>, signs, and wonders, among the children of men according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>faith</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346785" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But behold, I prophesy unto you concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>last days</span>; concerning the days when the Lord God shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bring</span> these things forth unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346786" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>After my seed and the seed of my brethren shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwindled</span> in unbelief, and shall have been smitten by the Gentiles; yea, after the Lord God shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>camped</span> against them round about, and shall have laid siege against them with a mount, and raised forts against them; and after they shall have been brought down low in the dust, even that they are not, yet the words of the righteous shall be written, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prayers</span> of the faithful shall be heard, and all those who have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>dwindled</span> in unbelief shall not be forgotten.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346787" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For those who shall be destroyed shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>speak</span> unto them out of the ground, and their speech shall be low out of the dust, and their voice shall be as one that hath a familiar spirit; for the Lord God will give unto him power, that he may whisper concerning them, even as it were out of the ground; and their speech shall whisper out of the dust.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346788" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For thus saith the Lord God: They shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> the things which shall be done among them, and they shall be written and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sealed</span> up in a book, and those who have dwindled in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unbelief</span> shall not have them, for they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>seek</span> to destroy the things of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346789" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, as those who have been destroyed have been destroyed speedily; and the multitude of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>terrible ones</span> shall be as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chaff</span> that passeth away—yea, thus saith the Lord God: It shall be at an instant, suddenly—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346790" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it shall come to pass, that those who have dwindled in unbelief shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smitten</span> by the hand of the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346791" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the Gentiles are lifted up in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span> of their eyes, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stumbled</span>, because of the greatness of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stumbling block</span>, that they have built up many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>churches</span>; nevertheless, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>put down</span> the power and miracles of God, and preach up unto themselves their own wisdom and their own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>learning</span>, that they may get gain and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>grind</span> upon the face of the poor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346792" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And there are many churches built up which cause <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>envyings</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strifes</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>malice</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346793" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And there are also secret <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>combinations</span>, even as in times of old, according to the combinations of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span>, for he is the founder of <span class="page-break" data-page="103"></span>all these things; yea, the founder of murder, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>works</span> of darkness; yea, and he leadeth them by the neck with a flaxen cord, until he bindeth them with his strong cords forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346794" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For behold, my beloved brethren, I say unto you that the Lord God worketh not in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346795" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>He doeth not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anything</span> save it be for the benefit of the world; for he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>loveth</span> the world, even that he layeth down his own life that he may draw <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>all</span> men unto him. Wherefore, he commandeth none that they shall not partake of his salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346796" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Behold, doth he cry unto any, saying: Depart from me? Behold, I say unto you, Nay; but he saith: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Come</span> unto me all ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ends</span> of the earth, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>buy</span> milk and honey, without money and without price.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346797" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Behold, hath he commanded any that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>depart</span> out of the synagogues, or out of the houses of worship? Behold, I say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346798" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Hath he commanded any that they should not partake of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span>? Behold I say unto you, Nay; but he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>given</span> it free for all men; and he hath commanded his people that they should persuade all men to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repentance</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346799" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Behold, hath the Lord commanded any that they should not partake of his goodness? Behold I say unto you, Nay; but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> men are privileged the one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>like</span> unto the other, and none are forbidden.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346800" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>He commandeth that there shall be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priestcrafts</span>; for, behold, priestcrafts are that men preach and set <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>themselves</span> up for a light unto the world, that they may get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gain</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>praise</span> of the world; but they seek not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>welfare</span> of Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346801" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Behold, the Lord hath forbidden this thing; wherefore, the Lord God hath given a commandment that all men should have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span>, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>charity</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>love</span>. And except they should have charity they were nothing. Wherefore, if they should have charity they would not suffer the laborer in Zion to perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346802" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>But the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laborer</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zion</span> shall labor for Zion; for if they labor for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>money</span> they shall perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346803" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And again, the Lord God hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> that men should not murder; that they should not lie; that they should not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>steal</span>; that they should not take the name of the Lord their God in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>vain</span>; that they should not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>envy</span>; that they should not have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>malice</span>; that they should not contend one with another; that they should not commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>whoredoms</span>; and that they should do none of these things; for whoso doeth them shall perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346804" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>For none of these iniquities come of the Lord; for he doeth that which is good among the children of men; and he doeth nothing save it be plain unto the children of men; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inviteth</span> them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>come</span> unto him and partake of his goodness; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>denieth</span> none that come <span class="page-break" data-page="104"></span>unto him, black and white, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>bond</span> and free, male and female; and he remembereth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>heathen</span>; and all are alike unto God, both Jew and Gentile.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 27	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345397" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/27" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 27</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345398" id="title_number1">Chapter 27</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345399" id="study_summary1">Darkness and apostasy will cover the earth in the last days—The Book of Mormon will come forth—Three witnesses will testify of the book—The learned man will say he cannot read the sealed book—The Lord will do a marvelous work and a wonder—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/29">Isaiah 29</a>. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345400" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>But, behold, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>last days</span>, or in the days of the Gentiles—yea, behold all the nations of the Gentiles and also the Jews, both those who shall come upon this land and those who shall be upon other lands, yea, even upon all the lands of the earth, behold, they will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>drunken</span> with iniquity and all manner of abominations—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345401" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And when that day shall come they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visited</span> of the Lord of Hosts, with thunder and with earthquake, and with a great noise, and with storm, and with tempest, and with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flame</span> of devouring fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345402" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nations</span> that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fight</span> against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345403" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, all ye that doeth iniquity, stay yourselves and wonder, for ye shall cry out, and cry; yea, ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drunken</span> but not with wine, ye shall stagger but not with strong drink.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345404" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, the Lord hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep. For behold, ye have closed your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eyes</span>, and ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rejected</span> the prophets; and your rulers, and the seers hath he covered because of your iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345405" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it shall come to pass that the Lord God shall bring forth unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>you</span> the words of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>book</span>, and they shall be the words of them which have slumbered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345406" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold the book shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sealed</span>; and in the book shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>revelation</span> from God, from the beginning of the world to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ending</span> thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345407" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, because of the things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sealed</span> up, the things which are sealed shall not be delivered in the day of the wickedness and abominations of the people. Wherefore the book shall be kept from them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345408" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But the book shall be delivered unto a man, and he shall deliver the words of the book, which are the words of those who have slumbered in the dust, and he shall deliver these words unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>another</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345409" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But the words which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sealed</span> he shall not deliver, neither shall he deliver the book. For the book shall <span class="page-break" data-page="105"></span>be sealed by the power of God, and the revelation which was sealed shall be kept in the book until the own due time of the Lord, that they may come forth; for behold, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>reveal</span> all things from the foundation of the world unto the end thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345410" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the day cometh that the words of the book which were sealed shall be read upon the house tops; and they shall be read by the power of Christ; and all things shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revealed</span> unto the children of men which ever have been among the children of men, and which ever will be even unto the end of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345411" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, at that day when the book shall be delivered unto the man of whom I have spoken, the book shall be hid from the eyes of the world, that the eyes of none shall behold it save it be that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>witnesses</span> shall behold it, by the power of God, besides him to whom the book shall be delivered; and they shall testify to the truth of the book and the things therein.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345412" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> other which shall view it, save it be a few according to the will of God, to bear testimony of his word unto the children of men; for the Lord God hath said that the words of the faithful should speak as if it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from the dead</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345413" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Wherefore, the Lord God will proceed to bring forth the words of the book; and in the mouth of as many witnesses as seemeth him good will he establish his word; and wo be unto him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejecteth</span> the word of God!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345414" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But behold, it shall come to pass that the Lord God shall say unto him to whom he shall deliver the book: Take these words which are not sealed and deliver them to another, that he may show them unto the learned, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Read</span> this, I pray thee. And the learned shall say: Bring hither the book, and I will read them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345415" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, because of the glory of the world and to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gain</span> will they say this, and not for the glory of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345416" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the man shall say: I cannot bring the book, for it is sealed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345417" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Then shall the learned say: I cannot read it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346856" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore it shall come to pass, that the Lord God will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> again the book and the words thereof to him that is not learned; and the man that is not learned shall say: I am not learned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346857" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Then shall the Lord God say unto him: The learned shall not read them, for they have rejected them, and I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>able</span> to do mine own work; wherefore thou shalt read the words which I shall give unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346858" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Touch not</span> the things which are sealed, for I will bring them forth in mine own due time; for I will show unto the children of men that I am able to do mine own work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346859" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Wherefore, when thou hast read the words which I have commanded thee, and obtained the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span> which I have promised unto thee, then shalt thou seal up the book again, and hide it up unto me, that I may preserve the words which thou hast not read, until I shall see fit in mine own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wisdom</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reveal</span> all things unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346860" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For behold, I am God; and I am a God of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span>; and I will show <span class="page-break" data-page="106"></span>unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>world</span> that I am the same yesterday, today, and forever; and I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>work</span> not among the children of men save it be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>according</span> to their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346861" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And again it shall come to pass that the Lord shall say unto him that shall read the words that shall be delivered him:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346862" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Forasmuch</span> as this people draw near unto me with their mouth, and with their lips do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>honor</span> me, but have removed their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearts</span> far from me, and their fear towards me is taught by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>precepts</span> of men—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346863" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Therefore, I will proceed to do a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>marvelous work</span> among this people, yea, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>marvelous work</span> and a wonder, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wisdom</span> of their wise and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>learned</span> shall perish, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>understanding</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>prudent</span> shall be hid.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346864" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> unto them that seek deep to hide their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>counsel</span> from the Lord! And their works are in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>dark</span>; and they say: Who seeth us, and who knoweth us? And they also say: Surely, your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>potter’s</span> clay. But behold, I will show unto them, saith the Lord of Hosts, that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>know</span> all their works. For shall the work say of him that made it, he made me not? Or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, he had no understanding?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346865" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>But behold, saith the Lord of Hosts: I will show unto the children of men that it is yet a very little while and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruitful</span> field shall be esteemed as a forest.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346866" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> in that day shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deaf</span> hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346867" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meek</span> also shall increase, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>joy</span> shall be in the Lord, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346868" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>For assuredly as the Lord liveth they shall see that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>terrible one</span> is brought to naught, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346869" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And they that make a man an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>offender</span> for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gate</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>turn</span> aside the just for a thing of naught.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346870" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Therefore, thus saith the Lord, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: Jacob shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not now</span> be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346871" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>But when he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seeth</span> his children, the work of my hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346872" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>They also that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>erred</span> in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>learn</span> doctrine.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 28	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345469" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/28" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 28</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345470" id="title_number1">Chapter 28</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345471" id="study_summary1">Many false churches will be built up in the last days—They will teach false, vain, and foolish doctrines—Apostasy will abound because of false teachers—The devil will rage in the hearts of men—He will teach all manner of false doctrines. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345472" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, behold, my brethren, I have spoken unto you, according <span class="page-break" data-page="107"></span>as the Spirit hath constrained me; wherefore, I know that they must surely come to pass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345473" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the things which shall be written out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> shall be of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worth</span> unto the children of men, and especially unto our seed, which is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remnant</span> of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345474" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For it shall come to pass in that day that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>churches</span> which are built up, and not unto the Lord, when the one shall say unto the other: Behold, I, I am the Lord’s; and the others shall say: I, I am the Lord’s; and thus shall every one say that hath built up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>churches</span>, and not unto the Lord—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345475" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they shall contend one with another; and their priests shall contend one with another, and they shall teach with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>learning</span>, and deny the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>, which giveth utterance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345476" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> of God, the Holy One of Israel; and they say unto the people: Hearken unto us, and hear ye our precept; for behold there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>no</span> God today, for the Lord and the Redeemer hath done his work, and he hath given his power unto men;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345477" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, hearken ye unto my precept; if they shall say there is a miracle wrought by the hand of the Lord, believe it not; for this day he is not a God of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span>; he hath done his work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345478" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Yea, and there shall be many which shall say: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Eat</span>, drink, and be merry, for tomorrow we die; and it shall be well with us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345479" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And there shall also be many which shall say: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Eat</span>, drink, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>merry</span>; nevertheless, fear God—he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>justify</span> in committing a little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sin</span>; yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>lie</span> a little, take the advantage of one because of his words, dig a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>pit</span> for thy neighbor; there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>no</span> harm in this; and do all these things, for tomorrow we die; and if it so be that we are guilty, God will beat us with a few stripes, and at last we shall be saved in the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345480" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, and there shall be many which shall teach after this manner, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false</span> and vain and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foolish</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>doctrines</span>, and shall be puffed up in their hearts, and shall seek deep to hide their counsels from the Lord; and their works shall be in the dark.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345481" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> of the saints shall cry from the ground against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345482" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, they have all gone out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>way</span>; they have become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>corrupted</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345483" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span>, and because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>false</span> teachers, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>false doctrine</span>, their churches have become corrupted, and their churches are lifted up; because of pride they are puffed up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345484" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>They <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rob</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>poor</span> because of their fine sanctuaries; they rob the poor because of their fine clothing; <span class="page-break" data-page="108"></span>and they persecute the meek and the poor in heart, because in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pride</span> they are puffed up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345485" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>They wear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiff</span> necks and high heads; yea, and because of pride, and wickedness, and abominations, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whoredoms</span>, they have all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gone astray</span> save it be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>few</span>, who are the humble followers of Christ; nevertheless, they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>led</span>, that in many instances they do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>err</span> because they are taught by the precepts of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345486" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>O the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span>, and the learned, and the rich, that are puffed up in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pride</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearts</span>, and all those who preach <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>false doctrines</span>, and all those who commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>whoredoms</span>, and pervert the right way of the Lord, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>wo</span>, wo, wo be unto them, saith the Lord God Almighty, for they shall be thrust down to hell!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345487" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wo unto them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>turn</span> aside the just for a thing of naught and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>revile</span> against that which is good, and say that it is of no worth! For the day shall come that the Lord God will speedily visit the inhabitants of the earth; and in that day that they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fully</span> ripe in iniquity they shall perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345488" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But behold, if the inhabitants of the earth shall repent of their wickedness and abominations they shall not be destroyed, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345489" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But behold, that great and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominable</span> church, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whore</span> of all the earth, must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tumble</span> to the earth, and great must be the fall thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345490" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For the kingdom of the devil must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shake</span>, and they which belong to it must needs be stirred up unto repentance, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span> will grasp them with his everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chains</span>, and they be stirred up to anger, and perish;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345491" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>For behold, at that day shall he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rage</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearts</span> of the children of men, and stir them up to anger against that which is good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345492" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And others will he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pacify</span>, and lull them away into carnal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>security</span>, that they will say: All is well in Zion; yea, Zion prospereth, all is well—and thus the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cheateth</span> their souls, and leadeth them away carefully down to hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345493" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And behold, others he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flattereth</span> away, and telleth them there is no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span>; and he saith unto them: I am no devil, for there is none—and thus he whispereth in their ears, until he grasps them with his awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chains</span>, from whence there is no deliverance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345494" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Yea, they are grasped with death, and hell; and death, and hell, and the devil, and all that have been seized therewith must stand before the throne of God, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span> according to their works, from whence they must go into the place prepared for them, even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lake</span> of fire and brimstone, which is endless torment.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345495" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, wo be unto him that is at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ease</span> in Zion!</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="109"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345496" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wo be unto him that crieth: All is well!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345497" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Yea, wo be unto him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearkeneth</span> unto the precepts of men, and denieth the power of God, and the gift of the Holy Ghost!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345498" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, wo be unto him that saith: We have received, and we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>need</span> no more!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345499" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And in fine, wo unto all those who tremble, and are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>the truth</span> of God! For behold, he that is built upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rock</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>receiveth</span> it with gladness; and he that is built upon a sandy foundation trembleth lest he shall fall.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345500" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Wo be unto him that shall say: We have received the word of God, and we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>need</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no more</span> of the word of God, for we have enough!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345501" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For behold, thus saith the Lord God: I will give unto the children of men line upon line, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>precept</span> upon precept, here a little and there a little; and blessed are those who hearken unto my precepts, and lend an ear unto my counsel, for they shall learn <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wisdom</span>; for unto him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>receiveth</span> I will give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>more</span>; and from them that shall say, We have enough, from them shall be taken away even that which they have.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345502" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Cursed is he that putteth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trust</span> in man, or maketh flesh his arm, or shall hearken unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>precepts</span> of men, save their precepts shall be given by the power of the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345503" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Wo</span> be unto the Gentiles, saith the Lord God of Hosts! For notwithstanding I shall lengthen out mine arm unto them from day to day, they will deny me; nevertheless, I will be merciful unto them, saith the Lord God, if they will repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto me; for mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>arm</span> is lengthened out all the day long, saith the Lord God of Hosts.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 29	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128346937" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/29" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 29</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128346938" id="title_number1">Chapter 29</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128346939" id="study_summary1">Many Gentiles will reject the Book of Mormon—They will say, We need no more Bible—The Lord speaks to many nations—He will judge the world out of the books which will be written. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346940" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>But behold, there shall be many—at that day when I shall proceed to do a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>marvelous work</span> among them, that I may remember my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenants</span> which I have made unto the children of men, that I may set my hand again the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>second</span> time to recover my people, which are of the house of Israel;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346941" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And also, that I may remember the promises which I have made unto thee, Nephi, and also unto thy father, that I would remember your seed; and that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of your seed should proceed forth out of my mouth unto your seed; and my words shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hiss</span> forth unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ends</span> of the earth, for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>standard</span> unto my people, which are of the house of Israel;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346942" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And because my words shall hiss forth—many of the Gentiles shall say: A <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bible</span>! A Bible! We have <span class="page-break" data-page="110"></span>got a Bible, and there cannot be any more Bible.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346943" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But thus saith the Lord God: O fools, they shall have a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bible</span>; and it shall proceed forth from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span>, mine ancient covenant people. And what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thank</span> they the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Jews</span> for the Bible which they receive from them? Yea, what do the Gentiles mean? Do they remember the travails, and the labors, and the pains of the Jews, and their diligence unto me, in bringing forth salvation unto the Gentiles?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346944" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>O ye Gentiles, have ye remembered the Jews, mine ancient covenant people? Nay; but ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> them, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hated</span> them, and have not sought to recover them. But behold, I will return all these things upon your own heads; for I the Lord have not forgotten my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346945" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Thou fool, that shall say: A <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bible</span>, we have got a Bible, and we need no more Bible. Have ye obtained a Bible save it were by the Jews?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346946" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Know ye not that there are more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nations</span> than one? Know ye not that I, the Lord your God, have created all men, and that I remember those who are upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>isles</span> of the sea; and that I rule in the heavens above and in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>earth</span> beneath; and I bring forth my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>word</span> unto the children of men, yea, even upon all the nations of the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346947" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore murmur ye, because that ye shall receive more of my word? Know ye not that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testimony</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>two</span> nations is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>witness</span> unto you that I am God, that I remember one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>nation</span> like unto another? Wherefore, I speak the same words unto one nation like unto another. And when the two <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>nations</span> shall run together the testimony of the two nations shall run together also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346948" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And I do this that I may prove unto many that I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>same</span> yesterday, today, and forever; and that I speak forth my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> according to mine own pleasure. And because that I have spoken one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>word</span> ye need not suppose that I cannot speak another; for my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>work</span> is not yet finished; neither shall it be until the end of man, neither from that time henceforth and forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346949" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, because that ye have a Bible ye need not suppose that it contains all my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span>; neither <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>need</span> ye suppose that I have not caused more to be written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346950" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For I command <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> men, both in the east and in the west, and in the north, and in the south, and in the islands of the sea, that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> the words which I speak unto them; for out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>books</span> which shall be written I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>judge</span> the world, every man according to their works, according to that which is written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346951" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For behold, I shall speak unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> it; and I shall also speak unto the <span class="page-break" data-page="111"></span>Nephites and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>write</span> it; and I shall also speak unto the other tribes of the house of Israel, which I have led away, and they shall write it; and I shall also speak unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>all</span> nations of the earth and they shall write it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346952" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it shall come to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> shall have the words of the Nephites, and the Nephites shall have the words of the Jews; and the Nephites and the Jews shall have the words of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lost tribes</span> of Israel; and the lost tribes of Israel shall have the words of the Nephites and the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128346953" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it shall come to pass that my people, which are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>house of Israel</span>, shall be gathered home unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lands</span> of their possessions; and my word also shall be gathered in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>one</span>. And I will show unto them that fight against my word and against my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>people</span>, who are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>house of Israel</span>, that I am God, and that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>covenanted</span> with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>Abraham</span> that I would remember his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>seed</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>forever</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 30	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347003" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/30" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 30</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347006" id="title_number1">Chapter 30</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347007" id="study_summary1">Converted Gentiles will be numbered with the covenant people—Many Lamanites and Jews will believe the word and become delightsome—Israel will be restored and the wicked destroyed. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347008" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now behold, my beloved brethren, I would speak unto you; for I, Nephi, would not suffer that ye should suppose that ye are more righteous than the Gentiles shall be. For behold, except ye shall keep the commandments of God ye shall all likewise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perish</span>; and because of the words which have been spoken ye need not suppose that the Gentiles are utterly destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347009" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, I say unto you that as many of the Gentiles as will repent are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> people of the Lord; and as many of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span> as will not repent shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cast off</span>; for the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>covenanteth</span> with none save it be with them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>repent</span> and believe in his Son, who is the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347010" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, I would prophesy somewhat more concerning the Jews and the Gentiles. For after the book of which I have spoken shall come forth, and be written unto the Gentiles, and sealed up again unto the Lord, there shall be many which shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> the words which are written; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>they</span> shall carry them forth unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remnant</span> of our seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347011" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And then shall the remnant of our seed know concerning us, how that we came out from Jerusalem, and that they are descendants of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347012" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the gospel of Jesus Christ shall be declared among <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>them</span>; wherefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>they</span> shall be restored unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> of their fathers, and also to the knowledge of Jesus Christ, which was had among their fathers.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="112"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347013" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And then shall they rejoice; for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> that it is a blessing unto them from the hand of God; and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scales</span> of darkness shall begin to fall from their eyes; and many generations shall not pass away among them, save they shall be a pure and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>delightsome</span> people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347014" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it shall come to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span> which are scattered also shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>begin</span> to believe in Christ; and they shall begin to gather in upon the face of the land; and as many as shall believe in Christ shall also become a delightsome people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347015" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it shall come to pass that the Lord God shall commence his work among all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people, to bring about the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restoration</span> of his people upon the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347016" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And with righteousness shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord God</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span> the poor, and reprove with equity for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>meek</span> of the earth. And he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth; and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347017" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> speedily cometh that the Lord God shall cause a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>division</span> among the people, and the wicked will he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroy</span>; and he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>spare</span> his people, yea, even if it so be that he must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>destroy</span> the wicked by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347018" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347019" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> then shall the wolf dwell with the lamb; and the leopard shall lie down with the kid, and the calf, and the young lion, and the fatling, together; and a little child shall lead them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347020" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together; and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347021" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice’s den.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347022" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mountain</span>; for the earth shall be full of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347024" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wherefore, the things of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> nations shall be made known; yea, all things shall be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>known</span> unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347026" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>There is nothing which is secret save it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revealed</span>; there is no work of darkness save it shall be made manifest in the light; and there is nothing which is sealed upon the earth save it shall be loosed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347028" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, all things which have been revealed unto the children of men shall at that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> be revealed; and Satan shall have power over the hearts of the children of men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no more</span>, for a long time. And now, my beloved brethren, I make an end of my sayings.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 31	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347005" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/31" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 31</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347029" id="title_number1">Chapter 31</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347033" id="study_summary1">Nephi tells why Christ was baptized—Men must follow Christ, be baptized, receive the Holy Ghost, and endure to the end to be saved—Repentance and <span class="page-break" data-page="113"></span>baptism are the gate to the strait and narrow path—Eternal life comes to those who keep the commandments after baptism. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347036" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Nephi, make an end of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesying</span> unto you, my beloved brethren. And I cannot write but a few things, which I know must surely come to pass; neither can I write but a few of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> of my brother Jacob.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347040" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Wherefore, the things which I have written sufficeth me, save it be a few words which I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>must</span> speak concerning the doctrine of Christ; wherefore, I shall speak unto you plainly, according to the plainness of my prophesying.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347044" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For my soul delighteth in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plainness</span>; for after this manner doth the Lord God work among the children of men. For the Lord God giveth light unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understanding</span>; for he speaketh unto men according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>language</span>, unto their understanding.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347047" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, I would that ye should remember that I have spoken unto you concerning that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophet</span> which the Lord showed unto me, that should baptize the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamb</span> of God, which should take away the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347051" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, if the Lamb of God, he being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy</span>, should have need to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> by water, to fulfil all righteousness, O then, how much more need have we, being unholy, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>baptized</span>, yea, even by water!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347055" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, I would ask of you, my beloved brethren, wherein the Lamb of God did fulfil all righteousness in being baptized by water?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347058" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Know ye not that he was holy? But notwithstanding he being holy, he showeth unto the children of men that, according to the flesh he humbleth himself before the Father, and witnesseth unto the Father that he would be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>obedient</span> unto him in keeping his commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347062" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, after he was baptized with water the Holy Ghost descended upon him in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>form</span> of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dove</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347066" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And again, it showeth unto the children of men the straitness of the path, and the narrowness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gate</span>, by which they should enter, he having set the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>example</span> before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347070" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he said unto the children of men: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Follow</span> thou me. Wherefore, my beloved brethren, can we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>follow</span> Jesus save we shall be willing to keep the commandments of the Father?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347073" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Father said: Repent ye, repent ye, and be baptized in the name of my Beloved Son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347077" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And also, the voice of the Son came unto me, saying: He that is baptized in my name, to him will the Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>give</span> the Holy Ghost, like unto me; wherefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>follow</span> me, and do the things which ye have seen me do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347081" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, I know that if ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>follow</span> the Son, with full purpose of heart, acting no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hypocrisy</span> and no deception before God, but with real <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>intent</span>, repenting of your sins, witnessing unto the Father that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>willing</span> to take upon you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>name</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="114"></span>of Christ, by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>baptism</span>—yea, by following your Lord and your Savior down into the water, according to his word, behold, then shall ye receive the Holy Ghost;
