yea, then cometh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>baptism of fire</span> and of the Holy Ghost; and then can ye speak with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>tongue</span> of angels, and shout praises unto the Holy One of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347085" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But, behold, my beloved brethren, thus came the voice of the Son unto me, saying: After ye have repented of your sins, and witnessed unto the Father that ye are willing to keep my commandments, by the baptism of water, and have received the baptism of fire and of the Holy Ghost, and can speak with a new tongue, yea, even with the tongue of angels, and after this should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> me, it would have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>better</span> for you that ye had not known me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347088" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I heard a voice from the Father, saying: Yea, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of my Beloved are true and faithful. He that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>endureth</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>end</span>, the same shall be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347092" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, I know by this that unless a man shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>endure</span> to the end, in following the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>example</span> of the Son of the living God, he cannot be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347095" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Wherefore, do the things which I have told you I have seen that your Lord and your Redeemer should do; for, for this cause have they been shown unto me, that ye might know the gate by which ye should enter. For the gate by which ye should enter is repentance and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptism</span> by water; and then cometh a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of your sins by fire and by the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347100" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And then are ye in this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strait</span> and narrow <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>path</span> which leads to eternal life; yea, ye have entered in by the gate; ye have done according to the commandments of the Father and the Son; and ye have received the Holy Ghost, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>witnesses</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Father</span> and the Son, unto the fulfilling of the promise which he hath made, that if ye entered in by the way ye should receive.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347103" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, after ye have gotten into this strait and narrow <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>path</span>, I would ask if all is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>done</span>? Behold, I say unto you, Nay; for ye have not come thus far save it were by the word of Christ with unshaken <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>faith</span> in him, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>relying</span> wholly upon the merits of him who is mighty to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>save</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347107" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Wherefore, ye must press forward with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steadfastness</span> in Christ, having a perfect brightness of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span>, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>love</span> of God and of all men. Wherefore, if ye shall press forward, feasting upon the word of Christ, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>endure</span> to the end, behold, thus saith the Father: Ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>eternal life</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347109" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now, behold, my beloved brethren, this is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>way</span>; and there <span class="page-break" data-page="115"></span>is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>none</span> other way nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>name</span> given under heaven whereby man can be saved in the kingdom of God. And now, behold, this is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>doctrine</span> of Christ, and the only and true doctrine of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Father</span>, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>one God</span>, without end. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 32	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347220" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/32" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 32</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347221" id="title_number1">Chapter 32</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347222" id="study_summary1">Angels speak by the power of the Holy Ghost—Men must pray and gain knowledge for themselves from the Holy Ghost. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347223" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, behold, my beloved brethren, I suppose that ye ponder somewhat in your hearts concerning that which ye should do after ye have entered in by the way. But, behold, why do ye ponder these things in your hearts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347224" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Do ye not remember that I said unto you that after ye had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>received</span> the Holy Ghost ye could speak with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tongue</span> of angels? And now, how could ye speak with the tongue of angels save it were by the Holy Ghost?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347225" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Angels</span> speak by the power of the Holy Ghost; wherefore, they speak the words of Christ. Wherefore, I said unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>feast</span> upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>words</span> of Christ; for behold, the words of Christ will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>tell</span> you all things what ye should do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347226" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, now after I have spoken these words, if ye cannot understand them it will be because ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ask</span> not, neither do ye knock; wherefore, ye are not brought into the light, but must perish in the dark.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347227" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, again I say unto you that if ye will enter in by the way, and receive the Holy Ghost, it will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>show</span> unto you all things what ye should do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347228" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, this is the doctrine of Christ, and there will be no more doctrine given until after he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manifest</span> himself unto you in the flesh. And when he shall manifest himself unto you in the flesh, the things which he shall say unto you shall ye observe to do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347229" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now I, Nephi, cannot say more; the Spirit stoppeth mine utterance, and I am left to mourn because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span>, and the wickedness, and the ignorance, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stiffneckedness</span> of men; for they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not</span> search <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knowledge</span>, nor understand great knowledge, when it is given unto them in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>plainness</span>, even as plain as word can be.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347230" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, I perceive that ye ponder still in your hearts; and it grieveth me that I must speak concerning this thing. For if ye would hearken unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> which teacheth a man to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span>, ye would know that ye must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pray</span>; for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>evil spirit</span> teacheth not a man to pray, but teacheth him that he must not pray.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347231" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But behold, I say unto you that ye must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> always, and not faint; that ye must not perform any thing unto the Lord save in the first place ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span> unto the Father in <span class="page-break" data-page="116"></span>the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>name</span> of Christ, that he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>consecrate</span> thy performance unto thee, that thy performance may be for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>welfare</span> of thy soul.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
2 Nephi 33	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345585" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/2-ne/33" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>2 Nephi 33</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345586" id="title_number1">Chapter 33</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345587" id="study_summary1">Nephi’s words are true—They testify of Christ—Those who believe in Christ will believe Nephi’s words, which will stand as a witness before the judgment bar. About 559–545 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345588" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Nephi, cannot write all the things which were taught among my people; neither am I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mighty</span> in writing, like unto speaking; for when a man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>speaketh</span> by the power of the Holy Ghost the power of the Holy Ghost carrieth it unto the hearts of the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345589" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But behold, there are many that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harden</span> their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearts</span> against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Holy Spirit</span>, that it hath no place in them; wherefore, they cast many things away which are written and esteem them as things of naught.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345590" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But I, Nephi, have written what I have written, and I esteem it as of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worth</span>, and especially unto my people. For I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span> continually for them by day, and mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>eyes</span> water my pillow by night, because of them; and I cry unto my God in faith, and I know that he will hear my cry.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345591" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I know that the Lord God will consecrate my prayers for the gain of my people. And the words which I have written in weakness will be made strong unto them; for it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persuadeth</span> them to do good; it maketh known unto them of their fathers; and it speaketh of Jesus, and persuadeth them to believe in him, and to endure to the end, which is life <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eternal</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345592" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it speaketh <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harshly</span> against sin, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plainness</span> of the truth; wherefore, no man will be angry at the words which I have written save he shall be of the spirit of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345593" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plainness</span>; I glory in truth; I glory in my Jesus, for he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redeemed</span> my soul from hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345594" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span> for my people, and great faith in Christ that I shall meet many souls spotless at his judgment-seat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345595" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>I have charity for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jew</span>—I say Jew, because I mean them from whence I came.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345596" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>I also have charity for the Gentiles. But behold, for none of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these</span> can I hope except they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>reconciled</span> unto Christ, and enter into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>narrow</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>gate</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>walk</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>strait</span> path which leads to life, and continue in the path until the end of the day of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>probation</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345597" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jew</span>, and all ye ends of the earth, hearken unto these words and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> in Christ; and if ye believe not in these words believe in Christ. <span class="page-break" data-page="117"></span>And if ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>believe</span> in Christ ye will believe in these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>words</span>, for they are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>words</span> of Christ, and he hath given them unto me; and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>teach</span> all men that they should do good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345598" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And if they are not the words of Christ, judge ye—for Christ will show unto you, with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>, that they are his words, at the last day; and you and I shall stand face to face before his bar; and ye shall know that I have been commanded of him to write these things, notwithstanding my weakness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345599" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I pray the Father in the name of Christ that many of us, if not all, may be saved in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kingdom</span> at that great and last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345600" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, all those who are of the house of Israel, and all ye ends of the earth, I speak unto you as the voice of one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>crying</span> from the dust: Farewell until that great day shall come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345601" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And you that will not partake of the goodness of God, and respect the words of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jews</span>, and also my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span>, and the words which shall proceed forth out of the mouth of the Lamb of God, behold, I bid you an everlasting farewell, for these words shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>condemn</span> you at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345602" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For what I seal on earth, shall be brought against you at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span> bar; for thus hath the Lord commanded me, and I must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>obey</span>. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Jacob 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357165" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/jacob/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Jacob 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128357173" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Jacob</span> <br />the Brother of Nephi</h1>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128357174" id="intro1">The words of his preaching unto his brethren. He confoundeth a man who seeketh to overthrow the doctrine of Christ. A few words concerning the history of the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357175" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357176" id="study_summary1">Jacob and Joseph seek to persuade men to believe in Christ and keep His commandments—Nephi dies—Wickedness prevails among the Nephites. About 544–421 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357177" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>For behold, it came to pass that fifty and five years had passed away from the time that Lehi left Jerusalem; wherefore, Nephi gave me, Jacob, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandment</span> concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>small</span> plates, upon which these things are engraven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357178" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he gave me, Jacob, a commandment that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>these plates</span> a few of the things which I considered to be most precious; that I should not touch, save it were lightly, concerning the history of this people which are called the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357179" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For he said that the history of his <span class="page-break" data-page="118"></span>people should be engraven upon his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other plates</span>, and that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserve</span> these plates and hand them down unto my seed, from generation to generation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357180" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And if there were preaching which was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacred</span>, or revelation which was great, or prophesying, that I should engraven the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heads</span> of them upon these plates, and touch upon them as much as it were possible, for Christ’s sake, and for the sake of our people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357181" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For because of faith and great anxiety, it truly had been made manifest unto us concerning our people, what things should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>happen</span> unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357182" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And we also had many revelations, and the spirit of much prophecy; wherefore, we knew of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Christ</span> and his kingdom, which should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357183" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Wherefore we labored diligently among our people, that we might persuade them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto Christ, and partake of the goodness of God, that they might enter into his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rest</span>, lest by any means he should swear in his wrath they should not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>enter</span> in, as in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>provocation</span> in the days of temptation while the children of Israel were in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>wilderness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357184" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, we would to God that we could persuade all men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not to rebel</span> against God, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>provoke</span> him to anger, but that all men would believe in Christ, and view his death, and suffer his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cross</span> and bear the shame of the world; wherefore, I, Jacob, take it upon me to fulfil the commandment of my brother Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357185" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now Nephi began to be old, and he saw that he must soon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>die</span>; wherefore, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anointed</span> a man to be a king and a ruler over his people now, according to the reigns of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>kings</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357186" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>The people having loved Nephi exceedingly, he having been a great protector for them, having wielded the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of Laban in their defence, and having labored in all his days for their welfare—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357187" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, the people were desirous to retain in remembrance his name. And whoso should reign in his stead were called by the people, second Nephi, third Nephi, and so forth, according to the reigns of the kings; and thus they were called by the people, let them be of whatever name they would.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357188" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi died.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357189" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now the people which were not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span> were Nephites; nevertheless, they were called Nephites, Jacobites, Josephites, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zoramites</span>, Lamanites, Lemuelites, and Ishmaelites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357190" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But I, Jacob, shall not hereafter distinguish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>them</span> by these names, but I shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> them Lamanites that seek to destroy the people of Nephi, and those who are friendly to Nephi I shall call <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Nephites</span>, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>people</span> of Nephi, according to the reigns of the kings.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="119"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357191" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now it came to pass that the people of Nephi, under the reign of the second king, began to grow hard in their hearts, and indulge themselves somewhat in wicked practices, such as like unto David of old desiring many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wives</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>concubines</span>, and also Solomon, his son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357192" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, and they also began to search much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span> and silver, and began to be lifted up somewhat in pride.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357193" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Wherefore I, Jacob, gave unto them these words as I taught them in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temple</span>, having first obtained mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>errand</span> from the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357194" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For I, Jacob, and my brother Joseph had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrated</span> priests and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teachers</span> of this people, by the hand of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357195" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And we did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>magnify</span> our office unto the Lord, taking upon us the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>responsibility</span>, answering the sins of the people upon our own heads if we did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>teach</span> them the word of God with all diligence; wherefore, by laboring with our might their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>blood</span> might not come upon our garments; otherwise their blood would come upon our garments, and we would not be found spotless at the last day.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Jacob 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356521" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/jacob/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Jacob 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356522" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356523" id="study_summary1">Jacob denounces the love of riches, pride, and unchastity—Men may seek riches to help their fellowmen—The Lord commands that no man among the Nephites may have more than one wife—The Lord delights in the chastity of women. About 544–421 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356524" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> which Jacob, the brother of Nephi, spake unto the people of Nephi, after the death of Nephi:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356525" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now, my beloved brethren, I, Jacob, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>responsibility</span> which I am under to God, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>magnify</span> mine office with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>soberness</span>, and that I might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rid</span> my garments of your sins, I come up into the temple this day that I might declare unto you the word of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356526" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And ye yourselves know that I have hitherto been diligent in the office of my calling; but I this day am weighed down with much more desire and anxiety for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>welfare</span> of your souls than I have hitherto been.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356528" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, as yet, ye have been obedient unto the word of the Lord, which I have given unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356529" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But behold, hearken ye unto me, and know that by the help of the all-powerful Creator of heaven and earth I can tell you concerning your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thoughts</span>, how that ye are beginning to labor in sin, which sin appeareth very abominable unto me, yea, and abominable unto God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356530" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, it grieveth my soul and causeth me to shrink with shame before the presence of my Maker, that I must testify unto you concerning the wickedness of your hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356531" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And also it grieveth me that I must use so much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boldness</span> of speech concerning you, before your wives and your children, many of whose feelings are exceedingly tender and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chaste</span> and delicate <span class="page-break" data-page="120"></span>before God, which thing is pleasing unto God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356532" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it supposeth me that they have come up hither to hear the pleasing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word of God</span>, yea, the word which healeth the wounded soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356533" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, it burdeneth my soul that I should be constrained, because of the strict commandment which I have received from God, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>admonish</span> you according to your crimes, to enlarge the wounds of those who are already wounded, instead of consoling and healing their wounds; and those who have not been wounded, instead of feasting upon the pleasing word of God have daggers placed to pierce their souls and wound their delicate minds.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356534" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But, notwithstanding the greatness of the task, I must do according to the strict <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commands</span> of God, and tell you concerning your wickedness and abominations, in the presence of the pure in heart, and the broken heart, and under the glance of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>piercing</span> eye of the Almighty God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356535" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, I must tell you the truth according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plainness</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>word</span> of God. For behold, as I inquired of the Lord, thus came the word unto me, saying: Jacob, get thou up into the temple on the morrow, and declare the word which I shall give thee unto this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356536" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now behold, my brethren, this is the word which I declare unto you, that many of you have begun to search for gold, and for silver, and for all manner of precious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ores</span>, in the which this land, which is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of promise</span> unto you and to your seed, doth abound most plentifully.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356537" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the hand of providence hath smiled upon you most pleasingly, that you have obtained many riches; and because some of you have obtained more abundantly than that of your brethren ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> in the pride of your hearts, and wear stiff necks and high heads because of the costliness of your apparel, and persecute your brethren because ye suppose that ye are better than they.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356538" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, my brethren, do ye suppose that God justifieth you in this thing? Behold, I say unto you, Nay. But he condemneth you, and if ye persist in these things his judgments must speedily come unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356539" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>O that he would show you that he can pierce you, and with one glance of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eye</span> he can smite you to the dust!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356540" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>O that he would rid you from this iniquity and abomination. And, O that ye would listen unto the word of his commands, and let not this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span> of your hearts destroy your souls!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356541" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Think of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brethren</span> like unto yourselves, and be familiar with all and free with your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>substance</span>, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>they</span> may be rich like unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356542" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>before</span> ye seek for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>riches</span>, seek ye for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>kingdom</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356543" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And after ye have obtained a hope in Christ ye shall obtain riches, if ye seek them; and ye will seek them for the intent to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>do</span> good—<span class="page-break" data-page="121"></span>to clothe the naked, and to feed the hungry, and to liberate the captive, and administer relief to the sick and the afflicted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356544" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, my brethren, I have spoken unto you concerning pride; and those of you which have afflicted your neighbor, and persecuted him because ye were proud in your hearts, of the things which God hath given you, what say ye of it?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356545" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Do ye not suppose that such things are abominable unto him who created all flesh? And the one being is as precious in his sight as the other. And all flesh is of the dust; and for the selfsame end hath he created them, that they should keep his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span> and glorify him forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356546" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now I make an end of speaking unto you concerning this pride. And were it not that I must speak unto you concerning a grosser crime, my heart would rejoice exceedingly because of you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356547" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But the word of God burdens me because of your grosser crimes. For behold, thus saith the Lord: This people begin to wax in iniquity; they understand not the scriptures, for they seek to excuse themselves in committing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whoredoms</span>, because of the things which were written concerning David, and Solomon his son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356548" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Behold, David and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Solomon</span> truly had many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wives</span> and concubines, which thing was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>abominable</span> before me, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356549" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wherefore, thus saith the Lord, I have led this people forth out of the land of Jerusalem, by the power of mine arm, that I might raise up unto me a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteous</span> branch from the fruit of the loins of Joseph.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356550" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Wherefore, I the Lord God will not suffer that this people shall do like unto them of old.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356552" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Wherefore, my brethren, hear me, and hearken to the word of the Lord: For there shall not any <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span> among you have save it be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wife</span>; and concubines he shall have none;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356555" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>For I, the Lord God, delight in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chastity</span> of women. And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whoredoms</span> are an abomination before me; thus saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356557" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Wherefore, this people shall keep my commandments, saith the Lord of Hosts, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> be the land for their sakes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356559" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For if I will, saith the Lord of Hosts, raise up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> unto me, I will command my people; otherwise they shall hearken unto these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356562" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>For behold, I, the Lord, have seen the sorrow, and heard the mourning of the daughters of my people in the land of Jerusalem, yea, and in all the lands of my people, because of the wickedness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominations</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>husbands</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356564" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And I will not suffer, saith the Lord of Hosts, that the cries of the fair daughters of this people, which I have led out of the land of Jerusalem, shall come up unto me against the men of my people, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356566" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>For they shall not lead away captive the daughters of my people because of their tenderness, save I shall visit them with a sore curse, even unto destruction; for they shall not commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whoredoms</span>, like <span class="page-break" data-page="122"></span>unto them of old, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356569" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And now behold, my brethren, ye know that these commandments were given to our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span>, Lehi; wherefore, ye have known them before; and ye have come unto great condemnation; for ye have done these things which ye ought not to have done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356571" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Behold, ye have done <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>greater</span> iniquities than the Lamanites, our brethren. Ye have broken the hearts of your tender wives, and lost the confidence of your children, because of your bad examples before them; and the sobbings of their hearts ascend up to God against you. And because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strictness</span> of the word of God, which cometh down against you, many hearts died, pierced with deep wounds.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Jacob 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356527" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/jacob/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Jacob 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356551" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356553" id="study_summary1">The pure in heart receive the pleasing word of God—Lamanite righteousness exceeds that of the Nephites—Jacob warns against fornication, lasciviousness, and every sin. About 544–421 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356554" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>But behold, I, Jacob, would speak unto you that are pure in heart. Look unto God with firmness of mind, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> unto him with exceeding faith, and he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>console</span> you in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>afflictions</span>, and he will plead your cause, and send down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>justice</span> upon those who seek your destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356556" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>O all ye that are pure in heart, lift up your heads and receive the pleasing word of God, and feast upon his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span>; for ye may, if your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>minds</span> are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>firm</span>, forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356558" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But, wo, wo, unto you that are not pure in heart, that are filthy this day before God; for except ye repent the land is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> for your sakes; and the Lamanites, which are not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthy</span> like unto you, nevertheless they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cursed</span> with a sore cursing, shall scourge you even unto destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356560" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the time speedily cometh, that except ye repent they shall possess the land of your inheritance, and the Lord God will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lead</span> away the righteous out from among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356561" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, the Lamanites your brethren, whom ye hate because of their filthiness and the cursing which hath come upon their skins, are more righteous than you; for they have not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgotten</span> the commandment of the Lord, which was given unto our father—that they should have save it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span> wife, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>concubines</span> they should have none, and there should not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>whoredoms</span> committed among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356563" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, this commandment they observe to keep; wherefore, because of this observance, in keeping this commandment, the Lord God will not destroy them, but will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> unto them; and one day they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>become</span> a blessed people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356565" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>husbands</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>love</span> their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wives</span>, and their wives love their husbands; and their husbands and their wives love their children; and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>unbelief</span> and their hatred towards you is because of the iniquity of their fathers; wherefore, <span class="page-break" data-page="123"></span>how much better are you than they, in the sight of your great Creator?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356567" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>O my brethren, I fear that unless ye shall repent of your sins that their skins will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whiter</span> than yours, when ye shall be brought with them before the throne of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356568" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, a commandment I give unto you, which is the word of God, that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revile</span> no more against them because of the darkness of their skins; neither shall ye revile against them because of their filthiness; but ye shall remember your own filthiness, and remember that their filthiness came because of their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356570" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, ye shall remember your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span>, how that ye have grieved their hearts because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>example</span> that ye have set before them; and also, remember that ye may, because of your filthiness, bring your children unto destruction, and their sins be heaped upon your heads at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356572" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>O my brethren, hearken unto my words; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>arouse</span> the faculties of your souls; shake yourselves that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>awake</span> from the slumber of death; and loose yourselves from the pains of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hell</span> that ye may not become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>angels</span> to the devil, to be cast into that lake of fire and brimstone which is the second <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356574" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now I, Jacob, spake many more things unto the people of Nephi, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>warning</span> them against <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fornication</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lasciviousness</span>, and every kind of sin, telling them the awful consequences of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356576" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And a hundredth part of the proceedings of this people, which now began to be numerous, cannot be written upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span>; but many of their proceedings are written upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>larger plates</span>, and their wars, and their contentions, and the reigns of their kings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356577" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>These</span> plates are called the plates of Jacob, and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>made</span> by the hand of Nephi. And I make an end of speaking these words.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Jacob 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357235" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/jacob/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Jacob 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357236" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357237" id="study_summary1">All the prophets worshiped the Father in the name of Christ—Abraham’s offering of Isaac was in similitude of God and His Only Begotten—Men should reconcile themselves to God through the Atonement—The Jews will reject the foundation stone. About 544–421 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357238" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now behold, it came to pass that I, Jacob, having ministered much unto my people in word, (and I cannot write but a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>little</span> of my words, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>difficulty</span> of engraving our words upon plates) and we know that the things which we write upon plates must remain;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357239" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But whatsoever things we write upon anything save it be upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates</span> must perish and vanish away; but we can write a few words upon plates, which will give our children, and also our beloved brethren, a small degree of knowledge concerning us, or concerning their fathers—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357240" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now in this thing we do rejoice; and we labor diligently to engraven these words upon plates, hoping that our beloved brethren and our children will receive them with thankful hearts, and look upon them that they may learn with joy and not with sorrow, neither with contempt, concerning their first <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>parents</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="124"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357241" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For, for this intent have we written these things, that they may know that we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knew</span> of Christ, and we had a hope of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span> many hundred years before his coming; and not only we ourselves had a hope of his glory, but also all the holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophets</span> which were before us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357242" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, they believed in Christ and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worshiped</span> the Father in his name, and also we worship the Father in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span>. And for this intent we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>keep</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>law</span> of Moses, it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>pointing</span> our souls to him; and for this cause it is sanctified unto us for righteousness, even as it was accounted unto Abraham in the wilderness to be obedient unto the commands of God in offering up his son Isaac, which is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>similitude</span> of God and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>Only Begotten Son</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357243" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Wherefore, we search the prophets, and we have many revelations and the spirit of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophecy</span>; and having all these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>witnesses</span> we obtain a hope, and our faith becometh unshaken, insomuch that we truly can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>command</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>name</span> of Jesus and the very trees obey us, or the mountains, or the waves of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357244" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Nevertheless, the Lord God showeth us our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weakness</span> that we may know that it is by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span>, and his great condescensions unto the children of men, that we have power to do these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357245" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Behold, great and marvelous are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span> of the Lord. How <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unsearchable</span> are the depths of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mysteries</span> of him; and it is impossible that man should find out all his ways. And no man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knoweth</span> of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>ways</span> save it be revealed unto him; wherefore, brethren, despise not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>revelations</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357246" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For behold, by the power of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>man</span> came upon the face of the earth, which earth was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>created</span> by the power of his word. Wherefore, if God being able to speak and the world was, and to speak and man was created, O then, why not able to command the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>earth</span>, or the workmanship of his hands upon the face of it, according to his will and pleasure?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357247" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, brethren, seek not to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>counsel</span> the Lord, but to take counsel from his hand. For behold, ye yourselves know that he counseleth in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wisdom</span>, and in justice, and in great mercy, over all his works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357248" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, beloved brethren, be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reconciled</span> unto him through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atonement</span> of Christ, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Only <span class="page-break" data-page="125"></span>Begotten Son</span>, and ye may obtain a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>resurrection</span>, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>power</span> of the resurrection which is in Christ, and be presented as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>first-fruits</span> of Christ unto God, having faith, and obtained a good hope of glory in him before he manifesteth himself in the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357249" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, beloved, marvel not that I tell you these things; for why not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>speak</span> of the atonement of Christ, and attain to a perfect knowledge of him, as to attain to the knowledge of a resurrection and the world to come?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357250" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, my brethren, he that prophesieth, let him prophesy to the understanding of men; for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> speaketh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>truth</span> and lieth not. Wherefore, it speaketh of things as they really <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>are</span>, and of things as they really will be; wherefore, these things are manifested unto us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>plainly</span>, for the salvation of our souls. But behold, we are not witnesses alone in these things; for God also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>spake</span> them unto prophets of old.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357251" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But behold, the Jews were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people; and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>despised</span> the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plainness</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>killed</span> the prophets, and sought for things that they could not understand. Wherefore, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>blindness</span>, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>blindness</span> came by looking beyond the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>mark</span>, they must needs fall; for God hath taken away his plainness from them, and delivered unto them many things which they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>cannot</span> understand, because they desired it. And because they desired it God hath done it, that they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>stumble</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357252" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now I, Jacob, am led on by the Spirit unto prophesying; for I perceive by the workings of the Spirit which is in me, that by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stumbling</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span> they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reject</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>stone</span> upon which they might build and have safe foundation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357253" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But behold, according to the scriptures, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stone</span> shall become the great, and the last, and the only sure <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foundation</span>, upon which the Jews can build.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357254" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, my beloved, how is it possible that these, after having rejected the sure foundation, can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ever</span> build upon it, that it may become the head of their corner?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357255" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, my beloved brethren, I will unfold this mystery unto you; if I do not, by any means, get shaken from my firmness in the Spirit, and stumble because of my over anxiety for you.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Jacob 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357316" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/jacob/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Jacob 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357317" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357318" id="study_summary1">Jacob quotes Zenos relative to the allegory of the tame and wild olive trees—They are a likeness of Israel and the Gentiles—The scattering and gathering of Israel are prefigured—Allusions are made to the Nephites and Lamanites and all the house of Israel—The Gentiles will be grafted into Israel—Eventually the vineyard will be burned. About 544–421 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="126"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357319" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, my brethren, do ye not remember to have read the words of the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span>, which he spake unto the house of Israel, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357320" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Hearken, O ye house of Israel, and hear the words of me, a prophet of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357321" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For behold, thus saith the Lord, I will liken thee, O house of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Israel</span>, like unto a tame <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>olive tree</span>, which a man took and nourished in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>vineyard</span>; and it grew, and waxed old, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>decay</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357322" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that the master of the vineyard went forth, and he saw that his olive tree began to decay; and he said: I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prune</span> it, and dig about it, and nourish it, that perhaps it may shoot forth young and tender branches, and it perish not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357323" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pruned</span> it, and digged about it, and nourished it according to his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357324" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that after many days it began to put forth somewhat a little, young and tender branches; but behold, the main <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>top</span> thereof began to perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357325" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that the master of the vineyard saw it, and he said unto his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span>: It grieveth me that I should lose this tree; wherefore, go and pluck the branches from a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wild</span> olive tree, and bring them hither unto me; and we will pluck off those main branches which are beginning to wither away, and we will cast them into the fire that they may be burned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357326" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, saith the Lord of the vineyard, I take <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>away</span> many of these young and tender branches, and I will graft them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whithersoever</span> I will; and it mattereth not that if it so be that the root of this tree will perish, I may preserve the fruit thereof unto myself; wherefore, I will take these young and tender branches, and I will graft them whithersoever I will.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357327" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Take thou the branches of the wild olive tree, and graft them in, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stead</span> thereof; and these which I have plucked off I will cast into the fire and burn them, that they may not cumber the ground of my vineyard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357328" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the servant of the Lord of the vineyard did according to the word of the Lord of the vineyard, and grafted in the branches of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wild</span> olive tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357329" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Lord of the vineyard caused that it should be digged about, and pruned, and nourished, saying unto his servant: It grieveth me that I should lose this tree; wherefore, that perhaps I might preserve the roots thereof that they perish not, that I might preserve them unto myself, I have done this thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357330" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, go thy way; watch the tree, and nourish it, according to my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357331" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And these will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>place</span> in the nethermost part of my vineyard, whithersoever I will, it mattereth not unto thee; and I do it that I may preserve unto myself the natural branches of the tree; and also, that I may lay up fruit thereof against the season, unto myself; for it grieveth me that I should lose this tree and the fruit thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357332" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord of the vineyard went his way, and hid the natural <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>branches</span> of the tame olive tree in the nethermost <span class="page-break" data-page="127"></span>parts of the vineyard, some in one and some in another, according to his will and pleasure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357333" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that a long time passed away, and the Lord of the vineyard said unto his servant: Come, let us go down into the vineyard, that we may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labor</span> in the vineyard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357334" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord of the vineyard, and also the servant, went down into the vineyard to labor. And it came to pass that the servant said unto his master: Behold, look here; behold the tree.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357335" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord of the vineyard looked and beheld the tree in the which the wild olive branches had been grafted; and it had sprung forth and begun to bear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruit</span>. And he beheld that it was good; and the fruit thereof was like unto the natural fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357336" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And he said unto the servant: Behold, the branches of the wild tree have taken hold of the moisture of the root thereof, that the root thereof hath brought forth much strength; and because of the much strength of the root thereof the wild branches have brought forth tame fruit. Now, if we had not grafted in these branches, the tree thereof would have perished. And now, behold, I shall lay up much fruit, which the tree thereof hath brought forth; and the fruit thereof I shall lay up against the season, unto mine own self.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357337" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord of the vineyard said unto the servant: Come, let us go to the nethermost part of the vineyard, and behold if the natural branches of the tree have not brought forth much fruit also, that I may lay up of the fruit thereof against the season, unto mine own self.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357338" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they went forth whither the master had hid the natural branches of the tree, and he said unto the servant: Behold these; and he beheld the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> that it had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought forth</span> much fruit; and he beheld also that it was good. And he said unto the servant: Take of the fruit thereof, and lay it up against the season, that I may preserve it unto mine own self; for behold, said he, this long time have I nourished it, and it hath brought forth much fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357339" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the servant said unto his master: How comest thou hither to plant this tree, or this branch of the tree?
