And I make an end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360342" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, I am Amaleki, the son of Abinadom. Behold, I will speak unto you somewhat concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mosiah</span>, who was made king over the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>; for behold, he being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>warned</span> of the Lord that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>flee</span> out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>land</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Nephi</span>, and as many as would hearken unto the voice of the Lord should also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>depart</span> out of the land with him, into the wilderness—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360343" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that he did according as the Lord had commanded him. And they departed out of the land into the wilderness, as many as would hearken unto the voice of the Lord; and they were led by many preachings and prophesyings. And they were admonished continually by the word of God; and they were led by the power of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>arm</span>, through the wilderness until they came down into the land which is called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360344" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they discovered a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span>, who were called the people of Zarahemla. Now, there was great rejoicing among the people of Zarahemla; and also Zarahemla did rejoice exceedingly, because the Lord had sent the people of Mosiah with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates of brass</span> which contained the record of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360345" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, it came to pass that Mosiah discovered that the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zarahemla</span> came out from Jerusalem at the time that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zedekiah</span>, king of Judah, was carried away captive into Babylon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360346" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>journeyed</span> in the wilderness, and were brought by the hand of the Lord across the great waters, into the land where Mosiah discovered them; and they had dwelt there from that time forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360347" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And at the time that Mosiah discovered them, they had become exceedingly numerous. Nevertheless, they had had many wars and serious contentions, and had fallen by the sword from time to time; and <span class="page-break" data-page="142"></span>their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> had become corrupted; and they had brought no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span> with them; and they denied the being of their Creator; and Mosiah, nor the people of Mosiah, could understand them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360348" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But it came to pass that Mosiah caused that they should be taught in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span>. And it came to pass that after they were taught in the language of Mosiah, Zarahemla gave a genealogy of his fathers, according to his memory; and they are written, but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> in these plates.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360349" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the people of Zarahemla, and of Mosiah, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unite</span> together; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mosiah</span> was appointed to be their king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360350" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass in the days of Mosiah, there was a large <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stone</span> brought unto him with engravings on it; and he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>interpret</span> the engravings by the gift and power of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360351" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they gave an account of one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Coriantumr</span>, and the slain of his people. And Coriantumr was discovered by the people of Zarahemla; and he dwelt with them for the space of nine moons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360352" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>It also spake a few words concerning his fathers. And his first parents came out from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tower</span>, at the time the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>confounded</span> the language of the people; and the severity of the Lord fell upon them according to his judgments, which are just; and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bones</span> lay scattered in the land northward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360353" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Behold, I, Amaleki, was born in the days of Mosiah; and I have lived to see his death; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Benjamin</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>his</span> son, reigneth in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360354" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And behold, I have seen, in the days of king Benjamin, a serious war and much bloodshed between the Nephites and the Lamanites. But behold, the Nephites did obtain much advantage over them; yea, insomuch that king Benjamin did drive them out of the land of Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360355" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that I began to be old; and, having no seed, and knowing king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Benjamin</span> to be a just man before the Lord, wherefore, I shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>these plates</span> unto him, exhorting all men to come unto God, the Holy One of Israel, and believe in prophesying, and in revelations, and in the ministering of angels, and in the gift of speaking with tongues, and in the gift of interpreting languages, and in all things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>good</span>; for there is nothing which is good save it comes from the Lord: and that which is evil cometh from the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360356" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, I would that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto Christ, who is the Holy One of Israel, and partake of his salvation, and the power of his redemption. Yea, come unto him, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>offer</span> your whole souls as an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>offering</span> unto him, and continue in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fasting</span> and praying, and endure to the end; and as the Lord liveth ye will be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360357" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now I would speak somewhat concerning a certain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>number</span> who went up into the wilderness to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>return</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land of Nephi</span>; for there was a large number who were desirous to possess the land of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360358" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Wherefore, they went up into <span class="page-break" data-page="143"></span>the wilderness. And their leader being a strong and mighty man, and a stiffnecked man, wherefore he caused a contention among them; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> slain, save fifty, in the wilderness, and they returned again to the land of Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360359" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that they also took others to a considerable number, and took their journey again into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360360" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And I, Amaleki, had a brother, who also went with them; and I have not since known concerning them. And I am about to lie down in my grave; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span> are full. And I make an end of my speaking.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Words of Mormon 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128361215" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/w-of-m/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Words of Mormon 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128361216" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Words of Mormon</span></h1>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128361217" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128361218" id="study_summary1">Mormon abridges the large plates of Nephi—He puts the small plates with the other plates—King Benjamin establishes peace in the land. About <small>A.D.</small> 385.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361219" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Mormon, being about to deliver up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> which I have been making into the hands of my son Moroni, behold I have witnessed almost all the destruction of my people, the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361220" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> hundred years after the coming of Christ that I deliver these records into the hands of my son; and it supposeth me that he will witness the entire <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> of my people. But may God grant that he may survive them, that he may write somewhat concerning them, and somewhat concerning Christ, that perhaps some day it may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>profit</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361221" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, I speak somewhat concerning that which I have written; for after I had made an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abridgment</span> from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates of Nephi</span>, down to the reign of this king Benjamin, of whom Amaleki spake, I searched among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>records</span> which had been delivered into my hands, and I found these plates, which contained this small account of the prophets, from Jacob down to the reign of this king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Benjamin</span>, and also many of the words of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361222" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the things which are upon these plates <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pleasing</span> me, because of the prophecies of the coming of Christ; and my fathers knowing that many of them have been fulfilled; yea, and I also know that as many things as have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophesied</span> concerning us down to this day have been fulfilled, and as many as go beyond this day must surely come to pass—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361223" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore, I chose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these things</span>, to finish my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> upon them, which remainder of my record I shall take from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plates of Nephi</span>; and I cannot write the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hundredth</span> part of the things of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361224" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But behold, I shall take these <span class="page-break" data-page="144"></span>plates, which contain these prophesyings and revelations, and put them with the remainder of my record, for they are choice unto me; and I know they will be choice unto my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361225" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And I do this for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>purpose</span>; for thus it whispereth me, according to the workings of the Spirit of the Lord which is in me. And now, I do not know all things; but the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knoweth</span> all things which are to come; wherefore, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>worketh</span> in me to do according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>will</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361226" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayer</span> to God is concerning my brethren, that they may once again come to the knowledge of God, yea, the redemption of Christ; that they may once again be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delightsome</span> people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361227" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now I, Mormon, proceed to finish out my record, which I take from the plates of Nephi; and I make it according to the knowledge and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>understanding</span> which God has given me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361228" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, it came to pass that after Amaleki had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered up</span> these plates into the hands of king Benjamin, he took them and put them with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>other plates</span>, which contained records which had been handed down by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>kings</span>, from generation to generation until the days of king Benjamin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361229" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And they were handed down from king Benjamin, from generation to generation until they have fallen into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my hands</span>. And I, Mormon, pray to God that they may be preserved from this time henceforth. And I know that they will be preserved; for there are great things written upon them, out of which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>my</span> people and their brethren shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judged</span> at the great and last day, according to the word of God which is written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361230" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, concerning this king Benjamin—he had somewhat of contentions among his own people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361231" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass also that the armies of the Lamanites came down out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Nephi</span>, to battle against his people. But behold, king Benjamin gathered together his armies, and he did stand against them; and he did fight with the strength of his own arm, with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sword</span> of Laban.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361232" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> of the Lord they did contend against their enemies, until they had slain many thousands of the Lamanites. And it came to pass that they did contend against the Lamanites until they had driven them out of all the lands of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>inheritance</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361233" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that after there had been false <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Christs</span>, and their mouths had been shut, and they punished according to their crimes;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361234" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after there had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false prophets</span>, and false preachers and teachers among the people, and all these having been punished according to their crimes; and after there having been much contention and many dissensions away <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unto</span> the Lamanites, behold, it came to pass that king Benjamin, with the assistance of the holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophets</span> who were among his people—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361235" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For behold, king Benjamin was <span class="page-break" data-page="145"></span>a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy</span> man, and he did reign over his people in righteousness; and there were many holy men in the land, and they did speak the word of God with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> and with authority; and they did use much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sharpness</span> because of the stiffneckedness of the people—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128361236" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, with the help of these, king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Benjamin</span>, by laboring with all the might of his body and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faculty</span> of his whole soul, and also the prophets, did once more establish peace in the land.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358298" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128358299" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Mosiah</span></h1>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358300" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358301" id="study_summary1">King Benjamin teaches his sons the language and prophecies of their fathers—Their religion and civilization have been preserved because of the records kept on the various plates—Mosiah is chosen as king and is given custody of the records and other things. About 130–124 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358302" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now there was no more contention in all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>, among all the people who belonged to king Benjamin, so that king Benjamin had continual peace all the remainder of his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358303" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that he had three <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons</span>; and he called their names Mosiah, and Helorum, and Helaman. And he caused that they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>taught</span> in all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>language</span> of his fathers, that thereby they might become men of understanding; and that they might know concerning the prophecies which had been spoken by the mouths of their fathers, which were delivered them by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358304" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he also taught them concerning the records which were engraven on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, saying: My sons, I would that ye should remember that were it not for these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates</span>, which contain these records and these commandments, we must have suffered in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ignorance</span>, even at this present time, not knowing the mysteries of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358305" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For it were not possible that our father, Lehi, could have remembered all these things, to have taught them to his children, except it were for the help of these plates; for he having been taught in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> of the Egyptians therefore he could read these engravings, and teach them to his children, that thereby they could teach them to their children, and so fulfilling the commandments of God, even down to this present time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358306" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>I say unto you, my sons, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>were</span> it not for these things, which have been kept and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserved</span> by the hand of God, that we might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>read</span> and understand of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mysteries</span>, and have his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>commandments</span> always <span class="page-break" data-page="146"></span>before our eyes, that even our fathers would have dwindled in unbelief, and we should have been like unto our brethren, the Lamanites, who know nothing concerning these things, or even do not believe them when they are taught them, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers, which are not correct.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358307" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>O my sons, I would that ye should remember that these sayings are true, and also that these records are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>true</span>. And behold, also the plates of Nephi, which contain the records and the sayings of our fathers from the time they left Jerusalem until now, and they are true; and we can know of their surety because we have them before our eyes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358308" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, my sons, I would that ye should remember to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>search</span> them diligently, that ye may profit thereby; and I would that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>keep</span> the commandments of God, that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prosper</span> in the land according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>promises</span> which the Lord made unto our fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358309" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And many more things did king Benjamin teach his sons, which are not written in this book.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358310" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that after king Benjamin had made an end of teaching his sons, that he waxed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span>, and he saw that he must very soon go the way of all the earth; therefore, he thought it expedient that he should confer the kingdom upon one of his sons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358311" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Therefore, he had Mosiah brought before him; and these are the words which he spake unto him, saying: My son, I would that ye should make a proclamation throughout all this land among all this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span>, or the people of Zarahemla, and the people of Mosiah who dwell in the land, that thereby they may be gathered together; for on the morrow I shall proclaim unto this my people out of mine own mouth that thou art a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>king</span> and a ruler over this people, whom the Lord our God hath given us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358312" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And moreover, I shall give this people a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span>, that thereby they may be distinguished above all the people which the Lord God hath brought out of the land of Jerusalem; and this I do because they have been a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>diligent</span> people in keeping the commandments of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358313" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I give unto them a name that never shall be blotted out, except it be through <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>transgression</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358314" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, and moreover I say unto you, that if this highly favored people of the Lord should fall into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>transgression</span>, and become a wicked and an adulterous people, that the Lord will deliver them up, that thereby they become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>weak</span> like unto their brethren; and he will no more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>preserve</span> them by his matchless and marvelous power, as he has hitherto preserved our fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358315" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For I say unto you, that if he had not extended his arm in the preservation of our fathers they must have fallen into the hands of the Lamanites, and become victims to their hatred.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358316" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that after king Benjamin had made an end of these sayings to his son, that he gave him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charge</span> concerning all the affairs of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358317" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And moreover, he also gave him charge concerning the records which <span class="page-break" data-page="147"></span>were engraven on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>; and also the plates of Nephi; and also, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sword</span> of Laban, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ball</span> or director, which led our fathers through the wilderness, which was prepared by the hand of the Lord that thereby they might be led, every one according to the heed and diligence which they gave unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358318" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore, as they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unfaithful</span> they did not prosper nor progress in their journey, but were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>driven</span> back, and incurred the displeasure of God upon them; and therefore they were smitten with famine and sore <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>afflictions</span>, to stir them up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>remembrance</span> of their duty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358319" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And now, it came to pass that Mosiah went and did as his father had commanded him, and proclaimed unto all the people who were in the land of Zarahemla that thereby they might gather themselves together, to go up to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temple</span> to hear the words which his father should speak unto them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359618" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359619" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359621" id="study_summary1">King Benjamin addresses his people—He recounts the equity, fairness, and spirituality of his reign—He counsels them to serve their Heavenly King—Those who rebel against God will suffer anguish like unquenchable fire. About 124 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359622" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that after Mosiah had done as his father had commanded him, and had made a proclamation throughout all the land, that the people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathered</span> themselves together throughout all the land, that they might go up to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temple</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hear</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>words</span> which king Benjamin should speak unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359623" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And there were a great number, even so many that they did not number them; for they had multiplied exceedingly and waxed great in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359624" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they also took of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>firstlings</span> of their flocks, that they might offer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sacrifice</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>burnt</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>offerings</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>according</span> to the law of Moses;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359625" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And also that they might give thanks to the Lord their God, who had brought them out of the land of Jerusalem, and who had delivered them out of the hands of their enemies, and had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appointed</span> just men to be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teachers</span>, and also a just man to be their king, who had established peace in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>, and who had taught them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>keep</span> the commandments of God, that they might rejoice and be filled with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>love</span> towards God and all men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359626" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that when they came up to the temple, they pitched their tents round about, every man according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>family</span>, consisting of his wife, and his sons, and his daughters, and their sons, and their daughters, from the eldest down to the youngest, every family being separate one from another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359627" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they pitched their tents round about the temple, every man having his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tent</span> with the door thereof towards the temple, that thereby they might remain in their tents and hear the words which king Benjamin should speak unto them;</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="148"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359628" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For the multitude being so great that king Benjamin could not teach them all within the walls of the temple, therefore he caused a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tower</span> to be erected, that thereby his people might hear the words which he should speak unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359629" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that he began to speak to his people from the tower; and they could not all hear his words because of the greatness of the multitude; therefore he caused that the words which he spake should be written and sent forth among those that were not under the sound of his voice, that they might also receive his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359630" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And these are the words which he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spake</span> and caused to be written, saying: My brethren, all ye that have assembled yourselves together, you that can hear my words which I shall speak unto you this day; for I have not commanded you to come up hither to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trifle</span> with the words which I shall speak, but that you should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearken</span> unto me, and open your ears that ye may hear, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hearts</span> that ye may understand, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>minds</span> that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>mysteries</span> of God may be unfolded to your view.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359631" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>I have not commanded you to come up hither that ye should fear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>me</span>, or that ye should think that I of myself am more than a mortal man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359632" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But I am like as yourselves, subject to all manner of infirmities in body and mind; yet I have been chosen by this people, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrated</span> by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>my</span> father, and was suffered by the hand of the Lord that I should be a ruler and a king over this people; and have been kept and preserved by his matchless power, to serve you with all the might, mind and strength which the Lord hath granted unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359633" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>I say unto you that as I have been suffered to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spend</span> my days in your service, even up to this time, and have not sought <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gold</span> nor silver nor any manner of riches of you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359634" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Neither have I suffered that ye should be confined in dungeons, nor that ye should make slaves one of another, nor that ye should murder, or plunder, or steal, or commit adultery; nor even have I suffered that ye should commit any manner of wickedness, and have taught you that ye should keep the commandments of the Lord, in all things which he hath commanded you—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359635" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And even I, myself, have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labored</span> with mine own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hands</span> that I might serve you, and that ye should not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>laden</span> with taxes, and that there should nothing come upon you which was grievous to be borne—and of all these things which I have spoken, ye yourselves are witnesses this day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359636" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yet, my brethren, I have not done these things that I might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span>, neither do I tell these things that thereby I might accuse you; but I tell you these things that ye may know that I can answer a clear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>conscience</span> before God this day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359637" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, I say unto you that because I said unto you that I had spent my days in your service, I do not desire to boast, for I have only been in the service of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359638" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And behold, I tell you these things that ye may learn <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wisdom</span>; that ye may learn that when ye are in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>service</span> of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fellow</span> beings <span class="page-break" data-page="149"></span>ye are only in the service of your God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359639" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, ye have called me your king; and if I, whom ye call your king, do labor to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>serve</span> you, then ought not ye to labor to serve one another?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359640" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold also, if I, whom ye call your king, who has spent his days in your service, and yet has been in the service of God, do merit any thanks from you, O how you ought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thank</span> your heavenly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>King</span>!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359641" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thanks</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praise</span> which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>preserved</span> you, and has caused that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rejoice</span>, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359642" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>I say unto you that if ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>serve</span> him who has created you from the beginning, and is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserving</span> you from day to day, by lending you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>breath</span>, that ye may live and move and do according to your own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span>, and even supporting you from one moment to another—I say, if ye should serve him with all your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>whole</span> souls yet ye would be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>unprofitable</span> servants.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359643" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And behold, all that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>requires</span> of you is to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>keep</span> his commandments; and he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>promised</span> you that if ye would keep his commandments ye should prosper in the land; and he never doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>vary</span> from that which he hath said; therefore, if ye do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>keep</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>commandments</span> he doth bless you and prosper you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359644" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now, in the first place, he hath created you, and granted unto you your lives, for which ye are indebted unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359646" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And secondly, he doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>require</span> that ye should do as he hath commanded you; for which if ye do, he doth immediately <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bless</span> you; and therefore he hath paid you. And ye are still indebted unto him, and are, and will be, forever and ever; therefore, of what have ye to boast?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359648" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now I ask, can ye say aught of yourselves? I answer you, Nay. Ye cannot say that ye are even as much as the dust of the earth; yet ye were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>created</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dust</span> of the earth; but behold, it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>belongeth</span> to him who created you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359650" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And I, even I, whom ye call your king, am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> better than ye yourselves are; for I am also of the dust. And ye behold that I am old, and am about to yield up this mortal frame to its mother earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359652" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Therefore, as I said unto you that I had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>served</span> you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walking</span> with a clear conscience before God, even so I at this time have caused that ye should assemble yourselves together, that I might be found blameless, and that your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blood</span> should not come upon me, when I shall stand to be judged of God of the things whereof he hath commanded me concerning you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359654" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>I say unto you that I have caused that ye should assemble yourselves together that I might <span class="page-break" data-page="150"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rid</span> my garments of your blood, at this period of time when I am about to go down to my grave, that I might go down in peace, and my immortal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spirit</span> may join the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>choirs</span> above in singing the praises of a just God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359656" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And moreover, I say unto you that I have caused that ye should assemble yourselves together, that I might declare unto you that I can no longer be your teacher, nor your king;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359658" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For even at this time, my whole frame doth tremble exceedingly while attempting to speak unto you; but the Lord God doth support me, and hath suffered me that I should speak unto you, and hath commanded me that I should declare unto you this day, that my son Mosiah is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> and a ruler over you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359660" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And now, my brethren, I would that ye should do as ye have hitherto done. As ye have kept my commandments, and also the commandments of my father, and have prospered, and have been kept from falling into the hands of your enemies, even so if ye shall keep the commandments of my son, or the commandments of God which shall be delivered unto you by him, ye shall prosper in the land, and your enemies shall have no power over you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359662" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>But, O my people, beware lest there shall arise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contentions</span> among you, and ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>list</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>obey</span> the evil spirit, which was spoken of by my father Mosiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359664" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>For behold, there is a wo pronounced upon him who listeth to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>obey</span> that spirit; for if he listeth to obey him, and remaineth and dieth in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sins</span>, the same drinketh <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>damnation</span> to his own soul; for he receiveth for his wages an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>everlasting</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>punishment</span>, having transgressed the law of God contrary to his own knowledge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359666" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>I say unto you, that there are not any among you, except it be your little children that have not been taught concerning these things, but what knoweth that ye are eternally <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>indebted</span> to your heavenly Father, to render to him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> that you have and are; and also have been taught concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>records</span> which contain the prophecies which have been spoken by the holy prophets, even down to the time our father, Lehi, left Jerusalem;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359668" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And also, all that has been spoken by our fathers until now. And behold, also, they spake that which was commanded them of the Lord; therefore, they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>just</span> and true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359670" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And now, I say unto you, my brethren, that after ye have known and have been taught all these things, if ye should transgress and go <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contrary</span> to that which has been spoken, that ye do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>withdraw</span> yourselves from the Spirit of the Lord, that it may have no place in you to guide you in wisdom’s paths that ye may be blessed, prospered, and preserved—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359672" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>I say unto you, that the man that doeth this, the same cometh out in open <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebellion</span> against God; therefore he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>listeth</span> to obey the evil spirit, and becometh an enemy to <span class="page-break" data-page="151"></span>all righteousness; therefore, the Lord has no place in him, for he dwelleth not in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unholy</span> temples.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359674" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Therefore if that man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repenteth</span> not, and remaineth and dieth an enemy to God, the demands of divine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span> do awaken his immortal soul to a lively sense of his own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>guilt</span>, which doth cause him to shrink from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>presence</span> of the Lord, and doth fill his breast with guilt, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>pain</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>anguish</span>, which is like an unquenchable <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>fire</span>, whose flame ascendeth up forever and ever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359676" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And now I say unto you, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> hath no claim on that man; therefore his final doom is to endure a never-ending <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>torment</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359678" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>O, all ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span> men, and also ye young men, and you little children who can understand my words, for I have spoken plainly unto you that ye might understand, I pray that ye should awake to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remembrance</span> of the awful situation of those that have fallen into transgression.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359680" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And moreover, I would desire that ye should consider on the blessed and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>happy</span> state of those that keep the commandments of God. For behold, they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessed</span> in all things, both temporal and spiritual; and if they hold out <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>faithful</span> to the end they are received into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>heaven</span>, that thereby they may dwell with God in a state of never-ending happiness. O remember, remember that these things are true; for the Lord God hath spoken it.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128360909" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128360921" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128360922" id="study_summary1">King Benjamin continues his address—The Lord Omnipotent will minister among men in a tabernacle of clay—Blood will come from every pore as He atones for the sins of the world—His is the only name whereby salvation comes—Men can put off the natural man and become Saints through the Atonement—The torment of the wicked will be as a lake of fire and brimstone. About 124 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360923" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And again my brethren, I would call your attention, for I have somewhat more to speak unto you; for behold, I have things to tell you concerning that which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360924" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the things which I shall tell you are made known unto me by an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> from God. And he said unto me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Awake</span>; and I awoke, and behold he stood before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360925" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he said unto me: Awake, and hear the words which I shall tell thee; for behold, I am come to declare unto you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glad</span> tidings of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>joy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360926" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For the Lord hath heard thy prayers, and hath judged of thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span>, and hath sent me to declare unto thee that thou mayest rejoice; and that thou mayest declare unto thy people, that they may also be filled with joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360927" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, the time cometh, and is not far distant, that with power, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Omnipotent</span> who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reigneth</span>, who was, and is from all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>eternity</span> to all eternity, shall come down from heaven among the <span class="page-break" data-page="152"></span>children of men, and shall dwell in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>tabernacle</span> of clay, and shall go forth amongst men, working mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>miracles</span>, such as healing the sick, raising the dead, causing the lame to walk, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>blind</span> to receive their sight, and the deaf to hear, and curing all manner of diseases.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360928" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he shall cast out <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>devils</span>, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil spirits</span> which dwell in the hearts of the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360929" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And lo, he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffer</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temptations</span>, and pain of body, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hunger</span>, thirst, and fatigue, even more than man can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>suffer</span>, except it be unto death; for behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>blood</span> cometh from every pore, so great shall be his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>anguish</span> for the wickedness and the abominations of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360930" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he shall be called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jesus</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Christ</span>, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Son of God</span>, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Father</span> of heaven and earth, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Creator</span> of all things from the beginning; and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>mother</span> shall be called Mary.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360931" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And lo, he cometh unto his own, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> might come unto the children of men even through <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> on his name; and even after all this they shall consider him a man, and say that he hath a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>devil</span>, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>scourge</span> him, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>crucify</span> him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360932" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rise</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>third</span> day from the dead; and behold, he standeth to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judge</span> the world; and behold, all these things are done that a righteous judgment might come upon the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360933" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For behold, and also his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atoneth</span> for the sins of those who have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fallen</span> by the transgression of Adam, who have died not knowing the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span> of God concerning them, or who have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>ignorantly</span> sinned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360934" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But wo, wo unto him who knoweth that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebelleth</span> against God! For salvation cometh to none such except it be through repentance and faith on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lord Jesus Christ</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360935" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the Lord God hath sent his holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span> among all the children of men, to declare these things to every kindred, nation, and tongue, that thereby whosoever should believe that Christ should come, the same might receive <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of their sins, and rejoice with exceedingly great joy, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>as</span> though he had already come among them.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="153"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360936" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yet the Lord God saw that his people were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, and he appointed unto them a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span>, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360937" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And many signs, and wonders, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>types</span>, and shadows showed he unto them, concerning his coming; and also holy prophets spake unto them concerning his coming; and yet they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hardened</span> their hearts, and understood not that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> of Moses availeth nothing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>except</span> it were through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>atonement</span> of his blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360938" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And even if it were possible that little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> could sin they could not be saved; but I say unto you they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessed</span>; for behold, as in Adam, or by nature, they fall, even so the blood of Christ <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>atoneth</span> for their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360939" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And moreover, I say unto you, that there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> other name given nor any other way nor means whereby <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>salvation</span> can come unto the children of men, only in and through the name of Christ, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Lord</span> Omnipotent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360940" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For behold he judgeth, and his judgment is just; and the infant perisheth not that dieth in his infancy; but men drink <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>damnation</span> to their own souls except they humble themselves and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>become</span> as little children, and believe that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>salvation</span> was, and is, and is to come, in and through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>atoning</span> blood of Christ, the Lord Omnipotent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360941" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>natural</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>man</span> is an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>enemy</span> to God, and has been from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fall</span> of Adam, and will be, forever and ever, unless he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>yields</span> to the enticings of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Holy Spirit</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>putteth</span> off the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>natural</span> man and becometh a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19i"><sup class="marker">i</sup>saint</span> through the atonement of Christ the Lord, and becometh as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19j"><sup class="marker">j</sup>child</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19k"><sup class="marker">k</sup>submissive</span>, meek, humble, patient, full of love, willing to submit to all things which the Lord seeth fit to inflict upon him, even as a child doth submit to his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360942" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And moreover, I say unto you, that the time shall come when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Savior</span> shall spread throughout <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>every</span> nation, kindred, tongue, and people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360943" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And behold, when that time cometh, none shall be found <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blameless</span> before God, except it be little children, only through repentance and faith on the name of the Lord God Omnipotent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360944" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And even at this time, when thou shalt have taught thy people the things which the Lord thy God hath commanded thee, even then <span class="page-break" data-page="154"></span>are they found no more blameless in the sight of God, only according to the words which I have spoken unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360945" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now I have spoken the words which the Lord God hath commanded me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360946" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And thus saith the Lord: They shall stand as a bright testimony against this people, at the judgment day; whereof they shall be judged, every man according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span>, whether they be good, or whether they be evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360947" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And if they be evil they are consigned to an awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>view</span> of their own guilt and abominations, which doth cause them to shrink from the presence of the Lord into a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>misery</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>endless</span> torment, from whence they can no more return; therefore they have drunk damnation to their own souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360948" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Therefore, they have drunk out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cup</span> of the wrath of God, which justice could no more deny unto them than it could deny that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Adam</span> should fall because of his partaking of the forbidden <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fruit</span>; therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mercy</span> could have claim on them no more forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360949" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>torment</span> is as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lake</span> of fire and brimstone, whose flames are unquenchable, and whose smoke ascendeth up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>forever</span> and ever. Thus hath the Lord commanded me. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128360125" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128360126" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128360127" id="study_summary1">King Benjamin continues his address—Salvation comes because of the Atonement—Believe in God to be saved—Retain a remission of your sins through faithfulness—Impart of your substance to the poor—Do all things in wisdom and order. About 124 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360128" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, it came to pass that when king Benjamin had made an end of speaking the words which had been delivered unto him by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of the Lord, that he cast his eyes round about on the multitude, and behold they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span> to the earth, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fear</span> of the Lord had come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360129" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>viewed</span> themselves in their own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carnal</span> state, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>less</span> than the dust of the earth. And they all cried aloud with one voice, saying: O have mercy, and apply the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>atoning</span> blood of Christ that we may receive forgiveness of our sins, and our hearts may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>purified</span>; for we believe in Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>created</span> heaven and earth, and all things; who shall come down among the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360130" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that after they had spoken these words the Spirit of the Lord came upon them, and they were filled with joy, having received a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remission</span> of their sins, and having peace of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>conscience</span>, because of the exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>faith</span> which they had in Jesus Christ who should come, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>words</span> which king Benjamin had spoken unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360131" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And king Benjamin again opened his mouth and began to speak unto them, saying: My friends and my brethren, my kindred and my people, I would again call your attention, that ye may hear and <span class="page-break" data-page="155"></span>understand the remainder of my words which I shall speak unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360132" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, if the knowledge of the goodness of God at this time has awakened you to a sense of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nothingness</span>, and your worthless and fallen state—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360133" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>I say unto you, if ye have come to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> of the goodness of God, and his matchless power, and his wisdom, and his patience, and his long-suffering towards the children of men; and also, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atonement</span> which has been prepared from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foundation</span> of the world, that thereby salvation might come to him that should put his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>trust</span> in the Lord, and should be diligent in keeping his commandments, and continue in the faith even unto the end of his life, I mean the life of
