and he could even look over all the land round about.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359232" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that he caused many buildings to be built in the land Shilom; and he caused a great tower to be built on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hill</span> north of the land Shilom, which had been a resort for the children of Nephi at the time they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fled</span> out of the land; and thus he did do with the riches which he obtained by the taxation of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359233" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that he placed his heart upon his riches, and he spent his time in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riotous</span> living with his wives and his concubines; and so did also his priests spend their time with harlots.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359234" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that he planted vineyards round about in the land; and he built wine-presses, and made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wine</span> in abundance; and therefore he became a wine-bibber, and also his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359235" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites began to come in upon his people, upon small numbers, and to slay them in their fields, and while they were tending their flocks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359236" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And king Noah sent guards round about the land to keep them <span class="page-break" data-page="169"></span>off; but he did not send a sufficient number, and the Lamanites came upon them and killed them, and drove many of their flocks out of the land; thus the Lamanites began to destroy them, and to exercise their hatred upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359237" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that king Noah sent his armies against them, and they were driven back, or they drove them back for a time; therefore, they returned rejoicing in their spoil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359238" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now, because of this great victory they were lifted up in the pride of their hearts; they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span> in their own strength, saying that their fifty could stand against thousands of the Lamanites; and thus they did boast, and did delight in blood, and the shedding of the blood of their brethren, and this because of the wickedness of their king and priests.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359239" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that there was a man among them whose name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Abinadi</span>; and he went forth among them, and began to prophesy, saying: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, Go forth, and say unto this people, thus saith the Lord—Wo be unto this people, for I have seen their abominations, and their wickedness, and their whoredoms; and except they repent I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visit</span> them in mine anger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359240" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And except they repent and turn to the Lord their God, behold, I will deliver them into the hands of their enemies; yea, and they shall be brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>; and they shall be afflicted by the hand of their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359241" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it shall come to pass that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> that I am the Lord their God, and am a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>jealous</span> God, visiting the iniquities of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359242" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it shall come to pass that except this people repent and turn unto the Lord their God, they shall be brought into bondage; and none shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> them, except it be the Lord the Almighty God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359243" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Yea, and it shall come to pass that when they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> unto me I will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slow</span> to hear their cries; yea, and I will suffer them that they be smitten by their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359244" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And except they repent in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sackcloth</span> and ashes, and cry mightily to the Lord their God, I will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hear</span> their prayers, neither will I deliver them out of their afflictions; and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359245" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now it came to pass that when Abinadi had spoken these words unto them they were wroth with him, and sought to take away his life; but the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> him out of their hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359246" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Now when king Noah had heard of the words which Abinadi had spoken unto the people, he was also wroth; and he said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Who</span> is Abinadi, that I and my people should be judged of him, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>who</span> is the Lord, that shall bring upon my people such great affliction?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359247" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>I command you to bring Abinadi hither, that I may slay him, for he has said these things that he might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir up</span> my people to anger one with another, and to raise contentions among my people; therefore I will slay him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359248" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now the eyes of the people were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blinded</span>; therefore they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hardened</span> their hearts against the words of <span class="page-break" data-page="170"></span>Abinadi, and they sought from that time forward to take him. And king Noah hardened his heart against the word of the Lord, and he did not repent of his evil doings.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359286" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359287" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359288" id="study_summary1">Abinadi is imprisoned for prophesying the destruction of the people and the death of King Noah—The false priests quote the scriptures and pretend to keep the law of Moses—Abinadi begins to teach them the Ten Commandments. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359289" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that after the space of two years that Abinadi came among them in disguise, that they knew him not, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesy</span> among them, saying: Thus has the Lord commanded me, saying—Abinadi, go and prophesy unto this my people, for they have hardened their hearts against my words; they have repented not of their evil doings; therefore, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visit</span> them in my anger, yea, in my fierce anger will I visit them in their iniquities and abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359290" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, wo be unto this generation! And the Lord said unto me: Stretch forth thy hand and prophesy, saying: Thus saith the Lord, it shall come to pass that this generation, because of their iniquities, shall be brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>, and shall be smitten on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cheek</span>; yea, and shall be driven by men, and shall be slain; and the vultures of the air, and the dogs, yea, and the wild beasts, shall devour their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>flesh</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359291" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it shall come to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>life</span> of king Noah shall be valued even as a garment in a hot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>furnace</span>; for he shall know that I am the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359292" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it shall come to pass that I will smite this my people with sore afflictions, yea, with famine and with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pestilence</span>; and I will cause that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>howl</span> all the day long.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359293" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and I will cause that they shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>burdens</span> lashed upon their backs; and they shall be driven before like a dumb ass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359294" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it shall come to pass that I will send forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hail</span> among them, and it shall smite them; and they shall also be smitten with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>east wind</span>; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>insects</span> shall pester their land also, and devour their grain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359295" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they shall be smitten with a great pestilence—and all this will I do because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquities</span> and abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359296" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it shall come to pass that except they repent I will utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> them from off the face of the earth; yet they shall leave a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> behind them, and I will preserve them for other nations which shall possess the land; yea, even this will I do that I may discover the abominations of this people to other nations. And many things did Abinadi prophesy against this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359297" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they were angry with him; and they took him and carried him bound before the king, and said unto the king: Behold, we have brought a man before thee who has prophesied evil concerning thy people, and saith that God will destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359298" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he also prophesieth evil concerning thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>life</span>, and saith that thy life shall be as a garment in a furnace of fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359299" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And again, he saith that thou shalt be as a stalk, even as a dry stalk <span class="page-break" data-page="171"></span>of the field, which is run over by the beasts and trodden under foot.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359300" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And again, he saith thou shalt be as the blossoms of a thistle, which, when it is fully ripe, if the wind bloweth, it is driven forth upon the face of the land. And he pretendeth the Lord hath spoken it. And he saith all this shall come upon thee except thou repent, and this because of thine iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359301" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, O king, what great evil hast thou done, or what great sins have thy people committed, that we should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>condemned</span> of God or judged of this man?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359302" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, O king, behold, we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guiltless</span>, and thou, O king, hast not sinned; therefore, this man has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lied</span> concerning you, and he has prophesied in vain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359303" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And behold, we are strong, we shall not come into bondage, or be taken captive by our enemies; yea, and thou hast prospered in the land, and thou shalt also prosper.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359304" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359305" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that king Noah caused that Abinadi should be cast into prison; and he commanded that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> should gather themselves together that he might hold a council with them what he should do with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359306" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they said unto the king: Bring him hither that we may question him; and the king commanded that he should be brought before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359307" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they began to question him, that they might cross him, that thereby they might have wherewith to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>accuse</span> him; but he answered them boldly, and withstood all their questions, yea, to their astonishment; for he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>withstand</span> them in all their questions, and did confound them in all their words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359308" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that one of them said unto him: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>What</span> meaneth the words which are written, and which have been taught by our fathers, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359309" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>How</span> beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>that</span> bringeth good tidings; that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good; that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359310" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Thy</span> watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing; for they shall see eye to eye when the Lord shall bring again Zion;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359311" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Break forth into joy; sing together ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359312" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>The Lord hath made bare his holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>arm</span> in the eyes of all the nations, and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359313" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now Abinadi said unto them: Are you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span>, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359314" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>I say unto you, wo be unto you for perverting the ways of the Lord! For if ye understand these things ye have not taught them; therefore, ye have perverted the ways of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359315" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Ye have not applied your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understanding</span>; therefore, ye have not been wise. Therefore, what teach ye this people?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359316" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And they said: We teach the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359317" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And again he said unto them: <span class="page-break" data-page="172"></span>If ye teach the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> of Moses why do ye not keep it? Why do ye set your hearts upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>riches</span>? Why do ye commit whoredoms and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>spend</span> your strength with harlots, yea, and cause this people to commit sin, that the Lord has cause to send me to prophesy against this people, yea, even a great evil against this people?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359318" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Know ye not that I speak the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>truth</span>? Yea, ye know that I speak the truth; and you ought to tremble before God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359319" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it shall come to pass that ye shall be smitten for your iniquities, for ye have said that ye teach the law of Moses. And what know ye concerning the law of Moses? <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Doth</span> salvation come by the law of Moses? What say ye?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359320" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And they answered and said that salvation did come by the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359321" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But now Abinadi said unto them: I know if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>keep</span> the commandments of God ye shall be saved; yea, if ye keep the commandments which the Lord delivered unto Moses in the mount of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Sinai</span>, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359322" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I am</span> the Lord thy God, who hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought</span> thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359323" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Thou shalt have no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other</span> God before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359324" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Thou</span> shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing in heaven above, or things which are in the earth beneath.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359325" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Now Abinadi said unto them, Have ye done all this? I say unto you, Nay, ye have not. And have ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taught</span> this people that they should do all these things? I say unto you, Nay, ye have not.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358390" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358391" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358392" id="study_summary1">Abinadi is protected by divine power—He teaches the Ten Commandments—Salvation does not come by the law of Moses alone—God Himself will make an atonement and redeem His people. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358393" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now when the king had heard these words, he said unto his priests: Away with this fellow, and slay him; for what have we to do with him, for he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mad</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358394" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they stood forth and attempted to lay their hands on him; but he withstood them, and said unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358395" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Touch me not</span>, for God shall smite you if ye lay your hands upon me, for I have not delivered the message which the Lord sent me to deliver; neither have I told you that which ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>requested</span> that I should tell; therefore, God will not suffer that I shall be destroyed at this time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358396" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But I must fulfil the commandments wherewith God has commanded me; and because I have told you the truth ye are angry with me. And again, because I have spoken the word of God ye have judged me that I am mad.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358397" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now it came to pass after Abinadi had spoken these words that the people of king Noah durst not lay their hands on him, for the Spirit of the Lord was upon him; and his face <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shone</span> with exceeding luster, even as Moses’ did while in the mount of Sinai, while speaking with the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358398" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he spake with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and authority from God; and he continued his words, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358399" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Ye see that ye have not power to <span class="page-break" data-page="173"></span>slay me, therefore I finish my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>message</span>. Yea, and I perceive that it cuts you to your hearts because I tell you the truth concerning your iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358400" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, and my words fill you with wonder and amazement, and with anger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358401" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But I finish my message; and then it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>matters</span> not whither I go, if it so be that I am saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358402" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But this much I tell you, what you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>do</span> with me, after this, shall be as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>type</span> and a shadow of things which are to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358403" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now I read unto you the remainder of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span> of God, for I perceive that they are not written in your hearts; I perceive that ye have studied and taught <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>iniquity</span> the most part of your lives.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358404" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, ye remember that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>said</span> unto you: Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of things which are in heaven above, or which are in the earth beneath, or which are in the water under the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358405" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And again: Thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bow</span> down thyself unto them, nor serve them; for I the Lord thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquities of the fathers upon the children, unto the third and fourth generations of them that hate me;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358406" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358407" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain; for the Lord will not hold him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guiltless</span> that taketh his name in vain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358408" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sabbath</span> day, to keep it holy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358409" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358410" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But the seventh day, the sabbath of the Lord thy God, thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358411" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>six</span> days the Lord made heaven and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is; wherefore the Lord blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358412" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Honor</span> thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>father</span> and thy mother, that thy days may be long upon the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358413" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kill</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358414" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Thou shalt not commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>adultery</span>. Thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>steal</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358415" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Thou shalt not bear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false witness</span> against thy neighbor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358416" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covet</span> thy neighbor’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor’s.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358417" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that after Abinadi had made an end of these sayings that he said unto them: Have ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taught</span> this people that they should observe to do all these things for to keep these commandments?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358418" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>I say unto you, Nay; for if ye had, the Lord would not have caused me to come forth and to prophesy evil concerning this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358419" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now ye have said that salvation cometh by the law of Moses. I say unto you that it is expedient that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>keep</span> the law of Moses as yet; but I say unto you, <span class="page-break" data-page="174"></span>that the time shall come when it shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no more</span> be expedient to keep the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358420" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And moreover, I say unto you, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> doth not come by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> alone; and were it not for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>atonement</span>, which God himself shall make for the sins and iniquities of his people, that they must unavoidably perish, notwithstanding the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358421" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strict</span> law; for they were a stiffnecked people, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quick</span> to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358422" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Therefore there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> given them, yea, a law of performances and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordinances</span>, a law which they were to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>observe</span> strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358423" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>But behold, I say unto you, that all these things were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>types</span> of things to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358424" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now, did they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>understand</span> the law? I say unto you, Nay, they did not all understand the law; and this because of the hardness of their hearts; for they understood not that there could not any man be saved <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>except</span> it were through the redemption of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358425" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>For behold, did not Moses prophesy unto them concerning the coming of the Messiah, and that God should redeem his people? Yea, and even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> the prophets who have prophesied ever since the world began—have they not spoken more or less concerning these things?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358426" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Have they not said that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span> himself should come down among the children of men, and take upon him the form of man, and go forth in mighty power upon the face of the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358427" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Yea, and have they not said also that he should bring to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead, and that he, himself, should be oppressed and afflicted?</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358357" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358358" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358359" id="study_summary1">Isaiah speaks messianically—The Messiah’s humiliation and sufferings are set forth—He makes His soul an offering for sin and makes intercession for transgressors—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/53">Isaiah 53</a>. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358360" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Yea, even doth not Isaiah say: Who hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believed</span> our report, and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358361" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of dry ground; he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him there is no beauty that we should desire him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358362" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>He is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>despised</span> and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief; and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358363" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Surely he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>borne</span> our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>griefs</span>, and carried our sorrows; yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="175"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358364" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wounded</span> for our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>transgressions</span>, he was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>healed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358365" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>All we, like <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sheep</span>, have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the Lord hath laid on him the iniquities of us all.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358366" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>opened</span> not his mouth; he is brought as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lamb</span> to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb so he opened not his mouth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358367" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>He was taken from prison and from judgment; and who shall declare his generation? For he was cut off out of the land of the living; for the transgressions of my people was he stricken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358368" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rich</span> in his death; because he had done no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil</span>, neither was any deceit in his mouth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358369" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yet it pleased the Lord to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bruise</span> him; he hath put him to grief; when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin he shall see his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seed</span>, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358370" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>He shall see the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied; by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bear</span> their iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358371" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore will I divide him a portion with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>he</span> shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he hath poured out his soul unto death; and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bore the sins of many, and made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>intercession</span> for the transgressors.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359369" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359370" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359371" id="study_summary1">How Christ is both the Father and the Son—He will make intercession and bear the transgressions of His people—They and all the holy prophets are His seed—He brings to pass the Resurrection—Little children have eternal life. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359372" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now Abinadi said unto them: I would that ye should understand that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span> himself shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> down among the children of men, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redeem</span> his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359373" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And because he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwelleth</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flesh</span> he shall be called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Son of God</span>, and having subjected the flesh to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Father</span>, being the Father and the Son—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358449" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>The Father, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>because</span> he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>conceived</span> by the power of God; and the Son, because of the flesh; thus becoming the Father and Son—</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="176"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358450" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one God</span>, yea, the very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Eternal</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Father</span> of heaven and of earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358451" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And thus the flesh becoming subject to the Spirit, or the Son to the Father, being one God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffereth</span> temptation, and yieldeth not to the temptation, but suffereth himself to be mocked, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scourged</span>, and cast out, and disowned by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>people</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358452" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And after all this, after working many mighty miracles among the children of men, he shall be led, yea, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> Isaiah said, as a sheep before the shearer is dumb, so he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>opened</span> not his mouth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358453" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Yea, even so he shall be led, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>crucified</span>, and slain, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flesh</span> becoming subject even unto death, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>will</span> of the Son being swallowed up in the will of the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358454" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus God breaketh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bands</span> of death, having gained the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>victory</span> over death; giving the Son power to make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>intercession</span> for the children of men—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358455" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Having ascended into heaven, having the bowels of mercy; being filled with compassion towards the children of men; standing betwixt them and justice; having broken the bands of death, taken upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>himself</span> their iniquity and their transgressions, having redeemed them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>satisfied</span> the demands of justice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358456" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now I say unto you, who shall declare his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>generation</span>? Behold, I say unto you, that when his soul has been made an offering for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sin</span> he shall see his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>seed</span>. And now what say ye? And who shall be his seed?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358457" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Behold I say unto you, that whosoever has heard the words of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span>, yea, all the holy prophets who have prophesied concerning the coming of the Lord—I say unto you, that all those who have hearkened unto their words, and believed that the Lord would redeem his people, and have looked forward to that day for a remission of their sins, I say unto you, that these are his seed, or they are the heirs of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kingdom</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358458" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For these are they whose sins <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>he</span> has borne; these are they for whom he has died, to redeem them from their transgressions. And now, are they not his seed?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358459" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, and are not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span>, every one that has opened his mouth to prophesy, that has not fallen into transgression, I mean all the holy prophets ever since the world began? I say unto you that they are his seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358460" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And these are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> who have published peace, who have brought good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tidings</span> of good, who have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>published</span> salvation; and said unto Zion: Thy God reigneth!</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="177"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358461" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And O how beautiful upon the mountains were their feet!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359393" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And again, how beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of those that are still publishing peace!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359394" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And again, how beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of those who shall hereafter publish peace, yea, from this time henceforth and forever!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359395" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And behold, I say unto you, this is not all. For O how beautiful upon the mountains are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>feet</span> of him that bringeth good tidings, that is the founder of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>peace</span>, yea, even the Lord, who has redeemed his people; yea, him who has granted salvation unto his people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359396" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For were it not for the redemption which he hath made for his people, which was prepared from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>foundation</span> of the world, I say unto you, were it not for this, all mankind must have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perished</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359397" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, the bands of death shall be broken, and the Son reigneth, and hath power over the dead; therefore, he bringeth to pass the resurrection of the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359398" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And there cometh a resurrection, even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first resurrection</span>; yea, even a resurrection of those that have been, and who are, and who shall be, even until the resurrection of Christ—for so shall he be called.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359399" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now, the resurrection of all the prophets, and all those that have believed in their words, or all those that have kept the commandments of God, shall come forth in the first resurrection; therefore, they are the first resurrection.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359400" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>They are raised to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwell</span> with God who has redeemed them; thus they have eternal life through Christ, who has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>broken</span> the bands of death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359401" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And these are those who have part in the first resurrection; and these are they that have died before Christ came, in their ignorance, not having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> declared unto them. And thus the Lord bringeth about the restoration of these; and they have a part in the first resurrection, or have eternal life, being redeemed by the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359402" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> also have eternal life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359403" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But behold, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fear</span>, and tremble before God, for ye ought to tremble; for the Lord redeemeth none such that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rebel</span> against him and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>die</span> in their sins; yea, even all those that have perished in their sins ever since the world began, that have wilfully rebelled against God, that have known the commandments of God, and would not keep them; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>these</span> are they that have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>no</span> part in the first <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>resurrection</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359404" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Therefore ought ye not to tremble? For salvation cometh to none such; for the Lord hath redeemed none such; yea, neither can the Lord redeem such; for he cannot deny himself; for he cannot deny <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> when it has its claim.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359405" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now I say unto you that the time shall come that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> of the Lord shall be declared to every nation, kindred, tongue, and people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359406" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, Lord, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>watchmen</span> shall lift up their voice; with the voice together shall they sing; for <span class="page-break" data-page="178"></span>they shall see eye to eye, when the Lord shall bring again Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359407" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359408" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> of our God.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359465" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359466" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359467" id="study_summary1">God redeems men from their lost and fallen state—Those who are carnal remain as though there were no redemption—Christ brings to pass a resurrection to endless life or to endless damnation. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359468" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, it came to pass that after Abinadi had spoken these words he stretched forth his hand and said: The time shall come when all shall see the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> of the Lord; when <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>every</span> nation, kindred, tongue, and people shall see eye to eye and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confess</span> before God that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>judgments</span> are just.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359469" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wicked</span> be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast out</span>, and they shall have cause to howl, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>weep</span>, and wail, and gnash their teeth; and this because they would not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hearken</span> unto the voice of the Lord; therefore the Lord redeemeth them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359470" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carnal</span> and devilish, and the devil has power over them; yea, even that old serpent that did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>beguile</span> our first parents, which was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cause</span> of their fall; which was the cause of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>all</span> mankind becoming carnal, sensual, devilish, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>knowing</span> evil from good, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>subjecting</span> themselves to the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359471" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Thus all mankind were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lost</span>; and behold, they would have been endlessly lost were it not that God redeemed his people from their lost and fallen state.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359472" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But remember that he that persists in his own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carnal</span> nature, and goes on in the ways of sin and rebellion against God, remaineth in his fallen state and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span> hath all power over him. Therefore he is as though there was no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redemption</span> made, being an enemy to God; and also is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>devil</span> an enemy to God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359473" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now if Christ had not come into the world, speaking of things to come <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> though they had already come, there could have been no redemption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359474" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And if Christ had not risen from the dead, or have broken the bands of death that the grave should have no victory, and that death should have no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sting</span>, there could have been no resurrection.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359475" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But there is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span>, therefore the grave hath no victory, and the sting of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> is swallowed up in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359476" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>He is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> and the life of the world; yea, a light that is endless, <span class="page-break" data-page="179"></span>that can never be darkened; yea, and also a life which is endless, that there can be no more death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359477" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Even this mortal shall put on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>immortality</span>, and this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>corruption</span> shall put on incorruption, and shall be brought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stand</span> before the bar of God, to be judged of him according to their works whether they be good or whether they be evil—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359478" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>If they be good, to the resurrection of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>endless</span> life and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>happiness</span>; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>endless</span> damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359479" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Having gone according to their own carnal wills and desires; having never called upon the Lord while the arms of mercy were extended towards them; for the arms of mercy were extended towards them, and they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span>; they being warned of their iniquities and yet they would not depart from them; and they were commanded to repent and yet they would not repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359480" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, ought ye not to tremble and repent of your sins, and remember that only in and through Christ ye can be saved?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359481" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore, if ye teach the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> of Moses, also teach that it is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shadow</span> of those things which are to come—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359482" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Teach them that redemption cometh through Christ the Lord, who is the very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Eternal Father</span>. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 17	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359517" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/17" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 17</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359518" id="title_number1">Chapter 17</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359519" id="study_summary1">Alma believes and writes the words of Abinadi—Abinadi suffers death by fire—He prophesies disease and death by fire upon his murderers. About 148 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359520" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that when Abinadi had finished these sayings, that the king commanded that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> should take him and cause that he should be put to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359521" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But there was one among them whose name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Alma</span>, he also being a descendant of Nephi. And he was a young man, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believed</span> the words which Abinadi had spoken, for he knew concerning the iniquity which Abinadi had testified against them; therefore he began to plead with the king that he would not be angry with Abinadi, but suffer that he might depart in peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359522" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But the king was more wroth, and caused that Alma should be cast out from among them, and sent his servants after him that they might slay him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359523" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But he fled from before them and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hid</span> himself that they found him not. And he being concealed for many days did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> all the words which Abinadi had spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359524" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the king caused that his guards should surround Abinadi and take him; and they bound him and cast him into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359525" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And after three days, having counseled with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span>, he caused that he should again be brought before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359526" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he said unto him: Abinadi, we have found an accusation against thee, and thou art worthy of death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359527" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For thou hast said that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span> himself should come down among <span class="page-break" data-page="180"></span>the children of men; and now, for this cause thou shalt be put to death unless thou wilt recall all the words which thou hast spoken evil concerning me and my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359528" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now Abinadi said unto him: I say unto you, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> recall the words which I have spoken unto you concerning this people, for they are true; and that ye may know of their surety I have suffered myself that I have fallen into your hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359529" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yea, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffer</span> even until death, and I will not recall my words, and they shall stand as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>testimony</span> against you. And if ye slay me ye will shed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>innocent</span> blood, and this shall also stand as a testimony against you at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359530" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now king Noah was about to release him, for he feared his word; for he feared that the judgments of God would come upon him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359531" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> lifted up their voices against him, and began to accuse him, saying: He has reviled the king. Therefore the king was stirred up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anger</span> against him, and he delivered him up that he might be slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359532" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that they took him and bound him, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scourged</span> his skin with faggots, yea, even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359533" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now when the flames began to scorch him, he cried unto them, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359534" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, even as ye have done unto me, so shall it come to pass that thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> shall cause that many shall suffer the pains that I do suffer, even the pains of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> by fire; and this because they believe in the salvation of the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359535" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it will come to pass that ye shall be afflicted with all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>diseases</span> because of your iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359536" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Yea, and ye shall be smitten on every hand, and shall be driven and scattered to and fro, even as a wild flock is driven by wild and ferocious beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359537" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And in that day ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hunted</span>, and ye shall be taken by the hand of your enemies, and then ye shall suffer, as I suffer, the pains of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359538" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Thus God executeth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vengeance</span> upon those that destroy his people. O God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>receive</span> my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359539" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, when <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Abinadi</span> had said these words, he fell, having suffered death by fire; yea, having been put to death because he would not deny the commandments of God, having sealed the truth of his words by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 18	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358462" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/18" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 18</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358463" id="title_number1">Chapter 18</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358464" id="study_summary1">Alma preaches in private—He sets forth the covenant of baptism and baptizes at the waters of Mormon—He organizes the Church of Christ and ordains priests—They support themselves and teach the people—Alma and his people flee from King Noah into the wilderness. About 147–145 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358465" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, it came to pass that Alma, who had fled from the servants of king Noah, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repented</span> of his sins and iniquities, and went about privately among the people, and began to teach the words of Abinadi—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358466" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, concerning that which was to come, and also concerning the resurrection of the dead, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redemption</span> of the people, which was to be brought to pass through the <span class="page-break" data-page="181"></span>power, and sufferings, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> of Christ, and his resurrection and ascension into heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358467" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And as many as would hear his word he did teach. And he taught them privately, that it might not come to the knowledge of the king. And many did believe his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358468" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that as many as did believe him did go forth to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>place</span> which was called Mormon, having received its name from the king, being in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>borders</span> of the land having been infested, by times or at seasons, by wild beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358469" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now, there was in Mormon a fountain of pure water, and Alma resorted thither, there being near the water a thicket of small trees, where he did hide himself in the daytime from the searches of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358470" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that as many as believed him went thither to hear his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358471" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass after many days there were a goodly number gathered together at the place of Mormon, to hear the words of Alma. Yea, all were gathered together that believed on his word, to hear him. And he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teach</span> them, and did preach unto them repentance, and redemption, and faith on the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358472" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that he said unto them: Behold, here are the waters of Mormon (for thus were they called) and now, as ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desirous</span> to come into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fold</span> of God, and to be called his people, and are willing to bear one another’s burdens, that they may be light;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358473" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, and are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>willing</span> to mourn with those that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mourn</span>; yea, and comfort those that stand in need of comfort, and to stand as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>witnesses</span> of God at all times and in all things, and in all places that ye may be in, even until death, that ye may be redeemed of God, and be numbered with those of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>first resurrection</span>, that ye may have eternal life—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358474" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now I say unto you, if this be the desire of your hearts, what have you against being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span> of the Lord, as a witness before him that ye have entered into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenant</span> with him, that ye will serve him and keep his commandments, that he may pour out his Spirit more abundantly upon you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358475" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now when the people had heard these words, they clapped their hands for joy, and exclaimed: This is the desire of our hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358476" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma took Helam, he being one of the first, and went and stood forth in
