the water, and cried, saying: O Lord, pour out thy Spirit upon thy servant, that he may do this work with holiness of heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358477" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And when he had said these words, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord was upon him, and he said: Helam, I baptize thee, having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>authority</span> from the Almighty God, as a testimony that ye have entered into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenant</span> to serve him until you are dead as to the mortal body; and may the Spirit of the Lord be poured out upon you; and may he grant unto you eternal life, through the redemption of Christ, whom he has prepared from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>foundation</span> of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358478" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And after Alma had said these words, both Alma and Helam were <span class="page-break" data-page="182"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>buried</span> in the water; and they arose and came forth out of the water rejoicing, being filled with the Spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358479" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And again, Alma took another, and went forth a second time into the water, and baptized him according to the first, only he did not bury <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>himself</span> again in the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358480" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after this manner he did baptize every one that went forth to the place of Mormon; and they were in number about two hundred and four souls; yea, and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span> in the waters of Mormon, and were filled with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358481" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they were called the church of God, or the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> of Christ, from that time forward. And it came to pass that whosoever was baptized by the power and authority of God was added to his church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358482" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Alma, having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> from God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordained</span> priests; even one priest to every fifty of their number did he ordain to preach unto them, and to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>teach</span> them concerning the things pertaining to the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358483" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And he commanded them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teach</span> nothing save it were the things which he had taught, and which had been spoken by the mouth of the holy prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358484" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Yea, even he commanded them that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> nothing save it were repentance and faith on the Lord, who had redeemed his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358485" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he commanded them that there should be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contention</span> one with another, but that they should look forward with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span> eye, having one faith and one baptism, having their hearts <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knit</span> together in unity and in love one towards another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358486" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And thus he commanded them to preach. And thus they became the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358487" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he commanded them that they should observe the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sabbath</span> day, and keep it holy, and also every day they should give thanks to the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358488" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And he also commanded them that the priests whom he had ordained <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>should</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>labor</span> with their own hands for their support.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358489" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> day in every week that was set apart that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gather</span> themselves together to teach the people, and to worship the Lord their God, and also, as often as it was in their power, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>assemble</span> themselves together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358490" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the priests were not to depend upon the people for their support; but for their labor they were to receive the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grace</span> of God, that they might wax strong in the Spirit, having the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of God, that they might teach with power and authority from God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358491" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And again Alma commanded that the people of the church should impart of their substance, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>every</span> one according to that which he had; if he have more abundantly he should impart more abundantly; and of him that had but little, but <span class="page-break" data-page="183"></span>little should be required; and to him that had not should be given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358492" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And thus they should impart of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>substance</span> of their own free will and good desires towards God, and to those priests that stood in need, yea, and to every needy, naked soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358493" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And this he said unto them, having been commanded of God; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> uprightly before God, imparting to one another both temporally and spiritually according to their needs and their wants.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358494" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now it came to pass that all this was done in Mormon, yea, by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters of Mormon</span>, in the forest that was near the waters of Mormon; yea, the place of Mormon, the waters of Mormon, the forest of Mormon, how beautiful are they to the eyes of them who there came to the knowledge of their Redeemer; yea, and how blessed are they, for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sing</span> to his praise forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358495" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And these things were done in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>borders</span> of the land, that they might not come to the knowledge of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358496" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>But behold, it came to pass that the king, having discovered a movement among the people, sent his servants to watch them. Therefore on the day that they were assembling themselves together to hear the word of the Lord they were discovered unto the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358497" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And now the king said that Alma was stirring up the people to rebellion against him; therefore he sent his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>army</span> to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358498" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that Alma and the people of the Lord were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>apprised</span> of the coming of the king’s army; therefore they took their tents and their families and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>departed</span> into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358499" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And they were in number about <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>four hundred and fifty</span> souls.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 19	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359565" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/19" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 19</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359566" id="title_number1">Chapter 19</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359567" id="study_summary1">Gideon seeks to slay King Noah—The Lamanites invade the land—King Noah suffers death by fire—Limhi rules as a tributary monarch. About 145–121 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359568" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>army</span> of the king returned, having searched in vain for the people of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359569" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now behold, the forces of the king were small, having been reduced, and there began to be a division among the remainder of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359570" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the lesser part began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>breathe</span> out threatenings against the king, and there began to be a great contention among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359571" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now there was a man among them whose name was Gideon, and he being a strong man and an enemy to the king, therefore he drew his sword, and swore in his wrath that he would slay the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359572" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that he fought with the king; and when the king saw that he was about to overpower him, he fled and ran and got upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tower</span> which was near the temple.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359573" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And Gideon pursued after him and was about to get upon the tower to slay the king, and the king cast his eyes round about towards the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shemlon</span>, and behold, the army of the Lamanites were within the borders of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359574" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now the king cried out in the anguish of his soul, saying: Gideon, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spare</span> me, for the Lamanites are upon us, and they will destroy us; yea, they will destroy my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359575" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now the king was not so much concerned about his people as <span class="page-break" data-page="184"></span>he was about his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>own life</span>; nevertheless, Gideon did spare his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359576" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the king commanded the people that they should flee before the Lamanites, and he himself did go before them, and they did flee into the wilderness, with their women and their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359577" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did pursue them, and did overtake them, and began to slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359578" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now it came to pass that the king commanded them that all the men should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>leave</span> their wives and their children, and flee before the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359579" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now there were many that would not leave them, but had rather stay and perish with them. And the rest left their wives and their children and fled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359580" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that those who tarried with their wives and their children caused that their fair daughters should stand forth and plead with the Lamanites that they would not slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359581" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites had compassion on them, for they were charmed with the beauty of their women.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359582" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Therefore the Lamanites did spare their lives, and took them captives and carried them back to the land of Nephi, and granted unto them that they might possess the land, under the conditions that they would deliver up king Noah into the hands of the Lamanites, and deliver up their property, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> half of all they possessed, one half of their gold, and their silver, and all their precious things, and thus they should pay tribute to the king of the Lamanites from year to year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359583" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now there was one of the sons of the king among those that were taken captive, whose name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Limhi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359584" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now Limhi was desirous that his father should not be destroyed; nevertheless, Limhi was not ignorant of the iniquities of his father, he himself being a just man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359585" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Gideon sent men into the wilderness secretly, to search for the king and those that were with him. And it came to pass that they met the people in the wilderness, all save the king and his priests.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359586" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now they had sworn in their hearts that they would return to the land of Nephi, and if their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wives</span> and their children were slain, and also those that had tarried with them, that they would seek revenge, and also perish with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359587" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the king commanded them that they should not return; and they were angry with the king, and caused that he should suffer, even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359588" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they were about to take the priests also and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>put</span> them to death, and they fled before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359589" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that they were about to return to the land of Nephi, and they met the men of Gideon. And the men of Gideon told them of all that had happened to their wives and their children; and that the Lamanites had granted unto them that they might possess the land by paying a tribute to the Lamanites of one half of all they possessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359590" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the people told the men of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gideon</span> that they had slain the king, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> had fled from them farther into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359591" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that after they had ended the ceremony, that they returned to the land of Nephi, rejoicing, because their wives and their children were not slain; and they told Gideon what they had done to the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359592" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="page-break" data-page="185"></span>king of the Lamanites made an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> unto them, that his people should not slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359593" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And also Limhi, being the son of the king, having the kingdom conferred upon him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>by</span> the people, made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>oath</span> unto the king of the Lamanites that his people should pay <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tribute</span> unto him, even one half of all they possessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359594" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that Limhi began to establish the kingdom and to establish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peace</span> among his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359595" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And the king of the Lamanites set <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guards</span> round about the land, that he might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>keep</span> the people of Limhi in the land, that they might not depart into the wilderness; and he did support his guards out of the tribute which he did receive from the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359596" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now king Limhi did have continual peace in his kingdom for the space of two years, that the Lamanites did not molest them nor seek to destroy them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 20	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359620" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/20" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 20</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358553" id="title_number1">Chapter 20</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358554" id="study_summary1">Some Lamanite daughters are abducted by the priests of Noah—The Lamanites wage war upon Limhi and his people—The Lamanite hosts are repulsed and pacified. About 145–123 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358555" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now there was a place in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shemlon</span> where the daughters of the Lamanites did gather themselves together to sing, and to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dance</span>, and to make themselves merry.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358556" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that there was one day a small number of them gathered together to sing and to dance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358557" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now the priests of king Noah, being ashamed to return to the city of Nephi, yea, and also fearing that the people would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slay</span> them, therefore they durst not return to their wives and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>children</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358558" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And having tarried in the wilderness, and having discovered the daughters of the Lamanites, they laid and watched them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358559" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when there were but few of them gathered together to dance, they came forth out of their secret places and took them and carried them into the wilderness; yea, twenty and four of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of the Lamanites they carried into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358560" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that when the Lamanites found that their daughters had been missing, they were angry with the people of Limhi, for they thought it was the people of Limhi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358561" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore they sent their armies forth; yea, even the king himself went before his people; and they went up to the land of Nephi to destroy the people of Limhi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358562" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now Limhi had discovered them from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tower</span>, even all their preparations for war did he discover; therefore he gathered his people together, and laid wait for them in the fields and in the forests.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358563" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that when the Lamanites had come up, that the people of Limhi began to fall upon them from their waiting places, and began to slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358564" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the battle became exceedingly sore, for they fought like lions for their prey.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358565" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that the people of Limhi began to drive the Lamanites before them; yet they were not half so numerous as the Lamanites. But they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fought</span> for their lives, and for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wives</span>, and for their children; therefore they exerted themselves and like dragons did they fight.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358566" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that they found the king of the Lamanites <span class="page-break" data-page="186"></span>among the number of their dead; yet he was not dead, having been wounded and left upon the ground, so speedy was the flight of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358567" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And they took him and bound up his wounds, and brought him before Limhi, and said: Behold, here is the king of the Lamanites; he having received a wound has fallen among their dead, and they have left him; and behold, we have brought him before you; and now let us slay him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358568" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But Limhi said unto them: Ye shall not slay him, but bring him hither that I may see him. And they brought him. And Limhi said unto him: What cause have ye to come up to war against my people? Behold, my people have not broken the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> that I made unto you; therefore, why should ye break the oath which ye made unto my people?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358569" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now the king said: I have broken the oath because thy people did carry away the daughters of my people; therefore, in my anger I did cause my people to come up to war against thy people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358570" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now Limhi had heard nothing concerning this matter; therefore he said: I will search among my people and whosoever has done this thing shall perish. Therefore he caused a search to be made among his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358571" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now when <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gideon</span> had heard these things, he being the king’s captain, he went forth and said unto the king: I pray thee forbear, and do not search this people, and lay not this thing to their charge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358572" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For do ye not remember the priests of thy father, whom this people sought to destroy? And are they not in the wilderness? And are not they the ones who have stolen the daughters of the Lamanites?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358573" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now, behold, and tell the king of these things, that he may tell his people that they may be pacified towards us; for behold they are already preparing to come against us; and behold also there are but few of us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358574" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And behold, they come with their numerous hosts; and except the king doth pacify them towards us we must perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358575" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>For are not the words of Abinadi <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfilled</span>, which he prophesied against us—and all this because we would not hearken unto the words of the Lord, and turn from our iniquities?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358576" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now let us pacify the king, and we fulfil the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> which we have made unto him; for it is better that we should be in bondage than that we should lose our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lives</span>; therefore, let us put a stop to the shedding of so much blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358577" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now Limhi told the king all the things concerning his father, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> that had fled into the wilderness, and attributed the carrying away of their daughters to them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358578" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that the king was pacified towards his people; and he said unto them: Let us go forth to meet my people, without arms; and I swear unto you with an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> that my people shall not slay thy people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358579" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that they followed the king, and went forth without arms to meet the Lamanites. And it came to pass that they did meet the Lamanites; and the king of the Lamanites did bow himself down before them, and did plead in behalf of the people of Limhi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358580" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And when the Lamanites saw the people of Limhi, that they were without arms, they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>compassion</span> on them and were pacified towards them, and returned with their king in peace to their own land.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 21	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358552" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/21" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 21</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="187"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359645" id="title_number1">Chapter 21</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359647" id="study_summary1">Limhi’s people are smitten and defeated by the Lamanites—Limhi’s people meet Ammon and are converted—They tell Ammon of the twenty-four Jaredite plates. About 122–121 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359649" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Limhi and his people returned to the city of Nephi, and began to dwell in the land again in peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359651" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that after many days the Lamanites began again to be stirred up in anger against the Nephites, and they began to come into the borders of the land round about.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359653" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now they durst not slay them, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> which their king had made unto Limhi; but they would smite them on their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cheeks</span>, and exercise authority over them; and began to put heavy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>burdens</span> upon their backs, and drive them as they would a dumb ass—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359655" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Yea, all this was done that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of the Lord might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fulfilled</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359657" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now the afflictions of the Nephites were great, and there was no way that they could deliver themselves out of their hands, for the Lamanites had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>surrounded</span> them on every side.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359659" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that the people began to murmur with the king because of their afflictions; and they began to be desirous to go against them to battle. And they did afflict the king sorely with their complaints; therefore he granted unto them that they should do according to their desires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359661" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they gathered themselves together again, and put on their armor, and went forth against the Lamanites to drive them out of their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359663" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did beat them, and drove them back, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slew</span> many of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359665" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now there was a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span> and lamentation among the people of Limhi, the widow mourning for her husband, the son and the daughter mourning for their father, and the brothers for their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359667" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now there were a great many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>widows</span> in the land, and they did cry mightily from day to day, for a great fear of the Lamanites had come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359669" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that their continual cries did stir up the remainder of the people of Limhi to anger against the Lamanites; and they went again to battle, but they were driven back again, suffering much loss.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359671" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, they went again even the third time, and suffered in the like manner; and those that were not slain returned again to the city of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359673" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And they did humble themselves even to the dust, subjecting themselves to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>yoke</span> of bondage, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>submitting</span> themselves to be smitten, and to be driven to and fro, and burdened, according to the desires of their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359675" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> themselves even in the depths of humility; and they did cry mightily to God; yea, even all the day long did they cry unto their God that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> them out of their afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359677" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now the Lord was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slow</span> to hear their cry because of their iniquities; nevertheless the Lord <span class="page-break" data-page="188"></span>did hear their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cries</span>, and began to soften the hearts of the Lamanites that they began to ease their burdens; yet the Lord did not see fit to deliver them out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359679" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that they began to prosper by degrees in the land, and began to raise grain more abundantly, and flocks, and herds, that they did not suffer with hunger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359681" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now there was a great number of women, more than there was of men; therefore king Limhi commanded that every man should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>impart</span> to the support of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>widows</span> and their children, that they might not perish with hunger; and this they did because of the greatness of their number that had been slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359683" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now the people of Limhi kept together in a body as much as it was possible, and secured their grain and their flocks;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359685" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And the king himself did not trust his person without the walls of the city, unless he took his guards with him, fearing that he might by some means fall into the hands of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359687" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he caused that his people should watch the land round about, that by some means they might take those priests that fled into the wilderness, who had stolen the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of the Lamanites, and that had caused such a great destruction to come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359689" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>For they were desirous to take them that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>punish</span> them; for they had come into the land of Nephi by night, and carried off their grain and many of their precious things; therefore they laid wait for them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359691" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that there was no more disturbance between the Lamanites and the people of Limhi, even until the time that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammon</span> and his brethren came into the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359693" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the king having been without the gates of the city with his guard, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>discovered</span> Ammon and his brethren; and supposing them to be priests of Noah therefore he caused that they should be taken, and bound, and cast into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prison</span>. And had they been the priests of Noah he would have caused that they should be put to death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359695" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>But when he found that they were not, but that they were his brethren, and had come from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>, he was filled with exceedingly great joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359697" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now king Limhi had sent, previous to the coming of Ammon, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>small</span> number of men to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>search</span> for the land of Zarahemla; but they could not find it, and they were lost in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359699" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Nevertheless, they did find a land which had been peopled; yea, a land which was covered with dry <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bones</span>; yea, a land which had been peopled and which had been destroyed; and they, having supposed it to be the land of Zarahemla, returned to the land of Nephi, having arrived in the borders of the land not many days before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>coming</span> of Ammon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359701" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And they brought a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> with them, even a record of the people whose bones they had found; and it was engraven on plates of ore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359703" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now Limhi was again filled with joy on learning from the mouth of Ammon that king Mosiah had a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gift</span> from God, whereby he could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>interpret</span> such engravings; yea, and Ammon also did rejoice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359705" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yet Ammon and his brethren were filled with sorrow because so <span class="page-break" data-page="189"></span>many of their brethren had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359707" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And also that king Noah and his priests had caused the people to commit so many sins and iniquities against God; and they also did mourn for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> of Abinadi; and also for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>departure</span> of Alma and the people that went with him, who had formed a church of God through the strength and power of God, and faith on the words which had been spoken by Abinadi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359709" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Yea, they did mourn for their departure, for they knew not whither they had fled. Now they would have gladly joined with them, for they themselves had entered into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> with God to serve him and keep his commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359711" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now since the coming of Ammon, king Limhi had also entered into a covenant with God, and also many of his people, to serve him and keep his commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359713" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that king Limhi and many of his people were desirous to be baptized; but there was none in the land that had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> from God. And Ammon declined doing this thing, considering himself an unworthy servant.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359715" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Therefore they did not at that time form themselves into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, waiting upon the Spirit of the Lord. Now they were desirous to become even as Alma and his brethren, who had fled into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359717" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>They were desirous to be baptized as a witness and a testimony that they were willing to serve God with all their hearts; nevertheless they did prolong the time; and an account of their baptism shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>given</span> hereafter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359719" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And now all the study of Ammon and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>his</span> people, and king Limhi and his people, was to deliver themselves out of the hands of the Lamanites and from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 22	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358597" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/22" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 22</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358598" id="title_number1">Chapter 22</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358599" id="study_summary1">Plans are made for the people to escape from Lamanite bondage—The Lamanites are made drunk—The people escape, return to Zarahemla, and become subject to King Mosiah. About 121–120 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358600" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that Ammon and king Limhi began to consult with the people how they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> themselves out of bondage; and even they did cause that all the people should gather themselves together; and this they did that they might have the voice of the people concerning the matter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358601" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that they could find no way to deliver themselves out of bondage, except it were to take their women and children, and their flocks, and their herds, and their tents, and depart into the wilderness; for the Lamanites being so numerous, it was impossible for the people of Limhi to contend with them, thinking to deliver themselves out of bondage by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358602" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gideon</span> went forth and stood before the king, and said unto him: Now O king, thou hast hitherto hearkened unto my words many times when we have been contending with our brethren, the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358603" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now O king, if thou hast not found me to be an unprofitable servant, or if thou hast hitherto listened to my words in any degree, and they have been of service to thee, even so I desire that thou wouldst listen to my words at this time, and I will be thy servant and deliver this people out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358604" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the king granted unto him that he might speak. And Gideon said unto him:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358605" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold the back pass, through the back wall, on the back side of the city. The Lamanites, or the <span class="page-break" data-page="190"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guards</span> of the Lamanites, by night are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>drunken</span>; therefore let us send a proclamation among all this people that they gather together their flocks and herds, that they may drive them into the wilderness by night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358606" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And I will go according to thy command and pay the last <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tribute</span> of wine to the Lamanites, and they will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>drunken</span>; and we will pass through the secret pass on the left of their camp when they are drunken and asleep.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358607" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Thus we will depart with our women and our children, our flocks, and our herds into the wilderness; and we will travel around the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shilom</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358608" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that the king hearkened unto the words of Gideon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358609" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And king Limhi caused that his people should gather their flocks together; and he sent the tribute of wine to the Lamanites; and he also sent more wine, as a present unto them; and they did drink freely of the wine which king Limhi did send unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358610" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that the people of king Limhi did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>depart</span> by night into the wilderness with their flocks and their herds, and they went round about the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Shilom</span> in the wilderness, and bent their course towards the land of Zarahemla, being led by Ammon and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358611" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And they had taken all their gold, and silver, and their precious things, which they could carry, and also their provisions with them, into the wilderness; and they pursued their journey.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358612" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And after being many days in the wilderness they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>arrived</span> in the land of Zarahemla, and joined Mosiah’s people, and became his subjects.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358613" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Mosiah <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>received</span> them with joy; and he also received their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span>, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>records</span> which had been found by the people of Limhi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358614" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now it came to pass when the Lamanites had found that the people of Limhi had departed out of the land by night, that they sent an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>army</span> into the wilderness to pursue them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358615" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after they had pursued them two days, they could no longer follow their tracks; therefore they were lost in the wilderness.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 23	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359840" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/23" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 23</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128359841" id="intro1">An account of Alma and the people of the Lord, who were driven into the wilderness by the people of King Noah.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128359842" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 23 and 24.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359843" id="title_number1">Chapter 23</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359844" id="study_summary1">Alma refuses to be king—He serves as high priest—The Lord chastens His people, and the Lamanites conquer the land of Helam—Amulon, leader of King Noah’s wicked priests, rules subject to the Lamanite monarch. About 145–121 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359845" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now Alma, having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>warned</span> of the Lord that the armies of king Noah would come upon them, and having made it known to his people, therefore they gathered together their flocks, and took of their grain, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>departed</span> into the wilderness before the armies of king Noah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359846" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the Lord did strengthen them, that the people of king Noah could not overtake them to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359847" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they fled <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eight</span> days’ journey into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359848" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they came to a land, yea, even a very beautiful and pleasant land, a land of pure water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359849" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they pitched their tents, and began to till the ground, and <span class="page-break" data-page="191"></span>began to build buildings; yea, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>industrious</span>, and did labor exceedingly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359850" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And the people were desirous that Alma should be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span>, for he was beloved by his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359851" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But he said unto them: Behold, it is not expedient that we should have a king; for thus saith the Lord: Ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> esteem one flesh above another, or one man shall not think himself above another; therefore I say unto you it is not expedient that ye should have a king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359852" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Nevertheless, if it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>were</span> possible that ye could always have just men to be your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kings</span> it would be well for you to have a king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359853" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquity</span> of king Noah and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span>; and I myself was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>caught</span> in a snare, and did many things which were abominable in the sight of the Lord, which caused me sore <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>repentance</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359854" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Nevertheless, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>after</span> much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tribulation</span>, the Lord did hear my cries, and did answer my prayers, and has made me an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>instrument</span> in his hands in bringing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>so</span> many of you to a knowledge of his truth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359855" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Nevertheless, in this I do not glory, for I am unworthy to glory of myself.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359856" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now I say unto you, ye have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oppressed</span> by king Noah, and have been in bondage to him and his priests, and have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought</span> into iniquity by them; therefore ye were bound with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bands</span> of iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359857" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now as ye have been delivered by the power of God out of these bonds; yea, even out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hands</span> of king Noah and his people, and also from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bonds</span> of iniquity, even so I desire that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stand fast</span> in this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>liberty</span> wherewith ye have been made free, and that ye trust <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>no man</span> to be a king over you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359858" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And also trust no one to be your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teacher</span> nor your minister, except he be a man of God, walking in his ways and keeping his commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359859" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Thus did Alma teach his people, that every man should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>neighbor</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>as</span> himself, that there should be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>contention</span> among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359860" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, Alma was their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priest</span>, he being the founder of their church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359861" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that none received <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> to preach or to teach except it were by him from God. Therefore he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>consecrated</span> all their priests and all their teachers; and none were consecrated except they were just men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359862" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Therefore they did watch over their people, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nourish</span> them with things pertaining to righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359863" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that they began to prosper exceedingly in the land; and they called the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Helam</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359864" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they did multiply and prosper exceedingly in the land of Helam; and they built a city, which they called the city of Helam.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359865" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Nevertheless the Lord seeth fit <span class="page-break" data-page="192"></span>to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chasten</span> his people; yea, he trieth their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>patience</span> and their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359866" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Nevertheless—whosoever putteth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trust</span> in him the same shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lifted up</span> at the last day. Yea, and thus it was with this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359867" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For behold, I will show unto you that they were brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>, and none could deliver them but the Lord their God, yea, even the God of Abraham and Isaac and of Jacob.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359868" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that he did deliver them, and he did show forth his mighty power unto them, and great were their rejoicings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359869" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For behold, it came to pass that while they were in the land of Helam, yea, in the city of Helam, while tilling the land round about, behold an army of the Lamanites was in the borders of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359870" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now it came to pass that the brethren of Alma fled from their fields, and gathered themselves together in the city of Helam; and they were much frightened because of the appearance of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359871" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>But Alma went forth and stood among them, and exhorted them that they should not be frightened, but that they should remember the Lord their God and he would deliver them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359872" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Therefore they hushed their fears, and began to cry unto the Lord that he would soften the hearts of the Lamanites, that they would spare them, and their wives, and their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359873" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did soften the hearts of the Lamanites. And Alma and his brethren went forth and delivered themselves up into their hands; and the Lamanites took possession of the land of Helam.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359874" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Now the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>armies</span> of the Lamanites, which had followed after the people of king Limhi, had been lost in the wilderness for many days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359875" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And behold, they had found those priests of king Noah, in a place which they called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span>; and they had begun to possess the land of Amulon and had begun to till the ground.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359876" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Now the name of the leader of those priests was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359877" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that Amulon did plead with the Lamanites; and he also sent forth their wives, who were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>daughters</span> of the Lamanites, to plead with their brethren, that they should not destroy their husbands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359878" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And the Lamanites had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>compassion</span> on Amulon and his brethren, and did not destroy them, because of their wives.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359879" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span> and his brethren did join the Lamanites, and they were traveling in the wilderness in search of the land of Nephi when they discovered the land of Helam, which was possessed by Alma and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359880" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites promised unto Alma and his brethren, that if they would show them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>way</span> which led to the land of Nephi that they would grant unto them their lives and their liberty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359881" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>But after Alma had shown them the way that led to the land of Nephi the Lamanites would not keep their promise; but they set <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guards</span> round about the land of Helam, over Alma and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359882" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And the remainder of them went to the land of Nephi; and a part of them returned to the land of Helam, and also brought with them the wives and the children of the guards who had been left in the land.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="193"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359883" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And the king of the Lamanites had granted unto Amulon that he should be a king and a ruler over his people, who were in the land of Helam; nevertheless he should have no power to do anything contrary to the will of the king of the Lamanites.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 24	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358630" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/24" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 24</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358631" id="title_number1">Chapter 24</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358632" id="study_summary1">Amulon persecutes Alma and his people—They are to be put to death if they pray—The Lord makes their burdens seem light—He delivers them from bondage, and they return to Zarahemla. About 145–120 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358633" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Amulon did gain favor in the eyes of the king of the Lamanites; therefore, the king of the Lamanites granted unto him and his brethren that they should be appointed teachers over his people, yea, even over the people who were in the land of Shemlon, and in the land of Shilom, and in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Amulon</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358634" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For the Lamanites had taken possession of all these lands; therefore, the king of the Lamanites had appointed kings over all these lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358635" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now the name of the king of the Lamanites was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Laman</span>, being called after the name of his father; and therefore he was called king Laman. And he was king over a numerous people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358636" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And he appointed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teachers</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brethren</span> of Amulon in every land which was possessed by his people; and thus the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>language</span> of Nephi began to be taught among all the people of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358637" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they were a people friendly one with another; nevertheless they knew not God; neither did the brethren of Amulon teach them anything concerning the Lord their God, neither the law of Moses; nor did they teach them the words of Abinadi;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358638" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But they taught them that they should keep their record, and that they might write one to another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358639" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And thus the Lamanites began to increase in riches, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trade</span> one with another and wax great, and began to be a cunning and a wise people, as to the wisdom of the world, yea, a very cunning people, delighting in all manner of wickedness and plunder, except it were among their own brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358640" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span> began to exercise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>authority</span> over Alma and his brethren, and began to persecute him, and cause that his children should persecute their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358641" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For Amulon knew Alma, that he had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> of the king’s priests, and that it was he that believed the words of Abinadi and was driven out before the king, and therefore he was wroth with him; for he was subject to king Laman, yet he exercised authority over them, and put <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tasks</span> upon them, and put <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>task-masters</span> over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358642" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that so great were their afflictions that they began to cry mightily to God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358643" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And Amulon commanded them that they should stop their cries; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>put</span> guards over them to watch them, that whosoever should be found calling upon God should be put to death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358644" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And Alma and his people did not raise their voices to the Lord their God, but did pour out their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> to him; and he did know the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thoughts</span> of their hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358645" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>came</span> to pass that the voice of the Lord came to them in their afflictions, saying: Lift up <span class="page-break" data-page="194"></span>your heads and be of good comfort, for I know of the covenant which ye have made unto me; and I will covenant with my people and deliver them out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358646" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And I will also ease the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>burdens</span> which are put upon your shoulders, that even you cannot feel them upon your backs, even while you are in bondage; and this will I do that ye may stand as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>witnesses</span> for me hereafter, and that ye may know of a surety that I, the Lord God, do visit my people in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>afflictions</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358647" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now it came to pass that the burdens which were laid upon Alma and his brethren were made light; yea, the Lord did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strengthen</span> them that they could bear up their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burdens</span> with ease, and they did submit cheerfully and with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>patience</span> to all the will of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358648" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that so great was their faith and their patience that the voice of the Lord came unto them again, saying: Be of good comfort, for on the morrow I will deliver you out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358649" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And he said unto Alma: Thou shalt go before this people, and I will go <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>with thee</span> and deliver this people out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358650" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now it came to pass that Alma and his people in the night-time gathered their flocks together, and also of their grain; yea, even all the night-time were they gathering their flocks together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358651" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And in the morning the Lord caused a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deep sleep</span> to come upon the Lamanites, yea, and all their task-masters were in a profound sleep.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358652" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And Alma and his people departed into the wilderness; and when they had traveled all day they pitched their tents in a valley, and they called the valley Alma, because he led their way in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358653" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Yea, and in the valley of Alma they poured out their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thanks</span> to God because he had been merciful unto them, and eased their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burdens</span>, and had delivered them out of bondage; for they were in bondage, and none could deliver them except it were the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358654" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And they gave <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thanks</span> to God, yea, all their men and all their women and all their children that could speak lifted their voices in the praises of their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358655" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now the Lord said unto Alma: Haste thee and get thou and this people out of this land, for the Lamanites have awakened and do pursue thee; therefore get thee out of this land, and I will stop the Lamanites in this valley that they come no further in pursuit of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358656" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that they departed out of the valley, and took their journey into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358657" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And after they had been in the wilderness <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> days they arrived in the land of Zarahemla; and king Mosiah did also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>receive</span> them with joy.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
