Mosiah 25	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358687" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/25" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 25</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358688" id="title_number1">Chapter 25</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358689" id="study_summary1">The descendants of Mulek at Zarahemla become Nephites—They learn of the people of Alma and of Zeniff—Alma baptizes Limhi and all his people—Mosiah authorizes Alma to organize the Church of God. About 120 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358690" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now king Mosiah caused that all the people should be gathered together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358691" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now there were not so many of the children of Nephi, or so many of those who were descendants of <span class="page-break" data-page="195"></span>Nephi, as there were of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Zarahemla, who was a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mulek</span>, and those who came with him into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358692" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And there were not so many of the people of Nephi and of the people of Zarahemla as there were of the Lamanites; yea, they were not half so numerous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358693" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now all the people of Nephi were assembled together, and also all the people of Zarahemla, and they were gathered together in two bodies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358694" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that Mosiah did read, and caused to be read, the records of Zeniff to his people; yea, he read the records of the people of Zeniff, from the time they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>left</span> the land of Zarahemla until they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>returned</span> again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358695" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he also read the account of Alma and his brethren, and all their afflictions, from the time they left the land of Zarahemla until the time they returned again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358696" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, when Mosiah had made an end of reading the records, his people who tarried in the land were struck with wonder and amazement.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358697" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For they knew not what to think; for when they beheld those that had been delivered <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>out</span> of bondage they were filled with exceedingly great joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358698" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And again, when they thought of their brethren who had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span> by the Lamanites they were filled with sorrow, and even shed many tears of sorrow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358699" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And again, when they thought of the immediate goodness of God, and his power in delivering Alma and his brethren out of the hands of the Lamanites and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>, they did raise their voices and give thanks to God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358700" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And again, when they thought upon the Lamanites, who were their brethren, of their sinful and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>polluted</span> state, they were filled with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pain</span> and anguish for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>welfare</span> of their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358701" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that those who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>were</span> the children of Amulon and his brethren, who had taken to wife the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>daughters</span> of the Lamanites, were displeased with the conduct of their fathers, and they would no longer be called by the names of their fathers, therefore they took upon themselves the name of Nephi, that they might be called the children of Nephi and be numbered among those who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>called</span> Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358702" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now all the people of Zarahemla were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numbered</span> with the Nephites, and this because the kingdom had been conferred upon none but those who were descendants of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358703" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now it came to pass that when Mosiah had made an end of speaking and reading to the people, he desired that Alma should also speak to the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358704" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And Alma did speak unto them, when they were assembled together in large bodies, and he went from one body to another, preaching unto the people repentance and faith on the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358705" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And he did exhort the people of Limhi and his brethren, all those that had been delivered out of bondage, that they should remember that it was the Lord that did deliver them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358706" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that after Alma had taught the people many things, and had made an end of speaking to them, that king Limhi was desirous that he might be baptized; and all his people were <span class="page-break" data-page="196"></span>desirous that they might be baptized also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358707" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Therefore, Alma did go forth into the water and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptize</span> them; yea, he did baptize them after the manner he did his brethren in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>waters of Mormon</span>; yea, and as many as he did baptize did belong to the church of God; and this because of their belief on the words of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358708" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that king Mosiah granted unto Alma that he might establish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>churches</span> throughout all the land of Zarahemla; and gave him power to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordain</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>priests</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>teachers</span> over every church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358709" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now this was done because there were so many people that they could not all be governed by one teacher; neither could they all hear the word of God in one assembly;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358710" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Therefore they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>assemble</span> themselves together in different bodies, being called churches; every church having their priests and their teachers, and every priest preaching the word according as it was delivered to him by the mouth of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358711" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And thus, notwithstanding there being many churches they were all one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, yea, even the church of God; for there was nothing preached in all the churches except it were repentance and faith in God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358712" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now there were seven churches in the land of Zarahemla. And it came to pass that whosoever were desirous to take upon them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> of Christ, or of God, they did join the churches of God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358713" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And they were called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of God. And the Lord did pour out his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span> upon them, and they were blessed, and prospered in the land.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 26	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358739" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/26" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 26</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358740" id="title_number1">Chapter 26</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358741" id="study_summary1">Many members of the Church are led into sin by unbelievers—Alma is promised eternal life—Those who repent and are baptized gain forgiveness—Church members in sin who repent and confess to Alma and to the Lord will be forgiven; otherwise, they will not be numbered among the people of the Church. About 120–100 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359931" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that there were many of the rising generation that could not understand the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of king Benjamin, being little children at the time he spake unto his people; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not believe</span> the tradition of their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359932" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>They did not believe what had been said concerning the resurrection of the dead, neither did they believe concerning the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359933" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span> they could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understand</span> the word of God; and their hearts were hardened.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359934" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they would not be baptized; neither would they join the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>. And they were a separate people as to their faith, and remained so ever after, even in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carnal</span> and sinful state; for they would not call upon the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359935" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now in the reign of Mosiah they were not half so numerous as the people of God; but because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissensions</span> among the brethren they became more numerous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359936" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deceive</span> many with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flattering</span> words, who were in the church, and did cause them to commit many sins; therefore it became expedient <span class="page-break" data-page="197"></span>that those who committed sin, that were in the church, should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>admonished</span> by the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359937" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that they were brought before the priests, and delivered up unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> by the teachers; and the priests brought them before Alma, who was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>high priest</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359938" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now king Mosiah had given Alma the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> over the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359939" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that Alma did not know concerning them; but there were many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span> against them; yea, the people stood and testified of their iniquity in abundance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359940" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now there had not any such thing happened before in the church; therefore Alma was troubled in his spirit, and he caused that they should be brought before the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359941" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he said unto the king: Behold, here are many whom we have brought before thee, who are accused of their brethren; yea, and they have been taken in divers iniquities. And they do not repent of their iniquities; therefore we have brought them before thee, that thou mayest judge them according to their crimes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359942" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But king Mosiah said unto Alma: Behold, I judge them not; therefore I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> them into thy hands to be judged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359943" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now the spirit of Alma was again troubled; and he went and inquired of the Lord what he should do concerning this matter, for he feared that he should do wrong in the sight of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359944" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that after he had poured out his whole soul to God, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the Lord came to him, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359945" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Blessed art thou, Alma, and blessed are they who were baptized in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters of Mormon</span>. Thou art blessed because of thy exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in the words alone of my servant Abinadi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359946" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And blessed are they because of their exceeding faith in the words alone which thou hast spoken unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359947" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And blessed art thou because thou hast established a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> among this people; and they shall be established, and they shall be my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359948" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, blessed is this people who are willing to bear my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span>; for in my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span> shall they be called; and they are mine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359949" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And because thou hast inquired of me concerning the transgressor, thou art blessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359950" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Thou art my servant; and I covenant with thee that thou shalt have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eternal life</span>; and thou shalt serve me and go forth in my name, and shalt gather together my sheep.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359951" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he that will hear my voice shall be my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sheep</span>; and him shall ye receive into the church, and him will I also receive.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359952" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span>; whosoever is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>baptized</span> shall be baptized unto repentance. And whomsoever ye receive shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>believe</span> in my name; and him will I freely <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>forgive</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359953" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For it is I that taketh upon me the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span> of the world; for it is I that hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>created</span> them; and it is I that granteth unto him that believeth <span class="page-break" data-page="198"></span>unto the end a place at my right hand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359954" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, in my name are they called; and if they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> me they shall come forth, and shall have a place eternally at my right hand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359955" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it shall come to pass that when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>second</span> trump shall sound then shall they that never <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knew</span> me come forth and shall stand before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359956" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And then shall they know that I am the Lord their God, that I am their Redeemer; but they would not be redeemed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359957" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And then I will confess unto them that I never <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knew</span> them; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>depart</span> into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>everlasting</span> fire prepared for the devil and his angels.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359958" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Therefore I say unto you, that he that will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hear</span> my voice, the same shall ye not receive into my church, for him I will not receive at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359959" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore I say unto you, Go; and whosoever transgresseth against me, him shall ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>according</span> to the sins which he has committed; and if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confess</span> his sins before thee and me, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>repenteth</span> in the sincerity of his heart, him shall ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>forgive</span>, and I will forgive him also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359960" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Yea, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> often as my people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repent</span> will I forgive them their trespasses against me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359961" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And ye shall also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgive</span> one another your trespasses; for verily I say unto you, he that forgiveth not his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>neighbor’s</span> trespasses when he says that he repents, the same hath brought himself under condemnation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359962" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Now I say unto you, Go; and whosoever will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not repent</span> of his sins the same shall not be numbered among my people; and this shall be observed from this time forward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359963" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass when Alma had heard these words he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrote</span> them down that he might have them, and that he might judge the people of that church according to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359964" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that Alma went and judged those that had been taken in iniquity, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359965" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And whosoever repented of their sins and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>confess</span> them, them he did number among the people of the church;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359966" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And those that would not confess their sins and repent of their iniquity, the same were not numbered among the people of the church, and their names were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blotted out</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359967" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that Alma did regulate all the affairs of the church; and they began again to have peace and to prosper exceedingly in the affairs of the church, walking circumspectly before God, receiving many, and baptizing many.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359968" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And now all these things did Alma and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fellow laborers</span> do who were over the church, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walking</span> in all diligence, teaching the word of God in all things, suffering all manner of afflictions, being persecuted by all those who did not belong to the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359969" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And they did admonish their <span class="page-break" data-page="199"></span>brethren; and they were also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>admonished</span>, every one by the word of God, according to his sins, or to the sins which he had committed, being commanded of God to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span> without ceasing, and to give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thanks</span> in all things.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 27	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128360027" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/27" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 27</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128360028" id="title_number1">Chapter 27</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128360029" id="study_summary1">Mosiah forbids persecution and enjoins equality—Alma the younger and the four sons of Mosiah seek to destroy the Church—An angel appears and commands them to cease their evil course—Alma is struck dumb—All mankind must be born again to gain salvation—Alma and the sons of Mosiah declare glad tidings. About 100–92 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360030" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that the persecutions which were inflicted on the church by the unbelievers became so great that the church began to murmur, and complain to their leaders concerning the matter; and they did complain to Alma. And Alma laid the case before their king, Mosiah. And Mosiah <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consulted</span> with his priests.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360031" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that king Mosiah sent a proclamation throughout the land round about that there should not any unbeliever <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persecute</span> any of those who belonged to the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360032" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And there was a strict command throughout all the churches that there should be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persecutions</span> among them, that there should be an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>equality</span> among all men;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360033" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>That they should let no pride nor haughtiness disturb their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peace</span>; that every man should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>esteem</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>neighbor</span> as himself, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>laboring</span> with their own hands for their support.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360034" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and all their priests and teachers <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>should</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>labor</span> with their own hands for their support, in all cases save it were in sickness, or in much want; and doing these things, they did abound in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360035" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And there began to be much peace again in the land; and the people began to be very numerous, and began to scatter abroad upon the face of the earth, yea, on the north and on the south, on the east and on the west, building large cities and villages in all quarters of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360036" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visit</span> them and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prosper</span> them, and they became a large and wealthy people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360037" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the sons of Mosiah were numbered among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelievers</span>; and also one of the sons of Alma was numbered among them, he being called Alma, after his father; nevertheless, he became a very wicked and an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>idolatrous</span> man. And he was a man of many words, and did speak much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>flattery</span> to the people; therefore he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>led</span> many of the people to do after the manner of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>iniquities</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360038" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he became a great hinderment to the prosperity of the church of God; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stealing</span> away the hearts of the people; causing much dissension among the people; giving a chance for the enemy of God to exercise his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360039" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now it came to pass that while he was going about to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the church of God, for he did go about secretly with the sons of Mosiah seeking to destroy the church, <span class="page-break" data-page="200"></span>and to lead astray the people of the Lord, contrary to the commandments of God, or even the king—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360040" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And as I said unto you, as they were going about <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebelling</span> against God, behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angel</span> of the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>appeared</span> unto them; and he descended as it were in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cloud</span>; and he spake as it were with a voice of thunder, which caused the earth to shake upon which they stood;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360041" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And so great was their astonishment, that they fell to the earth, and understood not the words which he spake unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360042" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Nevertheless he cried again, saying: Alma, arise and stand forth, for why persecutest thou the church of God? For the Lord hath said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>This</span> is my church, and I will establish it; and nothing shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>overthrow</span> it, save it is the transgression of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360043" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And again, the angel said: Behold, the Lord hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heard</span> the prayers of his people, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prayers</span> of his servant, Alma, who is thy father; for he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prayed</span> with much faith concerning thee that thou mightest be brought to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knowledge</span> of the truth; therefore, for this purpose have I come to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>convince</span> thee of the power and authority of God, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>prayers</span> of his servants might be answered according to their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360044" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now behold, can ye dispute the power of God? For behold, doth not my voice shake the earth? And can ye not also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>behold</span> me before you? And I am sent from God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360045" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now I say unto thee: Go, and remember the captivity of thy fathers in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Helam</span>, and in the land of Nephi; and remember how great things he has done for them; for they were in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span>, and he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>delivered</span> them. And now I say unto thee, Alma, go thy way, and seek to destroy the church no more, that their prayers may be answered, and this even if thou wilt of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>thyself</span> be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>cast off</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360046" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now it came to pass that these were the last words which the angel spake unto Alma, and he departed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360047" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And now Alma and those that were with him fell again to the earth, for great was their astonishment; for with their own eyes they had beheld an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of the Lord; and his voice was as thunder, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shook</span> the earth; and they knew that there was nothing save the power of God that could shake the earth and cause it to tremble as though it would part asunder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360048" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now the astonishment of Alma was so great that he became <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dumb</span>, that he could not open his mouth; yea, and he became weak, even that he could not move his hands; therefore he was taken by those that were with him, and carried helpless, even until he was laid before his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360049" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they rehearsed unto his father all that had happened unto them; and his father rejoiced, for he knew that it was the power of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360050" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he caused that a multitude should be gathered together that they might witness what the Lord <span class="page-break" data-page="201"></span>had done for his son, and also for those that were with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360051" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And he caused that the priests should assemble themselves together; and they began to fast, and to pray to the Lord their God that he would open the mouth of Alma, that he might speak, and also that his limbs might receive their strength—that the eyes of the people might be opened to see and know of the goodness and glory of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360052" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass after they had fasted and prayed for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>two</span> days and two nights, the limbs of Alma received their strength, and he stood up and began to speak unto them, bidding them to be of good comfort:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360053" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For, said he, I have repented of my sins, and have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeemed</span> of the Lord; behold I am born of the Spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360054" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And the Lord said unto me: Marvel not that all mankind, yea, men and women, all nations, kindreds, tongues and people, must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born again</span>; yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born of God</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>changed</span> from their carnal and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fallen</span> state, to a state of righteousness, being redeemed of God, becoming his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sons</span> and daughters;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360055" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And thus they become new creatures; and unless they do this, they can in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nowise</span> inherit the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360056" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>I say unto you, unless this be the case, they must be cast off; and this I know, because I was like to be cast off.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360057" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Nevertheless, after <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wading</span> through much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tribulation</span>, repenting nigh unto death, the Lord in mercy hath seen fit to snatch me out of an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>everlasting</span> burning, and I am born of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360058" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>My soul hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeemed</span> from the gall of bitterness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bonds</span> of iniquity. I was in the darkest abyss; but now I behold the marvelous light of God. My soul was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>racked</span> with eternal torment; but I am snatched, and my soul is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>pained</span> no more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360059" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>I rejected my Redeemer, and denied that which had been spoken of by our fathers; but now that they may foresee that he will come, and that he remembereth every creature of his creating, he will make himself manifest unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360060" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>every</span> knee shall bow, and every tongue confess before him. Yea, even at the last day, when all men shall stand to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> of him, then shall they confess that he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>God</span>; then shall they confess, who live <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>without</span> God in the world, that the judgment of an everlasting punishment is just upon them; and they shall quake, and tremble, and shrink beneath the glance of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>all-searching</span> eye.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360061" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma began from this time forward to teach the people, and those who were with Alma at the time the angel appeared unto them, traveling round about through all the land, publishing to all the people the things which they had heard and seen, and preaching the word of God in much tribulation, being greatly persecuted by those who were unbelievers, being smitten by many of them.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="202"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360062" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But notwithstanding all this, they did impart much consolation to the church, confirming their faith, and exhorting them with long-suffering and much travail to keep the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360063" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And four of them were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons of Mosiah</span>; and their names were Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner, and Himni; these were the names of the sons of Mosiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360064" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And they traveled throughout all the land of Zarahemla, and among all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> who were under the reign of king Mosiah, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>zealously</span> striving to repair all the injuries which they had done to the church, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confessing</span> all their sins, and publishing all the things which they had seen, and explaining the prophecies and the scriptures to all who desired to hear them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360065" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And thus they were instruments in the hands of God in bringing many to the knowledge of the truth, yea, to the knowledge of their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360066" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And how blessed are they! For they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>publish</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>peace</span>; they did publish good tidings of good; and they did declare unto the people that the Lord reigneth.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 28	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358742" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/28" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 28</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358743" id="title_number1">Chapter 28</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358744" id="study_summary1">The sons of Mosiah go to preach to the Lamanites—Using the two seer stones, Mosiah translates the Jaredite plates. About 92 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358745" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons of Mosiah</span> had done all these things, they took a small number with them and returned to their father, the king, and desired of him that he would grant unto them that they might, with these whom they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>selected</span>, go up to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Nephi</span> that they might preach the things which they had heard, and that they might impart the word of God to their brethren, the Lamanites—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358746" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>That</span> perhaps they might bring them to the knowledge of the Lord their God, and convince them of the iniquity of their fathers; and that perhaps they might cure them of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hatred</span> towards the Nephites, that they might also be brought to rejoice in the Lord their God, that they might become friendly to one another, and that there should be no more contentions in all the land which the Lord their God had given them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358747" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now they were desirous that salvation should be declared to every creature, for they could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bear</span> that any human <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>soul</span> should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>perish</span>; yea, even the very thoughts that any soul should endure <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>endless</span> torment did cause them to quake and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>tremble</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358748" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus did the Spirit of the Lord work upon them, for they were the very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vilest</span> of sinners. And the Lord saw fit in his infinite <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span> to spare them; nevertheless they suffered much anguish of soul because of their iniquities, suffering much and fearing that they should be cast off forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358749" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that they did plead with their father many days that they might go up to the land of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358750" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And king Mosiah went and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquired</span> of the Lord if he should let his sons go up among the Lamanites to preach the word.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="203"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358751" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord said unto Mosiah: Let them go up, for many shall believe on their words, and they shall have eternal life; and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> thy sons out of the hands of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358752" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that Mosiah granted that they might go and do according to their request.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358753" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>took</span> their journey into the wilderness to go up to preach the word among the Lamanites; and I shall give an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>account</span> of their proceedings hereafter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358754" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now king Mosiah had no one to confer the kingdom upon, for there was not any of his sons who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>would</span> accept of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358755" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore he took the records which were engraven on the plates of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brass</span>, and also the plates of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephi</span>, and all the things which he had kept and preserved according to the commandments of God, after having translated and caused to be written the records which were on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plates</span> of gold which had been found by the people of Limhi, which were delivered to him by the hand of Limhi;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358756" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And this he did because of the great anxiety of his people; for they were desirous beyond measure to know concerning those people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>who</span> had been destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358757" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now he translated them by the means of those two <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stones</span> which were fastened into the two rims of a bow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358758" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now these things were prepared from the beginning, and were handed down from generation to generation, for the purpose of interpreting languages;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358759" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And they have been kept and preserved by the hand of the Lord, that he should discover to every creature who should possess the land the iniquities and abominations of his people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358760" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And whosoever has these things is called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seer</span>, after the manner of old times.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358761" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now after Mosiah had finished <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>translating</span> these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span>, behold, it gave an account of the people who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroyed</span>, from the time that they were destroyed back to the building of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>great tower</span>, at the time the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>confounded</span> the language of the people and they were scattered abroad upon the face of all the earth, yea, and even from that time back until the creation of Adam.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358762" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now this account did cause the people of Mosiah to mourn exceedingly, yea, they were filled with sorrow; nevertheless it gave them much knowledge, in the which they did rejoice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358763" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And this account shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> hereafter; for behold, it is expedient that all people should know the things which are written in this account.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358764" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, as I said unto you, that after king Mosiah had done these things, he took the plates of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brass</span>, and all the things which he had kept, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>conferred</span> them upon Alma, who was the son of Alma; yea, all the records, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>interpreters</span>, and conferred them upon him, and commanded him that he should keep and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>preserve</span> them, and also keep a record of the people, handing them down from <span class="page-break" data-page="204"></span>one generation to another, even as they had been handed down from the time that Lehi left Jerusalem.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mosiah 29	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358809" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/mosiah/29" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mosiah 29</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358810" id="title_number1">Chapter 29</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358811" id="study_summary1">Mosiah proposes that judges be chosen in place of a king—Unrighteous kings lead their people into sin—Alma the younger is chosen chief judge by the voice of the people—He is also the high priest over the Church—Alma the elder and Mosiah die. About 92–91 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358812" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now when Mosiah had done this he sent out throughout all the land, among all the people, desiring to know their will concerning who should be their king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358813" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the people came, saying: We are desirous that Aaron thy son should be our king and our ruler.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358814" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now Aaron had gone up to the land of Nephi, therefore the king could not confer the kingdom upon him; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>neither</span> would Aaron take upon him the kingdom; neither were any of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sons of Mosiah</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>willing</span> to take upon them the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358815" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore king Mosiah sent again among the people; yea, even a written word sent he among the people. And these were the words that were written, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358816" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, O ye my people, or my brethren, for I esteem you as such, I desire that ye should consider the cause which ye are called to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consider</span>—for ye are desirous to have a king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358817" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now I declare unto you that he to whom the kingdom doth rightly belong has declined, and will not take upon him the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358818" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now if there should be another appointed in his stead, behold I fear there would rise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contentions</span> among you. And who knoweth but what my son, to whom the kingdom doth belong, should turn to be angry and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>draw</span> away a part of this people after him, which would cause wars and contentions among you, which would be the cause of shedding much blood and perverting the way of the Lord, yea, and destroy the souls of many people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360819" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now I say unto you let us be wise and consider these things, for we have no right to destroy my son, neither should we have any right to destroy another if he should be appointed in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360820" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And if my son should turn again to his pride and vain things he would recall the things which he had said, and claim his right to the kingdom, which would cause him and also this people to commit much sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360821" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now let us be wise and look forward to these things, and do that which will make for the peace of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360822" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore I will be your king the remainder of my days; nevertheless, let <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>us</span> appoint <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span>, to judge this people according to our law; and we will newly arrange the affairs of this people, for we will appoint wise men to be judges, that will judge this people according to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360823" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now it is better that a man should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span> of God than of man, for the judgments of God are always just, but the judgments of man are not always just.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360824" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>if</span> it were possible that you could have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>just</span> men to be your kings, who would establish the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>laws</span> of God, and judge this people according to his commandments, <span class="page-break" data-page="205"></span>yea, if ye could have men for your kings who would do even as my father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Benjamin</span> did for this people—I say unto you, if this could always be the case then it would be expedient that ye should always have kings to rule over you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360825" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And even I myself have labored with all the power and faculties which I have possessed, to teach you the commandments of God, and to establish peace throughout the land, that there should be no wars nor contentions, no stealing, nor plundering, nor murdering, nor any manner of iniquity;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360826" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And whosoever has committed iniquity, him have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>punished</span> according to the crime which he has committed, according to the law which has been given to us by our fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360827" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now I say unto you, that because all men are not just it is not expedient that ye should have a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> or kings to rule over you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360828" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For behold, how much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquity</span> doth one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wicked</span> king cause to be committed, yea, and what great destruction!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360829" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, remember king Noah, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> and his abominations, and also the wickedness and abominations of his people. Behold what great destruction did come upon them; and also because of their iniquities they were brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360830" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And were it not for the interposition of their all-wise Creator, and this because of their sincere repentance, they must unavoidably remain in bondage until now.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360831" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, he did deliver them because they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> themselves before him; and because they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cried</span> mightily unto him he did deliver them out of bondage; and thus doth the Lord work with his power in all cases among the children of men, extending the arm of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mercy</span> towards them that put their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>trust</span> in him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360832" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And behold, now I say unto you, ye cannot dethrone an iniquitous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> save it be through much contention, and the shedding of much blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360833" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, he has his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>friends</span> in iniquity, and he keepeth his guards about him; and he teareth up the laws of those who have reigned in righteousness before him; and he trampleth under his feet the commandments of God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360834" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he enacteth laws, and sendeth them forth among his people, yea, laws after the manner of his own wickedness; and whosoever doth not obey his laws he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>causeth</span> to be destroyed; and whosoever doth rebel against him he will send his armies against them to war, and if he can he will destroy them; and thus an unrighteous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>king</span> doth pervert the ways of all righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360835" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now behold I say unto you, it is not expedient that such abominations should come upon you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360836" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Therefore, choose you by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of this people, judges, that ye may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>laws</span> which have been given you by our fathers, which are correct, and which were given them by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360837" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now it is not common that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the people desireth <span class="page-break" data-page="206"></span>anything <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>contrary</span> to that which is right; but it is common for the lesser part of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>people</span> to desire that which is not right; therefore this shall ye observe and make it your law—to do your business by the voice of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360838" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>if</span> the time comes that the voice of the people doth choose iniquity, then is the time that the judgments of God will come upon you; yea, then is the time he will visit you with great destruction even as he has hitherto visited this land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360839" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now if ye have judges, and they do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span> you according to the law which has been given, ye can cause that they may be judged of a higher judge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360840" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>If your higher judges do not judge righteous judgments, ye shall cause that a small number of your lower judges should be gathered together, and they shall judge your higher judges, according to the voice of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360841" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And I command you to do these things in the fear of the Lord; and I command you to do these things, and that ye have no king; that if these people commit sins and iniquities they shall be answered upon their own heads.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360842" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>For behold I say unto you, the sins of many people have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>caused</span> by the iniquities of their kings; therefore their iniquities are answered upon the heads of their kings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360843" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now I desire that this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inequality</span> should be no more in this land, especially among this my people; but I desire that this land be a land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>every man</span> may enjoy his rights and privileges alike, so long as the Lord sees fit that we may live and inherit the land, yea, even as long as any of our posterity remains upon the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360844" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And many more things did king Mosiah write unto them, unfolding unto them all the trials and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>troubles</span> of a righteous king, yea, all the travails of soul for their people, and also all the murmurings of the people to their king; and he explained it all unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360845" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And he told them that these things ought not to be; but that the burden should come upon all the people, that every man might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bear</span> his part.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360846" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And he also unfolded unto them all the disadvantages they labored under, by having an unrighteous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> to rule over them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360847" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Yea, all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>his</span> iniquities and abominations, and all the wars, and contentions, and bloodshed, and the stealing, and the plundering, and the committing of whoredoms, and all manner of iniquities which cannot be enumerated—telling them that these things ought not to be, that they were expressly repugnant to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360848" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And now it came to pass, after king Mosiah had sent these things forth among the people they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>convinced</span> of the truth of his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360849" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Therefore they relinquished their desires for a king, and became exceedingly anxious that every man should have an equal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chance</span> throughout all the land; yea, and every man expressed a willingness to answer for his own sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360850" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Therefore, it came to pass that they assembled themselves together in bodies throughout the land, to cast in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voices</span> concerning who should be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span>, to judge them according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> which had been given them; and they were <span class="page-break" data-page="207"></span>exceedingly rejoiced because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>liberty</span> which had been granted unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360851" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And they did wax strong in love towards Mosiah; yea, they did esteem him more than any other man; for they did not look upon him as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tyrant</span> who was seeking for gain, yea, for that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lucre</span> which doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>corrupt</span> the soul; for he had not exacted riches of them, neither had he delighted in the shedding of blood; but he had established <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>peace</span> in the land, and he had granted unto his people that they should be delivered from all manner of bondage; therefore they did esteem him, yea, exceedingly, beyond measure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360852" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appoint</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span> to rule over them, or to judge them according to the law; and this they did throughout all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360853" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And it came to pass that Alma was appointed to be the first <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chief judge</span>, he being also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>high priest</span>, his father having conferred the office upon him, and having given him the charge concerning all the affairs of the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360854" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> in the ways of the Lord, and he did keep his commandments, and he did judge righteous judgments; and there was continual peace through the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360855" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>And thus commenced the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reign</span> of the judges throughout all the land of Zarahemla, among all the people who were called the Nephites; and Alma was the first and chief judge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360856" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And now it came to pass that his father died, being eighty and two years old, having lived to fulfil the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360857" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And it came to pass that Mosiah <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>died</span> also, in the thirty and third year of his reign, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sixty</span> and three years old; making in the whole, five hundred and nine years from the time Lehi left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128360858" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>And thus ended the reign of the kings over the people of Nephi; and thus ended the days of Alma, who was the founder of their church.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350141" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128350158" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Alma</span> <br />the Son of Alma</h1>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128350160" id="intro1">The account of Alma, who was the son of Alma, the first and chief judge over the people of Nephi, and also the high priest over the Church. An account of the reign of the judges, and the wars and contentions among the people. And also an account of a war between the Nephites and the Lamanites, according to the record of Alma, the first and chief judge.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350162" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350164" id="study_summary1">Nehor teaches false doctrines, establishes a church, introduces priestcraft, and slays Gideon—Nehor is executed for his crimes—Priestcrafts and persecutions spread among the people—The priests support themselves, the people care for the poor, and the Church prospers. About 91–88 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="208"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350165" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that in the first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, from this time forward, king Mosiah having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gone</span> the way of all the earth, having warred a good warfare, walking uprightly before God, leaving none to reign in his stead;
