nevertheless he had established <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>laws</span>, and they were acknowledged by the people; therefore they were obliged to abide by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>laws</span> which he had made.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350167" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that in the first year of the reign of Alma in the judgment-seat, there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span> brought before him to be judged, a man who was large, and was noted for his much strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350169" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he had gone about among the people, preaching to them that which he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>termed</span> to be the word of God, bearing down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>against</span> the church; declaring unto the people that every priest and teacher ought to become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>popular</span>; and they ought <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>not</span> to labor with their hands, but that they ought to be supported by the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350170" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And he also testified unto the people that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> mankind should be saved at the last day, and that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>need</span> not fear nor tremble, but that they might lift up their heads and rejoice; for the Lord had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>created</span> all men, and had also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>redeemed</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>all</span> men; and, in the end, all men should have eternal life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350172" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that he did teach these things so much that many did believe on his words, even so many that they began to support him and give him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>money</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350174" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he began to be lifted up in the pride of his heart, and to wear very costly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>apparel</span>, yea, and even began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>establish</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>church</span> after the manner of his preaching.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350176" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass as he was going, to preach to those who believed on his word, he met a man who belonged to the church of God, yea, even one of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teachers</span>; and he began to contend with him sharply, that he might lead away the people of the church; but the man withstood him, admonishing him with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350177" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the name of the man was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gideon</span>; and it was he who was an instrument in the hands of God in delivering the people of Limhi out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350179" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now, because Gideon withstood him with the words of God he was wroth with Gideon, and drew his sword and began to smite him. Now Gideon being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stricken</span> with many years, therefore he was not able to withstand his blows, therefore he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slain</span> by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350181" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And the man who slew him was taken by the people of the church, and was brought before Alma, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span> according to the crimes which he had committed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350183" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that he stood before Alma and pled for himself with much boldness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350184" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But Alma said unto him: Behold, this is the first time that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priestcraft</span> has been introduced among this people. And behold, thou art not only guilty of priestcraft, but hast endeavored to enforce it by the sword; and were <span class="page-break" data-page="209"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priestcraft</span> to be enforced among this people it would prove their entire destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350186" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And thou hast shed the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> of a righteous man, yea, a man who has done much good among this people; and were we to spare thee his blood would come upon us for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vengeance</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350188" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore thou art condemned to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>die</span>, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> which has been given us by Mosiah, our last king; and it has been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>acknowledged</span> by this people; therefore this people must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>abide</span> by the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350190" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that they took him; and his name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nehor</span>; and they carried him upon the top of the hill Manti, and there he was caused, or rather did acknowledge, between the heavens and the earth, that what he had taught to the people was contrary to the word of God; and there he suffered an ignominious <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350191" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Nevertheless, this did not put an end to the spreading of priestcraft through the land; for there were many who loved the vain things of the world, and they went forth preaching <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false doctrines</span>; and this they did for the sake of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>riches</span> and honor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350193" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Nevertheless, they durst not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lie</span>, if it were known, for fear of the law, for liars were punished; therefore they pretended to preach according to their belief; and now the law could have no power on any man for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>his</span> belief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350195" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And they durst not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steal</span>, for fear of the law, for such were punished; neither durst they rob, nor murder, for he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murdered</span> was punished unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350197" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>But it came to pass that whosoever did not belong to the church of God began to persecute those that did belong to the church of God, and had taken upon them the name of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350198" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Yea, they did persecute them, and afflict them with all manner of words, and this because of their humility; because they were not proud in their own eyes, and because they did impart the word of God, one with another, without <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>money</span> and without price.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350200" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now there was a strict law among the people of the church, that there should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> any man, belonging to the church, arise and persecute those that did not belong to the church, and that there should be no persecution among themselves.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350202" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Nevertheless, there were many among them who began to be proud, and began to contend warmly with their adversaries, even unto blows; yea, they would smite one another with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fists</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350204" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now this was in the second year of the reign of Alma, and it was a cause of much affliction to the church; yea, it was the cause of much trial with the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350205" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For the hearts of many were hardened, and their names were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blotted out</span>, that they were remembered no more among the people of God. And also many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>withdrew</span> themselves from among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350207" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now this was a great trial to those that did stand fast in the faith; nevertheless, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steadfast</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="210"></span>and immovable in keeping the commandments of God, and they bore with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>patience</span> the persecution which was heaped upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350209" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And when the priests left their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labor</span> to impart the word of God unto the people, the people also left their labors to hear the word of God. And when the priest had imparted unto them the word of God they all returned again diligently unto their labors; and the priest, not esteeming himself above his hearers, for the preacher was no better than the hearer, neither was the teacher any better than the learner; and thus they were all equal, and they did all labor, every man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>according</span> to his strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350211" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>impart</span> of their substance, every man according to that which he had, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>poor</span>, and the needy, and the sick, and the afflicted; and they did not wear costly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>apparel</span>, yet they were neat and comely.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350212" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And thus they did establish the affairs of the church; and thus they began to have continual peace again, notwithstanding all their persecutions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350214" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now, because of the steadiness of the church they began to be exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rich</span>, having abundance of all things whatsoever they stood in need—an abundance of flocks and herds, and fatlings of every kind, and also abundance of grain, and of gold, and of silver, and of precious things, and abundance of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>silk</span> and fine-twined linen, and all manner of good homely <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cloth</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350216" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And thus, in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosperous</span> circumstances, they did not send away any who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>naked</span>, or that were hungry, or that were athirst, or that were sick, or that had not been nourished; and they did not set their hearts upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>riches</span>; therefore they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>liberal</span> to all, both old and young, both bond and free, both male and female, whether out of the church or in the church, having no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>respect</span> to persons as to those who stood in need.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350218" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And thus they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span> and become far more wealthy than those who did not belong to their church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350219" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>For those who did not belong to their church did indulge themselves in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorceries</span>, and in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>idolatry</span> or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>idleness</span>, and in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>babblings</span>, and in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>envyings</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>strife</span>; wearing costly apparel; being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>lifted up</span> in the pride of their own eyes; persecuting, lying, thieving, robbing, committing whoredoms, and murdering, and all manner of wickedness; nevertheless, the law was put in force upon all those who did transgress it, inasmuch as it was possible.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350221" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that by thus exercising the law upon them, every man suffering according to that which he had done, they became more still, and durst not commit any wickedness if it were known; therefore, there was much peace among the people of Nephi until the fifth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349551" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349552" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349553" id="study_summary1">Amlici seeks to be king and is rejected by the voice of the people—His followers make him king—The Amlicites <span class="page-break" data-page="211"></span>make war on the Nephites and are defeated—The Lamanites and Amlicites join forces and are defeated—Alma slays Amlici. About 87 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349554" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass in the commencement of the fifth year of their reign there began to be a contention among the people; for a certain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span>, being called Amlici, he being a very cunning man, yea, a wise man as to the wisdom of the world, he being after the order of the man that slew <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gideon</span> by the sword, who was executed according to the law—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349555" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now this Amlici had, by his cunning, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drawn</span> away much people after him; even so much that they began to be very powerful; and they began to endeavor to establish Amlici to be a king over the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349556" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now this was alarming to the people of the church, and also to all those who had not been drawn away after the persuasions of Amlici; for they knew that according to their law that such things must be established by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349557" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore, if it were possible that Amlici should gain the voice of the people, he, being a wicked man, would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deprive</span> them of their rights and privileges of the church; for it was his intent to destroy the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349558" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the people assembled themselves together throughout all the land, every man according to his mind, whether it were for or against Amlici, in separate bodies, having much dispute and wonderful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contentions</span> one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349559" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And thus they did assemble themselves together to cast in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voices</span> concerning the matter; and they were laid before the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349560" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the people came against Amlici, that he was not made king over the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349561" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now this did cause much joy in the hearts of those who were against him; but Amlici did stir up those who were in his favor to anger against those who were not in his favor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349562" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they gathered themselves together, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrate</span> Amlici to be their king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349563" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now when Amlici was made king over them he commanded them that they should take up arms against their brethren; and this he did that he might subject them to him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349564" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now the people of Amlici were distinguished by the name of Amlici, being called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amlicites</span>; and the remainder were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>called</span> Nephites, or the people of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349565" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore the people of the Nephites were aware of the intent of the Amlicites, and therefore they did prepare to meet them; yea, they did arm themselves with swords, and with cimeters, and with bows, and with arrows, and with stones, and with slings, and with all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weapons</span> of war, of every kind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349566" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And thus they were prepared to meet the Amlicites at the time of their coming. And there were appointed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captains</span>, and higher captains, and chief captains, according to their numbers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349567" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Amlici did arm his men with all manner of weapons of war of every kind; and he also appointed rulers and leaders over his people, to lead them to war against their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349568" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="page-break" data-page="212"></span>Amlicites came upon the hill Amnihu, which was east of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>river Sidon</span>, which ran by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>, and there they began to make war with the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349569" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now Alma, being the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chief judge</span> and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>governor</span> of the people of Nephi, therefore he went up with his people, yea, with his captains, and chief captains, yea, at the head of his armies, against the Amlicites to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349570" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they began to slay the Amlicites upon the hill east of Sidon. And the Amlicites did contend with the Nephites with great strength, insomuch that many of the Nephites did fall before the Amlicites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349571" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Nevertheless the Lord did strengthen the hand of the Nephites, that they slew the Amlicites with great slaughter, that they began to flee before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349572" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites did pursue the Amlicites all that day, and did slay them with much slaughter, insomuch that there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span> of the Amlicites twelve thousand five hundred thirty and two souls; and there were slain of the Nephites six thousand five hundred sixty and two souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349573" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that when Alma could pursue the Amlicites no longer he caused that his people should pitch their tents in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley of Gideon</span>, the valley being called after that Gideon who was slain by the hand of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nehor</span> with the sword; and in this valley the Nephites did pitch their tents for the night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349574" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And Alma sent spies to follow the remnant of the Amlicites, that he might know of their plans and their plots, whereby he might guard himself against them, that he might preserve his people from being destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349575" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now those whom he had sent out to watch the camp of the Amlicites were called Zeram, and Amnor, and Manti, and Limher; these were they who went out with their men to watch the camp of the Amlicites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349576" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that on the morrow they returned into the camp of the Nephites in great haste, being greatly astonished, and struck with much fear, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349577" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Behold, we followed the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>camp</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Amlicites</span>, and to our great astonishment, in the land of Minon, above the land of Zarahemla, in the course of the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Nephi</span>, we saw a numerous host of the Lamanites; and behold, the Amlicites have joined them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349578" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And they are upon our brethren in that land; and they are fleeing before them with their flocks, and their wives, and their children, towards our city; and except we make haste they obtain possession of our city, and our fathers, and our wives, and our children be slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349579" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that the people of Nephi took their tents, and departed out of the valley of Gideon towards their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city</span>, which was the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zarahemla</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349580" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And behold, as they were crossing the river Sidon, the Lamanites and the Amlicites, being as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numerous</span> almost, as it were, as the sands of the sea, came upon them to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349581" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Nevertheless, the Nephites being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strengthened</span> by the hand of the Lord, having prayed mightily to him that he would deliver them out of the hands of their enemies, therefore the Lord did hear their cries, and did strengthen them, and the Lamanites and the Amlicites did fall before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349582" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that Alma fought with Amlici with the sword, <span class="page-break" data-page="213"></span>face to face; and they did contend mightily, one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349583" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that Alma, being a man of God, being exercised with much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, cried, saying: O Lord, have mercy and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spare</span> my life, that I may be an instrument in thy hands to save and preserve this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349584" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Now when Alma had said these words he contended again with Amlici; and he was strengthened, insomuch that he slew Amlici with the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349585" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And he also contended with the king of the Lamanites; but the king of the Lamanites fled back from before Alma and sent his guards to contend with Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349586" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But Alma, with his guards, contended with the guards of the king of the Lamanites until he slew and drove them back.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349587" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And thus he cleared the ground, or rather the bank, which was on the west of the river Sidon, throwing the bodies of the Lamanites who had been slain into the waters of Sidon, that thereby his people might have room to cross and contend with the Lamanites and the Amlicites on the west side of the river Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349588" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that when they had all crossed the river Sidon that the Lamanites and the Amlicites began to flee before them, notwithstanding they were so numerous that they could not be numbered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349589" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And they fled before the Nephites towards the wilderness which was west and north, away beyond the borders of the land; and the Nephites did pursue them with their might, and did slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349590" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Yea, they were met on every hand, and slain and driven, until they were scattered on the west, and on the north, until they had reached the wilderness, which was called Hermounts; and it was that part of the wilderness which was infested by wild and ravenous beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349591" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that many died in the wilderness of their wounds, and were devoured by those beasts and also the vultures of the air; and their bones have been found, and have been heaped up on the earth.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351435" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351457" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351459" id="study_summary1">The Amlicites had marked themselves according to the prophetic word—The Lamanites had been cursed for their rebellion—Men bring their own curses upon themselves—The Nephites defeat another Lamanite army. About 87–86 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351461" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites who were not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span> by the weapons of war, after having buried those who had been slain—now the number of the slain were not numbered, because of the greatness of their number—after they had finished burying their dead they all returned to their lands, and to their houses, and their wives, and their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351464" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now many women and children had been slain with the sword, and also many of their flocks and their herds; and also many of their fields of grain were destroyed, for they were trodden down by the hosts of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351466" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now as many of the Lamanites and the Amlicites who had been slain upon the bank of the river Sidon were cast into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters of Sidon</span>; and behold their bones are in the depths of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sea</span>, and they are many.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351468" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amlicites</span> were distinguished from the Nephites, for they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>marked</span> themselves with red in their foreheads after the manner of the Lamanites; nevertheless they had not shorn their heads like unto the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351471" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now the heads of the Lamanites were shorn; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>naked</span>, <span class="page-break" data-page="214"></span>save it were skin which was girded about their loins, and also their armor, which was girded about them, and their bows, and their arrows, and their stones, and their slings, and so forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351473" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And the skins of the Lamanites were dark, according to the mark which was set upon their fathers, which was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> upon them because of their transgression and their rebellion against their brethren, who consisted of Nephi, Jacob, and Joseph, and Sam, who were just and holy men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351475" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And their brethren sought to destroy them, therefore they were cursed; and the Lord God set a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mark</span> upon them, yea, upon Laman and Lemuel, and also the sons of Ishmael, and Ishmaelitish women.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351478" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And this was done that their seed might be distinguished from the seed of their brethren, that thereby the Lord God might preserve his people, that they might not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mix</span> and believe in incorrect <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span> which would prove their destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351480" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that whosoever did mingle his seed with that of the Lamanites did bring the same curse upon his seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351483" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Therefore, whosoever suffered himself to be led away by the Lamanites was called under that head, and there was a mark set upon him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351485" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that whosoever would not believe in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tradition</span> of the Lamanites, but believed those records which were brought out of the land of Jerusalem, and also in the tradition of their fathers, which were correct, who believed in the commandments of God and kept them, were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>called</span> the Nephites, or the people of Nephi, from that time forth—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351487" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it is they who have kept the records which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>true</span> of their people, and also of the people of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351490" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now we will return again to the Amlicites, for they also had a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mark</span> set upon them; yea, they set the mark upon themselves, yea, even a mark of red upon their foreheads.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351492" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Thus the word of God is fulfilled, for these are the words which he said to Nephi: Behold, the Lamanites have I cursed, and I will set a mark on them that they and their seed may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>separated</span> from thee and thy seed, from this time henceforth and forever, except they repent of their wickedness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>turn</span> to me that I may have mercy upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351493" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And again: I will set a mark upon him that mingleth his seed with thy brethren, that they may be cursed also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351494" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And again: I will set a mark upon him that fighteth against thee and thy seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351495" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And again, I say he that departeth from thee shall no more be called thy seed; and I will bless thee, and whomsoever shall be called thy seed, henceforth and forever; and these were the promises of the Lord unto Nephi and to his seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351496" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now the Amlicites knew not that they were fulfilling the words of God when they began to mark themselves in their foreheads; nevertheless they had come out in open <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebellion</span> against God; therefore it was expedient that the curse should fall upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351497" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now I would that ye should see that they brought upon themselves the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span>; and even so doth every man that is cursed bring <span class="page-break" data-page="215"></span>upon himself his own condemnation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351498" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now it came to pass that not many days after the battle which was fought in the land of Zarahemla, by the Lamanites and the Amlicites, that there was another army of the Lamanites came in upon the people of Nephi, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>same</span> place where the first army met the Amlicites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351499" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that there was an army sent to drive them out of their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351500" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now Alma himself being afflicted with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wound</span> did not go up to battle at this time against the Lamanites;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351501" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But he sent up a numerous army against them; and they went up and slew many of the Lamanites, and drove the remainder of them out of the borders of their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351502" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And then they returned again and began to establish peace in the land, being troubled no more for a time with their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351503" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now all these things were done, yea, all these wars and contentions were commenced and ended in the fifth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351504" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And in one year were thousands and tens of thousands of souls sent to the eternal world, that they might reap their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rewards</span> according to their works, whether they were good or whether they were bad, to reap eternal happiness or eternal misery, according to the spirit which they listed to obey, whether it be a good spirit or a bad one.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351505" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>For every man receiveth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wages</span> of him whom he listeth to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>obey</span>, and this according to the words of the spirit of prophecy; therefore let it be according to the truth. And thus endeth the fifth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352981" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352982" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352983" id="study_summary1">Alma baptizes thousands of converts—Iniquity enters the Church, and the Church’s progress is hindered—Nephihah is appointed chief judge—Alma, as high priest, devotes himself to the ministry. About 86–83 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352984" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass in the sixth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, there were no contentions nor wars in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Zarahemla</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352985" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But the people were afflicted, yea, greatly afflicted for the loss of their brethren, and also for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>loss</span> of their flocks and herds, and also for the loss of their fields of grain, which were trodden under foot and destroyed by the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352986" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And so great were their afflictions that every soul had cause to mourn; and they believed that it was the judgments of God sent upon them because of their wickedness and their abominations; therefore they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>awakened</span> to a remembrance of their duty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352987" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they began to establish the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> more fully; yea, and many were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>waters of Sidon</span> and were joined to the church of God; yea, they were baptized by the hand of Alma, who had been consecrated the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>high priest</span> over the people of the church, by the hand of his father Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352988" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass in the seventh year of the reign of the judges there were about three thousand five hundred souls that united themselves to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> of God and were baptized. And thus ended the seventh year of the reign of the judges over the people <span class="page-break" data-page="216"></span>of Nephi; and there was continual peace in all that time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352989" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass in the eighth year of the reign of the judges, that the people of the church began to wax proud, because of their exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span>, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fine</span> silks, and their fine-twined linen, and because of their many flocks and herds, and their gold and their silver, and all manner of precious things, which they had obtained by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>industry</span>; and in all these things were they lifted up in the pride of their eyes, for they began to wear very costly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>apparel</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352990" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now this was the cause of much affliction to Alma, yea, and to many of the people whom Alma had consecrated to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teachers</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>elders</span> over the church; yea, many of them were sorely grieved for the wickedness which they saw had begun to be among their people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352991" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For they saw and beheld with great sorrow that the people of the church began to be lifted up in the pride of their eyes, and to set their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> upon riches and upon the vain things of the world, that they began to be scornful, one towards another, and they began to persecute those that did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not believe</span> according to their own will and pleasure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352992" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And thus, in this eighth year of the reign of the judges, there began to be great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contentions</span> among the people of the church; yea, there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>envyings</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>strife</span>, and malice, and persecutions, and pride, even to exceed the pride of those who did not belong to the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352993" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And thus ended the eighth year of the reign of the judges; and the wickedness of the church was a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stumbling-block</span> to those who did not belong to the church; and thus the church began to fail in its progress.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352994" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass in the commencement of the ninth year, Alma saw the wickedness of the church, and he saw also that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>example</span> of the church began to lead those who were unbelievers on from one piece of iniquity to another, thus bringing on the destruction of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352995" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, he saw great inequality among the people, some lifting themselves up with their pride, despising others, turning their backs upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>needy</span> and the naked and those who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hungry</span>, and those who were athirst, and those who were sick and afflicted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352996" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now this was a great cause for lamentations among the people, while others were abasing themselves, succoring those who stood in need of their succor, such as imparting their substance to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor</span> and the needy, feeding the hungry, and suffering all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span>, for Christ’s <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sake</span>, who should come according to the spirit of prophecy;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352997" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Looking forward to that day, thus <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>retaining</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of their sins; being filled with great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>joy</span> because of the resurrection of the dead, according to the will and power and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>deliverance</span> of Jesus Christ from the bands of death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352998" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma, having seen the afflictions of the humble followers of God, and <span class="page-break" data-page="217"></span>the persecutions which were heaped upon them by the remainder of his people, and seeing all their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inequality</span>, began to be very sorrowful; nevertheless the Spirit of the Lord did not fail him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352999" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And he selected a wise man who was among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>elders</span> of the church, and gave him power according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>voice</span> of the people, that he might have power to enact <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>laws</span> according to the laws which had been given, and to put them in force according to the wickedness and the crimes of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353000" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now this man’s name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephihah</span>, and he was appointed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chief judge</span>; and he sat in the judgment-seat to judge and to govern the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353001" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now Alma did not grant unto him the office of being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priest</span> over the church, but he retained the office of high priest unto himself; but he delivered the judgment-seat unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephihah</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353002" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And this he did that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>himself</span> might go forth among his people, or among the people of Nephi, that he might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preach</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>word</span> of God unto them, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>stir</span> them up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>remembrance</span> of their duty, and that he might pull down, by the word of God, all the pride and craftiness and all the contentions which were among his people, seeing no way that he might reclaim them save it were in bearing down in pure <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>testimony</span> against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353003" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And thus in the commencement of the ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, Alma delivered up the judgment-seat to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephihah</span>, and confined himself wholly to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>high priesthood</span> of the holy order of God, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>testimony</span> of the word, according to the spirit of revelation and prophecy.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352650" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128352651" id="intro1">The words which Alma, the High Priest according to the holy order of God, delivered to the people in their cities and villages throughout the land.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128352652" id="study_intro1">Beginning with chapter 5.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352653" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352654" id="study_summary1">To gain salvation, men must repent and keep the commandments, be born again, cleanse their garments through the blood of Christ, be humble and strip themselves of pride and envy, and do the works of righteousness—The Good Shepherd calls His people—Those who do evil works are children of the devil—Alma testifies of the truth of his doctrine and commands men to repent—The names of the righteous will be written in the book of life. About 83 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352655" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that Alma began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> the word of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>God</span> unto the people, first in the land of Zarahemla, and from thence throughout all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352656" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And these are the words which he spake to the people in the church which was established in the city of Zarahemla, according to his own record, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352657" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>I, Alma, having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consecrated</span> by my father, Alma, to be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>high priest</span> over the church of God, he having power and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>authority</span> from God to do these things, behold, I say unto you that he began to <span class="page-break" data-page="218"></span>establish a church in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>land</span> which was in the borders of Nephi; yea, the land which was called the land of Mormon; yea, and he did baptize his brethren in the waters of Mormon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352658" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And behold, I say unto you, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> out of the hands of the people of king Noah, by the mercy and power of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352659" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And behold, after that, they were brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span> by the hands of the Lamanites in the wilderness; yea, I say unto you, they were in captivity, and again the Lord did deliver them out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span> by the power of his word; and we were brought into this land, and here we began to establish the church of God throughout this land also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352660" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now behold, I say unto you, my brethren, you that belong to this church, have you sufficiently retained in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remembrance</span> the captivity of your fathers? Yea, and have you sufficiently retained in remembrance his mercy and long-suffering towards them? And moreover, have ye sufficiently retained in remembrance that he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delivered</span> their souls from hell?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352661" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold, he changed their hearts; yea, he awakened them out of a deep sleep, and they awoke unto God. Behold, they were in the midst of darkness; nevertheless, their souls were illuminated by the light of the everlasting word; yea, they were encircled about by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bands</span> of death, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chains</span> of hell, and an everlasting destruction did await them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352662" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now I ask of you, my brethren, were they destroyed? Behold, I say unto you, Nay, they were not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352663" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And again I ask, were the bands of death broken, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chains</span> of hell which encircled them about, were they loosed? I say unto you, Yea, they were loosed, and their souls did expand, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sing</span> redeeming love. And I say unto you that they are saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353456" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now I ask of you on what conditions are they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saved</span>? Yea, what grounds had they to hope for salvation? What is the cause of their being loosed from the bands of death, yea, and also the chains of hell?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353457" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Behold, I can tell you—did not my father Alma believe in the words which were delivered by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mouth</span> of Abinadi? And was he not a holy prophet? Did he not speak the words of God, and my father Alma believe them?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353458" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And according to his faith there was a mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>change</span> wrought in his heart. Behold I say unto you that this is all true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353459" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preached</span> the word unto your fathers, and a mighty change was also wrought in their hearts, and they humbled themselves and put their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trust</span> in the true and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>living God</span>. And behold, they were faithful until the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>end</span>; therefore they were saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353460" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now behold, I ask of you, my brethren of the church, have ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spiritually</span> been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born of God</span>? Have ye received his image in your countenances? Have ye experienced this mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>change</span> in your hearts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353461" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Do ye exercise faith in the <span class="page-break" data-page="219"></span>redemption of him who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>created</span> you? Do you look forward with an eye of faith, and view this mortal body raised in immortality, and this corruption <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>raised</span> in incorruption, to stand before God to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judged</span> according to the deeds which have been done in the mortal body?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353462" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>I say unto you, can you imagine to yourselves that ye hear the voice of the Lord, saying unto you, in that day: Come unto me ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span>, for behold, your works have been the works of righteousness upon the face of the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353463" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Or do ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>imagine</span> to yourselves that ye can lie unto the Lord in that day, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>say</span>—Lord, our works have been righteous works upon the face of the earth—and that he will save you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353464" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Or otherwise, can ye imagine yourselves brought before the tribunal of God with your souls filled with guilt and remorse, having a remembrance of all your guilt, yea, a perfect <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remembrance</span> of all your wickedness, yea, a remembrance that ye have set at defiance the commandments of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353465" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>I say unto you, can ye look up to God at that day with a pure heart and clean hands? I say unto you, can you look up, having the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>image</span> of God engraven upon your countenances?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353466" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>I say unto you, can ye think of being saved when you have yielded yourselves to become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>subjects</span> to the devil?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353467" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>I say unto you, ye will know at that day that ye cannot be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saved</span>; for there can no man be saved except his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>garments</span> are washed white; yea, his garments must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>purified</span> until they are cleansed from all stain, through the blood of him of whom it has been spoken by our fathers, who should come to redeem his people from their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353468" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now I ask of you, my brethren, how will any of you feel, if ye shall stand before the bar of God, having your garments stained with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> and all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthiness</span>? Behold, what will these things testify against you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353469" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Behold will they not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testify</span> that ye are murderers, yea, and also that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>guilty</span> of all manner of wickedness?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353470" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Behold, my brethren, do ye suppose that such an one can have a place to sit down in the kingdom of God, with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Abraham</span>, with Isaac, and with Jacob, and also all the holy prophets, whose garments are cleansed and are spotless, pure and white?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353471" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>I say unto you, Nay; except ye make our Creator a liar from the beginning, or suppose that he is a liar from the beginning, ye cannot suppose that such can have place in the kingdom of heaven; but they shall be cast out for they are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> of the kingdom of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353472" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now behold, I say unto you, my brethren, if ye have experienced a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>change</span> of heart, and if ye have felt to sing the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>song</span> of redeeming love, I would ask, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>can</span> ye feel so now?</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="220"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353474" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Have ye walked, keeping yourselves <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blameless</span> before God? Could ye say, if ye were called to die at this time, within yourselves, that ye have been sufficiently <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>humble</span>? That your garments have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cleansed</span> and made white through the blood of Christ, who will come to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>redeem</span> his people from their sins?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353475" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Behold, are ye stripped of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span>? I say unto you, if ye are not ye are not prepared to meet God. Behold ye must prepare quickly; for the kingdom of heaven is soon at hand, and such an one hath not eternal life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353476" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Behold, I say, is there one among you who is not stripped of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>envy</span>? I say unto you that such an one is not prepared; and I would that he should prepare <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quickly</span>, for the hour is close at hand, and he knoweth not when the time shall come; for such an one is not found guiltless.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353477" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And again I say unto you, is there one among you that doth make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mock</span> of his brother, or that heapeth upon him persecutions?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353478" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Wo unto such an one, for he is not prepared, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> is at hand that he must repent or he cannot be saved!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353479" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Yea, even wo unto all ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>workers</span> of iniquity; repent, repent, for the Lord God hath spoken it!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353480" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Behold, he sendeth an invitation unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> men, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>arms</span> of mercy are extended towards them, and he saith: Repent, and I will receive you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353481" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Yea, he saith: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Come</span> unto me and ye shall partake of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> of the tree of life; yea, ye shall eat and drink of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bread</span> and the waters of life <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>freely</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353482" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Yea, come unto me and bring forth works of righteousness, and ye shall not be hewn down and cast into the fire—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353483" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>For behold, the time is at hand that whosoever <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bringeth</span> forth not good fruit, or whosoever doeth not the works of righteousness, the same have cause to wail and mourn.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353484" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>O ye workers of iniquity; ye that are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>puffed up</span> in the vain things of the world, ye that have professed to have known the ways of righteousness nevertheless have gone <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>astray</span>, as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sheep</span> having no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>shepherd</span>, notwithstanding a shepherd hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>called</span> after you and is still calling after you, but ye will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>hearken</span> unto his voice!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353485" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Behold, I say unto you, that the good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shepherd</span> doth call you; yea, and in his own name he doth call you, which is the name of Christ; and if ye will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearken</span> unto the voice of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>good shepherd</span>, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>name</span> by which ye are called, behold, ye are not the sheep of the good shepherd.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353486" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And now if ye are not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sheep</span> of the good shepherd, of what fold are ye? Behold, I say unto you, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span> is your shepherd, and ye are of his fold; and now, <span class="page-break" data-page="221"></span>who can deny this? Behold, I say unto you, whosoever denieth this is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liar</span> and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>child</span> of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353487" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>For I say unto you that whatsoever is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good</span> cometh from God, and whatsoever is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil</span> cometh from the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353488" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Therefore, if a man bringeth forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good works</span> he hearkeneth unto the voice of the good shepherd, and he doth follow him; but whosoever bringeth forth evil works, the same becometh a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>child</span> of the devil, for he hearkeneth unto his voice, and doth follow him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353489" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And whosoever doeth this must receive his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wages</span> of him; therefore, for his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wages</span> he receiveth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span>, as to things pertaining unto righteousness, being dead unto all good works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353490" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And now, my brethren, I would that ye should hear me, for I speak in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>energy</span> of my soul; for behold, I have spoken unto you plainly that ye cannot err, or have spoken according to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353491" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>For I am called to speak after this manner, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy order</span> of God, which is in Christ Jesus; yea, I am commanded to stand and testify unto this people the things which have been spoken by our fathers concerning the things which are to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353492" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And this is not all. Do ye not suppose that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> of these things myself? Behold, I testify unto you that I do know that these things whereof I have spoken are true. And how do ye suppose that I know of their surety?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353493" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>Behold, I say unto you they are made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>known</span> unto me by the Holy Spirit of God. Behold, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fasted</span> and prayed many days that I might know these things of myself. And now I do know of myself that they are true; for the Lord God hath made them manifest unto me by his Holy Spirit; and this is the spirit of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>revelation</span> which is in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353494" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>And moreover, I say unto you that it has thus been revealed unto me, that the words which have been spoken by our fathers are true, even so according to the spirit of prophecy which is in me, which is also by the manifestation of the Spirit of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353495" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>I say unto you, that I know of myself that whatsoever I shall say unto you, concerning that which is to come, is true; and I say unto you, that I know that Jesus Christ shall come, yea, the Son, the Only Begotten of the Father, full of grace, and mercy, and truth.
