And behold, it is he that cometh to take away the sins of the world, yea, the sins of every man who steadfastly believeth on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353496" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>And now I say unto you that this is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span> after which I am called, yea, to preach unto my beloved brethren, yea, and every one that dwelleth in the land; yea, to preach unto all, both old and young, both bond and free; yea, I say unto you the aged, and also the middle aged, and the rising generation; yea, to cry unto them that they must repent and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born again</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353498" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>Yea, thus saith the Spirit: Repent, all ye ends of the earth, for the kingdom of heaven is soon at hand; yea, the Son of God cometh in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span>, in his might, majesty, power, <span class="page-break" data-page="222"></span>and dominion. Yea, my beloved brethren, I say unto you, that the Spirit saith: Behold the glory of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>King</span> of all the earth; and also the King of heaven shall very soon shine forth among all the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353500" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>And also the Spirit saith unto me, yea, crieth unto me with a mighty voice, saying: Go forth and say unto this people—Repent, for except ye repent ye can in nowise inherit the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kingdom</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heaven</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353502" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>And again I say unto you, the Spirit saith: Behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ax</span> is laid at the root of the tree; therefore every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hewn</span> down and cast into the fire, yea, a fire which cannot be consumed, even an unquenchable fire. Behold, and remember, the Holy One hath spoken it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353504" id="p53"><span class="verse-number">53 </span>And now my beloved brethren, I say unto you, can ye withstand these sayings; yea, can ye lay aside these things, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trample</span> the Holy One under your feet; yea, can ye be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>puffed up</span> in the pride of your hearts; yea, will ye still persist in the wearing of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>costly</span> apparel and setting your hearts upon the vain things of the world, upon your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>riches</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353506" id="p54"><span class="verse-number">54 </span>Yea, will ye persist in supposing that ye are better one than another; yea, will ye persist in the persecution of your brethren, who humble themselves and do walk after the holy order of God, wherewith they have been brought into this church, having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note54a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sanctified</span> by the Holy Spirit, and they do bring forth works which are meet for repentance—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352664" id="p55"><span class="verse-number">55 </span>Yea, and will you persist in turning your backs upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note55a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor</span>, and the needy, and in withholding your substance from them?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352665" id="p56"><span class="verse-number">56 </span>And finally, all ye that will persist in your wickedness, I say unto you that these are they who shall be hewn down and cast into the fire except they speedily repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352666" id="p57"><span class="verse-number">57 </span>And now I say unto you, all you that are desirous to follow the voice of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note57a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good shepherd</span>, come ye out from the wicked, and be ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note57b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>separate</span>, and touch not their unclean things; and behold, their names shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note57c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blotted out</span>, that the names of the wicked shall not be numbered among the names of the righteous, that the word of God may be fulfilled, which saith: The names of the wicked shall not be mingled with the names of my people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352667" id="p58"><span class="verse-number">58 </span>For the names of the righteous shall be written in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note58a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book of life</span>, and unto them will I grant an inheritance at my right hand. And now, my brethren, what have ye to say against this? I say unto you, if ye speak against it, it matters not, for the word of God must be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352668" id="p59"><span class="verse-number">59 </span>For what shepherd is there among you having many sheep doth not watch over them, that the wolves enter not and devour his flock? And behold, if a wolf enter his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note59a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flock</span> doth he not drive him out? Yea, and at the last, if he can, he will destroy him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352669" id="p60"><span class="verse-number">60 </span>And now I say unto you that the good shepherd doth call after you; and if you will hearken unto his voice he will bring you into his <span class="page-break" data-page="223"></span>fold, and ye are his sheep; and he commandeth you that ye suffer no ravenous wolf to enter among you, that ye may not be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352670" id="p61"><span class="verse-number">61 </span>And now I, Alma, do command you in the language of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note61a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>him</span> who hath commanded me, that ye observe to do the words which I have spoken unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352671" id="p62"><span class="verse-number">62 </span>I speak by way of command unto you that belong to the church; and unto those who do not belong to the church I speak by way of invitation, saying: Come and be baptized unto repentance, that ye also may be partakers of the fruit of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note62a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree of life</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354858" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354859" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354860" id="study_summary1">The Church in Zarahemla is cleansed and set in order—Alma goes to Gideon to preach. About 83 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354861" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after Alma had made an end of speaking unto the people of the church, which was established in the city of Zarahemla, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordained</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> and elders, by laying on his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hands</span> according to the order of God, to preside and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>watch</span> over the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354862" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that whosoever did not belong to the church who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repented</span> of their sins were baptized unto repentance, and were received into the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354863" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it also came to pass that whosoever did belong to the church that did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span> of their wickedness and humble themselves before God—I mean those who were lifted up in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pride</span> of their hearts—the same were rejected, and their names were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blotted out</span>, that their names were not numbered among those of the righteous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354864" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus they began to establish the order of the church in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city of Zarahemla</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354865" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now I would that ye should understand that the word of God was liberal unto all, that none were deprived of the privilege of assembling themselves together to hear the word of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354866" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Nevertheless the children of God were commanded that they should gather themselves together oft, and join in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fasting</span> and mighty prayer in behalf of the welfare of the souls of those who knew not God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354867" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now it came to pass that when Alma had made these regulations he departed from them, yea, from the church which was in the city of Zarahemla, and went over upon the east of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>river Sidon</span>, into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>valley of Gideon</span>, there having been a city built, which was called the city of Gideon, which was in the valley that was called Gideon, being called after the man who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>slain</span> by the hand of Nehor with the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354868" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And Alma went and began to declare the word of God unto the church which was established in the valley of Gideon, according to the revelation of the truth of the word which had been spoken by his fathers, and according to the spirit of prophecy which was in him, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testimony</span> of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who should come to redeem his people from their sins, and the holy order by which he was called. And thus it is written. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354133" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128354134" id="intro1">The words of Alma which he delivered to the people in Gideon, according to his own record.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128354135" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapter 7.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="224"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354136" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354137" id="study_summary1">Christ will be born of Mary—He will loose the bands of death and bear the sins of His people—Those who repent, are baptized, and keep the commandments will have eternal life—Filthiness cannot inherit the kingdom of God—Humility, faith, hope, and charity are required. About 83 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354138" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold my beloved brethren, seeing that I have been permitted to come unto you, therefore I attempt to address you in my language; yea, by my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>own</span> mouth, seeing that it is the first time that I have spoken unto you by the words of my mouth, I having been wholly confined to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment-seat</span>, having had much business that I could not come unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354139" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And even I could not have come now at this time were it not that the judgment-seat hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>given</span> to another, to reign in my stead; and the Lord in much mercy hath granted that I should come unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354140" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And behold, I have come having great hopes and much desire that I should find that ye had humbled yourselves before God, and that ye had continued in the supplicating of his grace, that I should find that ye were blameless before him, that I should find that ye were not in the awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dilemma</span> that our brethren were in at Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354141" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But blessed be the name of God, that he hath given me to know, yea, hath given unto me the exceedingly great joy of knowing that they are established again in the way of his righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354142" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I trust, according to the Spirit of God which is in me, that I shall also have joy over you; nevertheless I do not desire that my joy over you should come by the cause of so much afflictions and sorrow which I have had for the brethren at Zarahemla, for behold, my joy cometh over them after wading through much affliction and sorrow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354143" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But behold, I trust that ye are not in a state of so much unbelief as were your brethren; I trust that ye are not lifted up in the pride of your hearts; yea, I trust that ye have not set your hearts upon riches and the vain things of the world; yea, I trust that you do not worship <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>idols</span>, but that ye do worship the true and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>living God</span>, and that ye look forward for the remission of your sins, with an everlasting faith, which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354144" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For behold, I say unto you there be many things to come; and behold, there is one thing which is of more importance than they all—for behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> is not far distant that the Redeemer liveth and cometh among his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354145" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Behold, I do not say that he will come among us at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> of his dwelling in his mortal tabernacle; for behold, the Spirit hath not said unto me that this should be the case. Now as to this thing I do not know; but this much I do know, that the Lord God hath power to do all things which are according to his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354146" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But behold, the Spirit hath said this much unto me, saying: Cry unto this people, saying—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Repent</span> ye, and prepare the way of the Lord, and walk in his paths, which are straight; for behold, the kingdom of heaven is at hand, and the Son of God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cometh</span> upon the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354147" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And behold, he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born</span> of Mary, at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jerusalem</span> which is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land</span> of our forefathers, she being a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>virgin</span>, a precious and chosen <span class="page-break" data-page="225"></span>vessel, who shall be overshadowed and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>conceive</span> by the power of the Holy Ghost, and bring forth a son, yea, even the Son of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354148" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he shall go forth, suffering pains and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temptations</span> of every kind; and this that the word might be fulfilled which saith he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take upon</span> him the pains and the sicknesses of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354149" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he will take upon him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>, that he may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>loose</span> the bands of death which bind his people; and he will take upon him their infirmities, that his bowels may be filled with mercy, according to the flesh, that he may know according to the flesh how to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>succor</span> his people according to their infirmities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354150" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now the Spirit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> all things; nevertheless the Son of God suffereth according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flesh</span> that he might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take upon</span> him the sins of his people, that he might blot out their transgressions according to the power of his deliverance; and now behold, this is the testimony which is in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354151" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now I say unto you that ye must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span>, and be born again; for the Spirit saith if ye are not born again ye cannot inherit the kingdom of heaven; therefore come and be baptized unto repentance, that ye may be washed from your sins, that ye may have faith on the Lamb of God, who taketh away the sins of the world, who is mighty to save and to cleanse from all unrighteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354152" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, I say unto you come and fear not, and lay aside every sin, which easily doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beset</span> you, which doth bind you down to destruction, yea, come and go forth, and show unto your God that ye are willing to repent of your sins and enter into a covenant with him to keep his commandments, and witness it unto him this day by going into the waters of baptism.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354153" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And whosoever doeth this, and keepeth the commandments of God from thenceforth, the same will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> that I say unto him, yea, he will remember that I have said unto him, he shall have eternal life, according to the testimony of the Holy Spirit, which testifieth in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354154" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now my beloved brethren, do you believe these things? Behold, I say unto you, yea, I know that ye believe them; and the way that I know that ye believe them is by the manifestation of the Spirit which is in me. And now because your faith is strong concerning that, yea, concerning the things which I have spoken, great is my joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354155" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For as I said unto you from the beginning, that I had much desire that ye were not in the state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dilemma</span> like your brethren, even so I have found that my desires have been gratified.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354156" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For I perceive that ye are in the paths of righteousness; I perceive that ye are in the path which leads to the kingdom of God; yea, I perceive that ye are making his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>paths</span> straight.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354157" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>I perceive that it has been made known unto you, by the testimony of his word, that he cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> in crooked paths; neither doth he vary from that which he hath said; neither hath he a shadow of turning from the right to the left, or from that which is right to that which is wrong; therefore, his course is one eternal round.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="226"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354158" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he doth not dwell in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unholy</span> temples; neither can filthiness or anything which is unclean be received into the kingdom of God; therefore I say unto you the time shall come, yea, and it shall be at the last day, that he who is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthy</span> shall remain in his filthiness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354159" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now my beloved brethren, I have said these things unto you that I might awaken you to a sense of your duty to God, that ye may walk blameless before him, that ye may walk after the holy order of God, after which ye have been received.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354160" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now I would that ye should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span>, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>submissive</span> and gentle; easy to be entreated; full of patience and long-suffering; being temperate in all things; being diligent in keeping the commandments of God at all times; asking for whatsoever things ye stand in need, both spiritual and temporal; always returning thanks unto God for whatsoever things ye do receive.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354161" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And see that ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, hope, and charity, and then ye will always abound in good works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354162" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And may the Lord bless you, and keep your garments spotless, that ye may at last be brought to sit down with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Abraham</span>, Isaac, and Jacob, and the holy prophets who have been ever since the world began, having your garments <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spotless</span> even as their garments are spotless, in the kingdom of heaven to go no more out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354163" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now my beloved brethren, I have spoken these words unto you according to the Spirit which testifieth in me; and my soul doth exceedingly rejoice, because of the exceeding diligence and heed which ye have given unto my word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354164" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now, may the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peace</span> of God rest upon you, and upon your houses and lands, and upon your flocks and herds, and all that you possess, your women and your children, according to your faith and good works, from this time forth and forever. And thus I have spoken. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355027" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355028" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355029" id="study_summary1">Alma preaches and baptizes in Melek—He is rejected in Ammonihah and leaves—An angel commands him to return and cry repentance unto the people—He is received by Amulek, and the two of them preach in Ammonihah. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355030" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma returned from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Gideon</span>, after having taught the people of Gideon many things which cannot be written, having established the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>order</span> of the church, according as he had before done in the land of Zarahemla, yea, he returned to his own house at Zarahemla to rest himself from the labors which he had performed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355031" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And thus ended the ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355032" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass in the commencement of the tenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, that Alma departed from thence and took his journey over into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Melek</span>, on the west of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>river Sidon</span>, on the west by the borders of the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355033" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And he began to teach the people in the land of Melek according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy order</span> of God, by which he had been called; and he began to teach the people throughout all the land of Melek.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355034" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the people came to him throughout all <span class="page-break" data-page="227"></span>the borders of the land which was by the wilderness side. And they were baptized throughout all the land;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355035" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>So that when he had finished his work at Melek he departed thence, and traveled three days’ journey on the north of the land of Melek; and he came to a city which was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammonihah</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355036" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now it was the custom of the people of Nephi to call their lands, and their cities, and their villages, yea, even all their small villages, after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> of him who first possessed them; and thus it was with the land of Ammonihah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355037" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that when Alma had come to the city of Ammonihah he began to preach the word of God unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355038" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now Satan had gotten great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hold</span> upon the hearts of the people of the city of Ammonihah; therefore they would not hearken unto the words of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355039" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Nevertheless Alma <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labored</span> much in the spirit, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrestling</span> with God in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mighty prayer</span>, that he would pour out his Spirit upon the people who were in the city; that he would also grant that he might baptize them unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355040" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Nevertheless, they hardened their hearts, saying unto him: Behold, we know that thou art Alma; and we know that thou art high priest over the church which thou hast established in many parts of the land, according to your tradition; and we are not of thy church, and we do not believe in such foolish traditions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355041" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now we know that because we are not of thy church we know that thou hast no power over us; and thou hast delivered up the judgment-seat unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephihah</span>; therefore thou art not the chief judge over us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355042" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now when the people had said this, and withstood all his words, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reviled</span> him, and spit upon him, and caused that he should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast out</span> of their city, he departed thence and took his journey towards the city which was called Aaron.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355043" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that while he was journeying thither, being weighed down with sorrow, wading through much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tribulation</span> and anguish of soul, because of the wickedness of the people who were in the city of Ammonihah, it came to pass while Alma was thus weighed down with sorrow, behold an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angel</span> of the Lord appeared unto him, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355044" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Blessed art thou, Alma; therefore, lift up thy head and rejoice, for thou hast great cause to rejoice; for thou hast been faithful in keeping the commandments of God from the time which thou receivedst thy first message from him. Behold, I am he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> it unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355045" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And behold, I am sent to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>command</span> thee that thou return to the city of Ammonihah, and preach again unto the people of the city; yea, preach unto them. Yea, say unto them, except they repent the Lord God will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355046" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For behold, they do study at this time that they may destroy the liberty of thy people, (for thus saith the Lord) which is contrary to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>statutes</span>, and judgments, and commandments which he has given unto his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355047" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now it came to pass that after Alma had received his message from the angel of the Lord he returned speedily to the land of Ammonihah. And he entered the city by another way, yea, by the way which is on the south of the city of Ammonihah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355048" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>he</span> entered the city he <span class="page-break" data-page="228"></span>was an hungered, and he said to a man: Will ye give to an humble servant of God something to eat?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355049" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the man said unto him: I am a Nephite, and I know that thou art a holy prophet of God, for thou art the man whom an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> said in a vision: Thou shalt receive. Therefore, go with me into my house and I will impart unto thee of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>food</span>; and I know that thou wilt be a blessing unto me and my house.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355050" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the man received him into his house; and the man was called Amulek; and he brought forth bread and meat and set before Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355051" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that Alma ate bread and was filled; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> Amulek and his house, and he gave thanks unto God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355052" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And after he had eaten and was filled he said unto Amulek: I am Alma, and am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priest</span> over the church of God throughout the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355053" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And behold, I have been called to preach the word of God among all this people, according to the spirit of revelation and prophecy; and I was in this land and they would not receive me, but they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> me out and I was about to set my back towards this land forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355054" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But behold, I have been commanded that I should turn again and prophesy unto this people, yea, and to testify against them concerning their iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355055" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now, Amulek, because thou hast fed me and taken me in, thou art blessed; for I was an hungered, for I had fasted many days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355056" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And Alma <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tarried</span> many days with Amulek before he began to preach unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355059" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that the people did wax more gross in their iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355061" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And the word came to Alma, saying: Go; and also say unto my servant <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulek</span>, go forth and prophesy unto this people, saying—Repent ye, for thus saith the Lord, except ye repent I will visit this people in mine anger; yea, and I will not turn my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fierce</span> anger away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355063" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And Alma went forth, and also Amulek, among the people, to declare the words of God unto them; and they were filled with the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355065" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> given unto them, insomuch that they could not be confined in dungeons; neither was it possible that any man could slay them; nevertheless they did not exercise their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> until they were bound in bands and cast into prison. Now, this was done that the Lord might show forth his power in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355068" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that they went forth and began to preach and to prophesy unto the people, according to the spirit and power which the Lord had given them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354203" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128355057" id="intro1">The words of Alma, and also the words of Amulek, which were declared unto the people who were in the land of Ammonihah. And also they are cast into prison, and delivered by the miraculous power of God which was in them, according to the record of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128355058" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 9 through 14.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355060" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355062" id="study_summary1">Alma commands the people of Ammonihah to repent—The Lord will be merciful to the Lamanites in the last days—If the Nephites forsake the light, they will be destroyed by the Lamanites—The Son of God will come soon—He will redeem those who repent, are baptized, and have faith in His name. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="229"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355064" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And again, I, Alma, having been commanded of God that I should take Amulek and go forth and preach again unto this people, or the people who were in the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammonihah</span>, it came to pass as I began to preach unto them, they began to contend with me, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355066" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Who art thou? Suppose ye that we shall believe the testimony of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> man, although he should preach unto us that the earth should pass away?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355067" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now they understood not the words which they spake; for they knew not that the earth should pass away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355069" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they said also: We will not believe thy words if thou shouldst prophesy that this great city should be destroyed in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355071" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now they knew not that God could do such marvelous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span>, for they were a hard-hearted and a stiffnecked people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355073" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Who</span> is God, that sendeth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no more</span> authority than one man among this people, to declare unto them the truth of such great and marvelous things?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355075" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they stood forth to lay their hands on me; but behold, they did not. And I stood with boldness to declare unto them, yea, I did boldly testify unto them, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355077" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Behold, O ye wicked and perverse <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>generation</span>, how have ye forgotten the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tradition</span> of your fathers; yea, how soon ye have forgotten the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355078" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Do ye not remember that our father, Lehi, was brought out of Jerusalem by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hand</span> of God? Do ye not remember that they were all led by him through the wilderness?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355080" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And have ye forgotten so soon how many times he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> our fathers out of the hands of their enemies, and preserved them from being destroyed, even by the hands of their own brethren?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355082" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, and if it had not been for his matchless power, and his mercy, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>long-suffering</span> towards us, we should unavoidably have been cut off from the face of the earth long before this period of time, and perhaps been consigned to a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>endless</span> misery and woe.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355084" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, now I say unto you that he commandeth you to repent; and except ye repent, ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of God. But behold, this is not all—he has commanded you to repent, or he will utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> you from off the face of the earth; yea, he will visit you in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anger</span>, and in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fierce</span> anger he will not turn away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355086" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, do ye not remember the words which he spake unto Lehi, saying that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Inasmuch</span> as ye shall keep my commandments, ye shall prosper in the land? And again it is said that: Inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355087" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now I would that ye should remember, that inasmuch as the Lamanites have not kept the commandments of God, they have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cut off</span> from the presence of the Lord. Now we see that the word of the Lord has been verified in this thing, and the Lamanites have been cut off from his presence, from the beginning of their transgressions in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355089" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Nevertheless I say unto you, that it shall be more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tolerable</span> for them in the day of judgment than for you, if ye remain in your sins, <span class="page-break" data-page="230"></span>yea, and even more tolerable for them in this life than for you, except ye repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355091" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For there are many promises which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>extended</span> to the Lamanites; for it is because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers that caused them to remain in their state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ignorance</span>; therefore the Lord will be merciful unto them and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>prolong</span> their existence in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355093" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And at some period of time they will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brought</span> to believe in his word, and to know of the incorrectness of the traditions of their fathers; and many of them will be saved, for the Lord will be merciful unto all who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355095" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But behold, I say unto you that if ye persist in your wickedness that your days shall not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prolonged</span> in the land, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamanites</span> shall be sent upon you; and if ye repent not they shall come in a time when you know not, and ye shall be visited with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>utter</span> destruction; and it shall be according to the fierce <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>anger</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355096" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For he will not suffer you that ye shall live in your iniquities, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> his people. I say unto you, Nay; he would rather suffer that the Lamanites might destroy all his people who are called the people of Nephi, if it were possible that they could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fall</span> into sins and transgressions, after having had so much light and so much knowledge given unto them of the Lord their God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355098" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Yea, after having been such a highly favored people of the Lord; yea, after having been favored above every other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nation</span>, kindred, tongue, or people; after having had all things <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>made</span> known unto them, according to their desires, and their faith, and prayers, of that which has been, and which is, and which is to come;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355100" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visited</span> by the Spirit of God; having conversed with angels, and having been spoken unto by the voice of the Lord; and having the spirit of prophecy, and the spirit of revelation, and also many gifts, the gift of speaking with tongues, and the gift of preaching, and the gift of the Holy Ghost, and the gift of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>translation</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355102" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, and after having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> of God out of the land of Jerusalem, by the hand of the Lord; having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>saved</span> from famine, and from sickness, and all manner of diseases of every kind; and they having waxed strong in battle, that they might not be destroyed; having been brought out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bondage</span> time after time, and having been kept and preserved until now; and they have been prospered until they are rich in all manner of things—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355104" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now behold I say unto you, that if this people, who have received so many blessings from the hand of the Lord, should transgress <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contrary</span> to the light and knowledge which they do have, I say unto you that if this be the case, that if they should fall into transgression, it would be far more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tolerable</span> for the Lamanites than for them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355105" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promises</span> of the Lord are extended to the Lamanites, but they are not unto you if ye transgress; for has not the Lord expressly <span class="page-break" data-page="231"></span>promised and firmly decreed, that if ye will rebel against him that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>utterly</span> be destroyed from off the face of the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355107" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now for this cause, that ye may not be destroyed, the Lord has sent his angel to visit many of his people, declaring unto them that they must go forth and cry mightily unto this people, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Repent</span> ye, for the kingdom of heaven is nigh at hand;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355109" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> many days hence the Son of God shall come in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>; and his glory shall be the glory of the Only Begotten of the Father, full of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span>, equity, and truth, full of patience, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mercy</span>, and long-suffering, quick to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>hear</span> the cries of his people and to answer their prayers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355111" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And behold, he cometh to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeem</span> those who will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> unto repentance, through faith on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355113" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Therefore, prepare ye the way of the Lord, for the time is at hand that all men shall reap a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reward</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>works</span>, according to that which they have been—if they have been righteous they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reap</span> the salvation of their souls, according to the power and deliverance of Jesus Christ; and if they have been evil they shall reap the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>damnation</span> of their souls, according to the power and captivation of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355115" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now behold, this is the voice of the angel, crying unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355116" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beloved</span> brethren, for ye are my brethren, and ye ought to be beloved, and ye ought to bring forth works which are meet for repentance, seeing that your hearts have been grossly hardened against the word of God, and seeing that ye are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lost</span> and a fallen people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355118" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Now it came to pass that when I, Alma, had spoken these words, behold, the people were wroth with me because I said unto them that they were a hard-hearted and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355120" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And also because I said unto them that they were a lost and a fallen people they were angry with me, and sought to lay their hands upon me, that they might cast me into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355122" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But it came to pass that the Lord did not suffer them that they should take me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>at</span> that time and cast me into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355123" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that Amulek went and stood forth, and began to preach unto them also. And now the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of Amulek are not all written, nevertheless a part of his words are written in this book.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349421" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349422" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349423" id="study_summary1">Lehi descended from Manasseh—Amulek recounts the angelic command that he care for Alma—The prayers of the righteous cause the people to be spared—Unrighteous lawyers and judges lay the foundation of the destruction of the people. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349424" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now these are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Amulek</span> preached unto the people who were in the land of Ammonihah, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349425" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>I am Amulek; I am the son of Giddonah, who was the son of Ishmael, who was a descendant of Aminadi; and it was that same Aminadi who interpreted the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>writing</span> which was upon the wall of the temple, which was written by the finger of God.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="232"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349426" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And Aminadi was a descendant of Nephi, who was the son of Lehi, who came out of the land of Jerusalem, who was a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Manasseh</span>, who was the son of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Joseph</span> who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sold</span> into Egypt by the hands of his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349427" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And behold, I am also a man of no small <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reputation</span> among all those who know me; yea, and behold, I have many kindreds and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>friends</span>, and I have also acquired much riches by the hand of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>industry</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349428" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Nevertheless, after all this, I never have known much of the ways of the Lord, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mysteries</span> and marvelous power. I said I never had known much of these things; but behold, I mistake, for I have seen much of his mysteries and his marvelous power; yea, even in the preservation of the lives of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349429" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Nevertheless, I did harden my heart, for I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span> many times and I would not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hear</span>; therefore I knew concerning these things, yet I would not know; therefore I went on rebelling <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>against</span> God, in the wickedness of my heart, even until the fourth day of this seventh month, which is in the tenth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349430" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>As I was journeying to see a very near kindred, behold an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of the Lord appeared unto me and said: Amulek, return to thine own house, for thou shalt feed a prophet of the Lord; yea, a holy man, who is a chosen man of God; for he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fasted</span> many days because of the sins of this people, and he is an hungered, and thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>receive</span> him into thy house and feed him, and he shall bless thee and thy house; and the blessing of the Lord shall rest upon thee and thy house.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349431" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that I obeyed the voice of the angel, and returned towards my house. And as I was going thither I found the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span> whom the angel said unto me: Thou shalt receive into thy house—and behold it was this same man who has been speaking unto you concerning the things of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349432" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the angel said unto me he is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy</span> man; wherefore I know he is a holy man because it was said by an angel of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349433" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And again, I know that the things whereof he hath testified are true; for behold I say unto you, that as the Lord liveth, even so has he sent his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> to make these things manifest unto me; and this he has done while this Alma hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dwelt</span> at my house.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349434" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For behold, he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> mine house, he hath blessed me, and my women, and my children, and my father and my kinsfolk; yea, even all my kindred hath he blessed, and the blessing of the Lord hath rested upon us according to the words which he spake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349435" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, when Amulek had spoken these words the people began to be astonished, seeing there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> than one witness who testified of the things whereof they were accused, and also of the things which were to come, according to the spirit of prophecy which was in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349436" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Nevertheless, there were some among them who thought to question them, that by their cunning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>devices</span> they might catch them in their words, that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>find</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="233"></span>witness against them, that they might deliver them to their judges that they might be judged according to the law, and that they might be slain or cast into prison, according to the crime which they could make appear or witness against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349437" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now it was those men who sought to destroy them, who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lawyers</span>, who were hired or appointed by the people to administer the law at their times of trials, or at the trials of the crimes of the people before the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349438" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now these lawyers were learned in all the arts and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cunning</span> of the people; and this was to enable them that they might be skilful in their profession.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349439" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that they began to question Amulek, that thereby they might make him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cross</span> his words, or contradict the words which he should speak.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349440" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now they knew not that Amulek could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> of their designs. But it came to pass as they began to question him, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perceived</span> their thoughts, and he said unto them: O ye wicked and perverse <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>generation</span>, ye lawyers and hypocrites, for ye are laying the foundations of the devil; for ye are laying <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>traps</span> and snares to catch the holy ones of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349441" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Ye are laying plans to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pervert</span> the ways of the righteous, and to bring down the wrath of God upon your heads, even to the utter destruction of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349442" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Yea, well did Mosiah say, who was our last king, when he was about to deliver up the kingdom, having no one to confer it upon, causing that this people should be governed by their own voices—yea, well did he say that if the time should come that the voice of this people should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>choose</span> iniquity, that is, if the time should come that this people should fall into transgression, they would be ripe for destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349443" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now I say unto you that well doth the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span> of your iniquities; well doth he cry unto this people, by the voice of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angels</span>: Repent ye, repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349444" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Yea, well doth he cry, by the voice of his angels that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> will come down among my people, with equity and justice in my hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349445" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, and I say unto you that if it were not for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> of the righteous, who are now in the land, that ye would even now be visited with utter destruction; yet it would not be by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>flood</span>, as were the people in the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Noah</span>, but it would be by famine, and by pestilence, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sword</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349446" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But it is by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> of the righteous that ye are spared; now therefore, if ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast out</span> the righteous from among you then will not the Lord stay his hand; but in his fierce anger he will come out against you; then ye shall be smitten by famine, and by pestilence, and by the sword; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>time</span> is soon at hand except ye repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349447" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now it came to pass that the people were more angry with Amulek, and they cried out, saying: This man doth revile against our laws which are just, and our wise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lawyers</span> whom we have selected.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349448" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But Amulek stretched forth his hand, and cried the mightier unto them, saying: O ye wicked and <span class="page-break" data-page="234"></span>perverse generation, why hath Satan got such great hold upon your hearts? Why will ye yield yourselves unto him that he may have power over you, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blind</span> your eyes, that ye will not understand the words which are spoken, according to their truth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349449" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>For behold, have I testified against your law? Ye do not understand; ye say that I have spoken against your law; but I have not, but I have spoken in favor of your law, to your condemnation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349450" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now behold, I say unto you, that the foundation of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> of this people is beginning to be laid by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unrighteousness</span> of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lawyers</span> and your judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349451" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now it came to pass that when Amulek had spoken these words the people cried out against him, saying: Now we know that this man is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>child</span> of the devil, for he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lied</span> unto us; for he hath spoken against our law. And now he says that he has not spoken against it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349452" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And again, he has reviled against our lawyers, and our judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349453" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that the lawyers put it into their hearts that they should remember these things against him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349454" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And there was one among them whose name was Zeezrom. Now he was the foremost to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>accuse</span> Amulek and Alma, he being one of the most expert among them, having much business to do among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349455" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Now the object of these lawyers was to get gain; and they got gain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>according</span> to their employ.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350331" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350332" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350333" id="study_summary1">The Nephite monetary system is set forth—Amulek contends with Zeezrom—Christ will not save people in their sins—Only those who inherit the kingdom of heaven are saved—All men will rise in immortality—There is no death after the Resurrection. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350334" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it was in the law of Mosiah that every man who was a judge of the law, or those who were appointed to be judges, should receive <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wages</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>according</span> to the time which they labored to judge those who were brought before them to be judged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350335" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now if a man owed another, and he would not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pay</span> that which he did owe, he was complained of to the judge; and the judge executed authority, and sent forth officers that the man should be brought before him; and he judged the man according to the law and the evidences which were brought against him, and thus the man was compelled to pay that which he owed, or be stripped, or be cast out from among the people as a thief and a robber.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350336" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the judge received for his wages <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>according</span> to his time—a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>senine</span> of gold for a day, or a senum of silver, which is equal to a senine of gold; and this is according to the law which was given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350337" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now these are the names of the different pieces of their gold, and of their silver, according to their value. And the names are given by the Nephites, for they did not reckon after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manner</span> of the Jews who were at Jerusalem; neither did they measure after the manner of the Jews; but they altered their reckoning and their measure, according to the minds and the circumstances of the people, in every generation, until the reign of the judges, they having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>established</span> by king Mosiah.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="235"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350338" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now the reckoning is thus—a senine of gold, a seon of gold, a shum of gold, and a limnah of gold.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350339" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>A senum of silver, an amnor of silver, an ezrom of silver, and an onti of silver.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350340" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>A senum of silver was equal to a senine of gold, and either for a measure of barley, and also for a measure of every kind of grain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350341" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the amount of a seon of gold was twice the value of a senine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350342" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And a shum of gold was twice the value of a seon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350343" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And a limnah of gold was the value of them all.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350344" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And an amnor of silver was as great as two senums.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350345" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And an ezrom of silver was as great as four senums.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350346" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And an onti was as great as them all.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350347" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now this is the value of the lesser numbers of their reckoning—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350348" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>A shiblon is half of a senum; therefore, a shiblon for half a measure of barley.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350349" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And a shiblum is a half of a shiblon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350350"
