id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And a leah is the half of a shiblum.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350351" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now this is their number, according to their reckoning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350352" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now an antion of gold is equal to three shiblons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350353" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now, it was for the sole purpose to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gain</span>, because they received their wages according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>employ</span>, therefore, they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stir up</span> the people to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>riotings</span>, and all manner of disturbances and wickedness, that they might have more employ, that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>get</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>money</span> according to the suits which were brought before them; therefore they did stir up the people against Alma and Amulek.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350354" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And this Zeezrom began to question Amulek, saying: Will ye answer me a few questions which I shall ask you? Now Zeezrom was a man who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>expert</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devices</span> of the devil, that he might destroy that which was good; therefore, he said unto Amulek: Will ye answer the questions which I shall put unto you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350355" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And Amulek said unto him: Yea, if it be according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord, which is in me; for I shall say nothing which is contrary to the Spirit of the Lord. And Zeezrom said unto him: Behold, here are six onties of silver, and all these will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>give</span> thee if thou wilt deny the existence of a Supreme Being.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350356" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now Amulek said: O thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>child</span> of hell, why <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tempt</span> ye me? Knowest thou that the righteous yieldeth to no such temptations?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350357" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Believest thou that there is no God? I say unto you, Nay, thou knowest that there is a God, but thou lovest that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lucre</span> more than him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350358" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now thou hast lied before God unto me. Thou saidst unto me—Behold these six onties, which are of great worth, I will give unto thee—when thou hadst it in thy heart to retain them from me; and it was only thy desire that I should deny the true and living God, that thou mightest have cause to destroy me. And now behold, for this great evil thou shalt have thy reward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350359" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And Zeezrom said unto him: Thou sayest there is a true and living God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350360" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And Amulek said: Yea, there is a true and living God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350361" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Now Zeezrom said: Is there more than one God?</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="236"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350362" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And he answered, No.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350363" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Now Zeezrom said unto him again: How knowest thou these things?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350364" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he said: An <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> hath made them known unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350365" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And Zeezrom said again: Who is he that shall come? Is it the Son of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350366" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And he said unto him, Yea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350367" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And Zeezrom said again: Shall he save his people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in</span> their sins? And Amulek answered and said unto him: I say unto you he shall not, for it is impossible for him to deny his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350368" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Now Zeezrom said unto the people: See that ye remember these things; for he said there is but one God; yet he saith that the Son of God shall come, but he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> save his people—as though he had authority to command God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350369" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now Amulek saith again unto him: Behold thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lied</span>, for thou sayest that I spake as though I had authority to command God because I said he shall not save his people in their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350370" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And I say unto you again that he cannot save them in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span>; for I cannot deny his word, and he hath said that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no unclean thing</span> can inherit the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>kingdom</span> of heaven; therefore, how can ye be saved, except ye inherit the kingdom of heaven? Therefore, ye cannot be saved in your sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350371" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Now Zeezrom saith again unto him: Is the Son of God the very Eternal Father?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350372" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And Amulek said unto him: Yea, he is the very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Eternal Father</span> of heaven and of earth, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> things which in them are; he is the beginning and the end, the first and the last;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350373" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And he shall come into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>world</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redeem</span> his people; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take upon</span> him the transgressions of those who believe on his name; and these are they that shall have eternal life, and salvation cometh to none else.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350374" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Therefore the wicked remain as though there had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> redemption made, except it be the loosing of the bands of death; for behold, the day cometh that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> shall rise from the dead and stand before God, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judged</span> according to their works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350375" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>Now, there is a death which is called a temporal death; and the death of Christ shall loose the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bands</span> of this temporal death, that all shall be raised from this temporal death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350376" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>The spirit and the body shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reunited</span> again in its <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perfect</span> form; both limb and joint shall be restored to its proper frame, even as we now are at this time; and we shall be brought to stand before God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowing</span> even as we know now, and have a bright <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>recollection</span> of all our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>guilt</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350377" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>Now, this restoration shall come to all, both old and young, both bond and free, both male and female, both the wicked and the righteous; and even there shall not so much as a hair of their heads be lost; but every thing shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restored</span> to its perfect frame, as it is now, or in the body, and shall be <span class="page-break" data-page="237"></span>brought and be arraigned before the bar of Christ the Son, and God the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Father</span>, and the Holy Spirit, which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>one Eternal God</span>, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>judged</span> according to their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350378" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>Now, behold, I have spoken unto you concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> of the mortal body, and also concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>resurrection</span> of the mortal body. I say unto you that this mortal body is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>raised</span> to an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>immortal</span> body, that is from death, even from the first death unto life, that they can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>die</span> no more; their spirits uniting with their bodies, never to be divided; thus the whole becoming <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>spiritual</span> and immortal, that they can no more see corruption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350379" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>Now, when Amulek had finished these words the people began again to be astonished, and also Zeezrom began to tremble. And thus ended the words of Amulek, or this is all that I have written.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350431" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350432" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350433" id="study_summary1">Alma speaks to Zeezrom—The mysteries of God can be given only to the faithful—Men are judged by their thoughts, beliefs, words, and works—The wicked will suffer a spiritual death—This mortal life is a probationary state—The plan of redemption brings to pass the Resurrection and, through faith, a remission of sins—The repentant have a claim on mercy through the Only Begotten Son. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350434" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now Alma, seeing that the words of Amulek had silenced Zeezrom, for he beheld that Amulek had caught him in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lying</span> and deceiving to destroy him, and seeing that he began to tremble under a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>consciousness</span> of his guilt, he opened his mouth and began to speak unto him, and to establish the words of Amulek, and to explain things beyond, or to unfold the scriptures beyond that which Amulek had done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350435" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now the words that Alma spake unto Zeezrom were heard by the people round about; for the multitude was great, and he spake on this wise:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350436" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now Zeezrom, seeing that thou hast been taken in thy lying and craftiness, for thou hast not lied unto men only but thou hast lied unto God; for behold, he knows all thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thoughts</span>, and thou seest that thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thoughts</span> are made known unto us by his Spirit;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350437" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thou seest that we know that thy plan was a very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>subtle</span> plan, as to the subtlety of the devil, for to lie and to deceive this people that thou mightest set them against us, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>revile</span> us and to cast us out—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350438" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now this was a plan of thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>adversary</span>, and he hath exercised his power in thee. Now I would that ye should remember that what I say unto thee I say unto all.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350439" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And behold I say unto you all that this was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>snare</span> of the adversary, which he has laid to catch this people, that he might bring you into subjection unto him, that he might encircle you about with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chains</span>, that he might chain you down to everlasting destruction, according to the power of his captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350440" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now when Alma had spoken these words, Zeezrom began to tremble more exceedingly, for he was convinced more and more of the power of God; and he was also <span class="page-break" data-page="238"></span>convinced that Alma and Amulek had a knowledge of him, for he was convinced that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knew</span> the thoughts and intents of his heart; for power was given unto them that they might know of these things according to the spirit of prophecy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350441" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And Zeezrom began to inquire of them diligently, that he might know more concerning the kingdom of God. And he said unto Alma: What does this mean which Amulek hath spoken concerning the resurrection of the dead, that all shall rise from the dead, both the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>just</span> and the unjust, and are brought to stand before God to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> according to their works?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350442" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now Alma began to expound these things unto him, saying: It is given unto many to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mysteries</span> of God; nevertheless they are laid under a strict command that they shall not impart <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>only</span> according to the portion of his word which he doth grant unto the children of men, according to the heed and diligence which they give unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350443" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And therefore, he that will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harden</span> his heart, the same receiveth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lesser</span> portion of the word; and he that will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not</span> harden his heart, to him is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>given</span> the greater portion of the word, until it is given unto him to know the mysteries of God until he know them in full.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350444" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And they that will harden their hearts, to them is given the lesser <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>portion</span> of the word until they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know nothing</span> concerning his mysteries; and then they are taken captive by the devil, and led by his will down to destruction. Now this is what is meant by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chains</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hell</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350445" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And Amulek hath spoken plainly concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>, and being raised from this mortality to a state of immortality, and being brought before the bar of God, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> according to our works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350446" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Then if our hearts have been hardened, yea, if we have hardened our hearts against the word, insomuch that it has not been found in us, then will our state be awful, for then we shall be condemned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350447" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> will condemn us, yea, all our works will condemn us; we shall not be found spotless; and our thoughts will also condemn us; and in this awful state we shall not dare to look up to our God; and we would fain be glad if we could command the rocks and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mountains</span> to fall upon us to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hide</span> us from his presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350448" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But this cannot be; we must come forth and stand before him in his glory, and in his power, and in his might, majesty, and dominion, and acknowledge to our everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shame</span> that all his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgments</span> are just; that he is just in all his works, and that he is merciful unto the children of men, and that he has all power to save every man that believeth on his name and bringeth forth fruit meet for repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350449" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now behold, I say unto you then cometh a death, even a second <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>, which is a spiritual death; <span class="page-break" data-page="239"></span>then is a time that whosoever dieth in his sins, as to a temporal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>, shall also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>die</span> a spiritual death; yea, he shall die as to things pertaining unto righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350450" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Then is the time when their torments shall be as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lake</span> of fire and brimstone, whose flame ascendeth up forever and ever; and then is the time that they shall be chained down to an everlasting destruction, according to the power and captivity of Satan, he having subjected them according to his will.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350451" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Then, I say unto you, they shall be as though there had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> redemption made; for they cannot be redeemed according to God’s justice; and they cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>die</span>, seeing there is no more corruption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350452" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now it came to pass that when Alma had made an end of speaking these words, the people began to be more astonished;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350453" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But there was one Antionah, who was a chief ruler among them, came forth and said unto him: What is this that thou hast said, that man should rise from the dead and be changed from this mortal to an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>immortal</span> state, that the soul can never die?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350454" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>What does the scripture mean, which saith that God placed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cherubim</span> and a flaming sword on the east of the garden of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Eden</span>, lest our first parents should enter and partake of the fruit of the tree of life, and live forever? And thus we see that there was no possible chance that they should live forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350455" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now Alma said unto him: This is the thing which I was about to explain. Now we see that Adam did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fall</span> by the partaking of the forbidden <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span>, according to the word of God; and thus we see, that by his fall, all mankind became a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lost</span> and fallen people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350456" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now behold, I say unto you that if it had been possible for Adam to have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>partaken</span> of the fruit of the tree of life at that time, there would have been no death, and the word would have been void, making God a liar, for he said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>If</span> thou eat thou shalt surely die.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350457" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And we see that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> comes upon mankind, yea, the death which has been spoken of by Amulek, which is the temporal death; nevertheless there was a space granted unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>man</span> in which he might repent; therefore this life became a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>probationary state</span>; a time to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>prepare</span> to meet God; a time to prepare for that endless state which has been spoken of by us, which is after the resurrection of the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350458" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now, if it had not been for the plan of redemption, which was laid from the foundation of the world, there could have been no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead; but there was a plan of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redemption</span> laid, which shall bring to pass the resurrection of the dead, of which has been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350459" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now behold, if it were possible that our first parents could have gone forth and partaken of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree of life</span> they would have been forever miserable, having no preparatory state; and thus the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan <span class="page-break" data-page="240"></span>of redemption</span> would have been frustrated, and the word of God would have been void, taking none effect.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350460" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>But behold, it was not so; but it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appointed</span> unto men that they must die; and after death, they must come to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment</span>, even that same judgment of which we have spoken, which is the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350461" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And after God had appointed that these things should come unto man, behold, then he saw that it was expedient that man should know concerning the things whereof he had appointed unto them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350462" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore he sent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> to converse with them, who caused men to behold of his glory.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350463" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And they began from that time forth to call on his name; therefore God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conversed</span> with men, and made known unto them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan of redemption</span>, which had been prepared from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foundation</span> of the world; and this he made known unto them according to their faith and repentance and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>holy</span> works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350464" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Wherefore, he gave <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span> unto men, they having first transgressed the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>first</span> commandments as to things which were temporal, and becoming as gods, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowing</span> good from evil, placing themselves in a state to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>act</span>, or being placed in a state to act according to their wills and pleasures, whether to do evil or to do good—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350465" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Therefore God gave unto them commandments, after having made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>known</span> unto them the plan of redemption, that they should not do evil, the penalty thereof being a second <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>, which was an everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span> as to things pertaining unto righteousness; for on such the plan of redemption could have no power, for the works of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>justice</span> could not be destroyed, according to the supreme <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>goodness</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350466" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But God did call on men, in the name of his Son, (this being the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plan of redemption</span> which was laid) saying: If ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repent</span>, and harden not your hearts, then will I have mercy upon you, through mine Only Begotten Son;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350467" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Therefore, whosoever repenteth, and hardeneth not his heart, he shall have claim on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> through mine Only Begotten Son, unto a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of his sins; and these shall enter into my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rest</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350468" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And whosoever will harden his heart and will do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquity</span>, behold, I swear in my wrath that he shall not enter into my rest.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350469" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And now, my brethren, behold I say unto you, that if ye will harden your hearts ye shall not enter into the rest of the Lord; therefore your iniquity <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>provoketh</span> him that he sendeth down his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrath</span> upon you as in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>first</span> provocation, yea, according to his word in the last provocation as well as the first, to the everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>destruction</span> of your souls; therefore, according to his word, unto the last death, as well as the first.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350470" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And now, my brethren, seeing we know these things, and they are true, let us repent, and harden not <span class="page-break" data-page="241"></span>our hearts, that we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>provoke</span> not the Lord our God to pull down his wrath upon us in these his second commandments which he has given unto us; but let us enter into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rest</span> of God, which is prepared according to his word.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350541" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350552" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350553" id="study_summary1">Men are called as high priests because of their exceeding faith and good works—They are to teach the commandments—Through righteousness they are sanctified and enter into the rest of the Lord—Melchizedek was one of these—Angels are declaring glad tidings throughout the land—They will declare the actual coming of Christ. About 82 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350554" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And again, my brethren, I would cite your minds forward to the time when the Lord God gave these commandments unto his children; and I would that ye should remember that the Lord God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordained</span> priests, after his holy order, which was after the order of his Son, to teach these things unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350555" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And those priests were ordained after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span> of his Son, in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>manner</span> that thereby the people might know in what manner to look forward to his Son for redemption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350556" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And this is the manner after which they were ordained—being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prepared</span> from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foundation</span> of the world according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>foreknowledge</span> of God, on account of their exceeding faith and good works; in the first place being left to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>choose</span> good or evil; therefore they having chosen good, and exercising exceedingly great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>faith</span>, are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>called</span> with a holy calling, yea, with that holy calling which was prepared with, and according to, a preparatory redemption for such.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350557" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus they have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span> to this holy calling on account of their faith, while others would reject the Spirit of God on account of the hardness of their hearts and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blindness</span> of their minds, while, if it had not been for this they might have had as great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>privilege</span> as their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350558" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Or in fine, in the first place they were on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>same</span> standing with their brethren; thus this holy calling being prepared from the foundation of the world for such as would not harden their hearts, being in and through the atonement of the Only Begotten Son, who was prepared—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350559" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And thus being called by this holy calling, and ordained unto the high priesthood of the holy order of God, to teach his commandments unto the children of men, that they also might enter into his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350560" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>This high priesthood being after the order of his Son, which order was from the foundation of the world; or in other words, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>without</span> beginning of days or end of years, being prepared from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eternity</span> to all eternity, according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foreknowledge</span> of all things—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350561" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordained</span> after this manner—being called with a holy calling, and ordained with a holy ordinance, and taking upon them the high priesthood of the holy order, which calling, and ordinance, <span class="page-break" data-page="242"></span>and high priesthood, is without beginning or end—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350562" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Thus they become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priests</span> forever, after the order of the Son, the Only Begotten of the Father, who is without beginning of days or end of years, who is full of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span>, equity, and truth. And thus it is. Amen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350563" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now, as I said concerning the holy order, or this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priesthood</span>, there were many who were ordained and became high priests of God; and it was on account of their exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repentance</span>, and their righteousness before God, they choosing to repent and work righteousness rather than to perish;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350564" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore they were called after this holy order, and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sanctified</span>, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>garments</span> were washed white through the blood of the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350565" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now they, after being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sanctified</span> by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>, having their garments made white, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pure</span> and spotless before God, could not look upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sin</span> save it were with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>abhorrence</span>; and there were many, exceedingly great many, who were made pure and entered into the rest of the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350566" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, my brethren, I would that ye should humble yourselves before God, and bring forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruit</span> meet for repentance, that ye may also enter into that rest.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350567" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, humble yourselves even as the people in the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Melchizedek</span>, who was also a high priest after this same order which I have spoken, who also took upon him the high priesthood forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350568" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it was this same Melchizedek to whom Abraham paid <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tithes</span>; yea, even our father Abraham paid tithes of one-tenth part of all he possessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350569" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordinances</span> were given after this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>manner</span>, that thereby the people might look forward on the Son of God, it being a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>type</span> of his order, or it being his order, and this that they might look forward to him for a remission of their sins, that they might enter into the rest of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350570" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now this Melchizedek was a king over the land of Salem; and his people had waxed strong in iniquity and abomination; yea, they had all gone astray; they were full of all manner of wickedness;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350571" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But Melchizedek having exercised mighty faith, and received the office of the high priesthood according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy order</span> of God, did preach repentance unto his people. And behold, they did repent; and Melchizedek did establish peace in the land in his days; therefore he was called the prince of peace, for he was the king of Salem; and he did reign under his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350572" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now, there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> before him, and also there were many afterwards, but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>none</span> were greater; therefore, of him they have more particularly made mention.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350573" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now I need not rehearse the matter; what I have said may suffice. Behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scriptures</span> are <span class="page-break" data-page="243"></span>before you; if ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrest</span> them it shall be to your own destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350574" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now it came to pass that when Alma had said these words unto them, he stretched forth his hand unto them and cried with a mighty voice, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Now</span> is the time to repent, for the day of salvation draweth nigh;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350575" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, and the voice of the Lord, by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mouth</span> of angels, doth declare it unto all nations; yea, doth declare it, that they may have glad tidings of great joy; yea, and he doth sound these glad tidings among all his people, yea, even to them that are scattered abroad upon the face of the earth; wherefore they have come unto us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350576" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they are made known unto us in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plain</span> terms, that we may understand, that we cannot err; and this because of our being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wanderers</span> in a strange land; therefore, we are thus highly favored, for we have these glad tidings declared unto us in all parts of our vineyard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350577" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> are declaring it unto many at this time in our land; and this is for the purpose of preparing the hearts of the children of men to receive his word at the time of his coming in his glory.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350578" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now we only wait to hear the joyful news declared unto us by the mouth of angels, of his coming; for the time cometh, we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know not</span> how soon. Would to God that it might be in my day; but let it be sooner or later, in it I will rejoice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350579" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it shall be made known unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>just</span> and holy men, by the mouth of angels, at the time of his coming, that the words of our fathers may be fulfilled, according to that which they have spoken concerning him, which was according to the spirit of prophecy which was in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350580" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now, my brethren, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wish</span> from the inmost part of my heart, yea, with great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anxiety</span> even unto pain, that ye would hearken unto my words, and cast off your sins, and not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>procrastinate</span> the day of your repentance;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350581" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>But that ye would humble yourselves before the Lord, and call on his holy name, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>watch</span> and pray continually, that ye may not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tempted</span> above that which ye can bear, and thus be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>led</span> by the Holy Spirit, becoming humble, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>meek</span>, submissive, patient, full of love and all long-suffering;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350582" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Having</span> faith on the Lord; having a hope that ye shall receive eternal life; having the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>love</span> of God always in your hearts, that ye may be lifted up at the last day and enter into his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rest</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350583" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And may the Lord grant unto you repentance, that ye may not bring down his wrath upon you, that ye may not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bound</span> down by the chains of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hell</span>, that ye may not suffer the second <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350584" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And Alma spake many more words unto the people, which are not written in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> book.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350647" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350649" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350650" id="study_summary1">Alma and Amulek are imprisoned and smitten—The believers and their holy scriptures are burned by fire—These martyrs are received by the Lord <span class="page-break" data-page="244"></span>in glory—The prison walls are rent and fall—Alma and Amulek are delivered, and their persecutors are slain. About 82–81 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350651" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass after he had made an end of speaking unto the people many of them did believe on his words, and began to repent, and to search the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scriptures</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350652" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But the more part of them were desirous that they might destroy Alma and Amulek; for they were angry with Alma, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plainness</span> of his words unto Zeezrom; and they also said that Amulek had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lied</span> unto them, and had reviled against their law and also against their lawyers and judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350653" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they were also angry with Alma and Amulek; and because they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testified</span> so plainly against their wickedness, they sought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>put</span> them away privily.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350654" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But it came to pass that they did not; but they took them and bound them with strong cords, and took them before the chief judge of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350655" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the people went forth and witnessed against them—testifying that they had reviled against the law, and their lawyers and judges of the land, and also of all the people that were in the land; and also testified that there was but one God, and that he should send his Son among the people, but he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> save them; and many such things did the people testify against Alma and Amulek. Now this was done before the chief judge of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350656" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that Zeezrom was astonished at the words which had been spoken; and he also knew concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blindness</span> of the minds, which he had caused among the people by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lying</span> words; and his soul began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>harrowed up</span> under a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>consciousness</span> of his own guilt; yea, he began to be encircled about by the pains of hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350657" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that he began to cry unto the people, saying: Behold, I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guilty</span>, and these men are spotless before God. And he began to plead for them from that time forth; but they reviled him, saying: Art thou also possessed with the devil? And they spit upon him, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast</span> him out from among them, and also all those who believed in the words which had been spoken by Alma and Amulek; and they cast them out, and sent men to cast stones at them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350658" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And they brought their wives and children together, and whosoever believed or had been taught to believe in the word of God they caused that they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> into the fire; and they also brought forth their records which contained the holy scriptures, and cast them into the fire also, that they might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burned</span> and destroyed by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350659" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they took Alma and Amulek, and carried them forth to the place of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>martyrdom</span>, that they might witness the destruction of those who were consumed by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350660" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And when Amulek saw the pains of the women and children who were consuming in the fire, he also was pained; and he said unto Alma: How can we witness this awful scene? Therefore let us stretch forth our hands, and exercise the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of God which is in us, and save them from the flames.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350661" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But Alma said unto him: The Spirit constraineth me that I must not stretch forth mine hand; for behold the Lord receiveth them up <span class="page-break" data-page="245"></span>unto himself, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span>; and he doth suffer that they may do this thing, or that the people may do this thing unto them, according to the hardness of their hearts, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgments</span> which he shall exercise upon them in his wrath may be just; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blood</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>innocent</span> shall stand as a witness against them, yea, and cry mightily against them at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350662" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now Amulek said unto Alma: Behold, perhaps they will burn us also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350663" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Alma said: Be it according to the will of the Lord. But, behold, our work is not finished; therefore they burn us not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350664" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now it came to pass that when the bodies of those who had been cast into the fire were consumed, and also the records which were cast in with them, the chief judge of the land came and stood before Alma and Amulek, as they were bound; and he smote them with his hand upon their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cheeks</span>, and said unto them: After what ye have seen, will ye preach again unto this people, that they shall be cast into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lake</span> of fire and brimstone?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350665" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, ye see that ye had not power to save those who had been cast into the fire; neither has God saved them because they were of thy faith. And the judge smote them again upon their cheeks, and asked: What say ye for yourselves?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350666" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now this judge was after the order and faith of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nehor</span>, who slew Gideon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350667" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that Alma and Amulek answered him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nothing</span>; and he smote them again, and delivered them to the officers to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast</span> into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350668" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And when they had been cast into prison three days, there came many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lawyers</span>, and judges, and priests, and teachers, who were of the profession of Nehor; and they came in unto the prison to see them, and they questioned them about many words; but they answered them nothing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350669" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the judge stood before them, and said: Why do ye not answer the words of this people? Know ye not that I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> to deliver you up unto the flames? And he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commanded</span> them to speak; but they answered nothing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350670" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they departed and went their ways, but came again on the morrow; and the judge also smote them again on their cheeks. And many came forth also, and smote them, saying: Will ye stand again and judge this people, and condemn our law? If ye have such great power why do ye not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> yourselves?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350671" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And many such things did they say unto them, gnashing their teeth upon them, and spitting upon them, and saying: How shall we look when we are damned?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350672" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And many such things, yea, all manner of such things did they say unto them; and thus they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mock</span> them for many days. And they did withhold food from them that they might hunger, and water that they might thirst; and they also did take from them their clothes that they were naked; and thus they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bound</span> with strong cords, and confined in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prison</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350673" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass after they had thus suffered for many days, (and it was on the twelfth day, in the tenth month, in the tenth year of the reign of the judges over the <span class="page-break" data-page="246"></span>people of Nephi) that the chief judge over the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammonihah</span> and many of their teachers and their lawyers went in unto the prison where Alma and Amulek were bound with cords.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350674" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And the chief judge stood before them, and smote them again, and said unto them: If ye have the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of God deliver yourselves from these bands, and then we will believe that the Lord will destroy this people according to your words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350675" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that they all went forth and smote them, saying the same words, even until the last; and when the last had spoken unto them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of God was upon Alma and Amulek, and they rose and stood upon their feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349505" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And Alma cried, saying: How long shall we suffer these great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span>, O Lord? O Lord, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>give</span> us strength according to our faith which is in Christ, even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deliverance</span>. And they broke the cords with which they were bound; and when the people saw this, they began to flee, for the fear of destruction had come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349506" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that so great was their fear that they fell to the earth, and did not obtain the outer door of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span>; and the earth shook mightily, and the walls of the prison were rent in twain, so that they fell to the earth; and the chief judge, and the lawyers, and priests, and teachers, who smote upon Alma and Amulek, were slain by the fall thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349507" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And Alma and Amulek came forth out of the prison, and they were not hurt; for the Lord had granted unto them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>, according to their faith which was in Christ. And they straightway came forth out of the prison; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>loosed</span> from their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bands</span>; and the prison had fallen to the earth, and every soul within the walls thereof, save it were Alma and Amulek, was slain; and they straightway came forth into the city.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349508" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now the people having heard a great noise came running together by multitudes to know the cause of it; and when they saw Alma and Amulek coming forth out of the prison, and the walls thereof had fallen to the earth, they were struck with great fear, and fled from the presence of Alma and Amulek even as a goat fleeth with her young from two lions; and thus they did flee from the presence of Alma and Amulek.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349504" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350676" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350677" id="study_summary1">Alma and Amulek go to Sidom and establish a church—Alma heals Zeezrom, who joins the Church—Many are baptized, and the Church prospers—Alma and Amulek go to Zarahemla. About 81 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350678" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Alma and Amulek were commanded to depart out of that city; and they departed, and came out even into the land of Sidom; and behold, there they found all the people who had departed out of the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammonihah</span>, who had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cast out</span> and stoned, because they believed in the words of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350679" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they related unto them all that had happened unto their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wives</span> and children, and also concerning themselves, and of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> of deliverance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350680" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And also Zeezrom lay sick at Sidom, with a burning fever, which was caused by the great tribulations <span class="page-break" data-page="247"></span>of his mind on account of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span>, for he supposed that Alma and Amulek were no more; and he supposed that they had been slain because of his iniquity. And this great sin, and his many other sins, did harrow up his mind until it did become exceedingly sore, having no deliverance; therefore he began to be scorched with a burning heat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350681" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now, when he heard that Alma and Amulek were in the land of Sidom, his heart began to take courage; and he sent a message immediately unto them, desiring them to come unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350682" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that they went immediately, obeying the message which he had sent unto them; and they went in unto the house unto Zeezrom; and they found him upon his bed, sick, being very low with a burning fever; and his mind also was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exceedingly</span> sore because of his iniquities; and when he saw them he stretched forth his hand, and besought them that they would heal him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350683" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that Alma said unto him, taking him by the hand: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Believest</span> thou in the power of Christ unto salvation?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350684" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he answered and said: Yea, I believe all the words that thou hast taught.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350685" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And Alma said: If thou believest in the redemption of Christ thou canst be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>healed</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350686" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he said: Yea, I believe according to thy words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350687" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And then Alma cried unto the Lord, saying: O Lord our God, have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> on this man, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heal</span> him according to his faith which is in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350688" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And when Alma had said these words, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zeezrom</span> leaped upon his feet, and began to walk; and this was done to the great astonishment of all the people; and the knowledge of this went forth throughout all the land of Sidom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350689" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And Alma baptized Zeezrom unto the Lord; and he began from that time forth to preach unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350690" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Alma established a church in the land of Sidom, and consecrated <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teachers</span> in the land, to baptize unto the Lord whosoever were desirous to be baptized.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350691" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that they were many; for they did flock in from all the region round about Sidom, and were baptized.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350692" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But as to the people that were in the land of Ammonihah, they yet remained a hard-hearted and a stiffnecked people; and they repented not of their sins, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ascribing</span> all the power of Alma and Amulek to the devil; for they were of the profession of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nehor</span>, and did not believe in the repentance of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350693" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that Alma and Amulek, Amulek having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forsaken</span> all his gold, and silver, and his precious things, which were in the land of Ammonihah, for the word of God, he being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rejected</span> by those who were once his friends and also by his father and his kindred;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350694" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore, after Alma having established the church at Sidom, seeing a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>check</span>, yea, seeing that the people were checked as to the pride of their hearts, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>humble</span> themselves before God, and began to assemble themselves together at their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sanctuaries</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>worship</span> God before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>altar</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>watching</span> and praying continually, that they might be delivered from Satan, and from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>death</span>, and from destruction—</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="248"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350695" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now as I said, Alma having seen all these things, therefore he took Amulek and came over to the land of Zarahemla, and took him to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>own</span> house, and did administer unto him in his tribulations, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strengthened</span> him in the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350697" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And thus ended the tenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350696" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350714" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350715" id="study_summary1">The Lamanites destroy the people of Ammonihah—Zoram leads the Nephites to victory over the Lamanites—Alma and Amulek and many others preach the word—They teach that after His Resurrection Christ will appear to the Nephites. About 81–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350717" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass in the eleventh year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, on the fifth day of the second month, there having been much peace in the land of Zarahemla, there having been no wars nor contentions for a certain number of years, even until the fifth day of the second month in the eleventh year, there was a cry of war heard throughout the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350719" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, the armies of the Lamanites had come in upon the wilderness side, into the borders of the land, even into the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammonihah</span>, and began to slay the people and destroy the city.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350721" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now it came to pass, before the Nephites could raise a sufficient army to drive them out of the land, they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span> the people who were in the city of Ammonihah, and also some around the borders of Noah, and taken others captive into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350722" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now it came to pass that the Nephites were desirous to obtain those who had been carried away captive into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350724" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore, he that had been appointed chief captain over the armies of the Nephites, (and his name was Zoram, and he had two sons, Lehi and Aha)—now Zoram and his two sons, knowing that Alma was high priest over the church, and having heard that he had the spirit of prophecy, therefore they went unto him and desired of him to know whither the Lord would that they should go into the wilderness in search of their brethren, who had been taken captive by the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350726" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that Alma <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquired</span> of the Lord concerning the matter. And Alma returned and said unto them: Behold, the Lamanites will cross the river Sidon in the south wilderness, away up beyond the borders of the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Manti</span>. And behold there shall ye meet them, on the east of the river Sidon, and there the Lord will deliver unto thee thy brethren who have been taken captive by the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350727" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that Zoram and his sons crossed over the river Sidon, with their armies, and marched away beyond the borders of Manti into the south wilderness, which was on the east side of the river Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350729" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And they came upon the armies of the Lamanites, and the Lamanites were scattered and driven into the wilderness; and they took their brethren who had been taken captive by the Lamanites, and there was not one soul of them had been lost that were taken captive.
