And they were brought by their brethren to possess their own lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350731" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And thus ended the eleventh year of the judges, the Lamanites having been driven out of the land, and the people of Ammonihah were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span>; yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>every</span> living soul <span class="page-break" data-page="249"></span>of the Ammonihahites was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroyed</span>, and also their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>great</span> city, which they said God could not destroy, because of its greatness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350733" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But behold, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> day it was left desolate; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carcasses</span> were mangled by dogs and wild beasts of the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350734" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Nevertheless, after many days their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dead</span> bodies were heaped up upon the face of the earth, and they were covered with a shallow covering. And now so great was the scent thereof that the people did not go in to possess the land of Ammonihah for many years. And it was called Desolation of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nehors</span>; for they were of the profession of Nehor, who were slain; and their lands remained desolate.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350736" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And the Lamanites did not come again to war against the Nephites until the fourteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi. And thus for three years did the people of Nephi have continual peace in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350738" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Alma and Amulek went forth preaching repentance to the people in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temples</span>, and in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sanctuaries</span>, and also in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>synagogues</span>, which were built after the manner of the Jews.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350739" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And as many as would hear their words, unto them they did impart the word of God, without any <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>respect</span> of persons, continually.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350740" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And thus did Alma and Amulek go forth, and also many more who had been chosen for the work, to preach the word throughout all the land. And the establishment of the church became general throughout the land, in all the region round about, among all the people of the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350741" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> inequality among them; the Lord did pour out his Spirit on all the face of the land to prepare the minds of the children of men, or to prepare their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearts</span> to receive the word which should be taught among them at the time of his coming—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350742" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>That they might not be hardened against the word, that they might not be unbelieving, and go on to destruction, but that they might receive the word with joy, and as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>branch</span> be grafted into the true vine, that they might enter into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rest</span> of the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350743" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>priests</span> who did go forth among the people did preach against all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lyings</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deceivings</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>envyings</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>strifes</span>, and malice, and revilings, and stealing, robbing, plundering, murdering, committing adultery, and all manner of lasciviousness, crying that these things ought not so to be—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350744" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Holding forth things which must shortly come; yea, holding forth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>coming</span> of the Son of God, his sufferings and death, and also the resurrection of the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350745" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And many of the people did inquire concerning the place where the Son of God should come; and they were taught that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appear</span> unto them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>after</span> his resurrection; and this the people did hear with great joy and gladness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350746" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now after the church had been established throughout all the land—having got the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>victory</span> over <span class="page-break" data-page="250"></span>the devil, and the word of God being preached in its purity in all the land, and the Lord pouring out his blessings upon the people—thus ended the fourteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 17	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350776" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/17" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 17</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128350777" id="intro1">An account of the sons of Mosiah, who rejected their rights to the kingdom for the word of God, and went up to the land of Nephi to preach to the Lamanites; their sufferings and deliverance—according to the record of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128350778" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 17 through 27.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350779" id="title_number1">Chapter 17</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350780" id="study_summary1">The sons of Mosiah have the spirit of prophecy and of revelation—They go their several ways to declare the word to the Lamanites—Ammon goes to the land of Ishmael and becomes the servant of King Lamoni—Ammon saves the king’s flocks and slays his enemies at the water of Sebus. <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/bofm/alma/17?verse=1-3#p1">Verses 1–3</a>, about 77 <small>B.C.</small>; <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/bofm/alma/17?verse=4#p4">verse 4</a>, about 91–77 <small>B.C.</small>; and <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/bofm/alma/17?verse=5-39#p5">verses 5–39</a>, about 91 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350781" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that as Alma was journeying from the land of Gideon southward, away to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Manti</span>, behold, to his astonishment, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>met</span> with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sons of Mosiah</span> journeying towards the land of Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350782" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now these sons of Mosiah were with Alma at the time the angel <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> appeared unto him; therefore Alma did rejoice exceedingly to see his brethren; and what added more to his joy, they were still his brethren in the Lord; yea, and they had waxed strong in the knowledge of the truth; for they were men of a sound understanding and they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>searched</span> the scriptures diligently, that they might know the word of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350783" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But this is not all; they had given themselves to much prayer, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fasting</span>; therefore they had the spirit of prophecy, and the spirit of revelation, and when they taught, they taught with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> and authority of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350784" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they had been teaching the word of God for the space of fourteen years among the Lamanites, having had much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>success</span> in bringing many to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of the truth; yea, by the power of their words many were brought before the altar of God, to call on his name and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confess</span> their sins before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350785" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now these are the circumstances which attended them in their journeyings, for they had many afflictions; they did suffer much, both in body and in mind, such as hunger, thirst and fatigue, and also much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labor</span> in the spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350786" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now these were their journeyings: Having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taken</span> leave of their father, Mosiah, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>first</span> year of the judges; having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>refused</span> the kingdom which their father was desirous to confer upon them, and also this was the minds of the people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350787" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Nevertheless they departed out of the land of Zarahemla, and took their swords, and their spears, and their bows, and their arrows, and their slings; and this they did that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>provide</span> food for themselves while in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350788" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus they departed into the wilderness with their numbers which they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>selected</span>, to go up to the land of Nephi, to preach the word of God unto the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350789" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they <span class="page-break" data-page="251"></span>journeyed many days in the wilderness, and they fasted much and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayed</span> much that the Lord would grant unto them a portion of his Spirit to go with them, and abide with them, that they might be an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>instrument</span> in the hands of God to bring, if it were possible, their brethren, the Lamanites, to the knowledge of the truth, to the knowledge of the baseness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers, which were not correct.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350790" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visit</span> them with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span>, and said unto them: Be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>comforted</span>. And they were comforted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350791" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Lord said unto them also: Go forth among the Lamanites, thy brethren, and establish my word; yet ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>patient</span> in long-suffering and afflictions, that ye may show forth good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>examples</span> unto them in me, and I will make an instrument of thee in my hands unto the salvation of many souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350792" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that the hearts of the sons of Mosiah, and also those who were with them, took courage to go forth unto the Lamanites to declare unto them the word of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350793" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass when they had arrived in the borders of the land of the Lamanites, that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>separated</span> themselves and departed one from another, trusting in the Lord that they should meet again at the close of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>harvest</span>; for they supposed that great was the work which they had undertaken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350794" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And assuredly it was great, for they had undertaken to preach the word of God to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wild</span> and a hardened and a ferocious people; a people who delighted in murdering the Nephites, and robbing and plundering them; and their hearts were set upon riches, or upon gold and silver, and precious stones; yet they sought to obtain these things by murdering and plundering, that they might not labor for them with their own hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350795" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Thus they were a very indolent people, many of whom did worship idols, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> of God had fallen upon them because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers; notwithstanding the promises of the Lord were extended unto them on the conditions of repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350796" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, this was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cause</span> for which the sons of Mosiah had undertaken the work, that perhaps they might bring them unto repentance; that perhaps they might bring them to know of the plan of redemption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350797" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore they separated themselves one from another, and went forth among them, every man alone, according to the word and power of God which was given unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350798" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now Ammon being the chief among them, or rather he did administer unto them, and he departed from them, after having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> them according to their several stations, having imparted the word of God unto them, or administered unto them before his departure; and thus they took their several journeys throughout the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350799" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And Ammon went to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span>, the land being called after the sons of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Ishmael</span>, who also became Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350801" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And as Ammon entered the land of Ishmael, the Lamanites took him and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bound</span> him, as was their custom to bind all the Nephites who fell into their hands, and carry them before the king; and thus it was left to the pleasure of the king to slay them, or to retain them in captivity, <span class="page-break" data-page="252"></span>or to cast them into prison, or to cast them out of his land, according to his will and pleasure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350802" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And thus Ammon was carried before the king who was over the land of Ishmael; and his name was Lamoni; and he was a descendant of Ishmael.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350803" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And the king inquired of Ammon if it were his desire to dwell in the land among the Lamanites, or among his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350804" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And Ammon said unto him: Yea, I desire to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwell</span> among this people for a time; yea, and perhaps until the day I die.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350805" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that king Lamoni was much pleased with Ammon, and caused that his bands should be loosed; and he would that Ammon should take one of his daughters to wife.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350806" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But Ammon said unto him: Nay, but I will be thy servant. Therefore Ammon became a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span> to king Lamoni. And it came to pass that he was set among other servants to watch the flocks of Lamoni, according to the custom of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350807" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And after he had been in the service of the king three days, as he was with the Lamanitish servants going forth with their flocks to the place of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>water</span>, which was called the water of Sebus, and all the Lamanites drive their flocks hither, that they may have water—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350808" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Therefore, as Ammon and the servants of the king were driving forth their flocks to this place of water, behold, a certain number of the Lamanites, who had been with their flocks to water, stood and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scattered</span> the flocks of Ammon and the servants of the king, and they scattered them insomuch that they fled many ways.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350809" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Now the servants of the king began to murmur, saying: Now the king will slay us, as he has our brethren because their flocks were scattered by the wickedness of these men. And they began to weep exceedingly, saying: Behold, our flocks are scattered already.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350810" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now they wept because of the fear of being slain. Now when Ammon saw this his heart was swollen within him with joy; for, said he, I will show forth my power unto these my fellow-servants, or the power which is in me, in restoring these flocks unto the king, that I may win the hearts of these my fellow-servants, that I may lead them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> in my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350811" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now, these were the thoughts of Ammon, when he saw the afflictions of those whom he termed to be his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350812" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that he flattered them by his words, saying: My brethren, be of good cheer and let us go in search of the flocks, and we will gather them together and bring them back unto the place of water; and thus we will preserve the flocks unto the king and he will not slay us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350813" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that they went in search of the flocks, and they did follow Ammon, and they rushed forth with much swiftness and did head the flocks of the king, and did gather them together again to the place of water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350814" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And those men again stood to scatter their flocks; but Ammon said unto his brethren: Encircle the flocks round about that they flee not; and I go and contend with these men who do scatter our flocks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350815" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Therefore, they did as Ammon commanded them, and he went forth and stood to contend with those who stood by the waters of Sebus; and they were in number not a few.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350816" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Therefore they did not fear Ammon, for they supposed that one of their men could slay him according to their pleasure, for they knew not that the Lord had <span class="page-break" data-page="253"></span>promised Mosiah that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> his sons out of their hands; neither did they know anything concerning the Lord; therefore they delighted in the destruction of their brethren; and for this cause they stood to scatter the flocks of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350817" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammon</span> stood forth and began to cast stones at them with his sling; yea, with mighty power he did sling stones amongst them; and thus he slew a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>certain</span> number of them insomuch that they began to be astonished at his power; nevertheless they were angry because of the slain of their brethren, and they were determined that he should fall; therefore, seeing that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>could</span> not hit him with their stones, they came forth with clubs to slay him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350818" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>But behold, every man that lifted his club to smite Ammon, he smote off their arms with his sword; for he did withstand their blows by smiting their arms with the edge of his sword, insomuch that they began to be astonished, and began to flee before him; yea, and they were not few in number; and he caused them to flee by the strength of his arm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350819" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Now six of them had fallen by the sling, but he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slew</span> none save it were their leader with his sword; and he smote off as many of their arms as were lifted against him, and they were not a few.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350820" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And when he had driven them afar off, he returned and they watered their flocks and returned them to the pasture of the king, and then went in unto the king, bearing the arms which had been smitten off by the sword of Ammon, of those who sought to slay him; and they were carried in unto the king for a testimony of the things which they had done.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 18	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350800" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/18" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 18</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350823" id="title_number1">Chapter 18</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350825" id="study_summary1">King Lamoni supposes that Ammon is the Great Spirit—Ammon teaches the king about the Creation, God’s dealings with men, and the redemption that comes through Christ—Lamoni believes and falls to the earth as if dead. About 90 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350827" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that king Lamoni caused that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servants</span> should stand forth and testify to all the things which they had seen concerning the matter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350829" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And when they had all testified to the things which they had seen, and he had learned of the faithfulness of Ammon in preserving his flocks, and also of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> power in contending against those who sought to slay him, he was astonished exceedingly, and said: Surely, this is more than a man. Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350831" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they answered the king, and said: Whether he be the Great Spirit or a man, we know not; but this much we do know, that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cannot</span> be slain by the enemies of the king; neither can they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scatter</span> the king’s flocks when he is with us, because of his expertness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>great</span> strength; therefore, we know that he is a friend to the king. And now, O king, we do not believe that a man has such great power, for we know he cannot be slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350833" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now, when the king heard these words, he said unto them: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slay</span> you as I did your brethren. Now this is the Great Spirit of whom our fathers have spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350835" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now this was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tradition</span> of Lamoni, which he had received <span class="page-break" data-page="254"></span>from his father, that there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Great Spirit</span>. Notwithstanding they believed in a Great Spirit, they supposed that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>whatsoever</span> they did was right; nevertheless, Lamoni began to fear exceedingly, with fear lest he had done wrong in slaying his servants;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350837" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For he had slain many of them because their brethren had scattered their flocks at the place of water; and thus, because they had had their flocks scattered they were slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350839" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now it was the practice of these Lamanites to stand by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters of Sebus</span> to scatter the flocks of the people, that thereby they might drive away many that were scattered unto their own land, it being a practice of plunder among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350841" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that king Lamoni inquired of his servants, saying: Where is this man that has such great power?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350843" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And they said unto him: Behold, he is feeding thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span>. Now the king had commanded his servants, previous to the time of the watering of their flocks, that they should prepare his horses and chariots, and conduct him forth to the land of Nephi; for there had been a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>great</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>feast</span> appointed at the land of Nephi, by the father of Lamoni, who was king over all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350845" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now when king Lamoni heard that Ammon was preparing his horses and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chariots</span> he was more astonished, because of the faithfulness of Ammon, saying: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350847" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350849" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when Ammon had made ready the horses and the chariots for the king and his servants, he went in unto the king, and he saw that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>countenance</span> of the king was changed; therefore he was about to return out of his presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350851" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And one of the king’s servants said unto him, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Rabbanah</span>, which is, being interpreted, powerful or great king, considering their kings to be powerful; and thus he said unto him: Rabbanah, the king desireth thee to stay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350853" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore Ammon turned himself unto the king, and said unto him: What wilt thou that I should do for thee, O king? And the king answered him not for the space of an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hour</span>, according to their time, for he knew not what he should say unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350855" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon said unto him again: What desirest thou of me? But the king answered him not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350857" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon, being filled with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of God, therefore he perceived the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thoughts</span> of the king. And he said unto him: Is it because thou hast heard that I defended thy servants and thy flocks, and slew <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>seven</span> of their brethren with the sling and with the sword, and smote off the arms of others, in order to defend thy flocks and thy servants; behold, is it this that causeth thy marvelings?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350859" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>I say unto you, what is it, that thy marvelings are so great? Behold, I am a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span>, and am thy servant; therefore, whatsoever thou desirest which is right, that will I do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350861" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now when the king had heard <span class="page-break" data-page="255"></span>these words, he marveled again, for he beheld that Ammon could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>discern</span> his thoughts; but notwithstanding this, king Lamoni did open his mouth, and said unto him: Who art thou? Art thou that Great Spirit, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knows</span> all things?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350863" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Ammon answered and said unto him: I am not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350865" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the king said: How knowest thou the thoughts of my heart? Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350867" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>if</span> thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350869" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now Ammon being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span>, yet harmless, he said unto Lamoni: Wilt thou hearken unto my words, if I tell thee by what power I do these things? And this is the thing that I desire of thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350871" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the king answered him, and said: Yea, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>will believe</span> all thy words. And thus he was caught with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>guile</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350873" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And Ammon began to speak unto him with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boldness</span>, and said unto him: Believest thou that there is a God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350874" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And he answered, and said unto him: I do not know what that meaneth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350876" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And then Ammon said: Believest thou that there is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Great Spirit</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350878" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And he said, Yea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350880" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And Ammon said: This is God. And Ammon said unto him again: Believest thou that this Great Spirit, who is God, created all things which are in heaven and in the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350882" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And he said: Yea, I believe that he created all things which are in the earth; but I do not know the heavens.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350884" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And Ammon said unto him: The heavens is a place where God dwells and all his holy angels.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350886" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And king Lamoni said: Is it above the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350888" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And Ammon said: Yea, and he looketh down upon all the children of men; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knows</span> all the thoughts and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>intents</span> of the heart; for by his hand were they all created from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350890" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And king Lamoni said: I believe all these things which thou hast spoken. Art thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sent</span> from God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350892" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Ammon said unto him: I am a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span>; and man in the beginning was created after the image of God, and I am called by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Spirit</span> to teach these things unto this people, that they may be brought to a knowledge of that which is just and true;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350894" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And a portion of that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> dwelleth in me, which giveth me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span>, and also power according to my faith and desires which are in God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350896" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now when Ammon had said these words, he began at the creation of the world, and also the creation of Adam, and told him all the things concerning the fall of man, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rehearsed</span> and laid before him the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span> and the holy scriptures of the people, which had been spoken by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prophets</span>, even down to the time that their father, Lehi, left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350898" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And he also rehearsed unto <span class="page-break" data-page="256"></span>them (for it was unto the king and to his servants) all the journeyings of their fathers in the wilderness, and all their sufferings with hunger and thirst, and their travail, and so forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350900" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And he also rehearsed unto them concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebellions</span> of Laman and Lemuel, and the sons of Ishmael, yea, all their rebellions did he relate unto them; and he expounded unto them all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span> and scriptures from the time that Lehi left Jerusalem down to the present time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350902" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>But this is not all; for he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>expounded</span> unto them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan of redemption</span>, which was prepared from the foundation of the world; and he also made known unto them concerning the coming of Christ, and all the works of the Lord did he make known unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350904" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And it came to pass that after he had said all these things, and expounded them to the king, that the king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believed</span> all his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350906" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And he began to cry unto the Lord, saying: O Lord, have mercy; according to thy abundant <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> which thou hast had upon the people of Nephi, have upon me, and my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350908" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And now, when he had said this, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fell</span> unto the earth, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>as</span> if he were dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350909" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And it came to pass that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servants</span> took him and carried him in unto his wife, and laid him upon a bed; and he lay as if he were dead for the space of two days and two nights; and his wife, and his sons, and his daughters mourned over him, after the manner of the Lamanites, greatly lamenting his loss.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 19	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350933" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/19" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 19</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350956" id="title_number1">Chapter 19</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350958" id="study_summary1">Lamoni receives the light of everlasting life and sees the Redeemer—His household falls into a trance, and many see angels—Ammon is preserved miraculously—He baptizes many and establishes a church among them. About 90 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350960" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that after two days and two nights they were about to take his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>body</span> and lay it in a sepulchre, which they had made for the purpose of burying their dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350962" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now the queen having heard of the fame of Ammon, therefore she sent and desired that he should come in unto her.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350963" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon did as he was commanded, and went in unto the queen, and desired to know what she would that he should do.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350964" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And she said unto him: The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servants</span> of my husband have made it known unto me that thou art a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophet</span> of a holy God, and that thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>power</span> to do many mighty works in his name;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350965" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore, if this is the case, I would that ye should go in and see my husband, for he has been laid upon his bed for the space of two days and two nights; and some say that he is not dead, but others say that he is dead and that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stinketh</span>, and that he ought to be placed in the sepulchre; but as for myself, to me he doth not stink.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350966" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, this was what Ammon desired, for he knew that king Lamoni was under the power of God; he knew that the dark <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>veil</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span> was being cast away from his mind, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>light</span> which did light up his mind, which was the light of the glory of God, which was a marvelous light of his goodness—yea, this light had infused such joy into his soul, the cloud of darkness having been dispelled, and that the light of everlasting life was lit up in <span class="page-break" data-page="257"></span>his soul, yea, he knew that this had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>overcome</span> his natural frame, and he was carried away in God—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350967" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore, what the queen desired of him was his only desire. Therefore, he went in to see the king according as the queen had desired him; and he saw the king, and he knew that he was not dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350968" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he said unto the queen: He is not dead, but he sleepeth in God, and on the morrow he shall rise again; therefore bury him not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350969" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And Ammon said unto her: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Believest</span> thou this? And she said unto him: I have had no witness save thy word, and the word of our servants; nevertheless I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> that it shall be according as thou hast said.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350970" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And Ammon said unto her: Blessed art thou because of thy exceeding faith; I say unto thee, woman, there has not been such great faith among all the people of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephites</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350971" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that she watched over the bed of her husband, from that time even until that time on the morrow which Ammon had appointed that he should rise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350972" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that he arose, according to the words of Ammon; and as he arose, he stretched forth his hand unto the woman, and said: Blessed be the name of God, and blessed art thou.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350973" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For as sure as thou livest, behold, I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seen</span> my Redeemer; and he shall come forth, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born</span> of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>woman</span>, and he shall redeem all mankind who believe on his name. Now, when he had said these words, his heart was swollen within him, and he sunk again with joy; and the queen also sunk down, being overpowered by the Spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350974" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now Ammon seeing the Spirit of the Lord poured out according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> upon the Lamanites, his brethren, who had been the cause of so much mourning among the Nephites, or among all the people of God because of their iniquities and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span>, he fell upon his knees, and began to pour out his soul in prayer and thanksgiving to God for what he had done for his brethren; and he was also overpowered with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>joy</span>; and thus they all three had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sunk</span> to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350975" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now, when the servants of the king had seen that they had fallen, they also began to cry unto God, for the fear of the Lord had come upon them also, for it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> who had stood before the king and testified unto him concerning the great power of Ammon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350976" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that they did call on the name of the Lord, in their might, even until they had all fallen to the earth, save it were one of the Lamanitish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>women</span>, whose name was Abish, she having been converted unto the Lord for many years, on account of a remarkable vision of her father—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350977" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Thus, having been converted to the Lord, and never having made it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>known</span>, therefore, when she saw that all the servants of Lamoni had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span> to the earth, and also her mistress, the queen, and the king, and Ammon lay <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prostrate</span> upon the earth, she knew that it was the power of God; and supposing that this opportunity, by making known unto the people what had happened among them, that by beholding this scene it would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cause</span> them to believe in the power of God, therefore she ran forth from house to house, making it known unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350978" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And they began to assemble themselves together unto the house <span class="page-break" data-page="258"></span>of the king. And there came a multitude, and to their astonishment, they beheld the king, and the queen, and their servants prostrate upon the earth, and they all lay there as though they were dead; and they also saw Ammon, and behold, he was a Nephite.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350979" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now the people began to murmur among themselves; some saying that it was a great evil that had come upon them, or upon the king and his house, because he had suffered that the Nephite should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remain</span> in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350980" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But others rebuked them, saying: The king hath brought this evil upon his house, because he slew his servants who had had their flocks scattered at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters of Sebus</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350981" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they were also rebuked by those men who had stood at the waters of Sebus and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scattered</span> the flocks which belonged to the king, for they were angry with Ammon because of the number which he had slain of their brethren at the waters of Sebus, while defending the flocks of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350982" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now, one of them, whose brother had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span> with the sword of Ammon, being exceedingly angry with Ammon, drew his sword and went forth that he might let it fall upon Ammon, to slay him; and as he lifted the sword to smite him, behold, he fell dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350983" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now we see that Ammon could not be slain, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> had said unto Mosiah, his father: I will spare him, and it shall be unto him according to thy faith—therefore, Mosiah <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trusted</span> him unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350984" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that when the multitude beheld that the man had fallen dead, who lifted the sword to slay Ammon, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fear</span> came upon them all, and they durst not put forth their hands to touch him or any of those who had fallen; and they began to marvel again among themselves what could be the cause of this great power, or what all these things could mean.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350985" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that there were many among them who said that Ammon was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Great Spirit</span>, and others said he was sent by the Great Spirit;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350986" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But others rebuked them all, saying that he was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>monster</span>, who had been sent from the Nephites to torment them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350987" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And there were some who said that Ammon was sent by the Great Spirit to afflict them because of their iniquities; and that it was the Great Spirit that had always attended the Nephites, who had ever delivered them out of their hands; and they said that it was this Great Spirit who had destroyed so many of their brethren, the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350988" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And thus the contention began to be exceedingly sharp among them. And while they were thus contending, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>woman</span> servant who had caused the multitude to be gathered together came, and when she saw the contention which was among the multitude she was exceedingly sorrowful, even unto tears.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350989" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that she went and took the queen by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hand</span>, that perhaps she might raise her from the ground; and as soon as she touched her hand she arose and stood upon her feet, and cried with a loud voice, saying: O blessed Jesus, who has saved me from an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>awful</span> hell! O blessed God, have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mercy</span> on this people!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350990" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And when she had said this, she clasped her hands, being filled with joy, speaking many words which were not understood; and when she had done this, she took the king, <span class="page-break" data-page="259"></span>Lamoni, by the hand, and behold he arose and stood upon his feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350991" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he, immediately, seeing the contention among his people, went forth and began to rebuke them, and to teach them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> which he had heard from the mouth of Ammon; and as many as heard his words believed, and were converted unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350992" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>But there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> among them who would not hear his words; therefore they went their way.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350993" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that when Ammon arose he also administered unto them, and also did all the servants of Lamoni; and they did all declare unto the people the selfsame thing—that their hearts had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>changed</span>; that they had no more desire to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350994" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And behold, many did declare unto the people that they had seen <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> and had conversed with them; and thus they had told them things of God, and of his righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350995" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that there were many that did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> in their words; and as many as did believe were baptized; and they became a righteous people, and they did establish a church among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350996" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And thus the work of the Lord did commence among the Lamanites; thus the Lord did begin to pour out his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> upon them; and we see that his arm is extended to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> people who will repent and believe on his name.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 20	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351043" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/20" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 20</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351044" id="title_number1">Chapter 20</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351045" id="study_summary1">The Lord sends Ammon to Middoni to deliver his imprisoned brethren—Ammon and Lamoni meet Lamoni’s father, who is king over all the land—Ammon compels the old king to approve the release of his brethren. About 90 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351046" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that when they had established a church in that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span>, that king Lamoni desired that Ammon should go with him to the land of Nephi, that he might show him unto his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351047" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the voice of the Lord came to Ammon, saying: Thou shalt not go up to the land of Nephi, for behold, the king will seek thy life; but thou shalt go to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Middoni</span>; for behold, thy brother Aaron, and also Muloki and Ammah are in prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351048" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now it came to pass that when Ammon had heard this, he said unto Lamoni: Behold, my brother and brethren are in prison at Middoni, and I go that I may deliver them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351049" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now Lamoni said unto Ammon: I know, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> of the Lord thou canst do all things. But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prison</span>. Now Lamoni said unto him: Who told thee that thy brethren were in prison?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351050" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And Ammon said unto him: No one hath told me, save it be God; and he said unto me—Go and deliver thy brethren, for they are in prison in the land of Middoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351051" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now when Lamoni had heard this he caused that his servants should make ready his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span> and his chariots.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351052" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he said unto Ammon: Come, I will go with thee down to the land of Middoni, and there I will plead with the king that he will cast thy brethren out of prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351053" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that as Ammon and Lamoni were journeying <span class="page-break" data-page="260"></span>thither, they met the father of Lamoni, who was king <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>over</span> all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351054" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, the father of Lamoni said unto him: Why did ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> come to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>feast</span> on that great day when I made a feast unto my sons, and unto my people?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351055" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he also said: Whither art thou going with this Nephite, who is one of the children of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>liar</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351056" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that Lamoni rehearsed unto him whither he was going, for he feared to offend him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351057" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he also told him all the cause of his tarrying in his own kingdom, that he did not go unto his father to the feast which he had prepared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351058" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now when Lamoni had rehearsed unto him all these things, behold, to his astonishment, his father was angry with him, and said: Lamoni, thou art going to deliver these Nephites, who are sons of a liar. Behold, he robbed our fathers; and now his children are also come amongst us that they may, by their cunning and their lyings, deceive us, that they again may rob us of our property.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351059" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now the father of Lamoni commanded him that he should slay Ammon with the sword. And he also commanded him that he should not go to the land of Middoni, but that he should return with him to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351060" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But Lamoni said unto him: I will not slay Ammon, neither will I return to the land of Ishmael, but I go to the land of Middoni that I may release the brethren of Ammon, for I know that they are just men and holy prophets of the true God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351061" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now when his father had heard these words, he was angry with him, and he drew his sword that he might smite him to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351062" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But Ammon stood forth and said unto him: Behold, thou shalt not slay thy son; nevertheless, it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> that he should fall than thee, for behold, he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repented</span> of his sins; but if thou shouldst fall at this time, in thine anger, thy soul could not be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351063" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And again, it is expedient that thou shouldst forbear; for if thou shouldst <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slay</span> thy son, he being an innocent man, his blood would cry from the ground to the Lord his God, for vengeance to come upon thee; and perhaps thou wouldst lose thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>soul</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351064" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now when Ammon had said these words unto him, he answered him, saying: I know that if I should slay my son, that I should shed innocent blood; for it is thou that hast sought to destroy him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351065" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he stretched forth his hand to slay Ammon. But Ammon withstood his blows, and also smote his arm that he could not use it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351066" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now when the king saw that Ammon could slay him, he began to plead with Ammon that he would spare his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351067" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But Ammon raised his sword, and said unto him: Behold, I will smite thee except thou wilt grant unto me that my brethren may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast out</span> of prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351068" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now the king, fearing he should lose his life, said: If thou wilt spare me I will grant unto thee whatsoever thou wilt ask, even to half of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351069" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now when Ammon saw that he had wrought upon the old king according to his desire, he said unto him: If thou wilt grant that my brethren may be cast out of prison, and also that Lamoni may retain his kingdom, and that ye be not displeased with him, but grant that he may do according to his own desires in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whatsoever</span> thing he thinketh, <span class="page-break" data-page="261"></span>then will I spare thee; otherwise I will smite thee to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351070" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now when Ammon had said these words, the king began to rejoice because of his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351071" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And when he saw that Ammon had no desire to destroy him, and when he also saw the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span> he had for his son Lamoni, he was astonished exceedingly, and said: Because this is all that thou hast desired, that I would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>release</span> thy brethren, and suffer that my son Lamoni should retain his kingdom, behold, I will grant unto you that my son may retain his kingdom from this time and forever; and I will govern him no more—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351072" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And I will also grant unto thee that thy brethren may be cast out of prison, and thou and thy brethren may come unto me, in my kingdom; for I shall greatly desire to see thee. For the king was greatly astonished at the words which he had spoken, and also at the words which had been spoken by his son Lamoni, therefore he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desirous</span> to learn them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351073" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon and Lamoni proceeded on their journey towards the land of Middoni. And Lamoni found favor in the eyes of the king of the land; therefore the brethren of Ammon were brought forth out of prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351074" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And when Ammon did meet them he was exceedingly sorrowful, for behold they were naked, and their skins were worn exceedingly because of being bound with strong cords. And they also had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffered</span> hunger, thirst, and all kinds of afflictions; nevertheless they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>patient</span> in all their sufferings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351075" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And, as it happened, it was their lot to have fallen into the hands of a more hardened and a more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people; therefore they would not hearken unto their words, and they had cast them out, and had smitten them, and had driven them from house to house, and from place to place, even until they had arrived in the land of Middoni; and there they were taken and cast into prison, and bound with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strong</span> cords, and kept in prison for many days, and were delivered by Lamoni and Ammon.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 21	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351099" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/21" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 21</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128351100" id="intro1">An account of the preaching of Aaron, and Muloki, and their brethren, to the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128351101" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 21 through 25.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351102" id="title_number1">Chapter 21</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351103" id="study_summary1">Aaron teaches the Amalekites about Christ and His Atonement—Aaron and his brethren are imprisoned in Middoni—After their deliverance, they teach in the synagogues and make many converts—Lamoni grants religious freedom to the people in the land of Ishmael. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351104" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now when Ammon and his brethren <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>separated</span> themselves in the borders of the land of the Lamanites, behold Aaron took his journey towards the land which was called by the Lamanites, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jerusalem</span>, calling it after the land of their fathers’ nativity; and it was away joining the borders of Mormon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351105" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now the Lamanites and the Amalekites and the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span> had built a great city, which was called Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351106" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now the Lamanites of themselves were sufficiently hardened, but the Amalekites and the Amulonites were still harder; therefore they did cause the Lamanites that they should harden their hearts, that they should wax strong in wickedness and their abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351107" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that Aaron came to the city of Jerusalem, and <span class="page-break" data-page="262"></span>first began to preach to the Amalekites. And he began to preach to them in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span>, for they had built synagogues after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>order</span> of the Nehors; for many of the Amalekites and the Amulonites were after the order of the Nehors.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351108" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore, as Aaron entered into one of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span> to preach unto the people, and as he was speaking unto them, behold there arose an Amalekite and began to contend with him, saying: What is that thou hast testified? Hast thou seen an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>angel</span>? Why do not angels appear unto us? Behold <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>are</span> not this people as good as thy people?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351109" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Thou also sayest, except we repent we shall perish. How knowest thou the thought and intent of our hearts? How knowest thou that we have cause to repent? How knowest thou that we are not a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteous</span> people? Behold, we have built <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sanctuaries</span>, and we do assemble ourselves together to worship <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>God</span>. We do believe that God will save all men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351110" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now Aaron said unto him: Believest thou that the Son of God shall come to redeem mankind from their sins?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351111" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the man said unto him: We do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> that thou knowest any such thing. We do not believe in these foolish traditions.
