We do not believe that thou knowest of things to come, neither do we believe that thy fathers and also that our fathers did know concerning the things which they spake, of that which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351112" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now Aaron began to open the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scriptures</span> unto them concerning the coming of Christ, and also concerning the resurrection of the dead, and that there could be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no</span> redemption for mankind <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>save</span> it were through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>death</span> and sufferings of Christ, and the atonement of his blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351113" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass as he began to expound these things unto them they were angry with him, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mock</span> him; and they would not hear the words which he spake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351114" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore, when he saw that they would not hear his words, he departed out of their synagogue, and came over to a village which was called Ani-Anti, and there he found Muloki preaching the word unto them; and also Ammah and his brethren. And they contended with many about the word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351115" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that they saw that the people would harden their hearts, therefore they departed and came over into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Middoni</span>. And they did preach the word unto many, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>few</span> believed on the words which they taught.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351116" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Nevertheless, Aaron and a certain number of his brethren were taken and cast into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span>, and the remainder of them fled out of the land of Middoni unto the regions round about.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351117" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And those who were cast into prison <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffered</span> many things, and they were delivered by the hand of Lamoni and Ammon, and they were fed and clothed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351118" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And they went forth again to declare the word, and thus they were delivered for the first time out of prison; and thus they had suffered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351119" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And they went forth whithersoever they were led by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord, preaching the word of God in every synagogue of the Amalekites, or in every assembly of the Lamanites where they could be admitted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351120" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="page-break" data-page="263"></span>Lord began to bless them, insomuch that they brought many to the knowledge of the truth; yea, they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>convince</span> many of their sins, and of the traditions of their fathers, which were not correct.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351121" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon and Lamoni returned from the land of Middoni to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span>, which was the land of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351122" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And king Lamoni would not suffer that Ammon should serve him, or be his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servant</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351123" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But he caused that there should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span> built in the land of Ishmael; and he caused that his people, or the people who were under his reign, should assemble themselves together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351124" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he did rejoice over them, and he did teach them many things. And he did also declare unto them that they were a people who were under him, and that they were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>free</span> people, that they were free from the oppressions of the king, his father; for that his father had granted unto him that he might reign over the people who were in the land of Ishmael, and in all the land round about.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351125" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And he also declared unto them that they might have the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>liberty</span> of worshiping the Lord their God according to their desires, in whatsoever place they were in, if it were in the land which was under the reign of king Lamoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351126" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And Ammon did preach unto the people of king Lamoni; and it came to pass that he did teach them all things concerning things pertaining to righteousness. And he did exhort them daily, with all diligence; and they gave heed unto his word, and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>zealous</span> for keeping the commandments of God.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 22	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351156" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/22" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 22</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351157" id="title_number1">Chapter 22</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351158" id="study_summary1">Aaron teaches Lamoni’s father about the Creation, the Fall of Adam, and the plan of redemption through Christ—The king and all his household are converted—The division of the land between the Nephites and the Lamanites is explained. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351159" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now, as Ammon was thus teaching the people of Lamoni continually, we will return to the account of Aaron and his brethren; for after he departed from the land of Middoni he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led</span> by the Spirit to the land of Nephi, even to the house of the king which was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>over</span> all the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>save</span> it were the land of Ishmael; and he was the father of Lamoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351160" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that he went in unto him into the king’s palace, with his brethren, and bowed himself before the king, and said unto him: Behold, O king, we are the brethren of Ammon, whom thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prison</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351161" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, O king, if thou wilt spare our lives, we will be thy servants. And the king said unto them: Arise, for I will grant unto you your lives, and I will not suffer that ye shall be my servants; but I will insist that ye shall administer unto me; for I have been somewhat <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>troubled</span> in mind because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>generosity</span> and the greatness of the words of thy brother Ammon; and I desire to know the cause why he has not come up out of Middoni with thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351162" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And Aaron said unto the king: Behold, the Spirit of the Lord has called him another way; he has gone <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>to</span> the land of Ishmael, to teach the people of Lamoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351163" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now the king said unto them: What is this that ye have said concerning the Spirit of the Lord? <span class="page-break" data-page="264"></span>Behold, this is the thing which doth trouble me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351164" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And also, what is this that Ammon said—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>If</span> ye will repent ye shall be saved, and if ye will not repent, ye shall be cast off at the last day?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351165" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And Aaron answered him and said unto him: Believest thou that there is a God? And the king said: I know that the Amalekites say that there is a God, and I have granted unto them that they should build sanctuaries, that they may assemble themselves together to worship him. And if now thou sayest there is a God, behold I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351166" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now when Aaron heard this, his heart began to rejoice, and he said: Behold, assuredly as thou livest, O king, there is a God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351167" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the king said: Is God that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Great Spirit</span> that brought our fathers out of the land of Jerusalem?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351168" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And Aaron said unto him: Yea, he is that Great Spirit, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>created</span> all things both in heaven and in earth. Believest thou this?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351169" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he said: Yea, I believe that the Great Spirit created all things, and I desire that ye should tell me concerning all these things, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> thy words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351170" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when Aaron saw that the king would believe his words, he began from the creation of Adam, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reading</span> the scriptures unto the king—how God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>created</span> man after his own image, and that God gave him commandments, and that because of transgression, man had fallen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351171" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Aaron did expound unto him the scriptures from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>creation</span> of Adam, laying the fall of man before him, and their carnal state and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redemption</span>, which was prepared <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>from</span> the foundation of the world, through Christ, for all whosoever would believe on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351172" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And since man had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fallen</span> he could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>merit</span> anything of himself; but the sufferings and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>death</span> of Christ <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>atone</span> for their sins, through faith and repentance, and so forth; and that he breaketh the bands of death, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>grave</span> shall have no victory, and that the sting of death should be swallowed up in the hopes of glory; and Aaron did expound all these things unto the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351173" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that after Aaron had expounded these things unto him, the king said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>What</span> shall I do that I may have this eternal life of which thou hast spoken? Yea, what shall I do that I may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born of God</span>, having this wicked spirit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rooted</span> out of my breast, and receive his Spirit, that I may be filled with joy, that I may not be cast off at the last day? Behold, said he, I will give up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>all</span> that I possess, yea, I will forsake my kingdom, that I may receive this great joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351174" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But Aaron said unto him: If thou desirest this thing, if thou wilt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bow</span> down before God, yea, if thou wilt repent of all thy sins, and will bow down before God, and call on his name in faith, believing that ye shall receive, then shalt thou receive the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span> which thou desirest.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351175" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that when Aaron had said these words, the king did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bow</span> down before the Lord, upon his knees; yea, even he did <span class="page-break" data-page="265"></span>prostrate himself upon the earth, and cried <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mightily</span>, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351176" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>O God, Aaron hath told me that there is a God; and if there is a God, and if thou art God, wilt thou make thyself known unto me, and I will give away all my sins to know thee, and that I may be raised from the dead, and be saved at the last day. And now when the king had said these words, he was struck <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> if he were dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351177" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that his servants ran and told the queen all that had happened unto the king. And she came in unto the king; and when she saw him lay as if he were dead, and also Aaron and his brethren standing as though they had been the cause of his fall, she was angry with them, and commanded that her servants, or the servants of the king, should take them and slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351178" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now the servants had seen the cause of the king’s fall, therefore they durst not lay their hands on Aaron and his brethren; and they pled with the queen saying: Why commandest thou that we should slay these men, when behold one of them is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mightier</span> than us all? Therefore we shall fall before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351179" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now when the queen saw the fear of the servants she also began to fear exceedingly, lest there should some evil come upon her. And she commanded her servants that they should go and call the people, that they might slay Aaron and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351180" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now when Aaron saw the determination of the queen, he, also knowing the hardness of the hearts of the people, feared lest that a multitude should assemble themselves together, and there should be a great contention and a disturbance among them; therefore he put forth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hand</span> and raised the king from the earth, and said unto him: Stand. And he stood upon his feet, receiving his strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351181" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now this was done in the presence of the queen and many of the servants. And when they saw it they greatly marveled, and began to fear. And the king stood forth, and began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>minister</span> unto them. And he did minister unto them, insomuch that his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whole</span> household were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>converted</span> unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351182" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now there was a multitude gathered together because of the commandment of the queen, and there began to be great murmurings among them because of Aaron and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351183" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But the king stood forth among them and administered unto them. And they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pacified</span> towards Aaron and those who were with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351184" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that when the king saw that the people were pacified, he caused that Aaron and his brethren should stand forth in the midst of the multitude, and that they should preach the word unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351185" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that the king sent a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>proclamation</span> throughout all the land, amongst all his people who were in all his land, who were in all the regions round about, which was bordering even to the sea, on the east and on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>west</span>, and which was divided from the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zarahemla</span> by a narrow strip of wilderness, which ran from the sea east even to the sea west, and round about on the borders of the seashore, and the borders of the wilderness which was on the north by the land of Zarahemla, through the borders of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Manti</span>, by the head of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>river Sidon</span>, running from the east towards the west—and thus were the Lamanites and the Nephites divided.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="266"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351186" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Now, the more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>idle</span> part of the Lamanites lived in the wilderness, and dwelt in tents; and they were spread through the wilderness on the west, in the land of Nephi; yea, and also on the west of the land of Zarahemla, in the borders by the seashore, and on the west in the land of Nephi, in the place of their fathers’ first inheritance, and thus bordering along by the seashore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351187" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And also there were many Lamanites on the east by the seashore, whither the Nephites had driven them. And thus the Nephites were nearly surrounded by the Lamanites; nevertheless the Nephites had taken possession of all the northern parts of the land bordering on the wilderness, at the head of the river Sidon, from the east to the west, round about on the wilderness side; on the north, even until they came to the land which they called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Bountiful</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351188" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it bordered upon the land which they called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Desolation</span>, it being so far northward that it came into the land which had been peopled and been destroyed, of whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bones</span> we have spoken, which was discovered by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>people</span> of Zarahemla, it being the place of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>first</span> landing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351189" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And they came from there <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>up</span> into the south wilderness. Thus the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> on the northward was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Desolation</span>, and the land on the southward was called Bountiful, it being the wilderness which is filled with all manner of wild animals of every kind, a part of which had come from the land northward for food.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351190" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now, it was only the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>distance</span> of a day and a half’s journey for a Nephite, on the line Bountiful and the land Desolation, from the east to the west sea; and thus the land of Nephi and the land of Zarahemla were nearly surrounded by water, there being a small <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>neck</span> of land between the land northward and the land southward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351191" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites had inhabited the land Bountiful, even from the east unto the west sea, and thus the Nephites in their wisdom, with their guards and their armies, had hemmed in the Lamanites on the south, that thereby they should have no more possession on the north, that they might not overrun the land northward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351192" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Therefore the Lamanites could have no more possessions only in the land of Nephi, and the wilderness round about. Now this was wisdom in the Nephites—as the Lamanites were an enemy to them, they would not suffer their afflictions on every hand, and also that they might have a country whither they might flee, according to their desires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351193" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And now I, after having said this, return again to the account of Ammon and Aaron, Omner and Himni, and their brethren.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 23	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349621" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/23" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 23</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349622" id="title_number1">Chapter 23</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349623" id="study_summary1">Religious freedom is proclaimed—The Lamanites in seven lands and cities are converted—They call themselves Anti-Nephi-Lehies and are freed from the curse—The Amalekites and the Amulonites reject the truth. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349624" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that the king of the Lamanites sent a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>proclamation</span> among all his people, that they should not lay their hands on Ammon, or Aaron, or Omner, or Himni, nor either of their brethren who should go forth preaching the word of God, in whatsoever place <span class="page-break" data-page="267"></span>they should be, in any part of their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349625" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, he sent a decree among them, that they should not lay their hands on them to bind them, or to cast them into prison; neither should they spit upon them, nor smite them, nor cast them out of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span>, nor scourge them; neither should they cast stones at them, but that they should have free access to their houses, and also their temples, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sanctuaries</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349626" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And thus they might go forth and preach the word according to their desires, for the king had been converted unto the Lord, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>household</span>; therefore he sent his proclamation throughout the land unto his people, that the word of God might have no obstruction, but that it might go forth throughout all the land, that his people might be convinced concerning the wicked <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers, and that they might be convinced that they were all brethren, and that they ought not to murder, nor to plunder, nor to steal, nor to commit adultery, nor to commit any manner of wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349627" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now it came to pass that when the king had sent forth this proclamation, that Aaron and his brethren went forth from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city to city</span>, and from one house of worship to another, establishing churches, and consecrating <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> and teachers throughout the land among the Lamanites, to preach and to teach the word of God among them; and thus they began to have great success.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349628" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thousands</span> were brought to the knowledge of the Lord, yea, thousands were brought to believe in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span> of the Nephites; and they were taught the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>records</span> and prophecies which were handed down even to the present time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349629" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And as sure as the Lord liveth, so sure as many as believed, or as many as were brought to the knowledge of the truth, through the preaching of Ammon and his brethren, according to the spirit of revelation and of prophecy, and the power of God working <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> in them—yea, I say unto you, as the Lord liveth, as many of the Lamanites as believed in their preaching, and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>converted</span> unto the Lord, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>never</span> did fall away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349630" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For they became a righteous people; they did lay down the weapons of their rebellion, that they did not fight against God any more, neither against any of their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349631" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now, these are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> who were converted unto the Lord:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349632" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>The people of the Lamanites who were in the land of Ishmael;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349633" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And also of the people of the Lamanites who were in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Middoni</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349634" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And also of the people of the Lamanites who were in the city of Nephi;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349635" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And also of the people of the Lamanites who were in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shilom</span>, and who were in the land of Shemlon, and in the city of Lemuel, and in the city of Shimnilom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349636" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And these are the names of the cities of the Lamanites which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>converted</span> unto the Lord; and these are they that laid down the weapons of their rebellion, yea, all their weapons of war; and they were all Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349637" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And the Amalekites were not <span class="page-break" data-page="268"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>converted</span>, save only one; neither were any of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Amulonites</span>; but they did harden their hearts, and also the hearts of the Lamanites in that part of the land wheresoever they dwelt, yea, and all their villages and all their cities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349638" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Therefore, we have named all the cities of the Lamanites in which they did repent and come to the knowledge of the truth, and were converted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349639" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now it came to pass that the king and those who were converted were desirous that they might have a name, that thereby they might be distinguished from their brethren; therefore the king consulted with Aaron and many of their priests, concerning the name that they should take upon them, that they might be distinguished.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349640" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that they called their names <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehies</span>; and they were called by this name and were no more called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamanites</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349641" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And they began to be a very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>industrious</span> people; yea, and they were friendly with the Nephites; therefore, they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>open</span> a correspondence with them, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>curse</span> of God did no more follow them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 24	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351249" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/24" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 24</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351250" id="title_number1">Chapter 24</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351251" id="study_summary1">The Lamanites come against the people of God—The Anti-Nephi-Lehies rejoice in Christ and are visited by angels—They choose to suffer death rather than to defend themselves—More Lamanites are converted. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351252" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the Amalekites and the Amulonites and the Lamanites who were in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span>, and also in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Helam</span>, and who were in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jerusalem</span>, and in fine, in all the land round about, who had not been converted and had not taken upon them the name of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehi</span>, were stirred up by the Amalekites and by the Amulonites to anger against their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351253" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And their hatred became exceedingly sore against them, even insomuch that they began to rebel against their king, insomuch that they would not that he should be their king; therefore, they took up arms against the people of Anti-Nephi-Lehi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351254" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now the king conferred the kingdom upon his son, and he called his name Anti-Nephi-Lehi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351255" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the king died in that selfsame year that the Lamanites began to make preparations for war against the people of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351256" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now when Ammon and his brethren and all those who had come up with him saw the preparations of the Lamanites to destroy their brethren, they came forth to the land of Midian, and there Ammon met all his brethren; and from thence they came to the land of Ishmael that they might hold a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>council</span> with Lamoni and also with his brother Anti-Nephi-Lehi, what they should do to defend themselves against the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351257" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now there was not one soul among all the people who had been converted unto the Lord that would take up arms against their brethren; nay, they would not even make any preparations for war; yea, and also their king commanded them that they should not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351258" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now, these are the words which he said unto the people concerning the matter: I thank my God, my beloved people, that our great God has in goodness sent these our brethren, the Nephites, unto us to <span class="page-break" data-page="269"></span>preach unto us, and to convince us of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>traditions</span> of our wicked fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351259" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, I thank my great God that he has given us a portion of his Spirit to soften our hearts, that we have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>opened</span> a correspondence with these brethren, the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351260" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, I also thank my God, that by opening this correspondence we have been convinced of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span>, and of the many murders which we have committed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351261" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And I also thank my God, yea, my great God, that he hath granted unto us that we might repent of these things, and also that he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgiven</span> us of those our many sins and murders which we have committed, and taken away the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>guilt</span> from our hearts, through the merits of his Son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351262" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now behold, my brethren, since it has been all that we could do (as we were the most lost of all mankind) to repent of all our sins and the many murders which we have committed, and to get God to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>take</span> them away from our hearts, for it was all we could do to repent sufficiently before God that he would take away our stain—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351263" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now, my best beloved brethren, since God hath taken away our stains, and our swords have become bright, then let us stain our swords no more with the blood of our brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351264" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, I say unto you, Nay, let us retain our swords that they be not stained with the blood of our brethren; for perhaps, if we should stain our swords <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span> they can no more be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>washed</span> bright through the blood of the Son of our great God, which shall be shed for the atonement of our sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351265" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And the great God has had mercy on us, and made these things known unto us that we might not perish; yea, and he has made these things known unto us beforehand, because he loveth our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>souls</span> as well as he loveth our children; therefore, in his mercy he doth visit us by his angels, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan of salvation</span> might be made known unto us as well as unto future generations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351266" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Oh, how merciful is our God! And now behold, since it has been as much as we could do to get our stains taken away from us, and our swords are made bright, let us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> them away that they may be kept bright, as a testimony to our God at the last day, or at the day that we shall be brought to stand before him to be judged, that we have not stained our swords in the blood of our brethren since he imparted his word unto us and has made us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>clean</span> thereby.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351267" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, my brethren, if our brethren seek to destroy us, behold, we will hide away our swords, yea, even we will bury them deep in the earth, that they may be kept bright, as a testimony that we have never used them, at the last day; and if our brethren destroy us, behold, we shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> to our God and shall be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351268" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now it came to pass that when the king had made an end of these sayings, and all the people were assembled together, they took their swords, and all the weapons which were used for the shedding of man’s blood, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bury</span> them up deep in the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351269" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And this they did, it being in their view a testimony to God, and also to men, that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> would use weapons again for the shedding of man’s blood; and this they did, vouching and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenanting</span> with God, that rather than shed the <span class="page-break" data-page="270"></span>blood of their brethren they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>give</span> up their own lives; and rather than take away from a brother they would give unto him; and rather than spend their days in idleness they would labor abundantly with their hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351270" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And thus we see that, when these Lamanites were brought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> and to know the truth, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>firm</span>, and would suffer even unto death rather than commit sin; and thus we see that they buried their weapons of peace, or they buried the weapons of war, for peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351271" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that their brethren, the Lamanites, made preparations for war, and came up to the land of Nephi for the purpose of destroying the king, and to place <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>another</span> in his stead, and also of destroying the people of Anti-Nephi-Lehi out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351272" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now when the people saw that they were coming against them they went out to meet them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prostrated</span> themselves before them to the earth, and began to call on the name of the Lord; and thus they were in this attitude when the Lamanites began to fall upon them, and began to slay them with the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351273" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And thus without meeting any resistance, they did slay a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thousand</span> and five of them; and we know that they are blessed, for they have gone to dwell with their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351274" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now when the Lamanites saw that their brethren would not flee from the sword, neither would they turn aside to the right hand or to the left, but that they would lie down and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perish</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praised</span> God even in the very act of perishing under the sword—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351275" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now when the Lamanites saw this they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forbear</span> from slaying them; and there were many whose hearts had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>swollen</span> in them for those of their brethren who had fallen under the sword, for they repented of the things which they had done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351276" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that they threw down their weapons of war, and they would not take them again, for they were stung for the murders which they had committed; and they came down even as their brethren, relying upon the mercies of those whose arms were lifted to slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351277" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that the people of God were joined that day by more than the number who had been slain; and those who had been slain were righteous people, therefore we have no reason to doubt but what they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saved</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351278" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And there was not a wicked man slain among them; but there were more than a thousand brought to the knowledge of the truth; thus we see that the Lord worketh in many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ways</span> to the salvation of his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351279" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Now the greatest number of those of the Lamanites who slew so many of their brethren were Amalekites and Amulonites, the greatest number of whom were after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nehors</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351280" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now, among those who joined the people of the Lord, there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> who were Amalekites or Amulonites, or who were of the order of Nehor, but they were actual descendants of Laman and Lemuel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351281" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And thus we can plainly discern, that after a people have been once <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enlightened</span> by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span> of God, and have had great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> of things pertaining to righteousness, and then have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fallen</span> away into <span class="page-break" data-page="271"></span>sin and transgression, they become more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>hardened</span>, and thus their state becomes <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>worse</span> than though they had never known these things.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 25	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349667" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/25" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 25</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349668" id="title_number1">Chapter 25</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349669" id="study_summary1">Lamanite aggressions spread—The seed of the priests of Noah perish as Abinadi prophesied—Many Lamanites are converted and join the people of Anti-Nephi-Lehi—They believe in Christ and keep the law of Moses. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349670" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And behold, now it came to pass that those Lamanites were more angry because they had slain their brethren; therefore they swore vengeance upon the Nephites; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no more</span> attempt to slay the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehi</span> at that time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349671" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But they took their armies and went over into the borders of the land of Zarahemla, and fell upon the people who were in the land of Ammonihah and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroyed</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349672" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And after that, they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> battles with the Nephites, in the which they were driven and slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349673" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And among the Lamanites who were slain were almost all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> of Amulon and his brethren, who were the priests of Noah, and they were slain by the hands of the Nephites;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349674" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the remainder, having fled into the east wilderness, and having usurped the power and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> over the Lamanites, caused that many of the Lamanites should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perish</span> by fire because of their belief—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349675" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For many of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>them</span>, after having suffered much loss and so many afflictions, began to be stirred up in remembrance of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> which Aaron and his brethren had preached to them in their land; therefore they began to disbelieve the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers, and to believe in the Lord, and that he gave great power unto the Nephites; and thus there were many of them converted in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349676" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that those rulers who were the remnant of the children of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulon</span> caused that they should be put to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>, yea, all those that believed in these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349677" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now this martyrdom caused that many of their brethren should be stirred up to anger; and there began to be contention in the wilderness; and the Lamanites began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hunt</span> the seed of Amulon and his brethren and began to slay them; and they fled into the east wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349678" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold they are hunted at this day by the Lamanites. Thus the words of Abinadi were brought to pass, which he said concerning the seed of the priests who caused that he should suffer death by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349679" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For he said unto them: What ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>do</span> unto me shall be a type of things to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349680" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now Abinadi was the first that suffered <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> by fire because of his belief in God; now this is what he meant, that many should suffer death by fire, according as he had suffered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349681" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he said unto the priests of Noah that their seed should cause many to be put to death, in the like manner as he was, and that they should be scattered abroad and slain, even as a sheep having no shepherd is driven and slain by wild beasts; and now behold, these words were verified, for they were driven by the Lamanites, and they were hunted, and they were smitten.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349682" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that when <span class="page-break" data-page="272"></span>the Lamanites saw that they could not overpower the Nephites they returned again to their own land; and many of them came over to dwell in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ishmael</span> and the land of Nephi, and did join themselves to the people of God, who were the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349683" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they did also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bury</span> their weapons of war, according as their brethren had, and they began to be a righteous people; and they did walk in the ways of the Lord, and did observe to keep his commandments and his statutes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349684" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, and they did keep the law of Moses; for it was expedient that they should keep the law of Moses as yet, for it was not all fulfilled. But notwithstanding the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> of Moses, they did look forward to the coming of Christ, considering that the law of Moses was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>type</span> of his coming, and believing that they must keep those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>outward</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>performances</span> until the time that he should be revealed unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349685" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now they did not suppose that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> came by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> of Moses; but the law of Moses did serve to strengthen their faith in Christ; and thus they did retain a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hope</span> through faith, unto eternal salvation, relying upon the spirit of prophecy, which spake of those things to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349686" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now behold, Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner, and Himni, and their brethren did rejoice exceedingly, for the success which they had had among the Lamanites, seeing that the Lord had granted unto them according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span>, and that he had also verified his word unto them in every particular.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 26	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351324" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/26" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 26</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351325" id="title_number1">Chapter 26</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351326" id="study_summary1">Ammon glories in the Lord—The faithful are strengthened by the Lord and are given knowledge—By faith men may bring thousands of souls unto repentance—God has all power and comprehends all things. About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351327" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, these are the words of Ammon to his brethren, which say thus: My brothers and my brethren, behold I say unto you, how great reason have we to rejoice; for could we have supposed when we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>started</span> from the land of Zarahemla that God would have granted unto us such great blessings?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351328" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now, I ask, what great blessings has he bestowed upon us? Can ye tell?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351329" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, I answer for you; for our brethren, the Lamanites, were in darkness, yea, even in the darkest abyss, but behold, how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> of them are brought to behold the marvelous light of God! And this is the blessing which hath been bestowed upon us, that we have been made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>instruments</span> in the hands of God to bring about this great work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351330" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thousands</span> of them do rejoice, and have been brought into the fold of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351331" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>field</span> was ripe, and blessed are ye, for ye did thrust in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sickle</span>, and did reap with your might, yea, all the day long did ye labor; and behold the number of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sheaves</span>! And they shall be <span class="page-break" data-page="273"></span>gathered into the garners, that they are not wasted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351332" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, they shall not be beaten down by the storm at the last day; yea, neither shall they be harrowed up by the whirlwinds; but when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>storm</span> cometh they shall be gathered together in their place, that the storm cannot penetrate to them; yea, neither shall they be driven with fierce winds whithersoever the enemy listeth to carry them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351333" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But behold, they are in the hands of the Lord of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harvest</span>, and they are his; and he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>raise</span> them up at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351334" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Blessed</span> be the name of our God; let us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sing</span> to his praise, yea, let us give <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thanks</span> to his holy name, for he doth work righteousness forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351335" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For if we had not come up out of the land of Zarahemla, these our dearly beloved brethren, who have so dearly beloved us, would still have been racked with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hatred</span> against us, yea, and they would also have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strangers</span> to God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351336" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that when Ammon had said these words, his brother Aaron rebuked him, saying: Ammon, I fear that thy joy doth carry thee away unto boasting.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351337" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But Ammon said unto him: I do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span> in my own strength, nor in my own wisdom; but behold, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>joy</span> is full, yea, my heart is brim with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>joy</span>, and I will rejoice in my God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351338" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, I know that I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nothing</span>; as to my strength I am weak; therefore I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> boast of myself, but I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>boast</span> of my God, for in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>strength</span> I can do all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>things</span>; yea, behold, many mighty miracles we have wrought in this land, for which we will praise his name forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351339" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, how many thousands of our brethren has he loosed from the pains of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hell</span>; and they are brought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sing</span> redeeming love, and this because of the power of his word which is in us, therefore have we not great reason to rejoice?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351340" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, we have reason to praise him forever, for he is the Most High God, and has loosed our brethren from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chains</span> of hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351341" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, they were encircled about with everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span> and destruction; but behold, he has brought them into his everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span>, yea, into everlasting salvation; and they are encircled about with the matchless bounty of his love; yea, and we have been instruments in his hands of doing this great and marvelous work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351342" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, let us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span>, yea, we will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span> in the Lord; yea, we will rejoice, for our joy is full; yea, we will praise our God forever. Behold, who can glory too much in the Lord? Yea, who can say too much of his great power, and of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mercy</span>, and of his long-suffering towards the children of men? Behold, I say unto you, I cannot say the smallest part which I feel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351343" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Who could have supposed that our God would have been so merciful as to have snatched us from our awful, sinful, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>polluted</span> state?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351344" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, we went forth even in <span class="page-break" data-page="274"></span>wrath, with mighty threatenings to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> his church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351345" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Oh then, why did he not consign us to an awful destruction, yea, why did he not let the sword of his justice fall upon us, and doom us to eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>despair</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351346" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Oh, my soul, almost as it were, fleeth at the thought. Behold, he did not exercise his justice upon us, but in his great mercy hath brought us over that everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gulf</span> of death and misery, even to the salvation of our souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351347" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now behold, my brethren, what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>natural man</span> is there that knoweth these things? I say unto you, there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>none</span> that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knoweth</span> these things, save it be the penitent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351348" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repenteth</span> and exerciseth faith, and bringeth forth good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>works</span>, and prayeth continually without ceasing—unto such it is given to know the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mysteries</span> of God; yea, unto such it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>given</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>reveal</span> things which never have been revealed; yea, and it shall be given unto such to bring thousands of souls to repentance, even as it has been given unto us to bring these our brethren to repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351349" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now do ye remember, my brethren, that we said unto our brethren in the land of Zarahemla, we go up to the land of Nephi, to preach unto our brethren, the Lamanites, and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laughed</span> us to scorn?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351350" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For they said unto us: Do ye suppose that ye can bring the Lamanites to the knowledge of the truth? Do ye suppose that ye can convince the Lamanites of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>incorrectness</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers, as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stiffnecked</span> a people as they are; whose hearts delight in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>shedding</span> of blood; whose days have been spent in the grossest iniquity; whose ways have been the ways of a transgressor from the beginning? Now my brethren, ye remember that this was their language.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351351" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And moreover they did say: Let us take up arms against them, that we destroy them and their iniquity out of the land, lest they overrun us and destroy us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351352" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But behold, my beloved brethren, we came into the wilderness not with the intent to destroy our brethren, but with the intent that perhaps we might save some few of their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351353" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Now when our hearts were depressed, and we were about to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>turn</span> back, behold, the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>comforted</span> us, and said: Go amongst thy brethren, the Lamanites, and bear with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>patience</span> thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>afflictions</span>, and I will give unto you success.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351354" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now behold, we have come, and been forth amongst them; and we have been patient in our sufferings, and we have suffered every privation; yea, we have traveled from house to house, relying upon the mercies of the world—not upon the mercies of the world alone but upon the mercies of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351355" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And we have entered into their houses and taught them, and we have taught them in their streets; yea, and we have taught them upon their hills; and we have also entered into their temples and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span> and taught them; and we have been cast out, and mocked, and spit upon, and smote upon our <span class="page-break" data-page="275"></span>cheeks; and we have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stoned</span>, and taken and bound with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>strong</span> cords, and cast into prison; and through the power and wisdom of God we have been delivered again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351356" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And we have suffered all manner of afflictions, and all this, that perhaps we might be the means of saving some soul; and we supposed that our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span> would be full if perhaps we could be the means of saving some.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351357" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Now behold, we can look forth and see the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruits</span> of our labors; and are they few? I say unto you, Nay, they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>many</span>; yea, and we can witness of their sincerity, because of their love towards their brethren and also towards us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351358" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>For behold, they had rather <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifice</span> their lives than even to take the life of their enemy; and they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>buried</span> their weapons of war deep in the earth, because of their love towards their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351359" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And now behold I say unto you, has there been so great love in all the land? Behold, I say unto you, Nay, there has not, even among the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351360" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>For behold, they would take up arms against their brethren; they would not suffer themselves to be slain. But behold how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> of these have laid down their lives; and we know that they have gone to their God, because of their love and of their hatred to sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351361" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Now have we not reason to rejoice? Yea, I say unto you, there never were men that had so great reason to rejoice as we, since the world began; yea, and my joy is carried away, even unto boasting in my God; for he has all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> wisdom, and all understanding; he comprehendeth all things, and he is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>merciful</span> Being, even unto salvation, to those who will repent and believe on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351362" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now if this is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boasting</span>, even so will I boast; for this is my life and my light, my joy and my salvation, and my redemption from everlasting wo. Yea, blessed is the name of my God, who has been mindful of this people, who are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>branch</span> of the tree of Israel, and has been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lost</span> from its body in a strange land; yea, I say, blessed be the name of my God, who has been mindful of us, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>wanderers</span> in a strange land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351363" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Now my brethren, we see that God is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mindful</span> of every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>people</span>, whatsoever land they may be in; yea, he numbereth his people, and his bowels of mercy are over all the earth. Now this is my joy, and my great thanksgiving; yea, and I will give thanks unto my God forever. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 27	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349713" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/27" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 27</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349714" id="title_number1">Chapter 27</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349715" id="study_summary1">The Lord commands Ammon to lead the people of Anti-Nephi-Lehi to safety—Upon meeting Alma, Ammon’s joy exhausts his strength—The Nephites give the Anti-Nephi-Lehies the land of Jershon—They are called the people of Ammon.
