About 90–77 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349716" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that when those Lamanites who had gone to war against the Nephites had found, after their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> struggles to destroy them, that it was in vain to seek their destruction, they returned again to the land of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349717" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the Amalekites, because of their loss, were exceedingly angry. And when they saw that they could not seek revenge from the Nephites, they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir up</span> the people in anger <span class="page-break" data-page="276"></span>against their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brethren</span>, the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehi</span>; therefore they began again to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349718" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now this people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span> refused to take their arms, and they suffered themselves to be slain according to the desires of their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349719" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now when Ammon and his brethren saw this work of destruction among those whom they so dearly beloved, and among those who had so dearly beloved them—for they were treated as though they were angels sent from God to save them from everlasting destruction—therefore, when Ammon and his brethren saw this great work of destruction, they were moved with compassion, and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>said</span> unto the king:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349720" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Let us gather together this people of the Lord, and let us go down to the land of Zarahemla to our brethren the Nephites, and flee out of the hands of our enemies, that we be not destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349721" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But the king said unto them: Behold, the Nephites will destroy us, because of the many murders and sins we have committed against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349722" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And Ammon said: I will go and inquire of the Lord, and if he say unto us, go down unto our brethren, will ye go?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349723" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the king said unto him: Yea, if the Lord saith unto us go, we will go down unto our brethren, and we will be their slaves until we repair unto them the many murders and sins which we have committed against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349724" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But Ammon said unto him: It is against the law of our brethren, which was established by my father, that there should be any <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slaves</span> among them; therefore let us go down and rely upon the mercies of our brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349725" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But the king said unto him: Inquire of the Lord, and if he saith unto us go, we will go; otherwise we will perish in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349726" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon went and inquired of the Lord, and the Lord said unto him:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349727" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Get this people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>out</span> of this land, that they perish not; for Satan has great hold on the hearts of the Amalekites, who do stir up the Lamanites to anger against their brethren to slay them; therefore get thee out of this land; and blessed are this people in this generation, for I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserve</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349728" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now it came to pass that Ammon went and told the king all the words which the Lord had said unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349729" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they gathered together all their people, yea, all the people of the Lord, and did gather together all their flocks and herds, and departed out of the land, and came into the wilderness which divided the land of Nephi from the land of Zarahemla, and came over near the borders of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349730" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that Ammon said unto them: Behold, I and my brethren will go forth into the land of Zarahemla, and ye shall remain here until we return; and we will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>try</span> the hearts of our brethren, whether they will that ye shall come into their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349731" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that as Ammon was going forth into the land, that he and his brethren met Alma, over in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>place</span> of which has been spoken; and behold, this was a joyful meeting.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349732" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span> of Ammon was so great even that he was full; yea, he was swallowed up in the joy of his God, even to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>exhausting</span> of his strength; and he fell <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>again</span> to the earth.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="277"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349733" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now was not this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exceeding</span> joy? Behold, this is joy which none receiveth save it be the truly penitent and humble seeker of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>happiness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349734" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now the joy of Alma in meeting his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brethren</span> was truly great, and also the joy of Aaron, of Omner, and Himni; but behold their joy was not that to exceed their strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349735" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma conducted his brethren back to the land of Zarahemla; even to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>own</span> house. And they went and told the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chief judge</span> all the things that had happened unto them in the land of Nephi, among their brethren, the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349736" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the chief judge sent a proclamation throughout all the land, desiring the voice of the people concerning the admitting their brethren, who were the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Anti-Nephi-Lehi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349737" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that the voice of the people came, saying: Behold, we will give up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jershon</span>, which is on the east by the sea, which joins the land Bountiful, which is on the south of the land Bountiful; and this land Jershon is the land which we will give unto our brethren for an inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349738" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And behold, we will set our armies between the land Jershon and the land Nephi, that we may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>protect</span> our brethren in the land Jershon; and this we do for our brethren, on account of their fear to take up arms against their brethren lest they should commit sin; and this their great fear came because of their sore repentance which they had, on account of their many murders and their awful wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349739" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now behold, this will we do unto our brethren, that they may inherit the land Jershon; and we will guard them from their enemies with our armies, on condition that they will give us a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>portion</span> of their substance to assist us that we may maintain our armies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349740" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now, it came to pass that when Ammon had heard this, he returned to the people of Anti-Nephi-Lehi, and also Alma with him, into the wilderness, where they had pitched their tents, and made known unto them all these things. And Alma also related unto them his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conversion</span>, with Ammon and Aaron, and his brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349741" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that it did cause great joy among them. And they went down into the land of Jershon, and took possession of the land of Jershon; and they were called by the Nephites the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Ammon; therefore they were distinguished by that name ever after.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349742" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And they were among the people of Nephi, and also numbered among the people who were of the church of God. And they were also distinguished for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>zeal</span> towards God, and also towards men; for they were perfectly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>honest</span> and upright in all things; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>firm</span> in the faith of Christ, even unto the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349743" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And they did look upon shedding the blood of their brethren with the greatest abhorrence; and they never could be prevailed upon to take up arms against their brethren; and they never did look upon death with any degree of terror, for their hope and views of Christ and the resurrection; therefore, death was swallowed up to them by the victory of Christ over it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349744" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore, they would suffer <span class="page-break" data-page="278"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> in the most aggravating and distressing manner which could be inflicted by their brethren, before they would take the sword or cimeter to smite them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349745" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And thus they were a zealous and beloved people, a highly favored people of the Lord.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 28	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349776" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/28" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 28</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349777" id="title_number1">Chapter 28</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349778" id="study_summary1">The Lamanites are defeated in a tremendous battle—Tens of thousands are slain—The wicked are consigned to a state of endless woe; the righteous attain a never-ending happiness. About 77–76 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349779" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after the people of Ammon were established in the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jershon</span>, and a church also established in the land of Jershon, and the armies of the Nephites were set round about the land of Jershon, yea, in all the borders round about the land of Zarahemla; behold the armies of the Lamanites had followed their brethren into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349780" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And thus there was a tremendous battle; yea, even such an one as never had been known among all the people in the land from the time Lehi left Jerusalem; yea, and tens of thousands of the Lamanites were slain and scattered abroad.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349781" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, and also there was a tremendous slaughter among the people of Nephi; nevertheless, the Lamanites were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>driven</span> and scattered, and the people of Nephi returned again to their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349782" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now this was a time that there was a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span> and lamentation heard throughout all the land, among all the people of Nephi—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349783" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, the cry of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>widows</span> mourning for their husbands, and also of fathers mourning for their sons, and the daughter for the brother, yea, the brother for the father; and thus the cry of mourning was heard among all of them, mourning for their kindred who had been slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349784" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now surely this was a sorrowful day; yea, a time of solemnity, and a time of much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fasting</span> and prayer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349785" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And thus endeth the fifteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349786" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> is the account of Ammon and his brethren, their journeyings in the land of Nephi, their sufferings in the land, their sorrows, and their afflictions, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>incomprehensible</span> joy, and the reception and safety of the brethren in the land of Jershon. And now may the Lord, the Redeemer of all men, bless their souls forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349787" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And this is the account of the wars and contentions among the Nephites, and also the wars between the Nephites and the Lamanites; and the fifteenth year of the reign of the judges is ended.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349788" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> year to the fifteenth has brought to pass the destruction of many thousand lives; yea, it has brought to pass an awful scene of bloodshed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349789" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the bodies of many thousands are laid low in the earth, while the bodies of many thousands are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>moldering</span> in heaps upon the face of the earth; yea, and many thousands are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mourning</span> for the loss of their kindred, because they have reason to fear, according to the promises of the Lord, that they are consigned to a state of endless wo.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349790" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>While many thousands of others truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span> for the loss of their kindred, yet they rejoice and exult in the hope, and even know, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promises</span> of the Lord, that <span class="page-break" data-page="279"></span>they are raised to dwell at the right hand of God, in a state of never-ending <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>happiness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349791" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And thus we see how great the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inequality</span> of man is because of sin and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>transgression</span>, and the power of the devil, which comes by the cunning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plans</span> which he hath devised to ensnare the hearts of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349792" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And thus we see the great call of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>diligence</span> of men to labor in the vineyards of the Lord; and thus we see the great reason of sorrow, and also of rejoicing—sorrow because of death and destruction among men, and joy because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light of Christ</span> unto life.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 29	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351434" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/29" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 29</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351436" id="title_number1">Chapter 29</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351437" id="study_summary1">Alma desires to cry repentance with angelic zeal—The Lord grants teachers for all nations—Alma glories in the Lord’s work and in the success of Ammon and his brethren. About 76 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351438" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>O that I were an angel, and could have the wish of mine heart, that I might go forth and speak with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trump</span> of God, with a voice to shake the earth, and cry repentance unto every people!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351439" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, I would declare unto every soul, as with the voice of thunder, repentance and the plan of redemption, that they should repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto our God, that there might not be more sorrow upon all the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351440" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But behold, I am a man, and do sin in my wish; for I ought to be content with the things which the Lord hath allotted unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351441" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>I ought not to harrow up in my desires the firm decree of a just God, for I know that he granteth unto men according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desire</span>, whether it be unto death or unto life; yea, I know that he allotteth unto men, yea, decreeth unto them decrees which are unalterable, according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wills</span>, whether they be unto salvation or unto destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351442" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and I know that good and evil have come before all men; he that knoweth not good from evil is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blameless</span>; but he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knoweth</span> good and evil, to him it is given according to his desires, whether he desireth good or evil, life or death, joy or remorse of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>conscience</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351443" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, seeing that I know these things, why should I desire more than to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perform</span> the work to which I have been called?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351444" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Why should I desire that I were an angel, that I could speak unto all the ends of the earth?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351445" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For behold, the Lord doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grant</span> unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> nations, of their own nation and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tongue</span>, to teach his word, yea, in wisdom, all that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>seeth</span> fit that they should have; therefore we see that the Lord doth counsel in wisdom, according to that which is just and true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351446" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>I know that which the Lord hath commanded me, and I glory in it. I do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span> of myself, but I glory in that which the Lord hath commanded me; yea, and this is my glory, that perhaps I may be an instrument in the hands of God to bring some soul to repentance; and this is my joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351447" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And behold, when I see many of my brethren truly penitent, and coming to the Lord their God, then is my soul filled with joy; then do I remember <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>what</span> the Lord has done <span class="page-break" data-page="280"></span>for me, yea, even that he hath heard my prayer; yea, then do I remember his merciful arm which he extended towards me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351448" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, and I also remember the captivity of my fathers; for I surely do know that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> did deliver them out of bondage, and by this did establish his church; yea, the Lord God, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did deliver them out of bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351449" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, I have always remembered the captivity of my fathers; and that same God who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> them out of the hands of the Egyptians did deliver them out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bondage</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351450" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, and that same God did establish his church among them; yea, and that same God hath called me by a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy</span> calling, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preach</span> the word unto this people, and hath given me much success, in the which my joy is full.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351451" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But I do not joy in my own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>success</span> alone, but my joy is more full because of the success of my brethren, who have been up to the land of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351452" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, they have labored exceedingly, and have brought forth much fruit; and how great shall be their reward!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351453" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now, when I think of the success of these my brethren my soul is carried away, even to the separation of it from the body, as it were, so great is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351454" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now may God grant unto these, my brethren, that they may sit down in the kingdom of God; yea, and also all those who are the fruit of their labors that they may go no more out, but that they may praise him forever. And may God grant that it may be done according to my words, even as I have spoken. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 30	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349811" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/30" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 30</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349812" id="title_number1">Chapter 30</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349813" id="study_summary1">Korihor, the anti-Christ, ridicules Christ, the Atonement, and the spirit of prophecy—He teaches that there is no God, no fall of man, no penalty for sin, and no Christ—Alma testifies that Christ will come and that all things denote there is a God—Korihor demands a sign and is struck dumb—The devil had appeared to Korihor as an angel and taught him what to say—Korihor is trodden down and dies. About 76–74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349814" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Ammon were established in the land of Jershon, yea, and also after the Lamanites were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>driven out</span> of the land, and their dead were buried by the people of the land—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349815" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now their dead were not numbered because of the greatness of their numbers; neither were the dead of the Nephites numbered—but it came to pass after they had buried their dead, and also after the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fasting</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mourning</span>, and prayer, (and it was in the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi) there began to be continual peace throughout all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349816" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, and the people did observe to keep the commandments of the Lord; and they were strict in observing the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordinances</span> of God, according to the law of Moses; for they were taught to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>keep</span> the law of Moses until it should be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349817" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus the people did have no disturbance in all the sixteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349818" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that in the commencement of the seventeenth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351819" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But it came to pass in the latter end of the seventeenth year, there came a man into the land of <span class="page-break" data-page="281"></span>Zarahemla, and he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Anti-Christ</span>, for he began to preach unto the people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>against</span> the prophecies which had been spoken by the prophets, concerning the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351820" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now there was no law against a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man’s</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>belief</span>; for it was strictly contrary to the commands of God that there should be a law which should bring men on to unequal grounds.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351821" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For thus saith the scripture: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Choose</span> ye this day, whom ye will serve.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351822" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now if a man desired to serve God, it was his privilege; or rather, if he believed in God it was his privilege to serve him; but if he did not believe in him there was no law to punish him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351823" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murdered</span> he was punished unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>; and if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>robbed</span> he was also punished; and if he stole he was also punished; and if he committed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>adultery</span> he was also punished; yea, for all this wickedness they were punished.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351824" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For there was a law that men should be judged according to their crimes. Nevertheless, there was no law against a man’s belief; therefore, a man was punished only for the crimes which he had done; therefore all men were on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>equal</span> grounds.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351825" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Anti-Christ</span>, whose name was Korihor, (and the law could have no hold upon him) began to preach unto the people that there should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no</span> Christ. And after this manner did he preach, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351826" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O ye that are bound down under a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>foolish</span> and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things? Why do ye look for a Christ? For no man can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> of anything which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351827" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351828" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>How do ye know of their surety? Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>see</span>; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351829" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Ye look forward and say that ye see a remission of your sins. But behold, it is the effect of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>frenzied</span> mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351830" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And many more such things did he say unto them, telling them that there could be no atonement made for the sins of men, but every man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fared</span> in this life according to the management of the creature; therefore every man prospered according to his genius, and that every man conquered according to his strength; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whatsoever</span> a man did was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>no</span> crime.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351831" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And thus he did preach unto them, leading away the hearts of many, causing them to lift up their heads in their wickedness, yea, leading away many women, and also men, to commit whoredoms—telling them that when a man was dead, that was the end thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351832" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now this man went over to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jershon</span> also, to preach these things among the people of Ammon, who were once the people of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351833" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold they were more wise than many of the Nephites; for they took him, and bound him, and carried him before Ammon, who was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priest</span> over that people.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="282"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351834" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that he caused that he should be carried out of the land. And he came over into the land of Gideon, and began to preach unto them also; and here he did not have much success, for he was taken and bound and carried before the high priest, and also the chief judge over the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351835" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that the high priest said unto him: Why do ye go about perverting the ways of the Lord? Why do ye teach this people that there shall be no Christ, to interrupt their rejoicings? Why do ye speak against all the prophecies of the holy prophets?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351836" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now the high priest’s name was Giddonah. And Korihor said unto him: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351837" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Ye say that this people is a free people. Behold, I say they are in bondage. Ye say that those ancient prophecies are true. Behold, I say that ye do not know that they are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351838" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Ye say that this people is a guilty and a fallen people, because of the transgression of a parent. Behold, I say that a child is not guilty because of its parents.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351839" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And ye also say that Christ shall come. But behold, I say that ye do not know that there shall be a Christ. And ye say also that he shall be slain for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span> of the world—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351840" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351841" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God—a being who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> has been seen or known, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>never</span> was nor ever will be.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351842" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now when the high priest and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chief judge</span> saw the hardness of his heart, yea, when they saw that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>revile</span> even against God, they would not make any reply to his words; but they caused that he should be bound; and they delivered him up into the hands of the officers, and sent him to the land of Zarahemla, that he might be brought before Alma, and the chief judge who was governor over all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351843" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that when he was brought before Alma and the chief judge, he did go on in the same manner as he did in the land of Gideon; yea, he went on to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blaspheme</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351844" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he did rise up in great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swelling</span> words before Alma, and did revile against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> and teachers, accusing them of leading away the people after the silly traditions of their fathers, for the sake of glutting on the labors of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351845" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Now Alma said unto him: Thou knowest that we do not glut ourselves upon the labors of this people; for behold I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>labored</span> even from <span class="page-break" data-page="283"></span>the commencement of the reign of the judges until now, with mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>own</span> hands for my support, notwithstanding my many travels round about the land to declare the word of God unto my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351846" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And notwithstanding the many labors which I have performed in the church, I have never received so much as even one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>senine</span> for my labor; neither has any of my brethren, save it were in the judgment-seat; and then we have received only according to law for our time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351847" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And now, if we do not receive anything for our labors in the church, what doth it profit us to labor in the church save it were to declare the truth, that we may have rejoicings in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span> of our brethren?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351848" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Then why sayest thou that we preach unto this people to get gain, when thou, of thyself, knowest that we receive no gain? And now, believest thou that we deceive this people, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>causes</span> such joy in their hearts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351849" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And Korihor answered him, Yea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351850" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And then Alma said unto him: Believest thou that there is a God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351851" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And he answered, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351852" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Now Alma said unto him: Will ye deny again that there is a God, and also deny the Christ? For behold, I say unto you, I know there is a God, and also that Christ shall come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351853" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And now what evidence have ye that there is no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span>, or that Christ cometh not? I say unto you that ye have none, save it be your word only.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351854" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>But, behold, I have all things as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testimony</span> that these things are true; and ye also have all things as a testimony unto you that they are true; and will ye deny them? Believest thou that these things are true?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351855" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>Behold, I know that thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believest</span>, but thou art possessed with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lying</span> spirit, and ye have put <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>off</span> the Spirit of God that it may have no place in you; but the devil has power over you, and he doth carry you about, working devices that he may destroy the children of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351856" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And now Korihor said unto Alma: If thou wilt show me a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span>, that I may be convinced that there is a God, yea, show unto me that he hath power, and then will I be convinced of the truth of thy words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351857" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>But Alma said unto him: Thou hast had signs enough; will ye tempt your God? Will ye say, Show unto me a sign, when ye have the testimony of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> these thy brethren, and also all the holy prophets? The scriptures are laid before thee, yea, and all things denote there is a God; yea, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>earth</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>all</span> things that are upon the face of it, yea, and its <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>motion</span>, yea, and also all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>planets</span> which move in their regular form do witness that there is a Supreme Creator.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351858" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And yet do ye go about, leading away the hearts of this people, testifying unto them there is no God? And yet will ye deny against all these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span>? And he said: Yea, I will deny, except ye shall show me a sign.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351859" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And now it came to pass that Alma said unto him: Behold, I am grieved because of the hardness of your heart, yea, that ye will still resist the spirit of the truth, that thy soul may be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351860" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>But behold, it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> that thy <span class="page-break" data-page="284"></span>soul should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lost</span> than that thou shouldst be the means of bringing many souls down to destruction, by thy lying and by thy flattering words; therefore if thou shalt deny again, behold God shall smite thee, that thou shalt become dumb, that thou shalt never open thy mouth any more, that thou shalt not deceive this people any more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351861" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>Now Korihor said unto him: I do not deny the existence of a God, but I do not believe that there is a God; and I say also, that ye do not know that there is a God; and except ye show me a sign, I will not believe.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351862" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>Now Alma said unto him: This will I give unto thee for a sign, that thou shalt be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>struck</span> dumb, according to my words; and I say, that in the name of God, ye shall be struck dumb, that ye shall no more have utterance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351863" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>Now when Alma had said these words, Korihor was struck dumb, that he could not have utterance, according to the words of Alma.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351864" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>And now when the chief judge saw this, he put forth his hand and wrote unto Korihor, saying: Art thou convinced of the power of God? In whom did ye desire that Alma should show forth his sign? Would ye that he should afflict others, to show unto thee a sign? Behold, he has showed unto you a sign; and now will ye dispute more?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351865" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>And Korihor put forth his hand and wrote, saying: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knew</span> that there was a God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351866" id="p53"><span class="verse-number">53 </span>But behold, the devil hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deceived</span> me; for he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>appeared</span> unto me in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>form</span> of an angel, and said unto me: Go and reclaim this people, for they have all gone astray after an unknown God. And he said unto me: There is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no</span> God; yea, and he taught me that which I should say. And I have taught his words; and I taught them because they were pleasing unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>carnal</span> mind; and I taught them, even until I had much success, insomuch that I verily believed that they were true; and for this cause I withstood the truth, even until I have brought this great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note53f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>curse</span> upon me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351867" id="p54"><span class="verse-number">54 </span>Now when he had said this, he besought that Alma should pray unto God, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note54a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> might be taken from him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351868" id="p55"><span class="verse-number">55 </span>But Alma said unto him: If this curse should be taken from thee thou wouldst again lead away the hearts of this people; therefore, it shall be unto thee even as the Lord will.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351869" id="p56"><span class="verse-number">56 </span>And it came to pass that the curse was not taken off of Korihor; but he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note56a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast out</span>, and went about from house to house begging for his food.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351870" id="p57"><span class="verse-number">57 </span>Now the knowledge of what had happened unto Korihor was immediately published throughout all the land; yea, the proclamation was sent forth by the chief judge to all the people in the land, declaring unto those who had believed in the words of Korihor that they must speedily repent, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note57a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lest</span> the same judgments would come unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351871" id="p58"><span class="verse-number">58 </span>And it came to pass that they were all convinced of the wickedness of Korihor; therefore they were all converted again unto the Lord; and this put an end to the iniquity after the manner of Korihor. And Korihor did go about from house to house, begging food for his support.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351872" id="p59"><span class="verse-number">59 </span>And it came to pass that as he went forth among the people, yea, among a people who had separated themselves from the Nephites and called themselves <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note59a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span>, being <span class="page-break" data-page="285"></span>led by a man whose name was Zoram—and as he went forth amongst them, behold, he was run upon and trodden down, even until he was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note59b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351873" id="p60"><span class="verse-number">60 </span>And thus we see the end of him who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note60a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perverteth</span> the ways of the Lord; and thus we see that the devil will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note60b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>support</span> his children at the last day, but doth speedily drag them down to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note60c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hell</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 31	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351529" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/31" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 31</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351530" id="title_number1">Chapter 31</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351531" id="study_summary1">Alma heads a mission to reclaim the apostate Zoramites—The Zoramites deny Christ, believe in a false concept of election, and worship with set prayers—The missionaries are filled with the Holy Spirit—Their afflictions are swallowed up in the joy of Christ. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351532" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that after the end of Korihor, Alma having received tidings that the Zoramites were perverting the ways of the Lord, and that Zoram, who was their leader, was leading the hearts of the people to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bow</span> down to dumb <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>idols</span>, his heart again began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sicken</span> because of the iniquity of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351533" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For it was the cause of great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorrow</span> to Alma to know of iniquity among his people; therefore his heart was exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sorrowful</span> because of the separation of the Zoramites from the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351534" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now the Zoramites had gathered themselves together in a land which they called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Antionum</span>, which was east of the land of Zarahemla, which lay nearly bordering upon the seashore, which was south of the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jershon</span>, which also bordered upon the wilderness south, which wilderness was full of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351535" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now the Nephites greatly feared that the Zoramites would enter into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>correspondence</span> with the Lamanites, and that it would be the means of great loss on the part of the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351536" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preaching</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>word</span> had a great tendency to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lead</span> the people to do that which was just—yea, it had had more powerful effect upon the minds of the people than the sword, or anything else, which had happened unto them—therefore Alma thought it was expedient that they should try the virtue of the word of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351537" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Therefore he took Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner; and Himni he did leave in the church in Zarahemla; but the former three he took with him, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulek</span> and Zeezrom, who were at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Melek</span>; and he also took two of his sons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351538" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now the eldest of his sons he took not with him, and his name was Helaman; but the names of those whom he took with him were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shiblon</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Corianton</span>; and these are the names of those who went with him among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zoramites</span>, to preach unto them the word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351539" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the Zoramites were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissenters</span> from the Nephites; therefore they had had the word of God preached unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351540" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fallen</span> into great errors, for they would not observe to keep the commandments of God, <span class="page-break" data-page="286"></span>and his statutes, according to the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351541" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Neither would they observe the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>performances</span> of the church, to continue in prayer and supplication to God daily, that they might not enter into temptation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351542" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, in fine, they did pervert the ways of the Lord in very many instances; therefore, for this cause, Alma and his brethren went into the land to preach the word unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351543" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now, when they had come into the land, behold, to their astonishment they found that the Zoramites had built synagogues, and that they did gather themselves together on one day of the week, which day they did call the day of the Lord; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> after a manner which Alma and his brethren had never beheld;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351544" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For they had a place built up in the center of their synagogue, a place for standing, which was high above the head; and the top thereof would only admit one person.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351545" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore, whosoever desired to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> must go forth and stand upon the top thereof, and stretch forth his hands towards heaven, and cry with a loud voice, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351546" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Holy, holy God; we believe that thou art God, and we believe that thou art holy, and that thou wast a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spirit</span>, and that thou art a spirit, and that thou wilt be a spirit forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351547" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Holy God, we believe that thou hast separated us from our brethren; and we do not believe in the tradition of our brethren, which was handed down to them by the childishness of their fathers; but we believe that thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>elected</span> us to be thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>holy</span> children; and also thou hast made it known unto us that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>there</span> shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no</span> Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351548" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But thou art the same yesterday, today, and forever; and thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>elected</span> us that we shall be saved, whilst all around us are elected to be cast by thy wrath down to hell; for the which holiness, O God, we thank thee; and we also thank thee that thou hast elected us, that we may not be led away after the foolish traditions of our brethren, which doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bind</span> them down to a belief of Christ, which doth lead their hearts to wander far from thee, our God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351549" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And again we thank thee, O God, that we are a chosen and a holy people. Amen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351550" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now it came to pass that after Alma and his brethren and his sons had heard these prayers, they were astonished beyond all measure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351551" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>For behold, every man did go forth and offer up these same <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351552" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now the place was called by them Rameumptom, which, being interpreted, is the holy stand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351553" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now, from this stand they did offer up, every man, the selfsame prayer unto God, thanking their God that they were chosen of him, and that he did not lead them away after the tradition of their brethren, and that their hearts were not stolen away to believe in things to come, which they knew nothing about.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351554" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now, after the people had all offered up thanks after this manner, they returned to their homes, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> speaking of their God again until they had assembled themselves together again to the holy stand, to offer up thanks after their manner.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351555" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now when Alma saw this his heart was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grieved</span>; for he saw that they were a wicked and a perverse people; yea, he saw that their hearts were set upon gold, and upon silver, and upon all manner of fine goods.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="287"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351556" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Yea, and he also saw that their hearts were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> unto great boasting, in their pride.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351557" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And he lifted up his voice to heaven, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cried</span>, saying: O, how long, O Lord, wilt thou suffer that thy servants shall dwell here below in the flesh, to behold such gross wickedness among the children of men?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351558" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Behold, O God, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> unto thee, and yet their hearts are swallowed up in their pride. Behold, O God, they cry unto thee with their mouths, while they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>puffed up</span>, even to greatness, with the vain things of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>world</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351559" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Behold, O my God, their costly apparel, and their ringlets, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bracelets</span>, and their ornaments of gold, and all their precious things which they are ornamented with; and behold, their hearts are set upon them, and yet they cry unto thee and say—We thank thee, O God, for we are a chosen people unto thee, while others shall perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351560" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, and they say that thou hast made it known unto them that there shall be no Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351561" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>O Lord God, how long wilt thou suffer that such wickedness and infidelity shall be among this people? O Lord, wilt thou give me strength, that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bear</span> with mine infirmities. For I am infirm, and such wickedness among this people doth pain my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351562" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>O Lord, my heart is exceedingly sorrowful; wilt thou comfort my soul <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in Christ</span>. O Lord, wilt thou grant unto me that I may have strength, that I may suffer with patience these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span> which shall come upon me, because of the iniquity of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351563" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>O Lord, wilt thou comfort my soul, and give unto me success, and also my fellow laborers who are with me—yea, Ammon, and Aaron, and Omner, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulek</span> and Zeezrom, and also my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>two</span> sons—yea, even all these wilt thou comfort, O Lord. Yea, wilt thou comfort their souls in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351564" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Wilt thou grant unto them that they may have strength, that they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bear</span> their afflictions which shall come upon them because of the iniquities of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351565" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>O Lord, wilt thou grant <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unto</span> us that we may have success in bringing them again unto thee in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351566" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Behold, O Lord, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>souls</span> are precious, and many of them are our brethren; therefore, give unto us, O Lord, power and wisdom that we may bring these, our brethren, again unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351567" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now it came to pass that when Alma had said these words, that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>clapped</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hands</span> upon all them who were with him. And behold, as he clapped his hands upon them, they were filled with the Holy Spirit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351568" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And after that they did separate themselves one from another, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taking</span> no thought for themselves what they should eat, or what they should drink, or what they should put on.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351569" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And the Lord provided for them that they should hunger not, neither should they thirst; yea, and he also gave them strength, that they should suffer no manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span>, save it were swallowed up in the joy of Christ. Now this was according to the prayer of Alma; and this because he prayed in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 32	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351620" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/32" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 32</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="288"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351621" id="title_number1">Chapter 32</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351622" id="study_summary1">Alma teaches the poor whose afflictions had humbled them—Faith is a hope in that which is not seen which is true—Alma testifies that angels minister to men, women, and children—Alma compares the word unto a seed—It must be planted and nourished—Then it grows into a tree from which the fruit of eternal life is picked. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351623" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that they did go forth, and began to preach the word of God unto the people, entering into their synagogues, and into their houses; yea, and even they did preach the word in their streets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351624" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that after much labor among them, they began to have success among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor</span> class of people; for behold, they were cast out of the synagogues because of the coarseness of their apparel—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351625" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore they were not permitted to enter into their synagogues to worship God, being esteemed as filthiness; therefore they were poor; yea, they were esteemed by their brethren as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dross</span>; therefore they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>poor</span> as to things of the world; and also they were poor in heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351626" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now, as Alma was teaching and speaking unto the people upon the hill <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Onidah</span>, there came a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>multitude</span> unto him, who were those of whom we have been speaking, of whom were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>poor in heart</span>, because of their poverty as to the things of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351627" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they came unto Alma; and the one who was the foremost among them said unto him: Behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>what</span> shall these my brethren do, for they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>despised</span> of all men because of their poverty, yea, and more especially by our priests; for they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cast</span> us out of our synagogues which we have labored abundantly to build with our own hands; and they have cast us out because of our exceeding poverty; and we have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no</span> place to worship our God; and behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>what</span> shall we do?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351628" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now when Alma heard this, he turned him about, his face immediately towards him, and he beheld with great joy; for he beheld that their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>afflictions</span> had truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>humbled</span> them, and that they were in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>preparation</span> to hear the word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351629" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore he did say no more to the other multitude; but he stretched forth his hand, and cried unto those whom he beheld, who were truly penitent, and said unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351630" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>I behold that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lowly</span> in heart; and if so, blessed are ye.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351631" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Behold thy brother hath said, What shall we do?—for we are cast out of our synagogues, that we cannot worship our God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351632" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold I say unto you, do ye suppose that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cannot worship</span> God save it be in your synagogues only?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351633" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And moreover, I would ask, do ye suppose that ye must not worship God only <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>once</span> in a week?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351634" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>I say unto you, it is well that ye are cast out of your synagogues, that ye may be humble, and that ye may learn <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wisdom</span>; for it is necessary that ye should learn wisdom; for it is because that ye are cast out, that ye are despised of your brethren because of your exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>poverty</span>, that ye are brought to a lowliness of heart; for ye are necessarily brought to be humble.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="289"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351635" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now, because ye are compelled to be humble blessed are ye; for a man sometimes, if he is compelled to be humble, seeketh <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repentance</span>; and now surely, whosoever repenteth shall find mercy; and he that findeth mercy and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>endureth</span> to the end the same shall be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351636" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, as I said unto you, that because ye were compelled to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> ye were blessed, do ye not suppose that they are more blessed who truly humble themselves because of the word?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351637" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, he that truly humbleth himself, and repenteth of his sins, and endureth to the end, the same shall be blessed—yea, much more blessed than they who are compelled to be humble because of their exceeding poverty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351638" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, blessed are they who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humble</span> themselves without being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>compelled</span> to be humble;
