or rather, in other words, blessed is he that believeth in the word of God, and is baptized without <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stubbornness</span> of heart, yea, without being brought to know the word, or even compelled to know, before they will believe.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351639" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Yea, there are many who do say: If thou wilt show unto us a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span> from heaven, then we shall know of a surety; then we shall believe.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351640" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now I ask, is this faith? Behold, I say unto you, Nay; for if a man knoweth a thing he hath no cause to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span>, for he knoweth it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351641" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now, how much <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cursed</span> is he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knoweth</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span> of God and doeth it not, than he that only believeth, or only hath cause to believe, and falleth into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>transgression</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351642" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now of this thing ye must judge. Behold, I say unto you, that it is on the one hand even as it is on the other; and it shall be unto every man according to his work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351643" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now as I said concerning faith—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> is not to have a perfect knowledge of things; therefore if ye have faith ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span> for things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not</span> seen, which are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351644" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now, behold, I say unto you, and I would that ye should remember, that God is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> unto all who believe on his name; therefore he desireth, in the first place, that ye should believe, yea, even on his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351645" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now, he imparteth his word by angels unto men, yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> only men but women also. Now this is not all; little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>children</span> do have words given unto them many times, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confound</span> the wise and the learned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351646" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, as ye have desired to know of me what ye shall do because ye are afflicted and cast out—now I do not desire that ye should suppose that I mean to judge you only according to that which is true—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351647" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For I do not mean that ye all of you have been compelled to humble yourselves; for I verily believe that there are some among you who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>would humble</span> themselves, let them be in whatsoever circumstances they might.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351648" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now, as I said concerning faith—that it was not a perfect knowledge—even so it is with my words. Ye cannot know of their surety at first, unto perfection, any more than faith is a perfect knowledge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351649" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>But behold, if ye will awake and arouse your faculties, even to an experiment upon my words, and <span class="page-break" data-page="290"></span>exercise a particle of faith, yea, even if ye can no more than <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desire</span> to believe, let this desire work in you, even until ye believe in a manner that ye can give place for a portion of my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351650" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Now, we will compare the word unto a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span>. Now, if ye give place, that a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seed</span> may be planted in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heart</span>, behold, if it be a true seed, or a good seed, if ye do not cast it out by your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>unbelief</span>, that ye will resist the Spirit of the Lord, behold, it will begin to swell within your breasts; and when you feel these swelling motions, ye will begin to say within yourselves—It must needs be that this is a good seed, or that the word is good, for it beginneth to enlarge my soul; yea, it beginneth to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>enlighten</span> my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>understanding</span>, yea, it beginneth to be delicious to me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351652" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now behold, would not this increase your faith? I say unto you, Yea; nevertheless it hath not grown up to a perfect knowledge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351653" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>But behold, as the seed swelleth, and sprouteth, and beginneth to grow, then you must needs say that the seed is good; for behold it swelleth, and sprouteth, and beginneth to grow. And now, behold, will not this strengthen your faith? Yea, it will strengthen your faith: for ye will say I know that this is a good seed; for behold it sprouteth and beginneth to grow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351654" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And now, behold, are ye sure that this is a good seed? I say unto you, Yea; for every seed bringeth forth unto its own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>likeness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351655" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Therefore, if a seed groweth it is good, but if it groweth not, behold it is not good, therefore it is cast away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351656" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And now, behold, because ye have tried the experiment, and planted the seed, and it swelleth and sprouteth, and beginneth to grow, ye must needs know that the seed is good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351657" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And now, behold, is your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perfect</span>? Yea, your knowledge is perfect in that thing, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>faith</span> is dormant; and this because you know, for ye know that the word hath swelled your souls, and ye also know that it hath sprouted up, that your understanding doth begin to be enlightened, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mind</span> doth begin to expand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351658" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>O then, is not this real? I say unto you, Yea, because it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span>; and whatsoever is light, is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>good</span>, because it is discernible, therefore ye must know that it is good; and now behold, after ye have tasted this light is your knowledge perfect?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351659" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Behold I say unto you, Nay; neither must ye lay aside your faith, for ye have only exercised your faith to plant the seed that ye might try the experiment to know if the seed was good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351660" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And behold, as the tree beginneth to grow, ye will say: Let us nourish it with great care, that it may get root, that it may grow up, and bring forth fruit unto us. And now behold, if ye nourish it with much care it will get root, and grow up, and bring forth fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351661" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>But if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>neglect</span> the tree, and take no thought for its nourishment, behold it will not get any root; and when the heat of the sun cometh and scorcheth it, because it hath no root it withers away, and ye pluck it up and cast it out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351662" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Now, this is not because the seed was not good, neither is it because the fruit thereof would not be desirable; but it is because your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ground</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>barren</span>, and ye will not nourish the tree, therefore ye cannot have the fruit thereof.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="291"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351663" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And thus, if ye will not nourish the word, looking forward with an eye of faith to the fruit thereof, ye can never pluck of the fruit of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tree of life</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351664" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>But if ye will nourish the word, yea, nourish the tree as it beginneth to grow, by your faith with great diligence, and with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>patience</span>, looking forward to the fruit thereof, it shall take root; and behold it shall be a tree <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>springing up</span> unto everlasting life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351665" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And because of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>diligence</span> and your faith and your patience with the word in nourishing it, that it may take root in you, behold, by and by ye shall pluck the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> thereof, which is most precious, which is sweet above all that is sweet, and which is white above all that is white, yea, and pure above all that is pure; and ye shall feast upon this fruit even until ye are filled, that ye hunger not, neither shall ye thirst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351666" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>Then, my brethren, ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reap</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rewards</span> of your faith, and your diligence, and patience, and long-suffering, waiting for the tree to bring forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fruit</span> unto you.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 33	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351651" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/33" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 33</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351668" id="title_number1">Chapter 33</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351670" id="study_summary1">Zenos taught that men should pray and worship in all places, and that judgments are turned away because of the Son—Zenock taught that mercy is bestowed because of the Son—Moses had lifted up in the wilderness a type of the Son of God. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351672" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now after Alma had spoken these words, they sent forth unto him desiring to know whether they should believe in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one God</span>, that they might obtain this fruit of which he had spoken, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>how</span> they should plant the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>seed</span>, or the word of which he had spoken, which he said must be planted in their hearts; or in what manner they should begin to exercise their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351673" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And Alma said unto them: Behold, ye have said that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>could</span> not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worship</span> your God because ye are cast out of your synagogues. But behold, I say unto you, if ye suppose that ye cannot worship God, ye do greatly err, and ye ought to search the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scriptures</span>; if ye suppose that they have taught you this, ye do not understand them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351675" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Do ye remember to have read what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span>, the prophet of old, has said concerning prayer or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worship</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351677" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For he said: Thou art merciful, O God, for thou hast heard my prayer, even when I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in</span> the wilderness; yea, thou wast merciful when I prayed concerning those who were mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>enemies</span>, and thou didst turn them to me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351679" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, O God, and thou wast merciful unto me when I did cry unto thee in my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>field</span>; when I did cry unto thee in my prayer, and thou didst hear me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351680" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And again, O God, when I did turn to my house thou didst hear me in my prayer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351682" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And when I did turn unto my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>closet</span>, O Lord, and prayed unto thee, thou didst hear me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351684" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, thou art merciful unto thy children when they cry unto thee, to be heard of thee and not of men, and thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wilt hear</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351686" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, O God, thou hast been merciful unto me, and heard my cries in the midst of thy congregations.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="292"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351687" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast out</span> and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>visit</span> them in thine anger with speedy destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351689" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thou didst hear me because of mine afflictions and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sincerity</span>; and it is because of thy Son that thou hast been thus merciful unto me, therefore I will cry unto thee in all mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span>, for in thee is my joy; for thou hast turned thy judgments away from me, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>because</span> of thy Son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351691" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now Alma said unto them: Do ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> those scriptures which have been written by them of old?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351693" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, if ye do, ye must believe what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span> said; for, behold he said: Thou hast turned away thy judgments because of thy Son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351694" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now behold, my brethren, I would ask if ye have read the scriptures? If ye have, how can ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disbelieve</span> on the Son of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351696" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> written that Zenos alone spake of these things, but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zenock</span> also spake of these things—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351698" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For behold, he said: Thou art angry, O Lord, with this people, because they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>will</span> not understand thy mercies which thou hast bestowed upon them because of thy Son.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351700" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, my brethren, ye see that a second prophet of old has testified of the Son of God, and because the people would not understand his words they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stoned</span> him to death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351701" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But behold, this is not all; these are not the only ones who have spoken concerning the Son of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351703" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Behold, he was spoken of by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moses</span>; yea, and behold a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>type</span> was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>raised</span> up in the wilderness, that whosoever would look upon it might live. And many did look and live.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351705" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But few understood the meaning of those things, and this because of the hardness of their hearts. But there were many who were so hardened that they would not look, therefore they perished. Now the reason they would not look is because they did not believe that it would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heal</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351706" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>O my brethren, if ye could be healed by merely casting about your eyes that ye might be healed, would ye not behold quickly, or would ye rather harden your hearts in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span>, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slothful</span>, that ye would not cast about your eyes, that ye might perish?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351708" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>If so, wo shall come upon you; but if not so, then cast about your eyes and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>begin</span> to believe in the Son of God, that he will come to redeem his people, and that he shall suffer and die to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atone</span> for their sins; and that he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rise</span> again from the dead, which shall bring to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>resurrection</span>, that all men shall stand before him, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>judged</span> at the last and judgment day, according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>works</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351710" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now, my brethren, I desire that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plant</span> this word in your hearts, and as it beginneth to swell even so nourish it by your faith. And behold, it will become a tree, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>springing up</span> in you unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>everlasting <span class="page-break" data-page="293"></span>life</span>. And then may God grant unto you that your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>burdens</span> may be light, through the joy of his Son. And even all this can ye do if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>will</span>. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 34	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351945" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/34" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 34</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351946" id="title_number1">Chapter 34</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351947" id="study_summary1">Amulek testifies that the word is in Christ unto salvation—Unless an atonement is made, all mankind must perish—The whole law of Moses points toward the sacrifice of the Son of God—The eternal plan of redemption is based on faith and repentance—Pray for temporal and spiritual blessings—This life is the time for men to prepare to meet God—Work out your salvation with fear before God. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351948" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that after Alma had spoken these words unto them he sat down upon the ground, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amulek</span> arose and began to teach them, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351949" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>My brethren, I think that it is impossible that ye should be ignorant of the things which have been spoken concerning the coming of Christ, who is taught by us to be the Son of God; yea, I know that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these things</span> were taught unto you bountifully before your dissension from among us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351950" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And as ye have desired of my beloved brother that he should make known unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>what</span> ye should do, because of your afflictions; and he hath spoken somewhat unto you to prepare your minds; yea, and he hath exhorted you unto faith and to patience—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351951" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Yea, even that ye would have so much faith as even to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plant</span> the word in your hearts, that ye may try the experiment of its goodness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351952" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And we have beheld that the great question which is in your minds is whether the word be in the Son of God, or whether there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351953" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And ye also beheld that my brother has proved unto you, in many instances, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> is in Christ unto salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351954" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>My brother has called upon the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span>, that redemption cometh through the Son of God, and also upon the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zenock</span>; and also he has appealed unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Moses</span>, to prove that these things are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351955" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now, behold, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testify</span> unto you of myself that these things are true. Behold, I say unto you, that I do know that Christ shall come among the children of men, to take upon him the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>transgressions</span> of his people, and that he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>atone</span> for the sins of the world; for the Lord God hath spoken it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351956" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For it is expedient that an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>atonement</span> should be made; for according to the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan</span> of the Eternal God there must be an atonement made, or else all mankind must unavoidably perish; yea, all are hardened; yea, all are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fallen</span> and are lost, and must perish except it be through the atonement which it is expedient should be made.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351957" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For it is expedient that there should be a great and last <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifice</span>; yea, not a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sacrifice</span> of man, neither of beast, neither of any manner of fowl; for it shall not be a human sacrifice; but it must be an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>infinite</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>eternal</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sacrifice</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="294"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351958" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now there is not any man that can sacrifice his own blood which will atone for the sins of another. Now, if a man murdereth, behold will our law, which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>just</span>, take the life of his brother? I say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351959" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But the law requireth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>life</span> of him who hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murdered</span>; therefore there can be nothing which is short of an infinite atonement which will suffice for the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351960" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, it is expedient that there should be a great and last sacrifice, and then shall there be, or it is expedient there should be, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stop</span> to the shedding of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blood</span>; then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> of Moses be fulfilled; yea, it shall be all fulfilled, every jot and tittle, and none shall have passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351961" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold, this is the whole <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meaning</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span>, every whit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pointing</span> to that great and last <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sacrifice</span>; and that great and last <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sacrifice</span> will be the Son of God, yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>infinite</span> and eternal.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351962" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And thus he shall bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> to all those who shall believe on his name; this being the intent of this last sacrifice, to bring about the bowels of mercy, which overpowereth justice, and bringeth about means unto men that they may have faith unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351963" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And thus <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> can satisfy the demands of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span>, and encircles them in the arms of safety, while he that exercises no faith unto repentance is exposed to the whole law of the demands of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>justice</span>; therefore only unto him that has faith unto repentance is brought about the great and eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>plan</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>redemption</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351964" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore may God grant unto you, my brethren, that ye may begin to exercise your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> unto repentance, that ye begin to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> upon his holy name, that he would have mercy upon you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351965" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, cry unto him for mercy; for he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mighty</span> to save.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351966" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Yea, humble yourselves, and continue in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayer</span> unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351967" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Cry unto him when ye are in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fields</span>, yea, over all your flocks.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351968" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cry</span> unto him in your houses, yea, over all your household, both morning, mid-day, and evening.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351969" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, cry unto him against the power of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enemies</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351970" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> unto him against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span>, who is an enemy to all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteousness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351971" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Cry unto him over the crops of your fields, that ye may prosper in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351972" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Cry over the flocks of your fields, that they may increase.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351973" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But this is not all; ye must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pour out</span> your souls in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>closets</span>, and your secret places, and in your wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351974" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, and when you do not cry unto the Lord, let your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>full</span>, drawn out in prayer unto him continually for your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>welfare</span>, and also for the welfare of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>those</span> who are around you.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="295"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351975" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now behold, my beloved brethren, I say unto you, do not suppose that this is all; for after ye have done all these things, if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>turn away</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>needy</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>naked</span>, and visit not the sick and afflicted, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>impart</span> of your substance, if ye have, to those who stand in need—I say unto you, if ye do not any of these things, behold, your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>prayer</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>vain</span>, and availeth you nothing, and ye are as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>hypocrites</span> who do deny the faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351976" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore, if ye do not remember to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charitable</span>, ye are as dross, which the refiners do cast out, (it being of no worth) and is trodden under foot of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351977" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now, my brethren, I would that, after ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>received</span> so many witnesses, seeing that the holy scriptures testify of these things, ye come forth and bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fruit</span> unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351978" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Yea, I would that ye would come forth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harden</span> not your hearts any longer; for behold, now is the time and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>day</span> of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>salvation</span>; and therefore, if ye will repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>harden</span> not your hearts, immediately shall the great plan of redemption be brought about unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351979" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>For behold, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>life</span> is the time for men to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prepare</span> to meet God; yea, behold the day of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>this</span> life is the day for men to perform their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>labors</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351980" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And now, as I said unto you before, as ye have had so many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span>, therefore, I beseech of you that ye do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>procrastinate</span> the day of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repentance</span> until the end; for after this day of life, which is given us to prepare for eternity, behold, if we do not improve our time while in this life, then cometh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>night</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>darkness</span> wherein there can be no labor performed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351981" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Ye cannot say, when ye are brought to that awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>crisis</span>, that I will repent, that I will return to my God. Nay, ye cannot say this; for that same spirit which doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>possess</span> your bodies at the time that ye go out of this life, that same spirit will have power to possess your body in that eternal world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351982" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>For behold, if ye have procrastinated the day of your repentance even until death, behold, ye have become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>subjected</span> to the spirit of the devil, and he doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seal</span> you his; therefore, the Spirit of the Lord hath withdrawn from you, and hath no place in you, and the devil hath all power over you; and this is the final state of the wicked.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351983" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And this I know, because the Lord hath said he dwelleth not in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unholy</span> temples, but in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearts</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteous</span> doth he dwell; yea, and he has also said that the righteous shall sit down in his kingdom, to go no more out; but their garments should be made white through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>blood</span> of the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351984" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, I desire that ye should remember <span class="page-break" data-page="296"></span>these things, and that ye should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>work</span> out your salvation with fear before God, and that ye should no more deny the coming of Christ;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351985" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>That ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contend</span> no more against the Holy Ghost, but that ye receive it, and take upon you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span> of Christ; that ye humble yourselves even to the dust, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>worship</span> God, in whatsoever place ye may be in, in spirit and in truth; and that ye live in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>thanksgiving</span> daily, for the many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>mercies</span> and blessings which he doth bestow upon you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351986" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Yea, and I also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exhort</span> you, my brethren, that ye be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>watchful</span> unto prayer continually, that ye may not be led away by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>temptations</span> of the devil, that he may not overpower you, that ye may not become his subjects at the last day; for behold, he rewardeth you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no</span> good thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351987" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And now my beloved brethren, I would exhort you to have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>patience</span>, and that ye bear with all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span>; that ye do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>revile</span> against those who do cast you out because of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>exceeding</span> poverty, lest ye become sinners like unto them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351988" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>But that ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>patience</span>, and bear with those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span>, with a firm hope that ye shall one day rest from all your afflictions.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 35	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128351799" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/35" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 35</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128351800" id="title_number1">Chapter 35</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128351801" id="study_summary1">The preaching of the word destroys the craft of the Zoramites—They expel the converts, who then join the people of Ammon in Jershon—Alma sorrows because of the wickedness of the people. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351802" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that after Amulek had made an end of these words, they withdrew themselves from the multitude and came over into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jershon</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351803" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, and the rest of the brethren, after they had preached the word unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span>, also came over into the land of Jershon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351804" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that after the more popular part of the Zoramites had consulted together concerning the words which had been preached unto them, they were angry because of the word, for it did destroy their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>craft</span>; therefore they would not hearken unto the words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351805" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they sent and gathered together throughout all the land all the people, and consulted with them concerning the words which had been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351806" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now their rulers and their priests and their teachers did not let the people know concerning their desires; therefore they found out privily the minds of all the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351807" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that after they had found out the minds of all the people, those who were in favor of the words which had been spoken by Alma and his brethren were cast out of the land; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span>; and they came over also into the land of Jershon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351808" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that Alma and his brethren did minister unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351809" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the people of the Zoramites were angry with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Ammon who were in Jershon, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chief</span> ruler of the Zoramites, being a very wicked man, sent over unto the people of Ammon desiring them that they should cast out of their land all those who came over from them into their land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351810" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he breathed out many <span class="page-break" data-page="297"></span>threatenings against them. And now the people of Ammon did not fear their words; therefore they did not cast them out, but they did receive all the poor of the Zoramites that came over unto them; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nourish</span> them, and did clothe them, and did give unto them lands for their inheritance; and they did administer unto them according to their wants.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351811" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now this did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir up</span> the Zoramites to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>anger</span> against the people of Ammon, and they began to mix with the Lamanites and to stir them up also to anger against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351812" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thus the Zoramites and the Lamanites began to make preparations for war against the people of Ammon, and also against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351813" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And thus ended the seventeenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351814" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the people of Ammon departed out of the land of Jershon, and came over into the land of Melek, and gave place in the land of Jershon for the armies of the Nephites, that they might contend with the armies of the Lamanites and the armies of the Zoramites; and thus commenced a war betwixt the Lamanites and the Nephites, in the eighteenth year of the reign of the judges; and an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>account</span> shall be given of their wars hereafter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351815" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And Alma, and Ammon, and their brethren, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>two</span> sons of Alma returned to the land of Zarahemla, after having been instruments in the hands of God of bringing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>many</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zoramites</span> to repentance; and as many as were brought to repentance were driven out of their land; but they have lands for their inheritance in the land of Jershon, and they have taken up arms to defend themselves, and their wives, and children, and their lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351816" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now Alma, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grieved</span> for the iniquity of his people, yea for the wars, and the bloodsheds, and the contentions which were among them; and having been to declare the word, or sent to declare the word, among all the people in every city; and seeing that the hearts of the people began to wax hard, and that they began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>offended</span> because of the strictness of the word, his heart was exceedingly sorrowful.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128351817" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, he caused that his sons should be gathered together, that he might give unto them every one his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charge</span>, separately, concerning the things pertaining unto righteousness. And we have an account of his commandments, which he gave unto them according to his own record.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 36	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352090" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/36" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 36</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128352091" id="intro1">The commandments of Alma to his son Helaman.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128352092" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 36 and 37.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352093" id="title_number1">Chapter 36</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352094" id="study_summary1">Alma testifies to Helaman of his conversion after seeing an angel—He suffered the pains of a damned soul; he called upon the name of Jesus, and was then born of God—Sweet joy filled his soul—He saw concourses of angels praising God—Many converts have tasted and seen as he has tasted and seen. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352095" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>My <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>son</span>, give ear to my words; for I swear unto you, that inasmuch as ye shall keep the commandments of God ye shall prosper in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352096" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>I would that ye should do as I have done, in remembering the captivity of our fathers; for they were in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span>, and none could <span class="page-break" data-page="298"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> them except it was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>God</span> of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob; and he surely did deliver them in their afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352097" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, O my son Helaman, behold, thou art in thy youth, and therefore, I beseech of thee that thou wilt hear my words and learn of me; for I do know that whosoever shall put their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trust</span> in God shall be supported in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trials</span>, and their troubles, and their afflictions, and shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lifted up</span> at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352098" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I would not that ye think that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> of myself—not of the temporal but of the spiritual, not of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carnal</span> mind but of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352099" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now, behold, I say unto you, if I had not been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born of God</span> I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> have known these things; but God has, by the mouth of his holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>angel</span>, made these things known unto me, not of any <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>worthiness</span> of myself;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352100" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For I went about with the sons of Mosiah, seeking to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the church of God; but behold, God sent his holy angel to stop us by the way.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352101" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold, he spake unto us, as it were the voice of thunder, and the whole earth did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tremble</span> beneath our feet; and we all fell to the earth, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fear</span> of the Lord came upon us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352102" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But behold, the voice said unto me: Arise. And I arose and stood up, and beheld the angel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352103" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And he said unto me: If thou wilt of thyself be destroyed, seek no more to destroy the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352104" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that I fell to the earth; and it was for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> days and three nights that I could not open my mouth, neither had I the use of my limbs.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352105" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the angel spake more things unto me, which were heard by my brethren, but I did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not hear</span> them; for when I heard the words—If thou wilt be destroyed of thyself, seek no more to destroy the church of God—I was struck with such great fear and amazement lest perhaps I should be destroyed, that I fell to the earth and I did hear no more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352106" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But I was racked with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eternal</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>torment</span>, for my soul was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>harrowed up</span> to the greatest degree and racked with all my sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352107" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, I did remember all my sins and iniquities, for which I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tormented</span> with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pains</span> of hell; yea, I saw that I had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rebelled</span> against my God, and that I had not kept his holy commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352108" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, and I had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murdered</span> many of his children, or rather led them away unto destruction; yea, and in fine so great had been my iniquities, that the very thought of coming into the presence of my God did rack my soul with inexpressible horror.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352109" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Oh, thought I, that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>could</span> be banished and become extinct both soul and body, that I might not be brought to stand in the presence of my God, to be judged of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deeds</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352110" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, for three days and for three nights was I racked, even with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pains</span> of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>damned</span> soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352111" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that as I was thus <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>racked</span> with torment, while I <span class="page-break" data-page="299"></span>was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>harrowed up</span> by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>memory</span> of my many sins, behold, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>remembered</span> also to have heard my father prophesy unto the people concerning the coming of one Jesus Christ, a Son of God, to atone for the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352112" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now, as my mind caught hold upon this thought, I cried within my heart: O Jesus, thou Son of God, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>have</span> mercy on me, who am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>in</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gall of bitterness</span>, and am encircled about by the everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>chains</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352113" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now, behold, when I thought this, I could remember my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pains</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no more</span>; yea, I was harrowed up by the memory of my sins no more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352114" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And oh, what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span>, and what marvelous light I did behold; yea, my soul was filled with joy as exceeding as was my pain!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352115" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Yea, I say unto you, my son, that there could be nothing so exquisite and so bitter as were my pains. Yea, and again I say unto you, my son, that on the other hand, there can be nothing so exquisite and sweet as was my joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352116" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, methought I saw, even as our father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lehi</span> saw, God sitting upon his throne, surrounded with numberless concourses of angels, in the attitude of singing and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praising</span> their God; yea, and my soul did long to be there.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352117" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But behold, my limbs did receive their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span> again, and I stood upon my feet, and did manifest unto the people that I had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born of God</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352118" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Yea, and from that time even until now, I have labored without ceasing, that I might bring souls unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repentance</span>; that I might bring them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>taste</span> of the exceeding joy of which I did taste; that they might also be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>born of God</span>, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>filled</span> with the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352119" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Yea, and now behold, O my son, the Lord doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>give</span> me exceedingly great joy in the fruit of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>labors</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352120" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>For because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> which he has imparted unto me, behold, many have been born of God, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tasted</span> as I have tasted, and have seen eye to eye as I have seen; therefore they do know of these things of which I have spoken, as I do know; and the knowledge which I have is of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352121" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And I have been supported under trials and troubles of every kind, yea, and in all manner of afflictions; yea, God has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> me from prison, and from bonds, and from death; yea, and I do put my trust in him, and he will still <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352122" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And I know that he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>raise</span> me up at the last day, to dwell with him in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>; yea, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>praise</span> him forever, for he has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>brought</span> our fathers out of Egypt, and he has swallowed up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Egyptians</span> in the Red Sea; and he led them by his power into the promised land; yea, and he has delivered them out of <span class="page-break" data-page="300"></span>bondage and captivity from time to time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352123" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, and he has also brought our fathers out of the land of Jerusalem; and he has also, by his everlasting power, delivered them out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bondage</span> and captivity, from time to time even down to the present day; and I have always retained in remembrance their captivity; yea, and ye also ought to retain in remembrance, as I have done, their captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352124" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>But behold, my son, this is not all; for ye ought to know as I do know, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inasmuch</span> as ye shall keep the commandments of God ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prosper</span> in the land; and ye ought to know also, that inasmuch as ye will not keep the commandments of God ye shall be cut off from his presence. Now this is according to his word.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 37	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352835" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/37" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 37</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352845" id="title_number1">Chapter 37</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352848" id="study_summary1">The plates of brass and other scriptures are preserved to bring souls to salvation—The Jaredites were destroyed because of their wickedness—Their secret oaths and covenants must be kept from the people—Counsel with the Lord in all your doings—As the Liahona guided the Nephites, so the word of Christ leads men to eternal life. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352849" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my son Helaman, I command you that ye take the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> which have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>entrusted</span> with me;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352850" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I also command you that ye keep a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of this people, according as I have done, upon the plates of Nephi, and keep all these things sacred which I have kept, even as I have kept them; for it is for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wise</span> purpose that they are kept.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352851" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of brass</span>, which contain these engravings, which have the records of the holy scriptures upon them, which have the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>genealogy</span> of our forefathers, even from the beginning—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352852" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, it has been prophesied by our fathers, that they should be kept and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>handed</span> down from one generation to another, and be kept and preserved by the hand of the Lord until they should go forth unto every nation, kindred, tongue, and people, that they shall know of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mysteries</span> contained thereon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352853" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now behold, if they are kept they must retain their brightness; yea, and they will retain their brightness; yea, and also shall all the plates which do contain that which is holy writ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352854" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now ye may suppose that this is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>foolishness</span> in me; but behold I say unto you, that by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>small</span> and simple things are great things brought to pass; and small means in many instances doth confound the wise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352855" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord God doth work by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>means</span> to bring about his great and eternal purposes; and by very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>small</span> means the Lord doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>confound</span> the wise and bringeth about the salvation of many souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352856" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now, it has hitherto been wisdom in God that these things should be preserved; for behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>enlarged</span> the memory of this people, yea, and convinced many of the error of their ways, and brought them to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> of <span class="page-break" data-page="301"></span>their God unto the salvation of their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352857" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, I say unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>were</span> it not for these things that these records do contain, which are on these plates, Ammon and his brethren could not have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>convinced</span> so many thousands of the Lamanites of the incorrect tradition of their fathers; yea, these records and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>words</span> brought them unto repentance; that is, they brought them to the knowledge of the Lord their God, and to rejoice in Jesus Christ their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352858" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And who knoweth but what they will be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>means</span> of bringing many thousands of them, yea, and also many thousands of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stiffnecked</span> brethren, the Nephites, who are now hardening their hearts in sin and iniquities, to the knowledge of their Redeemer?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352859" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now these mysteries are not yet fully made known unto me; therefore I shall forbear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352860" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it may suffice if I only say they are preserved for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span> purpose, which purpose is known unto God; for he doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>counsel</span> in wisdom over all his works, and his paths are straight, and his course is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>one</span> eternal round.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352861" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O remember, remember, my son Helaman, how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strict</span> are the commandments of God. And he said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>If</span> ye will keep my commandments ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prosper</span> in the land—but if ye keep not his commandments ye shall be cut off from his presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352862" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now remember, my son, that God has <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>entrusted</span> you with these things, which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sacred</span>, which he has kept sacred, and also which he will keep and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>preserve</span> for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>wise</span> purpose in him, that he may show forth his power unto future generations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352863" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now behold, I tell you by the spirit of prophecy, that if ye transgress the commandments of God, behold, these things which are sacred shall be taken away from you by the power of God, and ye shall be delivered up unto Satan, that he may sift you as chaff before the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352864" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But if ye keep the commandments of God, and do with these things which are sacred according to that which the Lord doth command you, (for you must appeal unto the Lord for all things whatsoever ye must do with them) behold, no power of earth or hell can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>take</span> them from you, for God is powerful to the fulfilling of all his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352865" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For he will fulfil all his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promises</span> which he shall make unto you, for he has fulfilled his promises which he has made unto our fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352866" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For he promised unto them that he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preserve</span> these things for a wise purpose in him, that he might show forth his power unto future generations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352867" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now behold, one purpose hath he fulfilled, even to the restoration of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> thousands of the Lamanites to the knowledge of the truth; and he hath shown forth his power in them, and he will also still show forth his power in them unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>future</span> generations; therefore they shall be preserved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352868" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20
