</span>Therefore I command you, my son Helaman, that ye be diligent in fulfilling all my words, and that ye be diligent in keeping the commandments of God as they are written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352869" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now, I will speak unto <span class="page-break" data-page="302"></span>you concerning those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twenty-four</span> plates, that ye keep them, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mysteries</span> and the works of darkness, and their secret works, or the secret works of those people who have been destroyed, may be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>manifest</span> unto this people; yea, all their murders, and robbings, and their plunderings, and all their wickedness and abominations, may be made manifest unto this people; yea, and that ye preserve these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>interpreters</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352870" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, the Lord saw that his people began to work in darkness, yea, work secret murders and abominations; therefore the Lord said, if they did not repent they should be destroyed from off the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352871" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the Lord said: I will prepare unto my servant Gazelem, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stone</span>, which shall shine forth in darkness unto light, that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>discover</span> unto my people who serve me, that I may discover unto them the works of their brethren, yea, their secret works, their works of darkness, and their wickedness and abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352872" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, my son, these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>interpreters</span> were prepared that the word of God might be fulfilled, which he spake, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352873" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bring forth</span> out of darkness unto light all their secret works and their abominations; and except they repent I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> them from off the face of the earth; and I will bring to light all their secrets and abominations, unto every nation that shall hereafter possess the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352874" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now, my son, we see that they did not repent; therefore they have been destroyed, and thus far the word of God has been fulfilled; yea, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret abominations</span> have been brought out of darkness and made known unto us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352875" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now, my son, I command you that ye retain all their oaths, and their covenants, and their agreements in their secret abominations; yea, and all their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>signs</span> and their wonders ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>keep</span> from this people, that they know them not, lest peradventure they should fall into darkness also and be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352876" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>For behold, there is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> upon all this land, that destruction shall come upon all those workers of darkness, according to the power of God, when they are fully ripe; therefore I desire that this people might not be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352877" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore ye shall keep these secret plans of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oaths</span> and their covenants from this people, and only their wickedness and their murders and their abominations shall ye make known unto them; and ye shall teach them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>abhor</span> such wickedness and abominations and murders; and ye shall also teach them that these people were destroyed on account of their wickedness and abominations and their murders.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352878" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For behold, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murdered</span> all the prophets of the Lord who came among them to declare unto them concerning their iniquities; and the blood of those whom they murdered did cry unto the Lord their God for vengeance upon those who were their murderers; and thus the judgments of God did come upon these workers of darkness and secret <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>combinations</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352879" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Yea, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> be the land forever and ever unto those workers of <span class="page-break" data-page="303"></span>darkness and secret combinations, even unto destruction, except they repent before they are fully <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ripe</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352880" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now, my son, remember the words which I have spoken unto you; trust not those secret plans unto this people, but teach them an everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hatred</span> against sin and iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352881" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Preach</span> unto them repentance, and faith on the Lord Jesus Christ; teach them to humble themselves and to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>meek</span> and lowly in heart; teach them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>withstand</span> every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>temptation</span> of the devil, with their faith on the Lord Jesus Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352882" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Teach them to never be weary of good works, but to be meek and lowly in heart; for such shall find <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span> to their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352883" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>O, remember, my son, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>learn</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wisdom</span> in thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>youth</span>; yea, learn in thy youth to keep the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352884" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Yea, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> unto God for all thy support; yea, let all thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>doings</span> be unto the Lord, and whithersoever thou goest let it be in the Lord; yea, let all thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thoughts</span> be directed unto the Lord; yea, let the affections of thy heart be placed upon the Lord forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352885" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Counsel</span> with the Lord in all thy doings, and he will direct thee for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>good</span>; yea, when thou liest down at night lie down unto the Lord, that he may watch over you in your sleep; and when thou risest in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>morning</span> let thy heart be full of thanks unto God; and if ye do these things, ye shall be lifted up at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352886" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And now, my son, I have somewhat to say concerning the thing which our fathers call a ball, or director—or our fathers called it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Liahona</span>, which is, being interpreted, a compass; and the Lord prepared it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352887" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And behold, there cannot any man work after the manner of so curious a workmanship. And behold, it was prepared to show unto our fathers the course which they should travel in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352888" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And it did work for them according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> in God; therefore, if they had faith to believe that God could cause that those spindles should point the way they should go, behold, it was done; therefore they had this miracle, and also many other miracles wrought by the power of God, day by day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352889" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Nevertheless, because those miracles were worked by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>small</span> means it did show unto them marvelous works. They were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slothful</span>, and forgot to exercise their faith and diligence and then those marvelous works ceased, and they did not progress in their journey;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352890" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>Therefore, they tarried in the wilderness, or did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> travel a direct course, and were afflicted with hunger and thirst, because of their transgressions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352891" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And now, my son, I would that ye should understand that these things are not without a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shadow</span>; for as our fathers were slothful to give heed to this compass (now these things were temporal) they <span class="page-break" data-page="304"></span>did not prosper; even so it is with things which are spiritual.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352892" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>For behold, it is as easy to give heed to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of Christ, which will point to you a straight course to eternal bliss, as it was for our fathers to give heed to this compass, which would point unto them a straight course to the promised land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352893" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And now I say, is there not a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>type</span> in this thing? For just as surely as this director did bring our fathers, by following its course, to the promised land, shall the words of Christ, if we follow their course, carry us beyond this vale of sorrow into a far better land of promise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352894" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>O my son, do not let us be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slothful</span> because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>easiness</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>way</span>; for so was it with our fathers; for so was it prepared for them, that if they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>look</span> they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>live</span>; even so it is with us. The way is prepared, and if we will look we may live forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352895" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>And now, my son, see that ye take <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>care</span> of these sacred things, yea, see that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>look</span> to God and live. Go unto this people and declare the word, and be sober. My son, farewell.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 38	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352834" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/38" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 38</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128352836" id="intro1">The commandments of Alma to his son Shiblon.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128352837" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapter 38.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352838" id="title_number1">Chapter 38</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352839" id="study_summary1">Shiblon was persecuted for righteousness’ sake—Salvation is in Christ, who is the life and the light of the world—Bridle all your passions. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352840" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>My <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>son</span>, give ear to my words, for I say unto you, even as I said unto Helaman, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>inasmuch</span> as ye shall keep the commandments of God ye shall prosper in the land; and inasmuch as ye will not keep the commandments of God ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cut off</span> from his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>presence</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352841" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now, my son, I trust that I shall have great joy in you, because of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steadiness</span> and your faithfulness unto God; for as you have commenced in your youth to look to the Lord your God, even so I hope that you will continue in keeping his commandments; for blessed is he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>endureth</span> to the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352842" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>I say unto you, my son, that I have had great joy in thee already, because of thy faithfulness and thy diligence, and thy patience and thy long-suffering among the people of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352843" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For I know that thou wast in bonds; yea, and I also know that thou wast stoned for the word’s sake; and thou didst bear all these things with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>patience</span> because the Lord was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>with thee</span>; and now thou knowest that the Lord did deliver thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352844" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now my son, Shiblon, I would that ye should remember, that as much as ye shall put your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trust</span> in God even so much ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delivered</span> out of your trials, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>troubles</span>, and your afflictions, and ye shall be lifted up at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352846" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, my son, I would not that ye should think that I know these <span class="page-break" data-page="305"></span>things of myself, but it is the Spirit of God which is in me which maketh these things known unto me; for if I had not been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born of God</span> I should not have known these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352847" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But behold, the Lord in his great mercy sent his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> to declare unto me that I must stop the work of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> among his people; yea, and I have seen an angel face to face, and he spake with me, and his voice was as thunder, and it shook the whole earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352188" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> days and three nights in the most bitter <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pain</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>anguish</span> of soul; and never, until I did cry out unto the Lord Jesus Christ for mercy, did I receive a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>remission</span> of my sins. But behold, I did cry unto him and I did find peace to my soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352189" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now, my son, I have told you this that ye may learn wisdom, that ye may learn of me that there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> other way or means whereby man can be saved, only in and through Christ. Behold, he is the life and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> of the world. Behold, he is the word of truth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteousness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352190" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, as ye have begun to teach the word even so I would that ye should continue to teach; and I would that ye would be diligent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temperate</span> in all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352191" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>See that ye are not lifted up unto pride; yea, see that ye do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span> in your own wisdom, nor of your much strength.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352192" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Use <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boldness</span>, but not overbearance; and also see that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bridle</span> all your passions, that ye may be filled with love; see that ye refrain from idleness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352193" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> as the Zoramites do, for ye have seen that they pray to be heard of men, and to be praised for their wisdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352194" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Do not say: O God, I thank thee that we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> than our brethren; but rather say: O Lord, forgive my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unworthiness</span>, and remember my brethren in mercy—yea, acknowledge your unworthiness before God at all times.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352195" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And may the Lord bless your soul, and receive you at the last day into his kingdom, to sit down in peace. Now go, my son, and teach the word unto this people. Be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sober</span>. My son, farewell.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 39	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352226" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/39" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 39</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128352227" id="intro1">The commandments of Alma to his son Corianton.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128352228" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 39 through 42.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352229" id="title_number1">Chapter 39</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352230" id="study_summary1">Sexual sin is an abomination—Corianton’s sins kept the Zoramites from receiving the word—Christ’s redemption is retroactive in saving the faithful who preceded it. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352231" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>son</span>, I have somewhat more to say unto thee than what I said unto thy brother; for behold, have ye not observed the steadiness of thy brother, his faithfulness, and his diligence in keeping the commandments of God? Behold, has he not set a good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>example</span> for thee?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352232" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For thou didst not give so much heed unto my words as did thy brother, among the people of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span>. Now this is what I have against thee; thou didst go on unto <span class="page-break" data-page="306"></span>boasting in thy strength and thy wisdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352233" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And this is not all, my son. Thou didst do that which was grievous unto me; for thou didst forsake the ministry, and did go over into the land of Siron among the borders of the Lamanites, after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harlot</span> Isabel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352234" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Yea, she did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steal</span> away the hearts of many; but this was no excuse for thee, my son. Thou shouldst have tended to the ministry wherewith thou wast entrusted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352235" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Know ye not, my son, that these things are an abomination in the sight of the Lord; yea, most <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abominable</span> above all sins save it be the shedding of innocent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blood</span> or denying the Holy Ghost?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352236" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For behold, if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> the Holy Ghost when it once has had place in you, and ye know that ye deny it, behold, this is a sin which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unpardonable</span>; yea, and whosoever murdereth against the light and knowledge of God, it is not easy for him to obtain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>forgiveness</span>; yea, I say unto you, my son, that it is not easy for him to obtain a forgiveness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352237" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, my son, I would to God that ye had not been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>guilty</span> of so great a crime. I would not dwell upon your crimes, to harrow up your soul, if it were not for your good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352238" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But behold, ye cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> your crimes from God; and except ye repent they will stand as a testimony against you at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352239" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now my son, I would that ye should repent and forsake your sins, and go no more after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lusts</span> of your eyes, but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cross</span> yourself in all these things; for except ye do this ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of God. Oh, remember, and take it upon you, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cross</span> yourself in these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352240" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And I command you to take it upon you to counsel with your elder brothers in your undertakings; for behold, thou art in thy youth, and ye stand in need to be nourished by your brothers. And give heed to their counsel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352241" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Suffer not yourself to be led away by any vain or foolish thing; suffer not the devil to lead away your heart again after those wicked harlots. Behold, O my son, how great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>iniquity</span> ye brought upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zoramites</span>; for when they saw your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>conduct</span> they would not believe in my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352242" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now the Spirit of the Lord doth say unto me: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Command</span> thy children to do good, lest they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lead</span> away the hearts of many people to destruction; therefore I command you, my son, in the fear of God, that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>refrain</span> from your iniquities;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352243" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>That ye turn to the Lord with all your mind, might, and strength; that ye lead away the hearts of no more to do wickedly; but rather return unto them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>acknowledge</span> your faults and that wrong which ye have done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352244" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Seek not</span> after riches nor the vain things of this world; for behold, you cannot carry them with you.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="307"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352245" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now, my son, I would say somewhat unto you concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>coming</span> of Christ. Behold, I say unto you, that it is he that surely shall come to take away the sins of the world; yea, he cometh to declare glad tidings of salvation unto his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352246" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, my son, this was the ministry unto which ye were called, to declare these glad tidings unto this people, to prepare their minds; or rather that salvation might come unto them, that they may prepare the minds of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> to hear the word at the time of his coming.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352247" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now I will ease your mind somewhat on this subject. Behold, you marvel why these things should be known so long beforehand. Behold, I say unto you, is not a soul at this time as precious unto God as a soul will be at the time of his coming?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352248" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Is it not as necessary that the plan of redemption should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>made</span> known unto this people as well as unto their children?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352249" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Is it not as easy at this time for the Lord to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>send</span> his angel to declare these glad tidings unto us as unto our children, or as after the time of his coming?</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 40	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352277" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/40" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 40</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352278" id="title_number1">Chapter 40</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352279" id="study_summary1">Christ brings to pass the resurrection of all men—The righteous dead go to paradise and the wicked to outer darkness to await the day of their resurrection—All things will be restored to their proper and perfect frame in the Resurrection. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352280" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now my son, here is somewhat more I would say unto thee; for I perceive that thy mind is worried concerning the resurrection of the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352281" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, I say unto you, that there is no resurrection—or, I would say, in other words, that this mortal does not put on <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>immortality</span>, this corruption does not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>put</span> on incorruption—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>until</span> after the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352282" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, he bringeth to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead. But behold, my son, the resurrection is not yet. Now, I unfold unto you a mystery; nevertheless, there are many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mysteries</span> which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>kept</span>, that no one knoweth them save God himself. But I show unto you one thing which I have inquired diligently of God that I might know—that is concerning the resurrection.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352283" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, there is a time appointed that all shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> forth from the dead. Now when this time cometh no one knows; but God knoweth the time which is appointed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352284" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now, whether there shall be one time, or a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>second</span> time, or a third time, that men shall come forth from the dead, it mattereth not; for God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knoweth</span> all these things; and it sufficeth me to know that this is the case—that there is a time appointed that all shall rise from the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352285" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now there must needs be a space betwixt the time of death and the time of the resurrection.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352286" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now I would inquire what becometh of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>souls</span> of men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> this time of death to the time appointed for the resurrection?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352287" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now whether there is more than one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> appointed for men to rise it mattereth not; for all do not die at once, and this mattereth not; all is <span class="page-break" data-page="308"></span>as one day with God, and time only is measured unto men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352288" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Therefore, there is a time appointed unto men that they shall rise from the dead; and there is a space between the time of death and the resurrection. And now, concerning this space of time, what becometh of the souls of men is the thing which I have inquired diligently of the Lord to know; and this is the thing of which I do know.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352289" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And when the time cometh when all shall rise, then shall they know that God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>times</span> which are appointed unto man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352290" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now, concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>state</span> of the soul between <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> and the resurrection—Behold, it has been made known unto me by an angel, that the spirits of all men, as soon as they are departed from this mortal body, yea, the spirits of all men, whether they be good or evil, are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>taken</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>home</span> to that God who gave them life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352291" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And then shall it come to pass, that the spirits of those who are righteous are received into a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>happiness</span>, which is called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>paradise</span>, a state of rest, a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>peace</span>, where they shall rest from all their troubles and from all care, and sorrow.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352292" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And then shall it come to pass, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spirits</span> of the wicked, yea, who are evil—for behold, they have no part nor portion of the Spirit of the Lord; for behold, they chose evil works rather than good; therefore the spirit of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span> did enter into them, and take possession of their house—and these shall be cast out into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>outer darkness</span>; there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>weeping</span>, and wailing, and gnashing of teeth, and this because of their own iniquity, being led captive by the will of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352293" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now this is the state of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>souls</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wicked</span>, yea, in darkness, and a state of awful, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fearful</span> looking for the fiery <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>indignation</span> of the wrath of God upon them; thus they remain in this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>state</span>, as well as the righteous in paradise, until the time of their resurrection.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352294" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now, there are some that have understood that this state of happiness and this state of misery of the soul, before the resurrection, was a first resurrection. Yea, I admit it may be termed a resurrection, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>raising</span> of the spirit or the soul and their consignation to happiness or misery, according to the words which have been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352295" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And behold, again it hath been spoken, that there is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>resurrection</span>, a resurrection of all those who have been, or who are, or who shall be, down to the resurrection of Christ from the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352296" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now, we do not suppose that this first resurrection, which is spoken of in this manner, can be the resurrection of the souls and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consignation</span> to happiness or misery. Ye cannot suppose that this is what it meaneth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352297" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, I say unto you, Nay; but it meaneth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reuniting</span> of the <span class="page-break" data-page="309"></span>soul with the body, of those from the days of Adam down to the resurrection of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352298" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now, whether the souls and the bodies of those of whom has been spoken shall all be reunited at once, the wicked as well as the righteous, I do not say; let it suffice, that I say that they all come forth; or in other words, their resurrection cometh to pass <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>before</span> the resurrection of those who die after the resurrection of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352299" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now, my son, I do not say that their resurrection cometh at the resurrection of Christ; but behold, I give it as my opinion, that the souls and the bodies are reunited, of the righteous, at the resurrection of Christ, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ascension</span> into heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352300" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But whether it be at his resurrection or after, I do not say; but this much I say, that there is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>space</span> between death and the resurrection of the body, and a state of the soul in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>happiness</span> or in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>misery</span> until the time which is appointed of God that the dead shall come forth, and be reunited, both soul and body, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>brought</span> to stand before God, and be judged according to their works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352301" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, this bringeth about the restoration of those things of which has been spoken by the mouths of the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352302" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>soul</span> shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restored</span> to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>body</span>, and the body to the soul; yea, and every limb and joint shall be restored to its body; yea, even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hair</span> of the head shall not be lost; but all things shall be restored to their proper and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>perfect</span> frame.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352303" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, my son, this is the restoration of which has been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spoken</span> by the mouths of the prophets—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352304" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteous</span> shine forth in the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352305" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But behold, an awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span> cometh upon the wicked; for they die as to things pertaining to things of righteousness; for they are unclean, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no unclean thing</span> can inherit the kingdom of God; but they are cast out, and consigned to partake of the fruits of their labors or their works, which have been evil; and they drink the dregs of a bitter <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cup</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 41	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128353052" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/41" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 41</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128353053" id="title_number1">Chapter 41</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128353054" id="study_summary1">In the Resurrection men come forth to a state of endless happiness or endless misery—Wickedness never was happiness—Carnal men are without God in the world—Every person receives again in the Restoration the characteristics and attributes acquired in mortality. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353055" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my son, I have somewhat to say concerning the restoration of which has been spoken; for behold, some have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrested</span> the scriptures, and have gone far <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>astray</span> because of this thing. And I perceive that thy mind has been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>worried</span> also concerning this thing. But behold, I will explain it unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353056" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>I say unto thee, my son, that the plan of restoration is requisite with the justice of God; for it is requisite that all things should be restored to their proper order. Behold, it is requisite and just, according to the power and resurrection of Christ, <span class="page-break" data-page="310"></span>that the soul of man should be restored to its body, and that every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>part</span> of the body should be restored to itself.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353057" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it is requisite with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> of God that men should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judged</span> according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>works</span>; and if their works were good in this life, and the desires of their hearts were good, that they should also, at the last day, be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>restored</span> unto that which is good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353058" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And if their works are evil they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>restored</span> unto them for evil. Therefore, all things shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restored</span> to their proper order, every thing to its natural frame—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mortality</span> raised to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>immortality</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>corruption</span> to incorruption—raised to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>endless</span> happiness to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>inherit</span> the kingdom of God, or to endless misery to inherit the kingdom of the devil, the one on one hand, the other on the other—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353059" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>The one raised to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>happiness</span> according to his desires of happiness, or good according to his desires of good; and the other to evil according to his desires of evil; for as he has desired to do evil all the day long even so shall he have his reward of evil when the night cometh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353060" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And so it is on the other hand. If he hath repented of his sins, and desired righteousness until the end of his days, even so he shall be rewarded unto righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353061" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>These</span> are they that are redeemed of the Lord; yea, these are they that are taken out, that are delivered from that endless night of darkness; and thus they stand or fall; for behold, they are their own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span>, whether to do good or do evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353062" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now, the decrees of God are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unalterable</span>; therefore, the way is prepared that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whosoever</span> will may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>walk</span> therein and be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353063" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now behold, my son, do not risk <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> more offense against your God upon those points of doctrine, which ye have hitherto risked to commit sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353064" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Do not suppose, because it has been spoken concerning restoration, that ye shall be restored from sin to happiness. Behold, I say unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> never was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>happiness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353065" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now, my son, all men that are in a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nature</span>, or I would say, in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>carnal</span> state, are in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gall of bitterness</span> and in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>bonds</span> of iniquity; they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>without</span> God in the world, and they have gone <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>contrary</span> to the nature of God; therefore, they are in a state contrary to the nature of happiness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353066" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now behold, is the meaning of the word restoration to take a thing of a natural state and place it in an unnatural state, or to place it in a state opposite to its nature?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353067" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O, my son, this is not the case; but the meaning of the word restoration is to bring back again <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span> for evil, or carnal for carnal, or devilish for devilish—good for that which is good; righteous for that which is righteous; just for that which is just; merciful for that which is merciful.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="311"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353068" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore, my son, see that you are merciful unto your brethren; deal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justly</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span> righteously, and do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>good</span> continually; and if ye do all these things then shall ye receive your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>reward</span>; yea, ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>mercy</span> restored unto you again; ye shall have justice restored unto you again; ye shall have a righteous judgment restored unto you again; and ye shall have good rewarded unto you again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353069" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For that which ye do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>send</span> out shall return unto you again, and be restored; therefore, the word restoration more fully condemneth the sinner, and justifieth him not at all.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 42	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352357" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/42" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 42</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352358" id="title_number1">Chapter 42</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352359" id="study_summary1">Mortality is a probationary time to enable man to repent and serve God—The Fall brought temporal and spiritual death upon all mankind—Redemption comes through repentance—God Himself atones for the sins of the world—Mercy is for those who repent—All others are subject to God’s justice—Mercy comes because of the Atonement—Only the truly penitent are saved. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352360" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my son, I perceive there is somewhat more which doth worry your mind, which ye cannot understand—which is concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> of God in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>punishment</span> of the sinner; for ye do try to suppose that it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>injustice</span> that the sinner should be consigned to a state of misery.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352361" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now behold, my son, I will explain this thing unto thee. For behold, after the Lord God sent our first parents forth from the garden of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Eden</span>, to till the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ground</span>, from whence they were taken—yea, he drew out the man, and he placed at the east end of the garden of Eden, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cherubim</span>, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the tree of life—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352362" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now, we see that the man had become as God, knowing good and evil; and lest he should put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat and live forever, the Lord God placed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cherubim</span> and the flaming sword, that he should not partake of the fruit—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352363" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus we see, that there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> granted unto man to repent, yea, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>probationary time</span>, a time to repent and serve God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352364" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, if Adam had put forth his hand immediately, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>partaken</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tree of life</span>, he would have lived forever, according to the word of God, having no space for repentance; yea, and also the word of God would have been void, and the great plan of salvation would have been frustrated.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352365" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But behold, it was appointed unto man to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>die</span>—therefore, as they were cut off from the tree of life they should be cut off from the face of the earth—and man became <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lost</span> forever, yea, they became <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fallen</span> man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352366" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, ye see by this that our first parents were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cut off</span> both temporally and spiritually from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>presence</span> of the Lord; and thus we see they became subjects to follow after their own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>will</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352367" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now behold, it was not expedient <span class="page-break" data-page="312"></span>that man should be reclaimed from this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>temporal</span> death, for that would destroy the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan</span> of happiness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352368" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Therefore, as the soul could never die, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fall</span> had brought upon all mankind a spiritual <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> as well as a temporal, that is, they were cut off from the presence of the Lord, it was expedient that mankind should be reclaimed from this spiritual death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352369" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Therefore, as they had become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carnal</span>, sensual, and devilish, by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>nature</span>, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>probationary state</span> became a state for them to prepare; it became a preparatory state.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352370" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now remember, my son, if it were not for the plan of redemption, (laying it aside) as soon as they were dead their souls were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miserable</span>, being cut off from the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352371" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, there was no means to reclaim men from this fallen state, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>man</span> had brought upon himself because of his own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>disobedience</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352372" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, according to justice, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plan</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redemption</span> could not be brought about, only on conditions of repentance of men in this probationary state, yea, this preparatory state; for except it were for these conditions, mercy could not take effect except it should destroy the work of justice. Now the work of justice could not be destroyed; if so, God would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cease</span> to be God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352373" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And thus we see that all mankind were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fallen</span>, and they were in the grasp of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span>; yea, the justice of God, which consigned them forever to be cut off from his presence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352374" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now, the plan of mercy could not be brought about except an atonement should be made; therefore God himself <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>atoneth</span> for the sins of the world, to bring about the plan of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span>, to appease the demands of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>justice</span>, that God might be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>perfect</span>, just God, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>merciful</span> God also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352375" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now, repentance could not come unto men except there were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>punishment</span>, which also was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eternal</span> as the life of the soul should be, affixed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>opposite</span> to the plan of happiness, which was as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>eternal</span> also as the life of the soul.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352376" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now, how could a man repent except he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sin</span>? How could he sin if there was no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span>? How could there be a law save there was a punishment?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352377" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now, there was a punishment affixed, and a just law given, which brought remorse of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conscience</span> unto man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352378" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now, if there was no law given—if a man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>murdered</span> he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>die</span>—would he be afraid he would die if he should murder?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352379" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And also, if there was no law given against sin men would not be afraid to sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352380" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And if there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no law</span> given, if men sinned what could justice do, or mercy either, for they would have no claim upon the creature?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352381" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But there is a law given, and a <span class="page-break" data-page="313"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>punishment</span> affixed, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repentance</span> granted; which repentance, mercy claimeth; otherwise, justice claimeth the creature and executeth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span>, and the law inflicteth the punishment; if not so, the works of justice would be destroyed, and God would cease to be God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352382" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But God ceaseth not to be God, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> claimeth the penitent, and mercy cometh because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atonement</span>; and the atonement bringeth to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead bringeth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>back</span> men into the presence of God; and thus they are restored into his presence, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>judged</span> according to their works, according to the law and justice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352383" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, justice exerciseth all his demands, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> claimeth all which is her own; and thus, none but the truly penitent are saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352384" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>What, do ye suppose that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> can rob <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span>? I say unto you, Nay; not one whit. If so, God would cease to be God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352385" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And thus God bringeth about his great and eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purposes</span>, which were prepared <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> the foundation of the world. And thus cometh about the salvation and the redemption of men, and also their destruction and misery.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352386" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Therefore, O my son, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whosoever</span> will come may come and partake of the waters of life freely; and whosoever will not come the same is not compelled to come; but in the last day it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restored</span> unto him according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deeds</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352387" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>If he has desired to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span>, and has not repented in his days, behold, evil shall be done unto him, according to the restoration of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352388" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now, my son, I desire that ye should let these things <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>trouble</span> you no more, and only let your sins trouble you, with that trouble which shall bring you down unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352389" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>O my son, I desire that ye should deny the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> of God no more. Do not endeavor to excuse yourself in the least point because of your sins, by denying the justice of God; but do you let the justice of God, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span>, and his long-suffering have full sway in your heart; and let it bring you down to the dust in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>humility</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352390" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And now, O my son, ye are called of God to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> the word unto this people. And now, my son, go thy way, declare the word with truth and soberness, that thou mayest <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bring</span> souls unto repentance, that the great plan of mercy may have claim upon them. And may God grant unto you even according to my words. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 43	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352462" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/43" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 43</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352463" id="title_number1">Chapter 43</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352464" id="study_summary1">Alma and his sons preach the word—The Zoramites and other Nephite dissenters become Lamanites—The Lamanites come against the Nephites in war—Moroni arms the Nephites with defensive armor—The Lord <span class="page-break" data-page="314"></span>reveals to Alma the strategy of the Lamanites—The Nephites defend their homes, liberties, families, and religion—The armies of Moroni and Lehi surround the Lamanites. About 74 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352465" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that the sons of Alma did go forth among the people, to declare the word unto them. And Alma, also, himself, could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rest</span>, and he also went forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352466" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Now <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>we</span> shall say no more concerning their preaching, except that they preached the word, and the truth, according to the spirit of prophecy and revelation; and they preached after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>holy order</span> of God by which they were called.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352467" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> return to an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>account</span> of the wars between the Nephites and the Lamanites, in the eighteenth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352468" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span> became Lamanites; therefore, in the commencement of the eighteenth year the people of the Nephites saw that the Lamanites were coming upon them; therefore they made preparations for war; yea, they gathered together their armies in the land of Jershon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352469" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites came with their thousands; and they came into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Antionum</span>, which is the land of the Zoramites; and a man by the name of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zerahemnah</span> was their leader.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352470" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amalekites</span> were of a more wicked and murderous disposition than the Lamanites were, in and of themselves, therefore, Zerahemnah appointed chief <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>captains</span> over the Lamanites, and they were all Amalekites and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zoramites</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352471" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Now this he did that he might preserve their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hatred</span> towards the Nephites, that he might bring them into subjection to the accomplishment of his designs.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352472" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For behold, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>designs</span> were to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stir up</span> the Lamanites to anger against the Nephites; this he did that he might usurp great power over them, and also that he might gain power over the Nephites by bringing them into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bondage</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352473" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now the design of the Nephites was to support their lands, and their houses, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wives</span>, and their children, that they might preserve them from the hands of their enemies; and also that they might preserve their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rights</span> and their privileges, yea, and also their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liberty</span>, that they might worship God according to their desires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352474" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For they knew that if they should fall into the hands of the Lamanites, that whosoever should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> God in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spirit</span> and in truth, the true and the living God, the Lamanites would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352475" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, and they also knew the extreme hatred of the Lamanites towards their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brethren</span>, who were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>people</span> of Anti-Nephi-Lehi, who were called the people of Ammon—and they would not take up arms, yea, they had entered into a covenant and they would not break it—therefore, if they should fall into the hands of the Lamanites they would be destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352476" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And the Nephites would not suffer that they should be destroyed; therefore they gave them lands for their inheritance.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="315"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352477" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the people of Ammon did give unto the Nephites a large portion of their substance to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>support</span> their armies; and thus the Nephites were compelled, alone, to withstand against the Lamanites, who were a compound of Laman and Lemuel, and the sons of Ishmael, and all those who had dissented from the Nephites, who were Amalekites and Zoramites, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>descendants</span> of the priests of Noah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352478" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Now those descendants were as numerous, nearly, as were the Nephites;
