and thus the Nephites were obliged to contend with their brethren, even unto bloodshed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352479" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass as the armies of the Lamanites had gathered together in the land of Antionum, behold, the armies of the Nephites were prepared to meet them in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Jershon</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352480" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now, the leader of the Nephites, or the man who had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appointed</span> to be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chief</span> captain over the Nephites—now the chief captain took the command of all the armies of the Nephites—and his name was Moroni;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352481" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And Moroni took all the command, and the government of their wars. And he was only twenty and five years old when he was appointed chief captain over the armies of the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352482" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that he met the Lamanites in the borders of Jershon, and his people were armed with swords, and with cimeters, and all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weapons</span> of war.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352483" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And when the armies of the Lamanites saw that the people of Nephi, or that Moroni, had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prepared</span> his people with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>breastplates</span> and with arm-shields, yea, and also shields to defend their heads, and also they were dressed with thick clothing—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352484" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now the army of Zerahemnah was not prepared with any such thing; they had only their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swords</span> and their cimeters, their bows and their arrows, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stones</span> and their slings; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>naked</span>, save it were a skin which was girded about their loins; yea, all were naked, save it were the Zoramites and the Amalekites;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352485" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But they were not armed with breastplates, nor shields—therefore, they were exceedingly afraid of the armies of the Nephites because of their armor, notwithstanding their number being so much greater than the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352486" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that they durst not come against the Nephites in the borders of Jershon; therefore they departed out of the land of Antionum into the wilderness, and took their journey round about in the wilderness, away by the head of the river Sidon, that they might come into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Manti</span> and take possession of the land; for they did not suppose that the armies of Moroni would know whither they had gone.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352487" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But it came to pass, as soon as they had departed into the wilderness Moroni sent spies into the wilderness to watch their camp; and Moroni, also, knowing of the prophecies of Alma, sent certain men unto him, desiring him that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquire</span> of the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whither</span> the armies of the Nephites should go to defend themselves against the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352488" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of the Lord came unto Alma, and Alma informed the messengers of Moroni, that the armies of the <span class="page-break" data-page="316"></span>Lamanites were marching round about in the wilderness, that they might come over into the land of Manti, that they might commence an attack upon the weaker part of the people. And those messengers went and delivered the message unto Moroni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352489" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now Moroni, leaving a part of his army in the land of Jershon, lest by any means a part of the Lamanites should come into that land and take possession of the city, took the remaining part of his army and marched over into the land of Manti.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352490" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And he caused that all the people in that quarter of the land should gather themselves together to battle against the Lamanites, to defend their lands and their country, their rights and their liberties; therefore they were prepared against the time of the coming of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352491" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that Moroni caused that his army should be secreted in the valley which was near the bank of the river Sidon, which was on the west of the river Sidon in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352492" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And Moroni placed spies round about, that he might know when the camp of the Lamanites should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352493" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And now, as Moroni knew the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>intention</span> of the Lamanites, that it was their intention to destroy their brethren, or to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>subject</span> them and bring them into bondage that they might establish a kingdom unto themselves over all the land;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352494" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And he also knowing that it was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>only</span> desire of the Nephites to preserve their lands, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span>, and their church, therefore he thought it no sin that he should defend them by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stratagem</span>; therefore, he found by his spies which course the Lamanites were to take.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352495" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Therefore, he divided his army and brought a part over into the valley, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>concealed</span> them on the east, and on the south of the hill Riplah;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352496" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And the remainder he concealed in the west <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley</span>, on the west of the river Sidon, and so down into the borders of the land Manti.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352497" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And thus having placed his army according to his desire, he was prepared to meet them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352498" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites came up on the north of the hill, where a part of the army of Moroni was concealed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352499" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And as the Lamanites had passed the hill Riplah, and came into the valley, and began to cross the river Sidon, the army which was concealed on the south of the hill, which was led by a man whose name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lehi</span>, and he led his army forth and encircled the Lamanites about on the east in their rear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352500" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites, when they saw the Nephites coming upon them in their rear, turned them about and began to contend with the army of Lehi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352501" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And the work of death commenced on both sides, but it was more dreadful on the part of the Lamanites, for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nakedness</span> was exposed to the heavy blows of the Nephites with their swords and their cimeters, which brought death almost at every stroke.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352502" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>While on the other hand, there was now and then a man fell among the Nephites, by their swords and the loss of blood, they being shielded from the more vital parts of the body, or the more vital parts of the body being shielded from the strokes of the Lamanites, by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>breastplates</span>, and their armshields, and their head-plates; and thus the Nephites did carry on the work of death among the Lamanites.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="317"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352503" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites became frightened, because of the great destruction among them, even until they began to flee towards the river Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352504" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And they were pursued by Lehi and his men; and they were driven by Lehi into the waters of Sidon, and they crossed the waters of Sidon. And Lehi retained his armies upon the bank of the river Sidon that they should not cross.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352505" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And it came to pass that Moroni and his army met the Lamanites in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>valley</span>, on the other side of the river Sidon, and began to fall upon them and to slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352506" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And the Lamanites did flee again before them, towards the land of Manti; and they were met again by the armies of Moroni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352507" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>Now in this case the Lamanites did fight exceedingly; yea, never had the Lamanites been known to fight with such exceedingly great strength and courage, no, not even from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352508" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>And they were inspired by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zoramites</span> and the Amalekites, who were their chief captains and leaders, and by Zerahemnah, who was their chief captain, or their chief leader and commander; yea, they did fight like dragons, and many of the Nephites were slain by their hands, yea, for they did smite in two many of their head-plates, and they did pierce many of their breastplates, and they did smite off many of their arms; and thus the Lamanites did smite in their fierce anger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352509" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>Nevertheless, the Nephites were inspired by a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> cause, for they were not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fighting</span> for monarchy nor power but they were fighting for their homes and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liberties</span>, their wives and their children, and their all, yea, for their rites of worship and their church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352510" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And they were doing that which they felt was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>duty</span> which they owed to their God; for the Lord had said unto them, and also unto their fathers, that: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Inasmuch</span> as ye are not guilty of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>first</span> offense, neither the second, ye shall not suffer yourselves to be slain by the hands of your enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352511" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>And again, the Lord has said that: Ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>defend</span> your families even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bloodshed</span>. Therefore for this cause were the Nephites contending with the Lamanites, to defend themselves, and their families, and their lands, their country, and their rights, and their religion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352512" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>And it came to pass that when the men of Moroni saw the fierceness and the anger of the Lamanites, they were about to shrink and flee from them. And Moroni, perceiving their intent, sent forth and inspired their hearts with these thoughts—yea, the thoughts of their lands, their liberty, yea, their freedom from bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352513" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>And it came to pass that they turned upon the Lamanites, and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cried</span> with one voice <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unto</span> the Lord their God, for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liberty</span> and their freedom from bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352514" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>And they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>began</span> to stand against the Lamanites with power; and in that selfsame hour that they cried unto the Lord for their freedom, the Lamanites began to flee before them; and they fled even to the waters of Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352515" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>Now, the Lamanites were more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numerous</span>, yea, by more than double the number of the Nephites; nevertheless, they were driven <span class="page-break" data-page="318"></span>insomuch that they were gathered together in one body in the valley, upon the bank by the river Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352516" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>Therefore the armies of Moroni encircled them about, yea, even on both sides of the river, for behold, on the east were the men of Lehi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352517" id="p53"><span class="verse-number">53 </span>Therefore when Zerahemnah saw the men of Lehi on the east of the river Sidon, and the armies of Moroni on the west of the river Sidon, that they were encircled about by the Nephites, they were struck with terror.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352518" id="p54"><span class="verse-number">54 </span>Now Moroni, when he saw their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note54a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>terror</span>, commanded his men that they should stop shedding their blood.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 44	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128353107" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/44" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 44</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128353108" id="title_number1">Chapter 44</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128353109" id="study_summary1">Moroni commands the Lamanites to make a covenant of peace or be destroyed—Zerahemnah rejects the offer, and the battle resumes—Moroni’s armies defeat the Lamanites. About 74–73 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353110" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that they did stop and withdrew a pace from them. And Moroni said unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zerahemnah</span>: Behold, Zerahemnah, that we do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not</span> desire to be men of blood. Ye know that ye are in our hands, yet we do not desire to slay you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353111" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, we have not come out to battle against you that we might shed your blood for power; neither do we desire to bring any one to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>yoke</span> of bondage. But this is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>very</span> cause for which ye have come against us; yea, and ye are angry with us because of our religion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353112" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But now, ye behold that the Lord is with us; and ye behold that he has delivered you into our hands. And now I would that ye should understand that this is done unto us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>because</span> of our religion and our faith in Christ. And now ye see that ye cannot destroy this our faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353113" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now ye see that this is the true faith of God; yea, ye see that God will support, and keep, and preserve us, so long as we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faithful</span> unto him, and unto our faith, and our religion; and never will the Lord suffer that we shall be destroyed except we should fall into transgression and deny our faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353114" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, Zerahemnah, I command you, in the name of that all-powerful God, who has strengthened our arms that we have gained power over you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>by</span> our faith, by our religion, and by our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rites</span> of worship, and by our church, and by the sacred support which we owe to our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wives</span> and our children, by that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>liberty</span> which binds us to our lands and our country; yea, and also by the maintenance of the sacred word of God, to which we owe all our happiness; and by all that is most dear unto us—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353115" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, and this is not all; I command you by all the desires which ye have for life, that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deliver</span> up your weapons of war unto us, and we will seek not your blood, but we will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spare</span> your lives, if ye will go your way and come not again to war against us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353116" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now, if ye do not this, behold, ye are in our hands, and I will command my men that they shall fall upon you, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inflict</span> the wounds of death in your bodies, that ye may become extinct; and then we will see who shall have power over this people; yea, we will see who shall be brought into bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353117" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now it came to pass that when Zerahemnah had heard these sayings he came forth and delivered up his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> and his cimeter, and his bow into the hands of Moroni, and said unto him: Behold, here are <span class="page-break" data-page="319"></span>our weapons of war; we will deliver them up unto you, but we will not suffer ourselves to take an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>oath</span> unto you, which we know that we shall break, and also our children; but take our weapons of war, and suffer that we may depart into the wilderness; otherwise we will retain our swords, and we will perish or conquer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353118" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Behold, we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not of your faith</span>; we do not believe that it is God that has delivered us into your hands; but we believe that it is your cunning that has preserved you from our swords. Behold, it is your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>breastplates</span> and your shields that have preserved you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353119" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now when Zerahemnah had made an end of speaking these words, Moroni returned the sword and the weapons of war, which he had received, unto Zerahemnah, saying: Behold, we will end the conflict.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353120" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now I cannot recall the words which I have spoken, therefore as the Lord liveth, ye shall not depart except ye depart with an oath that ye will not return again against us to war. Now as ye are in our hands we will spill your blood upon the ground, or ye shall submit to the conditions which I have proposed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353121" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now when Moroni had said these words, Zerahemnah retained his sword, and he was angry with Moroni, and he rushed forward that he might slay Moroni; but as he raised his sword, behold, one of Moroni’s soldiers smote it even to the earth, and it broke by the hilt; and he also smote Zerahemnah that he took off his scalp and it fell to the earth. And Zerahemnah withdrew from before them into the midst of his soldiers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353122" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that the soldier who stood by, who smote off the scalp of Zerahemnah, took up the scalp from off the ground by the hair, and laid it upon the point of his sword, and stretched it forth unto them, saying unto them with a loud voice:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353123" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Even as this scalp has fallen to the earth, which is the scalp of your chief, so shall ye fall to the earth except ye will deliver up your weapons of war and depart with a covenant of peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353124" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now there were many, when they heard these words and saw the scalp which was upon the sword, that were struck with fear; and many came forth and threw down their weapons of war at the feet of Moroni, and entered into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> of peace. And as many as entered into a covenant they suffered to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>depart</span> into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353125" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Now it came to pass that Zerahemnah was exceedingly wroth, and he did stir up the remainder of his soldiers to anger, to contend more powerfully against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353126" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now Moroni was angry, because of the stubbornness of the Lamanites; therefore he commanded his people that they should fall upon them and slay them. And it came to pass that they began to slay them; yea, and the Lamanites did contend with their swords and their might.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353127" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But behold, their naked skins and their bare heads were exposed to the sharp swords of the Nephites; yea, behold they were pierced and smitten, yea, and did fall exceedingly fast before the swords of the Nephites; and they began to be swept down, even as the soldier of Moroni had prophesied.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353128" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now Zerahemnah, when he saw that they were all about to be destroyed, cried mightily unto Moroni, promising that he would covenant and also his people with them, if they would spare the remainder of their lives, that they <span class="page-break" data-page="320"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> would come to war again against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353129" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that Moroni caused that the work of death should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cease</span> again among the people. And he took the weapons of war from the Lamanites; and after they had entered into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> with him of peace they were suffered to depart into the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353130" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now the number of their dead was not numbered because of the greatness of the number; yea, the number of their dead was exceedingly great, both on the Nephites and on the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353131" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that they did cast their dead into the waters of Sidon, and they have gone forth and are buried in the depths of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sea</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353132" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the armies of the Nephites, or of Moroni, returned and came to their houses and their lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353133" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And thus ended the eighteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi. And thus ended the record of Alma, which was written upon the plates of Nephi.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 45	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128353234" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/45" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 45</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128353261" id="intro1">The account of the people of Nephi, and their wars and dissensions, in the days of Helaman, according to the record of Helaman, which he kept in his days.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128353263" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 45 through 62.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128353265" id="title_number1">Chapter 45</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128353267" id="study_summary1">Helaman believes the words of Alma—Alma prophesies the destruction of the Nephites—He blesses and curses the land—Alma may have been taken up by the Spirit, even as Moses—Dissension grows in the Church. About 73 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353269" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that the people of Nephi were exceedingly rejoiced, because the Lord had again <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> them out of the hands of their enemies; therefore they gave thanks unto the Lord their God; yea, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fast</span> much and pray much, and they did worship God with exceedingly great joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353271" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass in the nineteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, that Alma came unto his son Helaman and said unto him: Believest thou the words which I spake unto thee concerning those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> which have been kept?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353272" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And Helaman said unto him: Yea, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353273" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And Alma said again: Believest thou in Jesus Christ, who shall come?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353274" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And he said: Yea, I believe all the words which thou hast spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353275" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And Alma said unto him again: Will ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>keep</span> my commandments?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353276" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he said: Yea, I will keep thy commandments with all my heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353277" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Then Alma said unto him: Blessed art thou; and the Lord shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span> thee in this land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353278" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But behold, I have somewhat to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesy</span> unto thee; but what I prophesy unto thee ye shall not make known; yea, what I prophesy unto thee shall not be made known, even until the prophecy is fulfilled; therefore write the words which I shall say.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353279" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And these are the words: Behold, I perceive that this very people, the Nephites, according to the spirit of revelation which is in me, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>four hundred</span> years from the time that Jesus Christ shall manifest himself unto them, shall dwindle in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353280" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, and then shall they see wars and pestilences, yea, famines and bloodshed, even until the <span class="page-break" data-page="321"></span>people of Nephi shall become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>extinct</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353281" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, and this because they shall dwindle in unbelief and fall into the works of darkness, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lasciviousness</span>, and all manner of iniquities; yea, I say unto you, that because they shall sin against so great light and knowledge, yea, I say unto you, that from that day, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fourth</span> generation shall not all pass away before this great iniquity shall come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353282" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And when that great day cometh, behold, the time very soon cometh that those who are now, or the seed of those who are now numbered among the people of Nephi, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no more</span> be numbered among the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353283" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But whosoever remaineth, and is not destroyed in that great and dreadful day, shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numbered</span> among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamanites</span>, and shall become like unto them, all, save it be a few who shall be called the disciples of the Lord; and them shall the Lamanites pursue even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>until</span> they shall become extinct. And now, because of iniquity, this prophecy shall be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353284" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now it came to pass that after Alma had said these things to Helaman, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> him, and also his other sons; and he also blessed the earth for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteous’</span> sake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353285" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And he said: Thus saith the Lord God—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cursed</span> shall be the land, yea, this land, unto every nation, kindred, tongue, and people, unto destruction, which do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wickedly</span>, when they are fully ripe; and as I have said so shall it be; for this is the cursing and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blessing</span> of God upon the land, for the Lord cannot look upon sin with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>least</span> degree of allowance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353286" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, when Alma had said these words he blessed the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, yea, all those who should stand fast in the faith from that time henceforth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353287" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And when Alma had done this he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>departed</span> out of the land of Zarahemla, as if to go into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Melek</span>. And it came to pass that he was never heard of more; as to his death or burial we know not of.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353288" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Behold, this we know, that he was a righteous man; and the saying went abroad in the church that he was taken up by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span>, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>buried</span> by the hand of the Lord, even as Moses. But behold, the scriptures saith the Lord took Moses unto himself; and we suppose that he has also received Alma in the spirit, unto himself; therefore, for this cause we know nothing concerning his death and burial.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353289" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now it came to pass in the commencement of the nineteenth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, that Helaman went forth among the people to declare the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353290" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>For behold, because of their wars with the Lamanites and the many little dissensions and disturbances which had been among the people, it became expedient that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of God should be declared among them, yea, and that a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>regulation</span> should be made throughout the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353291" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Helaman</span> and his brethren went forth to establish the church again in all the land, yea, in every city throughout all the land which was possessed by the people <span class="page-break" data-page="322"></span>of Nephi. And it came to pass that they did appoint <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>priests</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>teachers</span> throughout all the land, over all the churches.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353292" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now it came to pass that after Helaman and his brethren had appointed priests and teachers over the churches that there arose a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissension</span> among them, and they would not give heed to the words of Helaman and his brethren;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353293" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>But they grew proud, being lifted up in their hearts, because of their exceedingly great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span>; therefore they grew rich in their own eyes, and would not give heed to their words, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>walk</span> uprightly before God.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 46	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128353157" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/46" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 46</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128353158" id="title_number1">Chapter 46</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128353159" id="study_summary1">Amalickiah conspires to be king—Moroni raises the title of liberty—He rallies the people to defend their religion—True believers are called Christians—A remnant of Joseph will be preserved—Amalickiah and the dissenters flee to the land of Nephi—Those who will not support the cause of freedom are put to death. About 73–72 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353160" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that as many as would not hearken to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of Helaman and his brethren were gathered together against their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353161" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now behold, they were exceedingly wroth, insomuch that they were determined to slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353162" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now the leader of those who were wroth against their brethren was a large and a strong man; and his name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amalickiah</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353163" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And Amalickiah was desirous to be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span>; and those people who were wroth were also desirous that he should be their king; and they were the greater part of them the lower <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span> of the land, and they were seeking for power.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353164" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they had been led by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flatteries</span> of Amalickiah, that if they would support him and establish him to be their king that he would make them rulers over the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353165" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Thus they were led away by Amalickiah to dissensions, notwithstanding the preaching of Helaman and his brethren, yea, notwithstanding their exceedingly great care over the church, for they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priests</span> over the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353166" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And there were many in the church who believed in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flattering</span> words of Amalickiah, therefore they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dissented</span> even from the church; and thus were the affairs of the people of Nephi exceedingly precarious and dangerous, notwithstanding their great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>victory</span> which they had had over the Lamanites, and their great rejoicings which they had had because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>deliverance</span> by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353167" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Thus we see how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>quick</span> the children of men do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>forget</span> the Lord their God, yea, how quick to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>iniquity</span>, and to be led away by the evil one.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353168" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, and we also see the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> one very wicked man can cause to take place among the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353169" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yea, we see that Amalickiah, because he was a man of cunning device and a man of many flattering words, that he led away the hearts of many people to do wickedly; yea, and to seek to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the church of God, and to destroy the foundation of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span> which God had granted <span class="page-break" data-page="323"></span>unto them, or which blessing God had sent upon the face of the land for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteous’</span> sake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353170" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now it came to pass that when Moroni, who was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chief</span> commander of the armies of the Nephites, had heard of these dissensions, he was angry with Amalickiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353171" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that he rent his coat; and he took a piece thereof, and wrote upon it—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>In</span> memory of our God, our religion, and freedom, and our peace, our wives, and our children—and he fastened it upon the end of a pole.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353172" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And he fastened on his head-plate, and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>breastplate</span>, and his shields, and girded on his armor about his loins; and he took the pole, which had on the end thereof his rent coat, (and he called it the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>title of liberty</span>) and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bowed</span> himself to the earth, and he prayed mightily unto his God for the blessings of liberty to rest upon his brethren, so long as there should a band of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Christians</span> remain to possess the land—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353173" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For thus were all the true believers of Christ, who belonged to the church of God, called by those who did not belong to the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353174" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And those who did belong to the church were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faithful</span>; yea, all those who were true believers in Christ <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>took upon</span> them, gladly, the name of Christ, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Christians</span> as they were called, because of their belief in Christ who should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353175" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And therefore, at this time, Moroni prayed that the cause of the Christians, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>freedom</span> of the land might be favored.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353176" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that when he had poured out his soul to God, he named all the land which was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>south</span> of the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Desolation</span>, yea, and in fine, all the land, both on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>north</span> and on the south—A chosen land, and the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>liberty</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353177" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And he said: Surely God shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>suffer</span> that we, who are despised because we take upon us the name of Christ, shall be trodden down and destroyed, until we bring it upon us by our own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>transgressions</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353178" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And when Moroni had said these words, he went forth among the people, waving the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rent</span> part of his garment in the air, that all might see the writing which he had written upon the rent part, and crying with a loud voice, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353179" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Behold, whosoever will maintain this title upon the land, let them come forth in the strength of the Lord, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enter</span> into a covenant that they will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>maintain</span> their rights, and their religion, that the Lord God may bless them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353180" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that when Moroni had proclaimed these words, behold, the people came running <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>together</span> with their armor girded about their loins, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rending</span> their garments in token, or as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenant</span>, that they would not forsake the Lord their God; or, in other words, if they should transgress the commandments of God, or fall into transgression, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>ashamed</span> to take upon them the name of Christ, the Lord should rend them even as they had rent their garments.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="324"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353181" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now this was the covenant which they made, and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> their garments at the feet of Moroni, saying: We <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> with our God, that we shall be destroyed, even as our brethren in the land northward, if we shall fall into transgression; yea, he may cast us at the feet of our enemies, even as we have cast our garments at thy feet to be trodden under foot, if we shall fall into transgression.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353182" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Moroni said unto them: Behold, we are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of Jacob; yea, we are a remnant of the seed of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Joseph</span>, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>coat</span> was rent by his brethren into many pieces; yea, and now behold, let us remember to keep the commandments of God, or our garments shall be rent by our brethren, and we be cast into prison, or be sold, or be slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353183" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Yea, let us preserve our liberty as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of Joseph; yea, let us remember the words of Jacob, before his death, for behold, he saw that a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>part</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remnant</span> of the coat of Joseph was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>preserved</span> and had not decayed. And he said—Even as this remnant of garment of my son hath been preserved, so shall a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of my son be preserved by the hand of God, and be taken unto himself, while the remainder of the seed of Joseph shall perish, even as the remnant of his garment.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353184" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now behold, this giveth my soul sorrow; nevertheless, my soul hath joy in my son, because of that part of his seed which shall be taken unto God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353185" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now behold, this was the language of Jacob.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353186" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And now who knoweth but what the remnant of the seed of Joseph, which shall perish as his garment, are those who have dissented from us? Yea, and even it shall be ourselves if we do not stand fast in the faith of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353187" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now it came to pass that when Moroni had said these words he went forth, and also sent forth in all the parts of the land where there were dissensions, and gathered together all the people who were desirous to maintain their liberty, to stand against Amalickiah and those who had dissented, who were called Amalickiahites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353188" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that when Amalickiah saw that the people of Moroni were more numerous than the Amalickiahites—and he also saw that his people were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doubtful</span> concerning the justice of the cause in which they had undertaken—therefore, fearing that he should not gain the point, he took those of his people who would and departed into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Nephi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353189" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Now Moroni thought it was not expedient that the Lamanites should have any more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strength</span>; therefore he thought to cut off the people of Amalickiah, or to take them and bring them back, and put Amalickiah to death; yea, for he knew that he would stir up the Lamanites to anger against them, and cause them to come to battle against them; and this he knew that Amalickiah would do that he might obtain his purposes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353190" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Therefore Moroni thought it was expedient that he should take his armies, who had gathered themselves together, and armed themselves, and entered into a covenant to keep the peace—and it came to pass that he took his army and marched out with his tents into the wilderness, to cut off the course of Amalickiah in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353191" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that he did <span class="page-break" data-page="325"></span>according to his desires, and marched forth into the wilderness, and headed the armies of Amalickiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353192" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fled</span> with a small number of his men, and the remainder were delivered up into the hands of Moroni and were taken back into the land of Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353193" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Now, Moroni being a man who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>appointed</span> by the chief judges and the voice of the people, therefore he had power according to his will with the armies of the Nephites, to establish and to exercise authority over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353194" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that whomsoever of the Amalickiahites that would not enter into a covenant to support the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cause</span> of freedom, that they might maintain a free <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>government</span>, he caused to be put to death; and there were but few who denied the covenant of freedom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353195" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass also, that he caused the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>title of liberty</span> to be hoisted upon every tower which was in all the land, which was possessed by the Nephites; and thus Moroni planted the standard of liberty among the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353196" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And they began to have peace again in the land; and thus they did maintain peace in the land until nearly the end of the nineteenth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353197" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And Helaman and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>high priests</span> did also maintain order in the church; yea, even for the space of four years did they have much peace and rejoicing in the church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353198" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And it came to pass that there were many who died, firmly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believing</span> that their souls were redeemed by the Lord Jesus Christ; thus they went out of the world rejoicing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353199" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And there were some who died with fevers, which at some seasons of the year were very frequent in the land—but not so much so with fevers, because of the excellent qualities of the many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plants</span> and roots which God had prepared to remove the cause of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>diseases</span>, to which men were subject by the nature of the climate—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353200" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>But there were many who died with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span> age; and those who died in the faith of Christ are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>happy</span> in him, as we must needs suppose.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 47	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128353330" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/47" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 47</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128353331" id="title_number1">Chapter 47</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128353332" id="study_summary1">Amalickiah uses treachery, murder, and intrigue to become king of the Lamanites—The Nephite dissenters are more wicked and ferocious than the Lamanites. About 72 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353333" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now we will return in our record to Amalickiah and those who had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fled</span> with him into the wilderness; for, behold, he had taken those who went with him, and went up in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Nephi</span> among the Lamanites, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stir up</span> the Lamanites to anger against the people of Nephi, insomuch that the king of the Lamanites sent a proclamation throughout all his land, among all his people, that they should gather themselves together again to go to battle against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353334" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that when the proclamation had gone forth among them they were exceedingly afraid; yea, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>feared</span> to displease the king, and they also feared to go to battle against the Nephites lest they should lose their lives. And it came to pass that they would not, or the more part of them would not, obey the commandments of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353335" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now it came to pass that <span class="page-break" data-page="326"></span>the king was wroth because of their disobedience; therefore he gave Amalickiah the command of that part of his army which was obedient unto his commands, and commanded him that he should go forth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>compel</span> them to arms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353336" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now behold, this was the desire of Amalickiah; for he being a very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>subtle</span> man to do evil therefore he laid the plan in his heart to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dethrone</span> the king of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353337" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now he had got the command of those parts of the Lamanites who were in favor of the king; and he sought to gain favor of those who were not obedient; therefore he went forward to the place which was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Onidah</span>, for thither had all the Lamanites fled; for they discovered the army coming, and, supposing that they were coming to destroy them, therefore they fled to Onidah, to the place of arms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353338" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they had appointed a man to be a king and a leader over them, being fixed in their minds with a determined resolution that they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> be subjected to go against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353339" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that they had gathered themselves together upon the top of the mount which was called Antipas, in preparation to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353340" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now it was not Amalickiah’s intention to give them battle according to the commandments of the king; but behold, it was his intention to gain favor with the armies of the Lamanites, that he might place himself at their head and dethrone the king and take possession of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353341" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, it came to pass that he caused his army to pitch their tents in the valley which was near the mount Antipas.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353342" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that when it was night he sent a secret embassy into the mount Antipas, desiring that the leader of those who were upon the mount, whose name was Lehonti, that he should come down to the foot of the mount, for he desired to speak with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353343" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that when Lehonti received the message he durst not go down to the foot of the mount. And it came to pass that Amalickiah sent again the second time, desiring him to come down. And it came to pass that Lehonti would not; and he sent again the third time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353344" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when Amalickiah found that he could not get Lehonti to come down off from the mount, he went up into the mount, nearly to Lehonti’s camp; and he sent again the fourth time his message unto Lehonti, desiring that he would come down, and that he would bring his guards with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353345" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that when Lehonti had come down with his guards to Amalickiah, that Amalickiah desired him to come down with his army in the night-time, and surround those men in their camps over whom the king had given him command, and that he would deliver them up into Lehonti’s hands, if he would make him (Amalickiah) a second <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>leader</span> over the whole army.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353346" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Lehonti came down with his men and surrounded the men of Amalickiah, so that before they awoke at the dawn of day they were surrounded by the armies of Lehonti.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353347" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that when they saw that they were surrounded, they pled with Amalickiah that he would suffer them to fall in with their brethren, that they might not be destroyed. Now this was the very thing which Amalickiah desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353348" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that he delivered his men, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contrary</span> to the commands of the king. Now this was the thing that Amalickiah <span class="page-break" data-page="327"></span>desired, that he might accomplish his designs in dethroning the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353349" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now it was the custom among the Lamanites, if their chief leader was killed, to appoint the second leader to be their chief leader.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353350" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah caused that one of his servants should administer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poison</span> by degrees to Lehonti, that he died.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353351" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now, when Lehonti was dead, the Lamanites appointed Amalickiah to be their leader and their chief commander.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353352" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah marched with his armies (for he had gained his desires) to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Nephi</span>, to the city of Nephi, which was the chief city.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353353" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the king came out to meet him with his guards, for he supposed that Amalickiah had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfilled</span> his commands, and that Amalickiah had gathered together so great an army to go against the Nephites to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353354" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But behold, as the king came out to meet him Amalickiah caused that his servants should go forth to meet the king. And they went and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bowed</span> themselves before the king, as if to reverence him because of his greatness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353355" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that the king put forth his hand to raise them, as was the custom with the Lamanites, as a token of peace, which custom they had taken from the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353356" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that when he had raised the first from the ground, behold he stabbed the king to the heart; and he fell to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353357" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now the servants of the king fled; and the servants of Amalickiah raised a cry, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353358" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Behold, the servants of the king have stabbed him to the heart, and he has fallen and they have fled; behold, come and see.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353359" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah commanded that his armies should march forth and see what had happened to the king; and when they had come to the spot, and found the king lying in his gore, Amalickiah pretended to be wroth, and said: Whosoever loved the king, let him go forth, and pursue his servants that they may be slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353360" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that all they who loved the king, when they heard these words, came forth and pursued after the servants of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353361" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Now when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servants</span> of the king saw an army pursuing after them, they were frightened again, and fled into the wilderness, and came over into the land of Zarahemla and joined the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>people</span> of Ammon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353362" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And the army which pursued after them returned, having pursued after them in vain; and thus Amalickiah, by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fraud</span>, gained the hearts of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353363" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass on the morrow he entered the city Nephi with his armies, and took possession of the city.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353364" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now it came to pass that the queen, when she had heard that the king was slain—for Amalickiah had sent an embassy to the queen informing her that the king had been slain by his servants, that he had pursued them with his army, but it was in vain, and they had made their escape—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353365" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Therefore, when the queen had received this message she sent unto Amalickiah, desiring him that he would spare the people of the city; and she also desired him that he should come in unto her; and she also desired him that he should bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span> with him to testify concerning the death of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353366" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah took the same servant that slew the king, and all them who <span class="page-break" data-page="328"></span>were with him, and went in unto the queen, unto the place where she sat; and they all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testified</span> unto her that the king was slain by his own servants; and they said also: They have fled; does not this testify against them? And thus they satisfied the queen concerning the death of the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353367" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that Amalickiah sought the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>favor</span> of the queen, and took her unto him to wife; and thus by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fraud</span>, and by the assistance of his cunning servants, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>obtained</span> the kingdom; yea, he was acknowledged king throughout all the land, among all the people of the Lamanites, who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>composed</span> of the Lamanites and the Lemuelites and the Ishmaelites, and all the dissenters of the Nephites, from the reign of Nephi down to the present time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128353368" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Now these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissenters</span>, having the same instruction and the same information of the Nephites, yea, having been instructed in the same <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of the Lord, nevertheless, it is strange to relate, not long after their dissensions they became more hardened and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>impenitent</span>, and more wild, wicked and ferocious than the Lamanites—drinking in with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>traditions</span> of the Lamanites; giving way to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>indolence</span>, and all manner of lasciviousness; yea, entirely forgetting the Lord their God.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Alma 48	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128352583" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/alma/48" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Alma 48</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128352584" id="title_number1">Chapter 48</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128352585" id="study_summary1">Amalickiah incites the Lamanites against the Nephites—Moroni prepares his people to defend the cause of the Christians—He rejoices in liberty and freedom and is a mighty man of God. About 72 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352586" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that, as soon as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amalickiah</span> had obtained the kingdom he began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>inspire</span> the hearts of the Lamanites against the people of Nephi; yea, he did appoint men to speak unto the Lamanites from their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>towers</span>, against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352587" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And thus he did inspire their hearts against the Nephites, insomuch that in the latter end of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nineteenth</span> year of the reign of the judges, he having accomplished his designs thus far, yea, having been made king over the Lamanites, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sought</span> also to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reign</span> over all the land, yea, and all the people who were in the land, the Nephites as well as the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352588" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore he had accomplished his design, for he had hardened the hearts of the Lamanites and blinded their minds, and stirred them up to anger, insomuch that he had gathered together a numerous host to go to battle against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352589" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For he was determined, because of the greatness of the number of his people, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>overpower</span> the Nephites and to bring them into bondage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128352590" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And thus he did appoint <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chief</span> captains of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zoramites</span>, they being the most acquainted with the strength of the Nephites, and their places of resort, and the weakest parts of their cities;
