and he was upheld by his band, who had entered into a covenant that no one should know his wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356845" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For there was one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton</span>, who was exceedingly expert in many words, and also in his craft, to carry on the secret work of murder and of robbery; therefore he became the leader of the band of Kishkumen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356846" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flatter</span> them, and also Kishkumen, that if they would place him in the judgment-seat he would grant unto those who belonged to his band that they should be placed in power and authority among the people; therefore Kishkumen sought to destroy Helaman.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356847" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass as he went forth towards the judgment-seat to destroy Helaman, behold one of the servants of Helaman, having been out by night, and having obtained, through disguise, a knowledge of those plans which had been laid by this band to destroy Helaman—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356848" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that he met Kishkumen, and he gave unto him a sign; therefore Kishkumen made known unto him the object of his desire, desiring that he would conduct him to the judgment-seat that he might murder Helaman.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356849" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when the servant of Helaman had known all the heart of Kishkumen, and how that it was his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>object</span> to murder, and also that it was the object of all those who belonged to his band to murder, and to rob, and to gain power, (and this was their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> plan, and their combination) the servant of Helaman said unto Kishkumen: Let us go forth unto the judgment-seat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356850" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now this did please Kishkumen exceedingly, for he did suppose that he should accomplish his design; but behold, the servant of Helaman, as they were going forth unto the judgment-seat, did stab Kishkumen even to the heart, that he fell dead without a groan. And he ran and told Helaman all the things which he had seen, and heard, and done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356851" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that Helaman did send forth to take this band of robbers and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> murderers, that they might be executed according to the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356852" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But behold, when Gadianton had found that Kishkumen did not return he feared lest that he should be destroyed; therefore he caused that his band should follow him. And they took their flight out of <span class="page-break" data-page="372"></span>the land, by a secret way, into the wilderness; and thus when Helaman sent forth to take them they could nowhere be found.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356853" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And more of this Gadianton shall be spoken hereafter. And thus ended the forty and second year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356854" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, in the end of this book ye shall see that this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton</span> did prove the overthrow, yea, almost the entire destruction of the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356855" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold I do not mean the end of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>book</span> of Helaman, but I mean the end of the book of Nephi, from which I have taken all the account which I have written.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356866" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356867" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356868" id="study_summary1">Many Nephites migrate to the land northward—They build houses of cement and keep many records—Tens of thousands are converted and baptized—The word of God leads men to salvation—Nephi the son of Helaman fills the judgment seat. About 49–39 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356869" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass in the forty and third year of the reign of the judges, there was no contention among the people of Nephi save it were a little pride which was in the church, which did cause some little dissensions among the people, which affairs were settled in the ending of the forty and third year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356870" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And there was no contention among the people in the forty and fourth year; neither was there much contention in the forty and fifth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356871" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass in the forty and sixth, yea, there was much contention and many dissensions; in the which there were an exceedingly great many who departed out of the land of Zarahemla, and went forth unto the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>northward</span> to inherit the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356872" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they did travel to an exceedingly great distance, insomuch that they came to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>large</span> bodies of water and many rivers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356873" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and even they did spread forth into all parts of the land, into whatever parts it had not been rendered desolate and without timber, because of the many inhabitants who had before inherited the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356874" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now no part of the land was desolate, save it were for timber; but because of the greatness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> of the people who had before inhabited the land it was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>desolate</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356875" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And there being but little timber upon the face of the land, nevertheless the people who went forth became exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>expert</span> in the working of cement; therefore they did build houses of cement, in the which they did dwell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356876" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that they did multiply and spread, and did go forth from the land southward to the land northward, and did spread insomuch that they began to cover the face of the whole earth, from the sea south to the sea north, from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sea</span> west to the sea east.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356877" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the people who were in the land northward did dwell in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tents</span>, and in houses of cement, and they did suffer whatsoever tree should spring up upon the face of the land that it should grow up, that in time they might have timber to build their houses, yea, their cities, and their temples, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>synagogues</span>, and their sanctuaries, and all manner of their buildings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356878" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass as timber was exceedingly scarce in the land northward, they did send forth much by the way of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shipping</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="373"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356879" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thus they did enable the people in the land northward that they might build many cities, both of wood and of cement.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356880" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that there were many of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> of Ammon, who were Lamanites by birth, did also go forth into this land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356881" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now there are many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> kept of the proceedings of this people, by many of this people, which are particular and very large, concerning them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356882" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But behold, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hundredth</span> part of the proceedings of this people, yea, the account of the Lamanites and of the Nephites, and their wars, and contentions, and dissensions, and their preaching, and their prophecies, and their shipping and their building of ships, and their building of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temples</span>, and of synagogues and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sanctuaries</span>, and their righteousness, and their wickedness, and their murders, and their robbings, and their plundering, and all manner of abominations and whoredoms, cannot be contained in this work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356883" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But behold, there are many books and many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> of every kind, and they have been kept chiefly by the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356884" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And they have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>handed</span> down from one generation to another by the Nephites, even until they have fallen into transgression and have been murdered, plundered, and hunted, and driven forth, and slain, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> upon the face of the earth, and mixed with the Lamanites until they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>no more</span> called the Nephites, becoming wicked, and wild, and ferocious, yea, even becoming Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356885" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now I return again to mine account; therefore, what I have spoken had passed after there had been great contentions, and disturbances, and wars, and dissensions, among the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356886" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>The forty and sixth year of the reign of the judges ended;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356887" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that there was still great contention in the land, yea, even in the forty and seventh year, and also in the forty and eighth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356888" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Nevertheless <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Helaman</span> did fill the judgment-seat with justice and equity; yea, he did observe to keep the statutes, and the judgments, and the commandments of God; and he did do that which was right in the sight of God continually; and he did walk after the ways of his father, insomuch that he did prosper in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356889" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that he had two sons. He gave unto the eldest the name of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>, and unto the youngest, the name of Lehi. And they began to grow up unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356890" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that the wars and contentions began to cease, in a small degree, among the people of the Nephites, in the latter end of the forty and eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356891" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass in the forty and ninth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace established in the land, all save it were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combinations</span> which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gadianton</span> the robber had established in the more settled parts of the land, which at that time were not known unto those who were at the head of government; therefore they were not destroyed out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356892" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that in this same year there was exceedingly great prosperity in the church, insomuch that there were thousands who did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>join</span> themselves unto the <span class="page-break" data-page="374"></span>church and were baptized unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356893" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And so great was the prosperity of the church, and so many the blessings which were poured out upon the people, that even the high priests and the teachers were themselves astonished beyond measure.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356894" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that the work of the Lord did prosper unto the baptizing and uniting to the church of God, many souls, yea, even tens of thousands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356895" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Thus we may see that the Lord is merciful unto all who will, in the sincerity of their hearts, call upon his holy name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356896" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Yea, thus we see that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gate</span> of heaven is open unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span>, even to those who will believe on the name of Jesus Christ, who is the Son of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356897" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, we see that whosoever will may lay hold upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of God, which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quick</span> and powerful, which shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>divide</span> asunder all the cunning and the snares and the wiles of the devil, and lead the man of Christ in a strait and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>narrow</span> course across that everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>gulf</span> of misery which is prepared to engulf the wicked—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356898" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And land their souls, yea, their immortal souls, at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>right hand</span> of God in the kingdom of heaven, to sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and with Jacob, and with all our holy fathers, to go no more out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356899" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And in this year there was continual rejoicing in the land of Zarahemla, and in all the regions round about, even in all the land which was possessed by the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356900" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that there was peace and exceedingly great joy in the remainder of the forty and ninth year; yea, and also there was continual peace and great joy in the fiftieth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356901" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And in the fifty and first year of the reign of the judges there was peace also, save it were the pride which began to enter into the church—not into the church of God, but into the hearts of the people who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>professed</span> to belong to the church of God—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356902" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And they were lifted up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span>, even to the persecution of many of their brethren. Now this was a great evil, which did cause the more humble part of the people to suffer great persecutions, and to wade through much affliction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356903" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Nevertheless they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fast</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span> oft, and did wax stronger and stronger in their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>humility</span>, and firmer and firmer in the faith of Christ, unto the filling their souls with joy and consolation, yea, even to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>purifying</span> and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sanctification</span> of their hearts, which sanctification cometh because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>yielding</span> their hearts unto God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356904" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that the fifty and second year ended in peace also, save it were the exceedingly great pride which had gotten into the hearts of the people; and it was because of their exceedingly great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span> and their prosperity in the land; and it did grow upon them from day to day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356905" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass in the fifty and third year of the reign of the judges, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Helaman</span> died, and his eldest son <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephi</span> began to reign in his stead. And it came to pass that he did fill the judgment-seat with justice and equity; yea, he did keep <span class="page-break" data-page="375"></span>the commandments of God, and did walk in the ways of his father.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356230" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356231" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356232" id="study_summary1">Nephite dissenters and the Lamanites join forces and take the land of Zarahemla—The Nephites’ defeats come because of their wickedness—The Church dwindles, and the people become weak like the Lamanites. About 38–30 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356233" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass in the fifty and fourth year there were many dissensions in the church, and there was also a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contention</span> among the people, insomuch that there was much bloodshed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356234" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the rebellious part were slain and driven out of the land, and they did go unto the king of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356235" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that they did endeavor to stir up the Lamanites to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>war</span> against the Nephites; but behold, the Lamanites were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>exceedingly</span> afraid, insomuch that they would not hearken to the words of those dissenters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356236" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But it came to pass in the fifty and sixth year of the reign of the judges, there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissenters</span> who went up from the Nephites unto the Lamanites; and they succeeded with those others in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stirring</span> them up to anger against the Nephites; and they were all that year preparing for war.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356237" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And in the fifty and seventh year they did come down against the Nephites to battle, and they did commence the work of death; yea, insomuch that in the fifty and eighth year of the reign of the judges they succeeded in obtaining <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>possession</span> of the land of Zarahemla; yea, and also all the lands, even unto the land which was near the land Bountiful.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356238" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And the Nephites and the armies of Moronihah were driven even into the land of Bountiful;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356239" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And there they did fortify against the Lamanites, from the west sea, even unto the east; it being a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day’s</span> journey for a Nephite, on the line which they had fortified and stationed their armies to defend their north country.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356240" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dissenters</span> of the Nephites, with the help of a numerous army of the Lamanites, had obtained all the possession of the Nephites which was in the land southward. And all this was done in the fifty and eighth and ninth years of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356241" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass in the sixtieth year of the reign of the judges, Moronihah did succeed with his armies in obtaining many parts of the land; yea, they regained many cities which had fallen into the hands of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356242" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass in the sixty and first year of the reign of the judges they succeeded in regaining even the half of all their possessions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356243" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now this great loss of the Nephites, and the great slaughter which was among them, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>would not</span> have happened had it not been for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wickedness</span> and their abomination which was among them; yea, and it was among those also who professed to belong to the church of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356244" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it was because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span> of their hearts, because of their exceeding <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>riches</span>, yea, it was because of their oppression to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>poor</span>, withholding their food from the hungry, withholding their clothing from the naked, and smiting their humble brethren upon the cheek, making a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mock</span> of that which was sacred, denying the spirit of prophecy and of revelation, murdering, plundering, lying, stealing, <span class="page-break" data-page="376"></span>committing adultery, rising up in great contentions, and deserting away into the land of Nephi, among the Lamanites—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356245" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And because of this their great wickedness, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boastings</span> in their own strength, they were left in their own strength; therefore they did not prosper, but were afflicted and smitten, and driven before the Lamanites, until they had lost possession of almost all their lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356246" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But behold, Moronihah did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> many things unto the people because of their iniquity, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephi</span> and Lehi, who were the sons of Helaman, did preach many things unto the people, yea, and did prophesy many things unto them concerning their iniquities, and what should come unto them if they did not repent of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356247" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that they did repent, and inasmuch as they did repent they did begin to prosper.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356248" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For when Moronihah saw that they did repent he did venture to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lead</span> them forth from place to place, and from city to city, even until they had regained the one-half of their property and the one-half of all their lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356249" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And thus ended the sixty and first year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356250" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass in the sixty and second year of the reign of the judges, that Moronihah could obtain no more possessions over the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356251" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Therefore they did abandon their design to obtain the remainder of their lands, for so numerous were the Lamanites that it became impossible for the Nephites to obtain more power over them; therefore Moronihah did employ all his armies in maintaining those parts which he had taken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356252" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass, because of the greatness of the number of the Lamanites the Nephites were in great fear, lest they should be overpowered, and trodden down, and slain, and destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356253" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Yea, they began to remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophecies</span> of Alma, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>words</span> of Mosiah; and they saw that they had been a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, and that they had set at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>naught</span> the commandments of God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356254" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And that they had altered and trampled under their feet the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laws</span> of Mosiah, or that which the Lord commanded him to give unto the people; and they saw that their laws had become corrupted, and that they had become a wicked people, insomuch that they were wicked even like unto the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356255" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And because of their iniquity the church had begun to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dwindle</span>; and they began to disbelieve in the spirit of prophecy and in the spirit of revelation; and the judgments of God did stare them in the face.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356256" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And they saw that they had become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weak</span>, like unto their brethren, the Lamanites, and that the Spirit of the Lord did no more preserve them; yea, it had withdrawn from them because the Spirit of the Lord doth not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dwell</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unholy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>temples</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356257" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Therefore the Lord did cease to preserve them by his miraculous and matchless power, for they had fallen into a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span> and awful wickedness; and they saw that the Lamanites were exceedingly more numerous than they, and except they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cleave</span> unto the Lord their God they must unavoidably perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356258" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>For behold, they saw that the strength of the Lamanites was as <span class="page-break" data-page="377"></span>great as their strength, even man for man. And thus had they fallen into this great transgression; yea, thus had they become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weak</span>, because of their transgression, in the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not many years</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356948" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356949" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356950" id="study_summary1">Nephi and Lehi devote themselves to preaching—Their names invite them to pattern their lives after their forebears—Christ redeems those who repent—Nephi and Lehi make many converts and are imprisoned, and fire encircles them—A cloud of darkness overshadows three hundred people—The earth shakes, and a voice commands men to repent—Nephi and Lehi converse with angels, and the multitude is encircled by fire. About 30 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356951" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that in this same year, behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>delivered up</span> the judgment-seat to a man whose name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Cezoram</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356952" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For as their laws and their governments were established by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the people, and they who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chose</span> evil were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>more</span> numerous than they who chose good, therefore they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>ripening</span> for destruction, for the laws had become corrupted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356953" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, and this was not all; they were a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, insomuch that they could not be governed by the law nor justice, save it were to their destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356954" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi had become weary because of their iniquity; and he yielded up the judgment-seat, and took it upon him to preach the word of God all the remainder of his days, and his brother Lehi also, all the remainder of his days;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356955" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For they remembered the words which their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span> Helaman spake unto them. And these are the words which he spake:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356956" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, my sons, I desire that ye should remember to keep the commandments of God; and I would that ye should declare unto the people these words. Behold, I have given unto you the names of our first <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>parents</span> who came out of the land of Jerusalem; and this I have done that when you remember your names ye may remember them; and when ye remember them ye may remember their works; and when ye remember their works ye may know how that it is said, and also written, that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>good</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356957" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore, my sons, I would that ye should do that which is good, that it may be said of you, and also written, even as it has been said and written of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356958" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now my sons, behold I have somewhat more to desire of you, which desire is, that ye may not do these things that ye may boast, but that ye may do these things to lay up for yourselves a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>treasure</span> in heaven, yea, which is eternal, and which fadeth not away; yea, that ye may have that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>precious</span> gift of eternal life, which we have reason to suppose hath been given to our fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356959" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>O remember, remember, my sons, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> which king Benjamin spake unto his people; yea, remember that there is no other way nor means whereby man can be saved, only through the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>atoning</span> blood of Jesus Christ, who shall come; yea, remember that he cometh to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redeem</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>world</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="378"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356960" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And remember also the words which Amulek spake unto Zeezrom, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in</span> the city of Ammonihah; for he said unto him that the Lord surely should come to redeem his people, but that he should not come to redeem them in their sins, but to redeem them from their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356961" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he hath power given unto him from the Father to redeem them from their sins because of repentance; therefore he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sent</span> his angels to declare the tidings of the conditions of repentance, which bringeth unto the power of the Redeemer, unto the salvation of their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356962" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, my sons, remember, remember that it is upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rock</span> of our Redeemer, who is Christ, the Son of God, that ye must build your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foundation</span>; that when the devil shall send forth his mighty winds, yea, his shafts in the whirlwind, yea, when all his hail and his mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>storm</span> shall beat upon you, it shall have no power over you to drag you down to the gulf of misery and endless wo, because of the rock upon which ye are built, which is a sure foundation, a foundation whereon if men build they cannot fall.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356963" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that these were the words which Helaman <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taught</span> to his sons; yea, he did teach them many things which are not written, and also many things which are written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356964" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they did remember his words; and therefore they went forth, keeping the commandments of God, to teach the word of God among all the people of Nephi, beginning at the city Bountiful;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356965" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And from thenceforth to the city of Gid; and from the city of Gid to the city of Mulek;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356966" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And even from one city to another, until they had gone forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>among</span> all the people of Nephi who were in the land southward; and from thence into the land of Zarahemla, among the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356967" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> with great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span>, insomuch that they did confound many of those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>dissenters</span> who had gone over from the Nephites, insomuch that they came forth and did confess their sins and were baptized unto repentance, and immediately returned to the Nephites to endeavor to repair unto them the wrongs which they had done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356968" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did preach unto the Lamanites with such great power and authority, for they had power and authority given unto them that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>speak</span>, and they also had what they should speak given unto them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356969" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Therefore they did speak unto the great astonishment of the Lamanites, to the convincing them, insomuch that there were eight thousand of the Lamanites who were in the land of Zarahemla and round about <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span> unto repentance, and were convinced of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wickedness</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>traditions</span> of their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356970" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did proceed from thence to go to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Nephi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356971" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that they were taken by an army of the Lamanites and cast into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span>; yea, even in that same prison in which Ammon and his brethren were cast by the servants of Limhi.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="379"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356972" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And after they had been cast into prison many days without food, behold, they went forth into the prison to take them that they might slay them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356973" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi were encircled about <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> if by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fire</span>, even insomuch that they durst not lay their hands upon them for fear lest they should be burned. Nevertheless, Nephi and Lehi were not burned; and they were as standing in the midst of fire and were not burned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356974" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And when they saw that they were encircled about with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pillar</span> of fire, and that it burned them not, their hearts did take courage.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356975" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For they saw that the Lamanites durst not lay their hands upon them; neither durst they come near unto them, but stood as if they were struck dumb with amazement.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356976" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did stand forth and began to speak unto them, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Fear not</span>, for behold, it is God that has shown unto you this marvelous thing, in the which is shown unto you that ye cannot lay your hands on us to slay us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356977" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And behold, when they had said these words, the earth shook exceedingly, and the walls of the prison did shake as if they were about to tumble to the earth; but behold, they did not fall. And behold, they that were in the prison were Lamanites and Nephites who were dissenters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356978" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that they were overshadowed with a cloud of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span>, and an awful solemn fear came upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356979" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that there came a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> as if it were above the cloud of darkness, saying: Repent ye, repent ye, and seek no more to destroy my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>servants</span> whom I have sent unto you to declare good tidings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356980" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass when they heard this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span>, and beheld that it was not a voice of thunder, neither was it a voice of a great tumultuous noise, but behold, it was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>still voice</span> of perfect mildness, as if it had been a whisper, and it did pierce even to the very soul—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356981" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And notwithstanding the mildness of the voice, behold the earth shook exceedingly, and the walls of the prison trembled again, as if it were about to tumble to the earth; and behold the cloud of darkness, which had overshadowed them, did not disperse—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356982" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And behold the voice came again, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Repent</span> ye, repent ye, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand; and seek no more to destroy my servants. And it came to pass that the earth shook again, and the walls trembled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356983" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And also again the third time the voice came, and did speak unto them marvelous words which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cannot</span> be uttered by man; and the walls did tremble again, and the earth shook as if it were about to divide asunder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356984" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites could not flee because of the cloud of darkness which did overshadow them; yea, and also they were immovable because of the fear which did come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356985" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Now there was one among them who was a Nephite by birth, who had once belonged to the church of God but had dissented from them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356986" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that he turned him about, and behold, he saw through the cloud of darkness the faces of Nephi and Lehi; and behold, they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shine</span> exceedingly, <span class="page-break" data-page="380"></span>even as the faces of angels. And he beheld that they did lift their eyes to heaven; and they were in the attitude as if talking or lifting their voices to some being whom they beheld.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356987" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that this man did cry unto the multitude, that they might turn and look. And behold, there was power given unto them that they did turn and look; and they did behold the faces of Nephi and Lehi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356291" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And they said unto the man: Behold, what do all these things mean, and who is it with whom these men do converse?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356292" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Now the man’s name was Aminadab. And Aminadab said unto them: They do converse with the angels of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356293" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites said unto him: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>What</span> shall we do, that this cloud of darkness may be removed from overshadowing us?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356294" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And Aminadab said unto them: You must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span>, and cry unto the voice, even until ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in Christ, who was taught unto you by Alma, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Amulek</span>, and Zeezrom; and when ye shall do this, the cloud of darkness shall be removed from overshadowing you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356295" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And it came to pass that they all did begin to cry unto the voice of him who had shaken the earth; yea, they did cry even until the cloud of darkness was dispersed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356296" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And it came to pass that when they cast their eyes about, and saw that the cloud of darkness was dispersed from overshadowing them, behold, they saw that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>encircled</span> about, yea every soul, by a pillar of fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356297" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lehi</span> were in the midst of them; yea, they were encircled about; yea, they were as if in the midst of a flaming fire, yet it did harm them not, neither did it take hold upon the walls of the prison; and they were filled with that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>joy</span> which is unspeakable and full of glory.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356298" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Holy Spirit</span> of God did come down from heaven, and did enter into their hearts, and they were filled as if with fire, and they could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>speak</span> forth marvelous words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356299" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And it came to pass that there came a voice unto them, yea, a pleasant voice, as if it were a whisper, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356300" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Peace</span>, peace be unto you, because of your faith in my Well Beloved, who was from the foundation of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356301" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>And now, when they heard this they cast up their eyes as if to behold from whence the voice came; and behold, they saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heavens</span> open; and angels came down out of heaven and ministered unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356302" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>And there were about three hundred souls who saw and heard these things; and they were bidden to go forth and marvel not, neither should they doubt.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356303" id="p50"><span class="verse-number">50 </span>And it came to pass that they did go forth, and did minister unto the people, declaring throughout all the regions round about all the things which they had heard and seen, insomuch that the more part of the Lamanites were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note50a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>convinced</span> of them, because of the greatness of the evidences which they had received.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356304" id="p51"><span class="verse-number">51 </span>And as many as were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note51a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>convinced</span> did lay down their weapons of war, and also their hatred and the tradition of their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356305" id="p52"><span class="verse-number">52 </span>And it came to pass that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note52a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>yield</span> up unto the Nephites the lands of their possession.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356988" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="381"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356989" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356990" id="study_summary1">The righteous Lamanites preach to the wicked Nephites—Both peoples prosper during an era of peace and plenty—Lucifer, the author of sin, stirs up the hearts of the wicked and the Gadianton robbers in murder and wickedness—The robbers take over the Nephite government. About 29–23 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356991" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that when the sixty and second year of the reign of the judges had ended, all these things had happened and the Lamanites had become, the more part of them, a righteous people, insomuch that their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> did exceed that of the Nephites, because of their firmness and their steadiness in the faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356992" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, there were many of the Nephites who had become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hardened</span> and impenitent and grossly wicked, insomuch that they did reject the word of God and all the preaching and prophesying which did come among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356993" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Nevertheless, the people of the church did have great joy because of the conversion of the Lamanites, yea, because of the church of God, which had been established among them. And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fellowship</span> one with another, and did rejoice one with another, and did have great joy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356994" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that many of the Lamanites did come down into the land of Zarahemla, and did declare unto the people of the Nephites the manner of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conversion</span>, and did exhort them to faith and repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356995" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, and many did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> with exceedingly great power and authority, unto the bringing down many of them into the depths of humility, to be the humble followers of God and the Lamb.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356996" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that many of the Lamanites did go into the land northward; and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lehi</span> went into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land</span> northward, to preach unto the people. And thus ended the sixty and third year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356997" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold, there was peace in all the land, insomuch that the Nephites did go into whatsoever part of the land they would, whether among the Nephites or the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356998" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did also go whithersoever they would, whether it were among the Lamanites or among the Nephites; and thus they did have free intercourse one with another, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>buy</span> and to sell, and to get gain, according to their desire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356999" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they became exceedingly rich, both the Lamanites and the Nephites; and they did have an exceeding plenty of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span>, and of silver, and of all manner of precious metals, both in the land south and in the land north.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357000" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now the land south was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lehi</span>, and the land north was called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mulek</span>, which was after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>son</span> of Zedekiah; for the Lord did bring Mulek into the land north, and Lehi into the land south.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357001" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And behold, there was all manner of gold in both these lands, and of silver, and of precious ore of every kind; and there were also curious workmen, who did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>work</span> all kinds of ore and did refine it; and thus they did become rich.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357002" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>They did raise grain in abundance, both in the north and in the south; and they did flourish exceedingly, both in the north and in the <span class="page-break" data-page="382"></span>south. And they did multiply and wax exceedingly strong in the land. And they did raise many flocks and herds, yea, many fatlings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357003" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold their women did toil and spin, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>make</span> all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cloth</span>, of fine-twined linen and cloth of every kind, to clothe their nakedness. And thus the sixty and fourth year did pass away in peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357004" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And in the sixty and fifth year they did also have great joy and peace, yea, much preaching and many prophecies concerning that which was to come. And thus passed away the sixty and fifth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357005" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that in the sixty and sixth year of the reign of the judges, behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cezoram</span> was murdered by an unknown hand as he sat upon the judgment-seat. And it came to pass that in the same year, that his son, who had been appointed by the people in his stead, was also murdered. And thus ended the sixty and sixth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357006" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And in the commencement of the sixty and seventh year the people began to grow exceedingly wicked again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357007" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>For behold, the Lord had blessed them so long with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span> of the world that they had not been stirred up to anger, to wars, nor to bloodshed; therefore they began to set their hearts upon their riches; yea, they began to seek to get gain that they might be lifted up one above another; therefore they began to commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> murders, and to rob and to plunder, that they might get gain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357008" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And now behold, those murderers and plunderers were a band who had been formed by Kishkumen and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton</span>. And now it had come to pass that there were many, even among the Nephites, of Gadianton’s band. But behold, they were more numerous among the more wicked part of the Lamanites. And they were called Gadianton’s robbers and murderers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357009" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it was they who did murder the chief judge <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cezoram</span>, and his son, while in the judgment-seat; and behold, they were not found.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357010" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now it came to pass that when the Lamanites found that there were robbers among them they were exceedingly sorrowful; and they did use every means in their power to destroy them off the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357011" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But behold, Satan did stir up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> of the more part of the Nephites, insomuch that they did unite with those bands of robbers, and did enter into their covenants and their oaths, that they would protect and preserve one another in whatsoever difficult circumstances they should be placed, that they should not suffer for their murders, and their plunderings, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stealings</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357012" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that they did have their signs, yea, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> signs, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> words; and this that they might distinguish a brother who had entered into the covenant, that whatsoever wickedness his brother should do he should not be injured by his brother, nor by those who did belong to his band, who had taken this covenant.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357013" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And thus they might murder, and plunder, and steal, and commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whoredoms</span> and all manner of wickedness, contrary to the laws of their country and also the laws of their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357014" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And whosoever of those who belonged to their band should reveal unto the world of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> and their abominations, should be <span class="page-break" data-page="383"></span>tried, not according to the laws of their country, but according to the laws of their wickedness, which had been given by Gadianton and Kishkumen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357015" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now behold, it is these secret <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oaths</span> and covenants which Alma commanded his son should not go forth unto the world, lest they should be a means of bringing down the people unto destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357016" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now behold, those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> oaths and covenants did not come forth unto Gadianton from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span> which were delivered unto Helaman; but behold, they were put into the heart of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Gadianton</span> by that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>same</span> being who did entice our first parents to partake of the forbidden fruit—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357017" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, that same being who did plot with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Cain</span>, that if he would murder his brother Abel it should not be known unto the world. And he did plot with Cain and his followers from that time forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357018" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And also it is that same being who put it into the hearts of the people to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> a tower sufficiently high that they might get to heaven. And it was that same being who led on the people who came from that tower into this land; who spread the works of darkness and abominations over all the face of the land, until he dragged the people down to an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>entire</span> destruction, and to an everlasting hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357019" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, it is that same being who put it into the heart of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton</span> to still carry on the work of darkness, and of secret murder; and he has brought it forth from the beginning of man even down to this time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357020" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And behold, it is he who is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>author</span> of all sin. And behold, he doth carry on his works of darkness and secret murder, and doth hand down their plots, and their oaths, and their covenants, and their plans of awful wickedness, from generation to generation according as he can get hold upon the hearts of the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357021" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And now behold, he had got great hold upon the hearts of the Nephites; yea, insomuch that they had become exceedingly wicked; yea, the more part of them had turned out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>way</span> of righteousness, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trample</span> under their feet the commandments of God, and did turn unto their own ways, and did build up unto themselves <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>idols</span> of their gold and their silver.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357022" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that all these iniquities did come unto them in the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not many years</span>, insomuch that a more part of it had come unto them in the sixty and seventh year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357023" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And they did grow in their iniquities in the sixty and eighth year also, to the great sorrow and lamentation of the righteous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357024" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And thus we see that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephites</span> did begin to dwindle in unbelief, and grow in wickedness and abominations, while the Lamanites began to grow exceedingly in the knowledge of their God; yea, they did begin to keep his statutes and commandments, and to walk in truth and uprightness before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357025" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And thus we see that the Spirit of the Lord began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>withdraw</span> from the Nephites, because of the wickedness and the hardness of their hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357026" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And thus we see that the Lord began to pour out his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> upon the Lamanites, because of their <span class="page-break" data-page="384"></span>easiness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>willingness</span> to believe in his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357027" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did hunt the band of robbers of Gadianton; and they did preach the word of God among the more wicked part of them, insomuch that this band of robbers was utterly destroyed from among the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357028" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass on the other hand, that the Nephites did build them up and support them, beginning at the more wicked part of them, until they had overspread all the land of the Nephites, and had seduced the more part of the righteous until they had come down to believe in their works and partake of their spoils, and to join with them in their secret murders and combinations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357029" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And thus they did obtain the sole management of the government, insomuch that they did trample under their feet and smite and rend and turn their backs upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor</span> and the meek, and the humble followers of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357030" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And thus we see that they were in an awful state, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ripening</span> for an everlasting destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357031" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And it came to pass that thus ended the sixty and eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356326" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128356345" id="intro1"><span class="small-caps">The Prophecy of Nephi, the Son of Helaman</span>—God threatens the people of Nephi that he will visit them in his anger, to their utter destruction except they repent of their wickedness. God smiteth the people of Nephi with pestilence; they repent and turn unto him. Samuel, a Lamanite, prophesies unto the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128356347" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 7 through 16.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356348" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356350" id="study_summary1">Nephi is rejected in the north and returns to Zarahemla—He prays upon his garden tower and then calls upon the people to repent or perish. About 23–21 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356352" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass in the sixty and ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of the Nephites, that Nephi, the son of Helaman, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>returned</span> to the land of Zarahemla from the land northward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356354" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For he had been forth among the people who were in the land northward, and did preach the word of God unto them, and did prophesy many things unto them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356355" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reject</span> all his words, insomuch that he could not stay among them, but returned again unto the land of his nativity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356357" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And seeing the people in a state of such awful wickedness, and those Gadianton robbers filling the judgment-seats—having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>usurped</span> the power and authority of the land; laying aside the commandments of God, and not in the least aright before him; doing no justice unto the children of men;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356359" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Condemning the righteous because of their righteousness; letting the guilty and the wicked go <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unpunished</span> because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>money</span>; and moreover to be held in office at the head of government, to rule and do according to their wills, that they might get gain and glory of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>world</span>, and, moreover, that they might the more easily commit adultery, and steal, and kill, and do according to their own wills—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356360" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now this great iniquity had come upon the Nephites, in the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not many years</span>; and when Nephi saw it, his heart was swollen with sorrow within his breast; and he did exclaim in the agony of his soul:</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="385"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356362" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Oh, that I could have had my days in the days when my father Nephi first came out of the land of Jerusalem, that I could have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joyed</span> with him in the promised land;
