then were his people easy to be entreated, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>firm</span> to keep the commandments of God, and slow to be led to do iniquity; and they were quick to hearken unto the words of the Lord—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356364" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, if my days could have been in those days, then would my soul have had joy in the righteousness of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356366" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But behold, I am consigned that these are my days, and that my soul shall be filled with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorrow</span> because of this the wickedness of my brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356367" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And behold, now it came to pass that it was upon a tower, which was in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>garden</span> of Nephi, which was by the highway which led to the chief market, which was in the city of Zarahemla; therefore, Nephi had bowed himself upon the tower which was in his garden, which tower was also near unto the garden gate by which led the highway.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356369" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that there were certain men passing by and saw Nephi as he was pouring out his soul unto God upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tower</span>; and they ran and told the people what they had seen, and the people came together in multitudes that they might know the cause of so great mourning for the wickedness of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356371" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now, when Nephi arose he beheld the multitudes of people who had gathered together.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356373" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that he opened his mouth and said unto them: Behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>why</span> have ye gathered yourselves together? That I may tell you of your iniquities?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356374" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, because I have got upon my tower that I might pour out my soul unto my God, because of the exceeding sorrow of my heart, which is because of your iniquities!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356376" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And because of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span> and lamentation ye have gathered yourselves together, and do marvel; yea, and ye have great need to marvel; yea, ye ought to marvel because ye are given away that the devil has got so great hold upon your hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356378" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, how could you have given way to the enticing of him who is seeking to hurl away your souls down to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>everlasting</span> misery and endless wo?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356380" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>O repent ye, repent ye! <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Why</span> will ye die? Turn ye, turn ye unto the Lord your God. Why has he forsaken you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356381" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>It is because you have hardened your hearts; yea, ye will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearken</span> unto the voice of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>good shepherd</span>; yea, ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>provoked</span> him to anger against you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356383" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, instead of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathering</span> you, except ye will repent, behold, he shall scatter you forth that ye shall become meat for dogs and wild beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356385" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>O, how could you have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgotten</span> your God in the very day that he has delivered you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356387" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But behold, it is to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gain</span>, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praised</span> of men, yea, and that ye might get gold and silver. And ye have set your hearts upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>riches</span> and the vain things of this world, for the which ye do murder, and plunder, and steal, and bear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>false witness</span> against your neighbor, and do all manner of iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356388" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And for this cause <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> shall come unto you except ye shall repent. <span class="page-break" data-page="386"></span>For if ye will not repent, behold, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>great</span> city, and also all those great cities which are round about, which are in the land of our possession, shall be taken away that ye shall have no place in them; for behold, the Lord will not grant unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>strength</span>, as he has hitherto done, to withstand against your enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356390" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For behold, thus saith the Lord: I will not show unto the wicked of my strength, to one more than the other, save it be unto those who repent of their sins, and hearken unto my words. Now therefore, I would that ye should behold, my brethren, that it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> for the Lamanites than for you except ye shall repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356392" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, they are more righteous than you, for they have not sinned against that great knowledge which ye have received; therefore the Lord will be merciful unto them; yea, he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lengthen</span> out their days and increase their seed, even when thou shalt be utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyed</span> except thou shalt repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356394" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Yea, wo be unto you because of that great abomination which has come among you; and ye have united yourselves unto it, yea, to that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> band which was established by Gadianton!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356396" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> shall come unto you because of that pride which ye have suffered to enter your hearts, which has lifted you up beyond that which is good because of your exceedingly great riches!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356397" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, wo be unto you because of your wickedness and abominations!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356398" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And except ye repent ye shall perish; yea, even your lands shall be taken from you, and ye shall be destroyed from off the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356399" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Behold now, I do not say that these things shall be, of myself, because it is not of myself that I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> these things; but behold, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> that these things are true because the Lord God has made them known unto me, therefore I testify that they shall be.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357079" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357080" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357081" id="study_summary1">Corrupt judges seek to incite the people against Nephi—Abraham, Moses, Zenos, Zenock, Ezias, Isaiah, Jeremiah, Lehi, and Nephi all testified of Christ—By inspiration Nephi announces the murder of the chief judge. About 23–21 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357082" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that when Nephi had said these words, behold, there were men who were judges, who also belonged to the secret band of Gadianton, and they were angry, and they cried out against him, saying unto the people: Why do ye not seize upon this man and bring him forth, that he may be condemned according to the crime which he has done?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357083" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Why seest thou this man, and hearest him revile against this people and against our law?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357084" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For behold, Nephi had spoken unto them concerning the corruptness of their law; yea, many things did Nephi speak which cannot be written; and nothing did he speak which was contrary to the commandments of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357085" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And those judges were angry with him because he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spake</span> plainly unto them concerning their secret works of darkness; nevertheless, they durst not lay their own hands upon him, for they feared the people lest they should cry out against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357086" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore they did cry unto the people, saying: Why do you suffer this man to revile against us? For <span class="page-break" data-page="387"></span>behold he doth condemn all this people, even unto destruction; yea, and also that these our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> cities shall be taken from us, that we shall have no place in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357087" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now we know that this is impossible, for behold, we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>powerful</span>, and our cities great, therefore our enemies can have no power over us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357088" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that thus they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stir up</span> the people to anger against Nephi, and raised contentions among them; for there were some who did cry out: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Let</span> this man alone, for he is a good man, and those things which he saith will surely come to pass except we repent;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357089" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, behold, all the judgments will come upon us which he has testified unto us; for we know that he has testified aright unto us concerning our iniquities. And behold they are many, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> as well all things which shall befall us as he knoweth of our iniquities;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357090" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, and behold, if he had not been a prophet he could not have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testified</span> concerning those things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357091" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that those people who sought to destroy Nephi were compelled because of their fear, that they did not lay their hands on him; therefore he began again to speak unto them, seeing that he had gained favor in the eyes of some, insomuch that the remainder of them did fear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357092" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore he was constrained to speak more unto them saying: Behold, my brethren, have ye not read that God gave power unto one man, even Moses, to smite upon the waters of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Red Sea</span>, and they parted hither and thither, insomuch that the Israelites, who were our fathers, came through upon dry ground, and the waters closed upon the armies of the Egyptians and swallowed them up?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357093" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And now behold, if God gave unto this man such power, then why should ye dispute among yourselves, and say that he hath given unto me no power whereby I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> concerning the judgments that shall come upon you except ye repent?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357094" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But, behold, ye not only deny my words, but ye also deny all the words which have been spoken by our fathers, and also the words which were spoken by this man, Moses, who had such great power given unto him, yea, the words which he hath spoken concerning the coming of the Messiah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357095" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, did he not bear record that the Son of God should come? And as he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> the brazen serpent in the wilderness, even so shall he be lifted up who should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357096" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And as many as should look upon that serpent should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>live</span>, even so as many as should look upon the Son of God with faith, having a contrite spirit, might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>live</span>, even unto that life which is eternal.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357097" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now behold, Moses did not only testify of these things, but also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> the holy prophets, from his days even to the days of Abraham.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357098" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Yea, and behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Abraham</span> saw of his coming, and was filled with gladness and did rejoice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357099" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, and behold I say unto you, that Abraham not only knew of these things, but there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> before the days of Abraham who were called by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>order</span> of God; <span class="page-break" data-page="388"></span>yea, even after the order of his Son; and this that it should be shown unto the people, a great many thousand years before his coming, that even redemption should come unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357100" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now I would that ye should know, that even since the days of Abraham there have been many prophets that have testified these things; yea, behold, the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span> did testify boldly; for the which he was slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357101" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And behold, also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenock</span>, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Ezias</span>, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Isaiah</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Jeremiah</span>, (Jeremiah being that same prophet who testified of the destruction of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Jerusalem</span>) and now we know that Jerusalem was destroyed according to the words of Jeremiah. O then why not the Son of God come, according to his prophecy?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357102" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now will you dispute that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> was destroyed? Will ye say that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sons</span> of Zedekiah were not slain, all except it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Mulek</span>? Yea, and do ye not behold that the seed of Zedekiah are with us, and they were driven out of the land of Jerusalem? But behold, this is not all—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357103" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Our father Lehi was driven out of Jerusalem because he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>testified</span> of these things. Nephi also testified of these things, and also almost all of our fathers, even down to this time; yea, they have testified of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>coming</span> of Christ, and have looked forward, and have rejoiced in his day which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357104" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And behold, he is God, and he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>with them</span>, and he did manifest himself unto them, that they were redeemed by him; and they gave unto him glory, because of that which is to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357105" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, seeing ye know these things and cannot deny them except ye shall lie, therefore in this ye have sinned, for ye have rejected all these things, notwithstanding so many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evidences</span> which ye have received; yea, even ye have received <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> things, both things in heaven, and all things which are in the earth, as a witness that they are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357106" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But behold, ye have rejected the truth, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebelled</span> against your holy God; and even at this time, instead of laying up for yourselves <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>treasures</span> in heaven, where nothing doth corrupt, and where nothing can come which is unclean, ye are heaping up for yourselves wrath against the day of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judgment</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357107" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Yea, even at this time ye are ripening, because of your murders and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fornication</span> and wickedness, for everlasting destruction; yea, and except ye repent it will come unto you soon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357108" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, behold it is now even at your doors; yea, go ye in unto the judgment-seat, and search; and behold, your judge is murdered, and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lieth</span> in his blood; and he hath been murdered <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>by</span> his brother, who seeketh to sit in the judgment-seat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357109" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And behold, they both belong to your secret band, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>author</span> is Gadianton and the evil one who seeketh to destroy the souls of men.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356435" data-aid-version="5" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="389"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356436" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356437" id="study_summary1">Messengers find the chief judge dead at the judgment seat—They are imprisoned and later released—By inspiration Nephi identifies Seantum as the murderer—Nephi is accepted by some as a prophet. About 23–21 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356438" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that when Nephi had spoken these words, certain men who were among them ran to the judgment-seat; yea, even there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>five</span> who went, and they said among themselves, as they went:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356439" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, now we will know of a surety whether this man be a prophet and God hath commanded him to prophesy such marvelous things unto us. Behold, we do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> that he hath; yea, we do not believe that he is a prophet; nevertheless, if this thing which he has said concerning the chief judge be true, that he be dead, then will we believe that the other words which he has spoken are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356440" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that they ran in their might, and came in unto the judgment-seat; and behold, the chief judge had fallen to the earth, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lie</span> in his blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356441" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now behold, when they saw this they were astonished exceedingly, insomuch that they fell to the earth; for they had not believed the words which Nephi had spoken concerning the chief judge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356442" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But now, when they saw they believed, and fear came upon them lest all the judgments which Nephi had spoken <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>should</span> come upon the people; therefore they did quake, and had fallen to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356443" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, immediately when the judge had been murdered—he being stabbed by his brother by a garb of secrecy, and he fled, and the servants ran and told the people, raising the cry of murder among them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356444" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold the people did gather themselves together unto the place of the judgment-seat—and behold, to their astonishment they saw those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>five</span> men who had fallen to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356445" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now behold, the people knew nothing concerning the multitude who had gathered together at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>garden</span> of Nephi; therefore they said among themselves: These men are they who have murdered the judge, and God has smitten them that they could not flee from us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356446" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they laid hold on them, and bound them and cast them into prison. And there was a proclamation sent abroad that the judge was slain, and that the murderers had been taken and were cast into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356447" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that on the morrow the people did assemble themselves together to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span> and to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fast</span>, at the burial of the great chief judge who had been slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356448" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thus also those judges who were at the garden of Nephi, and heard his words, were also gathered together at the burial.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356449" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that they inquired among the people, saying: Where are the five who were sent to inquire concerning the chief judge whether he was dead? And they answered and said: Concerning this five whom ye say ye have sent, we know not; but there are five who are the murderers, whom we have cast into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356450" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that the judges desired that they should be brought; and they were brought, and behold they were the five who were sent; and behold the judges inquired of them to know concerning the matter, and they told them all that they had done, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356451" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>We ran and came to the place of the judgment-seat, and when we saw all things even as Nephi had testified, we were astonished <span class="page-break" data-page="390"></span>insomuch that we fell to the earth; and when we were recovered from our astonishment, behold they cast us into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356452" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now, as for the murder of this man, we know not who has done it; and only this much we know, we ran and came <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>according</span> as ye desired, and behold he was dead, according to the words of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356453" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now it came to pass that the judges did expound the matter unto the people, and did cry out against Nephi, saying: Behold, we know that this Nephi must have agreed with some one to slay the judge, and then he might declare it unto us, that he might convert us unto his faith, that he might raise himself to be a great man, chosen of God, and a prophet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356454" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now behold, we will detect this man, and he shall confess his fault and make known unto us the true murderer of this judge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356455" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that the five were liberated on the day of the burial. Nevertheless, they did rebuke the judges in the words which they had spoken against Nephi, and did contend with them one by one, insomuch that they did confound them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356456" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Nevertheless, they caused that Nephi should be taken and bound and brought before the multitude, and they began to question him in divers ways that they might cross him, that they might accuse him to death—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356457" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Saying unto him: Thou art confederate; who is this man that hath done this murder? Now tell us, and acknowledge thy fault; saying, Behold here is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>money</span>; and also we will grant unto thee thy life if thou wilt tell us, and acknowledge the agreement which thou hast made with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356458" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But Nephi said unto them: O ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fools</span>, ye uncircumcised of heart, ye blind, and ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, do ye know how long the Lord your God will suffer you that ye shall go on in this your way of sin?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356459" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>O ye ought to begin to howl and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span>, because of the great destruction which at this time doth await you, except ye shall repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356460" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Behold ye say that I have agreed with a man that he should murder Seezoram, our chief judge. But behold, I say unto you, that this is because I have testified unto you that ye might know concerning this thing; yea, even for a witness unto you, that I did know of the wickedness and abominations which are among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356461" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And because I have done this, ye say that I have agreed with a man that he should do this thing; yea, because I showed unto you this sign ye are angry with me, and seek to destroy my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356462" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now behold, I will show unto you another sign, and see if ye will in this thing seek to destroy me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356463" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Behold I say unto you: Go to the house of Seantum, who is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brother</span> of Seezoram, and say unto him—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356464" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Has Nephi, the pretended prophet, who doth prophesy so much evil concerning this people, agreed with thee, in the which ye have murdered Seezoram, who is your brother?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356465" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And behold, he shall say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356466" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And ye shall say unto him: Have ye murdered your brother?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356467" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And he shall stand with fear, and wist not what to say. And behold, he shall deny unto you; and he shall make as if he were astonished; nevertheless, he shall declare unto you that he is innocent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356468" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>But behold, ye shall examine <span class="page-break" data-page="391"></span>him, and ye shall find blood upon the skirts of his cloak.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356469" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And when ye have seen this, ye shall say: From whence cometh this blood? Do we not know that it is the blood of your brother?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356470" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And then shall he tremble, and shall look pale, even as if death had come upon him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356471" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And then shall ye say: Because of this fear and this paleness which has come upon your face, behold, we know that thou art guilty.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356472" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And then shall greater fear come upon him; and then shall he confess unto you, and deny no more that he has done this murder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356473" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And then shall he say unto you, that I, Nephi, know nothing concerning the matter save it were given unto me by the power of God. And then shall ye know that I am an honest man, and that I am sent unto you from God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356474" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that they went and did, even according as Nephi had said unto them. And behold, the words which he had said were true; for according to the words he did deny; and also according to the words he did confess.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356475" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And he was brought to prove that he himself was the very murderer, insomuch that the five were set at liberty, and also was Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356476" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And there were some of the Nephites who believed on the words of Nephi; and there were some also, who believed because of the testimony of the five, for they had been converted while they were in prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356477" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And now there were some among the people, who said that Nephi was a prophet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356478" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And there were others who said: Behold, he is a god, for except he was a god he could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> of all things. For behold, he has told us the thoughts of our hearts, and also has told us things; and even he has brought unto our knowledge the true murderer of our chief judge.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355903" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355925" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355927" id="study_summary1">The Lord gives Nephi the sealing power—He is empowered to bind and loose on earth and in heaven—He commands the people to repent or perish—The Spirit carries him from multitude to multitude. About 21–20 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355930" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that there arose a division among the people, insomuch that they divided hither and thither and went their ways, leaving Nephi alone, as he was standing in the midst of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355932" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi went his way towards his own house, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pondering</span> upon the things which the Lord had shown unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355935" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass as he was thus pondering—being much cast down because of the wickedness of the people of the Nephites, their secret works of darkness, and their murderings, and their plunderings, and all manner of iniquities—and it came to pass as he was thus pondering in his heart, behold, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> came unto him saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355937" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Blessed</span> art thou, Nephi, for those things which thou hast done; for I have beheld how thou hast with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unwearyingness</span> declared the word, which I have given unto thee, unto this people. And thou hast not feared them, and hast not sought thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>own life</span>, but hast sought my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span>, and to keep my commandments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355940" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now, because thou hast done this with such unwearyingness, behold, I will bless thee forever; and I will make thee mighty in word and in deed, in faith and in works; yea, even that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> things shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>done</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="392"></span>unto thee according to thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>word</span>, for thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>not</span> ask that which is contrary to my will.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355942" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, thou art Nephi, and I am God. Behold, I declare it unto thee in the presence of mine angels, that ye shall have power over this people, and shall smite the earth with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>famine</span>, and with pestilence, and destruction, according to the wickedness of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355945" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold, I give unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>, that whatsoever ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seal</span> on earth shall be sealed in heaven; and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven; and thus shall ye have power among this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355947" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus, if ye shall say unto this temple it shall be rent in twain, it shall be done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355950" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And if ye shall say unto this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mountain</span>, Be thou cast down and become smooth, it shall be done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355952" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And behold, if ye shall say that God shall smite this people, it shall come to pass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355955" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now behold, I command you, that ye shall go and declare unto this people, that thus saith the Lord God, who is the Almighty: Except ye repent ye shall be smitten, even unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355957" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And behold, now it came to pass that when the Lord had spoken these words unto Nephi, he did stop and did not go unto his own house, but did return unto the multitudes who were scattered about upon the face of the land, and began to declare unto them the word of the Lord which had been spoken unto him, concerning their destruction if they did not repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355960" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Now behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>notwithstanding</span> that great miracle which Nephi had done in telling them concerning the death of the chief judge, they did harden their hearts and did not hearken unto the words of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355962" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore Nephi did declare unto them the word of the Lord, saying: Except ye repent, thus saith the Lord, ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smitten</span> even unto destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355964" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that when Nephi had declared unto them the word, behold, they did still harden their hearts and would not hearken unto his words; therefore they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revile</span> against him, and did seek to lay their hands upon him that they might cast him into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355967" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But behold, the power of God was with him, and they could not take him to cast him into prison, for he was taken by the Spirit and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conveyed</span> away out of the midst of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355969" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that thus he did go forth in the Spirit, from multitude to multitude, declaring the word of God, even until he had declared it unto them all, or sent it forth among all the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355971" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they would not hearken unto his words; and there began to be contentions, insomuch that they were divided against themselves and began to slay one another with the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355974" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And thus ended the seventy and first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356005" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356006" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356007" id="study_summary1">Nephi persuades the Lord to replace their war with a famine—Many people perish—They repent, and Nephi importunes the Lord for rain—Nephi and Lehi receive many revelations—The Gadianton robbers entrench themselves in the land. About 20–6 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="393"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356008" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass in the seventy and second year of the reign of the judges that the contentions did increase, insomuch that there were wars throughout all the land among all the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356009" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it was this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> band of robbers who did carry on this work of destruction and wickedness. And this war did last all that year; and in the seventy and third year it did also last.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356010" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that in this year Nephi did cry unto the Lord, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356011" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>O Lord, do not suffer that this people shall be destroyed by the sword; but O Lord, rather <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>let</span> there be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>famine</span> in the land, to stir them up in remembrance of the Lord their God, and perhaps they will repent and turn unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356012" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And so it was done, according to the words of Nephi. And there was a great famine upon the land, among all the people of Nephi. And thus in the seventy and fourth year the famine did continue, and the work of destruction did cease by the sword but became sore by famine.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356013" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And this work of destruction did also continue in the seventy and fifth year. For the earth was smitten that it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dry</span>, and did not yield forth grain in the season of grain; and the whole earth was smitten, even among the Lamanites as well as among the Nephites, so that they were smitten that they did perish by thousands in the more wicked parts of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356014" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that the people saw that they were about to perish by famine, and they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> the Lord their God; and they began to remember the words of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356015" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>began</span> to plead with their chief judges and their leaders, that they would say unto Nephi: Behold, we know that thou art a man of God, and therefore cry unto the Lord our God that he turn away from us this famine, lest all the words which thou hast spoken concerning our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356016" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that the judges did say unto Nephi, according to the words which had been desired. And it came to pass that when Nephi saw that the people had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repented</span> and did humble themselves in sackcloth, he cried again unto the Lord, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356017" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>O Lord, behold this people repenteth; and they have swept away the band of Gadianton from amongst them insomuch that they have become extinct, and they have concealed their secret plans in the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356018" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now, O Lord, because of this their humility wilt thou turn away thine anger, and let thine anger be appeased in the destruction of those wicked men whom thou hast already destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356019" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>O Lord, wilt thou turn away thine anger, yea, thy fierce anger, and cause that this famine may cease in this land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356020" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O Lord, wilt thou hearken unto me, and cause that it may be done according to my words, and send forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rain</span> upon the face of the earth, that she may bring forth her fruit, and her grain in the season of grain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356021" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>O Lord, thou didst hearken unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my words</span> when I said, Let there be a famine, that the pestilence of the sword might cease; and I know that thou wilt, even at this time, hearken unto my words, for thou saidst that: If this people repent I will spare them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356022" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, O Lord, and thou seest that they have repented, because of the famine and the pestilence and <span class="page-break" data-page="394"></span>destruction which has come unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356023" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now, O Lord, wilt thou turn away thine anger, and try again if they will serve thee? And if so, O Lord, thou canst bless them according to thy words which thou hast said.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356024" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that in the seventy and sixth year the Lord did turn away his anger from the people, and caused that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rain</span> should fall upon the earth, insomuch that it did bring forth her fruit in the season of her fruit. And it came to pass that it did bring forth her grain in the season of her grain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356025" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And behold, the people did rejoice and glorify God, and the whole face of the land was filled with rejoicing; and they did no more seek to destroy Nephi, but they did esteem him as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> prophet, and a man of God, having great power and authority given unto him from God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356026" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, Lehi, his brother, was not a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whit</span> behind him as to things pertaining to righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356027" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And thus it did come to pass that the people of Nephi began to prosper again in the land, and began to build up their waste places, and began to multiply and spread, even until they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cover</span> the whole face of the land, both on the northward and on the southward, from the sea west to the sea east.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356028" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the seventy and sixth year did end in peace. And the seventy and seventh year began in peace; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> did spread throughout the face of all the land; and the more part of the people, both the Nephites and the Lamanites, did belong to the church; and they did have exceedingly great peace in the land; and thus ended the seventy and seventh year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356029" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And also they had peace in the seventy and eighth year, save it were a few contentions concerning the points of doctrine which had been laid down by the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356030" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And in the seventy and ninth year there began to be much strife. But it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi, and many of their brethren who knew concerning the true points of doctrine, having many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revelations</span> daily, therefore they did preach unto the people, insomuch that they did put an end to their strife in that same year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356031" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that in the eightieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, there were a certain number of the dissenters from the people of Nephi, who had some years before gone over unto the Lamanites, and taken upon themselves the name of Lamanites, and also a certain number who were real descendants of the Lamanites, being stirred up to anger by them, or by those dissenters, therefore they commenced a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>war</span> with their brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356032" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And they did commit murder and plunder; and then they would retreat back into the mountains, and into the wilderness and secret places, hiding themselves that they could not be discovered, receiving daily an addition to their numbers, inasmuch as there were dissenters that went forth unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356033" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And thus in time, yea, even in the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not many years</span>, they became an exceedingly great band of robbers; and they did search out all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> plans of Gadianton; and thus they became robbers of Gadianton.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356034" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Now behold, these robbers did make great havoc, yea, even great destruction among the people of Nephi, and also among the people of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="395"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356035" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that it was expedient that there should be a stop put to this work of destruction; therefore they sent an army of strong men into the wilderness and upon the mountains to search out this band of robbers, and to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356036" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>But behold, it came to pass that in that same year they were driven back even into their own lands. And thus ended the eightieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356037" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass in the commencement of the eighty and first year they did go forth again against this band of robbers, and did destroy many; and they were also visited with much destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356038" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And they were again obliged to return out of the wilderness and out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mountains</span> unto their own lands, because of the exceeding greatness of the numbers of those robbers who infested the mountains and the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356039" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that thus ended this year. And the robbers did still increase and wax strong, insomuch that they did defy the whole armies of the Nephites, and also of the Lamanites; and they did cause great fear to come unto the people upon all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354660" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Yea, for they did visit many parts of the land, and did do great destruction unto them; yea, did kill many, and did carry away others captive into the wilderness, yea, and more especially their women and their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354661" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Now this great evil, which came unto the people because of their iniquity, did stir them up again in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remembrance</span> of the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354662" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And thus ended the eighty and first year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354663" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And in the eighty and second year they began again to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forget</span> the Lord their God. And in the eighty and third year they began to wax strong in iniquity. And in the eighty and fourth year they did not mend their ways.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354664" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass in the eighty and fifth year they did wax stronger and stronger in their pride, and in their wickedness; and thus they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ripening</span> again for destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354665" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And thus ended the eighty and fifth year.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354644" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354645" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354646" id="study_summary1">Men are unstable and foolish and quick to do evil—The Lord chastens His people—The nothingness of men is compared with the power of God—In the day of judgment, men will gain everlasting life or everlasting damnation. About 6 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354647" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And thus we can behold how false, and also the unsteadiness of the hearts of the children of men; yea, we can see that the Lord in his great infinite goodness doth bless and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span> those who put their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trust</span> in him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354648" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, and we may see at the very <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> when he doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prosper</span> his people, yea, in the increase of their fields, their flocks and their herds, and in gold, and in silver, and in all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>precious</span> things of every kind and art; sparing their lives, and delivering them out of the hands of their enemies; softening the hearts of their enemies that they should not declare wars against them; yea, and in fine, doing all things for the welfare and happiness of his people; yea, then is the time that they do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>harden</span> their hearts, and do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>forget</span> the Lord their God, and do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>trample</span> under their feet the <span class="page-break" data-page="396"></span>Holy One—yea, and this because of their ease, and their exceedingly great prosperity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354649" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And thus we see that except the Lord doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chasten</span> his people with many afflictions, yea, except he doth visit them with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> and with terror, and with famine and with all manner of pestilence, they will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remember</span> him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354650" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>O how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>foolish</span>, and how vain, and how evil, and devilish, and how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quick</span> to do iniquity, and how slow to do good, are the children of men; yea, how quick to hearken unto the words of the evil one, and to set their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearts</span> upon the vain things of the world!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354651" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Yea, how quick to be lifted up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span>; yea, how quick to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>boast</span>, and do all manner of that which is iniquity; and how slow are they to remember the Lord their God, and to give ear unto his counsels, yea, how slow to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>walk</span> in wisdom’s paths!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354652" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, they do not desire that the Lord their God, who hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>created</span> them, should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rule</span> and reign over them; notwithstanding his great goodness and his mercy towards them, they do set at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>naught</span> his counsels, and they will not that he should be their guide.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354653" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>O how great is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nothingness</span> of the children of men; yea, even they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>less</span> than the dust of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354654" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For behold, the dust of the earth moveth hither and thither, to the dividing asunder, at the command of our great and everlasting God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354655" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Yea, behold at his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> do the hills and the mountains tremble and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>quake</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354656" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of his voice they are broken up, and become smooth, yea, even like unto a valley.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354657" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, by the power of his voice doth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whole</span> earth shake;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354658" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, by the power of his voice, do the foundations rock, even to the very center.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354659" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, and if he say unto the earth—Move—it is moved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356040" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, if he say unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>earth</span>—Thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>go back</span>, that it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lengthen</span> out the day for many hours—it is done;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356041" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And thus, according to his word the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>earth</span> goeth back, and it appeareth unto man that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sun</span> standeth still; yea, and behold, this is so; for surely it is the earth that moveth and not the sun.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356042" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And behold, also, if he say unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>waters</span> of the great deep—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Be</span> thou dried up—it is done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356043" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Behold, if he say unto this mountain—Be thou raised up, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> over and fall upon that city, that it be buried up—behold it is done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356044" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And behold, if a man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> up a treasure in the earth, and the Lord shall say—Let it be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>accursed</span>, because of the iniquity of him who hath hid it up—behold, it shall be accursed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356045" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And if the Lord shall say—Be thou accursed, that no man shall find thee from this time henceforth and forever—behold, no man getteth it henceforth and forever.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="397"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356046" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And behold, if the Lord shall say unto a man—Because of thine iniquities, thou shalt be accursed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forever</span>—it shall be done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356047" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And if the Lord shall say—Because of thine iniquities thou shalt be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cut off</span> from my presence—he will cause that it shall be so.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356048" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And wo unto him to whom he shall say this, for it shall be unto him that will do iniquity, and he cannot be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saved</span>; therefore, for this cause, that men might be saved, hath repentance been declared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356049" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Therefore, blessed are they who will repent and hearken unto the voice of the Lord their God; for these are they that shall be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356050" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And may God grant, in his great fulness, that men might be brought unto repentance and good works, that they might be restored unto grace for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grace</span>, according to their works.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356051" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And I would that all men might be saved. But we read that in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and last day there are some who shall be cast out, yea, who shall be cast off from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>presence</span> of the Lord;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356052" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Yea, who shall be consigned to a state of endless misery, fulfilling the words which say: They that have done good shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>everlasting life</span>; and they that have done evil shall have everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>damnation</span>. And thus it is. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354689" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128354690" id="intro1">The prophecy of Samuel, the Lamanite, to the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128354691" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 13 through 15.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354692" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354693" id="study_summary1">Samuel the Lamanite prophesies the destruction of the Nephites unless they repent—They and their riches are cursed—They reject and stone the prophets, are encircled about by demons, and seek for happiness in doing iniquity. About 6 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354694" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass in the eighty and sixth year, the Nephites did still remain in wickedness, yea, in great wickedness, while the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span> did observe strictly to keep the commandments of God, according to the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354695" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that in this year there was one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Samuel</span>, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamanite</span>, came into the land of Zarahemla, and began to preach unto the people. And it came to pass that he did preach, many days, repentance unto the people, and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cast</span> him out, and he was about to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>return</span> to his own land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354696" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> of the Lord came unto him, that he should return again, and prophesy unto the people whatsoever things should come into his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heart</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354697" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that they would not suffer that he should enter into the city; therefore he went and got upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wall</span> thereof, and stretched forth his hand and cried with a loud voice, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophesied</span> unto the people whatsoever things the Lord put into his heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354698" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And he said unto them: Behold, I, Samuel, a Lamanite, do speak the words of the Lord which he doth put into my heart; and behold he hath put it into my heart to say unto this people that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of justice hangeth over this people; and four hundred years pass not away save the sword of justice falleth upon this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354699" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, heavy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> awaiteth <span class="page-break" data-page="398"></span>this people, and it surely cometh unto this people, and nothing can save this people save it be repentance and faith on the Lord Jesus Christ, who surely shall come into the world, and shall suffer many things and shall be slain for his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354700" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold, an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> of the Lord hath declared it unto me, and he did bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glad</span> tidings to my soul. And behold, I was sent unto you to declare it unto you also, that ye might have glad tidings; but behold ye would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not receive</span> me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354701" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Therefore, thus saith the Lord: Because of the hardness of the hearts of the people of the Nephites, except they repent I will take away my word from them, and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>withdraw</span> my Spirit from them, and I will suffer them no longer, and I will turn the hearts of their brethren against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354702" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>four hundred</span> years shall not pass away before I will cause that they shall be smitten; yea, I will visit them with the sword and with famine and with pestilence.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354703" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Yea, I will visit them in my fierce anger, and there shall be those of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fourth</span> generation who shall live, of your enemies, to behold your utter destruction; and this shall surely come except ye repent, saith the Lord; and those of the fourth generation shall visit your destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354704" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But if ye will repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>return</span> unto the Lord your God I will turn away mine anger, saith the Lord; yea, thus saith the Lord, blessed are they who will repent and turn unto me, but wo unto him that repenteth not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354705" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> unto this great city of Zarahemla; for behold, it is because of those who are righteous that it is saved; yea, wo unto this great city, for I perceive, saith the Lord, that there are many, yea, even the more part of this great city, that will harden their hearts against me, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354706" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But blessed are they who will repent, for them will I spare. But behold, if it were not for the righteous who are in this great city, behold, I would cause that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fire</span> should come down out of heaven and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354707" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>But behold, it is for the righteous’ sake that it is spared.
