But behold, the time cometh, saith the Lord, that when ye shall cast out the righteous from among you, then shall ye be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ripe</span> for destruction; yea, wo be unto this great city, because of the wickedness and abominations which are in her.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354708" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, and wo be unto the city of Gideon, for the wickedness and abominations which are in her.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354709" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, and wo be unto all the cities which are in the land round about, which are possessed by the Nephites, because of the wickedness and abominations which are in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354710" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And behold, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> shall come upon the land, saith the Lord of Hosts, because of the people’s sake who are upon the land, yea, because of their wickedness and their abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354711" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it shall come to pass, saith the Lord of Hosts, yea, our great and true God, that whoso shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> up treasures in the earth shall find them again no more, because of the great curse of the land, save he be a righteous man and shall hide it up unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354712" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For I will, saith the Lord, that they shall hide up their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>treasures</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="399"></span>unto me; and cursed be they who hide not up their treasures unto me; for none hideth up their treasures unto me save it be the righteous; and he that hideth not up his treasures unto me, cursed is he, and also the treasure, and none shall redeem it because of the curse of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354713" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the day shall come that they shall hide up their treasures, because they have set their hearts upon riches; and because they have set their hearts upon their riches, and will hide up their treasures when they shall flee before their enemies; because they will not hide them up unto me, cursed be they and also their treasures; and in that day shall they be smitten, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354714" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold ye, the people of this great city, and hearken unto my words; yea, hearken unto the words which the Lord saith; for behold, he saith that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cursed</span> because of your riches, and also are your riches cursed because ye have set your hearts upon them, and have not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearkened</span> unto the words of him who gave them unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354715" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Ye do not remember the Lord your God in the things with which he hath blessed you, but ye do always remember your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span>, not to thank the Lord your God for them; yea, your hearts are not drawn out unto the Lord, but they do swell with great pride, unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>boasting</span>, and unto great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>swelling</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>envyings</span>, strifes, malice, persecutions, and murders, and all manner of iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354716" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>For this cause hath the Lord God caused that a curse should come upon the land, and also upon your riches, and this because of your iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354717" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Yea, wo unto this people, because of this time which has arrived, that ye do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast out</span> the prophets, and do mock them, and cast stones at them, and do slay them, and do all manner of iniquity unto them, even as they did of old time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354718" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now when ye talk, ye say: If our days had been in the days of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fathers</span> of old, we would not have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>slain</span> the prophets; we would not have stoned them, and cast them out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354719" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Behold ye are worse than they; for as the Lord liveth, if a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophet</span> come among you and declareth unto you the word of the Lord, which testifieth of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sins</span> and iniquities, ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>angry</span> with him, and cast him out and seek all manner of ways to destroy him; yea, you will say that he is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>false</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>prophet</span>, and that he is a sinner, and of the devil, because he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>testifieth</span> that your deeds are evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354720" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>But behold, if a man shall come among you and shall say: Do this, and there is no iniquity; do that and ye shall not suffer; yea, he will say: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Walk</span> after the pride of your own hearts; yea, walk after the pride of your eyes, and do whatsoever your heart desireth—and if a man shall come among you and say this, ye will receive him, and say that he is a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophet</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354721" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Yea, ye will lift him up, and ye will give unto him of your substance; ye will give unto him of your gold, and of your silver, and ye will clothe him with costly apparel; and because he speaketh <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flattering</span> words unto you, and he saith that all is <span class="page-break" data-page="400"></span>well, then ye will not find fault with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354722" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>O ye wicked and ye perverse generation; ye hardened and ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, how long will ye suppose that the Lord will suffer you? Yea, how long will ye suffer yourselves to be led by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>foolish</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blind</span> guides? Yea, how long will ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>choose</span> darkness rather than <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>light</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354723" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Yea, behold, the anger of the Lord is already kindled against you; behold, he hath cursed the land because of your iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354724" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And behold, the time cometh that he curseth your riches, that they become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slippery</span>, that ye cannot hold them; and in the days of your poverty ye cannot retain them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354725" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And in the days of your poverty ye shall cry unto the Lord; and in vain shall ye cry, for your desolation is already come upon you, and your destruction is made sure; and then shall ye weep and howl in that day, saith the Lord of Hosts. And then shall ye lament, and say:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354726" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>that</span> I had repented, and had not killed the prophets, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stoned</span> them, and cast them out. Yea, in that day ye shall say: O that we had remembered the Lord our God in the day that he gave us our riches, and then they would not have become slippery that we should lose them; for behold, our riches are gone from us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354727" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Behold, we lay a tool here and on the morrow it is gone; and behold, our swords are taken from us in the day we have sought them for battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354728" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Yea, we have hid up our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>treasures</span> and they have slipped away from us, because of the curse of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354729" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>O that we had repented in the day that the word of the Lord came unto us; for behold the land is cursed, and all things are become slippery, and we cannot hold them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354730" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Behold, we are surrounded by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>demons</span>, yea, we are encircled about by the angels of him who hath sought to destroy our souls. Behold, our iniquities are great. O Lord, canst thou not turn away thine anger from us? And this shall be your language in those days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354731" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>But behold, your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>days</span> of probation are past; ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>procrastinated</span> the day of your salvation until it is everlastingly too late, and your destruction is made sure; yea, for ye have sought all the days of your lives for that which ye could not obtain; and ye have sought for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>happiness</span> in doing iniquity, which thing is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>contrary</span> to the nature of that righteousness which is in our great and Eternal Head.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354732" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>O ye people of the land, that ye would hear my words! And I pray that the anger of the Lord be turned away from you, and that ye would repent and be saved.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356097" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356098" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356099" id="study_summary1">Samuel predicts light during the night and a new star at Christ’s birth—Christ redeems men from temporal and spiritual death—The signs of His death include three days of darkness, the rending of the rocks, and great upheavals of nature. About 6 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356100" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Samuel</span>, the Lamanite, did prophesy a great many more things which cannot be written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356101" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And behold, he said unto them: Behold, I give unto you a sign; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>five</span> years more cometh, and behold, then cometh the Son of God <span class="page-break" data-page="401"></span>to redeem all those who shall believe on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356102" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And behold, this will I give unto you for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span> at the time of his coming; for behold, there shall be great lights in heaven, insomuch that in the night before he cometh there shall be no darkness, insomuch that it shall appear unto man as if it was day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356103" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore, there shall be one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> and a night and a day, as if it were one day and there were no night; and this shall be unto you for a sign; for ye shall know of the rising of the sun and also of its setting; therefore they shall know of a surety that there shall be two days and a night; nevertheless the night shall not be darkened; and it shall be the night before he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>born</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356104" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And behold, there shall a new <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>star</span> arise, such an one as ye never have beheld; and this also shall be a sign unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356105" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And behold this is not all, there shall be many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>signs</span> and wonders in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356106" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it shall come to pass that ye shall all be amazed, and wonder, insomuch that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fall</span> to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356107" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> on the Son of God, the same shall have everlasting life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356108" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, thus hath the Lord commanded me, by his angel, that I should come and tell this thing unto you; yea, he hath commanded that I should prophesy these things unto you; yea, he hath said unto me: Cry unto this people, repent and prepare the way of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356109" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, because I am a Lamanite, and have spoken unto you the words which the Lord hath commanded me, and because it was hard against you, ye are angry with me and do seek to destroy me, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> me out from among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356110" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hear</span> my words, for, for this intent have I come up upon the walls of this city, that ye might hear and know of the judgments of God which do await you because of your iniquities, and also that ye might know the conditions of repentance;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356111" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And also that ye might know of the coming of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Father</span> of heaven and of earth, the Creator of all things from the beginning; and that ye might know of the signs of his coming, to the intent that ye might believe on his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356112" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> on his name ye will repent of all your sins, that thereby ye may have a remission of them through his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>merits</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356113" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold, again, another sign I give unto you, yea, a sign of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356114" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For behold, he surely must die that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salvation</span> may come; yea, it behooveth him and becometh expedient that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dieth</span>, to bring to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead, that thereby men may be brought into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>presence</span> of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356115" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, behold, this death bringeth to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redeemeth</span> all mankind from the first death—that spiritual death; for all mankind, by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fall</span> of Adam being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>cut off</span> from the presence of <span class="page-break" data-page="402"></span>the Lord, are considered as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>dead</span>, both as to things temporal and to things spiritual.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356116" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But behold, the resurrection of Christ <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redeemeth</span> mankind, yea, even all mankind, and bringeth them back into the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356117" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, and it bringeth to pass the condition of repentance, that whosoever repenteth the same is not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hewn</span> down and cast into the fire; but whosoever repenteth not is hewn down and cast into the fire; and there cometh upon them again a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spiritual death</span>, yea, a second death, for they are cut off again as to things pertaining to righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356118" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Therefore repent ye, repent ye, lest by knowing these things and not doing them ye shall suffer yourselves to come under condemnation, and ye are brought down unto this second death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356120" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, as I said unto you concerning another <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span>, a sign of his death, behold, in that day that he shall suffer death the sun shall be darkened and refuse to give his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> unto you; and also the moon and the stars; and there shall be no light upon the face of this land, even from the time that he shall suffer death, for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>three</span> days, to the time that he shall rise again from the dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356121" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Yea, at the time that he shall yield up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ghost</span> there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thunderings</span> and lightnings for the space of many hours, and the earth shall shake and tremble; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rocks</span> which are upon the face of this earth, which are both above the earth and beneath, which ye know at this time are solid, or the more part of it is one solid mass, shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>broken up</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356122" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Yea, they shall be rent in twain, and shall ever after be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>found</span> in seams and in cracks, and in broken fragments upon the face of the whole earth, yea, both above the earth and beneath.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356123" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And behold, there shall be great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tempests</span>, and there shall be many mountains laid low, like unto a valley, and there shall be many places which are now called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>valleys</span> which shall become mountains, whose height is great.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356124" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> highways shall be broken up, and many cities shall become desolate.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356125" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>graves</span> shall be opened, and shall yield up many of their dead; and many saints shall appear unto many.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356126" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And behold, thus hath the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angel</span> spoken unto me; for he said unto me that there should be thunderings and lightnings for the space of many hours.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356127" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And he said unto me that while the thunder and the lightning lasted, and the tempest, that these things should be, and that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span> should cover the face of the whole earth for the space of three days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356128" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And the angel said unto me that many shall see greater things than these, to the intent that they might believe that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these signs</span> and these wonders should come to pass upon all the face of this land, to the intent that there should be no cause for unbelief among the children of men—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356129" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And this to the intent that whosoever will believe might be saved, and that whosoever will not believe, <span class="page-break" data-page="403"></span>a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteous judgment</span> might come upon them; and also if they are condemned they bring upon themselves their own condemnation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356130" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now remember, remember, my brethren, that whosoever perisheth, perisheth unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>himself</span>; and whosoever doeth iniquity, doeth it unto himself; for behold, ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>free</span>; ye are permitted to act for yourselves; for behold, God hath given unto you a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>knowledge</span> and he hath made you free.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356131" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>He hath given unto you that ye might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> good from evil, and he hath given unto you that ye might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>choose</span> life or death; and ye can do good and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restored</span> unto that which is good, or have that which is good restored unto you; or ye can do evil, and have that which is evil restored unto you.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128356119" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128356139" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128356141" id="study_summary1">The Lord chastened the Nephites because He loved them—Converted Lamanites are firm and steadfast in the faith—The Lord will be merciful unto the Lamanites in the latter days. About 6 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356143" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, behold, I declare unto you that except ye shall repent your houses shall be left unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desolate</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356144" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Yea, except ye repent, your women shall have great cause to mourn in the day that they shall give suck; for ye shall attempt to flee and there shall be no place for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>refuge</span>; yea, and wo unto them which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>with</span> child, for they shall be heavy and cannot flee; therefore, they shall be trodden down and shall be left to perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356146" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, wo unto this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> who are called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>people</span> of Nephi except they shall repent, when they shall see all these signs and wonders which shall be showed unto them; for behold, they have been a chosen people of the Lord; yea, the people of Nephi hath he loved, and also hath he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chastened</span> them; yea, in the days of their iniquities hath he chastened them because he loveth them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356148" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But behold my brethren, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span> hath he hated because their deeds have been evil continually, and this because of the iniquity of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tradition</span> of their fathers. But behold, salvation hath come unto them through the preaching of the Nephites; and for this intent hath the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prolonged</span> their days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356150" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I would that ye should behold that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> part of them are in the path of their duty, and they do walk circumspectly before God, and they do observe to keep his commandments and his statutes and his judgments according to the law of Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356151" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, I say unto you, that the more part of them are doing this, and they are striving with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unwearied diligence</span> that they may bring the remainder of their brethren to the knowledge of the truth; therefore there are many who do add to their numbers daily.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356153" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold, ye do know of yourselves, for ye have witnessed it, that as many of them as are brought to the knowledge of the truth, and to know of the wicked and abominable traditions of their fathers, and are led to believe the holy scriptures, yea, the prophecies of the holy prophets, which are written, which <span class="page-break" data-page="404"></span>leadeth them to faith on the Lord, and unto repentance, which faith and repentance bringeth a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>change</span> of heart unto them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356155" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Therefore, as many as have come to this, ye know of yourselves are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>firm</span> and steadfast in the faith, and in the thing wherewith they have been made free.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356157" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And ye know also that they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>buried</span> their weapons of war, and they fear to take them up lest by any means they should sin; yea, ye can see that they fear to sin—for behold they will suffer themselves that they be trodden down and slain by their enemies, and will not lift their swords against them, and this because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356158" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steadfastness</span> when they do believe in that thing which they do believe, for because of their firmness when they are once enlightened, behold, the Lord shall bless them and prolong their days, notwithstanding their iniquity—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356160" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Yea, even if they should dwindle in unbelief the Lord shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prolong</span> their days, until the time shall come which hath been spoken of by our fathers, and also by the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zenos</span>, and many other prophets, concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>restoration</span> of our brethren, the Lamanites, again to the knowledge of the truth—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356162" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Yea, I say unto you, that in the latter times the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promises</span> of the Lord have been extended to our brethren, the Lamanites; and notwithstanding the many afflictions which they shall have, and notwithstanding they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>driven</span> to and fro upon the face of the earth, and be hunted, and shall be smitten and scattered abroad, having no place for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>refuge</span>, the Lord shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>merciful</span> unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356164" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And this is according to the prophecy, that they shall again be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brought</span> to the true knowledge, which is the knowledge of their Redeemer, and their great and true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shepherd</span>, and be numbered among his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sheep</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356166" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore I say unto you, it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>better</span> for them than for you except ye repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356168" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>had</span> the mighty works been shown unto them which have been shown unto you, yea, unto them who have dwindled in unbelief because of the traditions of their fathers, ye can see of yourselves that they never would again have dwindled in unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356170" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, saith the Lord: I will not utterly destroy them, but I will cause that in the day of my wisdom they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>return</span> again unto me, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128356172" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now behold, saith the Lord, concerning the people of the Nephites: If they will not repent, and observe to do my will, I will utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> them, saith the Lord, because of their unbelief notwithstanding the many mighty works which I have done among them; and as surely as the Lord liveth shall these things be, saith the Lord.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Helaman 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354790" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/hel/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Helaman 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354791" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354792" id="study_summary1">The Nephites who believe Samuel are baptized by Nephi—Samuel cannot be slain with the arrows and stones of the unrepentant Nephites—Some harden their hearts, and others see angels—The unbelievers say it is not reasonable to believe in Christ and His coming in Jerusalem. About 6–1 <small>B.C.</small></p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="405"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354793" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, it came to pass that there were many who heard the words of Samuel, the Lamanite, which he spake upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walls</span> of the city. And as many as believed on his word went forth and sought for Nephi; and when they had come forth and found him they confessed unto him their sins and denied not, desiring that they might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354794" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But as many as there were who did not believe in the words of Samuel were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> with him; and they cast stones at him upon the wall, and also many shot arrows at him as he stood upon the wall; but the Spirit of the Lord was with him, insomuch that they could not hit him with their stones neither with their arrows.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354795" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now when they saw that they could not hit him, there were many more who did believe on his words, insomuch that they went away unto Nephi to be baptized.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354796" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For behold, Nephi was baptizing, and prophesying, and preaching, crying repentance unto the people, showing signs and wonders, working <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> among the people, that they might know that the Christ must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shortly</span> come—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354797" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Telling them of things which must shortly come, that they might know and remember at the time of their coming that they had been made known unto them beforehand, to the intent that they might believe; therefore as many as believed on the words of Samuel went forth unto him to be baptized, for they came repenting and confessing their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354798" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> part of them did not believe in the words of Samuel; therefore when they saw that they could not hit him with their stones and their arrows, they cried unto their captains, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Take</span> this fellow and bind him, for behold he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hath</span> a devil; and because of the power of the devil which is in him we cannot hit him with our stones and our arrows; therefore take him and bind him, and away with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354799" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And as they went forth to lay their hands on him, behold, he did cast himself down from the wall, and did flee out of their lands, yea, even unto his own country, and began to preach and to prophesy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>among</span> his own people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354800" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, he was never heard of more among the Nephites; and thus were the affairs of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354801" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And thus ended the eighty and sixth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354802" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And thus ended also the eighty and seventh year of the reign of the judges, the more part of the people remaining in their pride and wickedness, and the lesser part walking more circumspectly before God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354803" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And these were the conditions also, in the eighty and eighth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354804" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And there was but little alteration in the affairs of the people, save it were the people began to be more hardened in iniquity, and do more and more of that which was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contrary</span> to the commandments of God, in the eighty and ninth year of the reign of the judges.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354805" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But it came to pass in the ninetieth year of the reign of the judges, there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great signs</span> given unto the people, and wonders; and the words of the prophets <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>began</span> to be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354806" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> did appear unto men, wise men, and did declare unto them glad tidings of great joy; thus in this year the scriptures began to be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354807" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Nevertheless, the people began to harden their hearts, all save it were the most believing part of them, both of the Nephites and also of the <span class="page-break" data-page="406"></span>Lamanites, and began to depend upon their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>own</span> strength and upon their own wisdom, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354808" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Some things they may have guessed right, among so many; but behold, we know that all these great and marvelous works cannot come to pass, of which has been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354809" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they began to reason and to contend among themselves, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354810" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>That it is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> reasonable that such a being as a Christ shall come; if so, and he be the Son of God, the Father of heaven and of earth, as it has been spoken, why will he not show himself unto us as well as unto them who shall be at Jerusalem?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354811" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Yea, why will he not show himself in this land as well as in the land of Jerusalem?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354812" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, we know that this is a wicked <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tradition</span>, which has been handed down unto us by our fathers, to cause us that we should believe in some great and marvelous thing which should come to pass, but not among us, but in a land which is far distant, a land which we know not; therefore they can keep us in ignorance, for we cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>witness</span> with our own eyes that they are true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354813" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they will, by the cunning and the mysterious arts of the evil one, work some great mystery which we cannot understand, which will keep us down to be servants to their words, and also servants unto them, for we depend upon them to teach us the word; and thus will they keep us in ignorance if we will yield ourselves unto them, all the days of our lives.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354814" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And many more things did the people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>imagine</span> up in their hearts, which were foolish and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vain</span>; and they were much disturbed, for Satan did stir them up to do iniquity continually; yea, he did go about spreading <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rumors</span> and contentions upon all the face of the land, that he might harden the hearts of the people against that which was good and against that which should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354815" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And notwithstanding the signs and the wonders which were wrought among the people of the Lord, and the many miracles which they did, Satan did get great hold upon the hearts of the people upon all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354816" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And thus ended the ninetieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354817" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> thus ended the book of Helaman, according to the record of Helaman and his sons.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345642" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128345643" id="title1"><span class="dominant">Third Nephi</span></h1>^N			<h1 data-aid="128345644" id="title2"><span class="dominant">The Book of Nephi</span> <br />the Son of Nephi, Who Was the Son of Helaman</h1>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128345645" id="intro1">And Helaman was the son of Helaman, who was the son of Alma, who was the son of Alma, being a descendant of Nephi who was the son of Lehi, who came out of Jerusalem in the first year of the reign of Zedekiah, the king of Judah.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345646" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345647" id="study_summary1">Nephi, the son of Helaman, departs out of the land, and his son Nephi keeps the records—Though signs and wonders abound, the wicked plan to slay the righteous—The night of Christ’s birth arrives—The sign is given, and a <span class="page-break" data-page="407"></span>new star arises—Lyings and deceivings increase, and the Gadianton robbers slaughter many. About <small>A.D.</small> 1–4.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345648" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now it came to pass that the ninety and first year had passed away and it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>six hundred</span> years from the time that Lehi left Jerusalem; and it was in the year that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lachoneus</span> was the chief judge and the governor over the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345649" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>, the son of Helaman, had departed out of the land of Zarahemla, giving charge unto his son <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nephi</span>, who was his eldest son, concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plates of brass</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>all</span> the records which had been kept, and all those things which had been kept sacred from the departure of Lehi out of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345650" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Then he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>departed</span> out of the land, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whither</span> he went, no man knoweth; and his son Nephi did keep the records in his stead, yea, the record of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345651" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that in the commencement of the ninety and second year, behold, the prophecies of the prophets began to be fulfilled more fully; for there began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>greater</span> signs and greater miracles wrought among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345652" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But there were some who began to say that the time was past for the words to be fulfilled, which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spoken</span> by Samuel, the Lamanite.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345653" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejoice</span> over their brethren, saying: Behold the time is past, and the words of Samuel are not fulfilled; therefore, your joy and your faith concerning this thing hath been vain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345654" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that they did make a great uproar throughout the land; and the people who believed began to be very sorrowful, lest by any means those things which had been spoken might not come to pass.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345655" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But behold, they did watch steadfastly for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>that day</span> and that night and that day which should be as one day as if there were no night, that they might know that their faith had not been vain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345656" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now it came to pass that there was a day set apart by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelievers</span>, that all those who believed in those traditions should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>put to death</span> except the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sign</span> should come to pass, which had been given by Samuel the prophet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345657" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Now it came to pass that when Nephi, the son of Nephi, saw this wickedness of his people, his heart was exceedingly sorrowful.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345658" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that he went out and bowed himself down upon the earth, and cried mightily to his God in behalf of his people, yea, those who were about to be destroyed because of their faith in the tradition of their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345659" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that he cried mightily unto the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> that day; and behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>voice</span> of the Lord came unto him, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345660" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Lift up your head and be of good cheer; for behold, the time is at hand, and on this night shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span> be given, and on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>morrow</span> come I into the world, to show unto the world that I will fulfil all that which I have caused to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>spoken</span> by the mouth of my holy prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345661" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto my own, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fulfil</span> all things which I have made known unto the children of men from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foundation</span> of the <span class="page-break" data-page="408"></span>world, and to do the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>both</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>of</span> the Father and of the Son—of the Father because of me, and of the Son because of my flesh. And behold, the time is at hand, and this night shall the sign be given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345662" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that the words which came unto Nephi were fulfilled, according as they had been spoken; for behold, at the going down of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sun</span> there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no</span> darkness; and the people began to be astonished because there was no darkness when the night came.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345663" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And there were many, who had not believed the words of the prophets, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fell</span> to the earth and became as if they were dead, for they knew that the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plan</span> of destruction which they had laid for those who believed in the words of the prophets had been frustrated; for the sign which had been given was already at hand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345664" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they began to know that the Son of God must shortly appear; yea, in fine, all the people upon the face of the whole earth from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>west</span> to the east, both in the land north and in the land south, were so exceedingly astonished that they fell to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345665" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For they knew that the prophets had testified of these things for many years, and that the sign which had been given was already at hand; and they began to fear because of their iniquity and their unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345666" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that there was no darkness in all that night, but it was as light as though it was mid-day. And it came to pass that the sun did rise in the morning again, according to its proper order; and they knew that it was the day that the Lord should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>born</span>, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sign</span> which had been given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345667" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it had come to pass, yea, all things, every whit, according to the words of the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345668" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass also that a new <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>star</span> did appear, according to the word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345669" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that from this time forth there began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lyings</span> sent forth among the people, by Satan, to harden their hearts, to the intent that they might not believe in those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>signs</span> and wonders which they had seen; but notwithstanding these lyings and deceivings the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>more</span> part of the people did believe, and were converted unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345670" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi went forth among the people, and also many others, baptizing unto repentance, in the which there was a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remission</span> of sins. And thus the people began again to have peace in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345671" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And there were no contentions, save it were a few that began to preach, endeavoring to prove by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scriptures</span> that it was no more expedient to observe the law of Moses. Now in this thing they did err, having not understood the scriptures.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345672" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>But it came to pass that they soon became converted, and were convinced of the error which they were in, for it was made known unto them that the law was not yet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfilled</span>, and that it must be fulfilled in every whit; yea, the word came unto them that it must be fulfilled; yea, that one jot or tittle should not pass away till it should all be fulfilled; therefore in this same year were they brought to a knowledge of their error and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>confess</span> their faults.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345673" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And thus the ninety and second <span class="page-break" data-page="409"></span>year did pass away, bringing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glad</span> tidings unto the people because of the signs which did come to pass, according to the words of the prophecy of all the holy prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345674" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that the ninety and third year did also pass away in peace, save it were for the Gadianton robbers, who dwelt upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mountains</span>, who did infest the land; for so strong were their holds and their secret places that the people could not overpower them; therefore they did commit many murders, and did do much slaughter among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345675" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that in the ninety and fourth year they began to increase in a great degree, because there were many dissenters of the Nephites who did flee unto them, which did cause much sorrow unto those Nephites who did remain in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345676" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And there was also a cause of much sorrow among the Lamanites; for behold, they had many children who did grow up and began to wax strong in years, that they became for themselves, and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led away</span> by some who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zoramites</span>, by their lyings and their flattering words, to join those Gadianton robbers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345677" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And thus were the Lamanites afflicted also, and began to decrease as to their faith and righteousness, because of the wickedness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rising</span> generation.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348943" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348944" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348945" id="study_summary1">Wickedness and abominations increase among the people—The Nephites and Lamanites unite to defend themselves against the Gadianton robbers—Converted Lamanites become white and are called Nephites. About <small>A.D.</small> 5–16.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348946" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that thus passed away the ninety and fifth year also, and the people began to forget those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>signs</span> and wonders which they had heard, and began to be less and less astonished at a sign or a wonder from heaven, insomuch that they began to be hard in their hearts, and blind in their minds, and began to disbelieve all which they had heard and seen—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348947" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Imagining</span> up some vain thing in their hearts, that it was wrought by men and by the power of the devil, to lead away and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deceive</span> the hearts of the people; and thus did Satan get possession of the hearts of the people again, insomuch that he did blind their eyes and lead them away to believe that the doctrine of Christ was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>foolish</span> and a vain thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348948" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that the people began to wax strong in wickedness and abominations; and they did not believe that there should be any more signs or wonders given; and Satan did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> about, leading away the hearts of the people, tempting them and causing them that they should do great wickedness in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348949" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And thus did pass away the ninety and sixth year; and also the ninety and seventh year; and also the ninety and eighth year; and also the ninety and ninth year;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348950" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And also an hundred years had passed away since the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mosiah</span>, who was king over the people of the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348951" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And six hundred and nine years had passed away since Lehi left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348952" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And nine years had passed away from the time when the sign was given, which was spoken of by the prophets, that Christ should come into the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348953" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the Nephites began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reckon</span> their time from this period <span class="page-break" data-page="410"></span>when the sign was given, or from the coming of Christ; therefore, nine years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348954" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And Nephi, who was the father of Nephi, who had the charge of the records, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>did</span> not return to the land of Zarahemla, and could nowhere be found in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348955" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the people did still <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remain</span> in wickedness, notwithstanding the much preaching and prophesying which was sent among them; and thus passed away the tenth year also; and the eleventh year also passed away in iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348956" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass in the thirteenth year there began to be wars and contentions throughout all the land; for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton robbers</span> had become so <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>numerous</span>, and did slay so many of the people, and did lay waste so many cities, and did spread so much death and carnage throughout the land, that it became expedient that all the people, both the Nephites and the Lamanites, should take up arms against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348957" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore, all the Lamanites who had become converted unto the Lord did unite with their brethren, the Nephites, and were compelled, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>safety</span> of their lives and their women and their children, to take up arms against those Gadianton robbers, yea, and also to maintain their rights, and the privileges of their church and of their worship, and their freedom and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348958" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that before this thirteenth year had passed away the Nephites were threatened with utter destruction because of this war, which had become exceedingly sore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348959" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that those Lamanites who had united with the Nephites were numbered among the Nephites;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348960" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> was taken from them, and their skin became <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>white</span> like unto the Nephites;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348961" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And their young men and their daughters became exceedingly fair, and they were numbered among the Nephites, and were called Nephites. And thus ended the thirteenth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348962" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass in the commencement of the fourteenth year, the war between the robbers and the people of Nephi did continue and did become exceedingly sore; nevertheless, the people of Nephi did gain some advantage of the robbers, insomuch that they did drive them back out of their lands into the mountains and into their secret places.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348963" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And thus ended the fourteenth year. And in the fifteenth year they did come forth against the people of Nephi; and because of the wickedness of the people of Nephi, and their many contentions and dissensions, the Gadianton robbers did gain many advantages over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348964" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And thus ended the fifteenth year, and thus were the people in a state of many afflictions; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of destruction did hang over them, insomuch that they were about to be smitten down by it, and this because of their iniquity.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349302" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349303" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349304" id="study_summary1">Giddianhi, the Gadianton leader, demands that Lachoneus and the Nephites surrender themselves and their lands—Lachoneus appoints Gidgiddoni as chief captain of the armies—The Nephites assemble in Zarahemla and Bountiful to defend themselves. About <small>A.D.</small> 16–18.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349305" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that in the sixteenth year from the coming of Christ, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lachoneus</span>, the governor of the land, received an epistle from <span class="page-break" data-page="411"></span>the leader and the governor of this band of robbers; and these were the words which were written, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349306" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Lachoneus, most noble and chief governor of the land, behold, I write this epistle unto you, and do give unto you exceedingly great praise because of your firmness, and also the firmness of your people, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>maintaining</span> that which ye suppose to be your right and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span>; yea, ye do stand well, as if ye were supported by the hand of a god, in the defence of your liberty, and your property, and your country, or that which ye do call so.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349307" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it seemeth a pity unto me, most noble Lachoneus, that ye should be so foolish and vain as to suppose that ye can stand against so many brave men who are at my command, who do now at this time stand in their arms, and do await with great anxiety for the word—Go down upon the Nephites and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349308" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I, knowing of their unconquerable spirit, having proved them in the field of battle, and knowing of their everlasting hatred towards you because of the many wrongs which ye have done unto them, therefore if they should come down against you they would visit you with utter destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349309" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore I have written this epistle, sealing it with mine own hand, feeling for your welfare, because of your firmness in that which ye believe to be right, and your noble spirit in the field of battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349310" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Therefore I write unto you, desiring that ye would yield up unto this my people, your cities, your lands, and your possessions, rather than that they should visit you with the sword and that destruction should come upon you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349311" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Or in other words, yield yourselves up unto us, and unite with us and become acquainted with our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> works, and become our brethren that ye may be like unto us—not our slaves, but our brethren and partners of all our substance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349312" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swear</span> unto you, if ye will do this, with an oath, ye shall not be destroyed; but if ye will not do this, I swear unto you with an oath, that on the morrow month I will command that my armies shall come down against you, and they shall not stay their hand and shall spare not, but shall slay you, and shall let fall the sword upon you even until ye shall become extinct.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349313" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Giddianhi</span>; and I am the governor of this the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret society</span> of Gadianton; which society and the works thereof I know to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>good</span>; and they are of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>ancient</span> date and they have been handed down unto us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349314" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And I write this epistle unto you, Lachoneus, and I hope that ye will deliver up your lands and your possessions, without the shedding of blood, that this my people may recover their rights and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>government</span>, who have dissented away from you because of your wickedness in retaining from them their rights of government, and except ye do this, I will avenge their wrongs. I am Giddianhi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349315" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now it came to pass when Lachoneus received this epistle he was exceedingly astonished, because of the boldness of Giddianhi demanding the possession of the land of the Nephites, and also of threatening the people and avenging the wrongs of those that had received no wrong, save it were they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wronged</span> themselves by dissenting away unto those wicked and abominable robbers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349316" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now behold, this Lachoneus, <span class="page-break" data-page="412"></span>the governor, was a just man, and could not be frightened by the demands and the threatenings of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>robber</span>; therefore he did not hearken to the epistle of Giddianhi, the governor of the robbers, but he did cause that his people should cry unto the Lord for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span> against the time that the robbers should come down against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349317" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Yea, he sent a proclamation among all the people, that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gather</span> together their women, and their children, their flocks and their herds, and all their substance, save it were their land, unto one place.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349318" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And he caused that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fortifications</span> should be built round about them, and the strength thereof should be exceedingly great.
