And he caused that armies, both of the Nephites and of the Lamanites, or of all them who were numbered among the Nephites, should be placed as guards round about to watch them, and to guard them from the robbers day and night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349319" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, he said unto them: As the Lord liveth, except ye repent of all your iniquities, and cry unto the Lord, ye will in nowise be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered</span> out of the hands of those Gadianton robbers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349320" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And so great and marvelous were the words and prophecies of Lachoneus that they did cause fear to come upon all the people; and they did exert themselves in their might to do according to the words of Lachoneus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349321" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that Lachoneus did appoint chief captains over all the armies of the Nephites, to command them at the time that the robbers should come down out of the wilderness against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349322" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now the chiefest among all the chief captains and the great commander of all the armies of the Nephites was appointed, and his name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gidgiddoni</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349323" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Now it was the custom among all the Nephites to appoint for their chief captains, (save it were in their times of wickedness) some one that had the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spirit</span> of revelation and also prophecy; therefore, this Gidgiddoni was a great prophet among them, as also was the chief judge.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349324" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now the people said unto Gidgiddoni: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Pray</span> unto the Lord, and let us go up upon the mountains and into the wilderness, that we may fall upon the robbers and destroy them in their own lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349325" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>But Gidgiddoni saith unto them: The Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forbid</span>; for if we should go up against them the Lord would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> us into their hands; therefore we will prepare ourselves in the center of our lands, and we will gather all our armies together, and we will not go against them, but we will wait till they shall come against us; therefore as the Lord liveth, if we do this he will deliver them into our hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349326" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass in the seventeenth year, in the latter end of the year, the proclamation of Lachoneus had gone forth throughout all the face of the land, and they had taken their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span>, and their chariots, and their cattle, and all their flocks, and their herds, and their grain, and all their substance, and did march forth by thousands and by tens of thousands, until they had all gone forth to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>place</span> which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>had</span> been appointed that they should gather themselves together, to defend themselves against their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349327" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> which was <span class="page-break" data-page="413"></span>appointed was the land of Zarahemla, and the land which was between the land Zarahemla and the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Bountiful</span>, yea, to the line which was between the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land Bountiful</span> and the land Desolation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349328" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And there were a great many thousand people who were called Nephites, who did gather themselves together in this land. Now Lachoneus did cause that they should gather themselves together in the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>southward</span>, because of the great curse which was upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> northward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349329" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And they did fortify themselves against their enemies; and they did dwell in one land, and in one body, and they did fear the words which had been spoken by Lachoneus, insomuch that they did repent of all their sins; and they did put up their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> unto the Lord their God, that he would deliver them in the time that their enemies should come down against them to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349330" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And they were exceedingly sorrowful because of their enemies. And Gidgiddoni did cause that they should make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weapons</span> of war of every kind, and they should be strong with armor, and with shields, and with bucklers, after the manner of his instruction.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348765" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348766" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348767" id="study_summary1">The Nephite armies defeat the Gadianton robbers—Giddianhi is slain, and his successor, Zemnarihah, is hanged—The Nephites praise the Lord for their victories. About <small>A.D.</small> 19–22.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348768" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that in the latter end of the eighteenth year those armies of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>robbers</span> had prepared for battle, and began to come down and to sally forth from the hills, and out of the mountains, and the wilderness, and their strongholds, and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> places, and began to take possession of the lands, both which were in the land south and which were in the land north, and began to take possession of all the lands which had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deserted</span> by the Nephites, and the cities which had been left desolate.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348769" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But behold, there were no wild beasts nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>game</span> in those lands which had been deserted by the Nephites, and there was no game for the robbers save it were in the wilderness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348770" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the robbers could not exist save it were in the wilderness, for the want of food; for the Nephites had left their lands desolate, and had gathered their flocks and their herds and all their substance, and they were in one body.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348771" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore, there was no chance for the robbers to plunder and to obtain food, save it were to come up in open battle against the Nephites; and the Nephites being in one body, and having so great a number, and having reserved for themselves provisions, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span> and cattle, and flocks of every kind, that they might subsist for the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seven</span> years, in the which time they did hope to destroy the robbers from off the face of the land; and thus the eighteenth year did pass away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348772" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that in the nineteenth year Giddianhi found that it was expedient that he should go up to battle against the Nephites, for there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no</span> way that they could subsist save it were to plunder and rob and murder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348773" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they durst not spread themselves upon the face of the land insomuch that they could raise grain, lest the Nephites should come upon <span class="page-break" data-page="414"></span>them and slay them; therefore Giddianhi gave commandment unto his armies that in this year they should go up to battle against the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348774" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that they did come up to battle; and it was in the sixth month; and behold, great and terrible was the day that they did come up to battle; and they were girded about after the manner of robbers; and they had a lamb-skin about their loins, and they were dyed in blood, and their heads were shorn, and they had head-plates upon them; and great and terrible was the appearance of the armies of Giddianhi, because of their armor, and because of their being dyed in blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348775" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the armies of the Nephites, when they saw the appearance of the army of Giddianhi, had all fallen to the earth, and did lift their cries to the Lord their God, that he would spare them and deliver them out of the hands of their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348776" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that when the armies of Giddianhi saw this they began to shout with a loud voice, because of their joy, for they had supposed that the Nephites had fallen with fear because of the terror of their armies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348777" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But in this thing they were disappointed, for the Nephites did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fear</span> them; but they did fear their God and did supplicate him for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>protection</span>; therefore, when the armies of Giddianhi did rush upon them they were prepared to meet them; yea, in the strength of the Lord they did receive them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348778" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the battle commenced in this the sixth month; and great and terrible was the battle thereof, yea, great and terrible was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slaughter</span> thereof, insomuch that there never was known so great a slaughter among all the people of Lehi since he left Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348779" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And notwithstanding the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>threatenings</span> and the oaths which Giddianhi had made, behold, the Nephites did beat them, insomuch that they did fall back from before them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348780" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gidgiddoni</span> commanded that his armies should pursue them as far as the borders of the wilderness, and that they should not spare any that should fall into their hands by the way; and thus they did pursue them and did slay them, to the borders of the wilderness, even until they had fulfilled the commandment of Gidgiddoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348781" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Giddianhi, who had stood and fought with boldness, was pursued as he fled; and being weary because of his much fighting he was overtaken and slain. And thus was the end of Giddianhi the robber.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348782" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that the armies of the Nephites did return again to their place of security. And it came to pass that this nineteenth year did pass away, and the robbers did not come again to battle; neither did they come again in the twentieth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348783" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And in the twenty and first year they did not come up to battle, but they came up on all sides to lay siege round about the people of Nephi; for they did suppose that if they should cut off the people of Nephi from their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lands</span>, and should hem them in on every side, and if they should cut them off from all their outward privileges, that they could cause them to yield themselves up according to their wishes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348784" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now they had appointed unto themselves another leader, whose name was Zemnarihah; therefore it was Zemnarihah that did cause that this siege should take place.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348785" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But behold, this was an advantage to the Nephites; for it was impossible for the robbers to lay <span class="page-break" data-page="415"></span>siege sufficiently long to have any effect upon the Nephites, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>much</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>provision</span> which they had laid up in store,</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348786" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And because of the scantiness of provisions among the robbers; for behold, they had nothing save it were meat for their subsistence, which meat they did obtain in the wilderness;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348787" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wild</span> game became scarce in the wilderness insomuch that the robbers were about to perish with hunger.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348788" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the Nephites were continually marching out by day and by night, and falling upon their armies, and cutting them off by thousands and by tens of thousands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348789" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And thus it became the desire of the people of Zemnarihah to withdraw from their design, because of the great destruction which came upon them by night and by day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348790" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that Zemnarihah did give command unto his people that they should withdraw themselves from the siege, and march into the furthermost parts of the land northward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348791" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, Gidgiddoni being aware of their design, and knowing of their weakness because of the want of food, and the great slaughter which had been made among them, therefore he did send out his armies in the night-time, and did cut off the way of their retreat, and did place his armies in the way of their retreat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348792" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And this did they do in the night-time, and got on their march beyond the robbers, so that on the morrow, when the robbers began their march, they were met by the armies of the Nephites both in their front and in their rear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348793" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the robbers who were on the south were also cut off in their places of retreat. And all these things were done by command of Gidgiddoni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348794" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And there were many thousands who did yield themselves up prisoners unto the Nephites, and the remainder of them were slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348795" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And their leader, Zemnarihah, was taken and hanged upon a tree, yea, even upon the top thereof until he was dead. And when they had hanged him until he was dead they did fell the tree to the earth, and did cry with a loud voice, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348796" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>May the Lord preserve his people in righteousness and in holiness of heart, that they may cause to be felled to the earth all who shall seek to slay them because of power and secret combinations, even as this man hath been felled to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348797" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And they did rejoice and cry again with one voice, saying: May the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>God</span> of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, protect this people in righteousness, so long as they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> on the name of their God for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>protection</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348798" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that they did break forth, all as one, in singing, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>praising</span> their God for the great thing which he had done for them, in preserving them from falling into the hands of their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348799" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Yea, they did cry: Hosanna to the Most High God. And they did cry: Blessed be the name of the Lord God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Almighty</span>, the Most High God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348800" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And their hearts were swollen with joy, unto the gushing out of many tears, because of the great goodness of God in delivering them out of the hands of their enemies; and they knew it was because of their repentance and their humility that they had been delivered from an everlasting destruction.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349822" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="416"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349823" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349824" id="study_summary1">The Nephites repent and forsake their sins—Mormon writes the history of his people and declares the everlasting word to them—Israel will be gathered in from her long dispersion. About <small>A.D.</small> 22–26.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349825" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now behold, there was not a living soul among all the people of the Nephites who did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doubt</span> in the least the words of all the holy prophets who had spoken; for they knew that it must needs be that they must be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349826" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they knew that it must be expedient that Christ had come, because of the many signs which had been given, according to the words of the prophets; and because of the things which had come to pass already they knew that it must needs be that all things should come to pass according to that which had been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349827" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore they did forsake all their sins, and their abominations, and their whoredoms, and did serve God with all diligence day and night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349828" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now it came to pass that when they had taken all the robbers prisoners, insomuch that none did escape who were not slain, they did cast their prisoners into prison, and did cause the word of God to be preached unto them; and as many as would repent of their sins and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enter</span> into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> that they would murder no more were set at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>liberty</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349829" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But as many as there were who did not enter into a covenant, and who did still continue to have those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span> murders in their hearts, yea, as many as were found breathing out threatenings against their brethren were condemned and punished according to the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349830" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And thus they did put an end to all those wicked, and secret, and abominable combinations, in the which there was so much wickedness, and so many murders committed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349831" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And thus had the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twenty and second</span> year passed away, and the twenty and third year also, and the twenty and fourth, and the twenty and fifth; and thus had twenty and five years passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349832" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And there had many things transpired which, in the eyes of some, would be great and marvelous; nevertheless, they cannot all be written in this book; yea, this book cannot contain even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hundredth</span> part of what was done among so many people in the space of twenty and five years;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349833" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But behold there are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>records</span> which do contain <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> the proceedings of this people; and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>shorter</span> but true account was given by Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349834" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Therefore I have made my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of these things according to the record of Nephi, which was engraven on the plates which were called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates of Nephi</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349835" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And behold, I do make the record on plates which I have made with mine own hands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349836" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And behold, I am called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mormon</span>, being called after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land of Mormon</span>, the land in which Alma did establish the church among the people, yea, the first church which was established among them after their transgression.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349837" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, I am a disciple of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. I have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span> of him to declare his word among his people, that they might have everlasting life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349838" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it hath become expedient that I, according to the will of God, that the prayers of those who have <span class="page-break" data-page="417"></span>gone hence, who were the holy ones, should be fulfilled according to their faith, should make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of these things which have been done—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349839" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Yea, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>small</span> record of that which hath taken place from the time that Lehi left Jerusalem, even down until the present time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349840" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore I do make my record from the accounts which have been given by those who were before me, until the commencement of my day;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349841" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And then I do make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of the things which I have seen with mine own eyes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349842" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I know the record which I make to be a just and a true record; nevertheless there are many things which, according to our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span>, we are not able to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349843" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now I make an end of my saying, which is of myself, and proceed to give my account of the things which have been before me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349844" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>I am Mormon, and a pure <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>descendant</span> of Lehi. I have reason to bless my God and my Savior Jesus Christ, that he brought our fathers out of the land of Jerusalem, (and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no one</span> knew it save it were himself and those whom he brought out of that land) and that he hath given me and my people so much knowledge unto the salvation of our souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349845" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Surely he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blessed</span> the house of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jacob</span>, and hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>merciful</span> unto the seed of Joseph.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349846" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>insomuch</span> as the children of Lehi have kept his commandments he hath blessed them and prospered them according to his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349847" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Yea, and surely shall he again bring a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of Joseph to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knowledge</span> of the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349848" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And as surely as the Lord liveth, will he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gather</span> in from the four quarters of the earth all the remnant of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seed</span> of Jacob, who are scattered abroad upon all the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349849" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And as he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenanted</span> with all the house of Jacob, even so shall the covenant wherewith he hath covenanted with the house of Jacob be fulfilled in his own due time, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restoring</span> all the house of Jacob unto the knowledge of the covenant that he hath covenanted with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349850" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And then shall they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> their Redeemer, who is Jesus Christ, the Son of God; and then shall they be gathered in from the four quarters of the earth unto their own lands, from whence they have been dispersed; yea, as the Lord liveth so shall it be. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349884" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349885" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349886" id="study_summary1">The Nephites prosper—Pride, wealth, and class distinctions arise—The Church is rent with dissensions—Satan leads the people in open rebellion—Many prophets cry repentance and are slain—Their murderers conspire to take over the government. About <small>A.D.</small> 26–30.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349887" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that the people of the Nephites did all return to their own lands in the twenty and sixth year, every man, with his family, his flocks and his herds, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span> and his cattle, and all <span class="page-break" data-page="418"></span>things whatsoever did belong unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349888" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> eaten up all their provisions; therefore they did take with them all that they had not devoured, of all their grain of every kind, and their gold, and their silver, and all their precious things, and they did return to their own lands and their possessions, both on the north and on the south, both on the land northward and on the land southward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349889" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they granted unto those robbers who had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>entered</span> into a covenant to keep the peace of the land, who were desirous to remain Lamanites, lands, according to their numbers, that they might have, with their labors, wherewith to subsist upon; and thus they did establish peace in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349890" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And they began again to prosper and to wax great; and the twenty and sixth and seventh years passed away, and there was great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span> in the land; and they had formed their laws according to equity and justice.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349891" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And now there was nothing in all the land to hinder the people from prospering continually, except they should fall into transgression.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349892" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gidgiddoni</span>, and the judge, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lachoneus</span>, and those who had been appointed leaders, who had established this great peace in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349893" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that there were many cities built anew, and there were many old cities repaired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349894" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And there were many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>highways</span> cast up, and many roads made, which led from city to city, and from land to land, and from place to place.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349895" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And thus passed away the twenty and eighth year, and the people had continual peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349896" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But it came to pass in the twenty and ninth year there began to be some disputings among the people; and some were lifted up unto pride and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boastings</span> because of their exceedingly great riches, yea, even unto great persecutions;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349897" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For there were many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merchants</span> in the land, and also many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lawyers</span>, and many officers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349898" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And the people began to be distinguished by ranks, according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>riches</span> and their chances for learning; yea, some were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ignorant</span> because of their poverty, and others did receive great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>learning</span> because of their riches.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349899" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Some were lifted up in pride, and others were exceedingly humble; some did return railing for railing, while others would receive railing and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persecution</span> and all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>afflictions</span>, and would not turn and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>revile</span> again, but were humble and penitent before God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349900" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And thus there became a great inequality in all the land, insomuch that the church began to be broken up; yea, insomuch that in the thirtieth year the church was broken up in all the land save it were among a few of the Lamanites who were converted unto the true faith; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> would not depart from it, for they were firm, and steadfast, and immovable, willing with all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>diligence</span> to keep the commandments of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349901" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Now the cause of this iniquity of the people was this—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Satan</span> had great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span>, unto the stirring up of the people to do all manner of iniquity, and to the puffing them up <span class="page-break" data-page="419"></span>with pride, tempting them to seek for power, and authority, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>riches</span>, and the vain things of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349902" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And thus Satan did lead away the hearts of the people to do all manner of iniquity; therefore they had enjoyed peace but a few years.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349903" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And thus, in the commencement of the thirtieth year—the people having been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delivered up</span> for the space of a long time to be carried about by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>temptations</span> of the devil whithersoever he desired to carry them, and to do whatsoever iniquity he desired they should—and thus in the commencement of this, the thirtieth year, they were in a state of awful wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349904" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Now they did not sin <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ignorantly</span>, for they knew the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>will</span> of God concerning them, for it had been taught unto them; therefore they did wilfully <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rebel</span> against God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349905" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And now it was in the days of Lachoneus, the son of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lachoneus</span>, for Lachoneus did fill the seat of his father and did govern the people that year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349906" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And there began to be men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inspired</span> from heaven and sent forth, standing among the people in all the land, preaching and testifying boldly of the sins and iniquities of the people, and testifying unto them concerning the redemption which the Lord would make for his people, or in other words, the resurrection of Christ; and they did testify boldly of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span> and sufferings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349907" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Now there were many of the people who were exceedingly angry because of those who testified of these things; and those who were angry were chiefly the chief judges, and they who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>had</span> been high priests and lawyers; yea, all those who were lawyers were angry with those who testified of these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349909" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Now there was no lawyer nor judge nor high priest that could have power to condemn any one to death save their condemnation was signed by the governor of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349910" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Now there were many of those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>who</span> testified of the things pertaining to Christ who testified boldly, who were taken and put to death <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secretly</span> by the judges, that the knowledge of their death came not unto the governor of the land until after their death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349911" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now behold, this was contrary to the laws of the land, that any man should be put to death except they had power from the governor of the land—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349912" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Therefore a complaint came up unto the land of Zarahemla, to the governor of the land, against these judges who had condemned the prophets of the Lord unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>, not according to the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349913" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Now it came to pass that they were taken and brought up before the judge, to be judged of the crime which they had done, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> which had been given by the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349914" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Now it came to pass that those judges had many friends and kindreds; and the remainder, yea, even almost all the lawyers and the high priests, did gather themselves together, and unite with the kindreds of those judges who were to be tried according to the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349915" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And they did enter into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> one with another, yea, even into that covenant which was given by them of old, which covenant was given and administered by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span>, to combine against all righteousness.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="420"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349916" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore they did combine against the people of the Lord, and enter into a covenant to destroy them, and to deliver those who were guilty of murder from the grasp of justice, which was about to be administered according to the law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349917" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And they did set at defiance the law and the rights of their country; and they did covenant one with another to destroy the governor, and to establish a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span> over the land, that the land should no more be at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>liberty</span> but should be subject unto kings.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349908" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349931" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349933" id="study_summary1">The chief judge is murdered, the government is destroyed, and the people divide into tribes—Jacob, an anti-Christ, becomes king of a secret combination—Nephi preaches repentance and faith in Christ—Angels minister to him daily, and he raises his brother from the dead—Many repent and are baptized. About <small>A.D.</small> 30–33.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349935" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now behold, I will show unto you that they did not establish a king over the land; but in this same year, yea, the thirtieth year, they did destroy upon the judgment-seat, yea, did murder the chief judge of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349937" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And the people were divided one against another; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>separate</span> one from another into tribes, every man according to his family and his kindred and friends; and thus they did destroy the government of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349939" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And every tribe did appoint a chief or a leader over them; and thus they became tribes and leaders of tribes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349941" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Now behold, there was no man among them save he had much family and many kindreds and friends; therefore their tribes became exceedingly great.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349943" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Now all this was done, and there were no wars as yet among them; and all this iniquity had come upon the people <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>because</span> they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>yield</span> themselves unto the power of Satan.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349945" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And the regulations of the government were destroyed, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combination</span> of the friends and kindreds of those who murdered the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349947" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they did cause a great contention in the land, insomuch that the more righteous part of the people had nearly all become wicked; yea, there were but few righteous men among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349949" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And thus six years had not passed away since the more part of the people had turned from their righteousness, like the dog to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vomit</span>, or like the sow to her wallowing in the mire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349951" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now this secret combination, which had brought so great iniquity upon the people, did gather themselves together, and did place at their head a man whom they did call Jacob;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349953" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And they did call him their king; therefore he became a king over this wicked band; and he was one of the chiefest who had given his voice against the prophets who testified of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349955" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that they were not so strong in number as the tribes of the people, who were united together save it were their leaders did establish their laws, every one according to his tribe; nevertheless they were enemies; notwithstanding they were not a righteous people, yet they were united in the hatred of those who had entered into a covenant to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> the government.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349957" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore, Jacob seeing that their enemies were more numerous than they, he being the king of the band, therefore he commanded his <span class="page-break" data-page="421"></span>people that they should take their flight into the northernmost part of the land, and there build up unto themselves a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kingdom</span>, until they were joined by dissenters, (for he flattered them that there would be many dissenters) and they become sufficiently strong to contend with the tribes of the people; and they did so.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349959" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And so speedy was their march that it could not be impeded until they had gone forth out of the reach of the people. And thus ended the thirtieth year; and thus were the affairs of the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349961" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass in the thirty and first year that they were divided into tribes, every man according to his family, kindred and friends; nevertheless they had come to an agreement that they would not go to war one with another; but they were not united as to their laws, and their manner of government, for they were established according to the minds of those who were their chiefs and their leaders. But they did establish very strict laws that one tribe should not trespass against another, insomuch that in some degree they had peace in the land; nevertheless, their hearts were turned from the Lord their God, and they did stone the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span> and did cast them out from among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349963" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>—having been visited by angels and also the voice of the Lord, therefore having seen angels, and being eye-witness, and having had power given unto him that he might know concerning the ministry of Christ, and also being eye-witness to their quick return from righteousness unto their wickedness and abominations;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349965" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grieved</span> for the hardness of their hearts and the blindness of their minds—went forth among them in that same year, and began to testify, boldly, repentance and remission of sins through faith on the Lord Jesus Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349967" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And he did minister many things unto them; and all of them cannot be written, and a part of them would not suffice, therefore they are not written in this book. And Nephi did minister with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and with great authority.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349969" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they were angry with him, even because he had greater power than they, for it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> possible that they could disbelieve his words, for so great was his faith on the Lord Jesus Christ that angels did minister unto him daily.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349971" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And in the name of Jesus did he cast out devils and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unclean spirits</span>; and even his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brother</span> did he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>raise</span> from the dead, after he had been stoned and suffered death by the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349973" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the people saw it, and did witness of it, and were angry with him because of his power; and he did also do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> more miracles, in the sight of the people, in the name of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349975" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the thirty and first year did pass away, and there were but few who were converted unto the Lord; but as many as were converted did truly signify unto the people that they had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>visited</span> by the power and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Spirit</span> of God, which was in Jesus Christ, in whom they believed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349977" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And as many as had devils cast out from them, and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>healed</span> of their sicknesses and their infirmities, did truly manifest unto the <span class="page-break" data-page="422"></span>people that they had been wrought upon by the Spirit of God, and had been healed; and they did show forth signs also and did do some miracles among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349979" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Thus passed away the thirty and second year also. And Nephi did cry unto the people in the commencement of the thirty and third year; and he did preach unto them repentance and remission of sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349981" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Now I would have you to remember also, that there were none who were brought unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repentance</span> who were not baptized with water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349982" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Therefore, there were ordained of Nephi, men unto this ministry, that all such as should come unto them should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span> with water, and this as a witness and a testimony before God, and unto the people, that they had repented and received a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349983" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And there were many in the commencement of this year that were baptized unto repentance; and thus the more part of the year did pass away.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350003" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350007" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350008" id="study_summary1">Tempests, earthquakes, fires, whirlwinds, and physical upheavals attest the crucifixion of Christ—Many people are destroyed—Darkness covers the land for three days—Those who remain bemoan their fate. About <small>A.D.</small> 33–34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350009" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that according to our record, and we know our record to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>true</span>, for behold, it was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>just</span> man who did keep the record—for he truly did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>many</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>miracles</span> in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>name</span> of Jesus; and there was not any man who could do a miracle in the name of Jesus save he were cleansed every whit from his iniquity—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350010" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now it came to pass, if there was no mistake made by this man in the reckoning of our time, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thirty and third</span> year had passed away;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350011" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the people began to look with great earnestness for the sign which had been given by the prophet Samuel, the Lamanite, yea, for the time that there should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span> for the space of three days over the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350012" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And there began to be great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doubtings</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>disputations</span> among the people, notwithstanding so many signs had been given.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350013" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thirty and fourth</span> year, in the first month, on the fourth day of the month, there arose a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>storm</span>, such an one as never had been known in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350014" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And there was also a great and terrible tempest; and there was terrible <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thunder</span>, insomuch that it did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shake</span> the whole earth as if it was about to divide asunder.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350015" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And there were exceedingly sharp lightnings, such as never had been known in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350016" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city of Zarahemla</span> did take fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350017" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moroni</span> did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sink</span> into the depths of the sea, and the inhabitants thereof were drowned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350018" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And the earth was carried up upon the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moronihah</span>, that in the place of the city there became a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mountain</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="423"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350019" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And there was a great and terrible destruction in the land southward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350020" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But behold, there was a more great and terrible destruction in the land northward; for behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whole</span> face of the land was changed, because of the tempest and the whirlwinds, and the thunderings and the lightnings, and the exceedingly great quaking of the whole earth;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350021" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>highways</span> were broken up, and the level roads were spoiled, and many smooth places became rough.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350022" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and notable cities were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sunk</span>, and many were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>burned</span>, and many were shaken till the buildings thereof had fallen to the earth, and the inhabitants thereof were slain, and the places were left desolate.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350023" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And there were some cities which remained; but the damage thereof was exceedingly great, and there were many in them who were slain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350024" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And there were some who were carried away in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whirlwind</span>; and whither they went no man knoweth, save they know that they were carried away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350025" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And thus the face of the whole earth became deformed, because of the tempests, and the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the quaking of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350026" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And behold, the rocks were rent in twain; they were broken up upon the face of the whole earth, insomuch that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>found</span> in broken fragments, and in seams and in cracks, upon all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350027" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that when the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the storm, and the tempest, and the quakings of the earth did cease—for behold, they did last for about the space of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hours</span>; and it was said by some that the time was greater; nevertheless, all these great and terrible things were done in about the space of three hours—and then behold, there was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>darkness</span> upon the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350028" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that there was thick darkness upon all the face of the land, insomuch that the inhabitants thereof who had not fallen could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>feel</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vapor</span> of darkness;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350029" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And there could be no light, because of the darkness, neither candles, neither torches; neither could there be fire kindled with their fine and exceedingly dry wood, so that there could not be any light at all;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350030" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And there was not any light seen, neither fire, nor glimmer, neither the sun, nor the moon, nor the stars, for so great were the mists of darkness which were upon the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350031" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that it did last for the space of three days that there was no light seen; and there was great mourning and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>howling</span> and weeping among all the people continually; yea, great were the groanings of the people, because of the darkness and the great destruction which had come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350032" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And in one place they were heard to cry, saying: O that we had repented <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>before</span> this great and terrible day, and then would our brethren have been spared, and they would not have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burned</span> in that great city Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350033" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And in another place they were heard to cry and mourn, saying: O that we had repented before this great and terrible day, and had not killed and stoned the prophets, and cast them out; then would our <span class="page-break" data-page="424"></span>mothers and our fair daughters, and our children have been spared, and not have been buried up in that great city <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moronihah</span>. And thus were the howlings of the people great and terrible.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349363" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349364" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349365" id="study_summary1">In the darkness, the voice of Christ proclaims the destruction of many people and cities for their wickedness—He also proclaims His divinity, announces that the law of Moses is fulfilled, and invites men to come unto Him and be saved. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349366" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> heard among all the inhabitants of the earth, upon all the face of this land, crying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349367" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Wo, wo, wo unto this people; wo unto the inhabitants of the whole earth except they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span>; for the devil <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>laugheth</span>, and his angels rejoice, because of the slain of the fair sons and daughters of my people; and it is because of their iniquity and abominations that they are fallen!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349368" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, that great city Zarahemla have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>burned</span> with fire, and the inhabitants thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349369" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And behold, that great city Moroni have I caused to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sunk</span> in the depths of the sea, and the inhabitants thereof to be drowned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349370" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And behold, that great city <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moronihah</span> have I covered with earth, and the inhabitants thereof, to hide their iniquities and their abominations from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints shall not come any more unto me against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349371" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And behold, the city of Gilgal have I caused to be sunk, and the inhabitants thereof to be buried up in the depths of the earth;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349372" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Yea, and the city of Onihah and the inhabitants thereof, and the city of Mocum and the inhabitants thereof, and the city of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> and the inhabitants thereof; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>waters</span> have I caused to come up in the stead thereof, to hide their wickedness and abominations from before my face, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blood</span> of the prophets and the saints shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>not come up</span> any more unto me against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349373" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, the city of Gadiandi, and the city of Gadiomnah, and the city of Jacob, and the city of Gimgimno, all these have I caused to be sunk, and made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hills</span> and valleys in the places thereof; and the inhabitants thereof have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>buried</span> up in the depths of the earth, to hide their wickedness and abominations from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints should not come up any more unto me against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349374" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And behold, that great city Jacobugath, which was inhabited by the people of king Jacob, have I caused to be burned with fire because of their sins and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span>, which was above all the wickedness of the whole earth, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret</span> murders and combinations; for it was they that did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroy</span> the peace of my people and the government of the land; therefore I did cause them to be burned, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>destroy</span> them from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints should not come up unto me any more against them.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="425"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349375" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And behold, the city of Laman, and the city of Josh, and the city of Gad, and the city of Kishkumen, have I caused to be burned with fire, and the inhabitants thereof, because of their wickedness in casting out the prophets, and stoning those whom I did send to declare unto them concerning their wickedness and their abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349376" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And because they did cast them all out, that there were none righteous among them, I did send down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fire</span> and destroy them, that their wickedness and abominations might be hid from before my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>face</span>, that the blood of the prophets and the saints whom I sent among them might not cry unto me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>from</span> the ground against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349377" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many</span> great destructions have I caused to come upon this land, and upon this people, because of their wickedness and their abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349378" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>O all ye that are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spared</span> because ye were more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteous</span> than they, will ye not now return unto me, and repent of your sins, and be converted, that I may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heal</span> you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349379" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto me ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eternal life</span>. Behold, mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>arm</span> of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349380" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, I am Jesus Christ the Son of God. I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>created</span> the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are. I was with the Father from the beginning. <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>I</span> am in the Father, and the Father in me; and in me hath the Father glorified his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349381" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>I came unto my own, and my own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>received me not</span>. And the scriptures <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>concerning</span> my coming are fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349382" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And as many as have received me, to them have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>given</span> to become the sons of God; and even so will I to as many as shall believe on my name, for behold, by me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redemption</span> cometh, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>in</span> me is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>law</span> of Moses fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349383" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> and the life of the world. I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Alpha and Omega</span>, the beginning and the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349384" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And ye shall offer up unto me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no more</span> the shedding of blood; yea, your sacrifices and your burnt offerings shall be done away, for I will accept none of your sacrifices and your burnt offerings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349385" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And ye shall offer for a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifice</span> unto me a broken heart and a contrite spirit.
