And whoso cometh unto me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit, him will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptize</span> with fire and with the Holy Ghost, even as the Lamanites, because of their faith in me at the time of their conversion, were baptized with fire and with the Holy Ghost, and they knew it not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349386" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold, I have come unto the world to bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redemption</span> unto the world, to save the world from sin.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="426"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349387" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Therefore, whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repenteth</span> and cometh unto me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>as</span> a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>little</span> child, him will I receive, for of such is the kingdom of God. Behold, for such I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>laid down</span> my life, and have taken it up again; therefore repent, and come unto me ye ends of the earth, and be saved.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347770" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347793" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347795" id="study_summary1">There is silence in the land for many hours—The voice of Christ promises to gather His people as a hen gathers her chickens—The more righteous part of the people have been preserved. About <small>A.D.</small> 34–35.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347797" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now behold, it came to pass that all the people of the land did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hear</span> these sayings, and did witness of it. And after these sayings there was silence in the land for the space of many hours;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347799" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For so great was the astonishment of the people that they did cease lamenting and howling for the loss of their kindred which had been slain; therefore there was silence in all the land for the space of many hours.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347801" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that there came a voice again unto the people, and all the people did hear, and did witness of it, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347803" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>O ye people of these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> cities which have fallen, who are descendants of Jacob, yea, who are of the house of Israel, how oft have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gathered</span> you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>nourished</span> you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347805" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And again, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>how</span> oft would I have gathered you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, yea, O ye people of the house of Israel, who have fallen; yea, O ye people of the house of Israel, ye that dwell at Jerusalem, as ye that have fallen; yea, how oft would I have gathered you as a hen gathereth her chickens, and ye would not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347807" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>O ye house of Israel whom I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spared</span>, how oft will I gather you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, if ye will repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>return</span> unto me with full purpose of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heart</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347809" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But if not, O house of Israel, the places of your dwellings shall become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desolate</span> until the time of the fulfilling of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> to your fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347811" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now it came to pass that after the people had heard these words, behold, they began to weep and howl <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span> because of the loss of their kindred and friends.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347813" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that thus did the three days pass away. And it was in the morning, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>darkness</span> dispersed from off the face of the land, and the earth did cease to tremble, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rocks</span> did cease to rend, and the dreadful groanings did cease, and all the tumultuous noises did pass away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347815" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And the earth did cleave together again, that it stood; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span>, and the weeping, and the wailing of the people who were spared alive did cease; and their mourning was turned into joy, and their lamentations into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>praise</span> and thanksgiving unto the Lord Jesus Christ, their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347817" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thus far were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scriptures</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fulfilled</span> which had been spoken by the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347819" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> righteous part of the people who were saved, and it was they who received the <span class="page-break" data-page="427"></span>prophets and stoned them not; and it was they who had not shed the blood of the saints, who were spared—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347821" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And they were spared and were not sunk and buried up in the earth; and they were not drowned in the depths of the sea; and they were not burned by fire, neither were they fallen upon and crushed to death; and they were not carried away in the whirlwind; neither were they overpowered by the vapor of smoke and of darkness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347823" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now, whoso readeth, let him understand; he that hath the scriptures, let him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>search</span> them, and see and behold if all these deaths and destructions by fire, and by smoke, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tempests</span>, and by whirlwinds, and by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>opening</span> of the earth to receive them, and all these things are not unto the fulfilling of the prophecies of many of the holy prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347825" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, I say unto you, Yea, many have testified of these things at the coming of Christ, and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span> because they testified of these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347827" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, the prophet <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Zenos</span> did testify of these things, and also Zenock spake <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>concerning</span> these things, because they testified particularly concerning us, who are the remnant of their seed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347829" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Behold, our father Jacob also testified concerning a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of Joseph. And behold, are not we a remnant of the seed of Joseph? And these things which testify of us, are they not written upon the plates of brass which our father Lehi brought out of Jerusalem?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347831" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that in the ending of the thirty and fourth year, behold, I will show unto you that the people of Nephi who were spared, and also those who had been called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span>, who had been spared, did have great favors shown unto them, and great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessings</span> poured out upon their heads, insomuch that soon after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ascension</span> of Christ into heaven he did truly manifest himself unto them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347833" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Showing</span> his body unto them, and ministering unto them; and an account of his ministry shall be given hereafter. Therefore for this time I make an end of my sayings.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128347898" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128347925" id="intro1">Jesus Christ did show himself unto the people of Nephi, as the multitude were gathered together in the land Bountiful, and did minister unto them; and on this wise did he show himself unto them.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128347927" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapters 11 through 26.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128347929" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128347932" id="study_summary1">The Father testifies of His Beloved Son—Christ appears and proclaims His Atonement—The people feel the wound marks in His hands and feet and side—They cry Hosanna—He sets forth the mode and manner of baptism—The spirit of contention is of the devil—Christ’s doctrine is that men should believe and be baptized and receive the Holy Ghost. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347934" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that there were a great multitude <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathered</span> together, of the people of Nephi, round about the temple which was in the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Bountiful</span>; and they were marveling and wondering one with another, and were showing one to another the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>great</span> and marvelous change which had taken place.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347936" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they were also conversing about this Jesus Christ, of whom the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span> had been given concerning his death.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="428"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347939" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that while they were thus conversing one with another, they heard a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>voice</span> as if it came out of heaven; and they cast their eyes round about, for they understood not the voice which they heard; and it was not a harsh voice, neither was it a loud voice; nevertheless, and notwithstanding it being a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>small</span> voice it did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pierce</span> them that did hear to the center, insomuch that there was no part of their frame that it did not cause to quake; yea, it did pierce them to the very soul, and did cause their hearts to burn.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347941" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that again they heard the voice, and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>understood</span> it not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347943" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And again the third time they did hear the voice, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>open</span> their ears to hear it; and their eyes were towards the sound thereof; and they did look steadfastly towards heaven, from whence the sound came.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347946" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And behold, the third time they did understand the voice which they heard; and it said unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347948" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Beloved Son</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>in</span> whom I am well pleased, in whom I have glorified my name—hear ye him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347950" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass, as they understood they cast their eyes up again towards heaven; and behold, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saw</span> a Man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>descending</span> out of heaven; and he was clothed in a white robe; and he came down and stood in the midst of them; and the eyes of the whole multitude were turned upon him, and they durst not open their mouths, even one to another, and wist not what it meant, for they thought it was an angel that had appeared unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347953" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that he stretched forth his hand and spake unto the people, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347955" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold, I am Jesus Christ, whom the prophets testified shall come into the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347957" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And behold, I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> and the life of the world; and I have drunk out of that bitter <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cup</span> which the Father hath given me, and have glorified the Father in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>taking</span> upon me the sins of the world, in the which I have suffered the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>will</span> of the Father in all things from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347960" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words the whole multitude <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fell</span> to the earth; for they remembered that it had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prophesied</span> among them that Christ should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>show</span> himself unto them after his ascension into heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347962" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> spake unto them saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347964" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Arise and come forth unto me, that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thrust</span> your hands into my side, and also that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>feel</span> the prints of the nails in my hands and in my feet, that ye may know that I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>God</span> of Israel, and the God of the whole <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>earth</span>, and have been slain for the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347967" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that the multitude went forth, and thrust their hands into his side, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>did</span> feel the prints of the nails in his hands and in his feet; and this they <span class="page-break" data-page="429"></span>did do, going forth one by one until they had all gone forth, and did see with their eyes and did feel with their hands, and did know of a surety and did bear record, that it was he, of whom it was written by the prophets, that should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347969" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And when they had all gone forth and had witnessed for themselves, they did cry out with one accord, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347970" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Hosanna! Blessed be the name of the Most High God! And they did fall down at the feet of Jesus, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worship</span> him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347971" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that he spake unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span> (for Nephi was among the multitude) and he commanded him that he should come forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347972" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And Nephi arose and went forth, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bowed</span> himself before the Lord and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kiss</span> his feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347973" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the Lord commanded him that he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>arise</span>. And he arose and stood before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347974" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the Lord said unto him: I give unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptize</span> this people when I am again ascended into heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347975" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And again the Lord called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>others</span>, and said unto them likewise; and he gave unto them power to baptize. And he said unto them: On this wise shall ye baptize; and there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no disputations</span> among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347976" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Verily I say unto you, that whoso repenteth of his sins through your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>desireth</span> to be baptized in my name, on this wise shall ye baptize them—Behold, ye shall go down and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>stand</span> in the water, and in my name shall ye baptize them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347977" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now behold, these are the words which ye shall say, calling them by name, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347978" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> given me of Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Father</span>, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost. Amen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347979" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And then shall ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>immerse</span> them in the water, and come forth again out of the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347980" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And after this manner shall ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptize</span> in my name; for behold, verily I say unto you, that the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span>; and I am in the Father, and the Father in me, and the Father and I are one.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347981" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And according as I have commanded you thus shall ye baptize. And there shall be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disputations</span> among you, as there have hitherto been; neither shall there be disputations among you concerning the points of my doctrine, as there have hitherto been.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347982" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>For verily, verily I say unto you, he that hath the spirit of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contention</span> is not of me, but is of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devil</span>, who is the father of contention, and he stirreth up the hearts of men to contend with anger, one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347983" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Behold, this is not my doctrine, to stir up the hearts of men with anger, one against another; but this <span class="page-break" data-page="430"></span>is my doctrine, that such things <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>should</span> be done away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347984" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doctrine</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347985" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And this is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doctrine</span>, and it is the doctrine which the Father hath given unto me; and I bear <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> of the Father, and the Father beareth record of me, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Holy Ghost</span> beareth record of the Father and me; and I bear record that the Father commandeth all men, everywhere, to repent and believe in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347986" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And whoso believeth in me, and is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span>, the same shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>saved</span>; and they are they who shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>inherit</span> the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347987" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And whoso believeth not in me, and is not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span>, shall be damned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347988" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my doctrine, and I bear record of it from the Father; and whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believeth</span> in me believeth in the Father also; and unto him will the Father bear record of me, for he will visit him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>with</span> fire and with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Holy Ghost</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347989" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And thus will the Father bear record of me, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Holy Ghost</span> will bear record unto him of the Father and me; for the Father, and I, and the Holy Ghost are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347990" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And again I say unto you, ye must repent, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>become</span> as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>little</span> child, and be baptized in my name, or ye can in nowise receive these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347991" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And again I say unto you, ye must repent, and be baptized in my name, and become as a little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>child</span>, or ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347992" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>doctrine</span>, and whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>buildeth</span> upon this buildeth upon my rock, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gates</span> of hell shall not prevail against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347993" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And whoso shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>declare</span> more or less than this, and establish it for my doctrine, the same cometh of evil, and is not built upon my rock; but he buildeth upon a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sandy</span> foundation, and the gates of hell stand open to receive such when the floods come and the winds beat upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128347994" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Therefore, go forth unto this people, and declare the words which I have spoken, unto the ends of the earth.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128345724" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128345725" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128345726" id="study_summary1">Jesus calls and commissions the twelve disciples—He delivers to the Nephites a discourse similar to the Sermon on the Mount—He speaks the Beatitudes—His teachings transcend and take precedence over the law of Moses—Men are commanded to be perfect even as He and His Father are perfect—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/nt/matt/5">Matthew 5</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345727" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words unto Nephi, and to those who had been called, (now the number of them who had been called, and received power and authority to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptize</span>, was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>twelve</span>) and behold, he stretched forth his hand unto the multitude, <span class="page-break" data-page="431"></span>and cried unto them, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Blessed</span> are ye if ye shall give heed unto the words of these twelve whom I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>chosen</span> from among you to minister unto you, and to be your servants; and unto them I have given power that they may baptize you with water; and after that ye are baptized with water, behold, I will baptize you with fire and with the Holy Ghost; therefore blessed are ye if ye shall believe in me and be baptized, after that ye have seen me and know that I am.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345728" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And again, more blessed are they who shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> in your words because that ye shall testify that ye have seen me, and that ye know that I am. Yea, blessed are they who shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>words</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>come</span> down into the depths of humility and be baptized, for they shall be visited <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>with</span> fire and with the Holy Ghost, and shall receive a remission of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345729" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, blessed are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poor in spirit</span> who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto me, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345730" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And again, blessed are all they that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span>, for they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>comforted</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345731" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And blessed are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meek</span>, for they shall inherit the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>earth</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345732" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And blessed are all they who do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hunger</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thirst</span> after <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteousness</span>, for they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>filled</span> with the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345733" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And blessed are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span>, for they shall obtain mercy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345734" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And blessed are all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pure</span> in heart, for they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>see</span> God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345735" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And blessed are all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peacemakers</span>, for they shall be called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>children</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345736" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And blessed are all they who are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persecuted</span> for my name’s sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345737" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And blessed are ye when men shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revile</span> you and persecute, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345738" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ye</span> shall have great joy and be exceedingly glad, for great shall be your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>reward</span> in heaven; for so <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>persecuted</span> they the prophets who were before you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345739" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you to be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>salt</span> of the earth; but if the salt shall lose its savor wherewith shall the earth be salted? The salt shall be thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345740" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you to be the light of this people. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345741" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, do men light a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>candle</span> and put it under a bushel? Nay, but on a candlestick, and it giveth light to all that are in the house;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345742" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Therefore let your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> so shine before this people, that they may see your good works and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glorify</span> your Father who is in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345743" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Think not that I am come to destroy the law or the prophets. <span class="page-break" data-page="432"></span>I am not come to destroy but to fulfil;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345744" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For verily I say unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> jot nor one tittle hath not passed away from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span>, but in me it hath all been fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345745" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, I have given you the law and the commandments of my Father, that ye shall believe in me, and that ye shall repent of your sins, and come unto me with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>broken heart</span> and a contrite spirit. Behold, ye have the commandments before you, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span> is fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345746" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Therefore <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto me and be ye saved; for verily I say unto you, that except ye shall keep my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>commandments</span>, which I have commanded you at this time, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345747" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, and it is also written before you, that thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kill</span>, and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment of God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345748" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But I say unto you, that whosoever is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> with his brother shall be in danger of his judgment. And whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council; and whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345749" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>if</span> ye shall come unto me, or shall desire to come unto me, and rememberest that thy brother hath aught against thee—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345750" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Go thy way unto thy brother, and first be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reconciled</span> to thy brother, and then come unto me with full <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>purpose</span> of heart, and I will receive you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345751" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Agree</span> with thine adversary quickly while thou art in the way with him, lest at any time he shall get thee, and thou shalt be cast into prison.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345752" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto thee, thou shalt by no means come out thence until thou hast paid the uttermost senine. And while ye are in prison can ye pay even one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>senine</span>? Verily, verily, I say unto you, Nay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345753" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Behold, it is written by them of old time, that thou shalt not commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>adultery</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345754" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>But I say unto you, that whosoever looketh on a woman, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lust after</span> her, hath committed adultery already in his heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345755" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Behold, I give unto you a commandment, that ye suffer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> of these things to enter into your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heart</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345756" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For it is better that ye should deny yourselves of these things, wherein ye will take up your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cross</span>, than that ye should be cast into hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345757" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>It hath been written, that whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>divorcement</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345758" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, that whosoever shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>put away</span> his wife, saving for the cause of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fornication</span>, causeth her to commit <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>adultery</span>; and whoso shall marry her who is divorced committeth adultery.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345759" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And again it is written, thou shalt not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forswear</span> thyself, but <span class="page-break" data-page="433"></span>shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perform</span> unto the Lord thine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>oaths</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345760" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>But verily, verily, I say unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swear</span> not at all; neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345761" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Nor by the earth, for it is his footstool;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345762" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair black or white;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345763" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>But let your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>communication</span> be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Yea</span>, yea; Nay, nay; for whatsoever cometh of more than these is evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345764" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And behold, it is written, an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eye</span> for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345765" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>But I say unto you, that ye shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resist</span> evil, but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cheek</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>turn</span> to him the other also;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345766" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And if any man will sue thee at the law and take away thy coat, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>let</span> him have thy cloak also;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345767" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And whosoever shall compel thee to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> a mile, go with him twain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345768" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Give</span> to him that asketh thee, and from him that would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>borrow</span> of thee turn thou not away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345769" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And behold it is written also, that thou shalt love thy neighbor and hate thine enemy;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345770" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>But behold I say unto you, love your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enemies</span>, bless them that curse you, do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>good</span> to them that hate you, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pray</span> for them who despitefully use you and persecute you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345771" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>That ye may be the children of your Father who is in heaven; for he maketh his sun to rise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>on</span> the evil and on the good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345772" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>Therefore those things which were of old time, which were under the law, in me are all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulfilled</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345773" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Old</span> things are done away, and all things have become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>new</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128345774" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>Therefore I would that ye should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perfect</span> even as I, or your Father who is in heaven is perfect.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348088" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348089" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348090" id="study_summary1">Jesus teaches the Nephites the Lord’s Prayer—They are to lay up treasures in heaven—The twelve disciples in their ministry are commanded to take no thought for temporal things—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/nt/matt/6">Matthew 6</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348091" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Verily</span>, verily, I say that I would that ye should do alms unto the poor; but take heed that ye do not your alms before men to be seen of them; otherwise ye have no reward of your Father who is in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348092" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Therefore, when ye shall do your alms do not sound a trumpet before you, as will hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>glory</span> of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348093" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But when thou doest alms let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348094" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>That thine alms may be in secret; and thy Father who seeth in secret, himself shall reward thee openly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348095" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayest</span> thou shalt not do as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hypocrites</span>, for <span class="page-break" data-page="434"></span>they love to pray, standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348096" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shut</span> thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father, who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seeth</span> in secret, shall reward thee openly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348097" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But when ye pray, use not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vain repetitions</span>, as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heathen</span>, for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348098" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Be not ye therefore like unto them, for your Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knoweth</span> what things ye have need of before ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ask</span> him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348099" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>After this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manner</span> therefore <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span> ye: Our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Father</span> who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348100" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348101" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348102" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lead</span> us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348103" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348104" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>For, if ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forgive</span> men their trespasses your heavenly Father will also forgive you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348105" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But if ye forgive not men their trespasses neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348106" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Moreover, when ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fast</span> be not as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hypocrites</span>, of a sad countenance, for they disfigure their faces that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348107" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thy head, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wash</span> thy face;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348108" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father, who is in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret</span>; and thy Father, who seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348109" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>moth</span> and rust doth corrupt, and thieves break through and steal;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348110" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But lay up for yourselves <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>treasures</span> in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348111" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348112" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> of the body is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>eye</span>; if, therefore, thine eye be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>single</span>, thy whole body shall be full of light.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348113" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If, therefore, the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348114" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>No man can <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>serve</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>two</span> masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and Mammon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348115" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he looked upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> whom he had chosen, and said unto them: Remember the words which I have spoken. For behold, ye are they whom I have chosen to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>minister</span> unto this people. Therefore I say unto you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>take</span> no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye <span class="page-break" data-page="435"></span>shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>raiment</span>?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348116" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fowls</span> of the air, for they sow not, neither do they reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348117" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348118" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lilies</span> of the field how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348119" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And yet I say unto you, that even Solomon, in all his glory, was not arrayed like one of these.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348120" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, even so will he clothe you, if ye are not of little faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348121" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348122" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348123" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seek</span> ye first the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kingdom</span> of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348124" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Take therefore no thought for the morrow, for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Sufficient</span> is the day unto the evil thereof.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348828" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348160" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348161" id="study_summary1">Jesus commands: Judge not; ask of God; beware of false prophets—He promises salvation to those who do the will of the Father—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/nt/matt/7">Matthew 7</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348162" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>And</span> now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he turned again to the multitude, and did open his mouth unto them again, saying: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Judge not, that ye be not judged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348163" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>For</span> with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348164" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348165" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the mote out of thine eye—and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348166" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Thou <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hypocrite</span>, first cast the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>beam</span> out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote out of thy brother’s eye.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348167" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Give not that which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>holy</span> unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348168" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ask</span>, and it shall be given unto you; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seek</span>, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348169" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For every one that asketh, receiveth; and he that seeketh, findeth; and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348170" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Or what man is there of you, who, if his son ask bread, will give him a stone?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348171" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348172" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348173" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore, all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>do</span> ye even so to them, for this is the law and the prophets.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="436"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348174" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Enter ye in at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strait gate</span>; for wide is the gate, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>broad</span> is the way, which leadeth to destruction, and many there be who go in thereat;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348175" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Because strait is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gate</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>narrow</span> is the way, which leadeth unto life, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>few</span> there be that find it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348176" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Beware of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false prophets</span>, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348177" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Ye shall know them by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruits</span>. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348178" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Even so every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good</span> tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348179" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348180" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Every tree that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bringeth</span> not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348181" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Wherefore, by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruits</span> ye shall know them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348182" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>enter</span> into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348183" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Many will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>say</span> to me in that day: Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name, and in thy name have cast out devils, and in thy name done many wonderful works?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348184" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And then will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> profess unto them: I never <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knew</span> you; <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>depart</span> from me, ye that work iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348185" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, whoso heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, who built his house upon a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rock</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348186" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rain</span> descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fell</span> not, for it was founded upon a rock.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348187" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And every one that heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them not shall be likened unto a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>foolish</span> man, who built his house upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sand</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348188" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell, and great was the fall of it.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348217" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348218" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348219" id="study_summary1">Jesus announces that the law of Moses is fulfilled in Him—The Nephites are the other sheep of whom He spoke in Jerusalem—Because of iniquity, the Lord’s people in Jerusalem do not know of the scattered sheep of Israel. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348220" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had ended these sayings he cast his eyes round about on the multitude, and said unto them: Behold, ye have heard the things which I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taught</span> before I ascended to my Father; therefore, whoso remembereth these sayings of mine and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>doeth</span> them, him will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>raise up</span> at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348221" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had said these words he perceived that there were some among them who marveled, and wondered what he would concerning the law <span class="page-break" data-page="437"></span>of Moses; for they understood not the saying that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span> things had passed away, and that all things had become new.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348222" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he said unto them: Marvel not that I said unto you that old things had passed away, and that all things had become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>new</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348223" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, I say unto you that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span> is fulfilled that was given unto Moses.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348224" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> am he that gave the law, and I am he who covenanted with my people Israel; therefore, the law in me is fulfilled, for I have come to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fulfil</span> the law; therefore it hath an end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348225" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, I do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> destroy the prophets, for as many as have not been fulfilled in me, verily I say unto you, shall all be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348226" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And because I said unto you that old things have passed away, I do not destroy that which hath been spoken concerning things which are to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348227" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> which I have made with my people is not all fulfilled; but the law which was given unto Moses hath an end in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348228" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Behold, I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>law</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span>. Look unto me, and endure to the end, and ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>live</span>; for unto him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>endureth</span> to the end will I give eternal life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348229" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold, I have given unto you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandments</span>; therefore keep my commandments. And this is the law and the prophets, for they truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>testified</span> of me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348230" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>said</span> unto those twelve whom he had chosen:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348231" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Ye are my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span>; and ye are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> unto this people, who are a remnant of the house of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Joseph</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348232" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, this is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> of your inheritance; and the Father hath given it unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348233" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And not at any time hath the Father given me commandment that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tell</span> it unto your brethren at Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348234" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Neither at any time hath the Father given me commandment that I should tell unto them concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other tribes</span> of the house of Israel, whom the Father hath led away out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348235" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>This much did the Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>command</span> me, that I should tell unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348236" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>That other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shepherd</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348237" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And now, because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffneckedness</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span> they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>understood</span> not my word; therefore I was commanded to say no more of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Father</span> concerning this thing unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348238" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>But, verily, I say unto you that the Father hath commanded me, and I tell it unto you, that ye were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>separated</span> from among them because of their iniquity; therefore it <span class="page-break" data-page="438"></span>is because of their iniquity that they know not of you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348239" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And verily, I say unto you again that the other tribes hath the Father separated from them; and it is because of their iniquity that they know not of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348240" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And verily I say unto you, that ye are they of whom I said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Other</span> sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shepherd</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348241" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And they understood me not, for they supposed it had been the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>; for they understood not that the Gentiles should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>converted</span> through their preaching.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348242" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they understood me not that I said they shall hear my voice;
