and they understood me not that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span> should not at any time hear my voice—that I should not manifest myself unto them save it were by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348243" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>But behold, ye have both heard <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my voice</span>, and seen me; and ye are my sheep, and ye are numbered among those whom the Father hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>given</span> me.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 16	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348829" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/16" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 16</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348830" id="title_number1">Chapter 16</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348831" id="study_summary1">Jesus will visit others of the lost sheep of Israel—In the latter days the gospel will go to the Gentiles and then to the house of Israel—The Lord’s people will see eye to eye when He brings again Zion. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348832" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And verily, verily, I say unto you that I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>other sheep</span>, which are not of this land, neither of the land of Jerusalem, neither in any parts of that land round about whither I have been to minister.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348833" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For they of whom I speak are they who have not as yet heard my voice; neither have I at any time manifested myself unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348834" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>But I have received a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commandment</span> of the Father that I shall go unto them, and that they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hear</span> my voice, and shall be numbered among my sheep, that there may be one fold and one shepherd; therefore I go to show myself unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348835" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I command you that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>write</span> these sayings after I am gone, that if it so be that my people at Jerusalem, they who have seen me and been with me in my ministry, do not ask the Father in my name, that they may receive a knowledge of you by the Holy Ghost, and also of the other tribes whom they know not of, that these sayings which ye shall write shall be kept and shall be manifested unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, that through the fulness of the Gentiles, the remnant of their seed, who shall be scattered forth upon the face of the earth because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unbelief</span>, may be brought in, or may be brought to a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knowledge</span> of me, their Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348836" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And then will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gather</span> them in from the four quarters of the earth; and then will I fulfil the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> which the Father hath made unto all the people of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>house of Israel</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348837" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And blessed are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, because of their belief in me, in and of the Holy Ghost, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>witnesses</span> unto them of me and of the Father.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="439"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348838" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Behold, because of their belief in me, saith the Father, and because of the unbelief of you, O house of Israel, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>latter day</span> shall the truth come unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, that the fulness of these things shall be made known unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348839" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But wo, saith the Father, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelieving</span> of the Gentiles—for notwithstanding they have come forth upon the face of this land, and have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> my people who are of the house of Israel; and my people who are of the house of Israel have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cast out</span> from among them, and have been trodden under feet by them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348840" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And because of the mercies of the Father unto the Gentiles, and also the judgments of the Father upon my people who are of the house of Israel, verily, verily, I say unto you, that after all this, and I have caused my people who are of the house of Israel to be smitten, and to be afflicted, and to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>slain</span>, and to be cast out from among them, and to become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hated</span> by them, and to become a hiss and a byword among them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348841" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And thus commandeth the Father that I should say unto you: At that day when the Gentiles shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sin</span> against my gospel, and shall reject the fulness of my gospel, and shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lifted up</span> in the pride of their hearts above all nations, and above all the people of the whole earth, and shall be filled with all manner of lyings, and of deceits, and of mischiefs, and all manner of hypocrisy, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>murders</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>priestcrafts</span>, and whoredoms, and of secret abominations; and if they shall do all those things, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>reject</span> the fulness of my gospel, behold, saith the Father, I will bring the fulness of my gospel from among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348842" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And then will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> my covenant which I have made unto my people, O house of Israel, and I will bring my gospel unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348843" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I will show unto thee, O house of Israel, that the Gentiles shall not have power over you; but I will remember my covenant unto you, O house of Israel, and ye shall come unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> of the fulness of my gospel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348844" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But if the Gentiles will repent and return unto me, saith the Father, behold they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>numbered</span> among my people, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348845" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And I will not suffer my people, who are of the house of Israel, to go through among them, and tread them down, saith the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348846" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>But if they will not turn unto me, and hearken unto my voice, I will suffer them, yea, I will suffer my people, O house of Israel, that they shall go through among them, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tread</span> them down, and they shall be as salt that hath lost its savor, which is thenceforth good for nothing but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of my people, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348847" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, thus hath the Father commanded <span class="page-break" data-page="440"></span>me—that I should give unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this people</span> this land for their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348848" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And then the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of the prophet Isaiah shall be fulfilled, which say:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348849" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Thy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>watchmen</span> shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing, for they shall see eye to eye when the Lord shall bring again Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348850" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348851" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of God.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 17	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348884" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/17" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 17</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348885" id="title_number1">Chapter 17</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348886" id="study_summary1">Jesus directs the people to ponder His words and pray for understanding—He heals their sick—He prays for the people, using language that cannot be written—Angels minister to and fire encircles their little ones. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348887" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold, now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he looked round about again on the multitude, and he said unto them: Behold, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time is at hand</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348888" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>perceive</span> that ye are weak, that ye cannot <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understand</span> all my words which I am commanded of the Father to speak unto you at this time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348889" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore, go ye unto your homes, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ponder</span> upon the things which I have said, and ask of the Father, in my name, that ye may understand, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prepare</span> your minds for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>morrow</span>, and I come unto you again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348890" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>But now I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> unto the Father, and also to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>show</span> myself unto the lost tribes of Israel, for they are not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lost</span> unto the Father, for he knoweth whither he hath taken them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348891" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had thus spoken, he cast his eyes round about again on the multitude, and beheld they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in tears</span>, and did look steadfastly upon him as if they would ask him to tarry a little longer with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348892" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he said unto them: Behold, my bowels are filled with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>compassion</span> towards you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348893" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Have ye any that are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sick</span> among you? Bring them hither. Have ye any that are lame, or blind, or halt, or maimed, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>leprous</span>, or that are withered, or that are deaf, or that are afflicted in any manner? Bring them hither and I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heal</span> them, for I have compassion upon you; my bowels are filled with mercy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348894" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For I perceive that ye desire that I should show unto you what I have done unto your brethren at Jerusalem, for I see that your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sufficient</span> that I should heal you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348895" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that when he had thus spoken, all the multitude, with one accord, did go forth with their sick and their afflicted, and their lame, and with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blind</span>, and with their dumb, and with all them that were afflicted in any manner; and he did heal them every one as they were brought forth unto him.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="441"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348896" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And they did all, both they who had been healed and they who were whole, bow down at his feet, and did worship him; and as many as could come for the multitude did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kiss</span> his feet, insomuch that they did bathe his feet with their tears.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348897" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that he commanded that their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>little children</span> should be brought.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348898" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>So they brought their little children and set them down upon the ground round about him, and Jesus stood in the midst; and the multitude gave way till they had all been brought unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348899" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that when they had all been brought, and Jesus stood in the midst, he commanded the multitude that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kneel</span> down upon the ground.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348900" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that when they had knelt upon the ground, Jesus groaned within himself, and said: Father, I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>troubled</span> because of the wickedness of the people of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348901" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And when he had said these words, he himself also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knelt</span> upon the earth; and behold he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>prayed</span> unto the Father, and the things which he prayed cannot be written, and the multitude did bear record who heard him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348902" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after this manner do they bear record: The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eye</span> hath never seen, neither hath the ear heard, before, so great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus speak unto the Father;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348903" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tongue</span> can speak, neither can there be written by any man, neither can the hearts of men conceive so great and marvelous things as we both saw and heard Jesus speak; and no one can conceive of the joy which filled our souls at the time we heard him pray for us unto the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348904" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of praying unto the Father, he arose; but so great was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>joy</span> of the multitude that they were overcome.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348905" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that Jesus spake unto them, and bade them arise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348906" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they arose from the earth, and he said unto them: Blessed are ye because of your faith. And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>now</span> behold, my joy is full.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348907" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And when he had said these words, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wept</span>, and the multitude bare record of it, and he took their little children, one by one, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessed</span> them, and prayed unto the Father for them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348908" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And when he had done this he wept again;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348909" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he spake unto the multitude, and said unto them: Behold your little ones.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348910" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And as they looked to behold they cast their eyes towards heaven, and they saw the heavens open, and they saw angels descending out of heaven as it were in the midst of fire; and they came down and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>encircled</span> those little ones about, and they were encircled about with fire; and the angels did minister unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348911" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And the multitude did see and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hear</span> and bear record; and they know that their record is true for they all of them did see and hear, every man for himself; and they were in number about two thousand and five hundred souls; and they did consist of men, women, and children.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 18	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348282" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/18" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 18</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="442"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348283" id="title_number1">Chapter 18</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348284" id="study_summary1">Jesus institutes the sacrament among the Nephites—They are commanded to pray always in His name—Those who eat His flesh and drink His blood unworthily are damned—The disciples are given power to confer the Holy Ghost. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348285" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Jesus commanded his disciples that they should bring forth some <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bread and wine</span> unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348286" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And while they were gone for bread and wine, he commanded the multitude that they should sit themselves down upon the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348287" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And when the disciples had come with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bread and wine</span>, he took of the bread and brake and blessed it; and he gave unto the disciples and commanded that they should eat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348288" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when they had eaten and were filled, he commanded that they should give unto the multitude.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348289" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when the multitude had eaten and were filled, he said unto the disciples: Behold there shall one be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordained</span> among you, and to him will I give power that he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>break</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>bread</span> and bless it and give it unto the people of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>church</span>, unto all those who shall believe and be baptized in my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348290" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And this shall ye always observe to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>do</span>, even as I have done, even as I have broken bread and blessed it and given it unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348291" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And this shall ye do in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remembrance</span> of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>body</span>, which I have shown unto you. And it shall be a testimony unto the Father that ye do always remember me. And if ye do always remember me ye shall have my Spirit to be with you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348292" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that when he said these words, he commanded his disciples that they should take of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wine</span> of the cup and drink of it, and that they should also give unto the multitude that they might drink of it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348293" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they did so, and did drink of it and were filled; and they gave unto the multitude, and they did drink, and they were filled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348294" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And when the disciples had done this, Jesus said unto them: Blessed are ye for this thing which ye have done, for this is fulfilling my commandments, and this doth witness unto the Father that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>willing</span> to do that which I have commanded you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348295" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And this shall ye always do to those who repent and are baptized in my name; and ye shall do it in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remembrance</span> of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blood</span>, which I have shed for you, that ye may witness unto the Father that ye do always remember me. And if ye do always remember me ye shall have my Spirit to be with you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348296" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I give unto you a commandment that ye shall do these things. And if ye shall always do these things blessed are ye, for ye are built upon my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rock</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348297" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But whoso among you shall do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more</span> or less than these are not built upon my rock, but are built upon a sandy foundation; and when the rain descends, and the floods come, and the winds blow, and beat upon them, they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fall</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gates</span> of hell are ready open to receive them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348298" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Therefore blessed are ye if ye shall keep my commandments, which the Father hath commanded me that I should give unto you.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="443"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348299" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, ye must watch and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> always, lest ye be tempted by the devil, and ye be led away captive by him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348300" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And as I have prayed among you even so shall ye pray in my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, among my people who do repent and are baptized in my name. Behold I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span>; I have set an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>example</span> for you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348301" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words unto his disciples, he turned again unto the multitude and said unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348302" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, ye must watch and pray always lest ye enter into temptation; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Satan</span> desireth to have you, that he may sift you as wheat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348303" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Therefore ye must always pray unto the Father in my name;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348304" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whatsoever</span> ye shall ask the Father in my name, which is right, believing that ye shall receive, behold it shall be given unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348305" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Pray</span> in your families unto the Father, always in my name, that your wives and your children may be blessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348306" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And behold, ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meet</span> together oft; and ye shall not forbid any man from coming unto you when ye shall meet together, but suffer them that they may come unto you and forbid them not;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348307" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> for them, and shall not cast them out; and if it so be that they come unto you oft ye shall pray for them unto the Father, in my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348308" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, hold up your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> that it may shine unto the world. Behold I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>light</span> which ye shall hold up—that which ye have seen me do. Behold ye see that I have prayed unto the Father, and ye all have witnessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348309" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And ye see that I have commanded that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> of you should go away, but rather have commanded that ye should come unto me, that ye might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>feel</span> and see; even so shall ye do unto the world; and whosoever breaketh this commandment suffereth himself to be led into temptation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348310" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he turned his eyes again upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span> whom he had chosen, and said unto them:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348311" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Behold verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you another commandment, and then I must go unto my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Father</span> that I may fulfil <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>other</span> commandments which he hath given me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348312" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now behold, this is the commandment which I give unto you, that ye shall not suffer any one knowingly to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>partake</span> of my flesh and blood <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unworthily</span>, when ye shall minister it;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348313" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>For whoso eateth and drinketh my flesh and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unworthily</span> eateth and drinketh damnation to his soul; therefore if ye know that a man is unworthy to eat and drink of my flesh and blood ye shall forbid him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348314" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Nevertheless, ye shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> him out from among you, but ye <span class="page-break" data-page="444"></span>shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>minister</span> unto him and shall pray for him unto the Father, in my name; and if it so be that he repenteth and is baptized in my name, then shall ye receive him, and shall minister unto him of my flesh and blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348315" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>But if he repent not he shall not be numbered among my people, that he may not destroy my people, for behold I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>my</span> sheep, and they are numbered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348316" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Nevertheless, ye shall not cast him out of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>synagogues</span>, or your places of worship, for unto such shall ye continue to minister; for ye know not but what they will return and repent, and come unto me with full purpose of heart, and I shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heal</span> them; and ye shall be the means of bringing salvation unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348317" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Therefore, keep these sayings which I have commanded you that ye come not under <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>condemnation</span>; for wo unto him whom the Father condemneth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348318" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And I give you these commandments because of the disputations which have been among you. And blessed are ye if ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no disputations</span> among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348319" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And now I go unto the Father, because it is expedient that I should go unto the Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>for</span> your sakes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348320" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of these sayings, he touched with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hand</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>disciples</span> whom he had chosen, one by one, even until he had touched them all, and spake unto them as he touched them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348321" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And the multitude heard not the words which he spake, therefore they did not bear record; but the disciples bare record that he gave them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> to give the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>. And I will show unto you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hereafter</span> that this record is true.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348322" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had touched them all, there came a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cloud</span> and overshadowed the multitude that they could not see Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348323" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And while they were overshadowed he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>departed</span> from them, and ascended into heaven. And the disciples saw and did bear record that he ascended again into heaven.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 19	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348377" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/19" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 19</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348378" id="title_number1">Chapter 19</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348379" id="study_summary1">The twelve disciples minister unto the people and pray for the Holy Ghost—The disciples are baptized and receive the Holy Ghost and the ministering of angels—Jesus prays using words that cannot be written—He attests to the exceedingly great faith of these Nephites. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348380" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had ascended into heaven, the multitude did disperse, and every man did take his wife and his children and did return to his own home.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348381" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it was noised abroad among the people immediately, before it was yet dark, that the multitude had seen Jesus, and that he had ministered unto them, and that he would also show himself on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>morrow</span> unto the multitude.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348382" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Yea, and even all the night it was noised abroad concerning Jesus; and insomuch did they send forth unto the people that there were many, yea, an exceedingly great number, did labor exceedingly all that night, that they might be on the morrow in the place where Jesus should show himself unto the multitude.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="445"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348383" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that on the morrow, when the multitude was gathered together, behold, Nephi and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brother</span> whom he had raised from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span>, whose name was Timothy, and also his son, whose name was Jonas, and also Mathoni, and Mathonihah, his brother, and Kumen, and Kumenonhi, and Jeremiah, and Shemnon, and Jonas, and Zedekiah, and Isaiah—now these were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>names</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>disciples</span> whom Jesus had chosen—and it came to pass that they went forth and stood in the midst of the multitude.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348384" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And behold, the multitude was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>so great</span> that they did cause that they should be separated into twelve bodies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348385" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And the twelve did teach the multitude; and behold, they did cause that the multitude should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kneel</span> down upon the face of the earth, and should pray unto the Father in the name of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348386" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the disciples did pray unto the Father also in the name of Jesus. And it came to pass that they arose and ministered unto the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348387" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when they had ministered those same words which Jesus had spoken—nothing varying from the words which Jesus had spoken—behold, they knelt again and prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348388" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And they did pray for that which they most desired; and they desired that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Holy Ghost</span> should be given unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348389" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And when they had thus prayed they went down unto the water’s edge, and the multitude followed them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348390" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi went down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>into</span> the water and was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348391" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he came up out of the water and began to baptize. And he baptized all those whom Jesus had chosen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348392" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass when they were all baptized and had come <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>up</span> out of the water, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span> did fall upon them, and they were filled with the Holy Ghost and with fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348393" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>encircled</span> about as if it were by fire; and it came down from heaven, and the multitude did witness it, and did bear record; and angels did come down out of heaven and did minister unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348394" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that while the angels were ministering unto the disciples, behold, Jesus came and stood in the midst and ministered unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348395" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that he spake unto the multitude, and commanded them that they should kneel down again upon the earth, and also that his disciples should kneel down upon the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348396" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that when they had all knelt down upon the earth, he commanded his disciples that they should pray.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348397" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And behold, they began to pray; and they did pray unto Jesus, calling him their Lord and their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348398" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that Jesus departed out of the midst of them, and went a little way off from them and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bowed</span> himself to the earth, and he said:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348399" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Father, I thank thee that thou hast given the Holy Ghost unto these whom I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chosen</span>; and it is because of their belief in me that I have chosen them out of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348400" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Father, I pray thee that thou wilt give the Holy Ghost unto all them that shall believe in their words.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="446"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348401" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Father, thou hast given them the Holy Ghost because they believe in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>me</span>; and thou seest that they believe in me because thou hearest them, and they pray unto me; and they pray unto me because I am with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348402" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now Father, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> unto thee for them, and also for all those who shall believe on their words, that they may believe in me, that I may be in them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>as</span> thou, Father, art in me, that we may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>one</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348403" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had thus prayed unto the Father, he came unto his disciples, and behold, they did still continue, without ceasing, to pray unto him; and they did not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>multiply</span> many words, for it was given unto them what they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span>, and they were filled with desire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348404" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that Jesus blessed them as they did pray unto him; and his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>countenance</span> did smile upon them, and the light of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>countenance</span> did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>shine</span> upon them, and behold they were as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>white</span> as the countenance and also the garments of Jesus; and behold the whiteness thereof did exceed all the whiteness, yea, even there could be nothing upon earth so white as the whiteness thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348405" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And Jesus said unto them: Pray on; nevertheless they did not cease to pray.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348406" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And he turned from them again, and went a little way off and bowed himself to the earth; and he prayed again unto the Father, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348407" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Father, I thank thee that thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purified</span> those whom I have chosen, because of their faith, and I pray for them, and also for them who shall believe on their words, that they may be purified in me, through faith on their words, even as they are purified in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348408" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Father, I pray not for the world, but for those whom thou hast given me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>out</span> of the world, because of their faith, that they may be purified in me, that I may be in them as thou, Father, art in me, that we may be one, that I may be glorified in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348409" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And when Jesus had spoken these words he came again unto his disciples; and behold they did pray steadfastly, without ceasing, unto him; and he did smile upon them again; and behold they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>white</span>, even as Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348410" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that he went again a little way off and prayed unto the Father;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348411" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And tongue cannot speak the words which he prayed, neither can be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> by man the words which he prayed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348412" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And the multitude did hear and do bear record; and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> were open and they did understand in their hearts the words which he prayed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348413" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Nevertheless, so great and marvelous were the words which he prayed that they cannot be written, neither can they be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>uttered</span> by man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348414" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of praying he came again to the disciples, and said unto them: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>So</span> great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> have I never seen among all the Jews; wherefore I could not show unto them so great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>miracles</span>, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>unbelief</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="447"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348415" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Verily I say unto you, there are none of them that have seen so great things as ye have seen; neither have they heard so great things as ye have heard.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 20	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348973" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/20" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 20</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348982" id="title_number1">Chapter 20</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348983" id="study_summary1">Jesus provides bread and wine miraculously and again administers the sacrament unto the people—The remnant of Jacob will come to the knowledge of the Lord their God and will inherit the Americas—Jesus is the prophet like unto Moses, and the Nephites are children of the prophets—Others of the Lord’s people will be gathered to Jerusalem. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348984" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that he commanded the multitude that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cease</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>pray</span>, and also his disciples. And he commanded them that they should not cease to pray in their hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348985" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he commanded them that they should arise and stand up upon their feet. And they arose up and stood upon their feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348986" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brake</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bread</span> again and blessed it, and gave to the disciples to eat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348987" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when they had eaten he commanded them that they should break bread, and give unto the multitude.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348988" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when they had given unto the multitude he also gave them wine to drink, and commanded them that they should give unto the multitude.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348989" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now, there had been no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bread</span>, neither wine, brought by the disciples, neither by the multitude;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348990" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But he truly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gave</span> unto them bread to eat, and also wine to drink.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348991" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he said unto them: He that eateth this bread eateth of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my body</span> to his soul; and he that drinketh of this wine drinketh of my blood to his soul; and his soul shall never hunger nor thirst, but shall be filled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348992" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now, when the multitude had all eaten and drunk, behold, they were filled with the Spirit; and they did cry out with one voice, and gave glory to Jesus, whom they both saw and heard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348993" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that when they had all given glory unto Jesus, he said unto them: Behold now I finish the commandment which the Father hath commanded me concerning this people, who are a remnant of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348994" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Ye remember that I spake unto you, and said that when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Isaiah</span> should be fulfilled—behold they are written, ye have them before you, therefore search them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348995" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And verily, verily, I say unto you, that when they shall be fulfilled then is the fulfilling of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>covenant</span> which the Father hath made unto his people, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348996" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnants</span>, which shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scattered</span> abroad upon the face of the earth, be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gathered</span> in from the east and from the west, and from the south and from the north; and they shall be brought to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>knowledge</span> of the Lord their God, who hath redeemed them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348997" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And the Father hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> me that I should give unto you this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span>, for your inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348998" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I say unto you, that if the Gentiles do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span> after <span class="page-break" data-page="448"></span>the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessing</span> which they shall receive, after they have scattered my people—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348999" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Then shall ye, who are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the house of Jacob, go forth among them; and ye shall be in the midst of them who shall be many; and ye shall be among them as a lion among the beasts of the forest, and as a young <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lion</span> among the flocks of sheep, who, if he goeth through both <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>treadeth</span> down and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349000" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Thy hand shall be lifted up upon thine adversaries, and all thine enemies shall be cut off.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349001" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gather</span> my people together as a man gathereth his sheaves into the floor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349002" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For I will make my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> with whom the Father hath covenanted, yea, I will make thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>horn</span> iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass. And thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>beat</span> in pieces many people; and I will consecrate their gain unto the Lord, and their substance unto the Lord of the whole earth. And behold, I am he who doeth it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349003" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it shall come to pass, saith the Father, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of my justice shall hang over them at that day; and except they repent it shall fall upon them, saith the Father, yea, even upon all the nations of the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349004" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it shall come to pass that I will establish my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span>, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349005" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And behold, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span> will I establish in this land, unto the fulfilling of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> which I made with your father Jacob; and it shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>New Jerusalem</span>. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>powers</span> of heaven shall be in the midst of this people; yea, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>I</span> will be in the midst of you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349006" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Behold, I am he of whom Moses spake, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>A prophet</span> shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you. And it shall come to pass that every soul who will not hear that prophet shall be cut off from among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349007" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Verily I say unto you, yea, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have testified of me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349008" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And behold, ye are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> of the prophets; and ye are of the house of Israel; and ye are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> which the Father made with your fathers, saying unto Abraham: And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>in</span> thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349009" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>The Father having raised me up unto you first, and sent me to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bless</span> you in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>turning</span> away every one of you from his iniquities; and this because ye are the children of the covenant—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349010" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And after that ye were blessed then fulfilleth the Father the covenant which he made with Abraham, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>In</span> thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed—unto the pouring out of the Holy <span class="page-break" data-page="449"></span>Ghost through me upon the Gentiles, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blessing</span> upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Gentiles</span> shall make them mighty above all, unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>scattering</span> of my people, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349011" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And they shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scourge</span> unto the people of this land. Nevertheless, when they shall have received the fulness of my gospel, then if they shall harden their hearts against me I will return their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>iniquities</span> upon their own heads, saith the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349012" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> the covenant which I have made with my people; and I have covenanted with them that I would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gather</span> them together in mine own due time, that I would give unto them again the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>land</span> of their fathers for their inheritance, which is the land of Jerusalem, which is the promised land unto them forever, saith the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349013" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it shall come to pass that the time cometh, when the fulness of my gospel shall be preached unto them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349014" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> in me, that I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and shall pray unto the Father in my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349015" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Then shall their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>watchmen</span> lift up their voice, and with the voice together shall they sing; for they shall see eye to eye.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349016" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Then will the Father gather them together again, and give unto them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349017" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Then shall they break forth into joy—<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Sing</span> together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Father hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349018" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>The Father hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of the Father; and the Father and I are one.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349019" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And then shall be brought to pass that which is written: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Awake</span>, awake again, and put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349020" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Shake thyself from the dust; arise, sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349021" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>For thus saith the Lord: Ye have sold yourselves for naught, and ye shall be redeemed without money.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349022" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, that my people shall know my name; yea, in that day they shall know that I am he that doth speak.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349023" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And then shall they say: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>How</span> beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings unto them, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>publisheth</span> peace; that bringeth good tidings unto them of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion: Thy God reigneth!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349024" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And then shall a cry go forth: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Depart</span> ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch not that which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unclean</span>; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>clean</span> that bear the vessels of the Lord.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="450"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349025" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>For ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not go</span> out with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>haste</span> nor go by flight; for the Lord will go before you, and the God of Israel shall be your rearward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349026" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>Behold, my servant shall deal prudently; he shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349027" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>As many were astonished at thee—his visage was so marred, more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349028" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>So shall he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sprinkle</span> many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him, for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>consider</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349029" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, all these things shall surely come, even as the Father hath commanded me. Then shall this covenant which the Father hath covenanted with his people be fulfilled; and then shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> be inhabited again with my people, and it shall be the land of their inheritance.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 21	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348451" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/21" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 21</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348453" id="title_number1">Chapter 21</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348454" id="study_summary1">Israel will be gathered when the Book of Mormon comes forth—The Gentiles will be established as a free people in America—They will be saved if they believe and obey; otherwise, they will be cut off and destroyed—Israel will build the New Jerusalem, and the lost tribes will return. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348455" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And verily I say unto you, I give unto you a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sign</span>, that ye may know the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>time</span> when these things shall be about to take place—that I shall gather in, from their long dispersion, my people, O house of Israel, and shall establish again among them my Zion;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348456" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And behold, this is the thing which I will give unto you for a sign—for verily I say unto you that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>when</span> these things which I declare unto you, and which I shall declare unto you hereafter of myself, and by the power of the Holy Ghost which shall be given unto you of the Father, shall be made known unto the Gentiles that they may know concerning this people who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, and concerning this my people who shall be scattered by them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348457" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, when these things shall be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>known</span> unto them of the Father, and shall come forth of the Father, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from them</span> unto you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348458" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>For it is wisdom in the Father that they should be established in this land, and be set up as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>free</span> people by the power of the Father, that these things might come forth from them unto a remnant of your seed, that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> of the Father may be fulfilled which he hath covenanted with his people, O house of Israel;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348459" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Therefore, when these works and the works which shall be wrought among you hereafter shall come forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>from</span> the Gentiles, unto your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seed</span> which shall dwindle in unbelief because of iniquity;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348460" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For thus it behooveth the Father that it should come forth from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, that he may show forth his power unto the Gentiles, for this cause that the Gentiles, if they will not harden their hearts, that they <span class="page-break" data-page="451"></span>may repent and come unto me and be baptized in my name and know of the true points of my doctrine, that they may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>numbered</span> among my people, O house of Israel;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348461" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And when these things come to pass that thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seed</span> shall begin to know these things—it shall be a sign unto them, that they may know that the work of the Father hath already commenced unto the fulfilling of the covenant which he hath made unto the people who are of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348462" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when that day shall come, it shall come to pass that kings shall shut their mouths; for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consider</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348463" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For in that day, for my sake shall the Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>work</span> a work, which shall be a great and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>marvelous</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>work</span> among them; and there shall be among them those who will not believe it, although a man shall declare it unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348464" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>But behold, the life of my servant shall be in my hand; therefore they shall not hurt him, although he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>marred</span> because of them. Yet I will heal him, for I will show unto them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>my</span> wisdom is greater than the cunning of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348465" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Therefore it shall come to pass that whosoever will not believe in my words, who am Jesus Christ, which the Father shall cause <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>him</span> to bring forth unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span>, and shall give unto him power that he shall bring them forth unto the Gentiles, (it shall be done even as Moses said) they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cut off</span> from among my people who are of the covenant.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348466" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And my people who are a remnant of Jacob shall be among the Gentiles, yea, in the midst of them as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lion</span> among the beasts of the forest, as a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he go through both treadeth down and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348467" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Their hand shall be lifted up upon their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>adversaries</span>, and all their enemies shall be cut off.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348468" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Yea, wo be unto the Gentiles except they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span>; for it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Father, that I will cut off thy horses out of the midst of thee, and I will destroy thy
