<span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chariots</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348469" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I will cut off the cities of thy land, and throw down all thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strongholds</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348470" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I will cut off <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witchcrafts</span> out of thy land, and thou shalt have no more soothsayers;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348472" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>graven images</span> I will also cut off, and thy standing images out of the midst of thee, and thou shalt no more worship the works of thy hands;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348474" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And I will pluck up thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>groves</span> out of the midst of thee; so will I destroy thy cities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348475" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it shall come to pass that all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lyings</span>, and deceivings, and envyings, and strifes, and priestcrafts, and whoredoms, shall be done away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348477" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>For it shall come to pass, saith the Father, that at that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> whosoever will not repent and come unto my Beloved Son, them will I <span class="page-break" data-page="452"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cut off</span> from among my people, O house of Israel;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348479" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And I will execute <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vengeance</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fury</span> upon them, even as upon the heathen, such as they have not heard.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348481" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But if they will repent and hearken unto my words, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>harden</span> not their hearts, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>establish</span> my church among them, and they shall come in unto the covenant and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>numbered</span> among this the remnant of Jacob, unto whom I have given this land for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>inheritance</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348482" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they shall assist my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>people</span>, the remnant of Jacob, and also as many of the house of Israel as shall come, that they may build a city, which shall be called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>New Jerusalem</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348484" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And then shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> assist my people that they may be gathered in, who are scattered upon all the face of the land, in unto the New Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348486" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of heaven come down among them; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>I</span> also will be in the midst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348488" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And then shall the work of the Father commence at that day, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>when</span> this gospel shall be preached among the remnant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>this people</span>. Verily I say unto you, at that day shall the work of the Father commence among all the dispersed of my people, yea, even the tribes which have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lost</span>, which the Father hath led away out of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348489" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Yea, the work shall commence among all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dispersed</span> of my people, with the Father to prepare the way whereby they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto me, that they may call on the Father in my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348491" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Yea, and then shall the work commence, with the Father among all nations in preparing the way whereby his people may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gathered</span> home to the land of their inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348493" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And they shall go out from all nations; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not go</span> out in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>haste</span>, nor go by flight, for I will go before them, saith the Father, and I will be their rearward.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 22	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348452" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/22" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 22</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348471" id="title_number1">Chapter 22</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348473" id="study_summary1">In the last days, Zion and her stakes will be established, and Israel will be gathered in mercy and tenderness—They will triumph—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/isa/54">Isaiah 54</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348476" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And then shall that which is written come to pass: Sing, O <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>barren</span>, thou that didst not bear; break forth into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>singing</span>, and cry aloud, thou that didst not travail with child; for more are the children of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>desolate</span> than the children of the married wife, saith the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348478" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thy habitations; spare not, lengthen thy cords and strengthen thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stakes</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348480" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inherit</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Gentiles</span> and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="453"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348483" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Fear not, for thou shalt not be ashamed; neither be thou confounded, for thou shalt not be put to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shame</span>; for thou shalt forget the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>shame</span> of thy youth, and shalt not remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>reproach</span> of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348485" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For thy maker, thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>husband</span>, the Lord of Hosts is his name; and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel—the God of the whole earth shall he be called.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348487" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For the Lord hath called thee <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348490" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For a small moment have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forsaken</span> thee, but with great mercies will I gather thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348492" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment, but with everlasting <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kindness</span> will I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span> on thee, saith the Lord thy Redeemer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348494" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span>, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>waters of Noah</span> unto me, for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth, so have I sworn that I would not be wroth with thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348497" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mountains</span> shall depart and the hills be removed, but my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kindness</span> shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>depart</span> from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348499" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted! Behold, I will lay thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stones</span> with fair colors, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348502" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348504" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> thy children shall be taught of the Lord; and great shall be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>peace</span> of thy children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348506" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>In <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>righteousness</span> shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348509" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, they shall surely gather together <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> thee, not by me; whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348511" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348514" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall revile against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>servants</span> of the Lord, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 23	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349094" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/23" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 23</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349095" id="title_number1">Chapter 23</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349096" id="study_summary1">Jesus approves the words of Isaiah—He commands the people to search the prophets—The words of Samuel the Lamanite concerning the Resurrection are added to their records. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349097" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, behold, I say unto you, that ye ought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>search</span> these things. Yea, a commandment I give unto you that ye search these things diligently; for great are the words of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Isaiah</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349098" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For surely he spake as touching all things concerning my people which are of the house of Israel; <span class="page-break" data-page="454"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>therefore</span> it must needs be that he must speak also to the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349099" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And all things that he spake have been and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shall</span> be, even according to the words which he spake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349100" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore give heed to my words; write the things which I have told you; and according to the time and the will of the Father <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>they</span> shall go forth unto the Gentiles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349101" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And whosoever will hearken unto my words and repenteth and is baptized, the same shall be saved. Search the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span>, for many there be that testify of these things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349102" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had said these words he said unto them again, after he had expounded all the scriptures unto them which they had received, he said unto them: Behold, other scriptures I would that ye should write, that ye have not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349103" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that he said unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>: Bring forth the record which ye have kept.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349104" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when Nephi had brought forth the records, and laid them before him, he cast his eyes upon them and said:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349105" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Verily I say unto you, I commanded my servant <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Samuel</span>, the Lamanite, that he should testify unto this people, that at the day that the Father should glorify his name in me that there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>many</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>saints</span> who should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>arise</span> from the dead, and should appear unto many, and should minister unto them. And he said unto them: Was it not so?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349106" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And his disciples answered him and said: Yea, Lord, Samuel did prophesy according to thy words, and they were all fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349107" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And Jesus said unto them: How be it that ye have not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> this thing, that many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>saints</span> did arise and appear unto many and did minister unto them?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349108" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that Nephi remembered that this thing had not been written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349109" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that Jesus commanded that it should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span>; therefore it was written according as he commanded.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349110" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>expounded</span> all the scriptures in one, which they had written, he commanded them that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>teach</span> the things which he had expounded unto them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 24	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348579" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/24" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 24</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348580" id="title_number1">Chapter 24</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348581" id="study_summary1">The Lord’s messenger will prepare the way for the Second Coming—Christ will sit in judgment—Israel is commanded to pay tithes and offerings—A book of remembrance is kept—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/mal/3">Malachi 3</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348582" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that he commanded them that they should write the words which the Father had given unto Malachi, which he should tell unto them. And it came to pass that after they were written he expounded them. And these are the words which he did tell unto them, saying: Thus said the Father unto Malachi—Behold, I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>send</span> my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>messenger</span>, and he shall prepare the way before me, and the Lord whom ye seek shall suddenly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>come</span> to his temple, even the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>messenger</span> of the covenant, whom ye delight in; behold, he shall come, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348583" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But who may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abide</span> the day of his coming, and who shall stand when he appeareth? For he is like <span class="page-break" data-page="455"></span>a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>refiner’s</span> fire, and like fuller’s soap.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348584" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purify</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sons of Levi</span>, and purge them as gold and silver, that they may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>offer</span> unto the Lord an offering in righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348585" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the Lord, as in the days of old, and as in former years.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348586" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I will come <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>near</span> to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sorcerers</span>, and against the adulterers, and against false <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>swearers</span>, and against those that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>oppress</span> the hireling in his wages, the widow and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fatherless</span>, and that turn aside the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>stranger</span>, and fear not me, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348587" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I am</span> the Lord, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348588" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordinances</span>, and have not kept them. <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Return</span> unto me and I will return unto you, saith the Lord of Hosts. But ye say: Wherein shall we return?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348589" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say: Wherein have we robbed thee? In <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tithes</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>offerings</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348590" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Ye are cursed with a curse, for ye have robbed me, even this whole nation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348591" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Bring ye all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tithes</span> into the storehouse, that there may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>meat</span> in my house; and prove me now herewith, saith the Lord of Hosts, if I will not open you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>windows of heaven</span>, and pour you out a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>blessing</span> that there shall not be room enough to receive it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348592" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And I will rebuke the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>devourer</span> for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the fields, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348593" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And all nations shall call you blessed, for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348594" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Your words have been stout against me, saith the Lord. Yet ye say: What have we spoken against thee?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348595" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Ye have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>said</span>: It is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vain</span> to serve God, and what doth it profit that we have kept his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ordinances</span> and that we have walked mournfully before the Lord of Hosts?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348596" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are set up; yea, they that tempt God are even delivered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348597" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Then they that feared the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spake</span> often one to another, and the Lord hearkened and heard; and a book of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remembrance</span> was written before him for them that feared the Lord, and that thought upon his name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348598" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mine</span>, saith the Lord of Hosts, in that day when I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>make</span> up my jewels; and I will <span class="page-break" data-page="456"></span>spare them as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348599" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Then shall ye return and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>discern</span> between the righteous and the wicked, between him that serveth God and him that serveth him not.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 25	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349127" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/25" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 25</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349128" id="title_number1">Chapter 25</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349129" id="study_summary1">At the Second Coming, the proud and wicked will be burned as stubble—Elijah will return before that great and dreadful day—Compare <a class="scripture-ref" href="gospellibrary://content/scriptures/ot/mal/4">Malachi 4</a>. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349130" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>For</span> behold, the day cometh that shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>burn</span> as an oven; and all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>proud</span>, yea, and all that do wickedly, shall be stubble; and the day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349131" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But unto you that fear my name, shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Son of Righteousness</span> arise with healing in his wings; and ye shall go forth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grow up</span> as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>calves</span> in the stall.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349132" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tread</span> down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I shall do this, saith the Lord of Hosts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349133" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Remember ye the law of Moses, my servant, which I commanded unto him in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Horeb</span> for all Israel, with the statutes and judgments.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349134" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, I will send you <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Elijah</span> the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>day</span> of the Lord;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349135" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>turn</span> the heart of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fathers</span> to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>smite</span> the earth with a curse.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 26	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349149" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/26" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 26</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349150" id="title_number1">Chapter 26</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349151" id="study_summary1">Jesus expounds all things from the beginning to the end—Babes and children utter marvelous things that cannot be written—Those in the Church of Christ have all things in common among them. About <small>A.D.</small> 34.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349152" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that when Jesus had told these things he expounded them unto the multitude; and he did expound all things unto them, both great and small.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349153" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he saith: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>These scriptures</span>, which ye had not with you, the Father commanded that I should give unto you; for it was wisdom in him that they should be given unto future generations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349154" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he did expound all things, even from the beginning until the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> that he should come in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>glory</span>—yea, even all things which should come upon the face of the earth, even until the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>elements</span> should melt with fervent heat, and the earth should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>wrapt</span> together as a scroll, and the heavens and the earth should pass away;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349155" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And even unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and last day, when all people, and all kindreds, and all nations and tongues shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>stand</span> before God, to be judged <span class="page-break" data-page="457"></span>of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349156" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>If they be good, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span> of everlasting life; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of damnation; being on a parallel, the one on the one hand and the other on the other hand, according to the mercy, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span>, and the holiness which is in Christ, who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>before</span> the world began.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349157" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now there cannot be written in this book even a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hundredth</span> part of the things which Jesus did truly teach unto the people;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349158" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>But behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of Nephi</span> do contain the more part of the things which he taught the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349159" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And these things have I written, which are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lesser</span> part of the things which he taught the people; and I have written them to the intent that they may be brought again unto this people, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> the Gentiles, according to the words which Jesus hath spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349160" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And when they shall have received this, which is expedient that they should have first, to try their faith, and if it shall so be that they shall believe these things then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>greater things</span> be made manifest unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349161" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And if it so be that they will not believe these things, then shall the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>greater things</span> be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>withheld</span> from them, unto their condemnation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349162" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Behold, I was about to write them, all which were engraven upon the plates of Nephi, but the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forbade</span> it, saying: I will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>try</span> the faith of my people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349163" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Therefore I, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mormon</span>, do write the things which have been commanded me of the Lord. And now I, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Mormon</span>, make an end of my sayings, and proceed to write the things which have been commanded me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349164" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Therefore, I would that ye should behold that the Lord truly did teach the people, for the space of three days; and after that he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>show</span> himself unto them oft, and did break <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bread</span> oft, and bless it, and give it unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349165" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that he did teach and minister unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> of the multitude of whom hath been spoken, and he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>loose</span> their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tongues</span>, and they did speak unto their fathers great and marvelous things, even greater than he had revealed unto the people; and he loosed their tongues that they could utter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349166" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that after he had ascended into heaven—the second time that he showed himself unto them, and had gone unto the Father, after having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>healed</span> all their sick, and their lame, and opened the eyes of their blind and unstopped the ears of the deaf, and even had done all manner of cures among them, and raised a man from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span>, and had shown forth his power unto them, and had ascended unto the Father—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349167" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, it came to pass on the morrow that the multitude gathered themselves together, and they both saw and heard these children; yea, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>babes</span> did open their mouths <span class="page-break" data-page="458"></span>and utter marvelous things; and the things which they did utter were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>forbidden</span> that there should not any man write them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349168" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span> whom Jesus had chosen began <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> that time forth to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>baptize</span> and to teach as many as did come unto them; and as many as were baptized in the name of Jesus were filled with the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349169" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And many of them saw and heard unspeakable things, which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not lawful</span> to be written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349170" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they taught, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>minister</span> one to another; and they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> things <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>common</span> among them, every man dealing justly, one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349171" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they did do all things even as Jesus had commanded them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349172" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they who were baptized in the name of Jesus were called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> of Christ.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 27	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348633" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/27" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 27</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348634" id="title_number1">Chapter 27</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348635" id="study_summary1">Jesus commands them to call the Church in His name—His mission and atoning sacrifice constitute His gospel—Men are commanded to repent and be baptized that they may be sanctified by the Holy Ghost—They are to be even as Jesus is. About <small>A.D.</small> 34–35.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348636" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that as the disciples of Jesus were journeying and were preaching the things which they had both heard and seen, and were baptizing in the name of Jesus, it came to pass that the disciples were gathered together and were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>united</span> in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mighty prayer</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fasting</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348637" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And Jesus again <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>showed</span> himself unto them, for they were praying unto the Father in his name; and Jesus came and stood in the midst of them, and said unto them: What will ye that I shall give unto you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348638" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they said unto him: Lord, we will that thou wouldst tell us the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> whereby we shall call this church; for there are disputations among the people concerning this matter.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348639" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And the Lord said unto them: Verily, verily, I say unto you, why is it that the people should murmur and dispute because of this thing?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348640" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Have they not read the scriptures, which say ye must take upon you the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>name</span> of Christ, which is my name? For by this name shall ye be called at the last day;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348641" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And whoso taketh upon him my name, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>endureth</span> to the end, the same shall be saved at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348642" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore, whatsoever ye shall do, ye shall do it in my name; therefore ye shall call the church in my name; and ye shall call upon the Father in my name that he will bless the church for my sake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348643" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And how be it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>my</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span> save it be called in my name? For if a church be called in Moses’ name then it be Moses’ church; or if it be called in the name of a man then it be the church of a man; but if it be called in my name then it is my church, if it so be that they are built upon my gospel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348644" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Verily I say unto you, that ye are built upon my gospel; therefore ye shall call whatsoever things ye do call, in my name; therefore if ye call upon the Father, for the church, if it be in my name the Father will hear you;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348645" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And if it so be that the church <span class="page-break" data-page="459"></span>is built upon my gospel then will the Father show forth his own works in it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348646" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But if it be not built upon my gospel, and is built upon the works of men, or upon the works of the devil, verily I say unto you they have joy in their works for a season, and by and by the end cometh, and they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hewn</span> down and cast into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fire</span>, from whence there is no return.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348647" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For their works do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>follow</span> them, for it is because of their works that they are hewn down; therefore remember the things that I have told you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348648" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold I have given unto you my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span>, and this is the gospel which I have given unto you—that I came into the world to do the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>will</span> of my Father, because my Father sent me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348649" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And my Father sent me that I might be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cross</span>; and after that I had been lifted up upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cross</span>, that I might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>draw</span> all men unto me, that as I have been lifted up by men even so should men be lifted up by the Father, to stand before me, to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>judged</span> of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348650" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And for this cause have I been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span>; therefore, according to the power of the Father I will draw all men unto me, that they may be judged according to their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>works</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348651" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it shall come to pass, that whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repenteth</span> and is baptized in my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>name</span> shall be filled; and if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>endureth</span> to the end, behold, him will I hold guiltless before my Father at that day when I shall stand to judge the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348652" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And he that endureth not unto the end, the same is he that is also hewn down and cast into the fire, from whence they can no more return, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>justice</span> of the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348653" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And this is the word which he hath given unto the children of men. And for this cause he fulfilleth the words which he hath given, and he lieth not, but fulfilleth all his words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348654" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no unclean thing</span> can enter into his kingdom; therefore nothing entereth into his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rest</span> save it be those who have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>washed</span> their garments in my blood, because of their faith, and the repentance of all their sins, and their faithfulness unto the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348655" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Now this is the commandment: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Repent</span>, all ye ends of the earth, and come unto me and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> in my name, that ye may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sanctified</span> by the reception of the Holy Ghost, that ye may stand <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>spotless</span> before me at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348656" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Verily, verily, I say unto you, this is my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span>; and ye know the things that ye must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>do</span> in my church; for the works which ye have seen me do that shall ye also do; for that which ye have seen me do even that shall ye do;</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="460"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348657" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>Therefore, if ye do these things blessed are ye, for ye shall be lifted up at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348658" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Write</span> the things which ye have seen and heard, save it be those which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>forbidden</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348659" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Write the works of this people, which shall be, even as hath been written, of that which hath been.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348660" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For behold, out of the books which have been written, and which shall be written, shall this people be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span>, for by them shall their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>works</span> be known unto men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348661" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And behold, all things are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>written</span> by the Father; therefore out of the books which shall be written shall the world be judged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348662" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And know ye that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ye</span> shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judges</span> of this people, according to the judgment which I shall give unto you, which shall be just. Therefore, what <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>manner</span> of men ought ye to be? Verily I say unto you, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>as</span> I am.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348663" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And now I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> unto the Father. And verily I say unto you, whatsoever things ye shall ask the Father in my name shall be given unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348664" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ask</span>, and ye shall receive; knock, and it shall be opened unto you; for he that asketh, receiveth; and unto him that knocketh, it shall be opened.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348665" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And now, behold, my joy is great, even unto fulness, because of you, and also this generation; yea, and even the Father rejoiceth, and also all the holy angels, because of you and this generation; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> of them are lost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348666" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Behold, I would that ye should understand; for I mean them who are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>now</span> alive of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>this generation</span>; and none of them are lost; and in them I have fulness of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>joy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348667" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>But behold, it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorroweth</span> me because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fourth</span> generation from this generation, for they are led away captive by him even as was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>son of perdition</span>; for they will sell me for silver and for gold, and for that which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>moth</span> doth corrupt and which thieves can break through and steal. And in that day will I visit them, even in turning their works upon their own heads.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348668" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had ended these sayings he said unto his disciples: Enter ye in at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strait gate</span>; for strait is the gate, and narrow is the way that leads to life, and few there be that find it; but wide is the gate, and broad the way which leads to death, and many there be that travel therein, until the night cometh, wherein no man can work.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 28	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128349211" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/28" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 28</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128349212" id="title_number1">Chapter 28</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128349213" id="study_summary1">Nine of the twelve disciples desire and are promised an inheritance in Christ’s kingdom when they die—The Three Nephites desire and are given power over death so as to remain on the earth until Jesus comes again—They are translated and see things not lawful to utter, and they are now ministering among men. About <small>A.D.</small> 34–35.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349214" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass when Jesus had said these words, he spake unto his disciples, one by one, saying unto them: What is it that ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desire</span> of <span class="page-break" data-page="461"></span>me, after that I am gone to the Father?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349215" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they all spake, save it were three, saying: We desire that after we have lived unto the age of man, that our ministry, wherein thou hast called us, may have an end, that we may speedily come unto thee in thy kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349216" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And he said unto them: Blessed are ye because ye desired this thing of me; therefore, after that ye are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seventy and two</span> years old ye shall come unto me in my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kingdom</span>; and with me ye shall find <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rest</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349217" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when he had spoken unto them, he turned himself unto the three, and said unto them: What will ye that I should do unto you, when I am gone unto the Father?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349218" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they sorrowed in their hearts, for they durst not speak unto him the thing which they desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349219" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he said unto them: Behold, I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> your thoughts, and ye have desired the thing which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>John</span>, my beloved, who was with me in my ministry, before that I was lifted up by the Jews, desired of me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349220" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Therefore, more blessed are ye, for ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>never</span> taste of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>death</span>; but ye shall live to behold all the doings of the Father unto the children of men, even until all things shall be fulfilled according to the will of the Father, when I shall come in my glory with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>powers</span> of heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349221" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And ye shall never endure the pains of death; but when I shall come in my glory ye shall be changed in the twinkling of an eye from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mortality</span> to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>immortality</span>; and then shall ye be blessed in the kingdom of my Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349222" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And again, ye shall not have pain while ye shall dwell in the flesh, neither sorrow save it be for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span> of the world; and all this will I do because of the thing which ye have desired of me, for ye have desired that ye might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bring</span> the souls of men unto me, while the world shall stand.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349223" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And for this cause ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fulness</span> of joy; and ye shall sit down in the kingdom of my Father; yea, your joy shall be full, even as the Father hath given me fulness of joy; and ye shall be even as I am, and I am even as the Father; and the Father and I are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>one</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349224" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Holy Ghost</span> beareth record of the Father and me; and the Father giveth the Holy Ghost unto the children of men, because of me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349225" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he touched every one of them with his finger save it were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> who were to tarry, and then he departed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349226" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, the heavens were opened, and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>caught up</span> into heaven, and saw and heard unspeakable things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349227" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forbidden</span> them that they should utter; neither was it given unto them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> that they could utter the things which they saw and heard;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349228" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And whether they were in the body or out of the body, they could not tell; for it did seem unto them like a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>transfiguration</span> of them, that <span class="page-break" data-page="462"></span>they were changed from this body of flesh into an immortal state, that they could behold the things of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349229" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>But it came to pass that they did again minister upon the face of the earth; nevertheless they did not minister of the things which they had heard and seen, because of the commandment which was given them in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349230" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, whether they were mortal or immortal, from the day of their transfiguration, I know not;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349231" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But this much I know, according to the record which hath been given—they did go forth upon the face of the land, and did minister unto all the people, uniting as many to the church as would believe in their preaching; baptizing them, and as many as were baptized did receive the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349232" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they were cast into prison by them who did not belong to the church. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prisons</span> could not hold them, for they were rent in twain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349233" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they were cast down into the earth; but they did smite the earth with the word of God, insomuch that by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> they were delivered out of the depths of the earth; and therefore they could not dig pits sufficient to hold them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349234" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And thrice they were cast into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>furnace</span> and received no harm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349235" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And twice were they cast into a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>den</span> of wild beasts; and behold they did play with the beasts as a child with a suckling lamb, and received no harm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349236" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that thus they did go forth among all the people of Nephi, and did preach the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span> of Christ unto all people upon the face of the land; and they were converted unto the Lord, and were united unto the church of Christ, and thus the people of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>that generation</span> were blessed, according to the word of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349237" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now I, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Mormon</span>, make an end of speaking concerning these things for a time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349238" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Behold, I was about to write the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>names</span> of those who were never to taste of death, but the Lord forbade; therefore I write them not, for they are hid from the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349239" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>But behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>I</span> have seen them, and they have ministered unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349240" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And behold they will be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>among</span> the Gentiles, and the Gentiles shall know them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349241" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>They will also be among the Jews, and the Jews shall know them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349242" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it shall come to pass, when the Lord seeth fit in his wisdom that they shall minister unto all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scattered</span> tribes of Israel, and unto all nations, kindreds, tongues and people, and shall bring out of them unto Jesus many souls, that their desire may be fulfilled, and also because of the convincing power of God which is in them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349243" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And they are as the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> of God, and if they shall pray unto the Father in the name of Jesus they can show themselves unto whatsoever man it seemeth them good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349244" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Therefore, great and marvelous works shall be wrought by them, before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and coming day when all people must surely stand before the judgment-seat of Christ;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349245" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Yea even among the Gentiles shall there be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and marvelous work wrought by them, before that judgment day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349246" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And if ye had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> the scriptures which give an account of all the <span class="page-break" data-page="463"></span>marvelous works of Christ, ye would, according to the words of Christ, know that these things must surely come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349247" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And wo be unto him that will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not hearken</span> unto the words of Jesus, and also to them whom he hath chosen and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sent</span> among them; for whoso <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>receiveth</span> not the words of Jesus and the words of those whom he hath sent receiveth not him; and therefore he will not receive them at the last day;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349248" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it would be better for them if they had not been born. For do ye suppose that ye can get rid of the justice of an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>offended</span> God, who hath been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trampled</span> under feet of men, that thereby salvation might come?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349249" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And now behold, as I spake concerning those whom the Lord hath chosen, yea, even three who were caught up into the heavens, that I knew not whether they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cleansed</span> from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mortality</span> to immortality—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349250" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>But behold, since I wrote, I have inquired of the Lord, and he hath made it manifest unto me that there must needs be a change wrought upon their bodies, or else it needs be that they must taste of death;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349251" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>Therefore, that they might not taste of death there was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>change</span> wrought upon their bodies, that they might not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>suffer</span> pain nor sorrow save it were for the sins of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349252" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Now this change was not equal to that which shall take place at the last day; but there was a change wrought upon them, insomuch that Satan could have no power over them, that he could not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tempt</span> them; and they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sanctified</span> in the flesh, that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>holy</span>, and that the powers of the earth could not hold them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128349253" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And in this state they were to remain until the judgment day of Christ; and at that day they were to receive a greater change, and to be received into the kingdom of the Father to go no more out, but to dwell with God eternally in the heavens.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 29	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348723" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/29" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 29</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348724" id="title_number1">Chapter 29</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348725" id="study_summary1">The coming forth of the Book of Mormon is a sign that the Lord has commenced to gather Israel and fulfill His covenants—Those who reject His latter-day revelations and gifts will be cursed. About <small>A.D.</small> 34–35.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348726" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now behold, I say unto you that when the Lord shall see fit, in his wisdom, that these sayings shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto the Gentiles according to his word, then ye may know that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> which the Father hath made with the children of Israel, concerning their restoration to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lands</span> of their inheritance, is already beginning to be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348727" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And ye may know that the words of the Lord, which have been spoken by the holy prophets, shall all be fulfilled; and ye need not say that the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delays</span> his coming unto the children of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348728" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And ye need not imagine in your hearts that the words which have been spoken are vain, for behold, the Lord will remember his covenant which he hath made unto his people of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348729" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when ye shall see these sayings coming forth among you, then ye need not any longer spurn at the doings of the Lord, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sword</span> of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>justice</span> is in his right hand; <span class="page-break" data-page="464"></span>and behold, at that day, if ye shall spurn at his doings he will cause that it shall soon overtake you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348730" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Wo</span> unto him that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spurneth</span> at the doings of the Lord; yea, wo unto him that shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>deny</span> the Christ and his works!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348731" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Yea, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wo</span> unto him that shall deny the revelations of the Lord, and that shall say the Lord no longer worketh by revelation, or by prophecy, or by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gifts</span>, or by tongues, or by healings, or by the power of the Holy Ghost!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348732" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Yea, and wo unto him that shall say at that day, to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gain</span>, that there can be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>no miracle</span> wrought by Jesus Christ;
