for he that doeth this shall become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>like</span> unto the son of perdition, for whom there was no mercy, according to the word of Christ!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348733" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, and ye need not any longer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hiss</span>, nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spurn</span>, nor make game of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jews</span>, nor any of the remnant of the house of Israel; for behold, the Lord remembereth his covenant unto them, and he will do unto them according to that which he hath sworn.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348734" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Therefore ye need not suppose that ye can turn the right hand of the Lord unto the left, that he may not execute judgment unto the fulfilling of the covenant which he hath made unto the house of Israel.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
3 Nephi 30	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128348752" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/3-ne/30" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>3 Nephi 30</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128348753" id="title_number1">Chapter 30</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128348754" id="study_summary1">The latter-day Gentiles are commanded to repent, come unto Christ, and be numbered with the house of Israel. About <small>A.D.</small> 34–35.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348755" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>commanded</span> me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128348756" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Turn, all ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, from your wicked ways; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repent</span> of your evil doings, of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lyings</span> and deceivings, and of your whoredoms, and of your secret abominations, and your idolatries, and of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>murders</span>, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>priestcrafts</span>, and your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>envyings</span>, and your strifes, and from all your wickedness and abominations, and come unto me, and be baptized in my name, that ye may receive a remission of your sins, and be filled with the Holy Ghost, that ye may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>numbered</span> with my people who are of the house of Israel.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
4 Nephi 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128350096" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/4-ne/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>4 Nephi 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="465"></span>^N			<h1 data-aid="128350097" id="title1"><span class="dominant">Fourth Nephi</span></h1>^N			<h1 data-aid="128350098" id="title2"><span class="dominant">The Book of Nephi</span> <br />Who Is the Son of Nephi—One of the Disciples of Jesus Christ</h1>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128350099" id="intro1">An account of the people of Nephi, according to his record.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128350100" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128350101" id="study_summary1">The Nephites and the Lamanites are all converted unto the Lord—They have all things in common, work miracles, and prosper in the land—After two centuries, divisions, evils, false churches, and persecutions arise—After three hundred years, both the Nephites and the Lamanites are wicked—Ammaron hides up the sacred records. About <small>A.D.</small> 35–321.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350102" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the thirty and fourth year passed away, and also the thirty and fifth, and behold the disciples of Jesus had formed a church of Christ in all the lands round about. And as many as did come unto them, and did truly repent of their sins, were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>baptized</span> in the name of Jesus; and they did also receive the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350103" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass in the thirty and sixth year, the people were all converted unto the Lord, upon all the face of the land, both Nephites and Lamanites, and there were no contentions and disputations among them, and every man did deal justly one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350104" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> things common among them; therefore there were not rich and poor, bond and free, but they were all made free, and partakers of the heavenly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gift</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350105" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that the thirty and seventh year passed away also, and there still continued to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>peace</span> in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350106" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And there were great and marvelous works wrought by the disciples of Jesus, insomuch that they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heal</span> the sick, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>raise</span> the dead, and cause the lame to walk, and the blind to receive their sight, and the deaf to hear; and all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>miracles</span> did they work among the children of men; and in nothing did they work miracles save it were in the name of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350107" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And thus did the thirty and eighth year pass away, and also the thirty and ninth, and forty and first, and the forty and second, yea, even until forty and nine years had passed away, and also the fifty and first, and the fifty and second; yea, and even until fifty and nine years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350108" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord did prosper them exceedingly in the land; yea, insomuch that they did build cities again where there had been cities burned.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350109" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Yea, even that great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city Zarahemla</span> did they cause to be built again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350110" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>But there were many cities which had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sunk</span>, and waters came up in the stead thereof; therefore these cities could not be renewed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350111" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, behold, it came to pass that the people of Nephi did wax strong, and did multiply exceedingly fast, and became an exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fair</span> and delightsome people.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="466"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350112" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And they were married, and given in marriage, and were blessed according to the multitude of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promises</span> which the Lord had made unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350113" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And they did not walk any more after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>performances</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordinances</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>law</span> of Moses; but they did walk after the commandments which they had received from their Lord and their God, continuing in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fasting</span> and prayer, and in meeting together oft both to pray and to hear the word of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350114" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that there was no contention among all the people, in all the land; but there were mighty miracles wrought among the disciples of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350115" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that the seventy and first year passed away, and also the seventy and second year, yea, and in fine, till the seventy and ninth year had passed away; yea, even an hundred years had passed away, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span> of Jesus, whom he had chosen, had all gone to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>paradise</span> of God, save it were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>three</span> who should tarry; and there were other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>disciples</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>ordained</span> in their stead; and also many of that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>generation</span> had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350116" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that there was no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contention</span> in the land, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>love</span> of God which did dwell in the hearts of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350117" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And there were no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>envyings</span>, nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strifes</span>, nor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tumults</span>, nor whoredoms, nor lyings, nor murders, nor any manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>lasciviousness</span>; and surely there could not be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>happier</span> people among all the people who had been created by the hand of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350118" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>There were no robbers, nor murderers, neither were there Lamanites, nor any manner of -ites; but they were in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span>, the children of Christ, and heirs to the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350119" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And how blessed were they! For the Lord did bless them in all their doings; yea, even they were blessed and prospered until an hundred and ten years had passed away; and the first generation from Christ had passed away, and there was no contention in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350120" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>, he that kept this last record, (and he kept it upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates of Nephi</span>) died, and his son Amos kept it in his stead; and he kept it upon the plates of Nephi also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350121" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he kept it eighty and four years, and there was still peace in the land, save it were a small part of the people who had revolted from the church and taken upon them the name of Lamanites; therefore there began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span> again in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350122" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amos</span> died also, (and it was an hundred and ninety and four years from the coming of Christ) and his son Amos kept the record in his stead; and he also kept it upon the plates of Nephi; and it was also written in the book of Nephi, which is this book.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350123" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that two hundred years had passed away; and the second generation had all passed away save it were a few.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350124" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now I, Mormon, would that ye should know that the people had multiplied, insomuch that they were spread upon all the face of the land, <span class="page-break" data-page="467"></span>and that they had become exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rich</span>, because of their prosperity in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350125" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And now, in this two hundred and first year there began to be among them those who were lifted up in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span>, such as the wearing of costly apparel, and all manner of fine pearls, and of the fine things of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350126" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And from that time forth they did have their goods and their substance no more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>common</span> among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350127" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And they began to be divided into classes; and they began to build up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>churches</span> unto themselves to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gain</span>, and began to deny the true church of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350128" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that when two hundred and ten years had passed away there were many churches in the land; yea, there were many churches which professed to know the Christ, and yet they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> the more parts of his gospel, insomuch that they did receive all manner of wickedness, and did administer that which was sacred unto him to whom it had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>forbidden</span> because of unworthiness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350129" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And this church did multiply exceedingly because of iniquity, and because of the power of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Satan</span> who did get hold upon their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hearts</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350130" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And again, there was another church which denied the Christ; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>persecute</span> the true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span> of Christ, because of their humility and their belief in Christ; and they did despise them because of the many miracles which were wrought among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350131" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Therefore they did exercise power and authority over the disciples of Jesus who did tarry with them, and they did cast them into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span>; but by the power of the word of God, which was in them, the prisons were rent in twain, and they went forth doing mighty miracles among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350132" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Nevertheless, and notwithstanding all these miracles, the people did harden their hearts, and did seek to kill them, even as the Jews at Jerusalem sought to kill Jesus, according to his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350133" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And they did cast them into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>furnaces</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fire</span>, and they came forth receiving no harm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350134" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And they also cast them into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dens</span> of wild beasts, and they did play with the wild beasts even as a child with a lamb; and they did come forth from among them, receiving no harm.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350136" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Nevertheless, the people did harden their hearts, for they were led by many priests and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>false prophets</span> to build up many churches, and to do all manner of iniquity. And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>smite</span> upon the people of Jesus; but the people of Jesus did not smite again. And thus they did dwindle in unbelief and wickedness, from year to year, even until two hundred and thirty years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350137" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And now it came to pass in this year, yea, in the two hundred and thirty and first year, there was a great division among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350138" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that in this year there arose a people who were called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephites</span>, and they were true believers in Christ; and among them there were those who were called by the Lamanites—Jacobites, and Josephites, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Zoramites</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350139" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Therefore the true believers in Christ, and the true worshipers of <span class="page-break" data-page="468"></span>Christ, (among whom were the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three disciples</span> of Jesus who should tarry) were called Nephites, and Jacobites, and Josephites, and Zoramites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350140" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that they who rejected the gospel were called Lamanites, and Lemuelites, and Ishmaelites; and they did not dwindle in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelief</span>, but they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wilfully rebel</span> against the gospel of Christ; and they did teach their children that they should not believe, even as their fathers, from the beginning, did dwindle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350142" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And it was because of the wickedness and abomination of their fathers, even as it was in the beginning. And they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>taught</span> to hate the children of God, even as the Lamanites were taught to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hate</span> the children of Nephi from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350143" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And it came to pass that two hundred and forty and four years had passed away, and thus were the affairs of the people. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>more wicked</span> part of the people did wax strong, and became exceedingly more numerous than were the people of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350144" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And they did still continue to build up churches unto themselves, and adorn them with all manner of precious things. And thus did two hundred and fifty years pass away, and also two hundred and sixty years.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350145" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And it came to pass that the wicked part of the people began again to build up the secret oaths and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>combinations</span> of Gadianton.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350146" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And also the people who were called the people of Nephi began to be proud in their hearts, because of their exceeding riches, and become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>vain</span> like unto their brethren, the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350147" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>And from this time the disciples began to sorrow for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sins</span> of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350148" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And it came to pass that when three hundred years had passed away, both the people of Nephi and the Lamanites had become exceedingly wicked one like unto another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350149" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>And it came to pass that the robbers of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gadianton</span> did spread over all the face of the land; and there were none that were righteous save it were the disciples of Jesus. And gold and silver did they lay up in store in abundance, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note46b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traffic</span> in all manner of traffic.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350150" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>And it came to pass that after three hundred and five years had passed away, (and the people did still remain in wickedness) <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Amos</span> died; and his brother, Ammaron, did keep the record in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350151" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>And it came to pass that when three hundred and twenty years had passed away, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammaron</span>, being constrained by the Holy Ghost, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hide</span> up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>records</span> which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>sacred</span>—yea, even all the sacred records which had been handed down from generation to generation, which were sacred—even until the three hundred and twentieth year from the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128350152" id="p49"><span class="verse-number">49 </span>And he did hide them up unto the Lord, that they might <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note49a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> again unto the remnant of the house of Jacob, according to the prophecies and the promises of the Lord. And thus is the end of the record of Ammaron.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357533" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="469"></span>^N			<h1 data-aid="128357534" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Mormon</span></h1>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357535" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357536" id="study_summary1">Ammaron instructs Mormon concerning the sacred records—War commences between the Nephites and the Lamanites—The Three Nephites are taken away—Wickedness, unbelief, sorceries, and witchcraft prevail. About <small>A.D.</small> 321–26.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357537" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Mormon, make a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> of the things which I have both seen and heard, and call it the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Book of Mormon</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357538" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And about the time that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammaron</span> hid up the records unto the Lord, he came unto me, (I being about ten years of age, and I began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>learned</span> somewhat after the manner of the learning of my people) and Ammaron said unto me: I perceive that thou art a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sober</span> child, and art quick to observe;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357539" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Therefore, when ye are about twenty and four years old I would that ye should remember the things that ye have observed concerning this people; and when ye are of that age go to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land Antum</span>, unto a hill which shall be called <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Shim</span>; and there have I deposited unto the Lord all the sacred engravings concerning this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357540" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And behold, ye shall take the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>plates of Nephi</span> unto yourself, and the remainder shall ye leave in the place where they are; and ye shall engrave on the plates of Nephi all the things that ye have observed concerning this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357541" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And I, Mormon, being a descendant of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephi</span>, (and my father’s name was Mormon) I remembered the things which Ammaron commanded me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357542" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that I, being eleven years old, was carried by my father into the land southward, even to the land of Zarahemla.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357543" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>The whole face of the land had become covered with buildings, and the people were as numerous almost, as it were the sand of the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357544" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass in this year there began to be a war between the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Nephites</span>, who consisted of the Nephites and the Jacobites and the Josephites and the Zoramites; and this war was between the Nephites, and the Lamanites and the Lemuelites and the Ishmaelites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357545" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span> and the Lemuelites and the Ishmaelites were called Lamanites, and the two parties were Nephites and Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357546" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the war began to be among them in the borders of Zarahemla, by the waters of Sidon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357547" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites had gathered together a great number of men, even to exceed the number of thirty thousand. And it came to pass that they did have in this same year a number of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>battles</span>, in which the Nephites did beat the Lamanites and did slay many of them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357548" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites withdrew their design, and there was peace settled in the land; and peace did remain for the space of about four years, that there was no bloodshed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357549" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But wickedness did prevail upon the face of the whole land, insomuch that the Lord did take away his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beloved</span> disciples, and the work of miracles and of healing did cease because of the iniquity of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357550" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And there were no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gifts</span> from <span class="page-break" data-page="470"></span>the Lord, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span> did not come upon any, because of their wickedness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unbelief</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357551" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And I, being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fifteen</span> years of age and being somewhat of a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sober</span> mind, therefore I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>visited</span> of the Lord, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>tasted</span> and knew of the goodness of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357552" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And I did endeavor to preach unto this people, but my mouth was shut, and I was forbidden that I should preach unto them; for behold they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wilfully rebelled</span> against their God; and the beloved disciples were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>taken</span> away out of the land, because of their iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357553" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But I did remain among them, but I was forbidden to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>preach</span> unto them, because of the hardness of their hearts; and because of the hardness of their hearts the land was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cursed</span> for their sake.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357554" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And these Gadianton robbers, who were among the Lamanites, did infest the land, insomuch that the inhabitants thereof began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> up their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>treasures</span> in the earth; and they became slippery, because the Lord had cursed the land, that they could not hold them, nor retain them again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357555" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorceries</span>, and witchcrafts, and magics; and the power of the evil one was wrought upon all the face of the land, even unto the fulfilling of all the words of Abinadi, and also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Samuel the Lamanite</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357560" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357583" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357585" id="study_summary1">Mormon leads the Nephite armies—Blood and carnage sweep the land—The Nephites lament and mourn with the sorrowing of the damned—Their day of grace is passed—Mormon obtains the plates of Nephi—Wars continue. About <small>A.D.</small> 327–50.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357587" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass in that same year there began to be a war again between the Nephites and the Lamanites. And notwithstanding I being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>young</span>, was large in stature; therefore the people of Nephi appointed me that I should be their leader, or the leader of their armies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357588" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Therefore it came to pass that in my sixteenth year I did go forth at the head of an army of the Nephites, against the Lamanites; therefore three hundred and twenty and six years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357589" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that in the three hundred and twenty and seventh year the Lamanites did come upon us with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exceedingly</span> great power, insomuch that they did frighten my armies; therefore they would not fight, and they began to retreat towards the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>north</span> countries.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357590" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that we did come to the city of Angola, and we did take possession of the city, and make preparations to defend ourselves against the Lamanites. And it came to pass that we did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fortify</span> the city with our might; but notwithstanding all our fortifications the Lamanites did come upon us and did drive us out of the city.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357591" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they did also drive us forth out of the land of David.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357592" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And we marched forth and came to the land of Joshua, which was in the borders west by the seashore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357593" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that we did gather in our people as fast as it were <span class="page-break" data-page="471"></span>possible, that we might get them together in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>one</span> body.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357594" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But behold, the land was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>filled</span> with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>robbers</span> and with Lamanites; and notwithstanding the great destruction which hung over my people, they did not repent of their evil doings; therefore there was blood and carnage spread throughout all the face of the land, both on the part of the Nephites and also on the part of the Lamanites; and it was one complete revolution throughout all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357595" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now, the Lamanites had a king, and his name was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Aaron</span>; and he came against us with an army of forty and four thousand. And behold, I withstood him with forty and two thousand. And it came to pass that I beat him with my army that he fled before me. And behold, all this was done, and three hundred and thirty years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357596" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites began to repent of their iniquity, and began to cry even as had been prophesied by Samuel the prophet; for behold no man could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>keep</span> that which was his own, for the thieves, and the robbers, and the murderers, and the magic art, and the witchcraft which was in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357597" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Thus there began to be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span> and a lamentation in all the land because of these things, and more especially among the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357598" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that when I, Mormon, saw their lamentation and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourning</span> and their sorrow before the Lord, my heart did begin to rejoice within me, knowing the mercies and the long-suffering of the Lord, therefore supposing that he would be merciful unto them that they would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>again</span> become a righteous people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357599" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But behold this my joy was vain, for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorrowing</span> was not unto repentance, because of the goodness of God; but it was rather the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sorrowing</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>damned</span>, because the Lord would not always suffer them to take <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>happiness</span> in sin.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357600" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they did not come unto Jesus with broken <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearts</span> and contrite spirits, but they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>curse</span> God, and wish to die. Nevertheless they would struggle with the sword for their lives.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357601" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that my sorrow did return unto me again, and I saw that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>day</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>was passed</span> with them, both temporally and spiritually; for I saw thousands of them hewn down in open <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rebellion</span> against their God, and heaped up as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>dung</span> upon the face of the land. And thus three hundred and forty and four years had passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357602" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that in the three hundred and forty and fifth year the Nephites did begin to flee before the Lamanites; and they were pursued until they came even to the land of Jashon, before it was possible to stop them in their retreat.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357603" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, the city of Jashon was near the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> where Ammaron had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deposited</span> the records unto the Lord, that they might not be destroyed. And behold I had gone according to the word of Ammaron, and taken the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plates of Nephi</span>, and did make a record according to the words of Ammaron.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357604" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And upon the plates of Nephi I <span class="page-break" data-page="472"></span>did make a full account of all the wickedness and abominations; but upon <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these plates</span> I did forbear to make a full account of their wickedness and abominations, for behold, a continual scene of wickedness and abominations has been before mine eyes ever since I have been sufficient to behold the ways of man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357605" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And wo is me because of their wickedness; for my heart has been filled with sorrow because of their wickedness, all my days; nevertheless, I know that I shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lifted up</span> at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357606" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that in this year the people of Nephi again were hunted and driven. And it came to pass that we were driven forth until we had come northward to the land which was called Shem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357607" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that we did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fortify</span> the city of Shem, and we did gather in our people as much as it were possible, that perhaps we might save them from destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357608" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass in the three hundred and forty and sixth year they began to come upon us again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357609" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that I did speak unto my people, and did urge them with great energy, that they would stand boldly before the Lamanites and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fight</span> for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wives</span>, and their children, and their houses, and their homes.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357610" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And my words did arouse them somewhat to vigor, insomuch that they did not flee from before the Lamanites, but did stand with boldness against them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357611" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that we did contend with an army of thirty thousand against an army of fifty thousand. And it came to pass that we did stand before them with such firmness that they did flee from before us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357612" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that when they had fled we did pursue them with our armies, and did meet them again, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>beat</span> them; nevertheless the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span> of the Lord was not with us; yea, we were left to ourselves, that the Spirit of the Lord did not abide in us; therefore we had become weak like unto our brethren.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357613" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And my heart did sorrow because of this the great calamity of my people, because of their wickedness and their abominations. But behold, we did go forth against the Lamanites and the robbers of Gadianton, until we had again taken possession of the lands of our inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357614" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And the three hundred and forty and ninth year had passed away. And in the three hundred and fiftieth year we made a treaty with the Lamanites and the robbers of Gadianton, in which we did get the lands of our inheritance divided.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357615" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And the Lamanites did give unto us the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>northward</span>, yea, even to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>narrow passage</span> which led into the land southward. And we did give unto the Lamanites all the land southward.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357829" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357830" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357831" id="study_summary1">Mormon cries repentance unto the Nephites—They gain a great victory and glory in their own strength—Mormon refuses to lead them, and his prayers for them are without faith—The Book of Mormon invites the twelve tribes of Israel to believe the gospel. About <small>A.D.</small> 360–62.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357832" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did not come to battle again until ten years more had passed away. And behold, I had employed my people, the Nephites, in preparing their lands and their arms against the time of battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357833" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did say unto me: Cry unto this <span class="page-break" data-page="473"></span>people—Repent ye, and come unto me, and be ye baptized, and build up again my church, and ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spared</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357834" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I did cry unto this people, but it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>in vain</span>; and they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not realize</span> that it was the Lord that had spared them, and granted unto them a chance for repentance. And behold they did harden their hearts against the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357835" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that after this tenth year had passed away, making, in the whole, three hundred and sixty years from the coming of Christ, the king of the Lamanites sent an epistle unto me, which gave unto me to know that they were preparing to come again to battle against us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357836" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that I did cause my people that they should gather themselves together at the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Desolation</span>, to a city which was in the borders, by the narrow pass which led into the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>southward</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357837" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And there we did place our armies, that we might stop the armies of the Lamanites, that they might not get possession of any of our lands; therefore we did fortify against them with all our force.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357838" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that in the three hundred and sixty and first year the Lamanites did come down to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city of Desolation</span> to battle against us; and it came to pass that in that year we did beat them, insomuch that they did return to their own lands again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357839" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And in the three hundred and sixty and second year they did come down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span> to battle. And we did beat them again, and did slay a great number of them, and their dead were cast into the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357840" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now, because of this great thing which my people, the Nephites, had done, they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span> in their own strength, and began to swear before the heavens that they would avenge themselves of the blood of their brethren who had been slain by their enemies.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357841" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swear</span> by the heavens, and also by the throne of God, that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>would</span> go up to battle against their enemies, and would cut them off from the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357842" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that I, Mormon, did utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>refuse</span> from this time forth to be a commander and a leader of this people, because of their wickedness and abomination.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357843" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, I had led them, notwithstanding their wickedness I had led them many times to battle, and had loved them, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span> of God which was in me, with all my heart; and my soul had been poured out in prayer unto my God all the day long for them; nevertheless, it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>without faith</span>, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hardness</span> of their hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357844" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thrice</span> have I delivered them out of the hands of their enemies, and they have repented not of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357845" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And when they had sworn by all that had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>forbidden</span> them by our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, that they would go up unto their enemies to battle, and avenge themselves of the blood of their brethren, behold the voice of the Lord came unto me, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357846" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Vengeance</span> is mine, and I will <span class="page-break" data-page="474"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>repay</span>; and because this people repented not after I had delivered them, behold, they shall be cut off from the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357847" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that I utterly refused to go up against mine enemies; and I did even as the Lord had commanded me; and I did stand as an idle witness to manifest unto the world the things which I saw and heard, according to the manifestations of the Spirit which had testified of things to come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357848" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore I write <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unto</span> you, Gentiles, and also unto you, house of Israel, when the work shall commence, that ye shall be about to prepare to return to the land of your inheritance;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357849" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Yea, behold, I write unto all the ends of the earth; yea, unto you, twelve tribes of Israel, who shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judged</span> according to your works by the twelve whom Jesus chose to be his disciples in the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357850" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And I write also unto the remnant of this people, who shall also be judged by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twelve</span> whom Jesus chose in this land; and they shall be judged by the other twelve whom Jesus chose in the land of Jerusalem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357851" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And these things doth the Spirit manifest unto me; therefore I write unto you all. And for this cause I write unto you, that ye may know that ye must all stand before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment-seat</span> of Christ, yea, every soul who belongs to the whole human <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>family</span> of Adam; and ye must stand to be judged of your works, whether they be good or evil;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357852" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And also that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believe</span> the gospel of Jesus Christ, which ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>have</span> among you; and also that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Jews</span>, the covenant people of the Lord, shall have other <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>witness</span> besides him whom they saw and heard, that Jesus, whom they slew, was the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>very Christ</span> and the very God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357853" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And I would that I could persuade <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> ye ends of the earth to repent and prepare to stand before the judgment-seat of Christ.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357883" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357884" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357885" id="study_summary1">War and carnage continue—The wicked punish the wicked—Greater wickedness prevails than ever before in all Israel—Women and children are sacrificed to idols—The Lamanites begin to sweep the Nephites before them. About <small>A.D.</small> 363–75.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357886" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now it came to pass that in the three hundred and sixty and third year the Nephites did go up with their armies to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>battle</span> against the Lamanites, out of the land Desolation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357887" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the armies of the Nephites were driven back again to the land of Desolation. And while they were yet weary, a fresh army of the Lamanites did come upon them; and they had a sore battle, insomuch that the Lamanites did take possession of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city Desolation</span>, and did slay many of the Nephites, and did take many prisoners.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357888" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the remainder did flee and join the inhabitants of the city Teancum. Now the city Teancum lay in the borders by the seashore; and it was also near the city <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Desolation</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357889" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>because</span> the armies of the Nephites went up unto the Lamanites that they began to be smitten; for were it not for that, the <span class="page-break" data-page="475"></span>Lamanites could have had no power over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357890" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But, behold, the judgments of God will overtake the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wicked</span>; and it is by the wicked that the wicked are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>punished</span>; for it is the wicked that stir up the hearts of the children of men unto bloodshed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357891" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did make preparations to come against the city Teancum.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357892" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass in the three hundred and sixty and fourth year the Lamanites did come against the city Teancum, that they might take possession of the city Teancum also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357893" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that they were repulsed and driven back by the Nephites. And when the Nephites saw that they had driven the Lamanites they did again <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>boast</span> of their own strength; and they went forth in their own might, and took possession again of the city Desolation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357894" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now all these things had been done, and there had been thousands slain on both sides, both the Nephites and the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357895" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the three hundred and sixty and sixth year had passed away, and the Lamanites came again upon the Nephites to battle; and yet the Nephites repented not of the evil they had done, but persisted in their wickedness continually.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357896" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it is impossible for the tongue to describe, or for man to write a perfect description of the horrible scene of the blood and carnage which was among the people, both of the Nephites and of the Lamanites; and every heart was hardened, so that they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delighted</span> in the shedding of blood continually.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357897" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And there never had been so great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wickedness</span> among all the children of Lehi, nor even among all the house of Israel, according to the words of the Lord, as was among this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357898" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did take possession of the city Desolation, and this because their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>number</span> did exceed the number of the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357899" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And they did also march forward against the city Teancum, and did drive the inhabitants forth out of her, and did take many prisoners both women and children, and did offer them up as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacrifices</span> unto their idol gods.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357900" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that in the three hundred and sixty and seventh year, the Nephites being angry because the Lamanites had sacrificed their women and their children, that they did go against the Lamanites with exceedingly great anger, insomuch that they did beat again the Lamanites, and drive them out of their lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357901" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And the Lamanites did not come again against the Nephites until the three hundred and seventy and fifth year.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357902" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And in this year they did come down against the Nephites with all their powers; and they were not numbered because of the greatness of their number.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357903" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>from</span> this time forth did the Nephites gain no power over the Lamanites, but began to be swept off by them even as a dew before the sun.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357904" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did come down against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>city Desolation</span>; and there was an exceedingly sore battle fought in the land Desolation, in the which they did beat the Nephites.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="476"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357905" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they fled again from before them, and they came to the city Boaz; and there they did stand against the Lamanites with exceeding boldness, insomuch that the Lamanites did not beat them until they had come again the second time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357906" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And when they had come the second time, the Nephites were driven and slaughtered with an exceedingly great slaughter; their women and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> were again sacrificed unto idols.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357907" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that the Nephites did again flee from before them, taking all the inhabitants with them, both in towns and villages.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357908" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now I, Mormon, seeing that the Lamanites were about to overthrow the land, therefore I did go to the hill <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Shim</span>, and did take up all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>records</span> which Ammaron had hid up unto the Lord.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357651" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357652" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357653" id="study_summary1">Mormon again leads the Nephite armies in battles of blood and carnage—The Book of Mormon will come forth to convince all Israel that Jesus is the Christ—Because of their unbelief, the Lamanites will be scattered, and the Spirit will cease to strive with them—They will receive the gospel from the Gentiles in the latter days. About <small>A.D.</small> 375–84.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357654" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that I did go forth among the Nephites, and did repent of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oath</span> which I had made that I would no more assist them; and they gave me command again of their armies, for they looked upon me as though I could deliver them from their afflictions.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357655" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>But behold, I was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>without hope</span>, for I knew the judgments of the Lord which should come upon them; for they repented not of their iniquities, but did struggle for their lives without calling upon that Being who created them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357656" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that the Lamanites did come against us as we had fled to the city of Jordan; but behold, they were driven back that they did not take the city at that time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357657" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that they came against us again, and we did maintain the city. And there were also other cities which were maintained by the Nephites, which strongholds did cut them off that they could not get into the country which lay before us, to destroy the inhabitants of our land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357658" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But it came to pass that whatsoever lands we had passed by, and the inhabitants thereof were not gathered in, were destroyed by the Lamanites, and their towns, and villages, and cities were burned with fire; and thus three hundred and seventy and nine years passed away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357659" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that in the three hundred and eightieth year the Lamanites did come again against us to battle, and we did stand against them boldly; but it was all in vain, for so <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> were their numbers that they did tread the people of the Nephites under their feet.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357660" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that we did again take to flight, and those whose flight was swifter than the Lamanites’ did escape, and those whose flight did not exceed the Lamanites’ were swept down and destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357661" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now behold, I, Mormon, do not desire to harrow up the souls of men in casting before them such an awful scene of blood and carnage as was laid before mine eyes; but I, knowing that these things must surely be made known, and that all things which are hid must be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revealed</span> upon the house-tops—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357662" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And also that a knowledge of these things must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto the remnant of these people, and also unto the Gentiles, who the Lord <span class="page-break" data-page="477"></span>hath said should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>scatter</span> this people, and this people should be counted as naught among them—therefore <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>I</span> write a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>small abridgment</span>, daring not to give a full account of the things which I have seen, because of the commandment which I have received, and also that ye might not have too great sorrow because of the wickedness of this people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357663" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now behold, this I speak unto their seed, and also to the Gentiles who have care for the house of Israel, that realize and know from whence their blessings come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357664" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For I know that such will sorrow for the calamity of the house of Israel; yea, they will sorrow for the destruction of this people; they will sorrow that this people had not repented that they might have been clasped in the arms of Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357665" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Now <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these things</span> are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>written</span> unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remnant</span> of the house of Jacob; and they are written after this manner, because it is known of God that wickedness will not bring them forth unto them; and they are to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hid</span> up unto the Lord that they may come forth in his own due time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357666" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And this is the commandment which I have received; and behold, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shall</span> come forth according to the commandment of the Lord, when he shall see fit, in his wisdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357667" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And behold, they shall go unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelieving</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Jews</span>; and for this intent shall they go—that they may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>persuaded</span> that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of the living God; that the Father may bring about, through his most Beloved, his great and eternal purpose, in restoring the Jews, or all the house of Israel, to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>land</span> of their inheritance, which the Lord their God hath given them, unto the fulfilling of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>covenant</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357668" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And also that the seed of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this people</span> may more fully believe his gospel, which shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>go forth</span> unto them from the Gentiles; for this people shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>scattered</span>, and shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>become</span> a dark, a filthy, and a loathsome people, beyond the description of that which ever hath been amongst us, yea, even that which hath been among the Lamanites, and this because of their unbelief and idolatry.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357669" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For behold, the Spirit of the Lord hath already ceased to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>strive</span> with their fathers; and they are without Christ and God in the world; and they are driven about as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chaff</span> before the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357670" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>They were once a delightsome people, and they had Christ for their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shepherd</span>; yea, they were led even by God the Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357671" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>But now, behold, they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>led</span> about by Satan, even as chaff is driven before the wind, or as a vessel is tossed about upon the waves, without sail or anchor, or without anything wherewith to steer her; and even as she is, so are they.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357672" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, the Lord hath reserved their blessings, which they <span class="page-break" data-page="478"></span>might have received in the land, for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span> who shall possess the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357673" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, it shall come to pass that they shall be driven and scattered by the Gentiles;
