and after they have been driven and scattered by the Gentiles, behold, then will the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remember</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>covenant</span> which he made unto Abraham and unto all the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357674" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And also the Lord will remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> of the righteous, which have been put up unto him for them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357675" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And then, O ye Gentiles, how can ye stand before the power of God, except ye shall repent and turn from your evil ways?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357676" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Know ye not that ye are in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hands</span> of God? Know ye not that he hath all power, and at his great command the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>earth</span> shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>rolled</span> together as a scroll?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357677" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Therefore, repent ye, and humble yourselves before him, lest he shall come out in justice against you—lest a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of Jacob shall go forth among you as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lion</span>, and tear you in pieces, and there is none to deliver.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357925" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357926" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357927" id="study_summary1">The Nephites gather to the land of Cumorah for the final battles—Mormon hides the sacred records in the hill Cumorah—The Lamanites are victorious, and the Nephite nation is destroyed—Hundreds of thousands are slain with the sword. About <small>A.D.</small> 385.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357928" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I finish my record concerning the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> of my people, the Nephites. And it came to pass that we did march forth before the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357929" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I, Mormon, wrote an epistle unto the king of the Lamanites, and desired of him that he would grant unto us that we might gather together our people unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Cumorah</span>, by a hill which was called Cumorah, and there we could give them battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357930" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that the king of the Lamanites did grant unto me the thing which I desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357931" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that we did march forth to the land of Cumorah, and we did pitch our tents around about the hill Cumorah; and it was in a land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>many waters</span>, rivers, and fountains; and here we had hope to gain advantage over the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357932" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> hundred and eighty and four years had passed away, we had gathered in all the remainder of our people unto the land of Cumorah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357933" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that when we had gathered in all our people in one to the land of Cumorah, behold I, Mormon, began to be old; and knowing it to be the last struggle of my people, and having been commanded of the Lord that I should not suffer the records which had been handed down by our fathers, which were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sacred</span>, to fall into the hands of the Lamanites, (for the Lamanites would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroy</span> them) therefore I made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>this record</span> out of the plates of Nephi, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>hid</span> up in the hill Cumorah all the records which had been entrusted to me by the hand of the Lord, save it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>these</span> few plates which I gave unto my son <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Moroni</span>.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="479"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357934" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that my people, with their wives and their children, did now behold the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>armies</span> of the Lamanites marching towards them; and with that awful <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fear</span> of death which fills the breasts of all the wicked, did they await to receive them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357935" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that they came to battle against us, and every soul was filled with terror because of the greatness of their numbers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357936" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they did fall upon my people with the sword, and with the bow, and with the arrow, and with the ax, and with all manner of weapons of war.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357937" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that my men were hewn down, yea, even my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ten thousand</span> who were with me, and I fell wounded in the midst; and they passed by me that they did not put an end to my life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357938" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And when they had gone through and hewn down <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> my people save it were twenty and four of us, (among whom was my son Moroni) and we having survived the dead of our people, did behold on the morrow, when the Lamanites had returned unto their camps, from the top of the hill Cumorah, the ten thousand of my people who were hewn down, being led in the front by me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357939" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And we also beheld the ten thousand of my people who were led by my son Moroni.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357940" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And behold, the ten thousand of Gidgiddonah had fallen, and he also in the midst.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357941" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And Lamah had fallen with his ten thousand; and Gilgal had fallen with his ten thousand; and Limhah had fallen with his ten thousand; and Jeneum had fallen with his ten thousand; and Cumenihah, and Moronihah, and Antionum, and Shiblom, and Shem, and Josh, had fallen with their ten thousand each.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357942" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that there were ten more who did fall by the sword, with their ten thousand each; yea, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> my people, save it were those twenty and four who were with me, and also a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>few</span> who had escaped into the south countries, and a few who had deserted over unto the Lamanites, had fallen; and their flesh, and bones, and blood lay upon the face of the earth, being left by the hands of those who slew them to molder upon the land, and to crumble and to return to their mother earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357943" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And my soul was rent with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anguish</span>, because of the slain of my people, and I cried:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357944" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>O</span> ye fair ones, how could ye have departed from the ways of the Lord! O ye fair ones, how could ye have rejected that Jesus, who stood with open arms to receive you!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357945" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Behold, if ye had not done this, ye would not have fallen. But behold, ye are fallen, and I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourn</span> your loss.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357946" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>O ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fair</span> sons and daughters, ye fathers and mothers, ye husbands and wives, ye fair ones, how is it that ye could have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fallen</span>!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357947" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>But behold, ye are gone, and my sorrows cannot bring your return.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357948" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And the day soon cometh that your mortal must put on immortality, and these bodies which are now moldering in corruption must soon become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>incorruptible</span> bodies; and then ye must stand before the judgment-seat of Christ, to be judged according to your works; and if it so be that ye are righteous, then are ye blessed with your fathers who have gone before you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357949" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>O that ye had repented before this great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> had come upon you. But behold, ye are gone, <span class="page-break" data-page="480"></span>and the Father, yea, the Eternal Father of heaven, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>knoweth</span> your state; and he doeth with you according to his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>justice</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>mercy</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357965" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357966" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357967" id="study_summary1">Mormon invites the Lamanites of the latter days to believe in Christ, accept His gospel, and be saved—All who believe the Bible will also believe the Book of Mormon. About <small>A.D.</small> 385.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357968" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, behold, I would speak somewhat unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of this people who are spared, if it so be that God may give unto them my words, that they may know of the things of their fathers; yea, I speak unto you, ye remnant of the house of Israel; and these are the words which I speak:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357969" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Know ye that ye are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>house of Israel</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357970" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Know ye that ye must come unto repentance, or ye cannot be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357971" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Know ye that ye must lay down your weapons of war, and delight no more in the shedding of blood, and take them not again, save it be that God shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>command</span> you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357972" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Know ye that ye must come to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> of your fathers, and repent of all your sins and iniquities, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> in Jesus Christ, that he is the Son of God, and that he was slain by the Jews, and by the power of the Father he hath risen again, whereby he hath gained the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>victory</span> over the grave; and also in him is the sting of death swallowed up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357973" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he bringeth to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>resurrection</span> of the dead, whereby man must be raised to stand before his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment-seat</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357974" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And he hath brought to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>redemption</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>world</span>, whereby he that is found <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>guiltless</span> before him at the judgment day hath it given unto him to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>dwell</span> in the presence of God in his kingdom, to sing ceaseless praises with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>choirs</span> above, unto the Father, and unto the Son, and unto the Holy Ghost, which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>one God</span>, in a state of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>happiness</span> which hath no end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357975" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Therefore repent, and be baptized in the name of Jesus, and lay hold upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span> of Christ, which shall be set before you, not only in this record but also in the record which shall come unto the Gentiles <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>from</span> the Jews, which record shall come from the Gentiles <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>unto</span> you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357976" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>written</span> for the intent that ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>believe</span> that; and if <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>ye</span> believe that ye will believe this also; and if ye believe this ye will know concerning your fathers, and also the marvelous works which were wrought by the power of God among them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357977" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And ye will also know that ye are a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remnant</span> of the seed of Jacob; therefore ye are numbered among the people of the first covenant; and if it so be that ye believe in Christ, and are baptized, first <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>with water</span>, then with fire and with the Holy Ghost, following the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>example</span> of our Savior, according to that which <span class="page-break" data-page="481"></span>he hath commanded us, it shall be well with you in the day of judgment. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357985" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358004" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358005" id="study_summary1">The Lamanites seek out and destroy the Nephites—The Book of Mormon will come forth by the power of God—Woes pronounced upon those who breathe out wrath and strife against the work of the Lord—The Nephite record will come forth in a day of wickedness, degeneracy, and apostasy. About <small>A.D.</small> 400–421.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358006" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Behold I, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moroni</span>, do finish the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> of my father, Mormon. Behold, I have but few things to write, which things I have been commanded by my father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358007" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now it came to pass that after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great</span> and tremendous battle at Cumorah, behold, the Nephites who had escaped into the country southward were hunted by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lamanites</span>, until they were all destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358008" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And my father also was killed by them, and I even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remain</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>alone</span> to write the sad tale of the destruction of my people. But behold, they are gone, and I fulfil the commandment of my father. And whether they will slay me, I know not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358009" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore I will write and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> up the records in the earth; and whither I go it mattereth not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358010" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, my father hath made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this record</span>, and he hath written the intent thereof. And behold, I would write it also if I had room upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>plates</span>, but I have not; and ore I have none, for I am alone. My father hath been slain in battle, and all my kinsfolk, and I have not friends nor whither to go; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>how</span> long the Lord will suffer that I may live I know not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358011" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Behold, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>four hundred</span> years have passed away since the coming of our Lord and Savior.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358012" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And behold, the Lamanites have hunted my people, the Nephites, down from city to city and from place to place, even until they are no more; and great has been their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fall</span>; yea, great and marvelous is the destruction of my people, the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358013" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And behold, it is the hand of the Lord which hath done it. And behold also, the Lamanites are at <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>war</span> one with another; and the whole face of this land is one continual round of murder and bloodshed; and no one knoweth the end of the war.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358014" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now, behold, I say no more concerning them, for there are none save it be the Lamanites and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>robbers</span> that do exist upon the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358015" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And there are none that do know the true God save it be the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span> of Jesus, who did tarry in the land until the wickedness of the people was so great that the Lord would not suffer them to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remain</span> with the people; and whether they be upon the face of the land no man knoweth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358016" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But behold, my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span> and I have seen <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>them</span>, and they have ministered unto us.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358017" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And whoso receiveth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>this record</span>, and shall not condemn it because of the imperfections which are in it, the same shall know of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>greater things</span> than these. Behold, I am Moroni; and were it possible, I would make all things known unto you.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="482"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358018" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, I make an end of speaking concerning this people. I am the son of Mormon, and my father was a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>descendant</span> of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358019" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And I am the same who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hideth</span> up this record unto the Lord; the plates thereof are of no worth, because of the commandment of the Lord. For he truly saith that no one shall have them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>to</span> get gain; but the record thereof is of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>great</span> worth; and whoso shall bring it to light, him will the Lord bless.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358020" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For none can have power to bring it to light save it be given him of God; for God wills that it shall be done with an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>eye</span> single to his glory, or the welfare of the ancient and long dispersed covenant people of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358021" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And blessed be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>he</span> that shall bring this thing to light; for it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought</span> out of darkness unto light, according to the word of God; yea, it shall be brought out of the earth, and it shall shine forth out of darkness, and come unto the knowledge of the people; and it shall be done by the power of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358022" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And if there be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faults</span> they be the faults of a man. But behold, we know no fault; nevertheless God knoweth all things; therefore, he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>condemneth</span>, let him be aware lest he shall be in danger of hell fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358023" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And he that saith: Show unto me, or ye shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smitten</span>—let him beware lest he commandeth that which is forbidden of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358024" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For behold, the same that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgeth</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>rashly</span> shall be judged rashly again; for according to his works shall his wages be; therefore, he that smiteth shall be smitten again, of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358025" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Behold what the scripture says—man shall not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smite</span>, neither shall he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judge</span>; for judgment is mine, saith the Lord, and vengeance is mine also, and I will repay.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358026" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And he that shall breathe out <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrath</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strifes</span> against the work of the Lord, and against the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>covenant</span> people of the Lord who are the house of Israel, and shall say: We will destroy the work of the Lord, and the Lord will not remember his covenant which he hath made unto the house of Israel—the same is in danger to be hewn down and cast into the fire;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358027" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For the eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>purposes</span> of the Lord shall roll on, until all his promises shall be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358028" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Search the prophecies of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Isaiah</span>. Behold, I cannot write them. Yea, behold I say unto you, that those saints who have gone before me, who have possessed this land, shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cry</span>, yea, even from the dust will they cry unto the Lord; and as the Lord liveth he will remember the covenant which he hath made with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358029" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And he knoweth their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span>, that they were in behalf of their brethren. And he knoweth their faith, for in his name could they remove <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mountains</span>; and in his name could they cause the earth to shake; and by the power of his word did they cause <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prisons</span> to tumble to the earth; yea, even the fiery furnace could not harm them, neither wild <span class="page-break" data-page="483"></span>beasts nor poisonous serpents, because of the power of his word.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358030" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And behold, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prayers</span> were also in behalf of him that the Lord should suffer to bring these things forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358031" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And no one need say they shall not come, for they surely shall, for the Lord hath spoken it; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>out</span> of the earth shall they come, by the hand of the Lord, and none can stay it; and it shall come in a day when it shall be said that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>miracles</span> are done away; and it shall come even as if one should speak <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>from the dead</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358032" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it shall come in a day when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> of saints shall cry unto the Lord, because of secret <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>combinations</span> and the works of darkness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358033" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Yea, it shall come in a day when the power of God shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>denied</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>churches</span> become defiled and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lifted up</span> in the pride of their hearts; yea, even in a day when leaders of churches and teachers shall rise in the pride of their hearts, even to the envying of them who belong to their churches.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358034" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Yea, it shall come in a day when <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>there</span> shall be heard of fires, and tempests, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>vapors</span> of smoke in foreign lands;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358035" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And there shall also be heard of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span>, rumors of wars, and earthquakes in divers places.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358036" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Yea, it shall come in a day when there shall be great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pollutions</span> upon the face of the earth; there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>murders</span>, and robbing, and lying, and deceivings, and whoredoms, and all manner of abominations; when there shall be many who will say, Do this, or do that, and it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mattereth</span> not, for the Lord will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>uphold</span> such at the last day. But wo unto such, for they are in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>gall of bitterness</span> and in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>bonds</span> of iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358037" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>Yea, it shall come in a day when there shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>churches</span> built up that shall say: Come unto me, and for your money you shall be forgiven of your sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358038" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>O ye wicked and perverse and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stiffnecked</span> people, why have ye built up churches unto yourselves to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gain</span>? Why have ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>transfigured</span> the holy word of God, that ye might bring <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>damnation</span> upon your souls? Behold, look ye unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>revelations</span> of God; for behold, the time cometh at that day when all these things must be fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358039" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Behold, the Lord hath shown unto me great and marvelous things concerning that which must shortly come, at that day when these things shall come forth among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358040" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Behold, I speak unto you as if ye were present, and yet ye are not. But behold, Jesus Christ hath shown you unto me, and I know your doing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358041" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And I know that ye do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> in the pride of your hearts; and there are none save a few only who do not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lift</span> themselves up in the pride of their hearts, unto the wearing of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>very fine apparel</span>, unto envying, <span class="page-break" data-page="484"></span>and strifes, and malice, and persecutions, and all manner of iniquities; and your churches, yea, even every one, have become polluted because of the pride of your hearts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358042" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>For behold, ye do love <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>money</span>, and your substance, and your fine apparel, and the adorning of your churches, more than ye love the poor and the needy, the sick and the afflicted.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358043" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>O ye pollutions, ye hypocrites, ye teachers, who sell yourselves for that which will canker, why have ye polluted the holy church of God? Why are ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ashamed</span> to take upon you the name of Christ? Why do ye not think that greater is the value of an endless happiness than that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>misery</span> which never dies—because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>praise</span> of the world?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358044" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>Why do ye adorn yourselves with that which hath no life, and yet suffer the hungry, and the needy, and the naked, and the sick and the afflicted to pass by you, and notice them not?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358045" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>Yea, why do ye build up your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret abominations</span> to get gain, and cause that widows should mourn before the Lord, and also orphans to mourn before the Lord, and also the blood of their fathers and their husbands to cry unto the Lord from the ground, for vengeance upon your heads?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358046" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Behold, the sword of vengeance hangeth over you; and the time soon cometh that he avengeth the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> of the saints upon you, for he will not suffer their cries any longer.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Mormon 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128357725" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/morm/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Mormon 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128357726" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128357727" id="study_summary1">Moroni calls upon those who do not believe in Christ to repent—He proclaims a God of miracles, who gives revelations and pours out gifts and signs upon the faithful—Miracles cease because of unbelief—Signs follow those who believe—Men are exhorted to be wise and keep the commandments. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357728" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now, I speak also concerning those who do not believe in Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357729" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Behold, will ye believe in the day of your visitation—behold, when the Lord shall come, yea, even that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>great day</span> when the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>earth</span> shall be rolled together as a scroll, and the elements shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>melt</span> with fervent heat, yea, in that great day when ye shall be brought to stand before the Lamb of God—then will ye say that there is no God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357730" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Then will ye longer deny the Christ, or can ye behold the Lamb of God? Do ye suppose that ye shall dwell with him under a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>consciousness</span> of your guilt? Do ye suppose that ye could be happy to dwell with that holy Being, when your souls are racked with a consciousness of guilt that ye have ever abused his laws?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357731" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, I say unto you that ye would be more miserable to dwell with a holy and just God, under a consciousness of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>filthiness</span> before him, than ye would to dwell with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>damned</span> souls in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hell</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357732" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For behold, when ye shall be brought to see your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nakedness</span> before God, and also the glory of God, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>holiness</span> of Jesus Christ, it will kindle a flame of unquenchable fire upon you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357733" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>O then ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unbelieving</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>turn</span> ye unto the Lord; cry mightily unto the Father in the name of Jesus, that perhaps ye may be found spotless, <span class="page-break" data-page="485"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>pure</span>, fair, and white, having been cleansed by the blood of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Lamb</span>, at that great and last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357734" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And again I speak unto you who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> the revelations of God, and say that they are done away, that there are no revelations, nor prophecies, nor gifts, nor healing, nor speaking with tongues, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>interpretation</span> of tongues;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357735" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Behold I say unto you, he that denieth these things knoweth not the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gospel</span> of Christ; yea, he has not read the scriptures; if so, he does not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understand</span> them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357736" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>For do we not read that God is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>same</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>yesterday</span>, today, and forever, and in him there is no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>variableness</span> neither shadow of changing?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357737" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, if ye have imagined up unto yourselves a god who doth vary, and in whom there is shadow of changing, then have ye imagined up unto yourselves a god who is not a God of miracles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357738" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But behold, I will show unto you a God of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span>, even the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob; and it is that same <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>God</span> who created the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357739" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, he created Adam, and by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Adam</span> came the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fall</span> of man. And because of the fall of man came Jesus Christ, even the Father and the Son; and because of Jesus Christ came the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redemption</span> of man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357740" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And because of the redemption of man, which came by Jesus Christ, they are brought back into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>presence</span> of the Lord; yea, this is wherein all men are redeemed, because the death of Christ bringeth to pass the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>resurrection</span>, which bringeth to pass a redemption from an endless <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sleep</span>, from which sleep all men shall be awakened by the power of God when the trump shall sound; and they shall come forth, both small and great, and all shall stand before his bar, being redeemed and loosed from this eternal <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>band</span> of death, which death is a temporal death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357741" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And then cometh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span> of the Holy One upon them; and then cometh the time that he that is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>filthy</span> shall be filthy still; and he that is righteous shall be righteous still; he that is happy shall be happy still; and he that is unhappy shall be unhappy still.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357742" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And now, O all ye that have imagined up unto yourselves a god who can do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no miracles</span>, I would ask of you, have all these things passed, of which I have spoken? Has the end come yet? Behold I say unto you, Nay; and God has not ceased to be a God of miracles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357743" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, are not the things that God hath wrought marvelous in our eyes? Yea, and who can comprehend the marvelous <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span> of God?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357744" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Who shall say that it was not a miracle that by his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> the heaven and the earth should be; and by the power of his word man was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>created</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>dust</span> of the earth; and by the power of his word have miracles been wrought?</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="486"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357745" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And who shall say that Jesus Christ did not do many mighty <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span>? And there were many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mighty</span> miracles wrought by the hands of the apostles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357746" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And if there were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> wrought then, why has God ceased to be a God of miracles and yet be an unchangeable Being? And behold, I say unto you he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>changeth not</span>; if so he would cease to be God; and he ceaseth not to be God, and is a God of miracles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357747" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the reason why he ceaseth to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> among the children of men is because that they dwindle in unbelief, and depart from the right way, and know not the God in whom they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>trust</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357748" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold, I say unto you that whoso believeth in Christ, doubting nothing, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whatsoever</span> he shall ask the Father in the name of Christ it shall be granted him; and this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promise</span> is unto all, even unto the ends of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357749" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, thus said Jesus Christ, the Son of God, unto his disciples who should tarry, yea, and also to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> his disciples, in the hearing of the multitude: Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357750" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believeth</span> and is baptized shall be saved, but he that believeth not shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>damned</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357751" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>these signs</span> shall follow them that believe—in my name shall they cast out <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>devils</span>; they shall speak with new tongues; they shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing it shall not hurt them; they shall lay <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hands</span> on the sick and they shall recover;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357752" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And whosoever shall believe in my name, doubting nothing, unto him will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>confirm</span> all my words, even unto the ends of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357753" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And now, behold, who can stand <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>against</span> the works of the Lord? <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Who</span> can deny his sayings? Who will rise up against the almighty power of the Lord? Who will despise the works of the Lord? Who will despise the children of Christ? Behold, all ye who are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>despisers</span> of the works of the Lord, for ye shall wonder and perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357754" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>O then despise not, and wonder not, but hearken unto the words of the Lord, and ask the Father in the name of Jesus for what things soever ye shall stand in need. <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Doubt</span> not, but be believing, and begin as in times of old, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> unto the Lord with all your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>heart</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>work</span> out your own salvation with fear and trembling before him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357755" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wise</span> in the days of your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>probation</span>; strip yourselves of all uncleanness; ask not, that ye may consume it on your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>lusts</span>, but ask with a firmness unshaken, that ye will yield to no temptation, but that ye will serve the true and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>living God</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357756" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>See that ye are not baptized <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unworthily</span>; see that ye partake not of the sacrament of Christ <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unworthily</span>; but see that ye do all <span class="page-break" data-page="487"></span>things in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>worthiness</span>, and do it in the name of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God; and if ye do this, and endure to the end, ye will in nowise be cast out.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357757" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Behold, I speak unto you as though I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>spake</span> from the dead; for I know that ye shall have my words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357758" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Condemn me not because of mine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>imperfection</span>, neither my father, because of his imperfection, neither them who have written before him; but rather give thanks unto God that he hath made manifest unto you our imperfections, that ye may learn to be more wise than we have been.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357759" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And now, behold, we have written this record according to our knowledge, in the characters which are called among us the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reformed</span> Egyptian, being handed down and altered by us, according to our manner of speech.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357760" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And if our plates had been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sufficiently</span> large we should have written in Hebrew; but the Hebrew hath been altered by us also; and if we could have written in Hebrew, behold, ye would have had no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>imperfection</span> in our record.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357761" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>But the Lord knoweth the things which we have written, and also that none other people knoweth our language; and because that none other people knoweth our language, therefore he hath prepared <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>means</span> for the interpretation thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357762" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And these things are written that we may rid our garments of the blood of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brethren</span>, who have dwindled in unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357763" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And behold, these things which we have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>desired</span> concerning our brethren, yea, even their restoration to the knowledge of Christ, are according to the prayers of all the saints who have dwelt in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128357764" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And may the Lord Jesus Christ grant that their prayers may be answered according to their faith; and may God the Father remember the covenant which he hath made with the house of Israel; and may he bless them forever, through faith on the name of Jesus Christ. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355215" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128355216" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Ether</span></h1>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128355217" id="study_intro1">The record of the Jaredites, taken from the twenty-four plates found by the people of Limhi in the days of King Mosiah.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355218" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355219" id="study_summary1">Moroni abridges the writings of Ether—Ether’s genealogy is set forth—The language of the Jaredites is not confounded at the Tower of Babel—The Lord promises to lead them to a choice land and make them a great nation.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355220" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, proceed to give an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>account</span> of those ancient inhabitants who were destroyed by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hand</span> of the Lord upon the face of this north country.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355221" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I take mine account from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>twenty</span> and four plates which <span class="page-break" data-page="488"></span>were found by the people of Limhi, which is called the Book of Ether.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355222" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And as I suppose that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> part of this record, which speaks concerning the creation of the world, and also of Adam, and an account from that time even to the great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tower</span>, and whatsoever things transpired among the children of men until that time, is had among the Jews—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355223" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Therefore I do not write those things which transpired from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>days of Adam</span> until that time; but they are had upon the plates; and whoso findeth them, the same will have power that he may get the full account.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355224" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>But behold, I give not the full account, but a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>part</span> of the account I give, from the tower down until they were destroyed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355225" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And on this wise do I give the account. He that wrote this record was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ether</span>, and he was a descendant of Coriantor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355226" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Coriantor was the son of Moron.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355227" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And Moron was the son of Ethem.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355228" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And Ethem was the son of Ahah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355229" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And Ahah was the son of Seth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355230" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And Seth was the son of Shiblon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355231" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And Shiblon was the son of Com.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355232" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Com was the son of Coriantum.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355233" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And Coriantum was the son of Amnigaddah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355234" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And Amnigaddah was the son of Aaron.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355235" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And Aaron was a descendant of Heth, who was the son of Hearthom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355236" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And Hearthom was the son of Lib.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355237" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And Lib was the son of Kish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355238" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And Kish was the son of Corom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355239" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And Corom was the son of Levi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355240" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And Levi was the son of Kim.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355241" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And Kim was the son of Morianton.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355243" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And Morianton was a descendant of Riplakish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355244" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And Riplakish was the son of Shez.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355245" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And Shez was the son of Heth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355246" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And Heth was the son of Com.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355247" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And Com was the son of Coriantum.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355248" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And Coriantum was the son of Emer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355249" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And Emer was the son of Omer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355250" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And Omer was the son of Shule.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355251" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And Shule was the son of Kib.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355252" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Kib</span> was the son of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Orihah</span>, who was the son of Jared;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355253" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>Which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jared</span> came forth with his brother and their families, with some others and their families, from the great tower, at the time the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>confounded</span> the language of the people, and swore in his wrath that they should be scattered upon all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>face</span> of the earth; and according to the word of the Lord the people were scattered.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355254" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>brother of Jared</span> being a large and mighty man, and a man highly favored of the Lord, Jared, his brother, said unto him: Cry unto the Lord, that he will not confound us that we may not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>understand</span> our words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355255" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared did cry unto the Lord, and the Lord had compassion upon Jared; therefore he did not confound the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> of Jared; and Jared and his brother were not confounded.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355256" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Then Jared said unto his brother: Cry again unto the Lord, and it may be that he will turn away his anger from them who are our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>friends</span>, that he confound not their language.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355257" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared did cry unto the Lord, and the Lord had compassion <span class="page-break" data-page="489"></span>upon their friends and their families also, that they were not confounded.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355258" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And it came to pass that Jared spake again unto his brother, saying: Go and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>inquire</span> of the Lord whether he will drive us out of the land, and if he will drive us out of the land, cry unto him whither we shall go. And who knoweth but the Lord will carry us forth into a land which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>choice</span> above all the earth? And if it so be, let us be faithful unto the Lord, that we may receive it for our inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355259" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared did cry unto the Lord according to that which had been spoken by the mouth of Jared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355260" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did hear the brother of Jared, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>had</span> compassion upon him, and said unto him:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355261" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>Go to and gather together thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flocks</span>, both male and female, of every kind; and also of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seed</span> of the earth of every kind; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thy</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>families</span>; and also Jared thy brother and his family; and also thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>friends</span> and their families, and the friends of Jared and their families.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355264" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>And when thou hast done this thou shalt <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go</span> at the head of them down into the valley which is northward. And there will I meet thee, and I will go <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>before</span> thee into a land which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>choice</span> above all the lands of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355266" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And there will I bless thee and thy seed, and raise up unto me of thy seed, and of the seed of thy brother, and they who shall go with thee, a great nation. And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>there</span> shall be none <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>greater</span> than the nation which I will raise up unto me of thy seed, upon all the face of the earth. And thus I will do unto thee because this long time ye have cried unto me.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355551" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355552" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355553" id="study_summary1">The Jaredites prepare for their journey to a promised land—It is a choice land whereon men must serve Christ or be swept off—The Lord talks to the brother of Jared for three hours—The Jaredites build barges—The Lord asks the brother of Jared to propose how the barges will be lighted.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355554" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Jared and his brother, and their families, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>friends</span> of Jared and his brother and their families, went down into the valley which was northward, (and the name of the valley was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Nimrod</span>, being called after the mighty hunter) with their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>flocks</span> which they had gathered together, male and female, of every kind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355555" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they did also lay snares and catch <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fowls</span> of the air; and they did also prepare a vessel, in which they did carry with them the fish of the waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355556" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they did also carry with them deseret, which, by interpretation, is a honey bee; and thus they did carry with them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swarms</span> of bees, and all manner of that which was upon the face of the land, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seeds</span> of every kind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355557" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that when they had come down into the valley of Nimrod the Lord came down and talked with the brother of Jared; and he was in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cloud</span>, and the brother of Jared saw him not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355558" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord commanded them that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>go forth</span> into the wilderness, yea, <span class="page-break" data-page="490"></span>into that quarter where there never had man been. And it came to pass that the Lord did go before them, and did talk with them as he stood in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>cloud</span>, and gave <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>directions</span> whither they should travel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355559" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that they did travel in the wilderness, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>build</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>barges</span>, in which they did cross many waters, being directed continually by the hand of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355560" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord would not suffer that they should stop beyond the sea in the wilderness, but he would that they should come forth even unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of promise</span>, which was choice above all other lands, which the Lord God had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>preserved</span> for a righteous people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355561" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he had sworn in his wrath unto the brother of Jared, that whoso should possess this land of promise, from that time henceforth and forever, should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>serve</span> him, the true and only God, or they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>swept off</span> when the fulness of his wrath should come upon them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355562" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And now, we can behold the decrees of God concerning this land, that it is a land of promise; and whatsoever nation shall possess it shall serve God, or they shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swept off</span> when the fulness of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrath</span> shall come upon them. And the fulness of his wrath cometh upon them when they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>ripened</span> in iniquity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355563" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>For behold, this is a land which is choice above all other lands; wherefore he that doth possess it shall serve God or shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>swept off</span>; for it is the everlasting decree of God. And it is not until the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>fulness</span> of iniquity among the children of the land, that they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>swept off</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355564" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And this cometh unto you, O ye <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Gentiles</span>, that ye may know the decrees of God—that ye may repent, and not continue in your iniquities until the fulness come, that ye may not bring down the fulness of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrath</span> of God upon you as the inhabitants of the land have hitherto done.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355565" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Behold, this is a choice land, and whatsoever nation shall possess it shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>free</span> from bondage, and from captivity, and from all other nations under heaven, if they will but <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>serve</span> the God of the land, who is Jesus Christ, who hath been manifested by the things which we have written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355566" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And now I proceed with my record; for behold, it came to pass that the Lord did bring Jared and his brethren forth even to that great sea which divideth the lands. And as they came to the sea they pitched their tents; and they called the name of the place <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moriancumer</span>; and they dwelt in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tents</span>, and dwelt in tents upon the seashore for the space of four years.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355567" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass at the end of four years that the Lord came again unto the brother of Jared, and stood in a cloud and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>talked</span> with him. And for the space of three hours did the Lord talk with the brother of Jared, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>chastened</span> him because he remembered not to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>call</span> upon the name of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355568" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And the brother of Jared repented of the evil which he had done, and did call upon the name of the Lord for his brethren who were with him.
