And the Lord said unto him: I will forgive thee and thy brethren of their sins; but thou shalt not sin <span class="page-break" data-page="491"></span>any more, for ye shall remember that my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> will not always <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strive</span> with man; wherefore, if ye will sin until ye are fully ripe ye shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord. And these are my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>thoughts</span> upon the land which I shall give you for your inheritance; for it shall be a land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>choice</span> above all other lands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355569" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And the Lord said: Go to work and build, after the manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>barges</span> which ye have hitherto built. And it came to pass that the brother of Jared did go to work, and also his brethren, and built barges after the manner which they had built, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>instructions</span> of the Lord. And they were small, and they were light upon the water, even like unto the lightness of a fowl upon the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355570" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they were built after a manner that they were exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tight</span>, even that they would hold water like unto a dish; and the bottom thereof was tight like unto a dish; and the sides thereof were tight like unto a dish; and the ends thereof were peaked; and the top thereof was tight like unto a dish; and the length thereof was the length of a tree; and the door thereof, when it was shut, was tight like unto a dish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355571" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared cried unto the Lord, saying: O Lord, I have performed the work which thou hast commanded me, and I have made the barges according as thou hast directed me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355572" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And behold, O Lord, in them there is no light; whither shall we steer? And also we shall perish, for in them we cannot breathe, save it is the air which is in them; therefore we shall perish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355573" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the Lord said unto the brother of Jared: Behold, thou shalt make a hole in the top, and also in the bottom; and when thou shalt suffer for air thou shalt unstop the hole and receive air. And if it be so that the water come in upon thee, behold, ye shall stop the hole, that ye may not perish in the flood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355574" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared did so, according as the Lord had commanded.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355575" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And he cried again unto the Lord saying: O Lord, behold I have done even as thou hast commanded me; and I have prepared the vessels for my people, and behold there is no light in them. Behold, O Lord, wilt thou suffer that we shall cross this great water in darkness?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355576" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the Lord said unto the brother of Jared: What will ye that I should do that ye may have light in your vessels? For behold, ye cannot have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>windows</span>, for they will be dashed in pieces; neither shall ye take fire with you, for ye shall not go by the light of fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355577" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, ye shall be as a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whale</span> in the midst of the sea; for the mountain waves shall dash upon you. Nevertheless, I will bring you up again out of the depths of the sea; for the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>winds</span> have gone forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>out</span> of my mouth, and also the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rains</span> and the floods have I sent forth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355578" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And behold, I prepare you against these things; for ye cannot cross this great deep save I prepare you against the waves of the sea, and the winds which have gone forth, and the floods which shall come. Therefore what will ye that I should prepare for you that ye may have light when ye are swallowed up in the depths of the sea?</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355622" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="492"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355623" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355624" id="study_summary1">The brother of Jared sees the finger of the Lord as He touches sixteen stones—Christ shows His spirit body to the brother of Jared—Those who have a perfect knowledge cannot be kept from within the veil—Interpreters are provided to bring the Jaredite record to light.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355625" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Jared, (now the number of the vessels which had been prepared was eight) went forth unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mount</span>, which they called the mount <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Shelem</span>, because of its exceeding height, and did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>molten</span> out of a rock sixteen small stones; and they were white and clear, even as transparent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>glass</span>; and he did carry them in his hands upon the top of the mount, and cried again unto the Lord, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355626" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>O Lord, thou hast said that we must be encompassed about by the floods. Now behold, O Lord, and do not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angry</span> with thy servant because of his weakness before thee; for we know that thou art holy and dwellest in the heavens, and that we are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unworthy</span> before thee; because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fall</span> our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>natures</span> have become evil continually; nevertheless, O Lord, thou hast given us a commandment that we must call upon thee, that from thee we may receive according to our desires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355627" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, O Lord, thou hast smitten us because of our iniquity, and hast driven us forth, and for these many years we have been in the wilderness; nevertheless, thou hast been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> unto us. O Lord, look upon me in pity, and turn away thine anger from this thy people, and suffer not that they shall go forth across this raging deep in darkness; but behold these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>things</span> which I have molten out of the rock.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355628" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And I know, O Lord, that thou hast all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>, and can do whatsoever thou wilt for the benefit of man; therefore touch these stones, O Lord, with thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>finger</span>, and prepare them that they may shine forth in darkness; and they shall shine forth unto us in the vessels which we have prepared, that we may have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>light</span> while we shall cross the sea.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355629" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Behold, O Lord, thou canst do this. We know that thou art able to show forth great power, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>looks</span> small unto the understanding of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355630" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that when the brother of Jared had said these words, behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lord</span> stretched forth his hand and touched the stones one by one with his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>finger</span>. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>veil</span> was taken from off the eyes of the brother of Jared, and he saw the finger of the Lord; and it was as the finger of a man, like unto flesh and blood; and the brother of Jared <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>fell down</span> before the Lord, for he was struck with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>fear</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355631" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And the Lord saw that the brother of Jared had fallen to the earth; and the Lord said unto him: Arise, why hast thou fallen?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355632" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he saith unto the Lord: I saw the finger of the Lord, and I feared lest he should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>smite</span> me; for I knew not that the Lord had flesh and blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355633" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And the Lord said unto him: Because of thy faith thou hast seen that I shall take upon me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flesh and blood</span>; and never has man come before me with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>such</span> exceeding faith as thou hast; for were it not so ye <span class="page-break" data-page="493"></span>could not have seen my finger. Sawest thou more than this?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355634" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he answered: Nay; Lord, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>show</span> thyself unto me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355635" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And the Lord said unto him: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Believest</span> thou the words which I shall speak?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355636" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And he answered: Yea, Lord, I know that thou speakest the truth, for thou art a God of truth, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>canst</span> not lie.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355637" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And when he had said these words, behold, the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>showed</span> himself unto him, and said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Because</span> thou knowest these things ye are redeemed from the fall; therefore ye are brought back into my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>presence</span>; therefore I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>show</span> myself unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355638" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold, I am he who was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prepared</span> from the foundation of the world to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>redeem</span> my people. Behold, I am Jesus Christ. I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Father</span> and the Son. In me shall all mankind have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>life</span>, and that eternally, even they who shall believe on my name; and they shall become my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sons</span> and my daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355639" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And never have I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>showed</span> myself unto man whom I have created, for never has man <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believed</span> in me as thou hast. Seest thou that ye are created after mine own <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>image</span>? Yea, even all men were created in the beginning after mine own image.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355640" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Behold, this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>body</span>, which ye now <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>behold</span>, is the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>body</span> of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>spirit</span>; and man have I created after the body of my spirit; and even as I appear unto thee to be in the spirit will I appear unto my people in the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355641" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And now, as I, Moroni, said I could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> make a full account of these things which are written, therefore it sufficeth me to say that Jesus showed himself unto this man in the spirit, even after the manner and in the likeness of the same body even as he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>showed</span> himself unto the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355642" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And he ministered unto him even as he ministered unto the Nephites; and all this, that this man might know that he was God, because of the many great works which the Lord had showed unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355643" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowledge</span> of this man he could not be kept from beholding within the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>veil</span>; and he saw the finger of Jesus, which, when he saw, he fell with fear; for he knew that it was the finger of the Lord; and he had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>faith</span> no longer, for he knew, nothing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>doubting</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355644" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>Wherefore, having this perfect knowledge of God, he could <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> be kept from within the veil; therefore he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>saw</span> Jesus; and he did minister unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355645" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord said unto the brother of Jared: Behold, thou shalt not suffer these things which ye have seen and heard to go forth unto the world, until the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>time</span> cometh that I shall glorify my name in the flesh; wherefore, ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>treasure</span> up the things which ye have seen and heard, and show it to no man.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="494"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355646" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And behold, when ye shall come unto me, ye shall write them and shall seal them up, that no one can interpret them; for ye shall write them in a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> that they cannot be read.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355647" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And behold, these <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>two</span> stones will I give unto thee, and ye shall seal them up also with the things which ye shall write.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355648" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>language</span> which ye shall write I have confounded; wherefore I will cause in my own due time that these stones shall magnify to the eyes of men these things which ye shall write.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355649" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And when the Lord had said these words, he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>showed</span> unto the brother of Jared <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> the inhabitants of the earth which had been, and also all that would be; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>withheld</span> them not from his sight, even unto the ends of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355650" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>For he had said unto him in times before, that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>if</span> he would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>believe</span> in him that he could show unto him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>all</span> things—it should be shown unto him; therefore the Lord could not withhold anything from him, for he knew that the Lord could show him all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355651" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And the Lord said unto him: Write these things and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seal</span> them up; and I will show them in mine own due time unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355652" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord commanded him that he should seal up the two <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stones</span> which he had received, and show them not, until the Lord should show them unto the children of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>men</span>.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354499" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354500" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354501" id="study_summary1">Moroni is commanded to seal up the writings of the brother of Jared—They will not be revealed until men have faith even as the brother of Jared—Christ commands men to believe His words and those of His disciples—Men are commanded to repent, believe the gospel, and be saved.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354502" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And the Lord commanded the brother of Jared to go down out of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mount</span> from the presence of the Lord, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>write</span> the things which he had seen; and they were forbidden to come unto the children of men <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>until</span> after that he should be lifted up upon the cross; and for this cause did king Mosiah keep them, that they should not come unto the world until after Christ should show himself unto his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354503" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And after Christ truly had showed himself unto his people he commanded that they should be made manifest.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354504" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, after that, they have all dwindled in unbelief; and there is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>none</span> save it be the Lamanites, and they have rejected the gospel of Christ; therefore I am commanded that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hide</span> them up again in the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354505" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, I have written upon these plates the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>very things</span> which the brother of Jared saw; and there never were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>greater things</span> made manifest than those which were made manifest unto the brother of Jared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354506" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>Wherefore the Lord hath commanded me to write them; and I have written them. And he commanded <span class="page-break" data-page="495"></span>me that I should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seal</span> them up; and he also hath commanded that I should seal up the interpretation thereof; wherefore I have sealed up the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>interpreters</span>, according to the commandment of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354507" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For the Lord said unto me: They shall not go forth unto the Gentiles until the day that they shall repent of their iniquity, and become clean before the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354508" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And in that day that they shall exercise <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> in me, saith the Lord, even as the brother of Jared did, that they may become <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sanctified</span> in me, then will I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>manifest</span> unto them the things which the brother of Jared saw, even to the unfolding unto them all my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>revelations</span>, saith Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Father</span> of the heavens and of the earth, and all things that in them are.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354509" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And he that will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contend</span> against the word of the Lord, let him be accursed; and he that shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deny</span> these things, let him be accursed; for unto them will I show <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>no greater things</span>, saith Jesus Christ; for I am he who speaketh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354510" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And at my command the heavens are opened and are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>shut</span>; and at my word the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>earth</span> shall shake; and at my command the inhabitants thereof shall pass away, even so as by fire.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354511" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And he that believeth not my words believeth not my disciples; and if it so be that I do not speak, judge ye; for ye shall know that it is I that speaketh, at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>last day</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354512" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>But he that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>believeth</span> these things which I have spoken, him will I visit with the manifestations of my Spirit, and he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> and bear record. For because of my Spirit he shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>know</span> that these things are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>true</span>; for it persuadeth men to do good.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354513" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do good is of me; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good</span> cometh of none save it be of me. I am the same that leadeth men to all good; he that will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>not believe</span> my words will not believe me—that I am; and he that will not believe me will not believe the Father who sent me. For behold, I am the Father, I am the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>light</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>life</span>, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>truth</span> of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354514" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Come</span> unto me, O ye Gentiles, and I will show unto you the greater things, the knowledge which is hid up because of unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354515" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Come unto me, O ye house of Israel, and it shall be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manifest</span> unto you how great things the Father hath laid up for you, from the foundation of the world; and it hath not come unto you, because of unbelief.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354516" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, when ye shall rend that veil of unbelief which doth cause you to remain in your awful state of wickedness, and hardness of heart, and blindness of mind, then shall the great and marvelous things which have been <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hid</span> up from the foundation of the world from you—yea, when ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>call</span> upon the Father in my name, with a broken heart and a contrite spirit, then shall ye know that the Father hath <span class="page-break" data-page="496"></span>remembered the covenant which he made unto your fathers, O house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354517" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And then shall my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revelations</span> which I have caused to be written by my servant John be unfolded in the eyes of all the people. Remember, when ye see these things, ye shall know that the time is at hand that they shall be made manifest in very deed.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354518" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>when</span> ye shall receive this record ye may know that the work of the Father has commenced upon all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354519" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Therefore, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repent</span> all ye ends of the earth, and come unto me, and believe in my gospel, and be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptized</span> in my name; for he that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>signs</span> shall follow them that believe in my name.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354520" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And blessed is he that is found <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faithful</span> unto my name at the last day, for he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>lifted up</span> to dwell in the kingdom prepared for him <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>from</span> the foundation of the world. And behold it is I that hath spoken it. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354524" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354546" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354548" id="study_summary1">Three witnesses and the work itself will stand as a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354550" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, have written the words which were commanded me, according to my memory; and I have told you the things which I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sealed</span> up; therefore touch them not in order that ye may translate; for that thing is forbidden you, except by and by it shall be wisdom in God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354551" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And behold, ye may be privileged that ye may show the plates unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>those</span> who shall assist to bring forth this work;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354553" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> shall they be shown by the power of God; wherefore they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>know</span> of a surety that these things are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>true</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354555" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And in the mouth of three <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>witnesses</span> shall these things be established; and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>testimony</span> of three, and this work, in the which shall be shown forth the power of God and also his word, of which the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost bear record—and all this shall stand as a testimony against the world at the last day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354556" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And if it so be that they repent and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>come</span> unto the Father in the name of Jesus, they shall be received into the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354558" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, if I have no authority for these things, judge ye; for ye shall know that I have authority when ye shall see me, and we shall stand before God at the last day. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355716" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355717" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355718" id="study_summary1">The Jaredite barges are driven by the winds to the promised land—The people praise the Lord for His goodness—Orihah is appointed king over them—Jared and his brother die.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355719" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, proceed to give the record of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jared</span> and his brother.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355720" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For it came to pass after the Lord had prepared the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stones</span> which the brother of Jared had carried up into the mount, the brother of Jared <span class="page-break" data-page="497"></span>came down out of the mount, and he did put forth the stones into the vessels which were prepared, one in each end thereof; and behold, they did give light unto the vessels.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355721" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And thus the Lord caused stones to shine in darkness, to give light unto men, women, and children, that they might not cross the great waters in darkness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355722" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that when they had prepared all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>food</span>, that thereby they might subsist upon the water, and also food for their flocks and herds, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whatsoever</span> beast or animal or fowl that they should carry with them—and it came to pass that when they had done all these things they got aboard of their vessels or barges, and set forth into the sea, commending themselves unto the Lord their God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355723" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord God caused that there should be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>furious wind</span> blow upon the face of the waters, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>towards</span> the promised land; and thus they were tossed upon the waves of the sea before the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355724" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that they were many times buried in the depths of the sea, because of the mountain waves which broke upon them, and also the great and terrible tempests which were caused by the fierceness of the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355725" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that when they were buried in the deep there was no water that could hurt them, their vessels being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>tight</span> like unto a dish, and also they were tight like unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ark</span> of Noah; therefore when they were encompassed about by many waters they did cry unto the Lord, and he did bring them forth again upon the top of the waters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355726" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that the wind did never cease to blow towards the promised land while they were upon the waters; and thus they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>driven</span> forth before the wind.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355727" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sing</span> praises unto the Lord; yea, the brother of Jared did sing praises unto the Lord, and he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>thank</span> and praise the Lord all the day long; and when the night came, they did not cease to praise the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355728" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And thus they were driven forth; and no monster of the sea could break them, neither <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whale</span> that could mar them; and they did have light continually, whether it was above the water or under the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355729" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And thus they were driven forth, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>three</span> hundred and forty and four days upon the water.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355730" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> upon the shore of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>promised land</span>. And when they had set their feet upon the shores of the promised land they bowed themselves down upon the face of the land, and did humble themselves before the Lord, and did shed tears of joy before the Lord, because of the multitude of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>tender mercies</span> over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355731" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that they went forth upon the face of the land, and began to till the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355732" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And Jared had four <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons</span>; and they were called Jacom, and Gilgah, and Mahah, and Orihah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355733" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And the brother of Jared also begat sons and daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355734" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>friends</span> of Jared and his brother were in number about twenty and two souls; and they also begat sons and daughters before they came to the promised land; and therefore they began to be many.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355735" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And they were taught to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> <span class="page-break" data-page="498"></span>humbly before the Lord; and they were also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>taught</span> from on high.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355736" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they began to spread upon the face of the land, and to multiply and to till the earth; and they did wax strong in the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355737" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And the brother of Jared began to be old, and saw that he must soon go down to the grave; wherefore he said unto Jared: Let us gather together our people that we may number them, that we may know of them what they will desire of us before we go down to our graves.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355738" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And accordingly the people were gathered together. Now the number of the sons and the daughters of the brother of Jared were twenty and two souls; and the number of sons and daughters of Jared were twelve, he having four sons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355739" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And it came to pass that they did number their people; and after that they had numbered them, they did desire of them the things which they would that they should do before they went down to their graves.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355740" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that the people desired of them that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anoint</span> one of their sons to be a king over them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355741" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And now behold, this was grievous unto them. And the brother of Jared said unto them: Surely this thing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>leadeth</span> into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355742" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>But Jared said unto his brother: Suffer them that they may have a king. And therefore he said unto them: Choose ye out from among our sons a king, even whom ye will.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355743" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that they chose even the firstborn of the brother of Jared; and his name was Pagag. And it came to pass that he refused and would not be their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>king</span>. And the people would that his father should constrain him, but his father would not; and he commanded them that they should constrain no man to be their king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355744" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that they chose all the brothers of Pagag, and they would not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355745" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that neither would the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sons</span> of Jared, even all save it were one; and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Orihah</span> was anointed to be king over the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355746" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And he began to reign, and the people began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prosper</span>; and they became exceedingly rich.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355747" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that Jared died, and his brother also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355748" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that Orihah did walk humbly before the Lord, and did remember how great things the Lord had done for his father, and also taught his people how great things the Lord had done for their fathers.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354579" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354580" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354581" id="study_summary1">Orihah reigns in righteousness—Amid usurpation and strife, the rival kingdoms of Shule and Cohor are set up—Prophets condemn the wickedness and idolatry of the people, who then repent.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354582" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Orihah did execute judgment upon the land in righteousness all his days, whose days were exceedingly many.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354583" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he begat sons and daughters; yea, he begat thirty and one, among whom were twenty and three sons.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354584" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And it came to pass that he also begat <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Kib</span> in his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>old</span> age. And it came to pass that Kib reigned in his stead; and Kib begat Corihor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354585" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when Corihor was thirty and two years old he rebelled against his father, and went over and dwelt in the land of Nehor; and he begat sons and daughters, and they became exceedingly fair; wherefore Corihor drew away many people after him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354586" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And when he had gathered together an army he came up unto the <span class="page-break" data-page="499"></span>land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moron</span> where the king dwelt, and took him captive, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>brought</span> to pass the saying of the brother of Jared that they would be brought into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354587" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>Now the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land of Moron</span>, where the king dwelt, was near the land which is called Desolation by the Nephites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354588" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that Kib dwelt in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span>, and his people under Corihor his son, until he became exceedingly old; nevertheless Kib begat Shule in his old age, while he was yet in captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354589" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that Shule was angry with his brother; and Shule waxed strong, and became mighty as to the strength of a man; and he was also mighty in judgment.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354590" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, he came to the hill Ephraim, and he did molten out of the hill, and made swords out of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>steel</span> for those whom he had drawn away with him; and after he had armed them with swords he returned to the city Nehor, and gave battle unto his brother Corihor, by which means he obtained the kingdom and restored it unto his father Kib.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354591" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now because of the thing which Shule had done, his father bestowed upon him the kingdom; therefore he began to reign in the stead of his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354592" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that he did execute judgment in righteousness; and he did spread his kingdom upon all the face of the land, for the people had become exceedingly numerous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354593" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that Shule also begat many sons and daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354594" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Corihor repented of the many evils which he had done; wherefore Shule gave him power in his kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354595" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Corihor had many sons and daughters. And among the sons of Corihor there was one whose name was Noah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354596" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that Noah rebelled against Shule, the king, and also his father Corihor, and drew away Cohor his brother, and also all his brethren and many of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354597" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And he gave battle unto Shule, the king, in which he did obtain the land of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span> inheritance; and he became a king over that part of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354598" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that he gave battle again unto Shule, the king; and he took Shule, the king, and carried him away captive into Moron.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354599" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass as he was about to put him to death, the sons of Shule crept into the house of Noah by night and slew him, and broke down the door of the prison and brought out their father, and placed him upon his throne in his own kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354600" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore, the son of Noah did build up his kingdom in his stead; nevertheless they did not gain power any more over Shule the king, and the people who were under the reign of Shule the king did prosper exceedingly and wax great.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354601" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And the country was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>divided</span>; and there were two kingdoms, the kingdom of Shule, and the kingdom of Cohor, the son of Noah.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354602" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And Cohor, the son of Noah, caused that his people should give battle unto Shule, in which Shule did beat them and did slay Cohor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354603" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And now Cohor had a son who was called Nimrod; and Nimrod gave up the kingdom of Cohor unto Shule, and he did gain favor in the eyes of Shule; wherefore Shule did bestow great favors upon him, and he did do in the kingdom of Shule according to his desires.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354604" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And also in the reign of Shule there came <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span> among the people, who were sent from the Lord, prophesying that the wickedness and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>idolatry</span> of the people was bringing a curse upon the land, and they should be destroyed if they did not repent.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="500"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354605" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that the people did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>revile</span> against the prophets, and did mock them. And it came to pass that king Shule did execute judgment against all those who did revile against the prophets.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354606" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And he did execute a law throughout all the land, which gave power unto the prophets that they should go whithersoever they would; and by this cause the people were brought unto repentance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355768" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And because the people did repent of their iniquities and idolatries the Lord did spare them, and they began to prosper again in the land. And it came to pass that Shule <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>begat</span> sons and daughters in his old age.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355769" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And there were no more wars in the days of Shule; and he remembered the great things that the Lord had done for his fathers in bringing them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>across</span> the great deep into the promised land; wherefore he did execute judgment in righteousness all his days.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355781" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355792" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355793" id="study_summary1">There is strife and contention over the kingdom—Akish forms an oath-bound secret combination to slay the king—Secret combinations are of the devil and result in the destruction of nations—Modern Gentiles are warned against the secret combination that will seek to overthrow the freedom of all lands, nations, and countries.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355794" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that he begat Omer, and Omer reigned in his stead. And Omer begat Jared; and Jared begat sons and daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355795" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And Jared rebelled against his father, and came and dwelt in the land of Heth. And it came to pass that he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flatter</span> many people, because of his cunning words, until he had gained the half of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355796" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And when he had gained the half of the kingdom he gave battle unto his father, and he did carry away his father into captivity, and did make him serve in captivity;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355797" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now, in the days of the reign of Omer he was in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span> the half of his days. And it came to pass that he begat sons and daughters, among whom were Esrom and Coriantumr;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355798" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And they were exceedingly angry because of the doings of Jared their brother, insomuch that they did raise an army and gave battle unto Jared. And it came to pass that they did give battle unto him by night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355799" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that when they had slain the army of Jared they were about to slay him also; and he pled with them that they would not slay him, and he would give up the kingdom unto his father. And it came to pass that they did grant unto him his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355800" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now Jared became exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sorrowful</span> because of the loss of the kingdom, for he had set his heart upon the kingdom and upon the glory of the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355801" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the daughter of Jared being exceedingly expert, and seeing the sorrows of her father, thought to devise a plan whereby she could redeem the kingdom unto her father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355802" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Now the daughter of Jared was exceedingly fair. And it came to pass that she did talk with her father, and said unto him: Whereby hath my father so much sorrow? Hath he not read the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>record</span> which our fathers brought across the great deep? Behold, is there not an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>account</span> concerning them of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>old</span>, that they by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>secret</span> plans did obtain kingdoms and great glory?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355803" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And now, therefore, let my father send for Akish, the son of <span class="page-break" data-page="501"></span>Kimnor; and behold, I am fair, and I will dance before him, and I will please him, that he will desire me to wife; wherefore if he shall desire of thee that ye shall give unto him me to wife, then shall ye say: I will give her if ye will bring unto me the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>head</span> of my father, the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355804" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And now Omer was a friend to Akish; wherefore, when Jared had sent for Akish, the daughter of Jared danced before him that she pleased him, insomuch that he desired her to wife. And it came to pass that he said unto Jared: Give her unto me to wife.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355805" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And Jared said unto him: I will give her unto you, if ye will bring unto me the head of my father, the king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355806" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that Akish gathered in unto the house of Jared all his kinsfolk, and said unto them: Will ye swear unto me that ye will be faithful unto me in the thing which I shall desire of you?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355807" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that they all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sware</span> unto him, by the God of heaven, and also by the heavens, and also by the earth, and by their heads, that whoso should vary from the assistance which Akish desired should lose his head; and whoso should divulge whatsoever thing Akish made known unto them, the same should lose his life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355808" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that thus they did agree with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Akish</span>. And Akish did administer unto them the oaths which were given by them of old who also sought power, which had been handed down even from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Cain</span>, who was a murderer from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355809" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And they were kept up by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> of the devil to administer these oaths unto the people, to keep them in darkness, to help such as sought power to gain power, and to murder, and to plunder, and to lie, and to commit all manner of wickedness and whoredoms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355810" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it was the daughter of Jared who put it into his heart to search up these things of old; and Jared put it into the heart of Akish; wherefore, Akish administered it unto his kindred and friends, leading them away by fair promises to do whatsoever thing he desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355811" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that they formed a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combination</span>, even as they of old; which combination is most abominable and wicked above all, in the sight of God;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355812" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>For the Lord worketh not in secret combinations, neither doth he will that man should shed blood, but in all things hath forbidden it, from the beginning of man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355813" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now I, Moroni, do not write the manner of their oaths and combinations, for it hath been made known unto me that they are had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>among</span> all people, and they are had among the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355814" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they have caused the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destruction</span> of this people of whom I am now speaking, and also the destruction of the people of Nephi.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355815" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And whatsoever <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>nation</span> shall uphold such secret combinations, to get power and gain, until they shall spread over the nation, behold, they shall be destroyed; for the Lord will not suffer that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>blood</span> of his saints, which shall be shed by them, shall always cry unto him from the ground for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>vengeance</span> upon them and yet he avenge them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355816" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>Wherefore, O ye Gentiles, it is wisdom in God that these things should be shown unto you, that thereby ye may repent of your sins, and suffer not that these murderous combinations shall get above you, <span class="page-break" data-page="502"></span>which are built up to get <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and gain—and the work, yea, even the work of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destruction</span> come upon you, yea, even the sword of the justice of the Eternal God shall fall upon you, to your overthrow and destruction if ye shall suffer these things to be.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355817" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Wherefore, the Lord commandeth you, when ye shall see these things come among you that ye shall awake to a sense of your awful situation, because of this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combination</span> which shall be among you; or wo be unto it, because of the blood of them who have been slain; for they cry from the dust for vengeance upon it, and also upon those who built it up.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355818" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>For it cometh to pass that whoso buildeth it up seeketh to overthrow the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>freedom</span> of all lands, nations, and countries; and it bringeth to pass the destruction of all people, for it is built up by the devil, who is the father of all lies; even that same liar who <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>beguiled</span> our first parents, yea, even that same liar who hath caused man to commit murder from the beginning; who hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hardened</span> the hearts of men that they have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>murdered</span> the prophets, and stoned them, and cast them out from the beginning.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355819" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>Wherefore, I, Moroni, am commanded to write these things that evil may be done away, and that the time may come that Satan may have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no power</span> upon the hearts of the children of men, but that they may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>persuaded</span> to do good continually, that they may come unto the fountain of all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>righteousness</span> and be saved.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354607" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354608" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354609" id="study_summary1">The kingdom passes from one to another by descent, intrigue, and murder—Emer saw the Son of Righteousness—Many prophets cry repentance—A famine and poisonous serpents plague the people.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354610" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, proceed with my record. Therefore, behold, it came to pass that because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combinations</span> of Akish and his friends, behold, they did overthrow the kingdom of Omer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354611" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Nevertheless, the Lord was merciful unto Omer, and also to his sons and to his daughters who did not seek his destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354612" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And the Lord <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>warned</span> Omer in a dream that he should depart out of the land; wherefore Omer <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>departed</span> out of the land with his family, and traveled many days, and came over and passed by the hill of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Shim</span>, and came over by the place <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>where</span> the Nephites were destroyed, and from thence eastward, and came to a place which was called Ablom, by the seashore, and there he pitched his tent, and also his sons and his daughters, and all his household, save it were Jared and his family.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354613" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that Jared was anointed king over the people, by the hand of wickedness; and he gave unto Akish his daughter to wife.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354614" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that Akish <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sought</span> the life of his father-in-law; and he applied unto those whom he had sworn by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>oath</span> of the ancients, and they obtained the head of his father-in-law, as he sat upon his throne, giving audience to his people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354615" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For so great had been the spreading of this wicked and secret society that it had corrupted the hearts of all the people; therefore Jared was murdered upon his throne, and Akish reigned in his stead.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="503"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354616" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that Akish began to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>jealous</span> of his son, therefore he shut him up in prison, and kept him upon little or no food until he had suffered death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354617" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And now the brother of him that suffered death, (and his name was Nimrah) was angry with his father because of that which his father had done unto his brother.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354618" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that Nimrah gathered together a small number of men, and fled out of the land, and came over and dwelt with Omer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354619" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that Akish begat other sons, and they won the hearts of the people, notwithstanding they had sworn unto him to do all manner of iniquity according to that which he desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354620" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Now the people of Akish were desirous for gain, even as Akish was desirous for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span>; wherefore, the sons of Akish did offer them <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>money</span>, by which means they drew away the more part of the people after them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354621" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And there began to be a war between the sons of Akish and Akish, which lasted for the space of many years, yea, unto the destruction of nearly all the people of the kingdom, yea, even all, save it were thirty souls, and they who fled with the house of Omer.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354622" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, Omer was restored again to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span> of his inheritance.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355848" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Omer began to be old; nevertheless, in his old age he begat Emer; and he anointed Emer to be king to reign in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355849" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And after that he had anointed Emer to be king he saw peace in the land for the space of two years, and he died, having seen exceedingly many days, which were full of sorrow. And it came to pass that Emer did reign in his stead, and did fill the steps of his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355850" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And the Lord began again to take the curse from off the land, and the house of Emer did prosper exceedingly under the reign of Emer; and in the space of sixty and two years they had become exceedingly strong, insomuch that they became exceedingly rich—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355851" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> manner of fruit, and of grain, and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>silks</span>, and of fine linen, and of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>gold</span>, and of silver, and of precious things;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355852" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And also <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> manner of cattle, of oxen, and cows, and of sheep, and of swine, and of goats, and also many other kinds of animals which were useful for the food of man.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355853" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they also had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>horses</span>, and asses, and there were elephants and cureloms and cumoms; all of which were useful unto man, and more especially the elephants and cureloms and cumoms.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355854" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And thus the Lord did pour out his blessings upon this land, which was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>choice</span> above all other lands; and he commanded that whoso should possess the land should possess it unto the Lord, or they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>destroyed</span> when they were ripened in iniquity; for upon such, saith the Lord: I will pour out the fulness of my wrath.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355855" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And Emer did execute judgment in righteousness all his days, and he begat many sons and daughters; and he begat Coriantum, and he anointed Coriantum to reign in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355856" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And after he had anointed Coriantum to reign in his stead he lived four years, and he saw peace in the land; yea, and he even saw the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Son of Righteousness</span>, and did rejoice and glory in his day; and he died in peace.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355857" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantum did walk in the steps of his father, and did build many mighty <span class="page-break" data-page="504"></span>cities, and did administer that which was good unto his people in all his days. And it came to pass that he had no children even until he was exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355858" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that his wife died, being an hundred and two years old.
