And it came to pass that Coriantum took to wife, in his old age, a young maid, and begat sons and daughters; wherefore he lived until he was an hundred and forty and two years old.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355859" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And it came to pass that he begat Com, and Com reigned in his stead; and he reigned forty and nine years, and he begat Heth; and he also begat other sons and daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355860" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the people had spread again over all the face of the land, and there began again to be an exceedingly great wickedness upon the face of the land, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Heth</span> began to embrace the secret plans again of old, to destroy his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355861" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that he did dethrone his father, for he slew him with his own sword; and he did reign in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355862" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And there came prophets in the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>again</span>, crying repentance unto them—that they must prepare the way of the Lord or there should come a curse upon the face of the land; yea, even there should be a great famine, in which they should be destroyed if they did not repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355863" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>But the people believed not the words of the prophets, but they cast them out; and some of them they cast into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pits</span> and left them to perish. And it came to pass that they did all these things according to the commandment of the king, Heth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355864" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that there began to be a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dearth</span> upon the land, and the inhabitants began to be destroyed exceedingly fast because of the dearth, for there was no rain upon the face of the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355865" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And there came forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poisonous</span> serpents also upon the face of the land, and did poison many people. And it came to pass that their flocks began to flee before the poisonous serpents, towards the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>southward</span>, which was called by the Nephites <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Zarahemla</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355866" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that there were many of them which did perish by the way; nevertheless, there were some which fled into the land southward.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355867" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord did cause the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>serpents</span> that they should pursue them no more, but that they should hedge up the way that the people could not pass, that whoso should attempt to pass might fall by the poisonous serpents.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355868" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And it came to pass that the people did follow the course of the beasts, and did devour the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>carcasses</span> of them which fell by the way, until they had devoured them all. Now when the people saw that they must <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perish</span> they began to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repent</span> of their iniquities and cry unto the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355869" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And it came to pass that when they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>humbled</span> themselves sufficiently before the Lord he did send rain upon the face of the earth; and the people began to revive again, and there began to be fruit in the north countries, and in all the countries round about. And the Lord did show forth his power unto them in preserving them from famine.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355242" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355262" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354344" id="study_summary1">One king succeeds another—Some of the kings are righteous; others are wicked—When righteousness prevails, the people are blessed and prospered by the Lord.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354345" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that Shez, who was a descendant of Heth—for <span class="page-break" data-page="505"></span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Heth</span> had perished by the famine, and all his household save it were Shez—wherefore, Shez began to build up again a broken people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355267" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that Shez did remember the destruction of his fathers, and he did build up a righteous kingdom; for he remembered what the Lord had done in bringing Jared and his brother <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>across</span> the deep; and he did walk in the ways of the Lord; and he begat sons and daughters.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355269" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And his eldest son, whose name was Shez, did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebel</span> against him; nevertheless, Shez was smitten by the hand of a robber, because of his exceeding riches, which brought peace again unto his father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355270" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that his father did build up many cities upon the face of the land, and the people began again to spread over all the face of the land. And Shez did live to an exceedingly old age; and he begat Riplakish. And he died, and Riplakish reigned in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355272" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that Riplakish did not do that which was right in the sight of the Lord, for he did have many wives and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>concubines</span>, and did lay that upon men’s shoulders which was grievous to be borne; yea, he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>tax</span> them with heavy taxes; and with the taxes he did build many spacious buildings.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355274" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he did erect him an exceedingly beautiful throne; and he did build many prisons, and whoso would not be subject unto taxes he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cast</span> into prison; and whoso was not able to pay taxes he did cast into prison; and he did cause that they should labor continually for their support; and whoso refused to labor he did cause to be put to death.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355276" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>Wherefore he did obtain all his fine work, yea, even his fine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span> he did cause to be refined in prison; and all manner of fine <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>workmanship</span> he did cause to be wrought in prison. And it came to pass that he did afflict the people with his whoredoms and abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355277" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And when he had reigned for the space of forty and two years the people did rise up in rebellion against him; and there began to be war again in the land, insomuch that Riplakish was killed, and his descendants were driven out of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355279" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass after the space of many years, Morianton, (he being a descendant of Riplakish) gathered together an army of outcasts, and went forth and gave battle unto the people; and he gained power over many cities; and the war became exceedingly sore, and did last for the space of many years; and he did gain power over all the land, and did establish himself king over all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355281" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And after that he had established himself king he did ease the burden of the people, by which he did gain favor in the eyes of the people, and they did anoint him to be their king.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355283" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And he did do justice unto the people, but not unto himself because of his many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>whoredoms</span>; wherefore he was cut off from the presence of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355284" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that Morianton built up many cities, and the people became exceedingly rich under his reign, both in buildings, and in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gold</span> and silver, and in raising grain, and in flocks, and herds, and such things which had been restored unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355286" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And Morianton did live to an exceedingly great age, and then he begat Kim; and Kim did reign in the stead of his father; and he did reign eight years, and his father died. And it came to pass that Kim did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> reign in righteousness, <span class="page-break" data-page="506"></span>wherefore he was not favored of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355288" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And his brother did rise up in rebellion against him, by which he did bring him into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span>; and he did remain in captivity all his days; and he begat sons and daughters in captivity, and in his old age he begat Levi; and he died.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355290" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that Levi did serve in captivity after the death of his father, for the space of forty and two years. And he did make war against the king of the land, by which he did obtain unto himself the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355291" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And after he had obtained unto himself the kingdom he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord; and the people did prosper in the land; and he did live to a good <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>old</span> age, and begat sons and daughters; and he also begat Corom, whom he anointed king in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355293" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that Corom did that which was good in the sight of the Lord all his days; and he begat many sons and daughters; and after he had seen many days he did pass away, even like unto the rest of the earth; and Kish reigned in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355295" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Kish passed away also, and Lib reigned in his stead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355297" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that Lib also did that which was good in the sight of the Lord. And in the days of Lib the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>poisonous</span> serpents were destroyed. Wherefore they did go into the land southward, to hunt food for the people of the land, for the land was covered with animals of the forest. And Lib also himself became a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hunter</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355298" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they built a great city by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>narrow</span> neck of land, by the place where the sea divides the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355300" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And they did preserve the land <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>southward</span> for a wilderness, to get game. And the whole face of the land northward was covered with inhabitants.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355302" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And they were exceedingly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>industrious</span>, and they did buy and sell and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>traffic</span> one with another, that they might get gain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355304" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>work</span> in all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ore</span>, and they did make gold, and silver, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>iron</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>brass</span>, and all manner of metals; and they did dig it out of the earth; wherefore, they did cast up mighty heaps of earth to get ore, of gold, and of silver, and of iron, and of copper. And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>work</span> all manner of fine work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355305" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And they did have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>silks</span>, and fine-twined <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>linen</span>; and they did work all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>cloth</span>, that they might clothe themselves from their nakedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355307" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And they did make all manner of tools to till the earth, both to plow and to sow, to reap and to hoe, and also to thrash.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355309" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And they did make all manner of tools with which they did work their beasts.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355310" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And they did make all manner of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weapons</span> of war. And they did work all manner of work of exceedingly curious workmanship.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355312" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And never could be a people more blessed than were they, and more prospered by the hand of the Lord. And they were in a land that was choice above all lands, for the Lord had spoken it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355314" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that Lib did live many years, and begat sons and daughters; and he also begat Hearthom.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="507"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355316" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that Hearthom reigned in the stead of his father. And when Hearthom had reigned twenty and four years, behold, the kingdom was taken away from him. And he served many years in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span>, yea, even all the remainder of his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355318" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And he begat Heth, and Heth lived in captivity all his days. And Heth begat Aaron, and Aaron dwelt in captivity all his days; and he begat Amnigaddah, and Amnigaddah also dwelt in captivity all his days; and he begat Coriantum, and Coriantum dwelt in captivity all his days; and he begat Com.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355320" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that Com drew away the half of the kingdom. And he reigned over the half of the kingdom forty and two years; and he went to battle against the king, Amgid, and they fought for the space of many years, during which time Com gained power over Amgid, and obtained power over the remainder of the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355322" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And in the days of Com there began to be robbers in the land; and they adopted the old plans, and administered <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>oaths</span> after the manner of the ancients, and sought again to destroy the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355324" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Now Com did fight against them much; nevertheless, he did not prevail against them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 11	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354352" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/11" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 11</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354353" id="title_number1">Chapter 11</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354354" id="study_summary1">Wars, dissensions, and wickedness dominate Jaredite life—Prophets predict the utter destruction of the Jaredites unless they repent—The people reject the words of the prophets.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354355" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And there came also in the days of Com many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophets</span>, and prophesied of the destruction of that great people except they should repent, and turn unto the Lord, and forsake their murders and wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354356" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And it came to pass that the prophets were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rejected</span> by the people, and they fled unto Com for protection, for the people sought to destroy them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354357" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And they prophesied unto Com many things; and he was blessed in all the remainder of his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354358" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And he lived to a good old age, and begat Shiblom; and Shiblom reigned in his stead. And the brother of Shiblom rebelled against him, and there began to be an exceedingly great war in all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354359" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Shiblom caused that all the prophets who prophesied of the destruction of the people should be put to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354360" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And there was great calamity in all the land, for they had testified that a great curse should come upon the land, and also upon the people, and that there should be a great destruction among them, such an one as never had been upon the face of the earth, and their bones should become as <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>heaps</span> of earth upon the face of the land except they should repent of their wickedness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354361" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord, because of their wicked combinations; wherefore, there began to be wars and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>contentions</span> in all the land, and also many famines and pestilences, insomuch that there was a great destruction, such an one as never had been known upon the face of the earth; and all this came to pass in the days of Shiblom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354362" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the people began to repent of their iniquity; and inasmuch as they did the Lord did have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mercy</span> on them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354363" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that Shiblom was slain, and Seth was brought into <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span>, and did dwell in captivity all his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354364" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that Ahah, <span class="page-break" data-page="508"></span>his son, did obtain the kingdom; and he did reign over the people all his days. And he did do all manner of iniquity in his days, by which he did cause the shedding of much blood; and few were his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354365" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And Ethem, being a descendant of Ahah, did obtain the kingdom; and he also did do that which was wicked in his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354366" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that in the days of Ethem there came many prophets, and prophesied again unto the people; yea, they did prophesy that the Lord would utterly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>destroy</span> them from off the face of the earth except they repented of their iniquities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354367" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that the people hardened their hearts, and would not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hearken</span> unto their words; and the prophets <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mourned</span> and withdrew from among the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354368" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Ethem did execute judgment in wickedness all his days; and he begat Moron. And it came to pass that Moron did reign in his stead; and Moron did that which was wicked before the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354369" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that there arose a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>rebellion</span> among the people, because of that secret <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>combination</span> which was built up to get power and gain; and there arose a mighty man among them in iniquity, and gave battle unto Moron, in which he did overthrow the half of the kingdom; and he did maintain the half of the kingdom for many years.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354370" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that Moron did overthrow him, and did obtain the kingdom again.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354371" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that there arose another mighty man; and he was a descendant of the brother of Jared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354372" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that he did overthrow Moron and obtain the kingdom; wherefore, Moron dwelt in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>captivity</span> all the remainder of his days; and he begat Coriantor.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354373" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantor dwelt in captivity all his days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354374" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And in the days of Coriantor there also came many prophets, and prophesied of great and marvelous things, and cried repentance unto the people, and except they should repent the Lord God would execute <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment</span> against them to their utter destruction;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354375" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And that the Lord God would send or bring forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>another</span> people to possess the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span>, by his power, after the manner by which he brought their fathers.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354376" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>reject</span> all the words of the prophets, because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>secret society</span> and wicked abominations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354377" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantor begat <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ether</span>, and he died, having dwelt in captivity all his days.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 12	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355351" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/12" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 12</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355361" id="title_number1">Chapter 12</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355362" id="study_summary1">The prophet Ether exhorts the people to believe in God—Moroni recounts the wonders and marvels done by faith—Faith enabled the brother of Jared to see Christ—The Lord gives men weakness that they may be humble—The brother of Jared moved Mount Zerin by faith—Faith, hope, and charity are essential to salvation—Moroni saw Jesus face to face.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355363" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass that the days of Ether were in the days of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Coriantumr</span>; and Coriantumr was king over all the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355364" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ether</span> was a prophet of the Lord; wherefore Ether came forth <span class="page-break" data-page="509"></span>in the days of Coriantumr, and began to prophesy unto the people, for he could not be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>restrained</span> because of the Spirit of the Lord which was in him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355365" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>For he did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cry</span> from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>morning</span>, even until the going down of the sun, exhorting the people to believe in God unto repentance lest they should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>destroyed</span>, saying unto them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>by</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>faith</span> all things are fulfilled—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355366" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, whoso believeth in God might with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>surety</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span> for a better world, yea, even a place at the right hand of God, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hope</span> cometh of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>faith</span>, maketh an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>anchor</span> to the souls of men, which would make them sure and steadfast, always abounding in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>good works</span>, being led to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>glorify</span> God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355367" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that Ether did prophesy great and marvelous things unto the people, which they did not believe, because they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saw</span> them not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355368" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, I, Moroni, would speak somewhat concerning these things; I would show unto the world that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> is things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hoped</span> for and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>not</span> seen; wherefore, dispute not because ye see not, for ye receive no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>witness</span> until after the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>trial</span> of your faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355369" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For it was by faith that Christ showed himself unto our fathers, after he had risen from the dead; and he showed not himself unto them until after they had faith in him; wherefore, it must needs be that some had faith in him, for he showed himself <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> unto the world.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355370" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But because of the faith of men he has shown himself unto the world, and glorified the name of the Father, and prepared a way that thereby others might be partakers of the heavenly gift, that they might hope for those things which they have not seen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355371" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>Wherefore, ye may also have hope, and be partakers of the gift, if ye will but have faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355372" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold it was by faith that they of old were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>called</span> after the holy order of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355373" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>Wherefore, by faith was the law of Moses given. But in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>gift</span> of his Son hath God prepared a more <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>excellent</span> way; and it is by faith that it hath been fulfilled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355374" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>For if there be no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> among the children of men God can do no <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>miracle</span> among them; wherefore, he showed not himself until after their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355375" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Behold, it was the faith of Alma and Amulek that caused the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prison</span> to tumble to the earth.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355376" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold, it was the faith of Nephi and Lehi that wrought the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>change</span> upon the Lamanites, that they were baptized with fire and with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355377" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, it was the faith of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ammon</span> and his brethren which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>wrought</span> so great a miracle among the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355378" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Yea, and even all they who <span class="page-break" data-page="510"></span>wrought <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> wrought them by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span>, even those who were before Christ and also those who were after.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355379" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it was by faith that the three disciples obtained a promise that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> taste of death; and they obtained not the promise until after their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355380" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And neither at any time hath any wrought miracles until after their faith; wherefore they first believed in the Son of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355381" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And there were many whose faith was so exceedingly strong, even <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>before</span> Christ came, who could not be kept from within the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>veil</span>, but truly saw with their eyes the things which they had beheld with an eye of faith, and they were glad.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355382" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And behold, we have seen in this record that one of these was the brother of Jared; for so great was his faith in God, that when God put forth his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>finger</span> he could not hide it from the sight of the brother of Jared, because of his word which he had spoken unto him, which word he had obtained by faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355383" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And after the brother of Jared had beheld the finger of the Lord, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promise</span> which the brother of Jared had obtained by faith, the Lord could not withhold anything from his sight; wherefore he showed him all things, for he could no longer be kept without the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>veil</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355384" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it is by faith that my fathers have obtained the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>promise</span> that these things should come unto their brethren through the Gentiles; therefore the Lord hath commanded me, yea, even Jesus Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355385" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And I said unto him: Lord, the Gentiles will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mock</span> at these things, because of our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>weakness</span> in writing; for Lord thou hast made us <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mighty</span> in word by faith, but thou hast not made us mighty in writing; for thou hast made all this people that they could speak much, because of the Holy Ghost which thou hast given them;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355386" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And thou hast made us that we could write but little, because of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>awkwardness</span> of our hands. Behold, thou hast not made us mighty in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>writing</span> like unto the brother of Jared, for thou madest him that the things which he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>wrote</span> were mighty even as thou art, unto the overpowering of man to read them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355387" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Thou hast also made our words powerful and great, even that we <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cannot</span> write them; wherefore, when we write we behold our <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>weakness</span>, and stumble because of the placing of our words; and I fear lest the Gentiles shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mock</span> at our words.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355388" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And when I had said this, the Lord spake unto me, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Fools</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mock</span>, but they shall mourn; and my grace is sufficient for the meek, that they shall take no advantage of your weakness;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355389" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And if men come unto me I will show unto them their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weakness</span>. I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>give</span> unto men weakness that they may be humble; and my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>grace</span> is sufficient for all men that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>humble</span> themselves before me; for if they humble themselves before me, and have faith in me, then will I make <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>weak</span> things become strong unto them.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="511"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355390" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Behold, I will show unto the Gentiles their weakness, and I will show unto them that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, hope and charity bringeth unto me—the fountain of all <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>righteousness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355391" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And I, Moroni, having heard these words, was <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>comforted</span>, and said: O Lord, thy righteous will be done, for I know that thou workest unto the children of men according to their faith;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355392" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For the brother of Jared said unto the mountain Zerin, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Remove</span>—and it was removed. And if he had not had faith it would not have moved; wherefore thou workest after men have faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355393" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>For thus didst thou manifest thyself unto thy disciples; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>after</span> they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span>, and did speak in thy name, thou didst show thyself unto them in great power.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355394" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And I also remember that thou hast said that thou hast prepared a house for man, yea, even among the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mansions</span> of thy Father, in which man might have a more excellent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span>; wherefore man must hope, or he cannot receive an inheritance in the place which thou hast prepared.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355395" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And again, I remember that thou hast said that thou hast <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>loved</span> the world, even unto the laying down of thy life for the world, that thou mightest take it again to prepare a place for the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355396" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And now I know that this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>love</span> which thou hast had for the children of men is charity; wherefore, except men shall have charity they cannot inherit that place which thou hast prepared in the mansions of thy Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355397" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>Wherefore, I know by this thing which thou hast said, that if the Gentiles have not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span>, because of our weakness, that thou wilt prove them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>take away</span> their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>talent</span>, yea, even that which they have received, and give unto them who shall have more abundantly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355398" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>And it came to pass that I prayed unto the Lord that he would give unto the Gentiles <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grace</span>, that they might have charity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355399" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>And it came to pass that the Lord said unto me: If they have not charity it mattereth not unto thee, thou hast been faithful; wherefore, thy garments shall be made <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>clean</span>. And because thou hast seen thy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>weakness</span> thou shalt be made strong, even unto the sitting down in the place which I have prepared in the mansions of my Father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355400" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>And now I, Moroni, bid farewell unto the Gentiles, yea, and also unto my brethren whom I love, until we shall meet before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judgment-seat</span> of Christ, where all men shall know that my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note38b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>garments</span> are not spotted with your blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355401" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>And then shall ye know that I have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seen</span> Jesus, and that he hath talked with me <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>face to face</span>, and that he told me in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>plain</span> humility, even as a man telleth another in mine own language, concerning these things;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355402" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And only a few have I written, because of my weakness in writing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355403" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And now, I would commend you to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seek</span> this Jesus of whom the <span class="page-break" data-page="512"></span>prophets and apostles have written, that the grace of God the Father, and also the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost, which beareth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span> of them, may be and abide in you forever. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 13	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128355484" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/13" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 13</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128355485" id="title_number1">Chapter 13</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128355486" id="study_summary1">Ether speaks of a New Jerusalem to be built in America by the seed of Joseph—He prophesies, is cast out, writes the Jaredite history, and foretells the destruction of the Jaredites—War rages over all the land.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355487" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, proceed to finish my record concerning the destruction of the people of whom I have been writing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355488" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, they rejected all the words of Ether; for he truly told them of all things, from the beginning of man; and that after the waters had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>receded</span> from off the face of this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>land</span> it became a choice land above all other lands, a chosen land of the Lord; wherefore the Lord would have that all men should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>serve</span> him who dwell upon the face thereof;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355489" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And that it was the place of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>New Jerusalem</span>, which should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>come</span> down out of heaven, and the holy sanctuary of the Lord.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355490" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, Ether saw the days of Christ, and he spake concerning a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>New Jerusalem</span> upon this land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355491" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And he spake also concerning the house of Israel, and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> from whence <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Lehi</span> should come—after it should be destroyed it should be built up again, a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>holy city</span> unto the Lord; wherefore, it could not be a new Jerusalem for it had been in a time of old; but it should be built up again, and become a holy city of the Lord; and it should be built unto the house of Israel—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355492" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And that a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>New Jerusalem</span> should be built up upon this land, unto the remnant of the seed of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Joseph</span>, for which things there has been a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>type</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355493" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For as Joseph brought his father down into the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Egypt</span>, even so he died there; wherefore, the Lord brought a remnant of the seed of Joseph out of the land of Jerusalem, that he might be merciful unto the seed of Joseph that they should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perish</span> not, even as he was merciful unto the father of Joseph that he should perish not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355494" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Wherefore, the remnant of the house of Joseph shall be built upon this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>land</span>; and it shall be a land of their inheritance; and they shall build up a holy <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>city</span> unto the Lord, like unto the Jerusalem of old; and they shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>no more</span> be confounded, until the end come when the earth shall pass away.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355495" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And there shall be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>new</span> heaven and a new earth; and they shall be like unto the old save the old have passed away, and all things have become new.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355496" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And then cometh the New Jerusalem; and blessed are they who dwell therein, for it is they whose garments are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>white</span> through the blood of the Lamb; and they are they who are numbered among the remnant of the seed of Joseph, who were of the house of Israel.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355497" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And then also cometh the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jerusalem</span> of old; and the inhabitants thereof, blessed are they, for <span class="page-break" data-page="513"></span>they have been washed in the blood of the Lamb; and they are they who were scattered and gathered in from the four quarters of the earth, and from the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>north</span> countries, and are partakers of the fulfilling of the covenant which God made with their father, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Abraham</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355498" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And when these things come, bringeth to pass the scripture which saith, there are they who were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>first</span>, who shall be last; and there are they who were last, who shall be first.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355499" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And I was about to write more, but I am forbidden; but great and marvelous were the prophecies of Ether; but they esteemed him as naught, and cast him out; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hid</span> himself in the cavity of a rock by day, and by night he went forth viewing the things which should come upon the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355500" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And as he dwelt in the cavity of a rock he made the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>remainder</span> of this record, viewing the destructions which came upon the people, by night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355501" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that in that same year in which he was cast out from among the people there began to be a great war among the people, for there were many who rose up, who were mighty men, and sought to destroy Coriantumr by their secret plans of wickedness, of which hath been spoken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355502" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And now Coriantumr, having studied, himself, in all the arts of war and all the cunning of the world, wherefore he gave battle unto them who sought to destroy him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355503" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But he repented not, neither his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fair</span> sons nor daughters; neither the fair sons and daughters of Cohor; neither the fair sons and daughters of Corihor; and in fine, there were none of the fair sons and daughters upon the face of the whole earth who repented of their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355504" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>Wherefore, it came to pass that in the first year that Ether dwelt in the cavity of a rock, there were many people who were slain by the sword of those <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>secret combinations</span>, fighting against Coriantumr that they might obtain the kingdom.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355505" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the sons of Coriantumr fought much and bled much.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355506" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And in the second year the word of the Lord came to Ether, that he should go and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>prophesy</span> unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Coriantumr</span> that, if he would repent, and all his household, the Lord would give unto him his kingdom and spare the people—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355507" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Otherwise they should be destroyed, and all his household save it were himself. And he should only live to see the fulfilling of the prophecies which had been spoken concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>another</span> people receiving the land for their inheritance; and Coriantumr should receive a burial by them; and every soul should be destroyed save it were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Coriantumr</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355508" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr repented not, neither his household, neither the people; and the wars ceased not; and they sought to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>kill</span> Ether, but he fled from before them and hid again in the cavity of the rock.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355509" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And it came to pass that there arose up Shared, and he also gave battle unto Coriantumr; and he did beat him, insomuch that in the third year he did bring him into captivity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355510" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And the sons of Coriantumr, in the fourth year, did beat Shared, and did obtain the kingdom again unto their father.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355511" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Now there began to be a war <span class="page-break" data-page="514"></span>upon all the face of the land, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>every man</span> with his band fighting for that which he desired.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355512" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And there were robbers, and in fine, all manner of wickedness upon all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355513" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr was exceedingly angry with Shared, and he went against him with his armies to battle; and they did meet in great anger, and they did meet in the valley of Gilgal; and the battle became exceedingly sore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355514" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that Shared fought against him for the space of three days. And it came to pass that Coriantumr beat him, and did pursue him until he came to the plains of Heshlon.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355515" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that Shared gave him battle again upon the plains; and behold, he did beat Coriantumr, and drove him back again to the valley of Gilgal.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355516" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And Coriantumr gave Shared battle again in the valley of Gilgal, in which he beat Shared and slew him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128355517" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And Shared wounded Coriantumr in his thigh, that he did not go to battle again for the space of two years, in which time all the people upon the face of the land were shedding blood, and there was none to restrain them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 14	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354397" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/14" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 14</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354398" id="title_number1">Chapter 14</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354399" id="study_summary1">The iniquity of the people brings a curse upon the land—Coriantumr engages in warfare against Gilead, then Lib, and then Shiz—Blood and carnage cover the land.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354400" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now there began to be a great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>curse</span> upon all the land because of the iniquity of the people, in which, if a man should lay his tool or his sword upon his shelf, or upon the place whither he would keep it, behold, upon the morrow, he could not find it, so great was the curse upon the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354401" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Wherefore every man did cleave unto that which was his own, with his hands, and would not borrow neither would he lend; and every man kept the hilt of his sword in his right hand, in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>defence</span> of his property and his own life and of his wives and children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354402" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now, after the space of two years, and after the death of Shared, behold, there arose the brother of Shared and he gave battle unto Coriantumr, in which Coriantumr did beat him and did pursue him to the wilderness of Akish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354403" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that the brother of Shared did give battle unto him in the wilderness of Akish; and the battle became exceedingly sore, and many thousands fell by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354404" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr did lay siege to the wilderness; and the brother of Shared did march forth out of the wilderness by night, and slew a part of the army of Coriantumr, as they were drunken.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354405" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And he came forth to the land of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Moron</span>, and placed himself upon the throne of Coriantumr.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354406" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr dwelt with his army in the wilderness for the space of two years, in which he did receive great strength to his army.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354407" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>Now the brother of Shared, whose name was Gilead, also received great strength to his army, because of secret combinations.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354408" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that his high priest murdered him as he sat upon his throne.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354409" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that one of the secret combinations murdered him in a secret pass, and obtained unto himself the kingdom; and his name was Lib; and Lib was a man of great stature, more than any other man among all the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354410" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that in the first year of Lib, Coriantumr came up unto the land of Moron, and gave battle unto Lib.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="515"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354411" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that he fought with Lib, in which Lib did smite upon his arm that he was wounded; nevertheless, the army of Coriantumr did press forward upon Lib, that he fled to the borders upon the seashore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354412" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr pursued him; and Lib gave battle unto him upon the seashore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354413" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>And it came to pass that Lib did smite the army of Coriantumr, that they fled again to the wilderness of Akish.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354414" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that Lib did pursue him until he came to the plains of Agosh. And Coriantumr had taken all the people with him as he fled before Lib in that quarter of the land whither he fled.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354415" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And when he had come to the plains of Agosh he gave battle unto Lib, and he smote upon him until he died; nevertheless, the brother of Lib did come against Coriantumr in the stead thereof, and the battle became exceedingly sore, in the which Coriantumr fled again before the army of the brother of Lib.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354416" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>Now the name of the brother of Lib was called Shiz. And it came to pass that Shiz pursued after Coriantumr, and he did overthrow many cities, and he did slay both women and children, and he did burn the cities.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354417" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And there went a fear of Shiz throughout all the land; yea, a cry went forth throughout the land—Who can stand before the army of Shiz? Behold, he sweepeth the earth before him!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354418" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And it came to pass that the people began to flock together in armies, throughout all the face of the land.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354419" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And they were divided; and a part of them fled to the army of Shiz, and a part of them fled to the army of Coriantumr.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354420" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And so great and lasting had been the war, and so long had been the scene of bloodshed and carnage, that the whole face of the land was covered with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>bodies</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>dead</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354421" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And so swift and speedy was the war that there was none left to bury the dead, but they did march forth from the shedding of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>blood</span> to the shedding of blood, leaving the bodies of both men, women, and children strewed upon the face of the land, to become a prey to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worms</span> of the flesh.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354422" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>scent</span> thereof went forth upon the face of the land, even upon all the face of the land; wherefore the people became troubled by day and by night, because of the scent thereof.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354423" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Nevertheless, Shiz did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> cease to pursue Coriantumr; for he had sworn to avenge himself upon Coriantumr of the blood of his brother, who had been slain, and the word of the Lord which came to Ether that Coriantumr should not fall by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354424" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And thus we see that the Lord did visit them in the fulness of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wrath</span>, and their wickedness and abominations had prepared a way for their everlasting destruction.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354425" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that Shiz did pursue Coriantumr eastward, even to the borders by the seashore, and there he gave battle unto Shiz for the space of three days.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354426" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And so terrible was the destruction among the armies of Shiz that the people began to be frightened, and began to flee before the armies of Coriantumr; and they fled to the land of Corihor, and swept off the inhabitants before them, all them that would not join them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354427" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And they pitched their tents in the valley of Corihor; and Coriantumr pitched his tents in the valley of Shurr. Now the valley of Shurr was near the hill Comnor; <span class="page-break" data-page="516"></span>wherefore, Coriantumr did gather his armies together upon the hill Comnor, and did sound a trumpet unto the armies of Shiz to invite them forth to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354428" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And it came to pass that they came forth, but were driven again; and they came the second time, and they were driven again the second time. And it came to pass that they came again the third time, and the battle became exceedingly sore.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354429" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that Shiz smote upon Coriantumr that he gave him many deep wounds; and Coriantumr, having lost his blood, fainted, and was carried away as though he were dead.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354430" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>Now the loss of men, women and children on both sides was so great that Shiz commanded his people that they should not pursue the armies of Coriantumr; wherefore, they returned to their camp.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Ether 15	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128354441" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/ether/15" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Ether 15</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128354442" id="title_number1">Chapter 15</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128354443" id="study_summary1">Millions of the Jaredites are slain in battle—Shiz and Coriantumr assemble all the people to mortal combat—The Spirit of the Lord ceases to strive with them—The Jaredite nation is utterly destroyed—Only Coriantumr remains.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354444" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And it came to pass when Coriantumr had recovered of his wounds, he began to remember the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>words</span> which Ether had spoken unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354445" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>He saw that there had been slain by the sword already nearly <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>two millions</span> of his people, and he began to sorrow in his heart; yea, there had been slain two millions of mighty men, and also their wives and their children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354446" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>He began to repent of the evil which he had done; he began to remember the words which had been spoken by the mouth of all the prophets, and he saw them that they were fulfilled thus far, every whit; and his soul <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mourned</span> and refused to be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>comforted</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354447" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And it came to pass that he wrote an epistle unto Shiz, desiring him that he would spare the people, and he would give up the kingdom for the sake of the lives of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354448" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And it came to pass that when Shiz had received his epistle he wrote an epistle unto Coriantumr, that if he would give himself up, that he might slay him with his own sword, that he would spare the lives of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354449" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And it came to pass that the people repented not of their iniquity; and the people of Coriantumr were stirred up to anger against the people of Shiz; and the people of Shiz were stirred up to anger against the people of Coriantumr; wherefore, the people of Shiz did give battle unto the people of Coriantumr.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354450" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And when Coriantumr saw that he was about to fall he fled again before the people of Shiz.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354451" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And it came to pass that he came to the waters of Ripliancum, which, by interpretation, is large, or to exceed all; wherefore, when they came to these waters they pitched their tents; and Shiz also pitched his tents near unto them; and therefore on the morrow they did come to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354452" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And it came to pass that they fought an exceedingly sore battle, in which Coriantumr was wounded again, and he fainted with the loss of blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354453" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And it came to pass that the armies of Coriantumr did press upon the armies of Shiz that they beat them, that they caused them to flee before them; and they did flee southward, and did pitch their tents in a place which was called Ogath.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354454" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And it came to pass that the army of Coriantumr did pitch their tents by the hill Ramah; and it was that same hill where my father Mormon did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hide</span> up the records unto the Lord, which were sacred.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="517"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354455" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>And it came to pass that they did gather together all the people upon all the face of the land, who had not been slain, save it was Ether.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354456" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>And it came to pass that Ether did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>behold</span> all the doings of the people; and he beheld that the people who were for Coriantumr were gathered together to the army of Coriantumr; and the people who were for Shiz were gathered together to the army of Shiz.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354457" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Wherefore, they were for the space of four years gathering together the people, that they might get all who were upon the face of the land, and that they might receive all the strength which it was possible that they could receive.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354458" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>And it came to pass that when they were all gathered together, every one to the army which he would, with their wives and their children—both men, women and children being armed with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>weapons</span> of war, having shields, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>breastplates</span>, and head-plates, and being clothed after the manner of war—they did march forth one against another to battle; and they fought all that day, and conquered not.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354459" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And it came to pass that when it was night they were weary, and retired to their camps; and after they had retired to their camps they took up a howling and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>lamentation</span> for the loss of the slain of their people; and so great were their cries, their howlings and lamentations, that they did rend the air exceedingly.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354460" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And it came to pass that on the morrow they did go again to battle, and great and terrible was that day;
