nevertheless, they conquered not, and when the night came again they did rend the air with their cries, and their howlings, and their mournings, for the loss of the slain of their people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354461" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And it came to pass that Coriantumr wrote again an epistle unto Shiz, desiring that he would not come again to battle, but that he would take the kingdom, and spare the lives of the people.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354462" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>But behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit</span> of the Lord had ceased striving with them, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Satan</span> had full power over the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearts</span> of the people; for they were given up unto the hardness of their hearts, and the blindness of their minds that they might be destroyed; wherefore they went again to battle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354463" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And it came to pass that they fought all that day, and when the night came they slept upon their swords.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354464" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And on the morrow they fought even until the night came.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354465" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>And when the night came they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>drunken</span> with anger, even as a man who is drunken with wine; and they slept again upon their swords.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354466" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And on the morrow they fought again; and when the night came they had all fallen by the sword save it were fifty and two of the people of Coriantumr, and sixty and nine of the people of Shiz.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354467" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And it came to pass that they slept upon their swords that night, and on the morrow they fought again, and they contended in their might with their swords and with their shields, all that day.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354468" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And when the night came there were thirty and two of the people of Shiz, and twenty and seven of the people of Coriantumr.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354469" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And it came to pass that they ate and slept, and prepared for death on the morrow. And they were large and mighty men as to the strength of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354470" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>And it came to pass that they fought for the space of three hours, and they fainted with the loss of blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354471" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>And it came to pass that when <span class="page-break" data-page="518"></span>the men of Coriantumr had received sufficient strength that they could walk, they were about to flee for their lives; but behold, Shiz arose, and also his men, and he swore in his wrath that he would slay Coriantumr or he would perish by the sword.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354472" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>Wherefore, he did pursue them, and on the morrow he did overtake them; and they fought again with the sword. And it came to pass that when they had <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>all</span> fallen by the sword, save it were Coriantumr and Shiz, behold Shiz had fainted with the loss of blood.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354473" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>And it came to pass that when Coriantumr had leaned upon his sword, that he rested a little, he smote off the head of Shiz.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354474" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And it came to pass that after he had smitten off the head of Shiz, that Shiz raised up on his hands and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fell</span>; and after that he had struggled for breath, he died.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354475" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And it came to pass that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Coriantumr</span> fell to the earth, and became as if he had no life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354476" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And the Lord spake unto Ether, and said unto him: Go forth. And he went forth, and beheld that the words of the Lord had all been fulfilled; and he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>finished</span> his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>record</span>; (and the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hundredth</span> part I have not written) and he hid them in a manner that the people of Limhi did find them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128354477" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>Now the last words which are written by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Ether</span> are these: Whether the Lord will that I be translated, or that I suffer the will of the Lord in the flesh, it mattereth not, if it so be that I am <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>saved</span> in the kingdom of God. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 1	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358838" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/1" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 1</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<h1 data-aid="128358839" id="title1"><span class="dominant">The Book of Moroni</span></h1>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358840" id="title_number1">Chapter 1</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358841" id="study_summary1">Moroni writes for the benefit of the Lamanites—The Nephites who will not deny Christ are put to death. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358842" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now I, Moroni, after having made an end of abridging the account of the people of Jared, I had supposed <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>not</span> to have written more, but I have not as yet perished; and I make not myself known to the Lamanites lest they should destroy me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358843" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wars</span> are exceedingly fierce among themselves; and because of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hatred</span> they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>put to death</span> every Nephite that will not deny the Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358844" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And I, Moroni, will not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deny</span> the Christ; wherefore, I wander whithersoever I can for the safety of mine own life.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358845" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Wherefore, I write a few more things, contrary to that which I had supposed; for I had supposed not to have written any more; but I write a few more things, that perhaps they may be of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>worth</span> unto my brethren, the Lamanites, in some future day, according to the will of the Lord.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 2	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358123" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/2" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 2</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358124" id="title_number1">Chapter 2</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358125" id="study_summary1">Jesus gave the twelve Nephite disciples power to confer the gift of the Holy Ghost. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="519"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358126" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The words of Christ, which he spake unto his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disciples</span>, the twelve whom he had chosen, as he laid his hands upon them—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358127" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And he called them by name, saying: Ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>call</span> on the Father in my name, in mighty prayer; and after ye have done this ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> that to him upon whom ye shall lay your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hands</span>, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>ye</span> shall give the Holy Ghost; and in my name shall ye give it, for thus do mine apostles.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358128" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Now Christ spake these words unto them at the time of his first appearing; and the multitude heard it not, but the disciples heard it; and on as many as they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laid</span> their hands, fell the Holy Ghost.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 3	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358135" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/3" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 3</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358136" id="title_number1">Chapter 3</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358137" id="study_summary1">Elders ordain priests and teachers by the laying on of hands. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358138" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The manner which the disciples, who were called the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>elders</span> of the church, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ordained</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>priests</span> and teachers—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358139" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>After they had prayed unto the Father in the name of Christ, they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>laid</span> their hands upon them, and said:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358140" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>In the name of Jesus Christ I ordain you to be a priest (or if he be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>teacher</span>, I ordain you to be a teacher) to preach repentance and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of sins through Jesus Christ, by the endurance of faith on his name to the end. Amen.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358141" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And after this manner did they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ordain</span> priests and teachers, according to the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>gifts</span> and callings of God unto men; and they ordained them by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>power</span> of the Holy Ghost, which was in them.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 4	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358963" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/4" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 4</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358964" id="title_number1">Chapter 4</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358965" id="study_summary1">How elders and priests administer the sacramental bread is explained. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358966" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manner</span> of their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>elders</span> and priests administering the flesh and blood of Christ unto the church; and they administered it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>according</span> to the commandments of Christ; wherefore we know the manner to be true; and the elder or priest did minister it—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358967" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And they did kneel down with the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, and pray to the Father in the name of Christ, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358968" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>O God, the Eternal Father, we ask thee in the name of thy Son, Jesus Christ, to bless and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sanctify</span> this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>bread</span> to the souls of all those who partake of it; that they may eat in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remembrance</span> of the body of thy Son, and witness unto thee, O God, the Eternal Father, that they are willing to take upon them the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>name</span> of thy Son, and always remember him, and keep his commandments which he hath given them, that they may always have his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>Spirit</span> to be with them. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 5	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358151" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/5" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 5</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358152" id="title_number1">Chapter 5</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358153" id="study_summary1">The mode of administering the sacramental wine is set forth. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358154" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>The <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>manner</span> of administering the wine—Behold, they took the cup, and said:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358155" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>O God, the Eternal Father, we <span class="page-break" data-page="520"></span>ask thee, in the name of thy Son, Jesus Christ, to bless and sanctify this <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>wine</span> to the souls of all those who drink of it, that they may do it in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remembrance</span> of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>blood</span> of thy Son, which was shed for them; that they may witness unto thee, O God, the Eternal Father, that they do always remember him, that they may have his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>Spirit</span> to be with them. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 6	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358978" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/6" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 6</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358979" id="title_number1">Chapter 6</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358980" id="study_summary1">Repentant persons are baptized and fellowshipped—Church members who repent are forgiven—Meetings are conducted by the power of the Holy Ghost. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358981" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I speak concerning baptism. Behold, elders, priests, and teachers were baptized; and they were not baptized save they brought forth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fruit</span> meet that they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>worthy</span> of it.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358982" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>Neither did they receive any unto baptism save they came forth with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>broken</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>heart</span> and a contrite spirit, and witnessed unto the church that they truly repented of all their sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358983" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And none were received unto baptism save they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>took upon</span> them the name of Christ, having a determination to serve him to the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358984" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And after they had been received unto baptism, and were wrought upon and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cleansed</span> by the power of the Holy Ghost, they were numbered among the people of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>church</span> of Christ; and their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>names</span> were taken, that they might be remembered and nourished by the good word of God, to keep them in the right way, to keep them continually <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>watchful</span> unto prayer, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>relying</span> alone upon the merits of Christ, who was the author and the finisher of their faith.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358985" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span> did meet together <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>oft</span>, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>fast</span> and to pray, and to speak one with another concerning the welfare of their souls.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358986" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And they did <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meet</span> together oft to partake of bread and wine, in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remembrance</span> of the Lord Jesus.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358987" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And they were strict to observe that there should be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>no iniquity</span> among them; and whoso was found to commit iniquity, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>three</span> witnesses of the church did condemn them before the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>elders</span>, and if they repented not, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>confessed</span> not, their names were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>blotted out</span>, and they were not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>numbered</span> among the people of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358988" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>as</span> oft as they repented and sought forgiveness, with real <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>intent</span>, they were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>forgiven</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358989" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And their meetings were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>conducted</span> by the church after the manner of the workings of the Spirit, and by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>power</span> of the Holy Ghost; for as the power of the Holy Ghost led them whether to preach, or to exhort, or to pray, or to supplicate, or to sing, even so it was done.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 7	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358161" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/7" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 7</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="521"></span>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358162" id="title_number1">Chapter 7</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358163" id="study_summary1">An invitation is given to enter into the rest of the Lord—Pray with real intent—The Spirit of Christ enables men to know good from evil—Satan persuades men to deny Christ and do evil—The prophets manifest the coming of Christ—By faith, miracles are wrought and angels minister—Men should hope for eternal life and cleave unto charity. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358164" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>And now I, Moroni, write a few of the words of my father Mormon, which he spake concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, hope, and charity; for after this manner did he speak unto the people, as he taught them in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>synagogue</span> which they had built for the place of worship.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358165" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And now I, Mormon, speak unto you, my beloved brethren; and it is by the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>grace</span> of God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, and his holy will, because of the gift of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>calling</span> unto me, that I am permitted to speak unto you at this time.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358166" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Wherefore, I would speak unto you that are of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>church</span>, that are the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>peaceable</span> followers of Christ, and that have obtained a sufficient <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hope</span> by which ye can enter into the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>rest</span> of the Lord, from this time henceforth until ye shall rest with him in heaven.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358167" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now my brethren, I judge these things of you because of your peaceable <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>walk</span> with the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358168" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For I remember the word of God which saith by their <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>works</span> ye shall know them; for if their works be good, then they are good also.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358169" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>For behold, God hath said a man being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span> cannot do that which is good; for if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>offereth</span> a gift, or <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>prayeth</span> unto God, except he shall do it with real <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>intent</span> it profiteth him nothing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358170" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For behold, it is not counted unto him for righteousness.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358171" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>For behold, if a man being <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span> giveth a gift, he doeth it <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grudgingly</span>; wherefore it is counted unto him the same as if he had retained the gift; wherefore he is counted evil before God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358172" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And likewise also is it counted evil unto a man, if he shall pray and not with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>real intent</span> of heart; yea, and it profiteth him nothing, for God receiveth none such.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358173" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Wherefore, a man being evil cannot do that which is good; neither will he give a good gift.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358174" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>For behold, a bitter <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fountain</span> cannot bring forth good water; neither can a good fountain bring forth bitter water; wherefore, a man being a servant of the devil cannot follow Christ; and if he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>follow</span> Christ he cannot be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>servant</span> of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358175" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>Wherefore, all things which are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good</span> cometh of God; and that which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>evil</span> cometh of the devil; for the devil is an enemy unto God, and fighteth against him continually, and inviteth and enticeth <span class="page-break" data-page="522"></span>to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sin</span>, and to do that which is evil continually.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358176" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But behold, that which is of God inviteth and enticeth to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>good</span> continually; wherefore, every thing which inviteth and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>enticeth</span> to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>good</span>, and to love God, and to serve him, is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>inspired</span> of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358177" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Wherefore, take heed, my beloved brethren, that ye do not judge that which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span> to be of God, or that which is good and of God to be of the devil.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358178" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For behold, my brethren, it is given unto you to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note15a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>judge</span>, that ye may know good from evil; and the way to judge is as plain, that ye may know with a perfect knowledge, as the daylight is from the dark night.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358179" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>For behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Spirit of Christ</span> is given to every <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>man</span>, that he may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>know</span> good from evil; wherefore, I show unto you the way to judge; for every thing which inviteth to do good, and to persuade to believe in Christ, is sent forth by the power and gift of Christ; wherefore ye may know with a perfect knowledge it is of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358180" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>But whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>evil</span>, and believe not in Christ, and deny him, and serve not God, then ye may know with a perfect knowledge it is of the devil; for after this manner doth the devil work, for he persuadeth no man to do good, no, not one; neither do his angels; neither do they who subject themselves unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358181" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>And now, my brethren, seeing that ye know the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light</span> by which ye may judge, which light is the light of Christ, see that ye do not judge wrongfully; for with that same <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>judgment</span> which ye judge ye shall also be judged.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358182" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Wherefore, I beseech of you, brethren, that ye should search diligently in the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>light of Christ</span> that ye may know good from evil; and if ye will lay hold upon every good thing, and condemn it not, ye certainly will be a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>child</span> of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358183" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, my brethren, how is it possible that ye can lay hold upon every good thing?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358184" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>And now I come to that faith, of which I said I would speak; and I will tell you the way whereby ye may lay hold on every good thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358185" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold, God <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>knowing</span> all things, being from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>everlasting</span> to everlasting, behold, he sent <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>angels</span> to minister unto the children of men, to make manifest concerning the coming of Christ; and in Christ there should come every good thing.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358186" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And God also declared unto prophets, by his own mouth, that Christ should come.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358187" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And behold, there were divers ways that he did manifest things unto the children of men, which were good; and all things which are good cometh of Christ; otherwise men were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fallen</span>, and there could no good thing come unto them.</p>^N			<span class="page-break" data-page="523"></span>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358188" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>Wherefore, by the ministering of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span>, and by every word which proceeded forth out of the mouth of God, men began to exercise faith in Christ; and thus by faith, they did lay hold upon every good thing; and thus it was until the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358189" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And after that he came men also were <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>saved</span> by faith in his name; and by faith, they become the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>sons</span> of God. And as surely as Christ liveth he spake these words unto our fathers, saying: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Whatsoever</span> thing ye shall ask the Father in my name, which is good, in faith believing that ye shall receive, behold, it shall be done unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358190" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> ceased because Christ hath ascended into heaven, and hath sat down on the right hand of God, to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>claim</span> of the Father his rights of mercy which he hath upon the children of men?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358191" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>For he hath answered the ends of the law, and he claimeth all those who have faith in him; and they who have faith in him will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cleave</span> unto every good thing; wherefore he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>advocateth</span> the cause of the children of men; and he dwelleth eternally in the heavens.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358192" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And because he hath done this, my beloved brethren, have miracles ceased? Behold I say unto you, Nay; neither have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note29a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>angels</span> ceased to minister unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358193" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>For behold, they are subject unto him, to minister according to the word of his command, showing themselves unto them of strong faith and a firm mind in every form of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note30a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>godliness</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358194" id="p31"><span class="verse-number">31 </span>And the office of their ministry is to call men unto repentance, and to fulfil and to do the work of the covenants of the Father, which he hath made unto the children of men, to prepare the way among the children of men, by declaring the word of Christ unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note31a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>chosen</span> vessels of the Lord, that they may bear testimony of him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358195" id="p32"><span class="verse-number">32 </span>And by so doing, the Lord God prepareth the way that the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>residue</span> of men may have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note32b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in Christ, that the Holy Ghost may have place in their hearts, according to the power thereof; and after this manner bringeth to pass the Father, the covenants which he hath made unto the children of men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358196" id="p33"><span class="verse-number">33 </span>And Christ hath said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>If</span> ye will have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>faith</span> in me ye shall have power to do whatsoever thing is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note33c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>expedient</span> in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358197" id="p34"><span class="verse-number">34 </span>And he hath said: <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note34a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Repent</span> all ye ends of the earth, and come unto me, and be baptized in my name, and have faith in me, that ye may be saved.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358198" id="p35"><span class="verse-number">35 </span>And now, my beloved brethren, if this be the case that these things are true which I have spoken unto you, and God will show unto you, with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>power</span> and great glory at the last <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note35b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>day</span>, that they are true, and if they are true has the day of miracles ceased?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358199" id="p36"><span class="verse-number">36 </span>Or have angels ceased to appear unto the children of men? Or has he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note36a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>withheld</span> the power of the Holy Ghost from them? Or will he, so <span class="page-break" data-page="524"></span>long as time shall last, or the earth shall stand, or there shall be one man upon the face thereof to be saved?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358200" id="p37"><span class="verse-number">37 </span>Behold I say unto you, Nay; for it is by faith that <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>miracles</span> are wrought; and it is by faith that angels appear and minister unto men; wherefore, if these things have ceased wo be unto the children of men, for it is because of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note37b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>unbelief</span>, and all is vain.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358201" id="p38"><span class="verse-number">38 </span>For no man can be saved, according to the words of Christ, save they shall have faith in his name; wherefore, if these things have ceased, then has faith ceased also; and awful is the state of man, for they are as though there had been no redemption made.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358202" id="p39"><span class="verse-number">39 </span>But behold, my beloved brethren, I judge better things of you, for I judge that ye have faith in Christ because of your meekness; for if ye have not faith in him then ye are not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note39a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>fit</span> to be numbered among the people of his church.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358203" id="p40"><span class="verse-number">40 </span>And again, my beloved brethren, I would speak unto you concerning <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note40a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hope</span>. How is it that ye can attain unto faith, save ye shall have hope?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358204" id="p41"><span class="verse-number">41 </span>And what is it that ye shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hope</span> for? Behold I say unto you that ye shall have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>hope</span> through the atonement of Christ and the power of his resurrection, to be raised unto life <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note41c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>eternal</span>, and this because of your faith in him according to the promise.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358205" id="p42"><span class="verse-number">42 </span>Wherefore, if a man have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> he <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note42b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>must</span> needs have hope; for without faith there cannot be any hope.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358206" id="p43"><span class="verse-number">43 </span>And again, behold I say unto you that he cannot have faith and hope, save he shall be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note43a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meek</span>, and lowly of heart.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358207" id="p44"><span class="verse-number">44 </span>If so, his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span> and hope is vain, for none is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>acceptable</span> before God, save the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>meek</span> and lowly in heart; and if a man be meek and lowly in heart, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note44d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>confesses</span> by the power of the Holy Ghost that Jesus is the Christ, he must needs have charity; for if he have not charity he is nothing; wherefore he must needs have charity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358208" id="p45"><span class="verse-number">45 </span>And <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span> suffereth long, and is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>kind</span>, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>envieth</span> not, and is not puffed up, seeketh not her own, is not easily <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note45d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>provoked</span>, thinketh no evil, and rejoiceth not in iniquity but rejoiceth in the truth, beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358209" id="p46"><span class="verse-number">46 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, if ye have not charity, ye are nothing, for charity never faileth. Wherefore, cleave unto charity, which is the greatest of all, for all things must fail—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358210" id="p47"><span class="verse-number">47 </span>But <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span> is the pure <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>love</span> of Christ, and it endureth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note47c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>forever</span>; and whoso is found possessed of it at the last day, it shall be well with him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358211" id="p48"><span class="verse-number">48 </span>Wherefore, my beloved brethren, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> unto the Father with all the energy of heart, that ye may be filled with this love, which he hath bestowed upon all who are true <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>followers</span> of his Son, Jesus Christ; that ye may become the sons of God; that when he shall appear we <span class="page-break" data-page="525"></span>shall <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>be</span> like him, for we shall see him as he is; that we may have this hope; that we may be <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note48d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>purified</span> even as he is pure. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 8	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359014" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/8" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 8</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359017" id="title_number1">Chapter 8</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359018" id="study_summary1">The baptism of little children is an evil abomination—Little children are alive in Christ because of the Atonement—Faith, repentance, meekness and lowliness of heart, receiving the Holy Ghost, and enduring to the end lead to salvation. About <small>A.D.</small> 401–21.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359019" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>An epistle of my <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>father</span> Mormon, written to me, Moroni; and it was written unto me soon after my calling to the ministry. And on this wise did he write unto me, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359020" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>My beloved son, Moroni, I rejoice exceedingly that your Lord Jesus Christ hath been mindful of you, and hath called you to his ministry, and to his holy work.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359021" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>I am mindful of you always in my prayers, continually praying unto God the Father in the name of his Holy Child, Jesus, that he, through his infinite <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>goodness</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>grace</span>, will keep you through the endurance of faith on his name to the end.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359022" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And now, my son, I speak unto you concerning that which grieveth me exceedingly; for it grieveth me that there should <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>disputations</span> rise among you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359023" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For, if I have learned the truth, there have been disputations among you concerning the baptism of your little children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359024" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, my son, I desire that ye should labor diligently, that this gross error should be removed from among you; for, for this intent I have written this epistle.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359025" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>For immediately after I had learned these things of you I inquired of the Lord concerning the matter. And the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>word</span> of the Lord came to me by the power of the Holy Ghost, saying:</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359026" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span><span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Listen</span> to the words of Christ, your Redeemer, your Lord and your God. Behold, I came into the world not to call the righteous but sinners to repentance; the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>whole</span> need no physician, but they that are sick; wherefore, little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>children</span> are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>whole</span>, for they are not capable of committing <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>sin</span>; wherefore the curse of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>Adam</span> is taken from them in me, that it hath no power over them; and the law of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>circumcision</span> is done away in me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359027" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And after this manner did the Holy Ghost manifest the word of God unto me; wherefore, my beloved son, I know that it is solemn <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>mockery</span> before God, that ye should baptize little children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359028" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>Behold I say unto you that this thing shall ye teach—repentance and baptism unto those who are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>accountable</span> and capable of committing sin; yea, teach parents that they must repent and be baptized, and humble themselves as their little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>children</span>, and they shall all be saved with their little children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359029" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>And their little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> need no repentance, neither baptism. Behold, baptism is unto repentance to the fulfilling the commandments unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note11b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>remission</span> of sins.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359030" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>But little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> are alive in Christ, even from the foundation of the world; if not so, God is a partial <span class="page-break" data-page="526"></span>God, and also a changeable God, and a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note12b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>respecter</span> to persons; for how many little children have died without baptism!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359031" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>Wherefore, if little children could not be saved without baptism, these must have gone to an endless hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359032" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>Behold I say unto you, that he that supposeth that little children need baptism is in the gall of bitterness and in the bonds of iniquity; for he hath neither <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>faith</span>, hope, nor charity; wherefore, should he be cut off while in the thought, he must go down to hell.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359033" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>For awful is the wickedness to suppose that God saveth one child because of baptism, and the other must perish because he hath no baptism.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359034" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>Wo be unto them that shall pervert the ways of the Lord after this manner, for they shall perish except they repent. Behold, I speak with boldness, having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>authority</span> from God; and I fear not what man can do; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>perfect</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>love</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>casteth out</span> all fear.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359035" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And I am filled with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>charity</span>, which is everlasting love; wherefore, all children are alike unto me; wherefore, I love little children with a perfect love; and they are all alike and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>partakers</span> of salvation.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359036" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>For I know that God is not a partial God, neither a changeable being; but he is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>unchangeable</span> from <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>all</span> eternity to all eternity.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359037" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>Little <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>children</span> cannot repent; wherefore, it is awful wickedness to deny the pure mercies of God unto them, for they are all alive in him because of his <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note19b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>mercy</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359038" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And he that saith that little children need baptism denieth the mercies of Christ, and setteth at naught the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>atonement</span> of him and the power of his redemption.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359039" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Wo unto such, for they are in danger of death, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>hell</span>, and an <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>endless</span> torment. I speak it boldly; God hath commanded me. Listen unto them and give heed, or they stand against you at the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note21c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>judgment-seat</span> of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359040" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>For behold that all little children are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>alive</span> in Christ, and also all they that are without the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>law</span>. For the power of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>redemption</span> cometh on all them that have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>no law</span>; wherefore, he that is not condemned, or he that is under no condemnation, cannot repent; and unto such baptism availeth nothing—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359041" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>But it is mockery before God, denying the mercies of Christ, and the power of his Holy Spirit, and putting trust in <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>dead works</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359042" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>Behold, my son, this thing ought not to be; for <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repentance</span> is unto them that are under condemnation and under the curse of a broken law.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359043" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>And the first fruits of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>repentance</span> is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>baptism</span>; and baptism cometh by faith unto the fulfilling the commandments; and the fulfilling the commandments bringeth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>remission</span> of sins;</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359044" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And the remission of sins bringeth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>meekness</span>, and lowliness of heart; and because of meekness and lowliness of heart cometh the <span class="page-break" data-page="527"></span>visitation of the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>Holy Ghost</span>, which <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>Comforter</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>filleth</span> with hope and perfect <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>love</span>, which love endureth by <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>diligence</span> unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>prayer</span>, until the end shall come, when all the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26h"><sup class="marker">h</sup>saints</span> shall dwell with God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359045" id="p27"><span class="verse-number">27 </span>Behold, my son, I will write unto you again if I go not out soon against the Lamanites. Behold, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note27a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pride</span> of this nation, or the people of the Nephites, hath proven their destruction except they should repent.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359046" id="p28"><span class="verse-number">28 </span>Pray for them, my son, that repentance may come unto them. But behold, I fear lest the Spirit hath <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ceased</span> <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>striving</span> with them; and in this part of the land they are also seeking to put down all power and authority which cometh from God; and they are <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note28c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>denying</span> the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359047" id="p29"><span class="verse-number">29 </span>And after rejecting so great a knowledge, my son, they must perish soon, unto the fulfilling of the prophecies which were spoken by the prophets, as well as the words of our Savior himself.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359048" id="p30"><span class="verse-number">30 </span>Farewell, my son, until I shall write unto you, or shall meet you again. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 9	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128359099" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/9" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 9</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="intro" data-aid="128359105" id="intro1">The second epistle of Mormon to his son Moroni.</p>^N			<p class="study-intro" data-aid="128359106" id="study_intro1">Comprising chapter 9.</p>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128359107" id="title_number1">Chapter 9</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128359108" id="study_summary1">Both the Nephites and the Lamanites are depraved and degenerate—They torture and murder each other—Mormon prays that grace and goodness may rest upon Moroni forever. About <small>A.D.</small> 401.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359109" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>My beloved son, I write unto you again that ye may know that I am yet alive; but I write somewhat of that which is grievous.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359110" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>For behold, I have had a sore battle with the Lamanites, in which we did not conquer; and Archeantus has fallen by the sword, and also Luram and Emron; yea, and we have lost a great number of our choice men.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359111" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>And now behold, my son, I fear lest the Lamanites shall destroy this people; for they do not repent, and Satan stirreth them up continually to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>anger</span> one with another.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359112" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>Behold, I am laboring with them continually; and when I speak the word of God with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>sharpness</span> they tremble and anger against me; and when I use no sharpness they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>harden</span> their hearts against it; wherefore, I fear lest the Spirit of the Lord hath ceased <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>striving</span> with them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359113" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>For so exceedingly do they anger that it seemeth me that they have no fear of death; and they have lost their love, one towards another; and they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>thirst</span> after blood and revenge continually.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359114" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And now, my beloved son, notwithstanding their hardness, let us labor <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>diligently</span>; for if we should cease to <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note6b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>labor</span>, we should be brought under condemnation; for we have a labor to perform whilst in this tabernacle of clay, that we may conquer the enemy of all righteousness, and rest our souls in the kingdom of God.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359115" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And now I write somewhat concerning the sufferings of this people. <span class="page-break" data-page="528"></span>For according to the knowledge which I have received from Amoron, behold, the Lamanites have many prisoners, which they took from the tower of Sherrizah; and there were men, women, and children.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359116" id="p8"><span class="verse-number">8 </span>And the husbands and fathers of those women and children they have slain; and they feed the women upon the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note8a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>flesh</span> of their husbands, and the children upon the flesh of their fathers; and no water, save a little, do they give unto them.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359117" id="p9"><span class="verse-number">9 </span>And notwithstanding this great <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>abomination</span> of the Lamanites, it doth not exceed that of our people in Moriantum. For behold, many of the daughters of the Lamanites have they taken prisoners; and after <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>depriving</span> them of that which was most dear and precious above all things, which is <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>chastity</span> and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note9d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>virtue</span>—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359118" id="p10"><span class="verse-number">10 </span>And after they had done this thing, they did murder them in a most <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note10a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>cruel</span> manner, torturing their bodies even unto death; and after they have done this, they devour their flesh like unto wild beasts, because of the hardness of their hearts; and they do it for a token of bravery.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359119" id="p11"><span class="verse-number">11 </span>O my beloved son, how can a people like this, that are without civilization—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359120" id="p12"><span class="verse-number">12 </span>(And only a few years have passed away, and they were a civil and a delightsome people)</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359121" id="p13"><span class="verse-number">13 </span>But O my son, how can a people like this, whose <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note13a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>delight</span> is in so much abomination—</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359122" id="p14"><span class="verse-number">14 </span>How can we expect that God will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note14a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>stay</span> his hand in judgment against us?</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359123" id="p15"><span class="verse-number">15 </span>Behold, my heart cries: Wo unto this people. Come out in judgment, O God, and hide their sins, and wickedness, and abominations from before thy face!</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359124" id="p16"><span class="verse-number">16 </span>And again, my son, there are many <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note16a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>widows</span> and their daughters who remain in Sherrizah; and that part of the provisions which the Lamanites did not carry away, behold, the army of Zenephi has carried away, and left them to wander whithersoever they can for food; and many old women do faint by the way and die.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359125" id="p17"><span class="verse-number">17 </span>And the army which is with me is weak; and the armies of the Lamanites are betwixt Sherrizah and me; and as many as have fled to the army of <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note17a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Aaron</span> have fallen victims to their awful brutality.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359126" id="p18"><span class="verse-number">18 </span>O the depravity of my people! They are without <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>order</span> and without mercy. Behold, I am but a man, and I have but the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note18b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>strength</span> of a man, and I cannot any longer enforce my commands.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359127" id="p19"><span class="verse-number">19 </span>And they have become strong in their perversion; and they are alike brutal, sparing none, neither old nor young; and they delight in everything save that which is good; and the suffering of our women and our children upon all the face of this land doth exceed everything; yea, tongue cannot tell, neither can it be written.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359128" id="p20"><span class="verse-number">20 </span>And now, my son, I dwell no longer upon this horrible scene. Behold, thou knowest the wickedness of this people; thou knowest that they are without principle, and past feeling; and their wickedness doth <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note20a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>exceed</span> that of the Lamanites.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359129" id="p21"><span class="verse-number">21 </span>Behold, my son, I cannot recommend them unto God lest he should smite me.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359130" id="p22"><span class="verse-number">22 </span>But behold, my son, I recommend thee unto God, and I trust in Christ that thou wilt be saved; and I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>pray</span> unto God that he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>spare</span> thy life, to witness the return of his <span class="page-break" data-page="529"></span>people unto him, or their utter destruction; for I know that they must perish except they <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note22c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>repent</span> and return unto him.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359131" id="p23"><span class="verse-number">23 </span>And if they perish it will be like unto the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Jaredites</span>, because of the wilfulness of their hearts, <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>seeking</span> for blood and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note23c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>revenge</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359132" id="p24"><span class="verse-number">24 </span>And if it so be that they perish, we know that many of our brethren have <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>deserted</span> over unto the Lamanites, and many more will also desert over unto them; wherefore, write somewhat a few things, if thou art spared and I shall perish and not see thee; but I trust that I may see thee soon; for I have sacred records that I would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note24b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>deliver</span> up unto thee.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359133" id="p25"><span class="verse-number">25 </span>My son, be faithful in Christ; and may not the things which I have written grieve thee, to weigh thee down unto <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>death</span>; but may Christ lift thee up, and may his sufferings and death, and the showing his body unto our fathers, and his mercy and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>long-suffering</span>, and the hope of his glory and of eternal life, rest in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note25c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>mind</span> forever.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128359134" id="p26"><span class="verse-number">26 </span>And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note26a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>right hand</span> of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.</p>^N		</div>^N	</body>^N</html>
Moroni 10	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>^N<!DOCTYPE html>^N<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" data-aid="128358852" data-aid-version="4" data-content-type="chapter" data-uri="/scriptures/bofm/moro/10" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Article" lang="eng" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.lds.org/schema/lds/html5.xsd">^N	<head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" />^N		<title>Moroni 10</title>^N		<meta charset="UTF-8" />^N	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style_classic-scripture.css" /><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/images.js"></script><script type="text/javascript" src="../js/scripture-verse-number.js"></script><meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1.0,maximum-scale=1.0" /></head>^N	<body>^N		<header>^N			<p class="title-number" data-aid="128358853" id="title_number1">Chapter 10</p>^N			<p class="study-summary" data-aid="128358854" id="study_summary1">A testimony of the Book of Mormon comes by the power of the Holy Ghost—The gifts of the Spirit are dispensed to the faithful—Spiritual gifts always accompany faith—Moroni’s words speak from the dust—Come unto Christ, be perfected in Him, and sanctify your souls. About <small>A.D.</small> 421.</p>^N		</header>^N		<div class="body-block">^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358855" id="p1"><span class="verse-number">1 </span>Now I, Moroni, write somewhat as seemeth me good; and I write unto my brethren, the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>Lamanites</span>; and I would that they should know that more than <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note1b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>four hundred and twenty</span> years have passed away since the sign was given of the coming of Christ.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358856" id="p2"><span class="verse-number">2 </span>And I <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>seal</span> up <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note2b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>these records</span>, after I have spoken a few words by way of exhortation unto you.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358857" id="p3"><span class="verse-number">3 </span>Behold, I would exhort you that when ye shall read these things, if it be wisdom in God that ye should read them, that ye would remember how <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>merciful</span> the Lord hath been unto the children of men, from the creation of Adam even down until the time that ye shall receive these things, and <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>ponder</span> it in your <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note3c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>hearts</span>.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358858" id="p4"><span class="verse-number">4 </span>And when ye shall receive these things, I would exhort you that ye would <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>ask</span> God, the Eternal Father, in the name of Christ, if these things are not <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>true</span>; and if ye shall ask with a <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4c"><sup class="marker">c</sup>sincere heart</span>, with <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4d"><sup class="marker">d</sup>real intent</span>, having <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4e"><sup class="marker">e</sup>faith</span> in Christ, he will <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4f"><sup class="marker">f</sup>manifest</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note4g"><sup class="marker">g</sup>truth</span> of it unto you, by the power of the Holy Ghost.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358859" id="p5"><span class="verse-number">5 </span>And by the power of the Holy Ghost ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> the <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note5b"><sup class="marker">b</sup>truth</span> of all things.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358860" id="p6"><span class="verse-number">6 </span>And whatsoever thing is good is <span class="page-break" data-page="530"></span>just and true; wherefore, nothing that is good denieth the Christ, but acknowledgeth that he is.</p>^N			<p class="verse" data-aid="128358861" id="p7"><span class="verse-number">7 </span>And ye may <span class="study-note-ref" data-ref="note7a"><sup class="marker">a</sup>know</span> that he is, by the power of the Holy Ghost;
